reviews.review: It sees huge but we couldn't stay there for more than an hour. It sees huge but we couldn't stay there for more than an hour because its freezing. it has more activities for kids. the cable car was the best!

Fun and unexpected. How wonderful to know that you can escape the heat and have a "foreign" experience. Winter-wear is provided. This is not a game but real skiing and sledding. Excellent family outing.

Fantastic day out. Visited today after booking a ski experience day yesterday, this package included a one hour ski lesson (we were both non-skiers), the penguin experience, a pass to the snow park including unlimited goes on the rides, a pair of ski gloves, equipment hire, a hot chocolate and a set meal.The lesson was fantastic there was only three of us on it but myself and my partner progressed really quickly and got taken from the nursery slope up to the next one, we got issued with a ski passport at the end of the lesson and were signed off the first two levels making us into skiers. We did the penguin experience and got to cuddle and pet a king penguin which was lovely. The ski park is great for youngsters but not so exciting for us older ones but we went on everything including a high speed 'bullet' ride and a zip wire these were good but not worth going on more than once. The only thing wrong with the day was how many times you have your photo taken by the photographers from the centre it slows everything down when you just want to get on with stuff and the photos are really expensive to buy at 125AED each although we did buy 2!! The hot choc was a lovely break during the day and we had our meal after we had finished in the park, we spent about 5 hours there in total - would love to re-visit but this time just to ski and not bother with anything else. Would highly recommend this place as a must do whilst in Dubai.

Snow in the desert. . I attended with my nearly 3 year old and my adult sister. We stayed for a few hours mainly because we were underprepared in terms of clothing. When it's so hot outside its hard to imagine needing a beanie, but be sure to pack one! We throughly enjoyed the different activities, despite not skiing or snowboarding. My daughter loved the tube slides and kept asking for more. The price and quality of food on the slope were not impressive at all.

Only in Dubai do you get blistering heat and cold snowy slope so close!. If you have not skied before it is well worth a visit or for the pure novelty. If you are an experienced skier after about 30minutes you may get bored. Still worth a visit and great chance for children to learn how to ski.
Snow in the Desert. Its amazing that they have built a place with snow in the middle of a hot desert. Thoroughly enjoyed activities at Ski Dubai with my kids.

One of a kind. A great experience of skiing in what use to be the middle of the desert. I have learned to ski at Ski Dubai and all the instructors were very knowledgable and encouraging. Also i have been there a multiple of times for skiing and it was so much fun. You can find many activities to do, from zip lining, to penguin interaction, skiing, etc... So everyone is guaranteed to have fun especially that you are skiing in a -2 degree temperature while outside it is 37 or 45 degrees plus. Make sure to stop in the cafe on top of the slopes for a nice hot cup of coco.
Fun in the Snow!. Great place to visit while in the desert? Why not, its a conversation starter! Left 104 degrees outside to be in -4 degrees inside. Something different to do.
Saw it 😎. I went to the Emirates Mall just to seen this attraction. It was really pretty sight to see in the middle of the desert. A must see.

What a great idea. If you ski, this place should be on your list of places to visit. There is something slightly insane about wandering through a sweltering 45 deg day, then going skiing in a mild 4 deg room. It is certainly an experience.Now I can't say it is a top slope, with heaps of length, but then again we are not outdoors. It is though really well done, with quite a few options and things for the kids, for the shopping centre it is in.I'd visit again if I am ever in Dubai again.

It was a one time experience. It was OK, a lot over priced for what is offered. They did not explain where to store the cards so I kept putting mine in my pants pocket. We didn't know when to get off for the snow bullet because the attendant was not paying attention. They do not provide gloves if you are not paying for the higher priced sports. We couldn't even go down the snow bullet the second time because our hands were frozen. Not all of the staff members are helpful.
Weekend . Ski Dubai - place like no other! At the middle of the summer with outside temperature of 50 degree Celsius, you can enjoy snow covered slopes of Ski Dubai and even play with the pinguins.
Snow in the desert...... Go visit for yourself....amazing. Who would have thought they would have this in the desert. See the penguins and get to kiss and cuddle them....

Worth a visit but overpriced.. I would recommend this place as it is so unique but wouldn't spend the whole day there. It was fun for an hour or 2 but there is only 2 slopes, long queues and only a handful of other things to do. I'm definately glad I went, but it's not a "must return" place to visit. Also in the middle of the shopping centre skiing is a very strange feeling, seeing people watch you as the are doing their shopping!

Must do for skiers. I haven't skied for 18 years and just felt the need to do this. My wife and kids had never skied so they had a lesson whilst I went skiing. The run is very good for an indoor facility (about 400m). We took advice from previous reports about how cold it is inside and took extra clothes. We also took ski gloves because the ones they issue are not good enough. You should also bring your own beanie (warm hat) as they are not issued. We also used the other attractions in the centre which the kids loved. It was expensive for the 4 of us but understandable given what is required to keep it so cold.
Ski Dubai. Great places to visit! Even my auntie is nearly 70, she enjoyed all games inside the park. Unlimited rides let us played each games at least 3 three times. Kids will crazy for it!

Perfect snow. Great place to learn how to ski, snowbird in the middle of the desert. A very welcome break from the sun and getting in a little practice. The run lengths are practically limited due to the type of venue but well worth an afternoon out. Could improve Avalance Cafe a lot though. Gluwein missing.
It's getting crowded.... not only a ski-slope, but also a penguin-show and slides and ice carousels for kids. It's really getting full of activities. But is that good?

Ski Dubai. We gazed at the people skiing and went inside. Lots of people of all ages skiing. They give you boots and skiing clothes, hats, coats all inclusive of the price. You can have skiing lessons or you can just go on the snowboards or play and dive around on the tube slides and have great fun on the snow. If your brave enough to do it have fun !!!!
Nice experience!. This was a beautiful experience, i had a lot of fun! This can happen only in Dubai! It was simply unforgettable.
Snow , in the dessert ? ? ? ?. Went and had an hour lesson as I have never skied before. I was skiing in no time and it was so much fun.

The coolest thing to do in summer. We booked ski classes to refresh our skills, and it was quite helpful, the park is all fun, you only get frustrated with all these youngsters who were born in desert but smash the slope like a pro! The slopes are qood considering it´s an outdoor artificial stadium, you can learn from scratch, refresh, keep yourself in shape for your winter time in Alps or just come to Dubai instead of Alps in winter and save on summer/winter holidays package. The snow park is also great fun, esp. the slides a zorbing ball. Do get some functional underwear/leggins and a sweater because even after one hour you will get cold.

Expensive day out. When the temp outside is 38 degrees then treat yourself to some minus 4!! Pre paid for tickets before travelling to Dubai but when we got there our £160 didn't include everything and for additional activities we paid an extra £90 approx. For this we got a penguin interaction where you could touch a penguin, a one to one hr ski lesson for my 3yr old and access into the snow dome for rides of which there are about 5. Your clothes are included which is gloves (that you can keep and were reasonable quality), coat, waterproof trousers, socks and snow boots. Given the temp you definitely need warm clothes underneath and prob hat and scarf too. The ski lesson was worth the money. The penguin interaction is not so good as you are not allowed to take pictures. Of course the professional photographer takes pictures that you can buy at great expense after. The rides inside are OK but after you have done them a few times and are cold it's time to go! It's OK but nothing more. I was pretty pleased to get back our into the warm sun.
nice place in hot summers. Its amazing. You will see snow in this place and you can do sking and other snow sports but its very expensive.
Fantastic to watch. how different nations cope with their 1st experience with snow. Security is excellent, so do not hesitate to bring along Your kids

Pricey, but you're skiing indoors!!. Fun, exciting and a thrill to ski in Dubai, especially coming from Canada! 2 runs cost 150AED. Great for kids, and it's rift inside the mall! Don't forget to stay warm as it gets -4 in there!!
Love it. I really loved the place to forget about the heat outside .... affordable and amazing experience. ... suitable for children, adults and seniors

Fantastic. Had a one hour snowboarding lesson which was total fun and the instructor was fantastic, we paid extra to use the other facilities which included the ski lift, sledge rides, toboggans etc it was fab definitely recommend. We paid £70 and this included the lesson, activities, gloves, all equipment and locker.

Penguins in Dubai . I was there before with my elder children & we loved the idea of skiing in a very cold space with outside temperature is 45 degrees or even more. But this time I took my youngest daughters to explore the other side. To tell you the truth it is the most memorable experience they have I guess. We had tickets 4 for 3, I got through Dubai ski application. It includes almost all activities except skiing. We met the penguins & knew something about these funny creatures. We had the chance to hug & kiss them. My daughters enjoyed lots of activities for their age like slides, the huge ball rolling down the slope & many others. The queues were quiet long but waiting time from 15-30min. Everything is available & included (lockers, gloves, clothes) but for sure you can bring yours. I think it is better to bring your own gloves & wear winter clothes below the skiing clothes cause it is very cold inside especially at the penguins area. It costs us around 1000 AED but it worth it. You must go there.

Swiss slopes in the hearth of Dubai!. Wnen you go to the Mall of Emirates, at one end of it you find the exceptional attraction of SKY DUBAI: you go inside a protected atmosphere, encapsulated in a -4 degree temperature, separated by a very thick glass from the rest of the Mall.You can rent all the necessary for skiing at a very good price, except the woolen gloves that you must purchase.For people who never seen the snow it is a really fantastic experience, but even for regular skiers it is a good experience to be skiing in the desert!!A must for all visitors to Dubai!

Interesting experience. Of course that if you are an experienced skier, you will find the slopes a bit boring, but since they allow the rides for smaller amount of time (like hours), you can stay there time enough to have the experience. And by that i mean a HUGE venue with temperatures below 0 while outside is 50 degrees celsius.PS: I just worry about the environmental damage of that. Maybe the owners could do some actions to compensate the environment for it :) Maybe carbon compensation?
Amazing. A rally good fun times with family, a little over priced but something you can't get everywhere, epic ally skiing indoors and meeting penguins etc.
Snow in Desert.. Wow..is an understatement. Nicely made and maintained. Though I found it very diffcult to be there for more than 180 mins. It was great experience skiing in desert.

Ice Wonder in Desert. We have visited Mall Of Emirates for shopping and wondered to find Dubai Skie beautifully constructed with cold temperature below freezing point. Inside skie you can find ice covered with lawn upto 500 Metres.It great to enjoy with family and friends. Should visit once.
Penguins. We came to view the Penguins and they were a blast. But with the ticket price you get to go into ski part. Which was fun to watch all the family having a great time.

Good but too expensive for family.. Too small but It was good experience.. Snow Penguin pass was not worth it, they just allow to seat next to penguin just so they can take 120 AED picture for you with penguin !! and the stuff were very rude.

Had to do it!. Visited a friend who doesn't ski, but I had to do it!Was kitted out with warm jacket, salopettes style trousers and some socks (which were more like aeroplane socks but did the trick)! You DO NOT get gloves and I would advise you to bring them.Service of getting skis was very efficient, you step on to electronic scales to set height, weight and experience. The staff at the till use this to find appropriate ski's and to adjust the bindings.It is by far the best and biggest indoor slope I have been on and the quality of the snow was great. If anyone has been to Tamworth snow dome in England, I would say it is roughly 2 and a half of that slope - except you get a chair lift up this one!Saw a few ski schools which looked very well ran and never got too far into the path of other slope users.A really positive experience -- a treasure for any skiers/boarders or anyone who fancies being in the snow... In a shopping mall... In a desert.

Winter in the desert. Staff were very helpful and willing to assist us have the best options for the family. Instructions and directions were easy to follow and clear. The experience was great especially since we're were in Dubai during the hottest months. We were able to take lovely pictures

Dubai's wonderland. How many places around the world have an indoor snow park with real snow? I can tell you not much.Ski Dubai is a must visit. Especially if you are not from town, you can show of the next time someone asks you what have you experienced in Dubai and you can say " I've been to an indoor Ski Park". SAY WHAT?I saw real pengiuns which were really cute! They also have an indoor cafe to warm up at the top of the hill. There are also chairlifts and other indoor activities.You definitely need to go-Khulood

Penguins!. U can't believe that u see penguins in a desert. We did the penguin show. And we found it worth it. After all at how many places in the world u get to touch these cute little creatures. The tour is for 45min wherein they tell u abt penguins and u can also touch and get pics clicked with penguins. For ppl who like cute lil animals ...must do! Don't think much abt the money when u already spent so much on traveling abroad

Awesome attraction. Well worth a visit. It's 43 degrees outside and minus 4 in Ski Dubai. We sat and watched for ages and there are lots of activities to do inside including a decending ball and normal skiing too.

Can't wait for it to snow. Ski Dubai is just another reason to love visiting or living in Dubai, wonderful fun and for a family that loves to ski together it provides an invaluable and inexpensive (relatively speaking) opportunity to practice and enjoy the sport together. It is with a somewhat perverse joy that our son now participates in Ski School once a week as part of his School Extra Curricular activities and we get in a little Mum & Dad ski time and watch the little fellow in class from the ski lift. Where else can it be 45 degrees celcits outside and have ski school carried out inside other than Ski Dubai. Fabulous fun and a great resource for this ski obsessed out there. I am not sure who calculates the levels of difficulty as they don't seem aligned with what would be found outside of this facility (overstated difficulty such as the near shopping centre being described as a black run) but there are still enough opportunities for me to plough down these gentle slopes with my face to ensure a constant amusement for my family and well wishing onlookers.

Cold,chilling experience. This is a fun filled Snow area for adults and kids alike.. There are some cute snow slides and mini playing areas for everyone... Even though they provide some basic clothing, if you belong to India or similar tropical countries, you may find it really really cold. Just like I did :) There provision for Hot choclate although we couldnt have it as there was a long queue... Overall ann amazing experience inside the mall.

It's so cold. To go there you should buy a hat for your head and extra socks its so cold. Remember it will cost you to enjoy it 300 something UAE Derham and to buy hot drink inside the place and some photos so all trip will coast you more than 250 USD.

Not worth for your money!. I just dont think that the 300aed payment is worth it for the park itself. Theres not much to do inside plus you cant really stay there for long because its really below zero inside. I suggest to just go to the nearest waterparks instead. Wild Wadi or Atlantis!

Holiday visit to the centre. Amazing experience within the mall. Enjoyed the day very much.I was able to experience skiing for the first time and thanks to a good trainer I was able to pass the adventure stage of the ski lesson. I would like to mention Jamie who was the trainer who made the experience very enjoyable.

Huge interior, lots of activities, slightly crowded. There are a lot of activities here for all ages - skiing, après, penguin encounter, sledging, toboggans etc. We visited at around 8:30-10:30pm and at the start it was very very busy. I would recommend using the button lifts rather than the chairlifts. The button lifts however were badly designed as they would get stuck and would not be released for a couple of minutes at a time, making the queue even longer. However it was a very fun experience and the inside area is very large!
Must Go Once. Though the tickets are bit overpriced but you should go there at least once, especially if you have kids they will definitely enjoy there.

47 oc outside minus 15 oc inside . Only Dubai does the impossible skiing in a heat wave !!Great way to cool down if you feeling a bout of sunstroke You can view from the mall the ski slope or of course get suited n booted and going on the skis Great fun

Ski Resort in the Summer !. This is an amazing experience in Dubai..The temperature outside is above 50 degrees, However in Ski Dubai you can enjoy your ski experience indoor with freezing temperature..High and long Slop .. telfrik to take you up..Ski lessons .. they introduce over night camping as well..Snow playing area for kids ..Penguins! Its so fabulous..Really worth it.

Ski for dummies !!!!. It's impressive to see such ski station in a country like Dubai where the temp care reach above 40deg c.
But be serious, it's not a real skiing track with such small one.
Again it's fun to see this crazyness but that's it
Fabulous. My son went snow boarding here and it was great, good variety of activities and a great price including your clothes and boots.

Indoor skiing in the middle of the dessert.. What can I say? If your looking for mind blowing runs the likes of Europe; this place isn't for you. If you're looking for the novelty of saying you went skiing in Dubai with an outdoor air temperature of 39degrees this is for you. Essentially two basic blue runs, one short stretch of maybe a red - which is sold as a black run. Total distance is short, with maybe a hundred metres of skiable runs that are pretty straight and flat. Single 5seat chair lift up the middle and two faster button lifts up the sides that will all get you to the top. Would be a fun place for beginners, and kids - there are lots of added attractions that would be well suited to a young crowd.

Snowmen in Dubai. Every wondered what's it's like to go from 40 degrees Celsius to minus 5. Well here is your chance. There are lots of activities for all abilities ranging from skiing lessons, snowboarding, tubing, zorbing etc. Overall it's a great experience and quite refreshing from the heat. Worth going and the kids love it. Advice - Arrive early or book early if you want to do the penguin visit as it gets quite busy. Only down side is that as its busy you might have to wait a while to get your equipment and the sizes seem to be a little off so don't be surprised if you have to change your boots to get the right foot size.

Year end trip. This is really heart place please go well prepared you should plan at least 4-5 hours to enjoy fully please carry warm clothes even though we get from them our clothes will be helpful rest as all other places in Dubai it is expensive but worth
no real feel. do not gives you a real sensation but its fine for all skiers that are far from home at ski season :)

Fun for all . Skied to buy is like going to ski resorts in the heat of summer indoors the children loved it and they had a lot of fun there rides and there are penguins to play with and there is Family with kids can have a lot of fun though I believe like any age you'll enjoy it there's skiing for all levels there is rides and slides basically it's fun you can spend either the whole day or a couple of hours it doesn't matter depends on what you want to do

Why spend the time and money. As a skier, I would love to have the bragging right but decided against after seeing how unattractive the setting was. The longest run is only 1200 m and there is nothing scenic about it. It's not worth the hassle even if the cost were 1/4 as much. The best part of snow skiing is the outdoor scenery. This is just a shadow box.
Cool place. Nice to be able to ski while it is 40 degree celcuis outside! Little bit crowded but it is worth it.
Snow in desert. This fantastic place is located in Emirates mall.you can skiing, play with snow or games related with snow and see penguin. It is big.

Awesome -4 Degrees Celsius . Let's be straight first - it's amazing fun and experience for those who have experienced snow and also for those who haven't.See those who have experienced snow .. well you haven't experienced -4 degrees Celsius in a closed refrigerator. They have mastered the engineering in setting up and the experience is almost real and fun. Everything - skiing , the chairlift is romantic , the tubing is fun, the ball is cool and let's u loosen up. I would suggest time yourself while taking the ticket .. if your taking it in morning time then take unlimited access to rides as u will have entire day. In evenings there is always a rush and line for rides so taking unlimited pass won't help as u will not get to do it as much. Do wear warm clothes while going for it. They do give you gloves, jacket, pants, socks and shoes but still it won't warm u totally if u wearing summer clothes beneath.It's fun and a good change.
Great fun. Great fun, did not do the skiing but did other activities instead. Very cold so wrap up warm. Clothing, gloves and shoes are provided by the company
Colddd. This is real adventure....Outside is so hot.....like 40degreeButInside Emirates Mall Ski DubaiLike freezingReally we got surprised Definitely has to be visited.....
Diversity !!!. Nice to be in the park which its cold and freezing and outside its desert !!!No body can imagine this . Great experience !!!

Crazy contrast! Fun day !. I am Swiss and I never ever expected skiing in the desert. So, off we went to the MOE (Mall of the Emirates) to treat ourselves with a "snow day". We went there in flip flops and shorts, but you may bring your own ski equipment if you have one. We needed to buy gloves and hats which took us less then 10 min. To be fully equipped it took about 20min. Inside SkiDubai the Sky is grey ... not a sunny day in the snow. But you can really ski and have fun. If you're lucky you might even see a Penguin. The contrast is just mind blowing! It's not cheap, but it's a crazy thing to do. There is no real food/restaurant inside but you can have hot chocolate at the Chalet. This is a day, we all remember...

Best Activity in Hot Summer . Best thing to do with kids. We all loved it. Specially penguin experience and encounter. Touching and hugging penguins was a thrill in it self. Too crowded on weekend evenings. We went on weekday morning so it was better. Rides are good. Must have experience in Dubai

Me and my friends love this place very much , it is a must see and must do activity. How awesome this ski dubai has designed , its wonder atmosphere and really a fantastic place to do indoor ski . Very unique , and very worthwhile to make a visit . Me and my friends enjoyed a very nice day in Ski Dubai . Cannot wait to go back again to do Ski !!

Snow in the Desert? YES!. Where else in the world can you be in the desert and then ski within the same day? Only Dubai! Ski Dubai is a unique experience because they have literally figured it down to a science to where you can pay and be suited up with your ski’s and gear and be on the slopes within 20 minutes. If you don’t want to ski, they also have a snow park, penguin experience, and other options available as well. For skiing, advanced booking is not required (but for Penguin’s, yes). Expect to spend about 2 hours here.

A bit overpriced. The place is great if you do all the activities. Some activities are not as great as you imagine. The Penguin experience was a waste of money. It is more a scam to get you in pictures with the penguin and charge you a lot of money for them. The cable car was very good. The snow village is also very good. Great for kids. Great place if you know how to ski. The whole activity is very expensive. Overall is a very great experience.

Not something you're going to do everyday!. My 10 and 18 year old went snowboarding and really enjoyed it. There's a bit of mucking around at the beginning getting fitted out, with some of the attendants less than enthusiastic about their jobs. Allow at least 30 minutes and it wasn't busy when we were there. We came with nothing but needed to buy gloves (25dhs for material ones and 75dhs for waterproof), you can however bring your own, otherwise all else is supplied. I thought it was reasonably priced at 200dhs for 2 hours which is enough. Leaving just enough time for a quick scoot around the shops for mother.
Hot and Cold. In the middle of 30+ degrees you can walk the mall and be kitted out with ski suits and spend and hour or so brushing up on your ski or board techniques!!!

Soo cold, yet soo much fun!. Ski Dubai was on my list of activities to do in Dubai and my sister and I booked the Ski Dubai experience which included 1hr ski lesson, lunch and hot chocolate and unlimited fun on the rides and the penguin encounter. We had soo much fun and it still amazes me that this is an attraction inside a shopping mall. Great fun for the family.
Very expensive. Didn't go inside just had a look as prices were crazy high looked fun however this is the only thing the emerits Mall has going for it

Desert snow . Exciting place for kids, but not much to do for us grown ups. My seven year old simply loved it and had an action packed visit. We took a pass which had most of the rides/penguin behind the scenes/ cable car etc. Tip : if you want to do the interaction with dolphins then do book in advance not at counted as they are pre booked and mostly sold out.

SEEMS LIKE A GREAT PLACE BUT IT WAS TOO BUSY TO FEEL THE FULL ENJOYMENT AND SECURITY JUST COULDN'T HANDLE PEOPL!. Me and hubby visited ski dubai after hearing so much about it, however we went to Dubai a week before EID so everybody was off work/school/college for holidays.The place was extyremley busy and quite difficult to navigate through. We got our outfits and went through, as soon as we were about to go through we saw something happening with a goup of teenagers and the security and to be fair, it seemed like the security guards were having rings rung around them.When we got in it was nearly time for our penguin show, so when we went in for that the experience was amazing. getting to see these penguins so up close and getting pictures taken with them was a great experience.Once that was over, we manageed to fight our way through the children and the teenagers who were all going against all rules and went to the zorb ball. The queu was huge and it took about 45 minutes to eventually get there, but once we were there the experience again was amazing!! managed to land on my wrist right at the end, but thats just me, I can injure myself walking around my house so doing something like this, I was bound to lol.Once that was over, everything else that we went to go and see was just waaaay to busy, the quques were huge and seeing the groups of teenagers who were not being handled at all by security was really starting to put us off. We ended up walking out because time was getting on and it just didnt seem like we were getting any closer to going on anything.Overall it seems to be an amazing place and we enjoyed what we experienced, we just wish that it wasnt so busy and the people were handled better by security.

Ski in the dessert!. If you're a beginner you can take lessons for an hour and then start with the beginner slopes. If youre an expert you can start with the expert slopes. There is much to do for kids and adults. A great experience!
Amazing experiance. A great fun experience for the whole family. the only comment they need to bring new activities. it is the same as i remember from my last visit few years ago.

You enter in a different world once u enter this snow covered hudge activity place just perfectly made to give you that. great experience in the dessert such a big great place made with snow all around and just that perfect feeling of the mountain and snow. one have to hire jacker and boots to enter this great place. ticket is expensive but once you enter its great.lovely helpful staffs and guides to assists children and lots of games and activities for kids all around. good place for family time. sking there is fun and careful about geting cold as out side temp.very hot in dubai. one have to adjust .
Just the right thin in the middle east. A must visit place in every family trip. Kids love the park and slopes and so do myself. We never seem to skip it in every trip. Highly recommended.

Getting close to the Penguins. This is a must for anyone visiting Dubai.It was just amazing being able to cuddle and kiss a penguin well worth the money,just unbelievable and I was shocked at how heavy their wings are and they are solid

Interesting Anomaly in The Desert. We went to Dubai Mall to see "The Largest Indoor Mall in the World" which was well worth the time; not to buy (way overpriced) but to look. While we were there we went to see Ski Dubai. It's so strange to see and feel snow in the desert. Coming from outside at 100+ degrees into the ski area at 30ish degrees added to the surrealism. Although we did not ski, the runs were surprisingly ample and the snow was good. They have everything you would need to enjoy if you don't mind the price. When in Dubai, you should at least see Ski Dubai if for no reason than the "bragging rights".

Skiing in country without snow... This was my second visit at Ski Dubai, my first was back in 2014. There's a lot of changes since then. They've changed the super pass to Polar pass and included the chairlift and snowball rides which is good. Compare back then you can only access the tube ride and snow park. It is recommended to use an entertainer voucher and upgrade it to Polar Pass express. It will give you unlimited chairlift ride,unlimited snow ball ride plus a choice of either discovery lesson of skiing for beginners or 2 hours slope or penguin encounter or 2 rides of snow bullet plus snow park access and other unlimited rides included in Polar pass. We have opted for the discovery lesson since we don't know how to ski. It is better if you bring and use your own socks and gloves (make sure they're thick and can make you warm). Though they give free gloves and socks, if you spend like 5 hours inside the resort it'll will be soaked up in 2 hours time which is not advisable. Additionally have an extra leg warmer inside and bring your own woolen scarf and body warmer to make yourself comfortable while enjoying the ski. Just a note if you're going to try the discovery lesson, my friend and I thought it will be a one on one teaching lesson but it will be a group lesson instead. It is a little disappointing because some of the instructors think you'll get what they say in just one teaching which I don't think is not a good strategy if you wanted to make your customers sign up for the ski school. However, overall experience is quite good especially when they've added the chairlift ride.
Brrrrrrrr cold but good fun.. It was nice to see the younger parents having more fun than we were - with our 20 year old and 17 year old ... but it was a fun 3 hours in the Freeeeeeeezing SKI Dome.

Nice Time. Once you run out of patience to window shop any more , the ski Dubai is a great change. The place is really professionally managed and the instructors do a great job. You come out feeling great and right at the exit is this lovely place that serves some great soup , which you will totally enjoy after the freezing temperatures inside
Good place to live in the snow . I went to the place with my family and we have a great time there. The place is funny and learn how to live in similar areas.

Worth to try. I grew up in a tropical country and never been to any country that has snow so it was a good experience for me to try Ski Dubai. It was really really cold but it was fun. How I wish I knew how to ski like all the other kids there.

Ski Dubai .. Snow in the Desert.. Check you have the correct session!. My partner and I booked a 2 hour ski session through Expedia in advance. There was no purchasing terms or advice provided. When we went to cash in the voucher we were disallowed the 2 hour session as it was my partners 1st time skiing and had to downgrade to a beginners 1 hour lesson which was cheaper than our original sessions booked. Ski Dubai would not refund the difference and we have to chase reimbursment through Expedia. An error on our part and misinformation from a 3rd party seller.....so Please be careful what sessions you book and where you book it. You also have to purchase your own gloves.However, after a disappointing start, the skiing lesson was excellent, very thorough and safety conscious. Our instructor was lovely and a lot of fun, I do wish we had the 2nd hour session to be able to progress from the beginner up a level as the skiing was great fun. There is other ski park fun things to do such as tobogganing and zip wiring which is included on the upgraded ski pass. We would still go again learning from the issues we faced this first time.

Excellent entertainment for all ages.. Our experience was excellent and we enjoyed this a lot. Here are the tips:1. Book your stay at a hotel next to Mall of Emirates (MoE) and choose a hotel that gives out Ski Dubai entry tickets. We were booked at Novotel Suites which is 5 mins (or less) walk away and they gave us Ski Dubai tickets which were for unlimited time - meaning, we can come out and go back in again anytime during that day but minus Skiing and Ziplocking everything else was included.2. Prepare - Get ready for -4 C (negative 4) degrees temperature. So we brought our light warm jackets and leggings for kids. They will give you vouches for a free pair of gloves and will provide jackets, socks, pants, shoes and helmets for kids for free.3. Arrive early - Look at google and it will tell you the peak hours for Ski Dubai. we arrived at 10 AM and it took us one hour or so to get inside because it takes time to change and get the kids dressed up and all.4. The rush-hour starts to build up during the day, then vanishes off during lunch time and then again a peak rush between 3pm to 6 pm.5. The activities are all very nicely planned and safe. Kids are required to wear helmets, adults can choose to wear or not.6. In rush hours there are long lines for each activity however the attendants keep the place organized and tidy.7. They also give out voucher for food at a restaurant called St. Moritz which is good a simple lunch. Don't ask for fine dining seafood as they are good with simple chicken soup, sandwiches and burgers and a cup of coffee.8. The problem is that security doesn't let you go out if you are still wearing their shoes and attire. So take off your jaccket, while still in their pants and shoes and skip out from St. Moritz side entrance for a couple of smokes outside and come back.9. If you are wearing something full sleeves and a jeans or a training pants under their jackets and pants, you will be okay. Just dont forget to bring your warm caps.10. Either way the shop outside offers all kinds of snow apparel that you can buy.Totally Recommended !

Great experience but come early and prepared. Obviously not the real thing, and not really too exciting for ski enthusiastic used to St. Moritz but where else can you enjoy 4 degrees inside while the thermometer shows 40 outside....two tipps: come early to avoid long queues. NICE ICE -- and a great staff (but a bad website - read below to save money). So, I initially bought a ticket on line for what turned out to be the wrong thing as the website was misleading. If you click on "Read More" on the home page and then "Book Now" under "ski slope" (my only interest), you are brought to page asking for $510 AED. I really wanted to ski, so I booked it. It turns out this was for a "comprehensive" ticket, and what I really needed and wanted was the $200 AED two hour pass. This includes everything you need-- except gloves. Rather than blaming me or hiding behind some policy, the manager, a lovely Philipino woman, and her assistant, actually blamed the website's design and gave me a cash refund.I also bought gloves (necessary, I think) for a mere $10 American and they are ones I intend to keep. Very cool and branded "Ski Dubai." The slope itself is short but not too short and fun -- and not too crowded on a Sunday. The lift is fast, so you'll get as many as twenty runs or so per hour -- maybe more. I had a great experience and am sure to return again.

PRICE for supet pass: 275 for adults and children. TIP 2: There is a cylindrical booth inside the mall that provides ski experience via VR GLASSES for free. Ski dubai. From being out it the 40 degree heat one minute to been in a -4 environment it's a bit of a change in temperature so wrap up if you plan on visiting!.. Would recommend going for the experience, I went for the penguin interaction and was one of the best things iv ever done, the trainers were great and looked after us for the whole duration of the interaction, went for the more expensive package which included all our photos (107 photos), to play feed, get some hugs off penguins and a hot chocolate which was served to us in our own private room at the end. was worth every cent,we were treated like vip guests, would defiantly do it again!!
Fun in the snow. We had a marvelous time with my cousin going up and down the slopes and enjoying the ride on the ski tram. A break when it is hot outside.

Our Family had a blast! . We came here for a day in August. We tried coming the day before at approx. 1pm but the lines were huge so decided to come at 10am the following day. Glad we did as only a few people in a que and we virtually had the snow centre to ourselves. We did not book a ski/ snow board package but booked a package that included Penguins / Snow activities. My husband and our 3.5 yr old has a great time especially the giant inflatable orb and tabboggon ride.Unfortunately we missed out of the penguin park as the first tour wasn't till 12:15- and our son was very tired by that stage.Expensive but an experience we will always remember.

Different . My wife and I decided to do something different and Ski Dubai was our choice. Being +40 we thought that we will feel out of place yet the location was very accommodating and we almost enjoyed all games. Very nice place and for sure we will come again.

Nice. It was a nice experience for once if you never had been to a ski resort or sking facility or a snow covered mountain. Is it worth it - i dont think so. But its a nice place to be for one time and is a wonder to have snow in the middle of the desert.
DIFFRANT experience. good experience we first time go in ski ride if you see snow in desert so you can go or you like some diffrant so must go other avoid it
Great place. Great place but unfortunately my son didn't take to the skiing just the little sledge things was all he would do I would say its still good fun but just not for my son
Very good. Sky Dubai is in Mall of Emirates. Its unique experience. One can do sking. There is a package where kids can have photograph with penguin. One of the must do activity for kids in Dubai.

I loved SkiDubai. This place is awesome. Its clean, well managed and staff are professional. You can ski, snowboard, go to the park etc..
super family friendly. Good place to practice skiing or snowboarding. They have certified instructors.
A bit expensive if you plan to go frequently..
Fun to do even if you are not an expert. It is fun to go skiing in the desert. The lift is amazingly large for an indoor facility, and think it is 50 degrees outside!!
went for lunch. I don't ski but inside the mall there are several places to watch others duo the skiing while you enjoy food and drink, so I got a good view, had some coffee and a sandwich.

Ironic experience in the desert. This is not the first time our family enjoy a nice ski resort. But this is Dubai!We get the Polar Express package, which include the Polar (snow park fun) and choose of activities. We pick the Ski school lesson, instead of the Penguin encounter.Everybody enjoy it so much, and we which to spend a whole day in the park.Recommend to help cool (very cold) you off the high heat from Desert Safari.

Loads of fun. We had a great time at ski Dubai,2 adults and a 7year old Gloves,socks,pants and jackets were all supplied. Lots of fun activities for kids. Very cold so worth taking extra thick socks:)
Great Time!. Got a lesson and thoroughly enjoyed the entire night there. We both had great fun and wanted to go back again.

Not to be missed!. Excellent day out for kids and adults. Did Zorbing, bob sleigh, chair lift etc. Highly recommend the penguin experience. Touched and hugged a King Penguin. Once in a life time experience with the penguin.
So much fun to be freezing while the sun blazes outside. Great experience!We had so much fun using their inflatables.And we loved to freeze while outside it was so hot.For all ages.
Freezing COLD. it was a nice time for my kids, it is just kinda expensive but since it is once in a lifetime 8 of us went and enjoyed the snow!!
Brilliant . This is fantastic, supplied with all clothes and equipment. It is well organised and efficiently run. Excellent ski run and provides slopes for a variety of abilities.
Wonderful . It nice experience while enjoying skiing in Sumer time, and after ski you may have shopping in the Emirates mall or watch movie

Great experience . We visited it twice. Once we bought a ski lesson for ourselves and the kids. Kids really loved the experience. So did we. Second time we visited the park. Although it is an expensive activity, but not unlike most such activities in Dubai, but we had a great time. There were lots of things to do in the park. Should visit at least once.

Snow in the desert?. Still can't really believe it. Went snowboarding when it was 45 degrees outside. And they have a little bit of a black run. Guy next to me was from the Lebanon and said the skiing was getting to be good there! What a mind blowing experience!!!

Go during ramadan, everything is half priced!. And empty as well. If you happen to visit Dubai during Ramadan (wich I definitely do not recommend) or happen to live there, get the best deal by going during this time of the year. Super fun.

It is interesting. It is a place where you can enjoy the snow environment and atmosphere. You can play with the snow slide on it and enjoy the skid on the natural ice. You can spend part of the day along with the family and friends.

Wonderful place . It is an ideal place to have fun and get your kids to learn and know how to ski before you go into a real adventure, well set, well organised, safety, clean, busy in weekend and holidays but not to miss for a change in a desert weather conditions

Change of pace for the desert. Snow and Penguins in Dubai. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to Ski Dubai in July 2016. We purchased the polar experience with the Penguin encounter. With that, we had unlimited access to the Snow Park, where we enjoyed toboggans, tubing, rolling down the hill in a giant ball and a roundtrip ride on the chairlift. We also enjoyed seeing the march of the Penguins where the staff provided education on the type of penguins at Ski Dubai. We also had our own scheduled time to see the penguins, where we learned more and got to take pictures with and hold the penguins.

Who could pass up skiing in the desert?. Another pretty expensive spot in Dubai, but how many people can say that they went skiing in the desert? We managed a basic 2-hr pass on the slopes for around $40/pp, but that included equipment, jacket, pants and the slopes. Hats and gloves are extra, but necessary as the building is pretty cold inside to keep the snow from melting. Couldn't really grade the snow, but it wasn't too icy or slushy. Didn't really care, we were in the largest indoor ski place in the world. That's classic.

Snow in the desert. Incredible that a very realistic ski slope complete with chair lifts et al has been created in sizzling Dubai! The "Snow Bullet" zip line was an experience that I will remember for a long time.

ok for 2 hours slope pass. The slope is too short but ok for a two hour slope pass. Otherwise you will get bored very soon. Prices are too high, so let's hope the new Slope in Meydan City will open soon.

A treat for the snowboarder. Was not sure what to see.
There is absolutely no comparison to the UK ones, this is far larger.
Snow was good.
Prices not to bad.
Got me out of shopping.
An experience . It is really an experience to ski in the middle of the desert. It's not like normal skiing arena's but worth at least a try for once

A Perfect Break from the Summer Heat!. It's funny they ask if it's a good rainy day activity because it never really rains here. Anyway, Ski Dubai is a place we frequent being residents of the UAE. It is a great place to cool off and have a snowball fight, explore ice caves, tube down icy shoots, hang out on the ski lift and learn to ski or snowboard. My kids learned both here. They even have gentoo and King penguins!
Amazing. Nice place, I enjoyed it with the kids very much, we spent more than 2 hours and kids like it, the facility is amazing to see

Almost Didn't go because Locals said it was not worth the money.....BUT WE LOVED IT. LOVED IT!! Totally worth the money. My family of 4 went (10 and 8) and all thought it was the coolest thing we have ever done. We picked the highest package, but did not ski/board. We wanted to do unlimited zip-line, the penguins, and park. The penguins were super cute, but short. My kids loved that the penguin jumped on their lap. The snow rides were a lot of fun for the kids and us also. Understand that this is not about the rides, it is about the experience of being inside freezing while it was 113 degrees outside. NOTE: IT IS COLD!!!!!! We are a skiing /snowboarding family and we have never experienced cold like this. If you are going, you might want to bring an under-layer. The jackets and pants provided are like a shell. Also, bring a Hat! They do not give hats. My husband bought him and myself a hat (Total 30 dollars). We got the their "really good gloves" free with our package, but they were not warm. Not much lines (August) and the zip-line was fun. AGAIN: This is not about the rides. It is a about the experience. If you go in knowing this, you will think it was worth the money.

Best experience of snow. If you have never seen nor been to the Alps... This place is the closest with the best ever man made ski experience! The gear and equipment given are top notch and the coffee shops inside are also very helpful to warm you up whilst ascending or descending the slopes. A must do whilst visiting Dubai and The Mall of Emirates!

One of the reasons I came to Dubai. My eldest daughter lived in Neuss, Germany, so we had experienced an indoor ski resort prior to coming, otherwise, I would have thought this was incredible! Well worth seeing and or doing.

Learn to ski before entering . Ski Dubai is great if you know how to ski If you don't there is a ski park for non skiers and children I wouldn't recommend going as this is a real life ski slope and people act as such It can be dangerous if you are clueless They do offer classes here and you can build up your knowledge to become more confident on the slopes Fun day out for all ages
really funny day. was a really funny experience , ski in dubai ...... nice slope actually looking up on the left side is quite good slope , must try
Ready to ski. I loved ski Dubai you can zip line and it would be better if you can ski because it is so fun if you can do everything and the black run it is sssssssoooooooooooooo steep

Get ready to ski in Dubai . You can do a ski park and go skiing it is amazing in the ski park there is rides such as you go into a ball and they close the ball and then you roll down!! Loads of things to do I really would recommend this place
Ski in the desert. Do it only to have a picture to impress friends in your home country...or if you feel really hot because of the summer heat!
Birthday Bash. Celebrated my daughters bday here. Awesome place must visit. Take extra sweaters with u. It's very cold inside.

Great fun. This is a fantastic place for kids - the rates are quite expensive but worthwhile to book in advnace.
The penguin experience was worth the the wait - but staff need to be more on guard and helpful.
Enjoyable place. Fantastic place to visit especially with families ( kids) helpful staff good safety lockers enjoy rolling inside the big ball and riding telefreek

A funny skiing spot in the middle of the desert. Perfectly suited for families, Ski Dubai offers amazing facilities for experienced skiers as well as beginners. Also equipped with activities for young ones. Still not convinced about having penguins on site..

A ski slope, penguins, snow and ice in the middle of the desert. Really!. The Mall of the Emirates is like the Dubai Mall--huge and really difficult to comprehend. And in the middle is a substantial ski slope with a queue of people waitng for their turn to don appropriate clothing and claim their turn on the slope. It is incongruous but it fits the message of excess and extraordinary construction that is typical of the city state of Dubai.

OMG. This was amazing, I went alone and I still had great time. I was sceptic before about penguins as I love to see wild animals in nature but when I saw how well they treat them and how this guys love to play I was relieved. Whole freezing experience, when outside is 50 degrees is just amazing. I am often in Dubai but I this was my first time in SKI Dubai and it was much better than usual shopping I used to do in mall of Emirates. Great memory is better than shoes :)))

Stunning. There's almost everything you can think of in dubai. This is a huge snow park in the mall of emirates. A couple of rides too. You can also click pictures with penguins and do skiing. We also did the chair car ride. Some activities are paid and rides are free.
Great Afternoon. the kids had a wonderful afternoon skiing and sliding and penguin watching. its so nice to see their happy smiles. we had a nice time shopping and lunch while the kids played. yaya

amazing experience. don t miss this life experience in Dubai. great ski center, temperature is -4 inside and 45 outside! lifts are working great, snow quality is always perfect, no queue lines, even small chldren can play with snow and other snow games.

Increddible place to visit, it was 47C outside and they were snow sking in the mall. The Mall is very nice, and quite large. I stayed at the Ivory Grand across the street from the mall. From my living room I could observe a constant flow of traffic into the mall. The mall is open until 12 so you have plenty of time to shop, eat and visit
Unique experience. Ski dubai seem to have upgraded. a bit more organised. new zip line ride above ice. zorb ball is better organised this time. also more staff with help with sliding in tubes.
Cold place. My kids enjoy such place. I like it too but feel so cold there. My kids always insist to go inside and have fun.

Great fun on our stopover in Dubai. Stopped over in Dubai for 2 days on our way from Australia to London. Decided to spend a day at Ski Dubai and didn't regret out decision. I was travelling with my 10 year old daughter who had skied once before in Australia. I had never skied before. All clothing is supplied as well as ski boots and rubber boots (if you choose not to ski). Loved the toboggan and ski lesson. (I didn't realise skiing was so difficult). Even enjoyed the ride in the chair-lift. In hindsight I would pay extra for the waterproof gloves as once the material ones get wet my fingers started to get uncomfortably cold. Also got some great photographs from professional photographers who are snapping away all day. Would definitely go again. Great bonding session with my daughter.

Ski Dubai . That was a unbelievable experience. First you have to rap your brain around the fact that this Ski Park is in the middle of the Arabian Desert. Then once inside it is truly amazing to see how the park is set up and operated. Me and my son had a fabulous time. We bobsled, rolled down the hill in the giant snowball and last but not least purchased the best picture taken of us inside.
Nice to Play. This is an excellent attraction for those who come from the warm parts of the world where we never see snow

Amazing . Summer time for sure you should be there as it is sweet slippery and super slidy Amazing place to practice with your little onesWord of advice don't go there on weekends as you'll see less ice and more people

So, you can't bear the heat? Bear the cold then. We enjoyed the whole activities including bobsled, the plastic ball, tire spins, kids slide, chair lift & the avalanche cafe. I'm not into ski so people complaining about slow chairlift speed weren't mattered to us. We just went for the chills & really got the chills. So cold & so pleasurable. Tip: go on weekdays early around 10 o clock & take avalanche cafe entertainer vouchers to buy hot chocolate.

Exceeding my expectations!. The size of this attraction was my biggest surprise. Our teenage boys were not interested in ZORB ball, penguins or tobogganing for that matter, just the skiing.The goodSnow and decent slopes for the novice to intermediate to enjoyAll equipment hire included!Lifts without queuesThe BadConfusion and lack of detail from all staff regarding entry options different tickets etcThe UglyNoneTIP Don't forget to recover the ski pass deposit, I did grrrrrr

The ice cave escape. Even though you feel your self in the freezer, but it has a lot of activities inside. I enjoyed that feelings of cold and snow inside the dome. Also, kids enjoyed the slides, penguins show. We had a great time!

Skiing When It Is 45 Degrees C Outside !. I have been using the facility since it opened to keep my skiing level up in between proper ski holidays. It is an excellent facility - very popular so its good to go during off-peak times during the week rather than at weekends. It offers clothing and equipment for those who don't have their own, ski instruction at all levels - children to adults and it is a very well run facility. Great fun for the youngsters who can play around in the snow or do toboggan rides - good fun for everyone and well worth the visit.

Let it Snow. If you are from a snow part of the world I would skip this. But if you have not ever seen snow you can experience it here. You can ride a ski lift, sled, ski, snow board, and tube your way around in the snow. It's fun to do but for the price, there are other things I would do in Dubai.
Safe to ski with children. This is the safest place to ski for children and you can ski any that if the year that is the part of this place it's a brilliant idea of entertainment it's magic
very cold. this Dubai when it is 40c it is here only -4cfantastic hours inside slide ride cable car for more than 15minmake snow ball ice man enjoy till the end

Feel like snow . This is one of the most attractive place in dubai specially in summer. Indoor ski attached with mall of the emirates and Kempinski hotel. You may stay there with rooms has ski view which is unbelievable.

met the penguins!. We visited Ski Dubai for almost a full day. It was amazing how in a desert and shopping mall, this can be created! While we were there we did tobogganing, bobsleighing, snowballing and there was skiing of course! While there we answered certain questions regarding penguins and my daughter was able to meet and feed the penguins because of it! A lovely day out!!

Fun in snow. My kid is 6 yo so we didn't go for skiing but the snow world has a lot to offer like tubing, sledging and a lot more fun activities. It's more like a family place where all can enjoy .They have penguin show which is more about the lifestyle of penguin.

Amazing experience. Amazing experience in the sand and heat land. It is located within the MOE mall. Be ready for some adventures and try the crazy ball. An addition lunch of sushi at salmontini was a great match

Skiing for our daughters birthday. Dear Ski Dubai , Enjoyed the skiing but ski Dubai seems to be going down hill a little, snow was very sticky, don't think the skis had been edged or waxed in the last few months. Attention to detail and the quality of the ski clothing has degraded also.Shame really because as the biggest in the world it should be the best, but it's not.However we did enjoy, but not sure we would come back again, shame that UAE residents get 20% discount but the holiday maker does not.Ski Dubai you should focus on improving your equipment sorting out the snow.RegardsPaul

Half Day.. This is brilliant, we only did the half day and will def return and do the full day. The instructor was excellent and so patient for someone that was similar to bambi on ice!! its unreal to be sking indoor when its 35degrees plus outside.

Awesome experience. One of its kinda place. In the middle of Middle East a snow paradise maintained at an optimal -4 deg. Better go well clothed, even though you'll get clothing there. But the experience in itself is quite magical.
Something to do for every member of the family, immaterial of the age group.
Oh! And the penguins???
Really cute
it's cool. maybe for dubai it's cool place but for someone like me that we see real snow it's not so much fun..

A fun novelty in Dubai . This indoor ski resort is around freezing temperature, which is a nice relief from the heat outdoors! Ski jacket and pants are provided. I recommend bringing your own ski gloves and hat; otherwise you can buy them from the ski shop there.The "hills" are small (since it is inside a mall!), so it didn't take long to get down. There wasn't a line for the lift when we went, which meant we got a lot of runs in.I would recommend it as a good place for teaching kids to ski since it's not steep or crowded.The tickets are expensive, but it's part of the novelty of skiing in Dubai!

Skiing in the desert!. It is crazy that they managed to build a ski resort in the desert! It was very busy but great fun. Bring your hat and gloves! (They don't provide gloves and it's so cold, you will need them!)

Amzing indoor ski dome. World's largest indoor ski dome but yet somehow still a little bit too small :) This is a great attraction and highly recommended for a nice couple hours of fun. Also cool because thousands of people walk past looking at you skiing.

Frankly bonkers. Ended up here whilst staying in Dubai. Never been skiing in my life but we ended up visiting this place out of sheer curiosity. Had a fantastically fun filled afternoon here. Really enjoyed doing all the different activities and riding up the ski lift. Well worth the fee to get in id say.

Too cold ... Too fun. I didn't use to live in cold regions, so although it was so cold for me and the kids but we have an amazing time. Wonderful games inside,, enjoy playing with penguins. Simply it's fabulous experience.. Although a little bit expensive..Recommend it for all

Winter wonderland in Dubai. Located in the Mall of Emirates. Expensive. You are given clothes, boots and gloves to keep yourselves warm. You can ski , do zorbing, etc. Nice place for kids. Since its located in the mall it has a lot of options for food as well. ATM machines are available. Lockers available to keep your valuables.
Nice. Great spot with lots of activities... love the slided and all the decoration. Perfect for a family program.

Well designed ski slopes and fun rides. Ski Dubai offers a variety of program. With the Entertainer discount, we took ski group lessons and then did some of the rides for amateurs. Again, this winter fun park is so so so much better than the one in Singapore that it makes me wonder that if the fear of visiting an Arab country for non-Muslims subsides, Dubai could easily attract more tourists away from Singapore, as Universal Studio and other projects are underway ...

It's not the Alps but it's the only snow you'll find in Dubai. Having grown up in the cold and snowy Wisconsin I occasionally miss the cold. While the skiing is short and quickly repetitive it's worth an hour once or twice a year - especially as a warmup for a trip to the Alps or to teach children to ski. And how many places in the world can you water ski and snow ski the same day?

Itz chilling cold. Such a different experience you can have in the mid of desert.. Ski dubai no just give you skiing experience, so much of space around for fun with snow .. Small rides on snow..an awesome experience
Amazing. You will enjoy your time over there, especially for the Asians, Africans or the people who don't have snow and skiing in their countries.

So much fun!. Kids absolutely loved this. It was so much fun. We used the entertainer voucher and good a really good deal. Tip: Wear warm clothes. We were absolutely frozen as their kits are quite thin. Well worth the visit.

Great fun. Whilst the tickets are pricey, we had a great time here. My husband and son went on the zip wire which was great. There's tubing, zorbing and the ski lift ride is great too. It's so weird being cold in the middle of Dubai.Take a hat, you need one!

Nice occupancy when it's too hot outside. You get a pants and jacket + skis/board and boots for 2 hours.Lifts are ok (experienced, take the lift at the left side it goes much faster to the top)Piste is ok for 2 hours. Can get a bit crowdy during the weekend of course.It's nice, do it.

SKI DUBAI. In 40°Heat outside this place chills at -4°.. unbelievable fun with all that you can do in winters with snow..gondola ride to ball swing all were amazing on snow..penguin show another attraction inside

Over come ur fear ✔️. Amazing experience, despite that it's indoor, the amount of fun & enjoyment were tremendous for us ( young ladies age 25years to 45years ) We thought the photos' selling price was over priced, yet the entire experience was wooooowI had a hight fear since I was a kid; jumping and sliding hanging from only a rope was an experience to over come my fear .. I'm happy I did it
Family Fun. Great Great experience, a little over priced, but a wonderful noon to spend with the family. I wish they can also provide head covers because its cooooold.

Exceeded expectations . Kids (9 and 11) are intermediate skiers and we loved this place. Totally surreal to ski in the desert. We would do it again tomorrow! They provide ski clothes and socks but no gloves. You can buy gloves in the shop for 30 for cloth gloves and 65 for heavier waterproof gloves, I suggest the heavier gloves. It is cold in there. Their process is awesome, pay, get gloves, fill out personal info like weight and height, then get boots and clothes, then skis or board, then helmet if you want, then you take skis to slope and get poles there. Hope you have as much fun as us.

A Very Costly Attraction. In the desert area it is and anomaly to find a man made ski hill and though it is only 150 ft vertical drop it does have tons of man made snow and is air conditioned to stop fog from forming . Several resterants offer a view of the slopes. It is costly but there are even activities for kids if the don't ski. Worth a go if you have the dollars.
Ski Dubai. We d9idn't try this, but observed it through the many windows. Looked amazing - who said you can't have snow and ski in 40 deg plus? Also the other activities looked great there.
My one time experience.. it was amazing a one time experience. I wish it was in my city.  well my advice is everyone should have  fun "no dream too big, no dream too small"

Amazing, very enjoyable expeirience. Whether you are a small child of a teenager, you will for sure be able to have fun in this place. They have great activities for kids in the snow park and beautiful very fun ski and snowboard slopes too! Even though the entry cost can be a bit expensive, it is definetely worth it. It can get a bit popular after about 3.30pm with school kids on the slopes but even with them, you can still enjoy yourself! Highly recommend it!
Snow in dessert . It was so fun! You can never imagine ski in a dessert land but it's true! And don't worry about it's -1 degrees temperature, they give you warm jackets themselves!
amazing. its difficult to understand how in dubai you play in the snow but this it, go inside with your family and you'll love it

Ridiculous concept but still very fun! . Once you put to one side how ludicrous the whole thing is, you will thoroughly enjoy rugging up in a ski suit, sipping hot chocolate, waving at penguins and making snow angels. It really is a very fun day out, especially for people who don't generally get to visit the snow. Great day for kids...and big kids.
amazing place. this place worth the visit. very nice and will orginized. the staff are very helpful. it is better if they make the tickets types less confusing.
feels a bit bizarre to be skiing in the desert. If you want to do something completely different this is it! Feels strange but it's fun on a sweltering hot afternoon.

Skiing in the Desert. Don't be mistaken this is a real ski experience...in a mall. Great for every skill level and lessons are available if you need them. All of the equipment from skis to gloves and hats are available. After a few minutes on the slopes you'll forget you're in the middle of the desert. You must go here if you're in Dubai.

Winter in summer . It is a closed space in a huge mall and the way it is maintained at -4 with outside temperature of 50 is something exceptional. With a cruise inside you forget that you are in dubai. It makes you feel the chilly winter day out in snow.
excellent. excellent big snow park in the world, almost -4 degree overthere...a big marrry go round and snow skates are available

Amazing Experience in such a hot country. We went there in the summer, the experience was great, kids have lot of fun.
Its after Ramadan so it wasn't very busy.
Prices expensive to entry and for the penguin experience but you are in Dubai!!! Everything is expensive
Spent the whole day there and have a such wonderful time

Provide skiing lessons and fun for kids. I went there three times with family and kids. We took skiing lessons which I think is a must before going skiing. One time I tried to ski wethout a lesson and had a bad accident. There many activities and games for kids. You can also enjoy the penguin show for extra cost. U need at least 4-5 hours to enjoy the experience.

Best experience EVER. It's one of the things that you should Do in Dubai specially with friends or family Really had so much fun there I love everything about it I love how friendly the people who work there I love the telefrek part ❤️ I'm just in love with this place I really would like to try it again and again Thank you ski Dubai team

A new experience in the hot weather of Dubai. It was nice place and the accessories the provide like shoes, clothes, gloves, ... was so good. However my main reason to visit there was penguin show for my children but it was full and we missed it. There is no restaurant in there and when kids are there for several hours they need to eat something. There was only a small place with a very limited menu. There is many restaurant around but we had to take off all of our cloths to go outside and come back and put in them again it was a difficult and time consuming process.
SKI-DUBAI. I Can't Believe it -5 Degrees in the middle east.Very FUN&COLDAnd It Is IN one of the most famous City in the world.\Thanks SKI-DUBAI
No need to visit the Hill Station or switzerland. Best man made Ski and have a blast by playing the ski games inside, definitely worth a visit. Nice one where the kids have a great time.

Fun to Ski in the desert. This is actually a pretty fun thing to do while in the mall. Especially if you are missing the mountains. Considering it is inside a mall and the snow is blown, it's actually pretty good and a fun way to kill an hour ... After that it's a bit boring, unless you want to practice tricks.

Where I learnt to Snow Board. Ive lived in Dubai for 20 years so it was here that I learnt to snow board, lessons were good and instructors were awesome. Once you get the hang of it or you are a pro I guess it would get quite tedious as takes longer to get up than it goes to get down so could be boring but it is a great place to go and learn. Also, the café at the mid way level does the BEST hot chocolate with M&M's and marshmallows! Love it!

Fun in the snow. Good place to be in dubai. Both Children & adults can enjoy it. You get constumes,shoes & gloves before entering & it is included in the ticket. We didn't took ski tickets.One chairlift ride is included & it was good. From top you can see how big it is. Overall very enjoyable with plenty of photo ups. Ski world is in Mall of Emirates so after rides one can enjoy shopping & eating.

Sureal Skiing in the Desert. This was on our to do list, so booked tickets in advance before leaving UK, however this was not really necessary. When you arrive it's a bit chaotic, but once we organised ski lesson for children and the other activities we then got ski suits, gloves, boots to walk plus ski boots, then you get your skis, all included in the price. Inside the activity park, you do feel just how cold it is - like the inside of a giant freezer. You can do tobogganing, rubber ring slides as well as seeing penguins and rolling down a slope in a giant rubber ball. The skiing is pretty awesome too, and the snow is really cool. There is a gondola to the top as well as a couple of button lifts and a cafe half way up. It takes approximately 5 minutes to get to the top and 30 seconds to get to the bottom, but hey, remember you're in the desert.
Pricey but good fun. Our teenagers visited for the day and had a great time.The only visited the slope so are unable to comment on the other areas.

Give it ago. Never been to the snow before.. We went for 3-4 hours.. Didn't get lessons.. Just winged it.. Went back 2 days later for a 2 hr session and went down the experts only run.. Wicked experience..
Great indoor park . Snow had a nice feel to it, didn't feel artificial as most other parks of this nature do.Obviously the slope wasn't huge due to it being indoors but otherwise a good place to ski.

Loved Dubai dki. This is an amazing ski doneIt has a gondola lift to the topGood price -4 so cold tooAll equipment is hired in the price You can go to see penguins hereIt's in the mall of the emirites Would definitely go again

good place to enjoy the slopes without the cost of flying to the Alps!. I had lots of fun going down Ski Dubai slopes. It's a great place to practice skiing and not let your skills become rusty between real-mountain trips!

First time skier on summer holiday . We needed to get out of the sun and as the cinema ratings are different to the UK and my teenage boys didn't want to watch finding dory, we needed to do something different so the youngest had his first ski lesson and loved it - the instructor was great with them and quickly assessed that he had some balance so moved him to a different group. Very well organised, unless you get behind a group trying to haggle the price when paying, and well worth the money for a couple of hours entertainment.

Winter in the desert!. Amazing all around experience. Kept wondering how on earth they're able to keep such a big space so cold throughout. The skiing and watching the penguin show was top dollar! Easy to find location at the mall of the emirates, it is a kids type of thing so expect to mingle around with a few other toddlers. I was with another person so we used the entertainer deal and basically paid for one. All in all 9/10
Great. I really loved this day out with my wife. Staff were great and the price was fair. We used the snow park and went for the Penguin show. My wife loved it as well.

Icy Cold...Superb. You really can't imagine what these Sheikhs can do as long as you don't visit this place.
It's like a whole new city inside a Mall.
It's so huge. And the penguin show is just adorable
Time is not enough. Kids are not willing to come out from the venue they liked so much and all type of age also interested to visit.
Great for kids. I took a four year old in to see the Penguins and play around. The ski lift is good and makes you realize how big this place is inside!!

Beat the heat.. Well almost all travellers to dubai know that the weather is probably the only negative point here.It's hot most time of the year and when we say hot, it's really HOT! What better way to beat the heat than SKI DUBAI. Perfect family outing, kids love the place, just let yourself loose kind of place. Drawbacks: Can be a bit crowded at times, maybe too cold for young kids and a bit steep (worth for a one/two times experience)

BORING, OVERPRICED TIME WASTER!. The last two times I have been here, ( last Christmas and last summer) there has been tobogganing on the bottom of the slope which is where we have spent a fun couple of hours in the SNOWPARK. On this visit there was no tobogganing ( apparently, only on special occasions) What is a snow park without sledding! Without this activity the park was boring after an hour! So after paying 600aed, I decided to upgrade to ski package, 100aed each, so 900 aed (for 3 of us) in total, really??? A joke, I complained and got ski upgrade from manager who was great! But it took over an hour to change boots and get skis! I was on the edge of totally losing my rag with it all!!!! I have been here loads but no one told me there is a new system for getting weighed, measured etc, after all this we ENJOYED THE SKIING.If you really must go here get there at 9.30 am to beat the crowds and queues, terribly crowded after 1pm!!

Wish to cool yourself in hot Dubai?. Perfect place to keep you fit throughout the year. Ski in the morning and swim in the sea in the afternoon..It is perfect combination for me and my family..place is not big but well organised..equipped and vibrant. It accommodates needs of skiers at all levels along with those who just want to have fun on the slide or donut in the snow park.Place is not cheap but worthed to try..great experience in the middle of desert
snow in the desert. nice experience , nice mall , and the snow and skiing is a plus. Unfortunately not a skier myself, so just enjoyed the experience , and watched people enjoying the snow

Snow in the desert?!?!. A surreal experience when you're trying to get away from the searing heat of the hot Dubai sun. A fun little activity, facilities are well looked after and hire gear is stock standard, be it snowboarding or skiing. Getting to the top is easy enough, and it was wise for the designers to apply a large turn, so as to give the illusion that the run is a lot longer than it really is. For what its worth it was a bit of fun, its a short run but you could make it back up to the top again. There are a few little activities in the complex that would entertain all family members. And you can always nip outside to thaw out if the cold is to much to (polar bear) ;)

Snow in the middle of the Desert ..only in Dubai ... We went for the normal admission which allowed us to do the chairlift once, the ball & the snow fun (unlimited), all for the astounding price per person I think kids below 3 free would be much more appropriate. We did enjoy seeing the attractions and activities and were impressed with how enthusiastic the staff were and their knowledge of the facility I guess if you want to have a cool down in the heat of Dubai then this is the right place to do it! I was suitably freezing in there, but soon thawed out within minutes of the Dubai Sun.Personally I would recommend Ski Dubai due to the authenticity and novelty of the complex

Superb place for adventurers!. This is a place to check out in Dubai, the Ski Dubai is one of the first and only indoor artificial snow park located at the Mall of Emirates. It consists of a snow park, skiing, different rides, snow ball ride and even chair lifts..

Not to be missed. One memorable, exciting and thoroughly enjoyable visit to Ski Dubai with my small boys...a must try for kids and adults alike..its a unique snowy adventure anda great escape from the otherwise oppressive heat of Dubai.
Amazing experience . We had an amazing experience skiing in the middle of the desert is something new😁. The Penguins were soooo cute. Recommended.
Piiipickupapenguin. Great ski runs and if you don't fancy skiing or snowboarding you can have fun in the snow park or visit the penguins! You'll be amazed!

cosy and cold. my first time ski and sooo much fun, we booked a private session for one hour and the ski teacher was very kind and a really cool person. you need to pay for the entrance and book ski clothes, cause its cold and for your safety. the ski dubai is big and they offer you to make pictures of your visit and you can also book to play with pinguens.
Penguins!!. Met their King Penguins and it really was a great experience! Only in Dubai. They are clearly well looked after and happy which is great.

Ski lessons. I learned to both Ski and Snowboard here. It's great to get out of the heat and prepare for family skiing holidays before you fly.
