My top tip is to buy discount vouchers from Groupon or Cabone and use them when you need them.Evenings are best as it's less crowded. MONIR is the best instructor for 1-on-1 lessons. A real credit to the ski/snowboarding school.

A great laugh was had by all. Such a great place and so well run. We had a team bonding event here and also took the opportunity of cooling down during these hot summer months. We would highly recommend Ski Dubai. Even if you are a beginner, they have great instructors to get you going. Also a great warm up before heading off on a ski holiday!
Very sereal. On the to do list....if your a great skier then you'll be bored in one run but its worth ticking it off the list

We had a blast and it was so much fun.. We came the first day of Ramadan and we had the place to ourselves. They give you everything you need to ski indoors. We asked for two jackets and they just smiled and said sure. The boots and the skis were good and the guys on the hill were fun to ski with. This is really a fun place. When you're in Dubai you have to do this. LOVED IT

Fantastic day out at ski dubai. Brilliant experience loved every min of it, will Deffo be returning to see the Penguins
We loved the rides and playing in the real snow spend all day here, payed extra to play with the penguins and so glad we did as fully enjoyed the whole experience
Thanks x
wonderful time. The kids went skiing in Dubai and had na amazing time! The price is reasonable for what is offered, good quality of snow and nice staff.

They even leant me gloves!. Reading recent reviews and as an Austrian alpine hotel owner I was somewhat dubious about a trip to Ski Dubai with my daughter. I have to say that, on the whole I quiet enjoyed the experience - busy and a little chaotic, lots if queuing for equipment and no time for any sort of personal service - my boots were at least a couple of sizes too big!Great slope in terms of meterage, good drag lifts and even an ever so slow chair - and a really nice First Aid guy lent me his gloves.About £50 plus a locker fee for a couple of hours and as everyone comments - you have to 'snow ski in Dubai' even though it's outrageous and totally immoral!

Doesn't feel like you are in a country where its 45 degrees outside. Went there with a few friends, staff are very helpful and friendly with getting the gear on and ready. It is very cold but fun. For all students: Go on a Monday between 4-11 it only costs 100 dhs + card charge for 3 hours if you prove you study here.

Watch for Free.. The ski centre was an amazing place so incredible to releaize it's 40 outside. We didn't go inside but spent a good half hour having a coffe & watching all the kids having fun on the toboggans and snow fighting. There are a few eating places with big windows that give great views or you can simply just stand in front of three other huge Windows. Not if you have kids in tow or they would demand to go in - it looked a real blast
Nice time with family . We spend half day in ski dubai and we had a meet and greet with the Penguins. This is very interesting and you able to touch the bird. Very informative
Feel like you are out of GCC. Beat the heat by entering the freezing zone :)it's good experience but needs more improvement with more fun games.
Felt like in Himayalas :P. Ski Dubai is indoor ice resort and the best place to get relax from extreme summer in Dubai. It is a family's favourite destination.

Of course it's expensive!. It's a ski slope in the desert. It's expensive. It has a feeling of an alpine resort. Our kids have learnt to ski here. Great facility. Good ski school. A thousand times better than a dry ski slope. It's never going to be the Alps. The mid-way coffee shop is ok for hot chocolate.Down side. The kids were in ski school. We went in too. At the end of ski school they weren't released to us until they went outside the slope and handed their gear in. So if you want to ski with the kids at the end of their week, they want you to pay twice. Surely a nice little grad present would be an extended last session so families could ski together to see what the kids have learned?To watch the kids in there, you can go to the Cheesecake Factory, TGI Fridays or the bar upstairs near the Kempinski Hotel. There is no ski Dubai viewing area.

1 day snow experience. My 3 year old loved this place. This is a good place for families with kids or group of friends for skiing. The price for a whole day inside the -4 winter area is 275 AED for residents. This also includes the chair lift ride, tubing, giant ball, fleece gloves and jacket/trouser boots rental. The locker is 30 dirhams (refundable). There are coffee shops if you run low on energy and body heat. Please come in on full stomach because once you go out, it's game over. Take lots of pictures and maximize all the freebies included. Bring thermals, waterproof gloves and extra socks or bonnet. It is really sub zero inside. :)

Great Fun escape from Summer. It's amazing it's 47 degrees outside the mall and it's -3 inside the desert.. Wow incredible . Thanks Dubai!Kids enjoy it and love the experience We as adults had new experience too and enjoyed the games with out kids. We simply enjoyed it as a family. I played with my kids in the games together having fun feeling as a family experiencing little adventure we are not used to go through before but it was Great.The clothes provided us not enough to protect from the -3 cold place inside, so I recommend you to wear long sleeves and more than one cloth under the jacket. The gloves is not that quality to protect from snow so you have to purchase water proof gloves or bring yours. I found that socks are very light so we had to wear 2 socks and we were feeling cold also. I found my skiing cloth which j bought from the Alb mountains in Italy is very warm but this free cloth provided is very light and not not preserving the heat of your body. Even though you had to go in and out the skiing place to warm up and go back again several time.But we all love it and will go again soon running from the burning sun here.

Snow in Desert!!. This was also a part of our package which the kids throughly enjoyed and so did we, warm clothes and shoes alongwith helmets is provided by ski management staff as per your size and its better to load yourself with these as temperature inside is close to -10 degrees, there are plenty of rides alongwith ski slope where you can spend time with young ones, but the day we visited the ski slope was closed due to maintenance, they also have penguin show which is worth watching.

Wide variety of things to do and get out of the sun - Brilliant Santa Experience!. We have been quite a few times to Ski Dubai and it is getting better. It is not cheap but if you use 'The Entertainer' it helps. For those who ski/board, the run is very short and the black non existent but there is a small park. For non skiers there is still the option to ride the chair lift and do a variety of activities which look fun (never actually did any except the toboggan (hard and bumpy!). These all cost extra (except the toboggan) - a pass would make this economical and be a fun way to be in the cold but not get bored (just walking around inside seems a little boring).We took the kids to see Father Christmas here (Dec 2015) and it was AMAZING. Santa looked so real my kids were completely dumbstruck and there was a lovely toboggan slope that kids young and old could enjoy until they got too cold. We all had hot chocolate and it was insanely sweet but warm so we enjoyed it.TIP The 'warm' clothing you get given on entry isn't warm at all so take more layers to go underneath. You need to take your own gloves/hats although kids get given helmets.

Great fun day out. Took my young son 4 years old for a lesson. The staff are very courteous and help you get suited and booted ready for your ski experience. The instructor then took my son off for an hour lesson and I headed for the lifts. There are actually several combinations of slopes to use red or black runs from the top so there is a little for everybody. After an hour skiing then I picked my son up where he had a lot of fun and the staff really looked after him. It was a fun morning out.

Ski camp for a 3 year old, excellent!! . Just a quick review to say my 3 year old attended beginners ski camp for a week here and it was fab. My son generally isn't a daredevil so I thought he would hate it but he actually loved it, and based on the success of the week, will continue him with weekly lessons. He had two instructors who didn't initially seem that warm with young kids but over the week they built up a great rapport and had really got to know the group. Few suggestions for improvement: When booking the camp online, it only gave you three options for beginner, intermediate and advanced. Apparently there is also the 'discovery' class which is for real beginners where they learn to snowplough, how to stop etc and my son probably should have attended that class before the beginners camp. Would have been useful to have that information online ahead of time. Re: all the paraphernalia they need, again would have been good to get an automated email from the system saying this is what your child will need and this is what we will provide and this is how the week will work. Just to help the parents be more prepared and on top of things. Aside from that - it was well organised and run. Nice little touch on the last day was parents were allowed inside to watch and kids given hot chocolate on the slopes at the end of class which they really enjoyed. All in all would highly recommend for small kids and big kids / adults!
Cool in hot. Good place to have a cup of coffee in hot weather Coffee are amazing and very well presentable.......

Fun. It's a fun place ..ofcourse extremely cold.Loved the rides inside.They don't offer helmets for adults only for.kids so best to carry your own caps and a warm scarf if you aren't cold tolerant.Gloves and warm.clothes are given though they aren't that warm so prepare yourself accordingly.Fun place and deserves a visit atleast once.

Celebrated my daughters Bday. We had an awesome time at Ski Dubai. The staff Mr. Ravi was very friendly and informative. Thank you Mr. Ravi for the hospitable service given. I also have to mention Ms. Rachel at Digi Photos for being extremely helpful and providing explicit service.Hats off to Ski Dubai and Penguin Encounter for having excellent individuals at base who are genuine in their approach. My family congratulates everyone and the best service provided. I also would like to mention about the front area cleaning staff. I haven't seen such immaculate service and dedication in places like this before. I couldn't get the name of that gentleman though who was feverently cleaning up, at one time I had a drink , before I could place it in the bin, he took it from me to spare me the trouble of finding a bin, though I insisted I will do it myself. There is no requirement to go beyond your way to make everyone happy but I must say Ski Dubai offered the best service to my family. And I totally recommend this place to everyone. A must visit to see top class service and entertainment. Thank you Ski Dubai.
It's Like No Where Else. This is inside the mall. I went to the mall to see this attraction. I didn't ski but it is really something to see. It looks like a real ski resort.

Day visit. A great day out for all the family, real snow, great slopes and good facilties for the children ie fun slides, king penguins on show and much more. All clothing issued before you enter and is included in the price, well worth a visit
Good experience but very expensive. Being in the snow in Dubai is a good experience, has all kinds of details to play in the snow, but the price is quite expensive.

Nice change of scenery from the heat. incredibly cold inside. I went with my two small children and they enjoyed themselves very much on the activities for small children. Downhill skiing and snowboarding looked like fun. Very nice. Must see if ever in Dubai

The place to be escape from the heat of Dubai. Conveniently placed inside the mall of Emirates literally the coolest place to hang out with friends amazing place and amazing stuff to do lots fun and games inside to spend time never feel like going out cause of the minus temperature inside and the best part are the Penguins there lots of them and very well kept do visit and have a chill...!!!

So much surreal fun.. Only in Dubai.....an excellent day out of toboggan rides, skiing and snow boarding all inside a shopping mall, seeing really is believing!Very well organised and you can hire everything from boots to snowsuits, helmets and gloves and bizarrely after 20 mins you are freezing and can head for the cabin on the slope to enjoy hot chocolate. The ski lifts will take you to the top of the slopes and there are some great instructors to guide you. A great day out for the family and not to be missed.

First experience of snow and we came to the desert!. While we live in a country with snow - Australia! Our kids have never experienced it!My family travelled with me on a recent visit to Dubai for a conference this was part of a broader European holiday!Looking for day activities they ventured to the Emirates mall looking for activities and decided to try skiing. The kids loved it - the cost included gear and ski lessons.Great way to kill a few hours escaping the heat.Highly recommend it.

Good. This place seems to be very expensive. There are different packages to choose from. The option we purchased gave us 3 types of unlimited games and 1 chairlift. Overall it was fun but the downfall in the suits do not really keep you warm enough, we were too cold so decided to leave early. I would advise you definitely wear warm clothing under their suits.
Perfect for one day with friends . Very nice to spend one day with friends or family. While outside there are 45 degree you can ski inside. Perfect for families as well.

Excellent visit . This is awesome place. It is great experience to feel snow in summer hot days and in a hot area. Personally I've never been in snow area in winter but fortunately I visited this place and felt it really. My 5 years old daughter enjoyed a lot but my 4 year son was frightened by cold sliding, big ball etc. Overall we enjoyed.

Great Fun. The Ski Dubai is located in the Mall of The Emirates and online booking saves some money. Also, if you wish to experience the Penguins, online pre-booking is a must as it is based on time slots and has heavy rush. Carry some headwear as no headwear is provided and the temperature is sub zero. The activity needs the entire day and the complete family can enjoy. Metro is a good way to reach there.

Excellent experience. Ski Dubai experience is very unique experience you can get . I think this is the only place in middle east where we can experience snow park and activities .There are so many rides and activities in this park. Regardless of age all can experience this park and the attraction is you can see penguins inside . And you may get chance to touch and take pictures along with these penguins. There are so many different packages based on your activities.Overall experience is very good

Skiing in the Desert . Who skis in the desert??? Me, that's who. I call this the "11th wonder of the world" :) a legit ski park in the mall. I opt to do the discovery package (350 AED) and I found the hour of ski lessons, extremely helpful. Even if you don't like skiing or the cold, please, check this place out. How many people can boast about skiing in the desert.

Business with A Little Pleasure Mixed In. Ski Dubai is a one of a kind, mountain-themed attraction, offering the opportunity to enjoy real snow in Dubai, whatever the season. Situated in the Mall of the Emirates, Ski Dubai is the Middle East’s first indoor ski center. Whether you’re a newbie or a pro, Ski Dubai offers an amazing setting to enjoy skiing, snowboarding or just playing in the snow. Choose from five exhilarating fun runs, the longest being 400 meters with a 60-metre drop.
Ski Dubai visit. Must go , everyone will enjoy surely. Especially younger generation. Minus three degree temperature us maintained throughout. Lots of games inside.

Fun, Fun, Fun..... Well, Skiing in Dubai, seriously? We were expecting less, we actually enjoyed our time. It is a refreshing experience, and very well organized and prepared. You forgot your gears? No worries they have all, from gloves to poles EVERYTHING! Good for all ages and skills levels. Go try it!

Snow Experience in Desert. I must say that it is a blessing for people staying in Dubai to learn and enjoy Skiing. It has a huge Ski slopes enjoy all different types of situations in snow. For visitors they have very few rides and they are all OK not excellent. Knowing all that we just went for my Kid. For Kids I would say, will have a great time. My 10 Year old had his best time enjoying the activities, till he started feeling cold. We enjoyed the experience of the place more than any of the activities. The coffee shop in the snow which is on the ski slopes is only open for those who have opted for ski lessons or full day package, which I felt was a let down. Those who just want to enjoy the cafeteria and not want to do any activities will not get any thing to eat or drink inside. You will have to go out for food and drinks and enjoy the view from behind the glass window. Price : Its very expensive for the kind of activities offered inside. Its now worth spending if you have enjoyed the real snow else where.

ski dubai. in the heart of the shopping centre is a snow field with a full chair lift. Off you go to learn skiing with private tution if required or take on the slope your self. Pricing seems like any ski slope. Definately worth viewing as a tourist attraction also. great shopping complex with everything. money exchange, carre four etc.

Great fun for the family. When working out what tickets we needed to purchase for our family we found a lot of conflicting information regarding our 2 1/2 year old and the need to buy him a ticket. When we arrived they admitted that there was different information, however advised us that any child 2 and over has to have a ticket. Once that was resolved it was all uphill from there. The ski shop where you get gloves were very helpful and accommodating. The winter clothes they provide were great for the family. Make sure you leave plenty of time to get all your gear on, plus helmets for kids under 13. Our kids loved simple things of doing snow angels, but also loved the tubes and Zorb balls. All round it was great fun for all.
Super fun place. A great place to take your family and guests. Well maintained, well-trained staff, nice ambience. Really worth a visit.

Just awesome . Who said money can't buy you ski or snow in the middle of the desert110 degrees outside and About 20 inside must see just love the smiles on kids faces when they see snow for the first time

Beginner lessons weren't great. I had never skied before so I went with the beginner lessons. However, we were a group of 3 and the two others in my group had skied a few times before. I could keep up with the basics of moving around, but as the instructor started moving on to more advanced stuff like actual skiing, I started lagging behind. Instead of giving me special attention like one might expect, the instructor decided to stick with the two girls who could already ski. And just decided to yell at me from a distance and tell me that I was doing everything wrong. Towards the end he proceeded to joke about stealing our phones while we asked him to take pictures of us. Not funny.Also if you have a local with you, ask them if they have any promotions going on. We were able to get a decent discount because one of us had a particular local bank card.The other rides were quite fun and the penguins were really cute. Although it seems very commercial. e.g."Who would like to touch the penguins?"*little kid raises hand*"Well for that you have to buy the penguin encounter!"Poor little kid.

Amazing for all ages!. We visit this every year at Christmas as they have a special section with Father Christmas and sledging. I would definitely recommend this for anyone as there's so much to do here!

Wow. Must visit with kids.
They will love the place.
Penguins, ice slide, cable tram , ski, snow, many things to do here.
Must visit.
One of those places where u can have fun unlimited. If you plan to visit then reach before mid-day and have fun till you get tired. Bit expensive but fun unlimited.

Definitely go inside!. We went to the mall just to check it out and had no intention of going inside Ski Dubai. Honestly it was pretty affordable and they provide everything. We didn't actually ski but there was tubing and other kid friendly (and adults that are kids at heart) activities. We ended up having such a blast and the pictures are so amazing! Definitely worth the money and it was an unexpected surprise!

Snow oh Snow. It is a very good experience going there. I have gone there many times by now. Many activities to do over there. Rated as a Must Visit place. Pls visit there at least for the sake of your children
Sky dubai. Sky dubai part of dubai mall and more of item ice sleeping ice buket and on tree wire machine i like it

Amazing expereince. The place is really nice. The super pass costs 275 Dirhams but i took advantage of buying the entertainer application which gives the offer of buy 1 get 1 free and i have saved 550 dirhams as we are a family of 2 adults and 2 kids.Using the entertainer application is one of the most important savings for most of out trips.

Snowy Experience!. We went here to celebrate my son's 5th Birthday. no much queue since we came on a weekday, facilities are provided well. I suggest to get a full entry pass so you can enjoy the whole area.

Amazing experience. It is incredible to have snow in the middle of the desert. Lots of fun things to do inside. Zip line, chair lift, skiing. Need to be an experienced skiier or have lessons there. We had booked the wrong ticket (we booked for skiing but we had no experience). The attendant was good about changing it over to another ticket type. Would recommend giving it a try!

Great experience to meet the pengiins. As reviewed by our 5 year old: it was very cold and very icy but I had lots of fun. The sledging was brilliant and the tobagan was good fun. Photos were expensive £85 for3. Yes that is £85 for 3 8x10 photos plus you get the digital image.

Awesome experience, but too expensive. Awesome snow world, we enjoyed a lot.A great environment to relax/
However, everything is over-priced, especially the prices of photos, those are outrageous

Fun for a short while - Very Overpriced. We went for the normal admission which allowed us to do the chairlift once, the ball & the snow fun (unlimited), all for the astounding price of just over £50.00 per person, I think £20.00 would be much more appropriate. We did enjoy seeing the Penguins & were impressed with how enthusiastic the staff were and their knowledge of Penguins was admiral.I guess if you want to have a cool down in the heat of Dubai then this is the right place to do it! I was suitably freezing in there, but soon thawed out within minutes of the Dubai Sun.Personally I wouldn't recommend Ski Dubai due to the price, the complex being so small & the lack of things to do.
its an a world class experience. its awesome .we took polar express it was speechless thingand it was the most memorable moment of our life.i wish we could go there again and again
Joyful. I like it, I went there with my friends, you will enjoy ski there but you should know how to do it .Ticket is little bit expensive for one.

indoor temperature was -4°C & temperature outside was 38°C.. My last visit in Dubai was to the Ski Dubai in the Mall of the Emirates, here indoor temperature was -4°C & temperature outside was 38°C. Inside Ski hill was jammed with snowboarders and skiers. Here we got an opportunity to encounter with 3 little penguin’s.

Snow in summer. In the morning, we went jet skiing, and then in the afternoon we skiied on snow in Snow Dubai. I expected it to be tacky, but it really was nice. The staff were amazingly friendly and helpful -- so unlike what I am used to in the U.S.! My grandson went snowboarding and praised the lifts and the slope. I did the snow zipline, and that was fun! It's cold but not too cold, and they give you a snow suit and boots with the ticket. Just bring your own hat and gloves (or buy inexpensive ones in the adjoining shop). It's so much better than I expected.
Fantastic Experience. Quite pricey but great experiencePrice includes your 'winter uniform' with shoes...the works.Very cold inside.

Surreal Experience. None of our party had never been skiing before, and due to our exuberance just wanted to get the skis on (well, snowboarding) but sadly struggled to do anything - we should have went for an hours training session (which was available) and would have came away with some idea of what we should be doing.As it turned out, we didn't really get a good taste for skiing. However, that said - it was a very surreal experience standing in Dubai freezing our butts off in snow! We did the stair lift and then played about with the other winter games that were available.We awaited the penguin March, however that was a bit disappointing as only 2 penguins came out to see us. We did expect a bit more.Overall, if we had done some form of beginners learning we would have had a far better day, but still it was a good experience and great to see.
Really amazing!!. Very cool experience! Lots of different activities to do as well some penguin time. Definitely recommend for a few hours of fun.

Fun but not 100% safe.. I had a great time enjoying the snow while the temperature outside was reaching the 42 degrees Celsius. I am not an expert in skiing but I can go on the high slopes without problems. Except the lift. After going up with the extremely slow lift I have decided to take the small one that you hold between your legs. My friend just felt down in the middle of the way while I reached the end but there was no one from the park there to advise us of the moment that we should remove the lift from between our legs. I was apparently too slow and as an result I was thrown over a bump of ice, crashing my hips against and hitting my head on the ground. Scared after the hit and worrying for my physical integrity I was crying on the floor and it took a while until someone came and helped me. Of course after that I wasn't able to ski as before and my experience was basically cut in half.It is a lot of fun and I would definitely go back there because i really enjoy skiing but the experience would have been much better if I felt a little bit more safe and the staff would be more attentive.

Just Amazing!!!!. It was our Anniversary Day and we decided to visit Mall of Emirates and get into Ski Dubai. It was the ground level and we paid to get the tickets, got into the warm jackets provided onsite and entered the area. It was like Snow everywhere and cable car running above and people skiing all around. We also had few photo opt options which we didn't missed. As our visit time was Jul-Aug, the outside temp was aroung 47+ degrees and we were freezing in -5 degrees inside. Just an awesome feeling and the maintenance of the property is very good. I certainly recommend this visit to all travelers to Dubai.

Unique experience. It really feels weird coming across a ski resort in that hot climate. It offers an escape of the everyday weather and routine for those who live in Dubai. However, for those who are able to go to a normal ski resort , this is one is very small and very expensive.
Expensive. I enjoyed the main activity. The extras was aimed to much for kids. Had a beginner ski lesson. Instructor was great. She made the whole experience worth it

good for small kids for and if expert in sking. it good for people who have never seen snow . too expensive . 220 dirahms for just getting inside . you get access to a small slope ride and 2 more rides .for learning sking, penguin session you have ti pay more . get your pair of socks and good pair of gloves. Otherwise they charge 25 for a good pair . just get ready to shell of lot of money in all such activities.
The place to go In the summer. We had enjoyed our time my self and my kids and they had the experience of ICE while the outside temperature was around 40

Penguin Encounter. We visited the Ski Dubai with my niece, and it was an awesome experience. Opinions with his team of King Penguins - Wally and Aamshi were superb cute....such well trained penguins....Denis with Pebbles, Pumpkin and little Peter who are all Gento Penguins was so entertaining. It was so adorable to watch mama Pebbles trying to teach baby Peter how to Jump...this was a very enchanting experience, one that I will certainly repeat again...
Very, very funny sightseeing. Imagine the temperature outside to be around 45 degrees Celcius and get in a mall with a construction like this

Innovative and mostly "industrial" fun. Well it was so interesting giving this was all "man-made".The landscaping was good.Children had a blast of course.Limited activities for adults.Overall it was a new experience but wouldn't stay there for more than two hours max. To be honest.

Are you a skiier?. If you are a skiier, you will have a giggle watching people play on this indoor 'snow field', but you would never consider this a viable option for actually 'skiing'. But if you are visiting Dubai with kids and are looking for a fun family activity which keeps kids out of 42 degree heat, then this may be a good option for you.

something you have to see to believe. Ski Dubai - proof of the fun extravagance of Dubai created by developers and builders for the residents and tourists alike. Photos of the ski hill and winter park don't do it justice because it's difficult to imagine an indoor ski hill. It's free to view from the Mall of Emirates.

Underwhelming. If you are a serious skier you will be disappointed by the size of the infrastructure and the quality of the fake snow. If you are a beginner and have nothing better to do while in Dubai, this might do the trick.

Great Fun. As we're not 'experienced skiers' we didn't actually ski here, however, we did have a great time on the cable cars, and rolling down a hill in a giant ball.As expected it is freezing, so if you know you're coming here in advance it's worth bringing a jumper or something warmer to wear under the clothes that are provided.It seemed to be well catered to children, as there are a few child only 'rides'.All in all, if you've got the money to spare, it's a great experience. I would recommend getting the package where you can also meet the Penguins, as that was the highlight for me.

Pretty amazing . Went there with my 3 year old. She was very amazed (so was i). We did the penguin encounter. And by that time my daughter was cold. I think we're not dressed appropriately under the overalls they give. It was good though. Would recommend.
FUN. Very helpful staff and well maintained facilities. Super fun attraction in the heat of Dubai to enjoy with the whole family!

Brilliant Place . This is a brilliant idea and a great place to go to as well. Skiing is good not a lot but for the middle of Dubai it's good.Penguins are there as well which is brilliant. Overall a good day out.

Fun times . Wanted to try this as it's a key attraction in dubai, we are seasoned skiers so didn't feel there was a lot of excitement for people who have skied a lot beforehand, the slopes get quite repetitive. I would really recommend for beginners who want to learn before they go onto fresh snow. A good experience, but don't think we will return.

Great fun. We originally visited here in 2007 when it opened. Great fun for us all..... Strange going from over 40degrees to -4 The location is excellent as within the Mall. you don't have to ski, just have snow fun should you wish.
2 hour pass. Booked our son on the 2 hour pass ... Really enjoyed the slopes....would do again .250 dirhams with 20 refunded via the automated machines near the ticket counter

Super Cool. Well worth it - great fun for entire family.Take extra warm clothes along - remember to carry extra thick insulated gloves......you will need them!! Also alot an extra 30 mins in the beginning for putting on all the layers of clothing...it takes a while especially with kids :)Cafe at the top of the slope is also fantastic!! lovely nachos and coffee.Overall a brilliant experience.

Amazing Place to Ski or Snowboard. This really is a place for all Ski and Snowboarding fans, the largest indoor snow park in the middle of the desert, you just do not realise how big this place really is till your inside, it has a 1/4 mile from the top of the slope to the bottom runs and there are many different ways you can go from the top to the bottom, you then get the luxury of taking a chair lift where you can get off half way and ski or snowboard back down or stay on board and go right to the top where you really get an idea of how big this place really is. There is also plenty for the little one as there is a snow park where you can have fun with people who do not want to ski or snowboard, there is all sorts for them to do plus you can pay extra and meet a penguin, have a hug and have photos taken. One thing I must point out there is no where for anyone to sit to be able to watch people come down the ski slope unless you pay for an indoor pass that allows you to watch at different locations so unlike the UK where there is a restaurant at the bottom of the slope here there is not, at the bottom is a hotel and many different restaurants where you may be lucky to be seated in view of the slope but they do expect you to eat and drink so if you have anyone in the party who does not like snow and just wants to watch there can only look over the snow fun area and not at the slope itself unless you pay to enter.

Winter wonderland in the desert city................... Seeing is believing what unlimited wealth and good planning can do,reminiscent of a cold day on a mountain,a wonderful opportunity for locals to practice their skills and a must see for visitors,I find the whole concept incredible.

Ski Dubai is great fun!. Ski Dubai is an extremely creative concept of having a snow world in a desert city. Very innovative and well made. Safe for children however, a parent should always be attentive to kids as there are some obvious chances of children falling on the snow and getting hurt. Specially during the ski training. There are penguin shows where they allow you to be around the penguins and touch them. The clothes, hand gloves, shoes are to be taken from the park itself but one should always carry children warm clothes so that they are more. Protected in 2-3 layers of clothes. After few hours the cold becomes difficult to handle so kids enjoy in warm clothes. To summarise, it's a fun experience for elders and kids!
Different experience. indoor ski resort with ample space to cover. a different experience especially for the ones staying in the middle east.
Amazing and fun. Great oasis in middle of desert. Definitely a must do on your Dubai bucket list. Fun for the adults and kids

Icicles in the mall of Emirates . One way to cool down after traipsing around the mall of the Emirates is to jump into a snow suit and hit ski Dubai! As a complete novice I had the beeeest time! I had a full on induction and staff were so so friendly and keen to make me feel comfortable even though I was so scared! Be sure to get the full induction! Definitely worth a trip for a novice! Great family fun!

Skiing in a mall - in the desert?!! YEPPER!!!. What a pleasant surprise! I've skiid Utah, Norway, Colorado, The Dolomites, California/Tahoe, and even Mt. Etna! The first thing you notice driving up is the non-sequitor architectural element sticking out of the roof of the mall. Like what were they thinking?!! But then you find out... Ski Dubai is the real deal, with surface quality that will truly surprise and please. Full-gamut rent-and-ski packages just in case you thought you were touring in a desert or something. Great way to tune up for a trip to the frozen north.

Awesome Time. What can be said about an indoor ski resort but...AWESOME! We had some downtime between days and we decided to wonder into this place. Totally so much fun. They offer everything from ski lessons, to ski tubing, snow boarding, etc. Worth a trip.

A must do!. Really wasn't up for this but my husband convinced me and I'm so glad we did. It was rainy at home so really just wanted to enjoy the sun but 3hours in here on the activity pass for the bottom area was so much fun! Our 2+8mnths son had a fabulous time and so did we.

amazing snow experience in desert. amazing snow experience in desert, its a unforgettable, you can also get hot chocolate inside then you feel cold you can drink it like life saver, cable chair, activity are also amazing.
Snow in the dessert! Woah!. The place is perfect for people of all ages. Situated in a mall still it is located in a huge huge auditorium. Ideal place for a weekend trip.

A beautiful cold world in the desert city. Kids love it and adults enjoy it too. You can visit the snow world without carrying any warm outfits. The tickets are inclusive of the outfits and helmets.
Adults can carry their personal caps, as there are no helmets for adults, if not skiing.

Too expensive for a fake experience. Seriously ? Skying in the middle of the Desert ? It's like I didn't get it and be sure that I still don't ... What the hell is that ? It's just nonsense, still my friends attracted me inside, well it's definitely useless, only one track, you don't feel the mountain, no sensation it's just artificial in it's own essence, I don't recommandbat all !

Iceee!!!!. This is located at Mall of the Emirates, well connected by Metro! I had snow park n penguin encounter experience. Both were good! You even get to swim with penguins :)) ! Soon they are coming up with overnight camping in freezing temp! Looking forward!!

Snow in summer. This is a reminder of how innovative people in Dubai are. Imagine snow in summer. I come from a country where it never ever snows so it was an exciting experience for me. Its a bit pricey but its worth every penny. So much fun activities to do like snowboarding, skiing, penguin encounter, bobsledding.

Great time skiing. We had a very nice time skiing here. It was very quiet so we could get in a lot of runs in the 2 hours we were there. Kids enjoyed it although might be a bit boring for expert skiers it was ideal for us.

Expensive but nice experience. Ski Dubai is expensive but its a nice place to be with kids. They will provide all the accessories to get in to snow. Make sure to go to the cable car in the end, you will be freezing after that it will be difficult to enjoy other options.

Only in Dubai!!. I heard about this place and finally got to see it firsthand. If you live in a place that will never ever see snow unless hell freezes over, then you simply bring the snow to you. Inside the Mall Of the Emirates where outside it is 115 degrees and humid, you will see people wearing heavy clothing for ski vacations. Imagine walking into a mall and seeing people going up higher on ski lifts so they can ski or snowboard down. What an amazing idea and execution to bring snow to the desert!

Wow, indoor skiing . Situated in the Mall of the Emirates, this is an amazing totally indoor snow skiing fun park. Locals and tourists can either ski, snowboard or just play in the snow - sure looked like great fun. All this behind huge glass windows in a shopping centre - an amazing concept. Skiers could choose from five great runs, the longest being 400 meters with a 60-metre drop. Naturally you don't need your own equipment because the centre provides all the gear you need for the day. Well worth a visit just to see this.
A lot of fun. Very good value... my son and I had a great time skiingand snow boarding for a couple of hours whilethe rest of the family went shopping. Very good value for ther price.

A dream in the desert .... I went there last april 2016 . .. This amazing place is located in the Mall of Emirates, very easy to reach with Dubai metro ...How describe a ski run covered in the middle of the desert?They provide to all, jacket, pants, ski everything with a comfortable price ... you can choose if spend 2 hours, all day long and other packages, but my suggestion is (if you want to try just to ski) to spend 2h ... are more than enough ...Close to entrance there is a characteristic restaurant where eat a lot of meals ...My final conclusion is: to visit once in your life if you go to Dubai ... it will be an amazing experience ...

Fun Attraction. Although in a smaller mall -The Emirates - still lots to do and see here
Having an indoor ski resort is surely a great way to beat the heat

Ski Dubai experience. Experience:- Ski Dubai a must try if you have not seen snow in your life. - I am from India, never seen snow but have visited Finland while snowing so I was knowing how it will feel to my wife. So I decided to visit Ski Dubai. She liked it too much, maybe most in the whole list of Dubai visit.Felt that we should have stayed there more 2 hours but had other plans.Activity Info:- We were inside Ski Dubai for 2 hours and did mos of the activities (Snow Fun, Giant Ball, Mountain Thriller, etc) inside which comes with Super pass including Chairlift ride by which you feel like you are in Simla north India.Facilities:- They provide you enough cloths to keep you warm with some charges.- They provide you locker if needed to keep your belongings with some charges.- You can take pictures on your own, their professional photographers also take pictures of yours but the prices were way to high for me so skipped it. Just seen taken pictures in display and that's it !Reaching there:- This is inside Mall of Emirates (Crazy huh? Snow Park in the middle of Desert inside Mall)- Dubai is easy to roam around using metro and Mall of Emirates is one of the stop in the route.
Amazing day...always up for a nice change. Had a fun loving day...it's a place for a good unwind...when one is looking for a break from mall walking in dubai...

To kill time. While everyone is shopping, kids can enjoy as much as fun adults, the ski experience at the mall. It's easy access and the equipment is all provided and for a few half hours, one can occupy oneself with this exciting activity in a hot place like Dubai.

Surreal - a novelty in a desert country. Worth going just for the novelty - a simple, downhill run, not in any way taxing. A few small berms to give a bit of 'up', but essentially a straightforward short run - about 250m long. Good fun but the novelty wears off fast. Not cheap - but then its Dubai!

Overpriced and small. I was so excited to see this place and was very disappointed when we finally got there. The size was much smaller than I thought. There was very little viewing room to watch the winter activities. Everything is overpriced.
Nice 😬😬😬😆. Its very nice place where when u enter u are too cold and freezing it has great decorations to be more realistic. I advise to go
Ski DUbai. Visible from far distance and situated in Emirates mall.More interesting for people who dont have real winter and snow at home countries )

Poorly organised, don't do lessons!!. It is a novelty being able to ski in the desert, but there are so many other options to do in Dubai. Even during the quieter months, you will need to line up to buy your ticket, then line up again to get your gear and then if you re skiing, you need to line up for a third time, all of which will take considerable time. There are more people on the floor telling you where to go. The lessons are the worst I have seen, if you have young children, they may only get 1 or 2 goes down the beginners' slope. It really is a waste of money. Living in Dubai, it was a novelty to start with, but one that I will not be returning too.

Not for experts! . I feel that ski Dubai would be fantastic for beginners to the sports, but it certainly doesn't cater to experts I was quite bored when I went here the runs were too small length ways and the park was out of commission I got bored fairly quickly... However the cafe at the mid point of the slope was quite good, I had a nice hot chocolate there!
hot skiing. We had never skied in our lives until we visited the Ski Dubai and we were amazed how helpful and skilful the teacher was and we had a great time.

Very slow service. This is one of the attractions, that has to be included in your bucket list if you are travelling to Dubai. When +40C outside, its just -3C inside. its not cheap at all. Family of 4 has to spend a fortune for the Snowpark. I was very upset with double booking for the penguin encounter. that created a lot of waiting time and great inconvenience. Although the staff seemed to be willing to help, their service is to slow and they definitely need more training on their customer service skills. They were not very clear in their explanations and kept us waiting for almost an hour.

Good place to escape the heat. You could forget how hot it is outside once you go in. the Slop split into 2 in the middle. Perfect place to learn snowboarding or skiing also.Nice coffee shop to chill which you need to take the chairlift to reach.

Worth a look even if you don't ski. Located in lovely modern,Emirates Mall. It is fully visible from the central hall of the mall without actually going inside. There is a nearby food court with lots of nice choices, Besides skiing, there is sledding for children and they also offered rolling in those clear bubbles.

Great fun . Defo a must!!! I had never done snow boarding or skiing before so If ur the same I would highly recommend a lesson before hand... Great experience and fun!. Also there's plenty people There to help you too

Amazing!. Found it to be as fun filled and realistic as it could be for such man made entertainment facility.Enough rides to make it equally interesting to kids and adults, cold enough to make one shiver too.The encounter with the penguins is just as interesting and educational also.

Why not. We hadn't intended on going but after buying some hats to take home with us we thought we better try it so we could say we skied in Dubai.You are provided with pants, coat, and a pair of new socks and boots. They aren't heavy so having just shorts underneath was chilly after a couple runs. Gloves are not provided so my hands were cold and I was ready to leave well before the two hours. Poles you picked up after getting off the escalator at the top. You pay for a locker but get some of $$ back when you return the card that tracks your time.

A good stop. I always go to the Mall of the emirates to sit an rest at the arabian restaurant that overlooks the ski parkIts good to see the action and rest a while, I am not a skier but ale=ways fascinated by the sport

" Too Expensive !! ". This is also most hyped attractions in Duabi..Sky Dubai is too expensive, charges for entry is 500 AED & it is same for both adults & children...This charges are include only for snow garden & some other small slides & you have to pay extra for other activities like skying etc..

Totally worth the visit. It's an expensive deal but totally worth the money. It's super cool inside and you need to wear jackets and shoes and caps. The slides and other rides are really nice. Did not try the skiing. You can pay for skiing lessons as well. The sky lift is very nice. Other smaller attractions are cool.

Expensive for just snow park, young kids charged same entrance as Adults.... If you have never seen snow this place will be amazing... Clothes provided are too thin for -4 temperature, you will need to wrap up underneath. Gloves provided are not water proof, when you touch the snow your figures will get wet and subsequently cold.Visited during Ramadan, no restaurants were open but the venue was not too busy!Rides were okay, but seem disorganized in terms of management of guests pushing in front other guests...The snow park is actually missing snow to pick up and play with... My youngest daughter who is .5 years of age was charged the same entrance fee as an adult but was unable to participate on most of the rides; she would had been happy just to play with snow etc...You really should not charge revamp amount for very young children as adults... We enjoyed are few hours, but felt like we were overcharged... Perhaps I may return to snowboard...
Good for company outing.. First time and we amazed the place. Lots of activities that can fit to company outing.Helpful staff and approachable.

Snow World in UAE. Yes its the snow world for you in the middle of Desert land.Inside its too cold. The temperature is around -5 to 5` Celsius.Yes it is bit expensive and we have to keep in mind what all is allowed and what all dove need to see.It can take a whole day to enjoy the whole place.It is good if you visit the place with family & friends.

Hilarious, if expensive novelty. Is it ethical to snowboard in the desert? It certainly is a lot of fun! Though for more experienced skiers it may get a tad repetitive after an hour or so. The extras are great for kids only - they seem to love it.

Must visit place for Dubai weather. wonderful ground to play of any age. You difinately feel beautiful weather in dubai such a great atmosphere they made in dubai snow. Fact is it maintained standards of dubai. Dubai always flop in weather so visiting here will be another new world. Must go place for me

indoor skiing. if you visit the Mall of emirates you have to pay a visit to ski Dubai , featuring an 85-metre-high indoor mountain with 5 slopes of varying steepness and difficulty, including a 400-metre-long run

A bit of dissapointment. The cloths you get are realy thin. You better take some addiotional sweter or pants, otherwise you will be very cold like me. The lift was old and very slow. Snow was OK but the smell was the worst. It wasn' very expensive so I don't regret to go there. If you want to see and do in Dubaj everything was in "wird" you should go but it is far from mountain in Austria.

Arrive early to avoid the crowds. Fun in the cold! A good break away from the norm. You can rent out the gear from them, give yourself plenty of time to register, collect the gear, but the gear on and get to the slope. Arrive super early to avoid the crazy weekend crowds/queues and rush.

Feeling of Switzerland in Dubai. Few years back we visited Dubai. We were at Emirates Mall and some one suggested us to visit Ski Dubai. It was really good experience. They have maintained such a low temperature inside that you need to wear their suit. It was worth going there. Also in ride you get the same feeling which you feel at Switzerland.

DUBAI! HOT AS HADES! PLUS SKIING!!!!!. My son told me it would be ab experience of a lifetime...and it was!!!!what can I say...its Dubai. exciting, refreshing, and awesome. Had me looking for a ski lodge and a snifter of cognac by the fireplace...til I went back outside. Found the cognac at the hotel---perfect.

Ski Dubia. It was impressive to see such a big indoor ski facility, especially in the middle of the desert. They have many different ski package options with varying times, as well as lessons for inexperienced skiers. They do have winter gear that come with your ticket, however, if you're not wearing the proper clothing underneath gear - it is QUITE cold! My husband and I rode the ski lift (to get a better view of the whole facility) and did the sledding and other non-ski activities they have. Our schedule did not allow for ski instructions but we still wanted to see inside. I'm not sure a specific trip would here would be needed but if you are in the Mall of Emirates, definitely something to check out. If you're a family with kids, this seemed to be very popular and the children looked like they were having a blast!

Very expensive for what you get . We had a good time but felt without the skiing, there was very little to do for the price paid. Most families we saw were there for less than an hour. We would next time only go with a skiing offer but then it would need to be on offer and not at the full rate charged.
SKI DUBAI. Feeling climbed to the real mountain so cold summer is the best time to visit Sky Dubai with friend and family and is it inside the Mall.
Ok. It was too cold for my liking and for those of us not used to snow- I think the preparation for what to expect should be better. It's ok for kids but not much fun for adults.
Ice world in the desert.. Ski Dubai is snow world in the mall of emirates.. This will gives same feel in the top alps.. You can do winter activities there.
very nice place in emirates mall must visit place. ticket is expensive, many rides are there full enjoy, temp is minus 2 or more they will provide suit to go inside ,very nice place neat & lclean

Experience Ski in all seasons. Ski Dubai is a lovely experience for all ages. There are other activities such cable car, zip line etc to do if you can't Ski. We only spent an hour as we were there for business purposes. Would recommend it to my clients any time and will definitely return and stay longer. Ski clothes and gear are offered, you don't have to bring your own.

Cool every time!. My children absolutely love skiing at ski Dubai. Need to get through the initial ski suit hire and ski boot hire (always busy), but then you're ready to have some fun. The times they have been the snow has mostly been good, even quite powdery. But there have been days when it was somewhat icy.

Expensive but ultimate experience. Ski Dubai is located in the Mall of Emirates, which are little far from central Dubai. But me and my son, enjoyed thoroughly, very organized and staffs are co-operative, enjoyable rides but only thing is that i feel their tickets have to be cheaper and may be they need to introduce Family Pack. Inside, you can enjoy hot chocolate..very nice

Nice thrill. The ski dubai is a very good experience. Worth a visit.... In the Emirates mall. The kids will also love it. Take the day pass which saves you money. I recommend this if you are on a longer trip to Dubai.

An exciting game for all. One of the attractions in Dubai is the Ski Dubai at Emirates Mall,
It is great to the middle of warmth there is a place with cold -4
Except skiing and ski training have exciting overall games for everyone.
Ski Dubai is very attractive for all ages and I suggest go

SOooooooo COLD!. Our family enjoyed SKI DUBAI. It was freezing but you get a suits and boots with socks with your ticket. It was a bit confusing on what to do once you have paid...follow the crowds to the change areas but remember to pick up your free gloves at the store on the left of the rental area (near photo kiosk). Then proceed into the change area and queue on the left for clothing and shoes and then head to the right for the lockers. Now they do say no cameras but many people took in their phones. We didn't because we thought we weren't able to. Were disappointed not to get a good shot. The photographers took a few nice pics but were way to expensive to purchase :(

Only for kids. It had an average layer of snow, and was on a small areawithin the Mal of Emirates. Not a place for grown ups, unless they go in to supervise their children's, for which it would be an expensive proposition

Not for seasoned skiers!. OK, so there's a certain novelty factor in skiing in Dubai, but this was quite a small centre; felt very like being in any UK indoor ski slope; and was entertaining for about 30 minutes. Not worth doing if you're used to real skiing!

Amazing!!!!!!. This is definitely a must in Dubai. 1000 dirham for myself and my husband for the acess all areas package. There are cheaper packages also. Great fun but wrap but I can't stress enough how cold it is so wrap up.

Huge Fun. While here it was one of the things that I wanted to do and it did not disappoint. The slope is not huge or particularly challenging but what a experience skiing indoors in the middle of a mall. It is crowded on a Saturday and it is cold (Duh) but well worth the $75 for the two hours. A must do for world traveler adventure seekers.

Good place but the prices are overrated. It's awesome to see snow in the middle of the sand but still they should lower the prices 300 for a full day pass for a small slope not worth it which in outside countries they have real snow and full day pass is like 150 Darham and the snow mostly iced in skidubai it's half snow and half ice they should take look at that but I recommend to visit to see how Dubai is a great city and can do whatever they want

Ski in the closed man made slope in the shopping mall. Ski in the closed man made slope in the shopping mall. It is not near any skiing experience for an advanced skier in regular mountains, but still lots of fun for a afternoon when you are tired of the heat and sun

Not much of a space. Well,i give 2/5 because of its rareness... nice thought of bringing snow in Dubai,but since it's here,shouldn't be in a larger space? ... For kids and families,I guess is fun,but other than that..nothing special. The penguins encounter is a bit pricy (175 AED just to see them, 500 AED if you want to play with them).

Amazing to see snow in the desert. The most amazing thing is, one minute you are in the middle of the desert, the next you are freezing in the snow. You hire boots and jacket, we bought the gloves. I still felt cold and wished I had bought thicker pants with me. Good way to see the snow for the first time.

Worth a Visit. Whether you are a new skier/snowboarder or an experienced one, Ski Dubai is worth a visit. My husband started skiing at 4 and switched to a snowboard at 14. That's about 30 years of experience. If you're an experienced skier/snowboarder don't go there expecting Aspen or the Alps. It's the novelty of boarding indoors in the middle of a desert. The rental gear is pretty bad, but it's a couple of hours, you can deal. There are a lot of beginners, but it isn't too hard to avoid them if you know what you're doing. We bought the pass for 2 hours, but stopped after an hour. I think it's advertised as 5 runs, but it's really 1 run. It took me about 25 seconds to go from the top of the "expert" run to the end.If you're in Dubai, it's definitely worth visiting. Just keep in mind it's not Tahoe in California nor the Alps.

Ski Dubai, Penguin Encouner 2016.. This was a huge Mall, with many escallators, Had three floors, The 3rd. top floor had a good view of the Mall, The place was airconditioned, nice and cool and the Ski Dubia snow park was on the ground floor at the end of the Mall with a st. Moritz cafe near by. The Saturday afternoon we where there we stopped and had a cold diet coke, it had a screen like a tv that had a hologram of a log fire, very realistic. We booked the penguin encounter for the next day in the afternoon. It was very interesting. Wore gloves and trousers and jackets over our own clothes, saw 2 type of penguins, large King and smaller Gentoo penguin, felmale called Pebbles which we could touch and embrace and kiss, we had photos taken of the event which I bought and bought a large snow globe with 2 small photos and a small toy penguin that moves. A good afternoon. Later we saw through the glass some king penguins and trainers . Also the crowd that had stayed to watch close up still wearing the warm clothes and skiing helmets.

Great and unique facility in the dessert…!. Located in the Mall of the Emirates, this great engineering work provide visitors with a year around opportunity to enjoy ski related sports activities. A must place to visit while in Dubai.
Crazy. Money can turn many things about 180 deg., slope in desert is one from this list:-) really interesting experience,outside more than +40 deg C,inside -2

Freezing Dubai. If you like skiing or just want to learn, ski Dubai is a must. In the mall of the Emirates, the ski a really nice adventure for all the family. The staff is very polite and you can do many things there.

Thoroughly enjoyable few days of skiing and snow activities. Challenge activities, a beautiful penguin encounter, zip line fun, snowman building, as well as skiing lessons and skiing on the slope. An action packed few days at Ski Dubai has been thoroughly enjoyed.Hot chocolate, snacks and meals were all good too.Need to take your own gloves (waterproof and very warm) and hat, and extra thick socks are recommended, but the rest of the equipment is provided. Supervision and support is excellent.Not a cheap activity, but then neither is producing the world's largest indoor ski facility in a desert city!Well worth doing...

Wonderful ski in Emirates Mall. I'm kinda torn. On the one hand, it’s pretty darn cool that you can ski in the mall. For those of us living in the UAE, it’s either this or no skiing at all. On the other hand, the amount of electricity this place consumes must be astronomical. They’ve created a freezer the size of a tall building. And they’ve done it in the crazy-hot Arabian desert. Gotta wonder how that is good for the planet. Maybe not great, but if it keeps some people from flying to the Alps it may not be as bad as it first seems.Anyway, we're not regulars, but we’ve been here twice, both times because of the kids. My daughter wanted to go to Ski Dubai for her birthday, so we booked her and a friend some ski lessons. Ski Dubai is great for teaching kids to ski. It’s our only viable option to prepare the little ones for eventual outdoor skiing. The instructors are very professional and are good with children.However, if you already know how to ski, Ski Dubai will be way too small for you to take seriously. If you don’t spend all of your time falling down, it takes just one minute to ski down the slope. So it really is just for kids and beginners.There is also a kid’s play area which doesn’t involve skiing. My 5 year old son didn’t want to ski but he absolutely loved the other activities. Kids growing up here don’t get to see snow so it is nice for them to have that experience. Sometimes we adults forget how much kids love to play in the snow.The crowd, the lines (or should I say lack thereof since many people don’t bother to queue), and the general confusion of getting all the gear together is a bit of a headache. But all in all, it’s a unique experience, and of course it’s one that can only be found in Dubai.

Perfect Climate Every Day!. My husband, my parents, and I went to Dubai in April 2016. My husband loves to ski, and rarely gets the opportunity, as we live in Florida. Long before we booked our trip to Dubai, he learned about Ski Dubai, which is where the obsession began. "What do you want to do in Dubai?" I would ask while we were planning our trip. "Ski," was about the only answer I ever got. So expectations were high when we got to the Mall of the Emirates. Yes, Ski Dubai is in a mall. This is great for parties that maybe aren't all interested in going to a winter wonderland, because there is plenty for them to do nearby at a warmer temperature, even if it's just watch at the three-story windows into Ski Dubai. Our expectations were well rewarded! There are several experiences available at Ski Dubai, including skiing, snowboarding, tubing, tobogganing, a penguin interaction, and zip-lining. There are different tickets for different experiences, packages, and lengths of time. Whatever you choose, cold-weather wear is included (socks, shoes, and snow suit), though hats and gloves are not. Come prepared or purchase (both can be gotten for a decent price and make a nice souvenir), as Ski Dubai is kept at the ideal -2 degrees Celsius. You can rent a locker for a reasonable price and take things out and put them into it as many times as you need. Being less coordinated, my parents and I opted for the zip-line experience. This allowed us two runs down the Snow Bullet zip-line in the middle of the frozen environment. We took the ski lift up to the middle level where the very nice attendants outfitted us with harness and safety gear. The zip-line is side-by-side, so you can go in pairs and race, if you so choose. The zip-line feels very safe and is a great rush! When we were done with our two runs, they didn't kick us out of the snowy area, and we would have been allowed to stay in the snow for (I believe) as long as we wanted. Seeing as how it was -2, we didn't hang around for too terribly long, allowing my husband to finally get to skiing. His report of skiing was that conditions were great. We had gone to Alaska the month before, where conditions were slushy one day and icy the next, so the steady, well groomed slope was a pleasant change. He said that there was little traffic from other skiers, so he had a nice clear path down from the top most of the 2 hours he skied. There is a chair lift (which my parents and I enjoyed), but the speed is pretty leisurely, so if you are looking to maximize your time, the T-bar is the way to go. It's a little awkward at first, as my husband reports that you have to tug on the bar to get it going, but you are standing on grating that doesn't allow much movement on skis while you do this. So be prepared to hustle a little the first time you go up the T-bar. Bottom line: go play in the snow in the desert! Whichever experience you chose, it will be a wonderful, memorable experience. Awesome being able to ski in such a hot country. This is a massive indoor ski centre situated within Mall of the Emirates, Dubai. Take the family or go alone...fabulous.... Firstly, we are a mature couple, skiing for 20+ years so a few tips! Went went 9 am on a Monday & there was no one there, so fitted up with clothes & equipment & done all in 20 mins. No it's not Aspen, Whistler or Breck but it is very good fun & yes it is real snow!!Worth it to go BUT you must have the right gear to enjoy a half day + (we stayed the day) so suit provided is too thin for the job, shapeless & with no pockets.You can buy gloves & beanies but they are expensive & poor quality - take your own!Skis & boots provided, well used & no edges but not really needed anyway.Leave on your jeans/pants, need woolen thermal underwear & woolen socks perhaps a skivvy or roll neck wool jumper all UNDER their suit, ski/woolen beanie, ski/woolen waterproof gloves & a thick woolen scarf put your other street clothes in the locker (you pay but pass in the token at the desk for refund...these lockers are quite small with no room for shopping ~ take two if need be as I said they are refundable) you will certainly not have a good time if you clothing is not adequate.The chairlift is quite slow so to get to the top quickly use the pomma located at the left of the chair lift.Avalanche Cafe located half way down the easy slope was warm, cosy & cheap for snacks & coffee & a rest + toilet break.We watched the penguins from the lift for free...never tried tubes, sleds or ball but watched those who did & they certainly loved it.We actually skied all day with very few skiers on the ' slopes ' most people just rode up & down several times on the chair lift which looked pretty boring to us & they do offer to teach you to ski if you want? Don't book for too long if you don't want to ski as it is very cold without activity.Would we go again or recommend it .... YES & YES!

Winter in the desert. For someone who hails from a tropical country and living in the middle east, having to experience a snow laden park is quite an experience. We had an entertainer super pass voucher so I only paid for one person for my daughter and I. We also paid 40 dhs for a locker which is refundable once you are done using it and you return the key card to the counter. After reading some of the reviews mentioning that it can get really cold and the sock provided are quite flimsy. We decided to bring some extras. The park provides the shoes, socks, gloves and winter suit. If you are not used to cold climates like us, bring extra scarf, bonnets, ear muffs. It is -4 degrees inside. Suits do not have any pockets so make sure that you wear jeans or trousers with pockets where you can keep your key, mobile phone and other small valuables. The suit does not really give that much heat so wear something warm underneath the suit. We just came from Atlantis Resort the day we went to Ski Dubai hence we have 2 knapsacks and other carry ons. The lockers provided does not really fit much but if you take the corner ones. they provide much bigger storage space compared to the regularly situated lockers. Lockers no. 101 and 104 If I can remember are corner lockers. I would have to thank the lady guard in Ski Dubai for that great tip. We were able to get a peek at a penguin who was about to go a meet and greet so lucky us. If you don't want to pay extra to see them, be watchful as they may pass you by. The park I think also let them parade in the snow park at several different hours in a day so take note of their schedule. We tried the bobsled where you lie on a flat sled and slide on ice. You need to cross your arms on your chest or else you may risk of breaking them on accidentally with the ice walls. It is also very fast and takes sharp turns, be careful with your head and make sure your camera is secured before doing. Otherwise, you may also break them in the process. Next, my daughter did the tubing where she got tossed on a slope while sitting on a rubber tube; it was really fast and the attendant made the tube go on circles; really fun but can get dizzy upon getting up. You will aslo have to get your on rubber tube from down the slope and bring it up. We didn't try the zorb ball unfortunately especially my daughter who just came from the tubing. We rode the chairlift which gave us an aerial view of the whole park. It was really nice to see pro skiers. The chair sits 4 but there is height requirement for children.While it was an exciting ride, I was scared as hell the whole time, me being afraid of heights and wished that I have not joined my daughter. Her giggling while on air also did not help much as the chair was also moving. Make sure to give that big smile when you approach the gentleman taking photos. We did a stopover at the Avalanche Cafe up the slopes. View was great. It was like having your hot chocolate up in the mountains. Sadly, the food is just ok. Not much to rave about. After that it was back to the chair lift to go back to the main park. An hour or so in the park would be sufficient unless you are there for the ski lessons or you are already a pro skier. I couldn't imagine staying for more than 3 hours in the park. Lastly, dont forget to take your photos from the booth. They cost 150 for 2 and soft copies can be immediately posted in your social media account or sent to your email. TIP: Check Entertainer for a voucher before you visit.No reservation required unless you are coming with a big groupCome early morning or do it on a weekday, otherwise expect a crow especially during weekends. Bring scarf, bonnet and ear muffs. Wear something warm underneath
