penguins are the most exciting things to see in here. get to emirates mall have a look at kempinsky hotel , get a ticket to enter the ski dubai , and there you go , fun fun fun fun , slide, jump , play with the snow, meet the penguins , and live as you are in the north pole , coffee shops and resturants available in there too , take your kids and play with them snowboarding or skii with them , there are lessos to be thought too .

Good day out for the family. You can have a great day out skiing in the desert at ski Dubai. You can rent every piece of gear you need, but the skis and boots do their age, and wear and tear. You can rent skis or snow boards. It is actually a great place for absolute beginners because the lower slope is very gentle. The upper slope is blue/easy red standard. The snow is ok in the morning, but gets wet and slushy later in the day.As a skier it was a fun day out.
Wow Experience..... It is an awesome to enjoy, worth the money you will pay.PLace to enjoy for every age group.Well maintained.
Good. Good place for kids in Emirates mall.kids love the snow experience.....mall is of branded stores not for average buyer.......

A day spent well. It was certainly a day spent well. We got ourselves the whole day pass and did the penguin tour too which was good fun. Though the penguin show seems targetted on kids its good fun for olders too. Kids will surley love this place!

Great experience. This is known to be one of the first of its kind in the world...now there are other identical ones in other cities...its a great experience...especially for people from places where snow clad mountains are not the norm...worth a visit...

Amazing Place In Desert. It was an amazing experience. Place full of snow and chilling temperature in middle of desert city is simple unbelievable. Its a tremendous effort by authorities to successfully manage this place so well.
Big Kids. My wife and I tried the bob sleigh and the zorba ball and enjoyed the "danger" Quite expensive but for the experience, especially in the UAE it was worth it.

Wow. It is amazing to see such place at desert area. It should be known as wonder of the worlds also to find -6 centigrade temperature inside the Ski Dubai and world class experience to see the Penguins here.One of the best place to take your kids for the day enjoyment .

Would definitely go again and for longer next time. Where else can you ski in the desert? What a wonderful experience. Especially if you live in a country where there is no snow. Just a heads up. Take a hoody and thick socks as it is extremely cold (minus 4 degrees celsius)

best indoor skiing in the world. had to be mad and doing skiing in the desert....chose to go on a Friday so we were expecting it to be packed!....so they give you the gear...trousers and coat...but you need gloves (they'll sell you some)....and wear a few clothes underneath...clearly its going to be less than zero degrees!....skis were ok...boots were badly worn....fully tightened they were still too loose!....inside the place is so huge it didn't seem busy at all...little or no lift queues....and a nice variety of slopes...sure its not huge because its indoors (but the biggest i ever skied on)....but we had a blast for a couple of hours

Need to CHILL . If you live in Dubai and need to cool down and chill, Ski Dubai is a perfect option to connect with a different environment. Get all dressed up and cozy and hit the indoor slopes. They have everything you need except gloves and warm hats although helmets are also available. The system in place makes it for a good flow from the check-in, to rentals, locker, ski slopes...all very good. If anyone wishes to take some lessons, if booked in advanced it's still possible. I have to say that if you are a beginner it's the best, not too steep and just relaxing to ski down. If you are more advanced, you will get bored as you could probably be hitting the bottom of the slope in a minute or so. Nevertheless a great activity to do and feel the cold in your blood...pretty refreshing and invigorating.

Cool place. As I had never skied before I was looking forward to experiencing this wonder in the desert. My friend was visiting so we decided to give it a go. All the staff are mostly helpful and friendly and the instructor was good. As we had not skied before we needed to take part in Ski school (although I have heard you can say you have skied before and skip this) which was useful I guess but this was all the skiing we done which was only on a really really small slope about 45 metres long.I was expecting to at least get onto the medium slope but this never happened. Enjoyed our day all the same and got some great pictures.
designed for children & extremely expensive. It's very small and roughly $80/adult. This is not an activity for adults. It's located inside of the mall next to the Cheesecake Factory.

had a great time. had fun at Ski Dubai,The check-in process and getting ready took quite awhile, from initial check-in, to getting boots and jackets, to going to a kiosk to sign paperwork and get a printout with your specs for the proper skis or snowboards before picking them up. Jacket, snow pants, and socks are provided, and lockers are available for a modest fee and deposit. I missed the gloves, so not sure whether they were provided or available for purchase, and didn't realize this until I was out on the slopes, but it wasn't that cold so not a big deal.Real snow in the Middle East. Something you have to do!!!!

A must stop just for the stories to tell!. At the current exchange, skiing for one person cost $58.00 US, plus another $37.00 for gloves, for a two hour time. If you are there to ski, 2 hours is all you will need as there is a beginner hill, an "intermediate" hill and a "black diamond" hill. For real skiers, the intermediate and the black diamond are really stretching those definitions. It is a novelty and after 2 hours, you probably will have done enough skiing. All clothing and equipment is included in the the $58.00, which is a pretty good deal. We also found it very organized and automated, but it was a low season and in the morning, so it was not crowded. Do not wear summer clothing! Bring at least some long sleeved top for warmth and lose pants to wear under the outerwear that is provided to you. The interior is kept at 22 degrees, which is chilly after 2 hours. The gloves are really necessary. Hats are optional.For kids, there is a small luge, sledding, bouncey balls in plastic and a zipline, along with the penguin meeting. However, at 22 degrees, most kids will probably be ready to go after a couple of hours.

Badly organised and a waste of money!!. I was deeply disappointed by my trip to ski Dubai. It was badly organised! Firstly if you are going ensure you take your own gloves and fleece it freezing and they charge you to buy these items. It's manic!! When you enter be aware there are several things you need to do before you can start your adventure... Get your ski clothes shoes, helmet, weigh your self, then get your ski fitted. We had a lesson booked but we're not given any direction of what to do. No step by step guide and to be honest the staff aren't very useful. We finally had our lesson with an instructor called "smiley" whom was not very smiley at all!!! Bearing in mind we paid to learn how to ski after several attempts of the smaller slopes and me falling over I was asked to ski lower down the slopes bymyself!!! Being neglected for the last 30 mins of the lessons!!! I paid the same price at the 4 other attendees but was not given the same attention. Also bear in mind half of the lesson was taken up by us waiting for other non lesson children flying down the slopes even though they weren't meant to be In our area. The staff struggle with discipline and allow locals to do as they wish. It's a mess! I would not recommend it or ever go again!!
Chilly . I start feeling cold even while recalling my experience. It has decent set of rides. It is more about experience. You may also do a preliminary ski course.

Indoor snow experience in Dubai. One of the coldest and snowing place you can find in the desert. I have visited with my brother and sister. We have taken the Super pass Where we can enter all the rides and but there is different charges for skiing. Jackets and shoes are given without any extra charges. We got a free hot chocolate voucher when we purchased the ticket. Over all a good experience

A must winter experience of solid H2o in Desert. Its really freezing cold. A wonderful experience playing with the snow. Also multiple activities can be done together with skiing. And then you feel the actual bless of an hot chocklate drink.

A simulation only. A ski slope in a hall, that's it. People are covered by warm clothes looking like penguins :-) You can watch the scenery from outside while you are in the Mall of the Emirates, have a look. For sure not comparable to the swiss mountains, but if you where never there, it's an experience.

Fun if you live in the tropics. It was a good outing but the fun rides were overcrowded and there were not enough rest areas for people with young children who got tired and wanted a bit of a sit down within the ski area.

great experience. cool to walk in in shorts and flip flops from 40 degrees to the snow! Bring your own hat and gloves and you get everything else included in the ticket. Paid 200 AED for 2 hrs - enough especially when there was hardly people on the slope :) Skiing gear is very light so you might be a liitle bit cold. My first indoor skiing experience.

Oh my God !!! A place to be !!!. Never expected that my experience could be so great !The ski training for kids, snow bullet, chairs, Bob Sled all were too good.Its a feast for eyes to see all around while being clad in snow suits.
Cool place. A coolest place of Dubai inside the mall maintains below 0 degree temperature inspite of outside temperature above 40 degrees

Excellent place to go and experience snow, especially in a country where naturally Snow is difficult to get.. I visited this place with a another family and his kid. It is an must do visit place for families and people who have not experienced snow in their place or do not have the possibility to travel to the Swiss Alps, etc. I would say it is a wonder in its own self. It is a part of Mall of Emirates property which has its own metro connection has ample parking space and ample eating joints next to the Ski area as well as in the mall food court area. The Ski accepts Card payments as well as local currency and few forex currencies too like USD / GBP / Euro / Rial Omani / etc. You can rent the usable gear and shoes, gloves, etc as well as use your own too. It is an attraction for all age groups based on their basic safety guidelines. Use of warm clothes is a must as the temperature inside is too low. It has a small kids area as well as a training area and then finally the big Ski slide.
SkiFly pass. We bought SkiFly (SkiDubai + iFly) passes online as it was cheaper. Using the SkiFly pass we could access the snow park but would need to pay extra for skiing which we opted out of.

COLDDDDDDDD but fun. I don't do too well with cold but my fingers were too numb to get my phone outta my pocket and take pictures.I would probably need thicker gloves to ensure i maximise my time there.

Nice place for kids. During our recent visit to Mall of Emirates with our son and his family including young children we saw this place and it is quite amazing to see such area very dear to young children.

Terrible idea to begin with . I was disappointed. The place is small and has the feel of a 3rd class shopping mall. Nothing of the grandeur of a Dubai Fountain etc.I m an avid skier but thinking of the energy waste for this 3rd class attraction makes me sick. Better go on a 2 hr flight to Tehran and ski at 3900 m at Tochal resort.

Great way to spend a couple of houts. Had 2 hours here while we visited Dubai. For us 2 hours was enough it was quiet so we're straight on the lift so after you'd been up and skied down a good few times stopped for a drink it was enough time. Slopes are pretty easy one nursery slope and 2 main slopes, one is easier than the other but if you've been skiing before you can use both sides. The kit you get is enough for the 2 hours, don't waste money on expensive gloves etc. Well worth a visit.

Ski dubai
Sniw in dubai. Good to see snow park in dubai in ski dubai in mall of Emirates ..penguins live show was the main attraction. ...good experience. Indeed.....
LIFETIME EXPERIENCE. Ski Dubai is best snow park in Asia. once enter in this you will definitely forget that You are in desert. Nice place for Kids and Youngsters

Snow in the desert :). I experienced ski Dubai when i came for a holiday to Dubai Last year in Oct with bunch of friends and definitely Ski Dubai was our first hand experience to snow. I highly recommend it for kids as most rides are meant for them than adults.

Fun!. When I first heard of Ski Dubai I thought what a waste. When I saw the faces of the children seeing snow for the first (and possibly only) time in their life, I immediately changed my mind and though what an wonderful place.

Next Best Thing. If you can't get away to real slopes, this is a fine replacement - or even to get your ski legs back before heading back to the mountains. It won't be beautiful, untouched powder snow, but it is essentially "real" snow beneath your skis/board - much like a ski resorts snow machines keep runs open in the warm weather. It'll take you seven minutes to get to the top on the chairlift, and if you pin your ears back while keeping control, about 45 seconds to get back to the bottom. Such is the nature of the place, variety of runs don't change, though in a couple of years, there will be competition in the form of a new two-run slope at Meydan One.It's much cheaper that a ski holiday, but not quite got the same charm. It is the next best thing, tough.

snow in the desert. we never went to the snows before as a married couples, even though i am coming from Lebanon and didn't had the chance to visit since our marriage, the experience was full of adventure we had a lot of fun, it was cold and we tried all the available games in the ski area, the most beautiful moments was watching the penguins while drinking hot chocolate in the snow around you..

From flip flops to full ski gear. After the day on the beach it is surreal, but in Dubai it's possible, skiing in one of malls! Recommended if you are even beginner, as the slope is OK for kids and beginners as well. With a challet on the slope, it really tries to give you impression of ski slopes in Alps...
Alpin Ski in the desert. not a long run, but it is simply very unique - don't ask yourself about the logic to ski on snow in the desert - just special

Ski Dubai was a fun place for us and kids as well ... We wanted to spend some more time inside but was freezing inside v. It was a fun place for us kids as well .. We wanted stay for long inside but as it was freezing inside kids started feeling cold so we had to come out ..the out fit provided by the ski Dubai was not warm enough .. It's better to carry your own stuff especially Jacket and caps ...
UAE trip . Only place to ski in UAE. To escape the hot you go to Ski Dubai. A very beautiful winter Wonderland. It is in one of the malls

Great Way To Escape The Heat. This is a great way for adults or families to escape the heat for a day. There are many activities with something for everyone. Can't imagine anyone not falling in love with the penguin encounter. The slides can be great fun. Plan to spend several hours if not the day here to experience everything.

Some loved it, others just liked it. It was a bit wierd at first to skin indoors. The experience is certainly worth trying. My youngest loved it but the eldest thought it was just okay and wouldn't go skiing there again prefering outdoors over indoors. Expensive. Man created snow...... But very very expensive........ mostly like one in Bangalore Hydrabad ect.... Yes if ready to spend so high am sure kids would have feeling like in heaven

an amazing and beautiful in-door skiing park. Ski Dubai is one of the few better things in the Mall of the Emirates. The whole skiing park is beautiful like a picture. There are many activities inside. The park even has adorable penguins. I don't ski, but if I did, I would have gone inside and played. It must have been a once in a life time experience to ski in such an in-door skiing park in a desert country.

lovely experience. Tried the simple polar....best thing is the hot chocolate.. amazing ❤❤❤❤teleferic is amazing.. im bit scared of heights... so going back down wasn't much of enjoying as going up..next time.. should plan seeing the penguins ♡♡♡♡
Dubai Tour. One of the place in Dubai which can not be missed as a sight seeing. Even an infant enjoys in Ski Dubai.
A must on your Itinerary.. One will simple love this place. And if time permits, should try all the activities. Its fun engaging in all the activities.

Even Better than I Ever Imagined. Since Ski Dubai was built, I have wanted to come, so naturally, I had built up an idea of this place. Luckily, they exceeded my expectations! Everyone who worked there made the experience great. Purchasing tickets was easy (we did the 2 hour ski pass). Then we proceeded to get our gear. Once we changed, we got fitted for our boots, bindings and skis. They had a cool area where you fill out some information and step on a platform, so everything is fitted right to you. The weirdest experience is taking an escalator up to the skit hill, in your boots! Before you go in, you grab your poles. They have an RFID scanner that scans a card and tells you how many minutes you have left on the slope.There are basically three ski hills that you can choose from and one real chair lift. As a skier, you can take the chair lift about 2/3 of the way up and ski down. That's the beginner(ish) hill. You can keep going to the top and have two options: one is the black diamond and one is a little easier. There are a few obstacle parks in there too. We never had to wait for more than one group to get on the chair lift and if you don't want to wait, there are drag lifts that take you right to the top even faster.They also have some winter games, a zip line and penguins.This is a MUST DO in Dubai. I would definitely do it again if I came back.

Nice getaway if you haven't seen a ski resort at all. They have spent a lot to get to this. So, its worth going there once.We did have a nice time here. We also did the penguin encounter that my kids really fell in love with. They have unlimited games for the premium pass. Ski is not that great. Chaircar, zorbe, slide.. etc are good
Worth spending the money. Worth spending the money....An Iceland middle of desert...A little bit pricey but worth spending it..

Amazing Place!!. Really fantastic creating this is a desert.. and that too inside a mall..
till you go inside you wont believe they have all this snow and skii created!

Outstanding experience. How can you not love skiing in Dubai!
It was the first time for me to ski in here so it was an amazing experience. I do have an excellent instructor who made the experience an outstanding one.

Love this place- a regular. I love to ski there. I've never been on a real ski slope but this is awesome fun. Super cold. Pros- good instructors, well paced based on level, good room for progress to next levels if continue to practice Cons- no pocket for phone so had to put it on my pants inside my ski pants It's a little expensive when you pay for ticket and a locker if you are getting a lesson. I would prefer if lessons were longer than the total one hour.

Its just amazing the way it is made and maintained!!. I must say if you are going with your family, this is the place for kids, your kids will not just enjoy but learn things that they have not seen or will not see for a while, there is a penguin show which is also an interactive show where the guide tells you everything you want to know about penguines. Amazing, Fantastic awesome.

Good experience!. How odd to come inside from such heat to this... Yet again Dubai know how to do things. This was a good experience, the slope was the best indoor one I've been on. Stay clear of the chair lift if you don't want to spend all your time sat on them, the button lifts are much quicker. Only downside was how long it actually took to get on the slope, other than that where else can you see snow in Dubai!

Visitors from the Alps. We live in the alps and ski every winter weekend so just had to try this. The slope does the job although if course is short and hence feels expensive compared to a days real skiing. If you are local it seems great to learn before a holiday but inside skiing really takes away so much of the point. However worth it for the one off experience.
Midnight ride. Very cool. I was in Dubai for a shopping festival, so the mall didnt close until 3am or so. Went in about 11pm and rode fairly uninhibited for a few hours.

Great experience! . We are experienced skiers and ski Dubai was fantastic! I would say maybe a little pricey, but on par for Dubai. Take gloves though if you know you are going to visit in advance, they do not supply gloves and seeing as it's real snow, your hands obviously get cold! Great 2 hours though, not sure you'd want to spend all day there though! 2 hours is more than enough!

I brilliant for all the family. This is an amazing attraction, it makes the indoor ski places in the uk look so inferior. There are loads of different activities and even real penguins come out . You can view this from the mall side without going into the slopes

Worth a Look. Although we did not use the facility, it is worth a visit to the Mall of the Emirate to view from the mall itself. Visit the Mall and take a walk to the glass enclosed Ski slope to view the lift, the snow, and the skiers. I cannot comment on the facility itself, but it is worth a look.

Not worth that money. If I lived in a country that never sees snow, then maybe it would be an unbelievable experience for me. We really wanted to try this attraction, payed cca 50 $ and we got warm clothes and entrance to the place. No skiingm just watching. We stayed there cca one hour and wanted to go away. It is good attraction for those who live there and miss snow and cold but nothing for me. I
Wowzer. Fantastic and to have Penguins in the dessert is weird and so magical you need to have on a suit which you can hire as it is -4

Burning Calories before Cheese Fondue. Fun Thing to do if you're not a spoiled child comparing the 1 slope available to the Alps :DI've done it with friends and we had a lot of fun for a couple of hours.

The heaven on the earth. Ski dubai... the place you cant miss if you are visiting to dubai. Superb rides, the awsome penguin show. You can catch your picture with penguin. You can feel like you are at some hillstation playing with snow.
100% real ski experience !!. If you miss Ski anytime during summer, Just go there ! You will live it again.Need to train before.

Penguin experience . Wow what can I say excellent experience meeting a penguin. My son loved it and it was very informative and interesting. After the experience you get the opportunity to go sledging and tobogganing. Lots of photographs were taken by the experience as no camera's allowed. Photographs were expensive. You do get full ski equipment however it is very cold inside need to keep moving about.

Great fun to do... in a desert!. What do you do when you have a few days Dubai?Go skiing, of course... in the middle of a desert! In the burning sun (well, 80-ish degrees F), why not go for a little ski session! Situated in the Mall of the Emirates is Ski Dubai, a very impressive indoor ski slope. Definitely something new and not what you would expect to see in an environment like this. The prices are a little high (they charge you extra for gloves!), and the skiing isn't challenging at all (and it was also really cold at -4 degrees), but it was fun to just ski and for the experience of skiing in a desert country. Some of the setup was a bit cheesy (like the incomplete/somewhat ruddy-appearing chalet at "mid mountain", but it was fine. Don't let the "Experts Only" signs fool you - these are basically green runs. Funnily enough, there's a Cheesecake Factory near the base (not that we went).It's worth paying a visit if you're visiting Dubai and like skiing!

Good place to learn to snowboard. I never thought I would like snowboarding in the desert, especially since the hill is so small compared to the mountains I grew up around. But the fact it was indoors and smaller made it so much more easier to learn to board than the times I had tried before. Plus how cool is it to say you snowboarded in the desert?
Cool spot. For me that I can barely stand on a snowboard, it's pretty cool. It could be cheaper but it's always a good escape from the Dubai heat

has got to be seen to be believed. In the shopping Mall, we had heard about this and just had to see it. Not disappointed. Try and get into one of the restaurants which have a head-on view of the slope, which gives the best view. Unbelievable for an indoor facility (never mind that it is in the middle of the desert!!)

One time experience. Worth the experience in Emirates Mall
I went with my sister
nice place for adult (under 30)
and will be amazing for family, kids and expert Skiers

Adventure on ice. It was a hot summer day and we decided to go to Ski Dubai. My son and I had geared up with extra stuff to keep us warm underneath the suits that they give you. He had a blast playing inside and we watched the penguin show of which we answered correctly and got to hug the penguin and kiss her. It was amazing and it took us around 2 hours inside of which it was too cold to stay. I definitely recommend it for families
Very entertainment place. Nice place in Dubai to visit and very entrainment place you will enjoy playing in the snow. There are many activities you can do.

Enjoyed every single minute of it. Coming from a tropical country this was my first experience with snow. and experiencing snow in a dessert country is not exactly what someone would expect. We spent a full 5 hours at Ski Dubai and it was a completely scintillating experience. The snow, the cold, and activities were all very enjoyable. Highly recommend to anyone who is looking to experience this.

Must see in Dubai. Snow in the middle od the dessert is what you will experince. Good slopes for begginers and experinced skiers. You have plenrty of games for kids. Its the only place in the world where you can play and kisss and even swimm with penguins. The experince was amazing. The packege they offer was amazing it was 2 hours on the slopes and all activities unlimited in the snow park also the zip line. Free gloves and all ski needed equipment price also includes lockers free hot chocolate penguins encpunter and a free lunch or dinner set. All for 500 AED which is a fair price in Dubai.

Skiing in the dessert. Well this is an experience for any skiing to say they skied in Dubai. something very different skiing indoors, was a first and problem my last.. Great to have the opportunity to ski in Dubai...

snow without hassle. The beauty of snow without the hassle of driving in it, freezing in it and having to shovel your walkway. For kids who had rarely experienced a real snow day, this was great. Kids and adults had a great time. All snow gear provided. Beautiful.

Best place for kids to start. To be blunt skiing indoors no mountains no nothing is a no go unless one likes the novelty value....... how wrong was I. Both of my kids learned to ski there and it is the perfect environment. in the mountains you have to get there, then from the hotel to the slope, then 30 mins later inevitably one of the kids is too cold, needs a bathroom doesn't want to ski or all of these together.... and what do you do? drive back to the hotel? fly back home or make your kids go on...... at the indoor skiing...... the kid wants to stop... 5mins later you are back in your shorts.... no pressure just fun.... and the results both kids love skiing..... now all I need is an incentive for the better half... suggestions ap[preciated
One of the most unbelievable thing. It was cold, very cold, but enjoyment you will not miss, children never get tired and if you do not visit this, you have missed something extraordinary.

Snow in the desert!. From desert to snow in moments. Only in Dubai. Imagine looking into a snow globe and seeing a winter wonderland... that is the view of Ski Dubai from the Mall of the Emirates, which houses the longest indoor ski slope in the world. The slope protrudes out and up from the mall, visible for miles away; this is how big the slope is. No better way to learn to ski or snowboard and enjoy a few runs before reaching the actual mountains at your final destination. As far as indoor ski slopes is concerned, this one is phenomenal.
Ski in the desert. Good for family with kids. All the gears are included in the price. The downside is there are only two slopes and very short slopes.

Good Fun. Although expensive Ski Dubai Snow Park is good fun for all the family. We usually take our own gloves and long socks in addition to those provided, it is very cold in there. The snow suits are very good but you really need to wear long sleeve tee shirt or sweater and long trousers underneath. Its quite strenous fun so be prepared.Toboggan run, whizzing down a slope in a doughnut or a zorbe. The chair lift is an impressive ride and you can stop off for hot chocolate at the cafe half way if you take money in with you. Good fun.

Skiing in the desert- fabulous. This is really amazing- actually a decent length slop with chair lift. Button lifts faster and no queues when we went for either so plenty of runs during a 2 hr time session. The suits are quite thin so we ended up layering all our T shirts (took our own socks and gloves). So good we went twice during the holiday!
Snow and Cold in the desert?. Go skiing, tobogganing, tubing, zip-lining, all indoors with a constant temperature. Don't forget to visit the ski lodge for some hot cocoa. Fun in the snow. So, ENJOY!

Most fun with some friends! . Don't expect too much as the slope is short but you can still have a great time. It's fun to do it so ensure you go with 3 or more friends. The lift is in a good condition. It's artificial snow but still easy to ride. There's a fun park too. It's a once in alive time thing so you can tick the list of skiing in the desert!

Once in a lifetime penguin experience.. Surprised my wife for her birthday by booking the exclusive penguin experience where we got a escorted by a trainer to their den.
