Pretty neat to snowboard while outside is 40 Celsius . They lend you a snowboard at a decent price. You can choose how long you wanna use the lift I think we chose 2 hours but it was actually more than enough. Afterall it's man-made and not really big so you get bored after a while...

Stunning and so creative!. Kids and adults would love this! It is a lot of fun. Gears are provided and one could also dine in there. The only downside is that even if you're not participating, an entry fee is required.
Ski in the Mall. This place is an indoor place for skiing. Also you can make snowboarding. You can hire both board and clothers for ski and snow boarding. Clean and good place.

So fun. Daughters and husband went while I was at a conference and had fun. Not like skiing in Japan or Us of course - but the novelty of being able to say you have skied in a mall was the attraction!

deep freezer. The ski dubai is indoor ice rink a large area in mall of emirates. They offer a wide range of snow sports inside the ice rink and best place for every one to enjoy a antartic climate in dubai. They offer a wide range of ticket option from 225dhs to 500dhs

Impressive Place with terrible customer service. To start off, I don't want to review this place badly, because I didn't have a good time there. I enjoyed myself, but I want to influence Ski Dubai to improve their service.I have worked in the ski industry all around the world, and therefore had to visit ski Dubai, if anything for the novelty of skiing in Dubai. The building is incredible, and the slope is fun, and the best indoor slope I have ever skied. Not too busy, with pretty good snow (for indoors) and a chair lift indoors which is pretty incredible.No qualms there.But as for the service, that myself and my girlfriend received from the staff and the set up of the off snow was very much below par! Especially for Dubai standards. Some areas for improvement :- Make sure the ski boots are done up when they are given out to the guests.- Staff need to be more welcoming and friendly in the areas where they interact with guests.- If staff are asked a question by the guest, they should try their upmost to help the guest.Poor service on the most basic levels, whenever we interacted with a staff member we were met with miserable unhelpful staff, that being said we could have been unlucky in who we came across, but a little customer service training would not be a miss. And some equipment maintenance and general respect for the product being offered would turn this 1 star review into a 5 star review.I would tell any keen skier to visit Ski Dubai, its a must see attraction, but it could be 10x better than it is with some staff training. The Reviewist
Find it fun... ...to see all that snow and that its so cold inside a mall.. really insane how they have done this one.. im amazed.. again lol

mind blowing. A complete ice world in dubai. great experience. the ambience was so chilling that my hands and feet felt so cold despite wearing gloves and clothes provided by them. great work to maintain such low temperatures in a country like dubai. must visit.had enjoyed all the snow activities

Amazing . I have taken my kids there many times and they love it the ski lessons the penguins the rides and the snow park .just arrive early to enjoy the whole day as you can spend a lot of time easy so get your money worth.its the alps almost

Ski Dubai . I enjoyed it very much. My Filipino instructor taught me how to control my movement. Discovery lesson is the very basic but is very important. It's scary and difficult at first but you will enjoy it once you learn how to slide on your own even if you are still slow. I will definitely come back again to continue my ski lessons.
Snow in desert. Ski dubai is a awesome place snow in desert its really awesome place activities inside was great specially skating its a must visit place
ski dubai. i spent three hours with my wife and daughters in ski dubai last february, it was so much fun especially the picture with penguin, one of hour best memories.

Feel Winter. So cold and nice.Getting the clothes is a little bit crowded but ski dubai is still awsome. Some rides have a large queue.but ski dubai is made to fell winter so you have to deal with all that to feel winter

Fantastic skiing but not the best organisation. We booked lessons here for my daughters and I, all beginners. The website wasn't the easiest the use, you need to create an account in order to be able to finalise the booking but there was no promt to tell you this. It didn't tell you how far in advance you'd need to arrive, unfortunately we ran late and only arrived 10 minutes before the lesson was due to start but had no idea that this was not enough time. You need to allow 30-40 minutes, but no indication of this was given when booking. It's also unclear where you go for skis, boots or where to meet your instructor. The lesson itself was good, the instructor excellent and we had a great time. Once over it isn't clear where you put your skis or clothing, also don't forget to take your ski pass out of your jacket and post it in the booth on your way out to get your 20AED refund on it.

Fun!. Love ski Dubai! The crew is super nice and friendly and will get you to ski or snowboard in no time. The ski park is average, book your self on a ski/snowboard lesson instead and enjoy the coolness!
unbelievable experience with kids. A good place to learn Ski for kids and adult with intermidiate level, kind of pricy but it includes clothes and equipments.
Fun fun fun. We enjoyed visiting here, lots of fun for my boys.Be prepared to wear some warming undergarments as it is -4 C degrees inside.

Pleasantly surprised. Okay, the Canadian Rockies this ain't, but then it's been a lot of years since I skied them as well. I was surprised by the entire operation, from the efficiency of the equipment pickups to the quality of the hills and lifts. And does it get any better than a constant -4 ski day . . . every day?

Yes it is the best!. For all the snow lovers out there a visit to the ski Dubai is a must! It is one of the major attractions in Dubai located in the magnificent Emirates mall. There are a lot of activities which can keep kids as well as adults purely entertained . This place ought to be on every traveller's list!

Beat place to go in dubai.....but the couple with infants cant go..... The must visit place in dubai but without infant as the temperature is -4 degree C so u cant take infant with u....and there is no place for sitting with infant inside...
snow in dubai?! :))))). It's really amazing to see skiing place in the mall plus in UAE. Nothing to add more it's just amazing place.

Great fun!. The ticket is on the expensive side but fortunately it is on the Entertainer this year.We took the superpass and enjoyed all the activities allowed.Be sure to reach there at its opening times so you avoid the crowds as the queues can be long, especially if there are school outings.And be prepared for extreme cold. If you have sensitive skin, use a moisturiser on your face before going in.
New Advanture in Dubai. My wife and I visited Ski Dubai for the first time and really enjoyed our time and the fun thing there is to meet the Baby Penguin.

Better not go on weekends and holidays. Went there on one of the Sundays. Place was too crowded. Just falling in line took us an hour. Inside was just so-so. For some reason I felt like I want to go out again. I guess it all depends on how you look at it. For people who never experience snow, this place might be an intereresting experience. But for those who had experience with real snow, better stay away from this one.

Something to see!. We went to the Mall of the Emirates (amazing, must see) and watched the skiers at Ski Dubai. It is unbelievable that anyone would think to put in an indoor ski slope but they did! You can rent clothing, get a ski pass and go skiing, tubing and even ride down the slope inside a huge plastic ball. This is probably more of a thing to do out of novelty or if you do not live in an area where you can ski as the slope is not as long as one would find naturally. But all looked like they were having a great time!

ski in the desert? Awesome!. We took a 4 hour night tour with Dubai Private Tours because our plane got in a 7pm and we had a 7 hour layover. You can get a free transit visa as you leave airport and takes no time at all. Just make sure you show your passport and proof of your ongoing flight. It took an our to get out of airport so start your tour an hour after plane lands. Lines are long exiting customs.The ski slopes close at 12 midnight Thurs-Saturday and 10pm the rest of the week. This mall is awesome and if you can spend the entire day here and still not see all the sections of this mall. Visit the aquarium too, I hear you can snorkel there! Dubai is very safe and Americans are welcomed. If you have a couple days here do the sand dunes tour...a definite must!

Great fun for little kids and big kids alike!. We (2 adults and 2 young kids) had a great time. Yes the lines were long but the rides and attractions were well worth it. We spent three hours there but could have stayed longer. Save $ and use the Entertainer voucher to get 2-for-1 entry. BYO your own gloves if possible as the ones they give you are pathetic and the prices to upgrade them are extortionate. Over 13's should also BYO hat (under 13's have to wear helmets). All in all, great fun and a must-do if travelling with kids.

Learn to ski in the desert!. There is a ski slope built within the Mall of the Emirates building where hundreds of tourists and locals go to try their hand at skiing. Carry a sweater and warm clothes as it can get quite cold there whilst you sit there waiting. You have to hire the proper gear available there and be prepared to spend at least 3-4 hours waiting for your turn!

rip off. what a rip off not what it looks like pay for everything extra children not allowed on rides without adult but they go down on there own the toboggan ride silly 30yds long if that same with the rolling ball save your money don't go

Best indoor Dubai experience!!. Far cry from real snow but coming from another GCC country, this was definitely a nice treat specially for kids. Jackets and gears are clean, gloves are free but you can pay additional to get the better quality. All of the staff are very professional and helpful.There are different slides and experiences for different age groups.There is a nice coffee shop at the top of the hill but it can be a bit confusing how to get there.Suggest bringing along ear muffs and a scarf as added protection.

Brilliant. This was a very good experience.The entry took a lot of time, even though we had tickets prebooked. The dress and other items were pretty clean. The snow world was brilliant. The rides and attractions inside the snow world was also good. We also won a penguin soft toy by playing a game. Overall a wonderful experience, but reducing one star for delay in entry
Great experience. An amazing location to spend some time in Dubai. Good value for money. You receive some warm clothes. No queues for the T-bar tow. Bring your own hat and gloves.
Nice experience. Fun and enjoyable activities in there but too cold I was freezing most of the time and had to go out twice to get some warmth

Seriously good. The runs are short but blue to bordering on easy black, the temp is pleasant, the snow is perfectly groomed, there are no lift queues and the outside temp is a balmy 90 degrees. There is only one rule. Get there at ten am when the place opens otherwise its a nightmare lining up to rent your gear. Best to know your boot size, bring gloves otherwise you have to buy them (but only $15). Just wear a cap or beanie on your head. Shake shack is just up the escalators on the outside. Heaven

First time skiing. This was my first time skiing and i learned over there. They several tracks, for dummies, medium and 'hard'. Great experience.
Since the skiing is inside the dubai mall my wife went to the mall instead of skiing!

Unbelievable. So out of this world to have snow in a desert. Throughly enjoyed the experience. Really good value for money. With all the equipment given to you. Just felt bad that I did not go on the entire area.

A winter break in the hot Dubai summer :). It is so cool to have a real snow and winter in the heart of the desert :) Ski, toboggans, or just play with snowballs and build a snowman - all that and much more is available in Ski Dubai. Don't forget to have lunch in the "swiss" chalet :)

Ski Lesson was very good!. I had a ski lesson booked and the penguin encounter booked as a gift, Im 25 and never skied but my other half is desperate for me to get learning so we can go away ... at first I found it so odd that I would be doing this in a shopping centre in the desert (or this is how I imagined it) ... but when we got there I was blown away! When you arrive the staff deal with you very professionally, I was given all my over layers, books and skiis and sat and waited for my instructor, I was in a group of 4 who was all total new commers to the skiing world. Off we went and so it began, the guy was really patient and he could spot from a mile away who needed a bit more attention and 'teaching' and who would be a natural - unfortunely I was one of the ones who needed a bit of extra attention! ... but he worked very gradually and slowly introduced the next step ... by the end we were up the top (which isn't right at the top, this is a designated learners area) I still need a lot more working on but as a first attempt I felt really comfortable and left feeling confident for my next lesson!!My partner went off snow boarding while I was in my lesson and he said it was really good for an inside venue!!Penguin encounter was my favourite - I have reviewed this separately :)

fantastic place. Totally outstanding whether with friends or family. you will definitely end up having a gala time. Initially it does take time to collect gloves, uniform, shoes etc. better to always have someone from your group standing in the queue.
loved it!. great experience of effectively skiing in a shopping mall in the middle of the desert! The session we had went so quickly but was fun for the family. I would do it again

Exceptionally poor customer service.. This place looks impressive and I am sure, if you actually get to use it, it probably is. I sent then 3 emails asking if they rented snowblades without reply. I read several blogs which mentioned people using snowblades, so i assumed they did. We bought 2 x 2 hr ski passes from Cobone and duly turned up at Ski Dubai, only to be told that they no longer did snowblades. We spoke to the Duty Manager, who promised to check if they had some mothballed in storage and that she would email to confirm, we still await the email. Ski Dubai/Cobone have since refused to refund our money. I fail to see how they can keep the money when the facility has not been used. Shame on Ski Dubai and Cobone. Buyer beware. The other major voucher company in the area would have given a refund without question.

must do. If you come go to Dubai you can't leave without going to the skiing! Obviously the slopes aren't that long bit there are 2 (one a little more difficult than the other) and 2 skilifts and 1 chairlift. you also have a bar where you can eat , you can take ski and snowboard lessons, see penguins and do other activities. They give you skiis, boots, helmets and suits.

ice in the desert. just take the basic ticket which covers three activities,beacause most of us are not used to cold conditions cant stay for long time inside . better to carry something to cover your face and ears, if not buy there.

Snow if you have never seen it. Awesome experience if you come from a place of no snow or if you have never seen snow before. Very well set out and run - they give you all the goodies you need. Really nice little ski slope if you are a beginner or if you are looking at taking the kids for an experience. Take my hat off to them for doing a snow park kin the desert - but that's Dubai for you...

Great place but needs to attention in every aspect. Last Friday while we were in Dubai I took my wife and daughter and went to Ski Dubai at Mall of the Emirates. I have to say that our arrival there was not as anticipated and this all because of the lack of organization. As we were waiting in the Queue and waiting just like everyone else until our turn came, this Indian family of 10 if not more jumped in front of us and this was disrespectful. I looked at the staff in the counter thinking that he will talk to them and I had an angry look but he gave no regards. Therefore, I had to step in and speak to them and the staff "Mohsen" I believe this was his name just kept quite and actually he wanted to serve them! After I talked to them they did not go back they just stood next to me and I was so angry and just resumed with purchasing the tickets so I could get out of there.Then we went to pick up the outfit and for my surprise the same thing happened but with another Indian family. I was so upset that those came from another closed raw and jumped in front of us. When the staff there saw that I did not like what just happened she " A Filipino girl" asked them to move out and wait in the queue just like everyone else.Lockers were so dirty and water everywhere and smelled bad. But once you are inside then it is worth it. The staff inside are so much helpful, friendly and organized. Everything inside is ordered despite some people who still don't respect the lines but the staff inside are firm but respectful. I really like the place but I won't go there on a Friday.
Great Time!. Had a lovely time in ski Dubai, recommend brining gloves and a hat as they provide everything else! Great slopes and can do all the shopping you want afterwards as well!

Cold in the desert!. To add to the already surreal experiences we have had in Dubai, we went skiing! It was really good fun. We merrily followed the directions of the helpful staff, suited and booted in the appropriate attire, then entered the 'snow zone'! It was SNOW! Proper pick up and throw snow! Then some penguins appeared and danced with their trainer and I was compelled to throw myself down an ice toboggan run! Skiing was good for indoor and lots for none skiers to do. Fun for the whole family. Not cheap, but a giggle.

Had a gala time. Visited with family and friends Had very good enjoyable time at the Ski Dubai zone at Emirates Mall. My 7 year old son enjoyed very much , we tired man things inside though there was queue it was worth a wait.Penguin show as good and touched it first time in my life and was awesome feeling.Get tickets in advance if you going in a holiday season

Hug a penguin!. Wow! I love penguins and never thought that I would be able to get so close! Penguins clearly love their keepers and vice versa. Reasonably priced so that you can afford to buy some of the photos that they take for you. A relaxed and charming experience. Would recommend for children aged 7 and up.

A seasoned Skier and I Loved it!!. Ski Dubai is excellent! They have 1 large main slope that then peels off into 2 different categories of slopes (expert and general) the expert slope is probably the equivalent to a Red run in normal ski language!! To get to the top you have 3 options: chairlift, chairlift to halfway and then a button lift or button lift from bottom to top all the way, the button lift is a far quicker option than the chairlift but I would recommend that you try them all!!The trousers and jacket they give to you are not overly padded and so if you intend to stay for more 2 hours, you should definitely wear a sweater or a couple of layers at least otherwise you will start to feel the -4 temperature (or just take your own ski jacket) definitely take your own gloves too as this will make a difference between loving and hating Ski Dubai.All in all I loved it here, nearly 450 meter long ski slopes and very wide too - an awful lot better than Tamworth!!

Not for adults. The snow park is highly overpriced and not meant for adults. Children will enjoy it as the rides are small. The skiing is decent but definitely not for thrill seekers. You wont regret missing this one.
Must go place. Worth watching,beautiful place for snow lovers.Difficult to understand how is ice mentained in a shopping mall.just loved it.Money worth spending.
Exciting. An expensive but brilliant afternoon. The children spent 4 hours and said it was the best fun ever. Varied activities and reasonably good skiing.

Not terribly congruous.. I think the ski place is a bold attempt to try something different.But, I opine that there is a limit and skiing just does not fit in the desert. The idea of getting into a large ball to roll down a mild gradient is not a bad idea for kids.
Its lovely and cold. Well designed.. Its lovely and cold. Well designed. Lots of rides for all ages. Its a must see if possible and if one like the cold.

My first ski lesson!. When you think of Dubai, you don't think of skiing but Dubai Mall houses the biggest & best indoor ski dome in the world. My first lesson was fun, the instructors were relaxed, the groups were small and the 1:1 attention very good! I have since been on 3 ski holidays & love it! Thank you Dubai for being a great first taste!

Just for a short ski. If you get bored of shopping in Dubai Mall and wanted to squander your time. Well you try to check this place although the wait for the queue is about 15 minutes and to go down is just 5 minutes. At least its something you can do here in Middle East even in summer.

A surreal experience. Good day out but if you want to do all the activities it can become expensive. Great experience whilst in the desert to be able to have fun in the snow. Equipment good quality and staff friendly. Snow very realistic and the temperature reflects the experience brilliantly.

Fun experience!. It was such a fun experience! Located at the Mall of Emirates. My husband dragged me into this, I was nervous at first because its our first time to try skiing but it turned out to be a super fun experience! Instructor was a professional, (ofcourse, no worries). He will guide & teach you basic techniques. You can also avail different courses (basic/advance level). There is also photographer taking your pictures while skiing for souvenier. ✌
Enjoyable rainy day activity!. A good place to go when it is raining,Two hours is 200AED which is reasonable. It can get very busy and congested at peak times but generally it is well ran.
too good. had a great time with family and friends..lot of rides for every size and kind of person..A must for dubai visit..

Discovery Lesson. Had very very enjoyable time at the Ski Dubai zone at Emirates Mall. 19 year old daughter and I had the 60 min Beginners Discovery Lesson (Drs 175 = +/-$53). Our instructor, called Ali, was SUPERB !!! Felt a tad disappointed that "extras" (gloves{not in provided equip cost}, locker and photos) were all hugely over priced... But overall really good time....... Hugely recommend - especially on those few rainy days (today).

Great experience, good value. The place is very well organized they provide you with everything socks boots skis poles ski jacket and ski pants helmet. There is a quad left and a rope tow with seat rest. The snow is shockingly good considering you're in a mall in the desert. I went with my son and we had a blast.I have skied almost all the major resorts out west in Vermont and friends and still found this to be a great experience. We also did to being and other things while we were there. Would also be a great location for a beginner skier not too overwhelming and well set up with a magic carpet to one side for beginners. Compared to the $125 lift ticket prices and most of the US western resorts which obviously doesn't include any of your equipment or attire. In contrast the cost at Ski Dubai was approx $80 which included lift tix, all equipment, ski coats and pants, socks, gloves, helmet, etc.

Cool Fun in the Heat of the Desert. We really enjoyed our time at Ski Dubai! We did the snow activities/zip line and were also able to participate in the penguin experience which was truly the highlight for me. You're able to get up close to the penguins and will learn interesting facts about them. Being I'm from a northern region, it felt great to get out of the heat for a bit and enjoy the cooler temperatures. Great experience.

Couldn't do more than 2 hours. Checking in can be quite painful as the queues are slowed down by visiting parties discussing the various packages with the cashiers. All quite tedious. Getting clothes fairly quick. I wasn't skiing and was more looking to the snow park with my 8 year old. I think there is provably 4 rides you can do and that's it so becomes really repetitive after awhile. Glad I did it. Will I rush back? No.

Crazy timing but a must do!. Skiing in the dessert????? Yes, it's true and only in Dubai. We went during spring break and while not the best time due to the long lines it was still an excellent adventure. Advise to go early before the lines start. Overall great time.

It barely makes sense. You imagine being in the middle of the desert the last thing you would expect to find is a ski slope with real ice, but this is Dubai after all!It offers three forms of slopes, big medium, small and has a children's zone where younger kids can play!A very interesting experience.

very good snow park. it is a very good snow park i didn't skiso the cost was high for only snow park but i guess for whom can ski it may worth itpenguins were amazing (but to take photo with them it will cost 100 AED per photo !!!!)
a lot of fun. wow, indoor ski, guys. I liked it very much. My kids loved it a lot. The children play in there until it closed. They really had a very good time.

Got to do it!. This is a huge indoor ski slope. When we visited the outdoor temperatures were in the high 80s so the contrast was good. Imagine the difference in the Summer from 50C to 0C!Ski Dubai is located inside the Mall of the Emirates. On the ground level the entrance has a restaurant area, St Moritz in the style of an alpine lodge with blazing TV screen log fires. Then there are a range of shops selling mountain and ski equipment. There are viewing areas where you can see most of the slope and watch the regular penguin attraction through glass for free. Allow plenty of time to visit. We left it a bit late and felt rushed. You can limit your visit to a walk around which seemed to be very popular with locals or you can pay for a penguin experience or toboggan run plus zip wire. There are ski lessons and it looks like it could be a genuinely great place to get your first ski/board lesson.We decided on the 2 hour ski which is for experienced skiers. The time doesn't start until you swipe your pass at the entry gate before the (full sized ski lift) so don't rush. After 2 hours the swipe gate wont allow you any more access.Getting set up is a bit chaotic but you need to queue to pay and then take your pass and self-register at a kiosk. Helpfully, there's an integrated weighing scale. Then move to to the clothing/boot counter where they issue an outer jacket/trousers. I imagined that they'd be insulated but they're only one layer of nylon. I only had a T-Shirt underneath but was fine. Finally, you can get skis issued. There are helmets for kids. Ski Dubai provide everything except gloves. You can buy fleece inner gloves in the shop for £5 but I think you could do without at a push. The snow isn't at all icy so in the worst case I don't think you'd hurt your hands if you fell.You can add a locker to your pass which works by swiping the pass. It could be convenient.The slope itself is huge. It's in a two stage L shape. Ride the chairlift to the top and there's a slightly steeper to the right claimed to be a black. Probably not. When we visited there were some decent youngsters practicing slalom. The runs down were long enough to get in 8-10 decent turns and the snow was really forgiving - like cream cheese. On the way out don't forget to put your pass into a machine that returns your deposit as cash.
Loved meeting the Penguins. The highlight of this place was meeting the penguins. If meet the penguins wasn't past of Ski Dubai, I wouldn't have enjoyed it .

Confusing . To be quite honest I expected better of Dubai. The service was shabby as my brother and I had not a clue what we were doing the whole time we were there. We arrived bout a ticket were I was to ski for two hours and my brother who in 13 to go on the zip line and the little play area (we were very unknown to how kid friendly this place was) so we went into the ski dubai part and no signs, directions or instructions as to what to do. So we guessed we needed shoes and the outfit so we search to find where people were going. When we found it we asked for the suit and shoes and where to go to change and so they pointed us in a direction then left us to our own devices, so we got changed in open space (we didn't have to take anything off other than outer layers) then we were told before we had a locker, as there were about a hundred lockers we had to search around for a while to find one. After I realised I need skis and from being skiing before I knew they needed you weight and height to give you the right skis so I saw where people were getting the skis and went over, I waited for about half am hour for a family to get their skis as they kept changing the sizes and what not so after waiting for half an hour (being British) I get pushed infront of (I found this extremely common in dubai as no one here likes waiting when they are going to end up in the same place within a matter of 30 seconds) and so I waited again then I asked what to do and was pointed towards a machiene so I went to the machiene and without me realising it was weighing me infront of all these people where i felt so self conscious and jumped off, after getting a piece of paper saying my weight hight and level of skiing I was I went back to the skis man and waited another 15 minutes then I finally got my skis then spent about 10 minutes finding the entrance! After all the cafuffle I finally found the snow and I found the whole experience amazing as I love skiing but my brother first got told to go down the ski lift the first time he went up to use the zip wire and so I went up with him the second time and made sure he got onto it then after his second go he was told you can only do the zip line twice so he was forced to stay at the bottom and go on the small activities where when buying the ticket we were unaware of what they were and they ended up being for children under the age of 7 so he did them and found them boring and not so fun. So after I used about an hour and a half of skiing we both left in the hope to upgrade my brothers ticket to ski with me but to get a ticket you had to get undressed again and take everything away and so we ended up leaving early because for someone who hasn't skied before it us a disappointment unless you under the age of 7. But I personally found the skiing fun and enjoyable and impressive!

amazing. this is the second time i go there...my family and i had a great time but we couldn't stay more than 3 hours because of freezing weather :))the ticket is 250 dirhams...you can enjoy all the rides there and will give you free glovesbut the gloves are nit waterproof .so don't forget to bring your thick gloves and tuque... in case you bring your children

Enjoyable. We went on a Tuesday evening. It wasn't crowded at all so we skied many runs. The chairlift is very slow so we ended up just taking the t-bar the whole time There is minimal signage so it was difficult to determine which line we needed to be in for all the equipment.

So much fun!!. BEST TIME EVER!! We did the beginners course and it was awesome. If you don't know how to ski then this is a great introduction. They help you step by step through the entire process. It is so much fun and i would definitely do it again! Tip: bring a beanie and gloves. You can buy inside if you don't have.

Wrap your head around it . It is arid desert outside but somehow you are skiing above a car park. This place has been around for a while so they have a good sistem running. The slopes are not bad and sometimes they build small ramps to jump a bit, the more aggressive slope tends to be very quiet as is the ski lift on the far left.
snow in the desert. the attraction is very good and does have the real effect of the snow as it may be in the european countries. a must visit for children.

Good to visit but expensive. Its situated right inside mall of emirates, hence very convenient along with shopping. However, you can spend only about an hour or so inside as there is nothing to do after that. For such short time the cost is quite high. So visit it only if dont get to enjoy snow anywhere else. They have diff categories of tickets so select the one that suits you the most.

Fun & cool experience. Coming from a tropical country that doesn't have snow, this is truly an amazing experience! We enjoyed all their activities, especially the zipline. Although it is a little bit pricey, it is a unique experience that you shouldn't miss especially if you're traveling with your family.

Great fun. Skiing in a shopping mall is the way to go..There is a great indoor ski slope in Mall of the Emirates and it is well worth a visit.Unless you have skied before,you must do a beginners course called a 'Discovery Ski' which is a lesson for 1hr.If your instructor says you are good enough,you can pay for a session on the slopes afterwards..We'll worth it..Fabulous facilities and good fun.

Something to do. A fun couple of hours but it can get a bit repetitive. Also use the button lift if you are confident as it is quicker than waiting for the chairlift as all the people not skiing or snowboarding use this. Also it took over an hour get the clothes as there are a lot of people just going for the fun activities and they seem to take a while.

SNOW AND SLOPS IN A SHOPPING CENTRE. Loved the snow and iceicles enjoyed the rides, wore the snow gear, wow wonderful clever idea who ever started it. My son learnt to fly in a special room. hope some day to go back to BEAUTIFUL WONDERFUL ELEGANT DUBAI.
ice rink in middle of a desert. Amazing feet by Dubai, having a ice rink for skating in middle of a Desert... looks awesome but a little pricey on the pocket but worth the experience.

A Fun Sightseeing Stop. It's amazing to see a ski slope in the middle of a desert! The mall is fun, the food terrific and the crowds orderly and having fun. It's worth a stop to view the slope through the glass windows.

Best Indoor Park in Dubai. Those who travels to Dubai should try Ski Dubai. Suitable for all ages. My kids love the place very much. We just enjoy the Polar Package. playing with snow, tube ride, giant snow ball, chairlift ride, and more. Definitely will come back. Next time we will enroll the ski class for sure.
Fun to ski inside in a desert area. This is a fun attraction for the family. Worth to try out as they have many different snow activities to offer. Can be busy from time to time.

just an average getaway. Ski dubai attraction is located in the mall of the emirates . While it is much bigger than the facilities which i had been to in bangkok, there are limited avenus of entertainment here if you are not a sking guy. Yea playing with snow,ice sleds etc are there but you really have to go through a lot of hassle of clothes etc and inside also there is a lot of queing and you have to trudge along your own tubes up the slope in some of the cases. there is a ski lift on which you are allowed one round which basically gives you an overview of the facility. On this attraction there is a zipline which you can mount midway but the same is chargeable & we did not do it as it was not a grea proposition with so many clothes on. To be honest we had gone to the atlantis on the first part of our tour and the attraction here seemed a scaled down version of the same with ice added to it. If you have not been to a ski world before than you can visit this place for the novelty part of it.Otherwise i would not recommend this over the atlantis or for that matter even a hummer safari.Snow in a desert is its only USP & take a call according to your time & budgets.

Novel attraction for a shopping mall.. We did not ski here once we saw how small the slope is. As it's not high enough for a real skier to even do a decent turn but as an attraction for people who have never skied it is both novel and fun.
Snow in Desert. i am fro kashmir and know what and how snow fall. to have created this snow is middle of desert really take brains hats of to the brain behind this

certainly was an experience!. Remarkable feet of engineering. Pretty darn fun. Unlike any ski experience I've had before. Turned out to be a fun activity for our family on the rainiest day in Dubai's recent history.

OK, that was fun!. 45 years ago I last strapped on a pair of snow skis. In the past 4 years, I have been to Dubai several times, and always wanted to check out the famous indoor ski slope but time and other things that needed doing always intervened. THIS time, we stayed almost next door to the facility and it was finally a chance to try skiing indoors in the desert.I didn't break anything, and had a fine old time.There seemed to be a lot of people checking in when I arrived, and I feared it would be crowded -- crowds and one very out-of-practice skier could have been a bad mix -- but most of them must have been there for the many other activities on offer -- there were perhaps a dozen people using the ski slope.The check-in process, and getting geared up, seemed overly complicated, but since it has been so long since I skied, that may have been due more to my unfamiliarity with a now-standard process.Be aware that gloves and a hat are expressly excluded from the gear you rent -- you are instructed that you will have to buy those. If you plan to wear a helmet, you can skip the cost of the hat, at least.For 100% artificial snow (natural snow being more than just rare in Dubai, much more so indoors) the surface was much better than I would have guessed, and after a few "how do you do this, again?" spills, I was able to ski safely and enjoyably, though I am sure inelegantly.Staff were pretty helpful and friendly -- particular thanks to the photo-guy, who came t our rescue when my camera battery died and took some specific shots for me. "The thing about a dancing bear is not how well he dances, it is that he dances at all." Maybe there is some element of this at work here - it is not how great the skiing is in Dubai, it is that you can ski there at all! Still, the experience was enjoyable, memorable and makes for a good story. Worth the doing, give it a try.(And for non-skiers, check out the other c=activities offered, about which I cannot speak because I did not try them!

Ice in Desert!. Ice in Desert! Is it surprising? Then visit Ski Dubai in the Mall of Emirates. A lot of activities there for kids and few for adults. Very nice experience at -5 degree in desert of 50 degree.
All good everything was good . Staff r very friendly. Place to enjoy with family .We goes every month with family . MOE is really great

A must see if ur in Dubai . Come on ice in the middle of the desert. The place is nicely designed to suit the old and young alike. You can spend it on the slops or just having fun with the kids. Great eatery all around. Great day out of the heat

Awesome time with the kids. Was simply amazing fun experience with my kids inside a mall! We spent a couple of hours and would not have been hard to spend an entire day but we started to feel too cold! Tons of fun

Having in mind that you are in the desert- this is just unique.. For being in a mall in the desert, this is just amazing facility. The ski area is divided in sections for more advanced and less advanced, for people who are living in regions without winter conditions - this is the closest they can get to the trill of the winter sports.

Great memory for the kids. While this indoor ski won't be able to compare to the outside natural resort, this one creates a great memory for the kids fun and experience to a world well-known destination. I'm glad to let my kids enjoyed it. They really did and recalled it as one of their great memories in Dubai.

A great weird attraction of a ski slope in a mall in a desert!. I wouldnt say its an attraction for seasoned, professional skiers, but if you go just for the fun of trying something unusual and skiing in massive fridge, located in a massive mall in the desert, with penguins then its worth a try. The ski lift is a little slow but the slopes are surprisingly longer than expected for a ski slope in a mall. I would recommend to dress very warm as you dont have the sunshine. Equipment can all be rented including the ski suit.

AGAIN, AGAIN AND AGAIN!!!!. I loved Ski Dubai. The rides that are there are amazing . I loved the huge sphere game. All I wanted to do the whole time was to ride all of these things again, again and again. The best part is when I answered one of the questions in the show and I go to touch and take a picture with a penguin . That was so awesome. My brother kissed the penguin. I really recommend that you go there. Make sure that you watch the show and answer the questions that they ask. I will tell you one of the question they asked, what are the types of penguins that we have here?

ice place. it was an awesome experience in the unnatural ice word which seems an environment of full ice world slides snow balling with friends can be done there and skiing the best thing and best place do is there available.

Great Indoor Snow Fix. Ski Dubai is awesome!! An amazing place for kids and families. 2hours is enough for the more experienced as it can get a little boring if your used to the alps or mountains, a real novelty to be riding on snow in the middle of the desert!! I've been a number of times and find early morn is best to avoid the crowds. Rental gear is average but perfect for the indoor slope.
Was lots of fun. I had fun, it was really cold but everything was fun especially the chair lift and zipline. The zipline was my first and was scary but checked off my bucket list.
Too expensive.... A ticket for 500 DHS is really expensive. You can go to the mall of emirates to get a free view in the ski dubai hall (from rhe restaurants)
good but not worth it. this is situted in under the mall tempreture is good but activites is so lesser at ski dubai but must to see this
Fun for a day. I am a big skier and its really fun to go for a day. However don't expect difficult runs its more a novelty
What more can you say?. What more can you say? You get to ski in a mall!!! WAs a fantastic time. A little challenging for newbs like us but we made it work. Cant wait to go again.
great placee!!. famous for its sking in the desert area and highly tourist attracted point for its artificial view..

Excellent day in ski dubai. We've never gone skiing so did a 1 hour lesson. It was fantastic. The hour flew and we learned so much. Following that we did all the activities - zip line, zorbing,slides etc. We also had booked the penguin visit which was brilliant. Highly recommend ski dubai.

Good place to learn. Ski Dubai is the only place in UAE where you can start learning to ski or to snowboard. I did my lessons here and it was fun. Instructors were really good. When you visit this place bring some friends with you it will be more fun!

Ski Slope in the Mall of the Emirates. Well just having a Ski Slope in Dubai is pretty amazing. Adults and children are all catered for and seem to love it. Lessons are offered, there is the big slope for the seasoned skier, you can meet the penguins and there are other fun things to do. Those who don't want to ski can have a meal in one of the many restaurants, while watching the skiing or experience an amazing 'shopping trip' in this newly modernized, large Mall.

So much Fun. We had the best time, so much fun and you certainly got value for money. The ski lefts were good, the snow and speed of the slopes very good for an indoors area. The clothes they give for you to wear adequate for what we were doing.

Amazing time at Ski Dubai!. This place is simply amazing! Only in Dubai you can find a ski center inside a mall, in the middle of the desert. Temperature is really low (-4 C) but the ticket provides free suit, shoes, and gloves. I would recommend that you pay a little bit extra for an upgrade of the gloves (better quality), this is done once you are there in the store. I bought a snow power pass which includes access to several rides at the center and also I booked a penguin encounter which allows you to see two types of penguins. For the penguin encounter, cameras are not allowed, but they take several pictures of you and the penguins, you get to hug them and kiss them. It's an awesome experience, plus part of the ticket price goes to an organization that helps the penguins. Also if you don't get to book the penguin encounter activities you can see the march of the penguins every two hours from 2 to 6 pm. The staff provides interesting facts about the penguins and if you are lucky you can go and kiss one of them. If you feel to cold, you can get outside to changing rooms so you can warm up and then come back to the snow when you are ready. This place is really fun! Even if you don't know how to ski you can have a lot of fun doing some other things, such as slides and going up with the lift chairs and enjoying the white view. Awesome place!

Fun packed day out.... Was a bit skeptical of the concept but could not recommend this venue enough. We had great family fun in the snow and on the rides. We also met the penguins which was an incredible experience. They seemed really well looked after by professionals. Great day out
SHARING ABOUT SKI DUBAI. SKI DUBAI is a big and beautiful Snow Park and people can experience minus one degree temperature and also there are lots of thrilling sports activities people can take part.

Very badly organized. We were really shocked at how badly organized this was! We all know how to ski, so the actual skiing wasn't a problem for us, but the lines for equipment rental were a disorganized mess. And once on the slope the lift operators often hide inside where it is warm rather than actually help the skiers. Even the service in the cafe was unfriendly and slow. Something is really wrong at this attraction. Until they get it sorted I would recommend avoiding it, especially if you are a family. I should add that this is completely out of character for all our other experiences in Dubai, which have been a real joy.

Dubai in 1/2 day. Ecologically crazy. Of course the mere challenge and craziness attracts. We didn't go inside to see it, and encourage such nonsense. We'll save ourselves for street heating of the North Pole.

Very fun. This was a wonderful attraction, the slopes are nice, there are lots of other activities other than skiing, but the instructors are terrible. They are too busy talking to their friends, so you won't learn anything !But otherwise it is great, and a must try.
Little expensive but so much fun. Coming from country with no snow at all..i had so much fun there and I enjoyed the snow, the cold. It was new experience for me.

Snow in the dessert . Wonderfull experience. Had a really good afternoon inside emirates mall ski dubai. The rides r really nice. Once u enter the professional photographers take tons of photos but they r too over priced each is 125. My 6yold had a great time but the 3yold was really cold so bundle ur kids up really good.

Eh. We went to the mall of Emirates to do Ski Dubai. Thankfully we watched for a bit from the window before buying tickets. This is more of a kid friendly attraction. Most of the attractions inside ski Dubai are targeted for children and frankly we got bored even watching after a few minutes. We did not end up buying tickets to go in. (You can see inside ski Dubai from the mall. Look at the directory to point you in the right direction if you are also unsure of buying before seeing)

Ski in the desert... . Great indoor ski resort. The runs are long and the black is fantastic. The alpine cafe half way up is a great surprise and worth a visit. The kids love it. There's lots of other attractions too. The best is the one where you go down the slope on a rubber ring and shoot through the air onto an inflatable. My 4 year old grandson and I must have had 20 goes each. The penguin experience is so cute. It's a great place for young and old as well as novices and expert skiers.

Snow in the Desert. One of the modern marvels in Dubai. A ski slope and lots of fun activities to do at Ski Dubai. Situated in the mall of the emirates, ski dubai is a must do even if you do not know skiing. You can always ride up the lifts and just enjoy the slope or take a tumble on the ball in the snow. It a fun time at a reasonable cost.
Ever wated to ski in the desert?. This is the most unique opportunity to experience winter and the fun of winter in the desert. This is a fantastic family activity and even great for singles.

If you're not a ski person, you wont have a lot to do here. You need to know how to ski to really have some fun. Apart from that there are only a couple of activities that you can actually do.When you get there you will get a band on your hand which will get you some clothes and a pair of boots. The gloves and socks you get are yours to keep or dump. On entering you'll see an ice dragon. Take some pics, he wont bite! Moving on, there are some kiddy rides you can get yourself onto or play a little with the snow. Take the chairlift and see how big it is but its like a 15 mins just sit there in the cold stuff. Oh and half the mall watches you as there is a glass wall between you and the mall. Leaving that there's nothing else you can do.

Lots of fun !. Very child friendly and lots of fun ! Wouldn't miss it when in Dubai. Situated in one of the best malls (Mall of the Emirates) you can spend an entire day there. Full gear is included in price which is quite expensive but an experience not to be missed for anyone who has not experienced snow in reality. The rides were fun but adults should be warned to be more careful around young children. My younger one nearly got hit by a super-fast skier. The café at the top offering hot chocolate with marshmallows was just point on. The staff was friendly and the gear in excellent condition!After you have left the place, you can dine outside in a restaurant overlooking the snow. This completes it all.

Great experience for all !. We arrived with our pre booked tickets and were very well handled by the staff. They gave us the clothing and shoes which were a bit cold for my liking. But for the rest we had a great time. Great experience when we realise that we are in the desert. Wear some warm clothes to enjoy a max.

Best Place in Dubai. One of the best places I highly recommend in Dubai, its fun and absolutely safe to do different activities within the huge artificial snow park. Very expensive but its a one time good experience. All type of snow activities and its for all age groups, young children to senior age citizens. Snow bullet is the most I enjoyed, do not miss that activity.

A bit rusty. Having. Not skied for a few years we wondered. How we would get on, but there are plenty of opportunities with different areas to find your ski feet again. We had two hour tickets which was plenty. The centre provides all equipment included in the price, you only have to take a hat and gloves yourself. Fun was had by all, and would,recommend. Based inside huge shopping mall.
Cool indoors in hot summer. Best place to visit in Summer's of Dubai The clean environment and friendly staff makes the place very user friendly and the rides makes it more fun and enjoying
Regular visit. . We always visit the ski fine when we at bin Dubai. Whilst it always seems busy the floor is always quiet. Wouldn't miss it.

Expensive!. Located in the emerates mall, this is one hell of a pricey venue to visit. We enquired about going on the zip line. For 2 runs, they wanted £25 gbp per person (150 aed) . Add that to the cost of gloves and a hat, you're looking at at least £40 (200 aed) for roughly 20 minutes entertainment.

Not really snow as we know it!. So silly anyone who lives in a country that has snow will find this "attraction" a farce. It's amusing to look at through the viewing glass but unless you have never experienced snow don't waste your Dirhams!

Fun times at Ski Dubai. My partner and I had a blast at Ski Dubai. I am 66 and my partner is 60 but we had a great time.We Zorbed, rode the chair lift, zip lined and did the penguin encounter.Be fore warned that it is very cold and you should bring some thermals to wear under the suit they give you.
Penguin Encounter. Amazing, fantastic experience for both young and old...our son and future daughter in law have never stopped talking about....they were very excited
Feel the chill. Feel the chill in hot desert. One of the best SKI Drive and you feel like you have reached diff world.
IMAGINE YOU CAN SKY AT DUBAI!!!. In Dubai, everything is possible and you can enjoy skying at any time of the year! So , do not hesitate and enjoy the winter at Dubai!!!

lovely experience...joyous!!. An amazing experience of sking in the middle of a desert. Must try your hands on. you dont need to be a skilled ski-er to try this attarction, the slides and tyres and many other activities can be done by kids also.

A try before you buy. Skiing can be expensive especially for the novice, but in the UAE you can learn to ski without having to travel, buy before you fly, Ski Dubai offers a great way to try before committing to the real thing, skiing or snowboarding this is a great place to sample.

Nice for those who doesn't get snow. I am from New York we get snow and the snow here was extremely fake, couldn't make a snowball. It was cold the line for each attraction was extremely long. It is fun for smaller kids teens and under. I wouldn't recommend for 21+ it may be boring, limited things to do and it is cold so easily bothered by queue.
Very impressive but bit expensive . It's really impressive but you know in dubai everything is bit expensive . So ski dubai is bit expensive but it's worth a visit . Highly recommended by me.

Awesome place for a whole family. I've been to Ski Dubai many times for several birthday parties and Christmas get togethers. Its really wonderful for the kids and adults to spend a whole day there... from several type of slides & rides to seeing the penguins to snow ball fights there is a lot to do and explore for several hours! Try to keep warm and cover your ears especially!! :-)

Had to try. I have skied for over 40 years all over Europe and over 11 years in America. I had to give it a go skiing in the dessert when it is so warm outside. It is very cold, I brought my own hat, gloves and ski socks. It was good to try, my only complaint was it was not very well organised as they let people who could hardly ski use the lifts and go to the top and there was one girl who was out of control she could have caused a very serious accident and someone could have been badly hurt. I was lucky as I am a very experienced skier and could avoid and watch out for that person, but others could not have. It does say you are not meant to go to the top if you can not properly but some people do not take heed.I still enjoyed going there to get some skiing in as that year I forwent my ski holiday.
Skiing in the Dessert. Lovely 2 hours of skiing with nobody there! Nice slopes. They provide you with all the material and cloth. Only bring your own hat and gloves.
so easy to ski on.. Runs were quite short though so easy. No driving, no getting up the mountain. I must do for me to be able to ski in the desert.

Very impressive. Wow!who would have thought you would see ice skating in the hot humid Dubai.its really an impressive place to visit in the equally impressive and luxurious mall of the emirates.the mall has its own metro station and so its a very accessible location in al barsha.ski Dubai is a bit pricey though.you would really enjoy the experience and you can even view parts of it for free at the nearby restaurant
simply great. I personally have learned to ski in Ski Dubai with just one full course, and I'm a grown-up, so not easy as a young person. The staff is great and the structure is unbelievable
Penguins . I was so lucky to get to go on the Penguins tour. Absolutely once in a lifetime opportunity. If your around don't double think it!!

Fun experience of snow in the Middle East. My kids enjoyed every bit of this place. The penguin show was amusing too. Long lines as expected for every fun features like the big ball rolling down. The lockers were a bit small and inconvenient.The coffeeshop is situated way up high. How I wish, it is on the ground floor.

Mind blowing!. This is amazing, think... how qould you get the snow in a 40 degrees celcius country. no just joking. snowboarding, skiing, just playing in the snow well worth a visit. bring money for mall
Awesome Place.... Amazing experience, especially the encounter with the Penguins. Don't miss it this is the best part of this place, kids would really love it!!!
Ski in the Desert. £40 for 2 hours or £60 all day go early or late to avoid the busiest time. all stuff supplied, has a ski lift in the middle slope is 500M long and real snow

Do you really want to ski in Dubai???. Most of the sights in Dubai are absurds. If you think it's a good joke to say that you have skied in Dubai, go in. Many people are standing in the front of the window trying to get good picture of them self + the winter view - but through the window, it's quite difficult to get a good photo.

Coooool Experience!!!!!!!!. A totally different experience for people like me who do not experience real snow on regular basis!!!! All the attractions are fantastic and we did them a number of times. They provide you the appropriate gear. Choose the right pass that suits your needs!!

Shopping dubai. The biggest shopping mail we have ever been to great place easy to get round as you would expect in Dubai every designer shop there is lots of places eat .If you go I the evening you can also see the water fountain which is very good.Don't expect any think to be cheap there is it isn't but worth a visit if you want a afternoon away from the sun

Amazing Experience. One would definitely be amazed to see such kind of a place in a desert. But Dubai has gone way ahead of our imagination and is simply adding more and more amusing attractions. This place is definitely worth a visit for anyone who is planning to travel to Dubai.

2 hours of fun! . Why not right?? ...we went Sunday morning and were on the "slopes" at 10:23. My wife, daughter and I skied while our son snowboard. The process of getting clothes and skies was pretty easy and I'm sure it helped that we were there early.2 hours is all you really need. Going down the "slope" took me anywhere between 15 and 30 seconds..I brought hats for everyone and I would recommend bringing gloves...I gave my gloves to my wife and was too cheap to buy another pair and after 60 minutes, my hands were pretty cold! I doubt it would have been as much fun if the "slopes" were crowded...
Nice to learn skiing and quite exotic. If you know how to ski and you know how it is in real nature it is a bit boring but still a nice escape from the heat outside with a lot of activities offered.

Good for kids but otherwise unremarkable . It's a novelty to ski in a mall in the middle of the desert, which is why we did it, but otherwise the experience is only really great for kids or people who will never otherwise see snow. The lines to get the skis, then boots, then the bindings and outfits means you'll line up for 45mims before you even begin to start. The slopes are small and it's very cheesy but young kids would get a real kick out of it.
Excellent. When you visit Mall of the Emirates, you find this amazing place, a complete ski world in the middle east, worth to visit.

Snow in desert? Happens only in Dubai. We didn't know about this place until 2-3 days of our Dubai visit and then we decided to try this out one of the mornings. It was really nice. A bit small for the number of people who come to visit.

Just a show. Not the best I have seen in Dubai. It is just an attraction that should be seen anyway. Inside of the mall, this corner is dedicated to the children that have never seen or played with the snow before.

Surreal experience to ski in the middle of a desert.... Was a bit apprehensive about going here as firstly i was expexting a relaxing beach holiday and secondly, having experience indoor skiing facilities in the UK i wasnt convinced the expense was justified....how i was wrong....this is a must. Very organised process from booking to collecting ski clothing, ski's, boots, looker....WARNING...bring gloves!! these are not provided ( however can be purchased in a conveniently located sporting goods shop lol)Your 2 hrs start from when you actually scan your ski pass (which is good because please allow 30-40 minutes to get geared up) Every time you pass though the lift it tells you how much longer you have also.

Great fun!. It was freezing cold!I would recommend you come in some warm clothing and a head sock! My boyfriend and I had a great time..just a shame we didn't do any Skiing..maybe next time...rest of the activities were equally fun!This is a great place for both kids and adults.

Ski World in the middle of the dessert.. Who would have thought!!! But yeah, thats a reality. good experience, especially for kids - wanting to try a few snow rides. There is a cable car tour - that gives you view of the entire slope. worth going in..

Perfect to diversify your experiences in Dubai. For those interested in getting down the big slopes I would recommend to take the 2 hour slope pass that will give you access to the basic slopes for unlimited time and 2 hours of lift rides all way to the top. It is more than enought. If you are really intended to spen the hole day getting down, take the full day slope pass. The full pass is only worth for childrenso they can enjoin some attractions like sliders, bbig plasti balls where you will get into it to ride a snow hill, etc ...

Mini Switzerland experience. This place is located in Mall of the Emirates. The temperature inside is very low to maintain the ice. Very good attraction for children. You have to wear the costumes and gloves which are available at the entrance.

ICE IN DESERT ........ In a hot place if we find cool atmosphere it will be a God Blessing. SKI DUBAI is such a place, just unbelievable !! Words will not at all be sufficient to describe the attraction, one has to experience himself. If anybody visits Dubai, SKI DUBAI is a place must to visit.
From Australia. We visited the Mall of the Emirates where Ski Dubai is. We did not partake in the ski adventure,but watched the procedure for a long time. It was -4 degrees.
Amazing place. Just imagine that they moved mountains of Lebanon or Alps to the middle of the desert with all the activities even the penguins????
Incredible. Skied for 2 hours - no lines noon on Saturday. Incredible that skiDubai has more vertical than Nashoba, the mountain just west of Boston. And prices are incredibly reasonable.
Excellent!. Very nice day out meeting and playing with penguins! Didn't use the ski platform as it was pricey but the penguin interaction is very worth it.

Just Amazing. If you have not done any snow activity, you will surely enjoy the Ski Dubai. You can do many type of activities depending on the the ticket you choose. Though I had been to many places of snow, yet I was amazed to see the big area with snow, where people were enjoying skiing, chairlifting, zorfball, etc. Cons- You have to spent a lot for this, too much time outside for clothings, shoes etc., which you will have to return (except fleece gloves and socks- if you like the, otherwise just leave them also)

Penguin experience once in a lifetime opportunity. We did this during a break we had during one of our tours at Dubai Mall. The Ski Dubai is at the mall of Emirates which is 10 minutes away via metro. It was -4 degrees the day we went and they provide all the clothing and shoes. The penguin interactions was the best. I got to touch them but the photos are really expensive. It is very surprising to see snow indoors in Dubai.

Taster Lesson. I booked my friend and I taster lesson for snowboarding in February. It is easy to book online in advance with a good selection of times and days. Our instructor was excellent and quickly identified that one of our party was more advanced than the others so pushed her on to bigger and better things quickly which I know she appreciated. My friend loved her experience which was controlled, organised and lots of fun! She is now looking to practice more in her home country and looking to take a snowboarding holiday. At 150 AED for an hour, with all your equipment included, I think it is pretty good value. The only issue I have is when you go, you have to be there at least 30 minutes before your lesson starts to make sure you can queue for your equipment, get changed and to the ski school on time. The queues for equipment can sometimes be massive so it's a bit hit and miss what time you turn up at. If driving to MoE, parking can also be an issue! Overall, a great experience when visiting Dubai, or indeed if you live there!

Is it value for money?. We went in Feb as a family of four, the cost of getting in vs what is on offer . I am not sure its worth it. If you don't ski you have 2-3 rides and a ski lift ride. Ski lift does not seem very safe and they are happy to let a 3 year old ride it once you are in you cannot get off for 15 mins. The prices do not justify the attraction, people will go to it to tick it off the list of things done in Dubai. My advice would be to spend that money on something else, dune buggy, desert Safari etc. I would not recommend it.

To ski or not to ski?. The snow conditions did not look good from the window...so we did not ski. We were not sure what to make of Ski Dubai, should we ski or not? The pictures we saw on line made it look far better than it did in person. I am not sure how often they make the snow however it seemed hard and icy from the window views.It is amazing that this is even an option so in a way it could/should be rated more than average however it was overly packed with people, the snow did not look inviting and it seemed more like a tourist attraction...like a theme park vs. a place I would want to ski.
Family visit. Went with three children. Children loved the activities and rides. A must visit place if visitng dubai with family specialy young children.

Not impressed. Don't get me wrong. The idea of skiing inside of a building is crazy and amazing!But it's faaaaar from being a very fun track. It's an average one, and full of people. A quite short slide. And some baby slides. They claim to have like 15 different tracks, but that's not true. They have 1 or 2 big ones (that aren't that big), and 13 small dunes that are almost not dunes...And it was expensive. I wouldn't do it again...

Superb. Have visited many snow parks but this one is excellent with great rides and the best part is the ski area size simply amazing a must visit in dubai. The only problem there is their check in process which is really very slow and annoying otherwise a great fun thing to do with family. Advice: buy a entertainer dubai book which has a buy 1 get 1 offer for skidubai and most other attractions in dubai.
Good. Good for kids and OK for adults. Its pretty expensive so make sure you are there early. Kind of fun doing this in Dubai which is a desert :-)

Fun day out of the heat. Great way to spend a day out of the heat. You can ski, snowboard, zorb, zip line, toboggan.... even meet penguins!It is pricey, but we felt it was money well spent. It is within a shopping centre so something for everyone.
Great to see. Stopped by to see the snow in Dubai, it is surreal. To see a ski village in the dessert is surreal. Again it just makes me appreciate all the marvels of this wonderful city

Aamazing!. We watched from the mall, we didn't go in because we're not into skiing. But it was much fun to watch the kids come off that slope and play in the snow, dressed in real ski outfit. Amazing country!
Amaizing. I had been with my family to dubai and we visited SKi DUbai in mall of emirates. Zorbing is great and we get to click pictures with penguins.

Cool place!. Amazing to find a ski slope in the middle of the desert! Goodness knows what kind of money has to be spent to keep this place chilled?? In the middle of the Mall of The Emirates too and right next door to the Kempinski Hotel so easy to get to in a taxi from anywhere else in Dubai.It's quite a long slope and even has a bend in it halfway down.Pretty easy to hire equipment and not mega expensive either.Worth a session if you ever get bored with everything else that Dubai has to offer!

Wow we spent time with the King penguins. Wow this place is amazing if you want to have some fun in the cold. It has all your ski slopes and also has other activates. We also went to see the penguins and what an adventure that was and a ones in a life time experience I won't ever be able to forget. The prices inside ski Dubai was ok and staff was great to help when needed. I would love to do this again.

Good attraction but expensive. Try to book this through your hotel and it may be actually cheaper. The super pass costs 250 AED and power paas 325 AED but we got it for 225 AED from our hotel. Great day once on the slope. Where to start. Ski Dubai is a good fun day out but you need to plan the time carefully. Ski Dubai opens at 0900hrs for payment and to get your gear sorted before the slopes open at 1000hrs. This definitely seems the best time of day if your going with Kids, especially the first hour where the slopes seem relatively empty. It is also worth checking in with them the day before to make sure they do not have any special functions like i experienced this week when 800 people arrived at the same time to use the ski lift and snow park.Be prepared for a little frustration in getting the boots and skis sorted out. The computer system that weighs you in is very annoying when its asks for phone numbers and emails which if you are a kid and do not have that info it will not let you move on. This information gathering is unnecessary. The paper also jams in the system which creates more havoc. I hope Ski Dubai will read this and go back to the old manual system.On the slopes. Although not the great outdoors in the Swiss alps it is still a good laugh considering your in the desert. The chair lift is quite slow but the button lifts at the side get you up to the top quickly. The cafe half way down is a great stop for hot chocolate and coffee. Have fun and just remember it for what it is, the best IN DOOR ski resort in the world. One last word of advice. There are lots of special deals for Ski Dubai from Cobone Deals, Entertainer and then Ski Dubai's own Specials. But make sure you read the small print carefully as not all is what it seems at first glance.

Pricey for beginners. The place is definitely a must-visit for anyone who likes to ski, even if you are loyal to real snow, skiing in a place where there was nothing but sand, 15 years ago, is a something to remember.If you are a beginner and want to do things by the book, then you will need to take about 4 classes that are AED 185 each, before you are allowed on to the slopes. However, if you have a friend with you, who is willing to teach and hover over you, then hit the slopes directly, saying that you're an experienced skier. Ski lessons and fun in the snow!. Ski Dubai amazes the mind. We went for ski lessons and enjoyed the experience thoroughly. We booked ahead online and were pleasantly surprised by how seamless the preparation to ski and the lesson was. The attractions and activities inside are worth a visit too.

Snow in a very hot summer. Nice place where you will enjoy snow in a country with a very hot weather surrounding by a wonderful shops

A little corner of Winter in the Desert. We visited Ski Dubai twice while on a week's holiday in Dubai. It is quite an amazing concept and very well presented, with efficient processes and modern equipment. The interesting thing we found was that maybe only 10% of the people there actually skied or boarded, the rest just played in the snowpark and rode the chairlift. So the ski piste was not crowded at all. Our 4 year old had a couple of lessons, and the Instructors were very good, making it fun for her. Our older girl and I spent a couple of hours riding the chairlift and skiing down (about 6 minutes up and 45 seconds down!). The snow was very consistent and powdery. This may have been because we arrived early and finished our skiing by 2pm. We heard that it gets busier later in the day and the slope may get bumpier.The snowpark was great fun for kids with bob-sled, rubber rings down slopes, huge plastic balls that you sit inside while rolling down the slope, and even a cool penguin show.The hot chocolate at the Avalanche cafe halfway up the piste was excellent! Top Tip ..... Download the Ski Dubai app before you buy your tickets and you get a free Power pass with every 3 Power passes you buy ..... Good if you have a family of 4.

Probably the best indoor ski slope in the world. How do they do it, a ski slope in the middle of the dessert. Only in Dubai. Good ski lifts, steap and less steap slopes, ski lessons, apres ski bars, ... all you need!

Architectural masterpiece in Dxb, to bring snow in the desert. Thanks to their discounted rate for residents, we were able to visit this place again for the 2nd time around. ski dubai. for those that donot see any snow or play with snow, Ski Dubai is a place you must visit. Its very cold so be warm even with the outfit they provide its still cold. Upgrade your free pair of gloves as the cotton one is of no benefit.

Indoor Ski Slopes in the desert. How many people can say they've been skiing in real snow in die Arabian desert? Different kinds of slopes, Friendly staff, They even have different penguins that you can get close to. Defo a place worth visiting.

Good for Bragging Rights Only!. Ski Dubai's slope is so tiny that the effort to go there and ski is really just for the bragging rights that you've skied in the desert! It takes less than a minute to ski to the bottom from the top. The snow felt kind of soft, and was almost slushy in the second half towards the bottom. However, it is an unique experience, knowing that you are skiing in a big capsule.All the ski gear and clothing come with the price of the lift ticket, EXCEPT for gloves. If you don't want cold hands, you must BUY gloves.

Our first activity in Dubai. My wife and I planned to ski and do the Peng Friend encounter. We planned to do these on our first day after we checked into our hotel. Due to the fact that we were unsure of when we would get to ski Dubai, we did not make reservations for the Penguins and were only able to get the 6:30pm time slot when we got there at 3. We ski'd first. 120 minute slope pass was plenty, but it got busy around 5:30 when we were done.

It is a miracle to behold. Well organized and downright cold - like winter should be! You can get in about 12 turns from top to bottom, but it is a rush to ski for a few hours, then head out to the mall for some world class shopping and dinner in the fantastic food court. At the time I visited, ~$60 USD got you all your equipment plus two hours on the snow. The rental equipment is not too great, but hey, if I really cared, I'd have brought my own. It is the experience that counts. There is an amazing amount of activity crammed into this winter space at the Mall of the Emirates. A chair lift with a bend in it, a poma lift, a magic carpet for beginners, two zip lines, a mini "louge" course, al with an alpine village feel to it. Amazing...

Snow in the desert? Brilliant!. Why on earth wouldn't you come here and go skiing / snowboarding? Even if you don't go for a ride, the pure fact that you are in a giant freezer with an artificial mountain is mind boggling! You can buy a pass for 200 Dhs which includes 2 hours worth of lift access, jacket, pants, boots and snowboard / skis. It is worthwhile noting that they do not provide beanies or gloves, but you can buy them. Personally, I didn't use gloves or a beanie and was okay, my hands were quite cold by the end, but it was bearable. They give you a free pair of socks, so if you bring your own socks, you could always use the socks they give you as makeshift mittens!I thought the quality of snow was excellent and the run was much longer than I was expecting. It was also much warmer than my other skiing experiences, because there was no wind!This would be a great place to learn to ski or snowboard or perfect our technique. The staff were very attentive and the only person I saw who appeared to be in pain when they fell had three staff members helping them up. You would never get that kind of attention on a real mountain! If you are used to speeding down mountains, you may appreciate the novelty of skiing in the middle of the desert, but won't be challenged.We got there quite early, at about 10am on a Monday and found it wasn't very busy at all. Later on it got busier and there were more people on the slope.
