Nice experience but horrible lesson. I've never gone skiing before; this is my very first time doing anything like this. I signed up for the Adult Discovery class, which is basically a crash course for beginners. In the class, there were two other girls who were familiar with snowboarding but wanted to try skiing instead. Throughout the entire class, the instructor was extremely fixated with them, and I think it was tremendously helpful to their case that they were already somewhat familiar with the snow. I was having an extremely hard time even moving around with my skiis, and tended to get to locations much slower than them. Occasionally she'd give them instructions when I wasn't around (I hadn't managed to reach the destination yet) and despite my concerns that I wasn't ready to ski down the top of the beginner slope, we did so because the two other girls in the class were already ready.As a result, I fell twice - the second being an extremely bad fall. I uprooted one of their signpoints that had been fixed into the snow, crashed into the ski lift, and caused the entire lift to come to a stop. After that I couldn't even get up. It was only after being humiliated did the instructor pay me slightly more attention.I'm going to put it this way; the facilities were nice and the environment was really cool, especially if you've never seen snow before, but I really did not appreciate how the lesson went after paying AED 160 for it. I had certainly started the lesson hoping that it would be fun; halfway through I just wanted it to end. I didn't pay so much money to feel embarrassed and sorry for the fact that I'd never done anything like it before. It would be masochistic to enjoy paying money for something that just consistently made you feel bad and terrible about yourself.I'm not trying to sound vindictive, just trying to give constructive advice - if you ever go for a class, especially a discovery class, it's preferable you do so in a group. Perhaps only then will you gain the instructor's attention, and have your concerns legitimized. Overall I'd say it was a fun experience; unfortunately eclipsed by a terrible lesson.

The Snow Park part of Ski Dubai is lots of fun!. We aren't skiers, but wanted to see the crazy concept of a ski resort in a desert country, so we bought the "super pass" tickets, which include 1 ride on the ski lift and unlimited use of the zorbing (rolling down a hill inside a giant plastic ball), tubing, tobogganing, and bobsledding. These tickets do not include skiing or the zip line. It took 45 minutes from when we arrived to buy our tickets, collect our gear (they provide boots, thin socks, a ski jacket, and ski pants, and helmets for kids 13 and under), get dressed, and put our other clothes/gear into a locker (you can rent a locker when you buy your tickets - it's easy to use. We fit 5 people's belongings in 1 large locker). Once we were in the park, it wasn't too crowded (it was a week day) so we rode the chair lift first to get a view of the scope of the place and to watch people skiing and snowboarding down the hills. You can get off the lift at the top where there is a little snack bar. Then our kids did the zorbing (I had been worried about it but once I saw that it's a short, not steep hill and that the giant balls are kept in a track so they can't go wild, I wasn't worried.) It was a short ride and there was a long line so our kids only did it once. Then we all did the tubing (sliding down a hill in 1 or 2-person innertubes. There are guys at the top who spin you as much or little as you want so you can have a calm or wilder ride. It's a very short track, but fun, and you can get right back in line and go again - it moves fast. We also did the bobsledding, which was surprisingly long/fast (a little scary, actually!) compared to the other activities. After we were finished but before we left the park, we got hot chocolate at the snack shop near the entrance. In all, it was a fun afternoon! Our only complaint is that there are not enough signs to clearly mark where the lines are for each activity so it was a confusing and there aren't enough employees working inside the park to ask, so we wasted some time wandering aimlessly.Tips: it's cold in there so bring your own hat, scarf and gloves (they provide a free pair of fleece gloves you get to keep, which is a nice memento, but they aren't warm enough. You can pay 25 AED to upgrade to a pair of snow gloves or you can bring your own if you have them). And bring warm/thick socks since the boots aren't that warm and the socks they provide are very thin. Bring some money (if you want to buy a snack/drink inside) and camera inside the park with you. The only problem is there are NO pockets in the ski jackets/pants they provide so you have to stash things inside your clothes and then unzip to get to them, which isn't convenient.Note: you are required to pay a deposit of 20 AED per person for the key card. Before you leave, return the card to a key card machine and you get the money back.

Cool for kids, not so cool for adult beginners. I have zero skiing experience so I went there and asked what's best for me. The customer care lady recommended the beginners class. I paid, gave me a ticket and went straight to pick up the ski equipment and clothing and that's when the trouble began. The clothing is made from a very cheap material, I had no idea what to do with the equipment. After a five minute fumble, one of the Ski Dubai agents came to my rescue and started showing me how to wear the boots, etc.Then came the instructor and off we go to the snow. Even though the instructor was very kind and nice, he was just not trained enough on how to coach beginners and couldn't really teach us the basics and his English wasn't pretty good which meant an extra layer of miscommunication.I called it quits after 30 minutes of the cold seeping through the cheap material and the so-so coaching.I still believe that it's a good place for kids and maybe for adults who just wanna have fun and throw a couple of snowballs but I wouldn't really recommend it for adults who would like to learn how to ski.

Disappointed. We booked an afternoon session as our morning was already scheduled for other things. Alas, the "fresh snow" had turned into solid ice. Not so much skiing as more flying down a slope completely out of control A woman at the bottom taking pictures to sell later kept complaining to us that we were not stopping in time. She did not understand that trying to break on ice is just not possible when hurtling down a slope. Thankfully, there was a wall at the bottom that took care of my breaking needs (both stopping and bone breaking !).This venture was not cheap so not really for a budget traveller. The ski lesson prior to going up was hilarious with very little knowledge of any substance passed on. I'm sure that stopping in snow using the techniques shown work quite well. Not so much when you are on a slope designed for a stunt show.Having said all that. Go in the morning when the snow is fresh and I am sure the experience would be much better.
so much fun. just had so much fun with my friends..nice experience indoor skiing.its quite pretty amazing.lovely place.
Amazing for lessons. I learnt to snowboard here in just 3 sessions. The instructors were amazing and the equipment was brilliant. Certainly recommend this to travellers

Spectacular Ski Resort in the Desert. A must-see in Dubai. It is simply amazing that there is a place like this in the desert. Dress warm as the temperature inside is kept at around -6 degrees Celsius. If you are looking to book a session with the penguins, you may need to book ahead of time as there are limited availability for each time slot.
Great fun. Always fun to check out the ski slopes in the mall. Never ceases to amaze how it operates and draws people of all nations.

Amazing contrast of a ski slope in a hot desert. Outside the hot desert, but inside a ski slope. Dubai malls do anything to attract their shopping audience. I watched the ski entertainment from the nearby TGI.

Great . Nice experience to have.
Specially at summer.
You will feel the cold out of the heat.
The only thing I didn't like that there is no free area for keeping our things.

What an experience!. Pretty impressive for an indoor skiing venue, and we had a lot of fun throwing "snowballs" at each other apart from my failed attempts to ski haha... a lot of fun but make sure u bundle up warm and cozy. Not exactly the place where you want to share coats that has been worn by 100 other people before you. Still, a very unforgettable experience.
Cold Cold Cold. Lovely place considering where its location is, make sure you wrap up, it's quite cold in there, we met the penguins too, would highly recommend for everyone
Feeling Alaska . Thrilling for youngsters, kids were too happy , dresses provided by management were bit dirty, that place is still under construction. Totally worth to visit

Nice Place but Poorly Managed. Please note that I have rated this place average just for the pathetic management by the staff there.When you think about this place with respect that it in built inside a Mall in a desert its absolutely amazing. The place is huge from the inside with lots of activities for everyone especially for the kids. There is sliding on ice, zorbing on ice, Sking, ZipLine (i would not recommend this though), penguin show, snow fight area etc.We visited this place on 27th Dec 2015, entered around 5pm in the evening. It took us 40 mins to get the ticket and another 45 mins just to get the gear to enter the area. There was a lot of disappointment among the visitors due to the clearly avoidable waiting time. The place was a clearly a mess, there were jackets and gloves lying around all over the place, people had to stamp on those to stand and the same was taken back by the staff after long durations and given to visitors without any cleaning. The experience before entrance to the actual arena was pathetic.Advise to do the Skiing, Zorbing before any other activity coz there is a huge waiting line for that.

Very cool. A good day out. We got the complete pass for AED 500 purchased at the door. And there is loads to do. Take a thin jacket with pockets to wear under your ski suit as they don't have pockets so caring anything is difficult. Get there early when it opens as it gets busy later. Not to impressed with the ski lesson, and wish we could have spent more time on the slopes. But we would've had to purchase another ticket. Also pack a beanie as your ears really feel it!!

Finally! And better than I expected too!. After 11+ years in the Gulf and 5+ years in Abu Dhabi, I finally went skiing at Ski Dubai. An avid skier since childhood, I really miss being able to drive up to the mountains for some schussing on the slopes. The slopes at Ski Dubai are pretty tame, but I'm older now and 2 hours on an intermediate slope is all I needed to get my fix. Highly suggest off-peak time (I went on a weekday) and the "hill" is almost entirely yours, with minimal wait time for the chair lift. Sure it's a little pricey, but so are all the resorts now, and as I'm still a UAE local, the drive is much simpler and cheaper than a plane ride.

Only in Dubai!. In the middle of a desert, is a ski slope. Ski Dubai is an amazing sight to see. I didn't go in to the actual ski area but sat in TGI Fridays, had lunch and watched the skiers in action. Just fantastic.

Unexpectedly great!. My teenage son insisted we at least look at this amusement while we were in Dubai and we ended up spending 5 hours there!We have skied in NZ before (but some time ago) so we decided to purchase a package including a discovery lesson. This later led to a mix-up where we were not allowed to ski afterwards as we bought a beginner's package (you need at least 4 lessons before they will allow you unsupervised). However after a chat with the sale management, we came to a mutual agreement as ski-ed for another 2 hours which was great fun. The package included all the gear we needed (skis, poles, boots, gloves, pants and jacket) but in hindsight I wish I took my beanie. The staff were very friendly, keen to help. I agree with another contributor's comments about the queuing but when a place is popular - you draw crowds. Having said that, we skied after 10pm and almost had the slopes to ourselves.Overall - this was arguably the highlight of our Dubai trip!
Cold Summer time. This is the place of worth watching. As in hot climate of dubai we get great cold climate here with lots of various sports activity.
Good place. The site is maintained very well. Its very cold inside. Do carry caps and gloves. Shoes, socks and coats are provided by the team. Do opt for paid rides as well.
Must be in Dubai!. Great place, you feel like in Switzerland :) must be in Dubai :) you can rent all clothes and snowboard or ski and actually ride in the middle of the dessert. Great feeling.
Amazing. Dubai Ski was so amazing that my kids didn't want to come out. Was very well maintained. Rides were limited.

Worth it!. We visited Ski Dubai in January and bought the Super Pass which gave us two rides on the Snow Bullet and unlimited rides on the zorb balls, toboggans, tubes and chair lifts. The Snow Bullet was excellent - there was no queue both times we rode and the staff at the top were very friendly and made us feel safe and excited. Some tips:- Bring your own thick socks and wear a jumper under the ski jacket you are provided with. Ski pants, boots and socks are also provided but even over my own socks, my feet were still cold. - Unless I missed them, there are no pockets on the provided ski jackets or pants so make sure you wear something underneath that has a pocket if you plan on taking in your camera or phone.- Visit on a week night to avoid crowds.- Don't expect this to be an all day event. You can easily cover all activities in two hours (unless you're planning on skiing too).

Freezing fun. For a fun filled break away from the heat and the busy shopping this is a must. You can ski, just play around in the snow park, roll around or slide. This is so much fun!!! They provide ski suits, boots, socks and gloves. I recommend taking a beanie and scarf as well a waterproof gloves as the temperatures are freeeeeeeezing. I pack some extra thermal stuff for the kids and thicker socks so they nice and comfy. If you have never experienced snow this is as close to snow you can get. Kids under 3 are not allowed so keep that in mind when reserving your tickets. There are penguins there that the kids can see and even have a penguin encounter with them. I always visit Ski dubai when in Dubai as we all love it!!!
First snow experience. Took the niece there for her first time in the snow. She was a frozen fan and just wanted to build a snowman. Reality wa

Poorly managed at ticketing and clothing counter.. The place is very poorly managed at ticketing and clothing counter. We went again to same ticket counter and took another 15 minutes to change the locker keys. Great skiing!. Really enjoyed this activity. We were in Dubai during the summer so it was very hot and this proved a great indoor experience. The slopes were perfectly maintained and you got all equipment including warm ski jackets. Its obviously nothing like real skiing but the experience is like a mini version with T bars and ski lifts to the top and real snow! Only an hour or two is needed skiing as the same slopes get boring if you are a good skier. Great place to learn though and great staff!!
Caroline ochieng . My teenage children had a ball.We left after the place closed!Apart from my freezing and exorbitant prices everything else was great.

Fun and exciting for children. We took our grandson for the actual skiing while we watched from the huge glass panels outside.looks so real and. Panoramic and beautiful. An adult had to accompany him but he thoroughly enjoyed the experience. You can hire all the necessary kit for the skiing. Unbelievable that you can see a ski slope in a shopping mall and that too in a desert. There were a lot of children and some adults all having fun.

Unusual and fun.. Not a long run but fun just the same. Skiers and snow boarders welcome. Special price for students on Mondays. Ski jackets, pants and skiis or boards included in price. Gloves and hats are not, take your own. Can enter without skiing for 80 Dirham and includes 1 chair lift ride to the midway cafe and to the top and back.

Really chilling. Situated in the mall of emirates you will have the experience of snow in the desert. Awesome rides and playing space for the children You will feel like you are walking in real snow. They provide u with all the necessary clothing to feel warm inside.
it's amazing to see Artificial ice in Desert. I think it's a must place to if u are in Dubai, It's amazing to see and Play in artificial ice just like natural

SKIING IN DESERT. Over rated. Firstly very poor arrangements for ticketing process. In this digital age this process is medieval.After that starts the preparations. Total chaos reigns here. Absolutely no guidance for the first timer.After all this one goes in to see very very small events.One feels short changed, after coming out wondering for what, all this unnecessary stress.
Must Visit for Dubai. Fun place for Ski Lovers, otherwise also one can spend few hours with family and enjoy snow and rides.
Beginner Fun. If you're planning a ski trip, this is an excellent place to learn and hone your skills. If you're an avid ski pro you may find it boring
Nice. A nice experience if you miss winter or just want to see how it is possible to recreate it all inside! The place is really huge and great fun! Amazing for kids!

Worth seeing. It is definitely worth going to at least once. Make sure you try the zipline! BUT it is ridiculously expensive. Lots of fun for kids, good for adults who are dying to snow ski. But it can get a bit boring after a little while. It's such a cool thing though, I definitely recommend checking it out if you are in Dubai!
Overcrowded and confusing. Long lines to collect sleds, tubes. Waited over 30+ minutes for the huge zorb ball ride. Bring your own hats, gloves, socks as what they provide is not adequate.
Total disappointment. The quality of the rent material is below any expectative and the staff is uneffective and unpolite. I am very disappointed with the experience.

My wonderful experience in Dubai. I found Ski Dubai a very exciting and joyful experience , for both my siblings and I . Although we were freezing inside but neither did I or them wanted to leave as we were having a wonderful time . Each game makes you anxious to try it and go on to the other . I would go there every year if I had the chance .

What an experience. certainly not what you would expect in the middle of a desert but is absolutely brilliant. Chairlift up to a 'chalet' and had a hot chocolate, toboggans and loads of other snow activities available for those who dont want to ski. The penguin parade is a must and my daughter absolutely loved being able to get up close and personal with one of them.

you will be like WOWWWWW...... a ski slope in a mall and that too this long....you would definelty be like wow...ski dubai in the mall of emerits is one huge ski slope with temperature of -2 degrees and ice every where... ski dubai offers a lot of enternace options (visit thier website) you can ski there ,or just take a stroll, or go for ski classes or meet penguins...ski dubai has many options...once there you will definetly feel cold...they will give you the necessary snow shoes, and clothes.. gloves as well but i suggest you carry a cap as well just to be safe. keep atleast 4 hours minimum for this place...you would not realize how soon the time passes here.meeting the penguines is also fun they let you play and touch penguines at the end and also click pictures with their professsional photographers. i would consider this as a must visit attraction for any and all ages.

Great and fun but still far from an outdoor experience!. As I was on a business trip to Dubai I decided to spend a few hours experiencing the indoor ski. Well, I am probably too nature-oriented to say that it's good. It's a fun experience but when I see that for this money you can go to ski in Iran ... enjoying pure snow and amazing views for a quite similar price ... I don't get it.

Ski in desert. In Line of Dubai's Quest for being the World's Largest in architecture, This centerpiece of the Mall of the Emirates is the Largest Indoor Ski Resort for a Desert Country. You will not miss it as the Theme park is at the center of the Mall of the Emirates! Having a Ski Resort in a blazing desert is perfectly logical for Dubai, who aspires to awe the world in everything. This indoor ski resort features an 85-meter-high indoor mountain with 5 slopes of varying steepness and difficulty, including a 400-metre-long run, the world's first indoor black run, and various features (boxes, rails, kickers) that are changed on a regular basis. A quad lift and a tow lift carry skiers and snowboarders up the mountain. Adjoining the slopes is a 3,000-square-metre Snow Park play area comprising sled and toboggan runs, an icy body slide, climbing towers, giant snowballs and an ice cave. Ski Dubai is also home to a number of penguins who come out to play several times a day. Penguin encounters can be booked (although you will pay a separate price of AED 145 for a session with the penguins for 40 minutes plus the general admission for AED 200 for a total of 345 AED!) allowing the public to interact directly with the penguins. Winter clothing, ski and snowboard equipment are included in the price of admissionAdmission Price is:200 AED for adults (2 hours) and 170 AED for children less than 13 year old50 AED per 1 hour extensionFull Day Pass is 300 AED for adults and 240 AED for children less than 13 year oldINCLUDED IN THE PRICE- Jacket- Trousers- Disposable socks- Helmet for children up to 13- Skis, poles and boots or Snowboard and bootsNOT INCLUDED- Hat & gloves for hygiene reasons but can be purchased from the shop starting 10 Dhs- Locker rental is 20 Dhs and can be used by several persons- A ski pass deposit of 10 Dhs is required and will be refunded when returning the ticketFOR FIRST TIMERS:you need to get a ski lesson which includes being initiated to the equipment and basics of skiing or snowboarding for 1 hour and the price is different, at AED 150 for 1 hour for all ages, Group Lessons at 160 AED for 60 minutes.Opens: Thu to Sat 10AM-Midnight and Sun to Wed 10AM-11PM

Worth a try. When in Dubai, you should check this out. Relatively speaking, do not expect much as this is an indoor ski trail. However, you must give credit for what it is. There is no where else in the Middle East, where you can ski or snowboard. 2 hours is more than enough.

Skiing in a Dessert. To be clear and honest the Ski/snowboarding experience was great. There are friendly staff and the experienced is organized. I enjoyed this part of the trip. My issue is with the "snow" (ice) burns I received from the trip and the help I did not receive. I was not wearing gloves (which are not required) and during my sessions I made contact with the snow several times with my hands. It was not until the next day that the skin around my knuckles experienced the burn from the ice at the park. This was the last part of my trip and I was on a flight back home the next day. I live in the U.S. and reached out to the company that runs the ski park and they would not refund me the money from experience nor offer compensation. They were not helpful and that is why I give the poor rating for this trip.

A great experience for first time skiers!!!. Very popular attraction and a very busy one for both visitors and locals. It is a very unique attraction and yes for those of us who live and feel real snow, the difference is obvious. However Ski Dubai is an attraction that has really been created with both the young and old in mind. It’s a must to do attraction as they really have made it nice and I can imagine going in here from the 40C degree heat. Luckily we went over the xmas holidays and it’s the best weather in Dubai at that time. We wanted to enjoy the snow park, chairlift but also meet the penguins – best decision. We read the reviews before we left for Dubai and the ski Dubai website is not the most amazing website so we thought we would see better offers and book something when we reached Dubai as we were living in a hotel inside the MOE so knew we could book something and then come back. We were amazed at the queue for ticketing purchase and we were like 10th in the queue and my wife decided to go out of the queue while I stayed in the queue and she made inquiries and found out that buying online would actually save us AED 20 per ticket and we would not need to wait in the queues but rather just go to a separate kiosk and cash in our tickets.We went for the Peng-Friend Encounter and booked it using my iPad at the hotel. As I warned the website is not amazing and after booking we screen shot the booking reference just as well as we never received an email. The website was either too busy with traffic. Nevertheless one could always log back in go in ‘my account’ section and see your booking. The bookings for Peng-Friend Encounter were sold off for the next 2 days – shows how popular these are. We showed our screen shot and receive dour tickets from the online booking kiosk which had no queues at all. We received a token each for free gloves from a shop which was right inside ski-Dubai and adults gloves were good but kids ones were more like mittens – can’t complain they were free after all!!The prices are all on the website, Super Pass which is a must is AED 250 for an adult and a Child too, same price. The Power Pass includes the Peng-Friend Encounter and Super Pass so you enjoy the chair lift. The snow park has amazing activities for young kids including slides, rides, snowball and playing areas as well. We ended up spending 3 hours in this attraction until our feet and hands were numb so yes as advised by many, wear some warm clothes, thick socks as they provide rubbish socks. Ensure you have a woolly hat and good gloves. Snow boots are provided – just ensure you try them on as the staff giving these out seem to be making wild guess despite you giving your feet size.The Peng-Friend encounter is a unique experience and as experienced travellers not many places offer you to actually touch and kiss a penguin. Our kids went gaga and the trainers are really good and explain a lot about the penguins and some of the tricks that have taught these penguins. The Chair lift gives you an excellent way of viewing the whole ski-Dubai park and appreciate the structure and see skiers below – worth it for sure. Queues were horrendous but maybe because we went over xmas and it was peak holiday seasons. The staff are friendly and always happy for a chat – not easy doing their job at minus 4 for such long hours!

Snowboarding in a Desert. Though each run lasted 15-45 seconds depending on speed, it was an experience unlike any other, the snow felt like a real mountain, despite the walls, ceilings, and lights. Great atmosphere

Great Activity with Kids. We brought our 7 and 8 year old kids here while my parents went to shop at the Mall of Emirates. both kids loved it and wanted more. the amount of people who were here at that time was tremendous, therefore, it took some time to go through the line.coming from the tropics, it was a great experience for them and they still talk about it now. if we had enough time, i would have opted for them to have the Ski lessons.

skiing when its 40 degree's. For a little fun filled few hours you can ski in the Mall of the Emirates. They supply all the gear and if you cant ski they offer a range of sledges for the younger kids. Great fun.

Great for souvenir photos. Coming from a tropical country, it was a great experience to frolic in the snow. The place was rather crowded during our visit but we still decided to put on their outfit if only for the sake of the souvenir shots to mark the visit. What makes the place astounding is the idea that it is an indoor park where one can really learn how to ski, if only we had the time to do it.

World's best indoor ice skate. - largest indoor ice skating- not suitable for kid below 4 years- temperature maintained inside (-4 deg)- Feel the real snow- Penguin show is great- Ice statue- Costly by worth try once in a life time
Ski Dubai Indoors. Interesting your first visit. Have to do it, right? By your third visit, the thrill is gone:) Well run and easy access.

Enjoyable Afternoon. First of all I have never ski'd and I was visiting SD with my family including my 4 year old, so what I am not going to be able to talk about the quality of the skiing or snowboarding here.What I will be able to say is the basic access pass that gives you access to all of the small slides and games is well worth it and will easily be able to make an enjoyable day.We went on the ski lift ride which allowed us to marvel at the construction of this snowy mountain in the desert , I know it is obvious but I was shocked at just how cold it was in there but still the clothes provided did keep me warm.We also enjoyed all of the slides and activities such as the inflatable rings. The other highlight was seeing the penguins.Penguins in Dubai, wonders will never cease

Ski Dubai. It was a very nice experience. Skiing in warm Dubai. We were there for 2 hours and if you are a good skiër it is enough. The price is including the material and the boots, jacket and throuser. You can even drink a hot chocolate in the warm avalanche café.

Too crowded. The idea is great and draws a huge crowd. However it is too commercial and over crowded! It was the Christmas holiday so I expected it to be crowded but there were so many people you could not enjoy the attractions!!
Summer Chilled. It's a great n chilled place to visit in Dubai.t has got wonderful rides for kids ,teens n adults really don't fail to visit when ur in dubai.v enjoyed alot.

Loved it! . That was fun! It takes awhile to get ready...you have to wait in several different lines for tickets, skis, boots, etc. But it's pretty amazing that you can ski indoors like that. There are two lifts that take you to the top. Not huge runs, but still fun and a cool thing to check off the list.
Fun for the novelty of it. If you're a real skier, buy the 2 hour option. It's fun but you'll get bored quickly on the two beginner runs (although they call one expert)

Ski dubai. If you go to Dubai, you have to go to ski Dubai. It has a "big mountain" for all of the great skiers, there is a small (realy small) for begginers, were you can have an instructor individual or for group. It has lockers. They have proper cloths to go into the cold. (Included in the price) Not the gloves (only in some packages). You can buy gloves and hats. Besides the ski, you can play around, there are slides, zip line, etc. If you go, youre going to have fun for sure.
ski for beginners and experts. Who would of thought Dubai would have a ice spot... Ski Dubai. We were new to skiing but this place still allowed us to have fun.

too many people when we got there.... Only did the snow park area and it was good fun but after a few rides the whole place was pack with people already. We are planning to also do the Ski lesson but it was already full. It might be a better option to do it at a later time.
Cccoldd . It was 7 o'clock when we went to the ski Dubai. We were given very heavy clothes. I almost frost to death. If you weren't prepared for this. Be careful. We enjoyed the skiing and sliding.

Fantastic place but very costly . It's a great place to experience snow and allow kids to play to their heart's content. The arrangements are great. Gear they provide is clean and adequate (except for socks - get your own pair of warm socks - preferably 2 as they do get wet). And do get a cap for yourself (or buy at their shop). The cafe inside is great and not very expensive. Penguin encounter was a unique experience. Likes it. Overall expensive but you may want to do it if you haven't done anything like this before. We went with a power pass.
Costly Bet. A good place for Kids and who can ski ,as there is big slope for Skiing. Advise is better to ware enough warm clothes as this not a Natural Snow.

Snow in Dubai. This was an exciting attraction! We had to buy our tickets, lined up for our snow suites, including boots and got to enjoy as many activities inside, including snow fights for children.

A must visit for the mall. Took part in some downhill skiing. Was a good experience for a mall. Its expensive for the experience but overall worth the price for the strange feeling of skiing in Dubai.

So much fun!!!. We went to Ski Dubai and bought the Power Pass! Absolutely fantastic experience! Tip - go EARLY like at 9am and buy your tickets and get ready to go in already. NO ONE will be there when they open at 10AM, no need to wait in line for the anything. The crowds come around 11:15. So worth the money spent. They provide you with jacket, pants and shoes. Bring a beanie hat of your own and scarf because they do not provide those for you. Also, bring waterproof gloves of your own. You can buy them there but as it is in Dubai, it is very expensive!You won't regret going early and having a lot of fun!!! We did the zipline package but maybe you might want to trade it for the penguin experience in which you actually get to touch and hug a penguin! Don't worry about buying the packages online (very difficult to find info). Just show up at the mall of Emirates early and go to the ticket office of ski dubai. Go Early!!!!!

Ski Lessons . While on a 2 week vacation to Dubai, we sent our 7 yr old for ski lessons. We are impressed at the professionalism of the staff. It's always so so full and crowded at ski Dubai but once you get to the ice, it's all worth it!
Great stay. In Dubai you can combinate beach holiday with a great city. You have to made a sightseeing tour and visit the gold souks.

Snow in the desert...... A fantastic experience..... snow in a mall in the middle of the desert city.... you just feel like being in a ski location.... it has the skiing, the rides, the lift and the penguins!! do not miss it if you are in Dubai...... but make sure you have a few hours to enjoy the experience........

Communication. It's a nice place to visit and get the experience. The main problem with it the communication with the employees. Upon arrival they really don't explain what you are going to get. So we booked the beginner lesson finding out after the class was over we would never get to actually ski. It was a displeasure for me because I only took the class so my mom wouldn't have to take it alone. They then told me I had to pay for a separate ski lift. Which I felt like I just did all that for nothing. So if you go here make sure you understand exactly what u paying for.

Very Cold!. Worth a visit if you have kids who have never seen snow. There is lots to do here apart from ski (very tame - one run). It's like a snow adventure land for kids with sled runs (tame but suitable for little kudos) and snow slides. It is very very cold, they give you coats and boots and disposable socks but take your own warm socks, gloves and scarf and beanie or else you will only last a short while in the freezing temperature! Allow an hour with little kids, longer if you are properly kitted out with warm accessories. And wear long pants!
Great value for money. It took a while to get our boots, ski's etc.. but once we were all kitted out we had a great time. Ski'ing and sun bathing in the same day.. my family loved it!

Don't Miss it.. A must try for everyone !!. Great Experience ! My kid was so happy. She enjoyed it very well. Its very interesting from the starting to the end. My recommendation to every one.The provided gloves and socks are not enough for you if you guys are planing to stay inside for more than 2 hours. Get some good thick gloves which is water proof and a thick socks if possible. The provided dress is good enough to protect our body from the low temperature. Go there with your family and enjoy skiing in desert. It is bit high in price but worth trying. you wont regret for sure !!!

Skiing in the desert!. My family of 5 really enjoyed Ski Dubai. Although the skiing is not super challenging, it is a lot of fun and well worth the cost. Admission includes ski clothing, equipment and 2 hours on the slopes. My only complaint is the lack of organization in getting your clothing, boots and skis. We had to wait in 3 long lines, but we also went during the busy holiday week. Overall a fun family activity!

Amazanig. Since my daughter 4+ did not see snow before we planned the trip for her.but the fun was for all the family. Even it was such a crowded day we enjoyed every minute with super pasd entry .it really worths especially if u r from non snow country or if your home has just few days snowing with no facilities.I recommend to bring your own gaps. the gloves were free and fine for adults For kids we tried to upgrade to water proof ones for 25 AED extra for each but they were very tight so we did not upgrade and the kids' hands were really cold.Expect a cold weather and wear a warm clothes.We took dinner at restaurant next to the gate and the price and quality were very good.then we went back to have more fun.We went in a high season in Saturday when schools are off so I prefer to visit in a week day if possible to enjoy thrills in short queues.

Nice experience but very expensive!. From tube slides, slopes, skiing, snowboarding and jumps, this indoor ski resort has it all. But when you compare the prices with the enjoyment level I would rate it on a scale of 7 on 10. We took a Super Pass which included 3 rides/ activities. Our hands and ear were frozen within 60-75 mins and we had to get out of the ski area. You will have a unique experience if you are prepared to empty your pockets big time.
fun fun. skiing in the desert... what else to say, what an experience... so fun fun fun... Not for confirmed bt just go for fun...

Schussing into the future.... The Mall of the Emirates is an absolute must for every visitor to Dubai. It is vast, cavernous even- but surprisingly occasionally delicate and beautiful- rather like an oasis in the desert ! There is some fret-iron work in minaret style with a cupola skylight that is stunning in its simplicity, for example ! The number one highlight, though, is Ski Dubai. While the city outside cooked in 35 o C plus heat, the ski-slope glistened with artificial snow and kids wrapped up tight like parcels launched snowballs at each other. The piste is remarkably good and makes for easy turning and manoeuvrability. Ski Dubai was packed when we went in the afternoon but the crowds actually made for a cheerful atmosphere and a lively feel. Switzerland it's not- despite the fondue Matterhorn style restaurant at the bottom by the entrance- but every visitor to Dubai should scale these indoor peaks and schuss down into the future of winter sports' entertainment.

Great Fun in a Mall.... You'd never expect an indoor Ski slopes in a Mall in a country as hot as Dubai but there is in the Mall of Emirates. Surprisingly the Ski slopes were very popular and busy. Great Experience...a must do for novices and avid skiers alike!. First of all, don't go in with the attitude you are skiing the Alps or Rocky Mountains and enjoy the experience for what it is...a novelty. It's a ski slope attached to a mall in the desert...get past that and you will love the experience. As with everything in the UAE it's over the top. My 20yr old son snowboarded and I skied. He is a novice to intermediate snowboarder and I've been skiing a looooong time and we both thoroughly enjoyed the experience. We bought the 2hr slope only ticket which was a perfect amount of time...realistically I couldn't see staying all day inside the area. However they did have other options for purchase to include a toboggan/luge run, penguin experience as well as a seated zip line. While the initial part was a little painful due to the long lines...initial purchase of ticket...line; getting fitted for boots and snow suits...line; getting ticket from kiosk with weight, skier ability etc...line; then taking ticket to pick up skis and get bindings adjusted....line! So we were worried it was going to be jam packed inside, however, we were pleasantly surprised. The longest we waited was about 5 minutes for the chair lift...then we got smart and bypassed the chairlift line and took the j-bar to the top. It took us about 6-7 minutes from turnstile scan into lift, lift to top, ski down scan again.Just seeing the logistics of the entire operation is worth going. Imagine getting everyone fitted in snow clothes, issuing skis or boards and then adjusting them to each person's weight and ability...quite the feat...the guys doing the adjusting were busting their tails the entire time and I commend the effort.All in all a wonderful experience...would I do it again...probably not...but a once in a lifetime thing, most definitely. Tip of the day...download the skidubai app and purchase your ticket beforehand, that will alleviate the first and longest line. I had a very hard time trying to purchase just a 2hr ski slope ticket online...had I known about the app, it would have saved us a considerable amount of time.

Wow Factor at Ski Dubai. Situated in the Mall of the Emirates, Ski Dubai is the Middle East’s first indoor ski center. Whether you’re a newbie or a pro, Ski Dubai offers an amazing setting to enjoy skiing, snowboarding or just playing in the snow – whatever your level. From tube slides, slopes and jumps to a 3,000-metre interactive Snow Park and Zip Wire, this is an indoor ski resort that has it all. Look out over the amazing views from the chairlift, shoot down the toboggan run, or simply play and have fun in the snowy setting with your family. Choose from five exhilarating fun runs, the longest being 400 meters with a 60-metre drop.You do not need to worry about bringing your own equipment; the center will provide you with all the kit you need for the day.Ski Dubai is a one-of-a-kind, mountain-themed attraction, offering the opportunity to enjoy real snow in Dubai, whatever the season.
