Be prepared to be amazed and spend at least an hour looking in astonishment at this marvellous creation.
Surprising in Dubai. This is something so surprising to see in Dubai, being a desert but they have such an intresting place. Its so surprising and recommend people to visit it

Interesting ski experience . Seems to be running late on time. It seems to ve growing old.The experience was good but the adventure rides are too low on adventure quotient.However learning ski was a good experience.

Good for a season warm up. As indoor ski venues it doesn't really get much better than this. Additionally the novelty of it being in the desert never really escapes your mind the first time you go. If however you are an experienced skier this obviously does not provide enough distance to pick up real speed. It is basically like being in an extended snow park on the mountain.Tip: take the button lift, it will take you up to the top of the hill in less than half of the time the chair lift takes.

Great for beginners and family fun. Such a great thing to have a ski slope and park in the middle of a desert, inside a Mall. I have been twice now and had a ski and snowboard lesson. The instructors are good and make it fun. If you are an experienced skier you may get bored quickly as the slope isn't very big, but who would expect it to be. Lots of activities and things to see for children. Nice atmosphere and takes you away from the desert for just a little while.
Chilling experience. The best part is they have lessons on how to ski. The trainers are simply superb and very patience with the kids.

Amazing activity .!!. It's a must do in Dubai as its in Mall of Emirates n doesn't require you to travel any where outskitrts.. Rest explore all the Activites as it surely gives you a feel of ski and so many Activites and you seriously forget that you r in Dubai or Switzerland..

Good fun. Went in peak December and was really in advisable given the crowds. However it's a fantastic set up and great fun in the middle of the dessert. Kids loved it thoroughly but didn't get to do enough as 95% of time was in queues. Also found it quite pricey.
Excellent fun. Clean and well organised. Plenty to do even if you can't ski. A winter park, penguins as well as the slopes. Everything available for you to buy or rent. Some nice shops too.

Adrenaline Rush !. Burnt up by the heat outside ?... Walk into the Ski Dubai at the mall of Emirates.A great experience of Artificial Environment which is Well maintained and bolsters snow boarding and skiing.
Expensive but great experience. I visited Ski Dubai with my family in December 2015 and enjoyed it quite a lot. It tends to get cold at times but the rides are awesome.

snow in the middle of the desert. its a nice place to touch up on ur skiing skills, or just learn to ski till the reach the beginners level 2 then go abroad to a real mountain n continue ur lessens. its a great place to start.
its a good place to experience snow n the freezing weather.
its not cheap but worth it.

Awesome. So yes its not the alps but what a cool experience! I got to snow ski in the desert, hard to beat that. It also wasnt too expensive $60 for 2 hours plus equipment. Definitely something you should do while in Dubai.

my first snow experience in Ski Dubai.. Though I was not able to meet and greet the penguins because i came in late. But i had so much fun with all the rides. Would definitely come back with families next time.
Worth the experiance. I visited Ski Dubai with my family on August 2015. We really enjoyed each moment we spent inside it. My Kids also enjoyed the place and asked me to visit it again.
Why not try. This is a great thing to do here, as close as you can come to alpine ski resort, with a chairlift up the middle!

expensive but worth the experience. We visited Ski Dubai on Nov 25th for my bday. Desoite the fact that it is expensive, it is worth the experience. The infrastructures are great, they found the exact way to make you feel like on a real slope! Plus it is higher than what I was expecting ( not that it is high but for an inside hill, it is!). The only downside, is that while we were there , one side was occupied by a ski team on training/practicing and the other was crowded with ski/snowboard instructors which made it hard to enjoy the ski experience itself.

Fun but getting a bit dated. I visited the ski field one break from work. It was below freezing inside but out on the street it was above 40 degrees centigrade!The slope was fun but not challenging to a good skier. The facility was a bit tired. Gods for a single visit if you have never skied in a desert but otherwise not a must do.

not expected. a complete slice of a mountain ski slope fully equipped with towto hire equipment clothing and tow for a days entertainment is quite reasonable and has a surreal feeling being able to ski and eat and drink in an alpine setting and then walk out the door into 40 degree heat. being in a large mall has an extra attraction with many sights plenty of shopping and food offerings
I love it. . A very enjoyable area where u can ski in Dubai. I recommend this for people with experience and without. Cose they have mor than a game thire.
Just seen from outside. Since my chile is below 2 years, we did not went inside. But, the place is good if your health permits to staty at 4 degrees minus.
Amazing place in the dessert. A place you must visit when in Dubai, it's an amazing ski park but it's a little bit on the expensive side, make sure to grab the entertainer for this one.
Sorry #Summer! But there is no place for you at #Ski Dubai. i have visited this lace with my friends and its really an amazing experience. A Must visit place in visit if you are visiting dubai
winter in summer. wonderful for ever . imagine in 40 c you see snow , wow . if you want able rent accessorizes and sky . this experience is wonderful .
Wow. just wow ... how can the snow be made into an entertainment and picture perfect in a desert. Simply breathtaking

Pretty cool . In the UAE the climate is a bit hot, so ski Dubai offers you the opportunity to stay cold and calm, they have variety of enjoyable games in there and mini coffees as well to keep you warm.

Nice but small. If you're in need of skiing, then it is possible in dubai... Expensive!! But price include materials and clothing except gloves... Buy their expensive gloves or bring your own clothes. Overall nice but a bit small for those who really use to ski.
Good sensations . Good sensations but very cold (-3° dont forgot to wear your coat under the ski suit) and very slow to climb with the chair lift (more than 5 minutes to climb).

slippery but nice. If you are thinking of going on a real skying holiday and have never skied before, i recommend a couple of runs here to get acquainted with the basics, it can add a day to your skying time on vacation.

A great day our. It's a great day out with snow slides snow bullet and also the ice cafe
Ur a dare devil? Try the bullet and slides it's fun for sure

'What Fun'. How Bizarre, skiing in the desert. Having seen the ski area a few times whilst shopping in the Mall we decided to give it a go.We are so pleased we did as the snow was of good quality and the runs much longer than we thought they would be. Three very enjoyable hours ensued including a delicious hot chocolate in the 'mountain cafe'.Removing our ski equipment and changing back into shorts and flip flops was amazing.......

First Time Skiing. Ski Dubai - a must do in Dubai.Just the idea of skiing in the desert in an indoor mall is pretty amazing.Was pretty expensive, but had a buy one get one free Entertainer voucher which made it affordable. Did a beginner ski lesson which was great. The only thing which was a bit disappointing is that if you have never skied before, you cannot go on the ski slope.Even if you do a ski lesson, you cannot ski afterwards and if you think you are good enough and go on the slope security will kick you off it and won't refund your money. Would have been good if there was a beginner slope to have a ski on for the rest of the day after the lesson. All up a great place, well worth a visit. Ski equipment and clothing is all included in the price.

Excellent Place. Excellent place to visit ....No one can imagine the snow in the desert...its just amazing to have there....very good place and i must say that every child rather the adult also should visit the place.

Its a big freezer in the middle of the desert. Amazing as it is... lets face it, our tour guide was right... it is the biggest freezer in the world. And a pretty nice one too.We had only 2 hours to stay here with our programed tour and this was not enough time to ski for beginners. Getting into the equipment would have taken 45 mins so we decided just to enjoy the snow park.The facility provides you with an adequately warm jacket, trousers and shoes that you have to wear, and they also provide socks and gloves that are not warm enough for the -2 to -4 dec celius inside. Its a good thing my wife and brought warmer gloves and socks.Overall something that you have to visit at least once in Dubai.

skiing in desert !!. It's the Coolest Thing in Dubai and Yes it's in the middle of the desert! Located at the Kempinski hotel, in the Emirates Mall, they have Ski Dubai. Don't worry if you didn't bring your gear -- You can rent everything there! There are 5 different runs for varied levels of skiers and snowboarders. There are also two cafes with great views of the slopes if you just want to watch. It's a cool place to go!!!

not too good. just chilling in there. we upgraded to the super pass to get 2 additional rides. But the rides are really sad and lame. Doesnt live up to the expectations and price paid to visit the attraction. But good for people who like to ski or snow board.

Kids had a blast. Get the ski dubai experience. Trust me it is more worthwhile although the most expensive at 500aed. Why? U get the 2hrs on the ski slopes. Even if u dont ski, u still get waterproof thinsulate goves which aint cheap. N u get a free set lunch at the restaurant outside. Just these two freebies makes it more worth it than the superpass which was 375aed. Do the penguin experience. Its really great. U get to touch, hug a kiss the penguin! Lovely pics that u could buy. We ended up buying the soft copies which came an a usb stick penguin shaped off course at 300aed. Expensive but for an entire day's worth of fun for the kiddies. Not bad!

Skiing in the shopping Mall. This is a great experience if you can ski and want a couple of hours on the slopes. The outdoor temperature was 32c and to go to freezing is very strange. All your equipment is provided apart from gloves which you have to take. I would also suggest taking a hat as it is very cold. There are 2 slopes which give you enough of run back to the chair lift or the drag lift, which is a lot quicker. The session last for 2 hours and this is plenty. When we arrived on a Friday at 11am it seemed very busy in the area to get equipment however the actual ski slope was quiet and most people were doing the activities for non skiers. Would definitely have a go for a fun few hours.

must visit!!. paradise in the middle of the desert. must see attractions in dubai. located in mall of emirates (one of the best malls in dubai). good place to start learning to ski and also to have fun in the snow park with kids and family.

A cool way to spend a few hours in the desert!. This place is great for families even if you don't want to ski! Plenty still to do and a great way to cool off from the scorching temps outside! Entry is quite costly but there is no time limit as to how long you can stay for. Cafes on the outside as well as inside also provide a good break from the slopes! Staff are helpful and friendly!
You have to see this!. The ski slope in the Mall of the Emirates is awesome, protruding high into the sky! Well worth a visit.

A surreal experience. Make sure you wrap up warm. The upgrade to the gloves is a must as your hands will freeze with the free gloves. Get a hat on as well. We went for the skiing lessons where the instructor was brilliant, patient and knowledgeable. A good experience
Small ski slope but fun. The ski slope is small and there are really only 2 trails. With that said the price for skiing and rentals is not bad. And it is the only time I have been skiing inside!
Great fun. Crazy thinking about snow adventures in the middle of the desert. Everything supplied and no preparations needed. Lots of fun; especially for the kids.

Not as Big as it looks in Photos. Wow, Skying in Dubai, this is a proper sky slop, with proper ice, you need to wrap up here or you will freeze. Unfortunately, Its overpriced and because the floor space is not large it can get quite crowded which limits your enjoyment. I found that I had to look out for my children all the time as the were just too many people, and for the price it just is not worth it. It was more fun, to just sit and watch.
Ice on flow. Wow you will love to see this place.cant miss with family. World class standees. Don't miss this place.you can watch this place

Exceeded expectations, must do!. I didn't have high expectattions coming from an area in the world that has natual ski slopes. However, I was very impressed by the layout of the runs and the facility as a whole. The snow was well groomed and harldy any waits for the quad lifts or the single lift.

Fun-filled and Different Experience !!!. Ski Dubai - a huge snow area created in the desert which gives you chance to enjoy some time in snow for travellers who do not see snow regularly and skiing for those who are always in the snow.The trip needs to be planned a bit to avoid the additional cost and get maximum fun. Firstly do not go for any extra options if you are not from cold regions. Stick to general options and that too are enough.Full costume is provided except gloves and hat. So make sure you carry good woolen gloves and hat that covers head and ears. That will save your money. Make sure you go to the washroom before wearing the dress as it takes atleast 2-3 hrs till you remove the dress.There are slides, ballon rides, rope climbing for small children to adults. Just go for it without fear and it is fun. However elder people should avoid.The chair car is a must ride as it gives the entire view of the area and also see the experienced skiers go zip zap below you.Learn to ski depends if you have time.A totally different experience in the desert which we do not get very frequently and it gets fun-filled if you really get the courahe together to go thru the few slides.

Very Cool!. Well, I thought the idea of skiing in the desert was cool anyways... Located at the Mall of the Eremites gives you the opportunity to shop and have fun at the same time! Be warned!!! that if you are an inexperienced skier or snowboarder you could potentially be removed from the slope this did happen to some friends of ours. My friends and I had a great time, the hours flew by and it was not too busy when we went. The have a single lift with two stops. The package was about $80 US. And it includes everything you could need except gloves which you can purchase at the local shop and where not too expensive. The staff was very curious and helpful, you are provided lockers where you can store your personal belongings. Although I visited with adult friends I got to see many children enjoying the slope and the classes. I think it's perfect for families with children and couples looking for something to do together. Afterwards you can hit up one of the many restaurants at the mall and culminate a fun day out with perhaps a movie. My friends and I loved it and recommend visiting!

Slightly absurd thing to do in the desert. This really is extraordinary. It is attached to a shopping mall & it really is a snow dome. Great slopes - our boys skied for 3 hours. We watched from a mid slope mountain café! All the kit is provided, although I would recommend taking a hat if you are 'watching' - it is very cold in there. A really fun morning. For little children, the mini play area looked fantastic - sadly we were all too big for that. Would recommend for all ages.

Excellent snow park. Being a tourist in dubai you cant miss to see skidubai. its a one of the largest indoor snowpark in the world. similer snow park we had seen in singapore but this is better. A must visit specially for Tinagers.

Fun but unorganized . I took a break during a recent trip to Dubai. I'm an intermediate skier but don't expect the slope to challenge you. However its a unique experience to do indoor asking. I did a two hour experience. However or probably took me one hour to get through an unorganized line and movement from place to place. Once inside skiing it was not too crowded. The wait for chairlift was short though the lift was very slow. A good quick experience but be patient.
Ski in the desert. If you are a skier you won't be impressed but you will admit that it is fabulous to find a place 4º below zero in the middle of the desert where temperature can go beyond 50º
Excellent day out. Had a great time, my daughters enjoyed every moment, beware gets very very cold in there ' gloves, boots, jackets are provided

Even if You Don't Ski. I went to Ski Dubai with a friend and it was a great experience. She enjoyed the slopes and I enjoyed taking in the sights from the ski life. There is a bit more to do than ski.
Switzerland in Dubai :-). Absolutely superb experience, should visit if you are ona trip to Dubai especially during summer.U gonna enjoy

You really should not be going to Dubai to Ski. It's passable skiing if you have never seen snow before. The place is crowded, the slopes atrocious, the experience barely passable. Half way through, stop and ask yourself, why am I trying to ski in the desert? At least go to the sand dunes. Jesus christ.

Good for experience. It is located within Mall Of Emirates at Dubai.On-line ticket booking is preferred as it is more economical and saves time. They provide you with wrist bands and provide you with full costume from snow worthy shoes, socks,waterproof pant and jacket and hand gloves for protection against (-4 degree C ) inside.(Out of these, socks and hand gloves are not to be returned back to them ) Chair Lift ride is a must, as otherwise one would not get an idea, how big the ski Dubai.Area, away from the entrance side, are steep slopes of snow, meant for expert snow ski purpose only and not approachable otherwise.Preparation Time before entry, i.e. stand in various q s for shoes, jackets, socks, gloves.. and putting them on is one hour.Time you can spend inside, for 2-3 rides, is for one hour, during which you will start freezing at this low temperature and would like to come out.
Ice in Desert!. Well yes, can one imagine skiing in dubai.. yes its possible and too it being inside a mall!! great fun!!

Visit if you can't live without snow for even a day. Super overrated and super expensive - the gloves they give are a joke. Add AED 25 to the already expensive entry ticket. Then add few more for this and for that. The entry only gets you to feel the snow in your hand and doesn't even entitle you to throw it!

Fun but very expensive. The place offers good experience with .. good rides within it.. however not that great or exclusive... Penguins were good and it was worth the experience.. However, its very expensive.. it better that they reduce the price to attract more crowd..

Cool cool. No need for day pass. Take the entry pass.Expect queue for tickets. Or add 3 activities. Do carry woolen cap or cover your head & Gloves. Experience hot chocolate.... 2/3. Hours were enough. Don't forget to buy Souvenir's

Astonishing !. To think you could have skiing and snow in the desert. Well this is Dubai we are talking about. Though we ended up taking a penguin session instead of skiing, which btw is the only place you can do such a thing. It was extremely expensive but worth the experience in the end. They provide everything from jackets, pants, socks, shoes to gloves, the only thing you need is a wollen hat which is advisable to purchased from some shop in the mall itself. Also, check availability before landing up there for both the penguins as well as the skiing sessions.

SHUT this dirty tired place down quickly. We went here on our first day to Dubai, was not cheap but not much is these days in Dubai, however i dont think they have done any maintance on the attraction since the day it was built. Its dirty, tired and starting to get very unsafe with broken safety equipemnt and tired hire equipment. DON'T GO until they sort these major issues out.

Fun fun fun. Definitely worth a visit. A bit of a con - you need to purchase gloves and the cheapest are £10 (that have some thinsulate in). Next con ski passes have extra 20 dirham deposit. That said going up the poma was great. The slope was virtually empty, so intermediate and expert skier's could do as they wished. The 400m slope might be too much for beginners and improvers so stop off half way (only via chair lift) and go down the slightly easier gradient.We both left with smiles on our faces and would do it again.

Well worth a visit!!. This was a great experience, it cost us 378 dirhams (£68) for a 2 hour session. You get all your clothing apart from gloves which you have to buy separately, boots and board/skies for that price. Outside where you get all your kit from is pretty chaotic but once your inside on the slope it wasn't busy at all. We did realise that there are other activities within the ski centre, it is an experience and once you've skied here you realise Hemel and Milton Keynes have nothing on this place. Really enjoyable and 2 hours is more than enough. Half way up there is a cafe where you can get a warm drink then carry on. There is various pipes and jumps down the slope if that's what your into as well. Something for everyone in the place, well worth a visit!

Switzerland in Dubai. It must become one of the latest wonders of the world. Imagine -5 degrees inside and 40 degrees outside. certainly an engineering marvel. We took a package of 250 Dirhams per head. Jackets, lowers, boots are provided. Gloves were complementary for us but needed a cap. Good ice sculptures, slides, trolleys ride, skiing and some more activities. Some were covered in the package. Icing on the cake was penguin show

average. u need to carry your own hand gloves & cap.
as they just provide shoes & uniform.
very expensive gloves.
overall supportive staff.
if your booking through agent understand about entire ski as there are different levels

Totally Bizarre Experience. Had a great time skiing in Dubai. This was certainly a bizarre experience. The chair was very slow, but there was a faster Poma to the side if you didn't want to be too relaxed. Would recommend as an activity on a too hot day in Dubai.

Amazing excursion!! . Me and my wife visited ski dubai for the 1st time in our life. It was a great experience for us to witness this place. Approximately it took us nearly 2 hours to complete our excursion.Jacket, bottom boots and gloves included for the premium you pay. We paid AED 250 at the entrance which is inclusive of 4 rides.For me personally the rides were not recommended if you are expecting absolute thrill. If you are in dubai and if u haven't experience snow in your life this place is a must visit.

$50 for 2 hrs with all the rentals included, why would you not try this!?!. If you have a little time to spare in Dubai and are a little adventurous. Head to ski Dubai. I was shocked at how cheap it was. 2 hrs is about the right amount of time to spend on a single slope. Positives, you can check off skiing in the middle east! Fun and relatively inexpensive. Don't have to worry about anything, pants, jacket, skis boots and poles all included. Snow quality is surprisingly great! With a constant -8 C the snow never ices up! Fun amount of things to look at.Live penguins under where you get on the poma lift. (there is a poma and a chair lift)Negatives, just like every ski area in the world there are the ski brats. The young local skiers that are there day in and day out. They feel they rule the place and try and cut in line all the time. If you are aggressive with them they back down. It gets cold! Better if you bring some clothing with you. I would highly recommend doing this! It is a lot of fun.Bring with you from home. A few warmer layers of clothing. A hat and gloves!!!! (if not you will want to buy one, not included in the rentals)Your own coat, but this is really not necessary as they will provide you one. A camera, you have to take a selfie on the slopes!

Amazing experience. You will not want to miss this especially if you come from a country where you never see snow. I went with my husband and two daughter 3&5, and we all had so much fun.. We paid for the penguin encounter but it turned out that u can see the penguins (but not play with them) without having to pay an extra fee at specified times
Amazing. 40 Outside, -5 Inside. What a shock one Gets when he/she enters. Lots to do as well. Clothing is provided. Hats and Gloves are chargeable. We took the Super Pass so the gloves were free

Can be seen from the mall. If you're just looking see the crazy phenomena 'indoor ski hall in desert' you get a good view from the mall through big glass windows. No need to pay or go in to still get a sense of the atmosphere!

Disappointing. Visited 2 years ago and purchased a return ski lift pass with all gear included for a very reasonable price. Visited again last month to find you can now only purchase a 2 hour (or all day) pass which includes all gear BUT GLOVES. So you now have to buy ski gloves in order to snowboard or ski, something we would never use again. Extremely disappointing. Who wants to purchase ski gloves for the family when you are travelling and live in the tropics? Not fair ski Dubai, at least have them available for rent

Ultimate Snow / Skying experience in Middle East. Great place to be, specially Skying lovers and people who has no experience in Snow.. Kids will enjoy the atmosphere and number of thing's in place that all can enjoy. One to one and hours is sufficient to spend if not it might too difficult for any visitor since it is very COLD!

Would never thought i'd be frozen in Dubai.. What a truly exciting place to go. We heard about Ski Dubai but didn't really do any research before going, however when we went there I couldn't resist. We spoke to a very helpful lady at the entrance which took us through all the packages and we decided to do the power pack which was unlimited access to the winter park and unlimited rides such as zoorbing, tobogganing and other attractions. The power pack also included a introductory 1 hour ski lesson which I very much enjoyed and if we had time I would of done some more lessons. I shall be returning back to Ski Dubai when we return to the UAE.
Value for money in desert heat. This is not recomended if you have already visited europe or America , As this seems same.The price is very good so may try once .

Family fun!. Located in The Mall of the Emirates, Ski Dubai does have to be seen to be believed! We booked a ski lesson for our four year old, and an hours skiing for my husband. We turned up an hour before the session was booked for, and it was a good job we did! It was chaos!! I think staff just assume everyone has been before, and by the looks of things, there are lots of regulars. But if it is your first time then it is very unclear and confusing where you are meant to go and when. Despite being sat waiting in the correct area, my son missed being taken out by his instructor because he didn't have a bib, which we had not been told we needed! Some staff were really helpful, too many not helpful at all. By the time my husband and son got out on the slopes I was really annoyed. Luckily, a spiked hot chocolate at Apres bar, overlooking the slopes solved that! My son, whose first experience of skiing it was, loved it! His small group lesson for an hour was perfect. And my husband enjoyed skiing again for the first time in years. If it wasn't for the lack of organisation, and some very rude staff I would have given it 5stars!
Good experience. We only had chance for a couple of hours but I really enjoyed it.We where lucky as we had a deal as it is expensive
Great experience. It was a great experience. I & my son enjoyed it very much, Chairlift ride was very good. We saw live sking by people on snow. My son enjoyed Giant Ball & other activites very much.

Nice for break from heat. Nice experience, even better than we've expected. Despite relatively small area and short piste it was nice 2-hour experience. Kids enjoyed it and also I must admit that I enjoyed it as well, despite I prefer large ski resorts at high altitude. For quite reasonable price you get all equipment, I'd recommend gloves (not part of the standard equipment), despite I didn't need them.

This is Fun!. its not overly expensive considering all the equipment is included. This is a venue for all ages. They have bunny slopes for learing too as well as areas for just fun slides. For the mid or experienced skier, this has some fun challenge too with small moguls, some turns and steep drops here and there. The temps are between 30 and 35 farenheit, depending where you are.( upper is colder ). Personally, I like not having to wear goggles. Your obstacles are the novices further down the hill but that's the same at regular ski resorts too. its a great diversion from the heat outside.
Dated and odd. For anyone who hasn't experienced snow I recommend this but for everyone else there is no idea whatsoever to spend time to check it out.

Another piece of Dubai non-sense. Why would you go for skiing when you come to Dubai? It is just another of those things where someone in Dubai had idea to be unique in the world. Imagine yourself being inside at -20 C and than going out on +50C, perfect recipe to get sick.
interesting experience. well, an extraordinary facility in an extraordinary country. nice personnel, reasonably ok equipment, recommended for kids...

Desert Skiing. As a long time serious skier, its not worth bothering with. its frozen slush and the chair lift is the slowest in the world. If you've got little kids, then visit the penguins that's cool. I suppose when it was conceived it was all about bravado and Dubai was showing the world it could do anything. Unfortunately a couple of years later along came the global warming issue. So we all look at mindless consumption of energy in a rather different vein. No Dubai would not have built it today, they are not that irresponsible and take a serious view on green issues. perhaps one day, when no one is looking they will quietly remove it, as it is surely a minor embarrassment now. the local can most surely afford to get to the alps if they want to ski. Don't come to Dubai to go skiing, go to France or wherever
Must do in Dubai. It is a fantastic experience to visit the snow garden with your family however attending a training session on the slope is a much more fun . try it once !!!!!

Super Cool Place in the Desert. If you've never had the chance to experience snow or REALLY cold temperatures, this is the place to be! They offer a variety of activities from sliding down a kiddy snow slide to ski and snowboard lessons. This place can be a bit pricey, but for the experience, we found it's worth it. AND THEY HAVE PENGUINS!!!TIP: Wear pants and a long-sleeve shirt or sweater. Although winter jackets, snow pants and boots are provided, it's still very cold in there! If you have them handy, also bring gloves and a hat...otherwise you can buy them onsite (for a price).

A very Great experience of Snow in the Desert. It is a must visit destination for everyone. We spent almost 3 hours there and we all enjoyed the experience. It is really amazing experience not to be missed if possible.

Good experience. Larger and longer skiing than we expected. Good quality snow.Kept us (adult and 2 kids) occupied for easily 2 hours (so takes about 3 hours once you include queueing for skis, boots, getting changed etc)It is cold inside so bring warm clothes and good gloves (ski suit provided is not that thick).Quiet in October - did not have to queue much on slopes.
awesome. Feels like real snow in Canada....they did a great job of layout and temp along with providing proper clothing at no extra charge!

Ski Dubai - the snow park. WOW.. A snow park in desert !!It was wonderful.It had activities like skiing / rope way / balloon ride and so on. The snow park is spread across great length / breadth and height. They do provide clean and decent woolen wear to enjoy the park.The staff was quite supportive. Great place for photography.Enjoyed the -4 degree temperature.DO NOT MISS THIS ATTRACTION although expensive
Dubai fun . Good. Very expensive. But worth going. Within the mall itself. It is indeed good. Snow in Desert. Very nice

Business/Pleasure. It is picturesque... A postcard image but not quite like the real thing. A good family outing especially when you have kids and Europe is an expensive destination. Ski Dubai offers you winter all the year round!

Must try at least once. I took a beginner's ski lesson here in April 2014. The instructor taught a small group of us girls and it was a lot of fun. The equipment is provided for in the fee you pay which is a bit pricey, about $200 for a beginner's ski lesson, but a must try if you can afford it.

Children could not enjoy. It is a cool place but unless you're Canadian or european it is hard for the children to acclimate in a short period of time. For me it's cooler to look at from the outside. As others have said, the coats are too thin and it is quite crowded on the ground. If you are resident they have a seasonal pass.

Fabulous.....................!!!!!!. Ski Dubai is a great fun for both adult and children........it is a little bit costly..still the cost worth it.there are so many rides...and the degree is almost -5....something like that. they will provide everything. who loves winter??? they will love it!!!!i recommend u to visit ski Dubai at once.....

Awesome experience!. For a person who's never been to a cold place this really is an awesome experience. Before entering You get to put on some warm clothes provided by the management but that's not enough to stop ur fingertips to feel numb. It's really amazing the way they've made this place. It's really fun for young and old. I couldn't last in it for more than an hour. Another must visit attraction in Dubai.
Don't miss out on skiing in the desert. . Had a blast, it's amazing that they have created an environment that makes real snow. Don't leave Dubai without hitting the slopes.

No adequate clothing provided for the temperature inside. Went there with our kids this weekend. Naturally, one could expect an indoor ski park to be on the chilly side. The problem though is that the jackets that are provided are very thin and do not insulate well. One would never go skiing like this in the mountains. We could therefore not stay for more than an hour, despite having booked several activities, including skiing lessons. It was also super crowded in the play area at the bottom of the small hill. Skiing is nice I guess, but it is not advisable with small children, unless you are well prepared with winter clothing and do not just go in during a trip to the mall.
Desert snow skying. That is the attraction in the mall of the emirates. You cam also pet a penguin (for a fee of course). What rocks your boat.

Best Experience Ever .... One of the most memorable experience of our Dubai trip . one really feels that he is in some colder part of the world temp is-4 deg cel and they give you overalls to protect you from cold . rides are very good .Best is the hot chocolate that u have once you have reached at the top ..awesome ...

Crowded Indoor Ski "resort". This ski area is located in one of the worlds' biggest malls called the Mall of the Emirates. It features several slopes of various degrees of difficulty. It naturally gets very crowded in there as Dubai has 1000's of tourist flocking to this city. Restaurants line ski Dubai - so a large crowd of people watches the skiers as they enjoy themselves on the slopes. Really a unique experience.
Ski in the Desert. Yes. You can do it. But be sure you know what you are doing, otherwise there will be (bad) consequences. Outstanding infrastructure.

Surreal experience. My friend who lives in Dubai suggested I stop by and look through the windows at the ski slope. Coming from Minnesota, I had to go in and see it in person. I paid for the 'snow' experience which is riding the chair lift, penguin show, tubing, snowballing, etc. everything but skiing. It's totally surreal knowing that it's hot and humid outside (95 F) but freezing inside. Great fun to people watch kids and parents playing in the snow especially those who probably didn't grow up with cold weather. They were having a blast.

Blast of winter. Usually good for an early Friday morning head-clear with not too many others out. Today a big pick up of smaller kids' classes with the "expert" slope essentially closed to other users which was disappointing. Whilst the dome is a novel attraction, but not cheap, the quality of kit is going through the floor. Skis are old and my body's seen more wax(which it hasn't, by the way) than the bases of the rental skis and the knives in my rental apartment have more edge. Bring your own rub on wax if you don't want to her to a halt on the "powder". Can live with the skis, but the boots! Had to come down 2 full sizes to get any wrap around sensation, as all boots have the insoles removed and a delightfully damp feel inside - someone else's feet or just the cleaning?! Time for some new gear guys or how about a premium rental element? Feels too much like cost cutting and a rigorous fleecing. If you can, at least bring your own boots.

Nice Experience. For someone living in Asia snow is always exciting and to see it setup inside a mall was awesome....We were lucky to see the penguins around plus the place was not so crowded. Costed us about 250AED. Worth while experience.

A must-do experience!. This was just mind blowing.. snowboarding in the desert, who'd have imagined it?For 500 AED you get to experience everything Ski Dubai has to offer including kissing and cuddling penguins, hitting the slope, all gear and clothes hire and even lunch!There is only one run for snowboarding/skiing so if you're going purely as an avid snowsports person then you'll be wasting your time.However, if you're looking to discover something pretty cool with your family or friends, then you definitely need to visit.Chairlift, Ski Run, Zorb Balls, Zipline, Toboggans, Bobsledding, Penguin Cuddles and more. Definitely great value for money and a once-in-a-lifetime experience. I recommend you go early in the day as it gets busier later on.We arrived at 9.30am, which gave us enough time to get our gear and be the first people on the snow when it opened at 10am.We literally had the place to ourselves until around 10.30am. By midday it was noticeably busier but not packed. (This was on a Thursday so I don't know how weekends would be).The penguins were amazing to touch and cuddle but if you want photos of the experience then it gets more expensive as you can't take your own camera or phone in and it's an extra 110AED per photo that you buy.
Fun Tour. Ski Dubai was a wonderful experience .Lots of activities was their like chair lift , slides , penguin show etc.Its like a small snow town. Experience was amazing.

Brilliant. 33 degrees outside and minus 4 inside! I am an intermediate skier and so it was really just a bit of fun and a great 2 hours of exercise. I went on a weekday in the morning and almost had the slope to myself. You can easily hire everything except gloves (which you will need!) but if you don't have any you can buy a cheap pair there. Everything runs smoothly and efficiently and if you don't ski or snowboard there is toboggan run and a speedwire experience. Great for kids too.

SHEILA IS THE STAR OF THE SHOW !!!. I visited Ski Dubai last week with my son am Thursday morning . Hassle free entry with good quality equipment , empty slopes and fresh powder.We are both very experienced skiers but regretably within less than two minutes I had the re - occurence of knee problem and had to leave the slope. Sheila gave me full refund and son had best two hours of our holiday - thanks again!

Excellent fun for everyone. I absolutely loved this place - like so many of the tourist attractions in the UAE, it is clean, tidy, well organised and well presented. The skiing is brilliant and the venue is very attractive and well set out.

Novel...but not Necessary. Full disclosure: this was on my "to-do" list for Dubai - I just wanted to be able to say that I went snow skiing in the Middle East inside a mall. From that aspect, this experience was fine. It cost roughly $70 for 2 hours of skiing - but since there were only two slopes, which took roughly 20 seconds each (max), we only did 6-7 runs and called it quits.If you've never seen snow, or you want to "check the box" like me, go for it. If you're actually looking for a good ski experience and you're short on time, I'd say skip it.If you do go, I'd recommend bringing gloves (or buying the cheap ones they have for sale); our fingers got a bit numb from the cold!

Unlikely place in the middle of a mall in the middles of Dubai. We never used it, but my daughter and family did. We could watch easily it is so unusual the setting in which it is set, but go even if you just watch like us.

Ski Dubai. Ski Dubai - No such experience elsewhere in a desert. A must do. Cost is about ADH 200 per person. You cannot stay there beyond 2 hours as it is extremely cold. They provide suite and sox, glows.

Snow park. We in a group enjoyed like anything. Rides were good and maintained by well trained and cooperative staff. Only thing is that they don't provide hand gloves, so please carry or you end up paying more

23rd to 29th Oct. Very much enjoyable for those who have not experienced natural ice like Himalayas and stuff like that..its a redo of the Himalayas..few of the ice sports are really enjoyable for all age groups.. worth spending time .. but not entire day as it gets too cold after some time and feel like running away from it..
Super cool experience. It was a fun filled day for us.. This is such a superbbb place and a must visit place for people who come to Dubai.

amazing, fun, worth it!. never done skiing in my life, but after purchasing the Beginners Lesson provided at Ski Dubai, i became a pro. The lesson include kit to wear, equipment and gloves. There are other fun games including the chairlift ride. Try it as you will enjoy it!

Good fun in the heat of Dubai. Ski Dubai is an indoor snow / ski park located within the Mall of the Emirates. You can reach here by a taxi and even by public transportation.There are various packages available clubbing different rides / attractions within the Ski Park. The most popular ones are the ones including Ski / Ski lessons.There is a snow park where you can spend 1-2 hours with Luge, Zorb Ball and lot of other fun activites which even children can indulge in. The Ski lessons range from very basic to advance and the instructors are quite good. You get to ski from small slopes at the end of basic lesson.
Worth it. Since it is summer in Dubai, we totally enjoyed the cold of Dubai ski. You get the worth you paid......
Must do. Amazing and very well priced, my son was booked for a group lesson but he was the only one there so was able to enjoy a private lesson.

Playing wiht the Penguins - OVERRATED and EXPENSIVE. We went to play with the penguins and it was over rated, not allowed to take your own cameras, and the "professional" photographers were not professional at all and it was waste of money. You have literally 30 seconds with each penguins and I wish it was fun as I expected. I understand the penguins are beautiful and moody and can't be touched or played with but honestly I don't recommend it!! oh and by the end if you decide to purchase the terrible pics they cost 80$USD!! more expensive than the actual experience.
Nice experience . It's a very good place to have fun with your family.I really love the Penguins.they are so cute.such a nice idea to bring them here for people...!
Fun times . Don't be fooled just because it's in a mall it's small and a waste of time it's not. Had a great time loads of fun and cost about £130 for 2 hours for the 2 of us.
Great way to escape summer!. Loved the whole thing about Ski Dubai, the only downside; they don't have enough signage inside the park; you don't know where to go next/how to go there.

Expensive but worth it. Where else can you sit among penguins and pet them (under the watchful eye of a trainer)?? Penguins on TV will never lookthe same again. But beware the creeping expense - the initial ticket then the locker for your wallet then a stocking cap which is not provided and of course the professionalphoto because you can't use your own phone. Still - we would do it again.

Surreal experience in the heat of Dubai!. What a very strange but fun day we had at ski Dubai!Walking from nearly 100 degree heat to almost minus 5 is odd!Great fun though, we didn't get to ski, but the toboggan rides and rubber ring rides were good fun.The ski ride gave you good views of all the skiers.The clothes provided kept us warm, and you get a free pair of clothes to keep.A great day out.
Amazing. Not bad for the price. Best option is the hour lesson. Many options are available and kids will love the snow
Absolute must. Who can imagine that people can build a ski in the middle of the desert? An absolute must visit for all.

Penguin experience.. What an evening. It lasts just half an hour but well worth a visit. Included in the cost are your gloves, boots, either ski suit or trousers and jacket. You get to meet a Gentoo penguin and to get up close and personal with a king penguin.

Simple slope, fun ride. It's one of those things you should have done if you've been in Dubai. We had a two hour skipass (includes equipment and clothes except gloves & hat) and went skiing on our own. Can get crowded and two hours is enough.

SKI DUBAI. If you wanna experience snow in the hot desert then yes this is the place... Again i recommend that you buy your tickets in advance if you are planning to day in weekend.. and the full day pass is really good.
Underwhelming. It's a great option to have in Dubai for children and ski enthusiasts. But the entire indoor arrangement is claustrophobic.
Ice in the Desert. Indeed a fun place to visit, especially when you want to get a feel of snow/ glacier etc that too in the middle of a desert city.
ice land in middle of dubai. nothing but ice here.you will feel transported to the land of Iceland..everything including feeding penguins possible here

Cool spot in a hot place. Ski Dubai is a fun adventure to visit in Dubai. A novelty to be able to ski or play in the snow in the Middle East. The snow park and penguin adventure are great for kids or anyone who hasn't seen snow. If you are expecting double black runs this isn't the place to go.

Fantastic place in the middle of a shopping mall. Wow what a surreal experience but quite expensive but remember you probably will never get the chance again so go ahead and enjoy it and the kids will certainly love it beyond belief.
Do not forget to see the penguin show

Great to ski in the most unusual place. Not cheap but everything bar gloves included. We took a 2 hour slot which was more than enough. 2 main slopes neither were black. Easy red comes to mind. Well staffed- all helpful.

Out of this world. The strange feeling when your shopping in a mall and come across a ski slope and penguins. This made my day to think it's so hot out side and there is this just inside.
It is well worth the money.
Penguins! . We visited the penguins at ski dubai and it was incredible! The whole thing was so well organised and interesting! The trainers were very good!
dont ski. Dont ski plus live where plenty of snow but something I needed to see . Shiing in a mall yet plus it was 32 degrees celcius out.

Highlight of our 3-day Dubai visit. I can't really describe the place in words. It is something you have to experience yourself. It is an indoor ski resort in the middle of the desert and when you see it in Dubai, expect nothing but excellence.It is very well organized with lots of packages for skiiers and the snow novice like us. With the power pass you get free gloves from the gift shop. Make sure you bring your ice cap or buy it from centre point on the other side of the mall since it is very expensive in the gift shop.The resort provides everything else.Snow bullet is a nice experience to try.This is one must try activity in Dubai.

Cheapest ski of your life. Full skiing experience inside the Mall of the Emirates. Get there at 9.45am and ski until 2pm. It all gets a bit busy after 12.30pm. DO NOT lay in and expect a hassle free day. In the morning you get the slopes to yourself and it costs £50 for two if you have the Entertainer voucher. Wow.
Fun day. Awesome experience. Amazing feeling. Ice in the desert. Took a lesson there was tough but fun. Lots of fun

Ski Dubai. Even though it's the longest indoor ski park in the world, if you!re a proficient skier, it can be a bit boring going up and down the same slope. Ticket prices do include clothes and equipment hire, however not a pretty site seeing everyone wearing the same outfits.

Feeling like we're in a Switzerland Ski Station. I've been there recently, and it's awesome how you go from 30ºC outside to -2°C inside the ski station. I skied there and it's awesome, people are nice, and the strict rules in place are good to prevent any injury or danger to anyone. To absolutely do if you're in Dubai!

Ski for my four year old . My child and I loved this, the staff took my four year old for an hour. They were on time, took good care of him and he came out so happy. After that we did the penguin experience which was amazing! Penguins are the cutest.. What can I say

Ski day. The ski resort in Dubai is a excellent place to top up your sking while on holiday in the sun . Prices are far and it's we'll organised . It's the longest indoor ski run in the world with a cafe halfway down if refreshments are needed . A great way to pass 2 hours and cool down would defiantly recommend it . Lessons are given if you required also great for kids
Good for somebody who never seen snow !. Unique attraction which is good to see , but if you can skiing and you skied before this slope will be for you boring .

Unfortunately I had a bad experience . I was dreaming about that day and it happened, 4th October I went to ride snowboard and I had an accident and surgery in the hospital later on, I fall down on the small but sharp slope when I was going out from the chairlift ,which can be dangerous for the snowboarders and for everybody !!!because platform which u reach on the top it goes smooth and flat like 3 miters and then that small but sharp slope !!!there was no one to assist , to help in case you will need it, like in the beginning there was staff , in the middle of mountain there was staff at least 2 person , just in the top one lady whom I called later on, but she was watching ppl who is coming from down to up but not for those one who is behind !!!whatever will happens she will not see it because it's in her back side !!!Be careful on the top of mountain!!! P.S. TOP management you have to make that slope smooth and flat even its not that big but it can be difficult for snowboarders who get used to fix only one leg with the board and you need at least one more staff on the top of the mountain!!

Fun, fun, FUN. No trip to Dubai is complete until you have gone skiing in the desert. My visit here was a surprise gift and I am so thrilled that I can say that I have experienced it. I've had very limited snowboarding experience but this did not matter at all, I was allowed into the beginners area to find my feet and then was let loose on the main runs. No matter your experience level, the staff here will make sure that you're looked after and you have a great time. Will definitely come again next time we are in Dubai.

Very good indoor iceland. Very good place to visit with the little one, amazing contracted, all the place is made for ice, ice skating, penguins, everything is there , you will feel like you are in hill station where all over the ice

What s a crazy place to See. We cant not imagine..... Do you ever do skying in a shopping Mall? Mall of the. émirats .....yes ...At Dubai verything is possible. Near 100 degrés outside and you do skiing inside...and very Cold too. You can rent everything you need, the skis, the boots, the Wintertcoat,,,etc...etc..all électric équipement is include. Be careful no havé Cold...

Very good experience. -2 degree Centigrade in Desert? fabulous experience.. you can see penguin here and there are good rides which are worth. Also, there is a rope way which covers the entire snow park in 10 min. Great place if some one know skiing.
Not good. Not impressive, not many rides for the price family of 4 £250.00 not worth it at all. Waited too long for the Penguins experience too. I wouldn't recommend this

Super duper experience. It was my first experience to Ski Dubai yesterday. I was very much excited. I got the super pass for AED 250 which had the entry to the snow park along with Giant ball ride, Chairlift ride and other rides. Ski Dubai has amazing rides and cafes inside the snow park. They also do have cute little penguins marching once in 2 hours for the penguin encounter show. The temperature in there is -2 degree. As they dont give any helmet or scarves to adults, i would suggest carrying mufflers or caps to cover the ears. Over all it was a nice experience .

A skiing season all year round . A nice place with lots of activities to enjoy with the family Try to avoid going on Sunday because of long queues and lots of people They do have skiing classes and sessionsAlso free skiing for beginners and advanced levels

Very nice experience. Very nice experience. Can get crowded. Limited slope skiing space. Although it's an amazing experience to ski in the middle of the desert, nothing beats the experience of the skiing on real mountain slopes.
Family day out. Great place to be with your kids and family. We had visitors from India and we took them to Ski Dubai. We all had a great time.especially the kids loved the penguin show

How strange wearing ski clothes in Dubai!!. 4 kids and an adult had a great 2 hours at Ski Dubai. Quite expensive, costing £40 each. Our 8 year old had never been skiing before and although he didn't get a proper lesson he thoroughly enjoyed himself on the nursery slope. The teenagers who are competent skiers were also extremely happy with the slopes and couldn't believe how huge it was!

A different experience . After being in dubai and experiencing the hot and dry weather, ski dubai is a different experience all togethér. You get overall clothes, boots and gloves at the entrence, which would help u to keep warm in around minus 10 temperature inside. The different rides in it are good for all ages. My kids aged 11 and 6 both loved the place. If u know how to ski, it's even better. For a nominal upcharge u can experience skiing as well, if not u can get an an hour ski lesson for beginners at an affordable fee.Overall it's an amazing experience.It is advisable to keep warm clothes for young kids in addition to the clothes and accessories u get there as it gets really chilly inside. The more u r covered, the more you will enjoy inside.
Snow in desert. Must visit place, the ticket costing bit high but worth paying it. fun filled snow park with multiple activities but ensure you get enough time to explore that.
Snowboarding like on the alps. Impressive structure, 2 pistes for experts and intermediate snowboarders and skiers, the chair and push lifts make feel up in the mountains.

Dissappointing. Very Expensive entry with very little to do, we are not skiers but this place is advertised as having something for everyone skiers and non-skiers alike but this is not the case we did all the non-ski activities in less than a hour and then left because we were bored. It cost well over £100 and all the sea lions and meet the penguins are extra. Just to add to the disappointment I am sure its suppose to snow every 30 minutes we never saw a flake

Exciting. Wherever you come from this is a favourite with children, especially after they added the penguin show. Skiers love it as well. The place can get really packed on weekends and public holidays. Best time to go is early in the morning (10 am) on a week day.

A nice tourist attraction. Ski Dubai is in the Mall of Emirates. You can go by Metro or a cab .Its a nice place for kids to enjoy.. there are good rides inside although you cannot spend more than an hour or may be two .. because its -4 degrees:), but still its worth a visit ..my daughter thoroughly enjoyed
Snow in desert!!. Just loved the place and the best thing about the Ski Dubai,apart from other activities was the cute penguins.It was ofcourse a great experience.

Enjoyable couple of hours. We took our almost 4 year old into the Snow Park and she had a ball. Would definitely recommend taking extra jumpers and warm socks as it is truly cold inside!! I know that sounds like an obvious statement but we didn't have any warm clothes and it doesn't take long for the cold to seep through the jackets provided.

Ski School. My kids (ages 5 & 9) and I all took lessons at the same time, so I was able to see them experience skiing for time. The instructors were fantastic, friendly, and patient.
Getting the kids and myself outfitted for this adventure took almost an hour, so GIVE YOURSELF TIME AND SHOW UP EARLY!!

Penguins!. Penguins! There are Penguins here in Dubai!!! Why didn't anyone tell me??!!I do love a penguin, but who doesn't??Yes. You can book a visit with the penguins in Ski Dubai, a "meet and greet" if you will, where you can play with the penguins and even stroke the strange but adorable little fellows.You heard me, yep, you can stroke and play with the penguins. Are you booking it yet? You should be. Go book it now i'll wait for you.........Done? OK.So, you need to take something warm to wear as you will be going into their sub zero environment. They do provide a ski suit thingy, but it is still pretty chillers if you have your summer wear on underneath. I felt my bum numbing after just a minute sat on the freezing stone slabs, but I can pretty skinny, fatties may be ok. They also provide you with socks and shoes too.You have a guide that will tell you a little about the penguins first of all, then you will be handed over to the Penguin trainer (why is that not my job?) who will introduce a few of the penguins to you. They have Gentoo penguins and King penguins there. The Gentoo penguins are really playful and fun and hop around very comically. The king penguins are very proud looking chaps, who true to their name have a very regal aura. They are the second largest in the Penguin family behind the Emperor Penguins and are even more clumsy on their feet, providing us with some great comedy moments as well. As it was malting season though, they were a little bit standoffish, but still very friendly and lovable critters.I am a big animal lover and was wary that the penguins would not be happy in their enclosure or may not be kept very well, this was not the case. The trainers were very professional and obviously well trained themselves. The penguins were very calm and seemed very happy in their environment. They responded very well to the trainers and were not afraid of us visitors at all. I'm not very happy with animals being in captivity but I can see the benefits in some situations, however, they seemed very well looked after.So, you can throw toys for them which they loved to play with and then if you are lucky enough (depending on the size of the group, and if the penguins are not malting) you will then be able to stroke them and pose for some amazing photo's.There were only 3 in our group, so we had a very personal experience, but I think you can pay a bit more for that as well. Probably worth it!If you like a Penguin, you have to do this.Enjoy :)

Kids first taste of snow.....in the Desert?. I'd heard about this place before, but nothing prepares you for actually being there! My kids were so excited, they'd never seen show before, so was quite ironic we had to go the UAE to find it!!! This place is just amazing and so well run....and very BIG! The kids had a ball, will definitely stay longer next time and even boot up myself! I think to get best value for money you need to spend the whole day there, if not even buy a two day pass so that you can get to experience all attractions and rides. My kids were beginners but didn't want a ski lesson, and there was still plenty for them to do and play on. A great experience for everyone!
Ski in 35' C temp. This was really amazing to ski in Dubai having temperature of 35' C. We felt that we visited Switzerland ..... My son enjoyed a lot and played various game in ice.

Proof of how everything seems possible in Dubai. It would seem impossible to have snow or ice in a desert but Dubai proves it otherwise. Located in the Mall of Emirates, this attraction is good for all ages as there are activities for children and adults likewise.

Only in Dubai. I visited Ski Dubai with my grandson. It is hard to comprehend going from 40 degrees outside to minus degrees inside. We had great fun. The cool was a welcome relief from the heat. A great birthday party treat. As all things Dubai, everything is well done.

Snow in desert. Wow is the word that comes out when you visit this snow park. The cost is around 250 Aed per person for normal package which is sufficient. Temperature inside the snow park is -8°c which is very low and gives you that ultimate feeling of being inside a natural snow park. Remember its a snow park in the land of deserts. Games inside are very good and keeps you busy. Snow ball, tube fall and bench trolley will make your visit worth it. If you go for higher package you chose to Ski as well. Skiing from almost 5 floors high has a beautiful feeling. Due to immense cold a person can withstand this cold for Max 2 or 3 hours and that too without food. So it is recommended to eat first and then visit this snow park. Very beautiful and worth visiting.

Amazing experience. snow in the dessert, in the middle of the summer.. the best!!
Cute little penguins, would have loved more interaction though. Avalanche cafe needs a upgrade, but all in all.. love ski dubai.

St. Moritz in Dubai!. My husband and I along with our infant had a great time at Ski Dubai. However, I would recommend you take a day pass and plan on spending atleast 4-5 hours at this attraction as it is quite pricey!
Do try all the rides and come back home with some great memories and pictures!

Skiing in the Desert. A must do in Dubai - what an experience. Pomers that go around a corner as does the chair lift. Make sure you take gloves and a hat as it gets very cold in there. Good little runs and although one of them is classed as 'black' it is more of an intermediate run. Still a wonderful experience and I highly recommend

Kids had fun. A bit expensive and if you haven't snow boarded or skied before you are required to take a pricey lesson first. Smaller kids can run around in the snow which is really dirty ice for approximately $105
Great Experience. Yet to try snow skiing, by better half and I took on the Ski School. Instructors were great and certainly taught us the basics which were reflected later.

Interesting stuff in middle of desert. . Location : convenient location as located inside Mall of Emirates.Connectivity : easy to reach.. connected via Dubai metro (mall of Emirates station). Taxi and bus connectivity also available.Features: loads of rides.. chairlift, zorbing, skiing, zip line, etc.. all rides are manned with good enough safety care..Highlight is seeing the Penguins.. they cone for a march at 2 hrs intervals stating 12 noon..One can also choose to meet them closely at 9 P.M.To take care: the socks and shoes provided are not enough to keep you warm at -2 centigrade.Beware: do not try food or drinks, they are very bad..Minimum time required: 3 hrsAll in all very good experience.

Amazing experience. Wow this was a highlight of our vacation. We had so much fun sledding, rolling in balls, and all kinds of other winter activities. The penguin experience was once in a lifetime and well worth it.

wonderful experience!. Me and my 4 year old loved it throughly. even though by the end we were almost frozen but the slides and the ball was all worth it. one in a million experience. there was tiny appearance of a few penguins also. that was also cute. definetly must go place.The going in is a long long procedure, getting the outfits boots etc etc and you have to keep all your belongings inside a locker.

Great Indoor Snow Experience. I have never visited an indoor ski centre before and was intrigued to see what the Ski Dubai experience had to offer. My husband and I purchased a day pass and went in the evening, spending about 3 hours there. The day pass excludes skiing but includes:- Gloves, socks, boots, trousers and jacket- access to the centre- Penguin show- use of the ski lift- Bobsled (loved this)- Toboggan- Giant BallThere are large changing rooms and lockers available to store all of your belongings and we found the staff to be helpful. There are lots of upgrade options available to experience other activities.My top tip would be to take your own gloves as the ones supplied are thin and also a hat as it gets very cold and one is not supplied. There are no pockets in the trousers and only a small pocket in the jacket which is not big enough for a camera therefore if you are taking a camera in I would suggest taking this in a case so that it does not get damaged when experiencing the activities.A great experience which we fully enjoyed.

-4 inside 40 outside!. Second visit here and empty again! Loads of space with only a few people on the slopes.Sadly the black slope was closed with no reason given.The drag lift is tricky but much faster, if you know what you are doing then it's the best option.Quite expensive but a novel experience and welcome break from the heat. They provide everything you need apart from gloves.

Ski In the Desert. I have done three things there learnt skiing, snowboarding and the penguin encounter all were memorable experience. Its cool that when ever I travel abroad people after asked me where did I learn Skiing or Snow Boarding I tell them Dubai and they get shocked that I learnt skiing in the dessert but that is Dubai full of surprises and cool things, technologies and entertainment. About the place the instructors are very helpful they have classes for all level beginners to even people who are at the highest level and wanting to learn tricks. I recommend this place for families.

Fun, fun and fun!. Everyone hears about Dubai's indoor ski slope so you can't go wrong giving it a visit. The thrill starts with knowing you're indoors skiing while the desert is outside, plus there's tons to do besides skiing like going inside a bubble ball and rolling down the slope!

Atmosphere as beautifull as Switzerland. This is a must visit place. In desert country it is a 8th wonder to have this great entertainment. It is so well maintained that after we enter inside Ski Dubai, we feel that we are touring some cold country. But please don't forget that at time of exit you must collect the refund @20 dhirams.

Fun. Ski dubai is in emirates which is little far from bur dubai area . They provide all required clothes used for to play in snow . It was too cold in emirates mall after entering snow park it was not bearable for me to tackle cold it was very very cold and little son couldnt play nicely . But one who can bear cold can definey go .

Tick another one off the Bucket List. As a very experience skier this was a fun activity for a few hours. For the more experienced skier I recommend the 2 hour visit as going down the 300 to 400 meter long run gets a little old after a while. Snow in desert. Wow must visit especially if you have kids truly nice experience and wouldn't even think it's in the desert

The best experience ever!. Neither the impressive facilities nor the awesome staff will leave you indifferent. I say do it for the experience, not the skiing. Ski Dubai is great as a story to tell friends and family. However if you are an avid skier, this will not be what your used to. So I decided that ski Dubai would be his first experience, and as such he had a great time.I made certain to dress him warmly ( layers), because I noticed many of the children running in and out because they were freezing. As stated in many other reveiws bring hat, gloves, plus a sweat suit to go under the provided gear. This way you get your full 2 hours worth.I also paid for my nephew you to get kids group ski lesson, which he not only enjoyed, but he learned from.In addition to the ski slope there are also 2 or 3 snow rides. frustrating. I have been twice within 2 weeks and both times I have found the process of getting you kit extremely frustrating.on Friday evening there were 2 ski technicians on despite this being one of the busiest nights. there were people arguing as they had ski lessons booked and unable to collect their skis I went the following Monday and there was one ski technician however on this occasion I did manage to visit the Avalanche cafe in the middle of the slope and there were 4 people serving coffee to 2 people ! cmon ski Dubai,,,, sort it out please.the 2nd visit 1/3rd of the slope was not in use as they were building a ski jump to be used for a competition, this was not advertised until you had paid to get in and were collecting your equipment. as a result the drag lift was not in use and therefore you had to use the 4 man chairlift, this takes 5 minutes and about 15 seconds to reach the top, it then took me an average of 40 seconds to ski down again,,,,, got very cold , hence the visit to the cafe.I enjoy the skiing but not the process to acquire your equipment.nice to visit but be prepared to wait !!!

Crazy Skiing in Dubai. I was in Dubai on business and had a free evening on my own. So as a keen real mountain skier I thought I would give Ski Dubai a go. I understand that the walls have 5m of insulation to keep the slopes frozen in the desert heat of Dubai. You get all the clothing (ski pants, jacket, socks, skies, poles, ski boots and a locker included in the price. You will need your own gloves and hat to keep comfortable. I used some old socks on my hands which worked OK. Gloves can be purchased in the shop if required. You pay a small deposit for the lift pass which is timed so when your 2 hours is up you can't use the lifts anymore. On Thursday evening when I visited it was almost empty of other skiers. The slope is probably the only "Black" (difficult) run indoors and was quite challenging on the one corner if you cut close to the steepest part. Much better than any of the other indoor slopes I have visited. There are two beginners slopes and lesions can be purchased for those new to skiing. They have a small cafe half way down to get a burger and a coffee etc. To get you to the top there is a drag lift and a chair lift on the main slope, the drag being quicker and really quite advanced with two very strong pulling steep bends. The snow was very good quality with no ice or lumps but realistic bumps. It was crazy to ski in the desert but that's Dubai for you. I loved the 2 hours I had and that was just about enough.
Looks good. Only experienced ski Dubai from the outside, looked like everyone was enjoying themselves from children to adults. Great experience for those who have not experienced real snow.

Fun Experience. I am writing this as someone who has done 90% of my skiing in Australia. Someone who has mostly skiied in Europe or North America may have a different perspective.1. There is no scenery because it is indoors. The scenery is one of the bonuses of regular ski resorts. Since Ski Dubai is basically a single big room in a shopping mall, you don't get this.2. There is no sun. This is both good and bad. Skiing outdoors on a sunny day is good for visibility, and enjoying the scenery as mentioned above, but the snow can turn to slush late in the day. That does not happen in this temperature controlled environment.3. There is no wind. So even though it is about -4 degrees in Ski Dubai, there is no wind chill. It also means that the chair lift will not be stopped for safety reasons due to high winds.4. There are not many runs. It looked like 5 runs to me. One is a beginners run for skiing lessons. I did not ski that. There are areas with jumps and rails. I don't know if these are counted as runs. These were too hard for me. That left me with the other two runs which were also the longest. I found that I still enjoyed myself even though I skiied the same two runs all day. Apparently one of these is a blue run, but it would only be a green run in Perisher or Thredbo in Australia where I usually ski. If you are an advanced skiier who is after challenging runs, then Ski Dubai is not for you.5. There is artificial lighting. This means that at 5pm when most ski resorts are shutting down because the sun is setting, Ski Dubai is still busy. In fact I finished skiing at 5pm, having started just before noon, and there still lots of people arriving.6. It is in a big shopping mall. This means that when you stop for a meal, you can just put your ski things in the locker, and go out into the mall to get something to eat. This is much cheaper than a normal ski resort. 7. The jacket and pants and ski hire are included in the price of the day pass, which actually makes it decent value. You have to purchase gloves and hat which is normal everywhere.

Worth the experience. Ski Dubai is located in the Mall of Emirates. We were on a guided tour, so we had our guide take us straight to Ski Dubai from the parking lot. If you have the time, you can have the view of inside from the mall which is separated with glass. Entry to the Ski World is very well organised rows and people are ready to help you at every step. You can buy tickets from the internet or book the same across the counter. There are 2 types of tickets, one is general ticket which allows you to most parts of Ski World except for skiing or snow boarding. The general ticket entitles you to a jacket and gum boots. hand gloves are not included nor is a woolen cap to cover your head and ears. Kindly ensure to take them along with you when you visit as it will get pretty chilly inside or you can buy the same at site as there are various shops that sell these items, but would be slight expensive. For the special ticket, I have not asked much, so will not be able to comment accurately on the same, but you will be able to do skiing and snow boarding. Helmets at the entrance are reserved for children only. Once you enter you cannot come out. piece of advice, kindly go to the washroom before you enter the Ski world. Once inside, there is a cave and in the centre of it is a ice sculpture of a dragon. Also there is sitting arrangement on the edge, where you can sit and click images. When you enter the main area, it simply awe's you with the layout, size and the expanse of it. Depending on your visiting time, you will find rush. Try to take week days where there may be comparatively less rush so you can enjoy more number of rides with less amount of time lost for waiting for the same. If you are feeling very cold and need to de freeze, you can come out and before you exit there is an Anti Freeze chamber on the right. You can add DHS 10 for the machine to start and within some time you will feel the difference or you can use the Anti Freeze chamber on exit also.On exiting you have to deposit the gumboots and the jackets and then leave the area. There are curio shops that sell various articles.
