Ride Dubai!. Had a great time snowboarding at Ski Dubai with my teenage daughter in March. We stayed at the Kempinski next door, which was wonderful. We ride mostly in Colorado, but I've ridden small mountains in NC, went to Liberty University's "Snowflex," and I even rode a small mountain in Missouri once! It's all fun to me, just not for a long time. It's easy to ride all day in Breckenridge, for example, but these smaller places are only fun for a couple of hours, really. I like to hit the easier rails and boxes and will do small to medium sizes jumps. There was a nice little box set up when I was there (like most parks, they change the set up frequently), but there were no jumps, except for small ledges on the run, that you could get some air on with enough speed. It's real snow at Ski Dubai, so that's great! We rented boards (decided that smaller than our usual was best for speed). I normally ride a 150cm, but went to a 145 there (I'd never go that small in CO). I wish I would have had my board, but it seemed silly to drag it all that way for a few laps. Next time, I'll bring it though. I ended up going three times. Once I bought the all day pass (pretty cheap and you can leave and come back and ride until closing, even though the website says you can't) so I went twice that day (hit the park, instead of the gym). It's really fun and totally worth it. Everyone I saw there was super stoked, and the runs were empty. I guess they make their money off of the penguin encounter and the snow village, because there weren't many people on the slopes. I loved Ski Dubai...and hope to go back some day. If you're a skier or snowboarder and you don't check out Ski Dubai...you're missing out. It's so neat! So go ahead...go shred!
What a place!!. Oh what to say more baout this place, you have iceland, norway - right in the heart of Dubai, hats off to the idea!

Pricey but loads of fun!. The experience of skiing in a mall is one that should be done! The skiing is very good and was great for our group as each of us had done it in the past but it was many years back.My only negative would be that there should be a few more employees around offering guidance as to where you go to get your clothes and skiing equipment etc. You are provided with everything you need bar a hat and gloves (I would recommend you buy them as it is very cold), this is a little bit annoying as you have to go and buy them either in the shop or check around the stores of the mall. Just adds to the expense of the experience. I can also see their side of things in relation to hygiene though.Other than that it was great fun and I would definitely recommend it.

Freezing inside with 34 degress outside.. We couldn't really get in to the actual ski slope as it was very very crowded but already the whole ambience is like at a European ski resort...boots, ski ensembles and the lot.

Break from the heat!. A great way to get out of the heat of the Dubai summer.I'm a complete beginner so took a few lessons and can now, just about manage on my own after 3 lessons. Well worth buying a package of passes that you can switch to lessons or ski slope passes. Best time is to go early on weekends, from the afternoon it gets packed and isn't too much fun then.
You will love it. Unbelievable - 45 degrees outside minus 3 inside!! Get ski lessons and then use the slopes or just go and enjoy the real snow

bit pricey. loved this place,but not a lot of variety for youngsters and I felt that overall it was priceybut it was great fun not as cold as I thought,and meeting the penguins was amazing,the only problem was the photographers constantly barraging you to take your pictures I was not happy with that as my granduaghter got a bit upset by it.the price of the photographs were also expensive,but I have been twice now and the kids do love it
Visit. Having experienced this it is a must for all to see and visit wonderful experience.Cannot wait to go again on my next visit to Dubai

Fun day at the snow park. On our recent holiday to Dubai myself and my kids spent the day here. It was a highlight of our trip. We had a penguin encounter booked and entry to the snow park. My 9 year old son then added a ski lesson on which he thought was fantastic. The only reason I gave this place 4 stars instead of 5 stars is because of the prices of photos afterwards. It was the last day of our holiday and I didn't bring a lot of money to the mall with me as I thought we had everything paid, except for money for food. We had booked our tickets on EmiratesYoo and the ticket we bought said each of us would get a lesson included which was not true, we were told that it cost extra to add this on so I paid extra for my son only. Then when we met the penguins we were told that we couldn't use our own cameras but not to worry as a photographer would take some for us. I feel the photographer should have asked first if we wanted a professional photo or if he wanted to use our camera as they do in a lot of other tourist attractions! I didn't think it was fair to charge so much money for the photos afterwards especially when you weren't allowed to get anyone to take a photo for you, or 1 should at least be included in the price. We ended up not buying any photos.The snow park is great and has lots of different slides etc. We had a very good day here and we will defiantly be back but we will skip the penguins I'd say I wasn't too impressed the the whole encounter and wouldn't recommend it, I do however, really recommend the snow park and the ski lesson and make sure to bring lots of money!

My teens loved it but. My teens loved it but if you are planning to visit in the summer bring sweaters cause with summer Tshirts you will eather catch a cold or you'll freeze.The attraction defenetly gets 5 star but cobcidering that we paid good money for the penguine encounter, being asked to pay 120 derham for each photo spoilt it.I mean it so unfair that they ask you to pay 450 derhams for only the photoes with penguines and dont get me wrong it means one photo printed and the rest copied on a flash disk. I have twoo teens and I had already paid 600 DH so I had to go for the cheaper deal which was one photo for 120 DH and the fact is they are going to delet the rest of the photoes so why not ask for a more reasonable price?

Great time - it was worth the money. Dear readers, I took my son today for a discovery lesson, price 170AED-20AED you will get refunded later on.He had a great time, skies, cloth and boots all got provided. The instructor was very nice. Now we booked a group session 6x for 900+. Super!!

Learn to ski or just play in the snow. I learned to snowboard here. The instructors are very good and professional. If skiing or snowboarding is not your thing, There are less demanding activities for young and old alike. Don't miss the penguin show!
Snow in the dessert. Where else but Dubai, can you find a ski experience in the middle of a mall. Sub-zero temperatures and even penguins!

A bit overrated but still a nice thing to do when in Dubai. Go here early, before the crazy teenagers arrive wich is usually after lunch. They are not always the best skriers and to have smaller kids arround them is not to recommend. Otherwise it's a nice thing to do and one thing you should do when visiting Dubai.

Mall of the Emirates Skiing Facility. This skiing facility is amazing. It has an actual snow covered ski slope with a chair lift. There are also lots of children's activities there to keep them occupied

Go Skiing. This is also one of the tourist attractions in Dubai, I think you enjoy Ski Dubai if you ski. If you already know skiing you can enjoy it a lot, otherwise you have to go through training available at ski dubai

great. this is the place ,this is the place ....
never ever miss this ...
-18 degree !!!
oh my God this s really superb...

As cold as the Alps.... So much fun! The ski lift lets you get off halfway up the slope or go all the way to the top, meaning it's great for all abilities. There is also a small slope for the little ones. They offer ski lessons, so easy to learn. My one bit of advice.... wear a warm top underneath & take a hat & gloves... it's freezing cold in there! We bought our gloves locally at 25 DHS and they say 'Ski Dubai' on them, so a little souvenir :-)

Fantastic once in a lifetime experience . Only in Dubai can you walk out of a 32 degree mall and into a -4 degree magical snow globe! I'm my sisters and I learnt how to ski, do zorbing, bobsledding, snowboarding and more in this lovely place. Perfect for exploring and experiencing different climates. Love love love it!

perfect place for something different in dubai. its hard to imagine skiing in dubai but it was very much real skiing. it was my first time skiing anf im glad i did it here because the intructors are all friendly and willing to help. there is a nice cafe half way up which does amazing hot chocolates and there are penguins to see.
How to chill out in Dubai. This place is fantastic. We did the penguin experience which was great. You go to pat the king penguins. Amazing experience not to be missed.
summertime in Dubai. Unreal how in such a hot location you can walk into a area of 32* with snow all around and choose what you want to do.
The No 2 Mall. Within the Mall of the Emirates with a daily Penguin show, skiing and a bob sleigh run. Great place to cool of or feed the family.

Wow such a wonder. What a wonderful display of intricate snow activities can be found seen in what must be one of Dubai's most opulent shopping malls. A really splendid theme park well worth the effort to visit.

Taster session. Went with my gf to Ski Dubai for a taster session. My gf had never skied before. After much persuasion I managed to get her to have a lesson. All I can say is were considering swapping the sunshine for snow in the near future. Had a lot of fun. The instructor was very helpful and showed everyone different things to help them develop there skills how they wanted to develop them. By the end I was skiing down the slope backwards and some people were slaloming was a totally interactive experience. Would recommend to everyone wanting to ski in a desert with real snow the mind boggles!
realy good. It was excellent. It was affordable, they lend you clothes boots etc. We had a great time. The photos were excellent. Brilliant.

Skiing in the desert!!. Incredible piece of architecture. Enormous freezer that maintains -2 inside while its 45 outside and they claim it only uses as much power as a large hotel! Is that supposed to impress? Great if your a skiing fanatic otherwise just a curiousity. The Penguins they parade a few times a day is in poor taste I feel.

Horrible Experience. Poor Customer Service. My family and I purchased an excursion for Ski Dubai. Upon getting there, we were informed that since some of us had limited to no ski experience then we were not allowed on the slopes. We approached the ticket desk and talked with Peter and another guy who were very unhelpful. What they don't tell you is that you need at least 4 ski lessons to be allowed on the slopes. It's a complete waste of time, because who has time to take FOUR 60 minute lessons when you're visiting Dubai? Especially when you have to pay for each session! Over the course of 60 minutes you should be able to learn how to start, stop, turn, and get on the ski lift, but Ski Dubai wants to take all of your money by breaking the sessions up, which makes no sense. They say you need minimum experience which we have, but they really want you to have olympic ski experience. Instead of being understanding, Peter tried to sell us on the "snow experience" which is really for kids and not adults. Ski Dubai was the most disappointed part of our Dubai experience and a complete waste of our time.

Escape the heat-Ski in Dubai. I booked a lesson at Ski Dubai prior to flying to Dubai. I e-mailed them and told them my skill level and they quickly responded about the level of lesson I should take.Very good value. It cost 220AED for 90 minutes in a group lesson and that included the skis, boots and clothes (except gloves).The instructor was very good and everything seems to be run in a very organised way.It compared very favourably to my ski lessons in Scotland! You should try it!
Ski Dubai. Beautiful experience to be enjoyed either alone or with family.a bit expensive.You don't need anything they provide everything - socks boots etc.
Love this place. You have to do this & yes it's not cheap but it's worth the money. You can have food & hot chocolate up the top the mountain.Highly recommended for all ages

fun for all ages... Dubai ski is a great place to spend a day with your family, it's located at the Emirates Mall. and if you don't know how to ski.. guess what? they have courses.. a great way to spend the day.
Amaziing ski Dubai. 4 persons almost 960 Dirhams, depend on your packages. penguins show is amazing. you can't miss it. it is too cold for children

Amazing snow experience . Got the powerpass 300aed included was 2x flying fox , unlimited chairlift, tobogganing, and all activities minus skiing. Also included was all the gear to wear in the snow the gloves provided was sufficient Avalanche restaurant was well priced and their hot chocolate and nachos was deliciousNo different to being at an actual snowfield Great experience highly recommended

SkiDubai. Had a lot of fun, surprised by the quality of the facility and the ability of the staff to provide a real ski experience. Amazing how cold it was in there and had to purchase gloves and hats - but they will make good souvenirs.

Hill station in Desert. This Snow park is a must do activity. The Ski Dubai is attached to Mall of Emirates. what an experience. They created a hill station in the desert. It has many attractions . 1) penguins come out every 2 hours on weekends and 3 hours on weekdays.The start time is 2:00 PM. so better plan to include this show.we were lucy to see the penguin show at 2:00 PM as soon as we entered the snow park. Then there is chairlift.Chairlift will show you the snow park from top. Then Zoro ball a big plastic ball in which the person enters in the ball and the ball is rolled on the slope. then their are many small rides for children and adults.Sledge ride,tyre tube ride. Snow park has two tickets ) the penguin ticket 2) the skiing ticket . We took the penguin ticket . It costs 250 AED. The skiing experts skii on the snow which can be seen from the chair lift. You get warm cloths ,shoes and socks there in this ticket. If the ticket is of less than 250 AED you dont get gloves,.

Good family fun in amazing indoor facility!. This is Dubai at its best ! An indoor snow ski facility in a major shopping centre Great family fun and plenty to do ... Expensive but probably no different to snow skiing costs in Australia The ski runs are more suited to beginner and intermediate levels
too good. must visit as it is i think the largest indoor snow glacier man made. the experience inside was simply awesome
Ski diving. Paragliding oh my family dive' but it was terrific .good for youngsters. They enjoyed it very much. Nice place on with full safety belts .colours of parachutes looks good.
Best Place. It is an amazing place, not only for children also for adults it is an amazing indoor experience. A must do if there.

One of the must visit in Mall of Emirates. You can feel snow as in Alaska and you can play ski on ice.. Ski Dubai is one of the must visit in Mall of Emirates.You can feel snow and play ski like in Alaska. Next to Ski Dubai there is a famous Cheesecake Factory with an awesome taste of Cheesecake with a large space of restaurant. The taste of the cheesecake is very delicious different with the Cheesecake factory in my country. You must visit this outlet.

Great fun, good snow, cold!. I've been to ski Dubai twice now, for the 2 hour ski sessions good value at 200aed. The snow is good, equipment fine, but it is cold! Make sure you take a good thick jumper or two, and if for some reason you have a hat and gloves with you in Dubai take those too (otherwise you have to buy some). Great time.
Ski Dubai - Ice Age in Dubai. The Ski Dubai is very good concept situated in Mall of Emirates. The slides were good but the chairlift ride was average. Penguins were really cute...
WOW!!!. Dubai's very own swiss alps adjacent to our hotel was really enjoyable. The kids, even though at freezing temp, did not want to leave .Something to experience for sure.
Escaping the heat. Everything is provided to have fun at ski Dubai if you don't have your own gear. We all learned skiing there and it's always fun even if it's more ice then snow.

Amazing experience in Snow Park. We have a friend visiting and we brought her to experience the Snow Park in Ski Dubai.Buying the tickets was easy as all counters are very organized and the staff giving out the ski clothes were very friendly and accommodating, they just look at us and they already know what size to give and it all fits perfectly .. Super cool!The staff by the entrance of the Snow Park were very helpful and patient ( many kids in front of us not following what they wete saying but the staff were so professional and dealt with them good )The staff inside the park were very helpful too...Imagine how difficult their job is to be inside the cold working place all the time, but all of them were nice and helpful.The lady taking souvenir photos was not very pushy but she gets clients ( unline other places they run after you and pushes you to get photos ) the more you let the customer decides and you approach them nicely the more you get business.The place has nothing much to offer in the snow park but it offers an amazing "snow experience and we loved it!!!!It was very good for sure but we didnt mind.The "hot chocolate" staff named THAI was super, he was just in the corner but he greets everybody who passes his area and offers to be warm by having hot chocolate.. Not cheap but it was worth it.My friends had an amazing experience and they will go back home with all good feedback about Ski dubai.. I wish I can afford to go often :-) :-) Ooppss the "Penguins" are super amazing too.. We had a chance to watch them at 8pm, super cute!!!!!!!!! We didnt win the contest to be able to touch them.. Next time we will!!

snow in the desert. Amazing to go in a shopping mall and step into a minus 4 degrees snow haven. Get a super pass, and go on all the rides, plus have fun watching the penguins walk around within feet from you, go skiing or boarding and get relief from the heat for a few hours, even watch the snowfalls at certain hours of the day.

Average experience with limited time on the slopes.. This is the go to attraction but its only average in my opinion. Its very expensive and your actual time on the slope is probably half the session time. The instructor was nice but clearly bored off his chops. It's definately onnly average in my opinion.
ski. kids are so happy to snowbd in Dubai..... it is almost same price in US if you go to mountain for ski or snowbd. They rent eveything except you have to buy socks.

Unique snow Oasis in the desert. It is a great place to enjoy your favorite sport of skiing whether alone , with friends or family. The entire services and support by also providing the relevant skiing apparel is of great value and convenience. All equipment been maintained well and the team has been friendly and attentive. I recommend to go early mornings , just about opening times, when slopes are not yet overcrowded and snow is "fresh" to enjoy a few good ski runs.
Concept is coola dn neat but it;s small and not much to do.. Its cool to be able to ski in the mall in the desert but if you come from places close to snow mountains you can skip it.

It's all downhill at Ski Dubai. I'd count myself as an advanced skier and snowboarder, and thoroughly enjoyed ripping down the slopes for an hour. It's the biggest indoor snow dome I've been to with various gradients. There are also rails and box jumps to practice your skills. On certain days they have a large inflatable so you can practice your 360s and tricks. Tuition is available and they provide all the kit. Helmets are needed if you're doing the jumps and rails. There's lots to do for the kids as well including real penguins to hang out with. Snow slides and zorbing. There's lots of cafes, bars and restaurants within snowball distance including St Moritz for a burger and hot chocolate or something stronger at Aprez.
Snow Experience. It was nice experience..a must do for people who want to experience SNOW! Their staff are friendly too!
great day adventure. our son went snow boarding.you have to book in advance but it is a great experience.leave the kids and have a look around the mall,grab a coffee or sit at the window and watch

Ok attraction. Dubai is the only place in the world that I know that you can be standing outside in the street with 40 plus degrees celsius and in a matter of minutes be in the snow with minus 4 celsius.I like the Ski Dubai, if you like snow and skiing or if you just want something different it is a nice choice.The trully amazing thing is when you realize you are having snow in the middle of the desert.
Amazing but expensive. Amazing but very expensive to enter. one can experience the snow and life like being in a village in Switzerland.

Snow in Dubai!!!. Believe it or not but yes, its true!!! The place is in Mall of emirates covered by snow, where you can actually play ice sports like ski, skate and roll inside the ice ball etc.The ticket price is high but if you want to feel the cold in dubai and if you can afford than it is a must do in dubai.They have different type of tickets but if you really know the ski then you can opt for the one with ski else they will give you a ski class for an hour.Be prepare as it is very cold place and you will feel cold so wear the cap other thing like shoes and gloves will be provided by them it is already included in the ticket price.But, I bet you will enjoy it once you are in.

Easy but refreshing desert fun. When you need a quick ski fix! Fun family thing to do when it's crazy hot out. Not much excitement for ski veterans, as it's not a challenge, but great for beginners & kids. Also has the big air balls that you get inside and roll down slope. Cute.
PERFECT-- SKI DUBAI. We spent one full day me and my family enjoyed all things in SKI Dubai, it was very good day that each one of us will remember

Incredible wintersport in the desert. Visiting the Ski Dubai is a must see and must do . The ski dubai is located at the Dubai Mall. Its a real experience to explore one of the 4 different choices as taking a ski training or play with real pinguins etc. ticket are however pricy but for such a experience in the arabian desert worth the money.
Skiing in the Desert !!. Heard a lot about it and now I believe it ,skiing slop inside a mall ??yes it is true and unique ,fresh snow all day ,right there in the desert my friends .

"Ski" Is this inside or outside?. Unbelievable. feel like we are some where in a Europe country. But you will be surprise that this is really inside a Mall. When you take a still and show to some one. I am sure they cannot believe this al all

MUST go when in Dubai. Ski Dubai is an indoor ski resort with a couple slopes to hit on either skis or snowboard. I come from a place where I can snowboard during the winter, and I have to admit that this was still very fun. I attended with my girlfriend and we both enjoy snowboarding. The price is fair and was round about 500 AED (~$150) for both of us which included all the equipment, ski clothes, and 2 hour lift pass. It was very awesome to hit the slopes on the indoor mountain in the cool -4 degree C (25F) while is was over 45 degrees C outside (113F). We really enjoyed it as well as the hot chocolate at the mountain top lodge. The staff were all very helpful and friendly and they even have a ski patrol... haha. Quite funny to see in the desert. There are multiple packages including family packs, student deals, and training packages for first timers to learn. I am experienced, so we just opted for the ordinary package with just a lift ticket. If you have kiddoes you can opt for the kids package and play in the snow and enjoy the penguin show. It was definitely a must see/do in Dubai and I would happily repeat the adventure if I am in Dubai again. They also have lockers available for rental to place your goods while you are skiing/snowboarding.
Toooo awesome. It's one of the coolest place.we had great fun and wen u eat nacho inside it's such a wonderful feeling.I like skiing very much.
indoor ski. kids went for the first time had an hour ski lesson and loved it wanted stay all night I sat outside with coffee and watched

45 Degrees outside, 0 Degrees inside!. I didn't believe what i saw once I entered the Mall of the Emirates. It was almost 45 degrees Celsius outside and right in front of me was this huge area full of snow with people skiing, making an throwing snow bals at each other. The whole experience was just amazing.

Good experience. We paid for the Ski Zip Line, bare in mind once you do have a set booked time the line is still long. Overall the experience was fun, I wanted the photos but at $125 per picture it is a bit overpriced.

Zindegi Na milega doobara. Have you ever seen the movie ZINDEGI NA MILEGA DOOBARA.untill unless you try this no one can explain this in words.dnt try who have heart and nerve problem.a jump from a private jet above 30000 feet.i dint get scope to try one of my friend tried

Ski in Desert. Ski in desert ...if you are missing ski or if you want to practices Ski for your next holidays then this is the place to visit...they have regular course for beginners and for others they can ski just like that...for kids there is also penguin ( ofcourse you hv to pay to play ) but its fun for kids...

a quick skiing fix for when you miss it. Yes you are skiing in a Mall, and yes its very nice! as you can imagine there are not that many slopes (1 only ) but there are different paths and its a lot of fun. the advanced path is a lot of fun.

Amazing. Very amazing. Presenting the snow in the middle of the mall in the desert climates.
It is suitable for family tourism, especially the children who wanted to play with the snow.

Controversial freezing resort in hot Dubai. Who can ignore the amazing ambience ski pist under the burning sun in dubai? Where you will forget you are in one of hottest climate in the region. The pist in Emirate mall brings joy and exitement as well as feeling home for western ski lovers.

Very Disappointing, Poorly Run, Overcrowded.. We booked training sessions for our two late teenage children. The class was run with 30 trainees! So the poor instructor was unable to give any meaningful instruction due to the size of the class. We complained at the time and we're basically told it was tough luck! There appeared to be no Manager in charge who cared what was going on, despite the fact the instructor thought it was wrong, and said so before we even complained.
Snow and desert. It was a great experience but must lower prices i was spent almost US $ 400 for me and my family .But it still a very wonderful experience and will not forget .

Chairlift break downs ruin trip. Twice we have gone to Ski Dubai and twice the chairlift has not been working AND they don't tell you that part until you've nearly parted with your money so it pays to always ask if the chairlift is working! There's little signage as to how things work and the staff speak limited English so be sure to allow extra time if you are a seasoned skier or snow boarder because it will take some time to get your gear done right.The snow park is good fun for all though it does feel very very cold after about 30 mins, especially for the younger kids.

Kids loved it. Went with our kids 3, 5 & 8, to just have fun in the snow. They absolutely loved it. After a while we thought it would be great with some hot chocolate, unfortunately there was no one there to serve us. So F&B gets a low mark. But saved us money as it was over priced anyway.

Best indoor ski centre we have been too. My husband is a keen snow boarder anyway and the children and I have only taken up skiing/boarding in the last couple of years, and this centre is better than all the fresh snow centres closest to us at home! The instructors are good, although expect quite a lot if you've never tried it before, but I guess it's just them wanting the most out of the experience for you. The run is quite long which is unusual, and we wouldn't hesitate to go back again. Really easy process once you arrive. And quite nice to spend an hour or so out of the heat!

The winter in the desert !. It's really amazing. You can enjoy skiing , playing in the snow and watching the penguins show. Don't miss it !! I recommend visiting it in weekdays so you can enjoy without standing long time in the queue !

Whole family learned to ski and snowboard here. Ski Dubai lessons are excellent to learn snowboarding and skiing. Our 6 year old learned to ski whilst the rest of us took on snowboard lessons which took us from beginning to semi-advanced over the course of a few months. I've even ridden some rails and done some jumps now... Highly recommended to any family about to embark on a ski trip wanting up front time to practice. the staff are helpful and friendly. It gets a little busy toward lunchtime and onward Fridays, but as our lessons were from morning, this could not be avoided. After formal lessons are over, midweek evenings are a good time to go and practice...
dubai vacation. my son loved ski dubai. it was something new for him to try. he loved the tube slide, toboggan run and even the ride on the chairlift.

Really cool. It's amazing how they could built a Ski zone in such a hot place like Dubai, but it really works.I can tell you... don't rely on the clothes you can rent in this attraction, it's not enough, so bring your own pants, shirts, socks and gloves, because the cold inside is really crazy! I could stay for no longer than 2 hours before giving up with my hands and toes completely frozen.There are many attractions inside and all of them is fun, I just wish I had more clothes to stay longer inside.

Ski Dubai,. Of all the places to put a ski area,,,in one of hottest areas in a Hot city! The ski area is small, but an attraction that whoeeever has not gone skiing would enjoy. The area is in the mall and is very convenient place to shop and eat, then to go skiing!
Surprise in Middle East. Very nice and its the first ski venture in the middle east. Had fantastic experience with lot of fun.

Great place, Nice staff. The staff are really helpful. The place is very nice and its a great place to go if you want to escape the heat or just go skiing. The jumps are very fun. The place is definitely worth a visit.

Good facilities and nice staff. Haven't skied elsewhere so there is no comparison, the facilities are quite new and the staffs are friendly and helpful.But the queuing system is chaos. You have to spend about 45 minutes being in queue for 4 times (four! times!) before you can get to the ski area. Also too many fussy people complaining about their coat is a bit looser, pants are a bit longer...Yes the coat is so ugly and a bit too large, but I reeeeeeeeeeeeally don't care wearing them for only 2 hours so come on can you please move on so i don't need to spend another 5 minutes standing behide and waiting for you and your 3+ kids...

Kids over 120 cm which is about 8 years old need to pay adult prices. My kids have been going to ski Dubai since they were 3 years old so imagine my surprise when I turn up to pay and I am told that my 11 year old is an adult!!!! Apparently if they are over 120cm they are classed as an adult - this is clearly explained in very small writing on the tariff board. So I your child is short you are ok - sounds pretty ridiculous to me and another money making scheme!!!
Snow in dubai. Amazing and fun for all the family with play and entertainment with snow in the middle east ... and the penguins are really a scene

Love it. Get the supreme ticket for 300 dirhams, doesn't seem to be advertised anywhere but you get access to snow park and the slopes with no time limit. All equipment supplied Inc gloves and socks. Time it well with the penguin talk and you get a Brucey bonus of being up close to the funny and we'll trained penguins. Great fun and a super break from the sometimes crazy heat.
Worth It. Skied many times before but this was a different experience well worth it , staff are super friendly and the process is extremely easy

what an amazing experince I played like a Kid :). The place there is fantastic. We had so much fun and played with ice .the ticket is a little bit expensive but it worth the experience . It is for all ages kids and adults

Don't waste your Money. Very much for the novelty affect, don't waste your time or money on this. Extraordinary show of wealth to build a tacky snow environment in the middle of the desert. Fake penguins and an attempt to create a real European feel were completely lost to me.

What a polava. I went with a visiting friend and his teenage son 8pm Friday . Initially very speedy to take your money to get you in. Staff were good and plentiful, recommended we only needed one locker. The price was about what we expected for a couple of hours. So far so good. Then the queues start. First to get your boots and clothes. It there were 2 staff getting the boots which was a 15-20 wait and we asked for jacket and leggings. Another 10 minute wait as the same staff do that. Then we asked for socks and they were instant. You then get dressed and put your stuff in the lockers. There were only a few available and some had damaged doors. Then to the check in machines to register your contact details plus weight, height and experience. Only a short wait here. Then queue for skis. Only one person fitting those to your boots. Where is you print out he asks, what print out. From the check in machine. Most people in the queue look puzzled like we do. Of the 4 or 5 machines only 2 have paper in them so yep it's another queue for those. Back in the ski queue with paper. Another 15 minute wait. It's now just before 9 pm an hour gone by and no skiing yet. Oh you've got no gloves sir you can buy them there for AED 25. Finally skiing at 9:05 and its was good. But streamline the entry or I won't be going back

Touristy -- but you're skiing in Dubai!. Fun and worth doing -- but can get very crowded. I would not recommend for keeping track of a lot of kids unless they are confident skiers. The Penguin Encounter is amazing though and I understand this is a nice birthday party venue (my son attended one and had a great time).

cool n cool. my kids loved it. snows were clean and neat. its quite chilled place in the amid of hot Dubai. its located in mall of emirates. its has got few rides which kids enjoyed thoroughly. entertainer book again worked. one needs to get woolen gloves for it otherwise your hands will get frozen. so better get them before hand.
Ski Dubai. The snow was very icy when we went. It was fun to say we went snowboarding inside but i don't think i will ever go back.

Positively different!. If you are looking to do something fairly unique during a Dubai visit, I would recommend Ski Dubai.Giving my young children their very first experience in any form of snow, Ski Dubai has excellent children focused training programs which are effective and tremendously helpful for children getting their first experience on skis. We had two instructors Uzi and Mark who really helped my kids get comfortable during our 5 day training program.Good equipment from gloves to skis to shoes to gloves to overalls to salopettes to helmets...all available for a fee to hire as well as to buy. Having traveled and seen prices I wouldn't buy as the stuff is way overpriced; this would be my only negative of Ski Dubai that they should reconsider their astronomical pricing in everything...although there is a case to keep it such to help keep the crowds to manageable levels. Overall a very good experience!

Had a laugh with kids. Went here yesterday with my 7 year old and 14 and 16 year old. Was fun going on sledges and slides with donuts and few other activities but was freezing cold. Only managed to stay for an hour and i couldn't feel my nose or feet was freezing!!
amazing for a mall...... For a mall it is amazing, unique and you must go if you are there in Dubai. Mall Emirates it is one only!

Poor and Expensive. Poor - have been here many times before but the facilities were chaotic and the amount of activities have reduced even though the prices have gone up significantly! Poor queing systems too - chaos! Spent £200 and was worth £50 at best - will not be rushing back which is a shame as the concept is fantastic, just poorly executed and managed.
Ski Dubai. this artificial man made ski resort is worth visiting whether one can ski or not. there are a lot of other activities that you can engage in while iside

Gosh!!!!. Probably my best activity done on this trip if not for the cold!!!! I was really amazed at how realistically cold it was. It felt like winter!!! The rides and stuff were super cool. We couldn't stay long enough to do it all though.....like I said....chilly!!!!

Try it!. Great experience. When it's 40 degrees outside go skiing where it's -2! We had a one hour discovery lesson. the tutor was great, about 10 people in the lesson on the nursery slope. As a first timer getting all the kit yourself was a little confusing but once sorted it's great. Wished we'd had more time there.

Ski Dubai - Thoroughly Enjoyable.. Spent an afternoon here with the family. There is something for everyone - mrs went tobogganing with our older two.. good thing I didnt try it as i was scary I was told! I managed a ski lift (cough*cough) as I hate heights! and also had an hour ski lesson with my daughter - The instructors were good although they paid more attention to the 3 german girls in my group!.and I managed not to fall on my bottom for the whole hour. Very well organised. from payment to refunds and ski/boot/glove collection. Definitely will be back.
Crazy thing to do. Off course you have to explore the snow when the temperature is 50c outdoors. You can borrow proper clothing before entering the cold area. Good fun.

fantastic fun. Its kind of surreal to walk into this place when its 47 degrees outside.Actually its mind blowing if I am being honest,I have not skied in over 20 years so it took me a little while to get my groove back. It wasn't long before I was snow plugging and shooting my way around.We hired everything from the centre. All well proved and good quality.We have never laughed so much. LOVED IT

Whoo-Hoo!!. most unexpected pleasure on this trip to the desert! Imagine take an escalator while wearing your skis! The slope was great! I made about 15 runs in the early afternoon, and then went to the beach!
Ski Dubai Is Incredible. Ski Dubai is an experience for a lifetime. I have never had the chance of skiing indoors and this was an incredible experience. I would highly recommend this to anyone.

Fantastic facility. The biggest indoor Snowcentre in the world and it certainly has some fantastic attractions for all the family. Located in the Mall of the Emirates. Don't miss the penguin shows from 2pm onwards as they are a star attraction.

Should be good for learning but spoiled by learning slope management. An indoor place like this should be an ideal place for first timers to learn skiing. In normal ski slopes there is a bunny slope with a t bar or something of the sort where parents can take their kids to learn at their own pace. Here there is indeed a learning slope, but you will never have the parent/child learning experience you want because 1: you have to sign up the kids for classes and 2: you can't teach them yourself, but a stranger must do it for you. A ridiculous approach coming from what is supposed to be a family destination. Management can't possibly justify this since parents teaching their own kids is a standard worldwide at ski resorts across cultures and continents. Disappointed at this approach.

feel to be in netherland. the fun place in atmost chill like mountain.fees as affordable just 25 only.the best time to visit here is july augest.can feel the difference in and out sif=de temparature.(out side temp normaly 40 to 45 degree.the surrounding glass wall was too strong if you touch it from the outside you cant fell a single bit of chill what they made inside.after wearing all the weather jacket and safety harness we enjoied the fun...
Amazing. I have been there with my wife and ours young daughters. We loved it. The place is just what you need specially in the hot days. Charming!
Expensive. Kinda expensive, cant afford the local travelers as well as the normal peeps of there.. should reduce the prices of tickets.
Good time. I had good time with my Friends . Don't go without boots and jacket , you will freeze inside . Its is good place to visit with your family.
Ski Dubai. Great fun....just like the real thing.All equipment can be hired including ski wear, several different activities are available here...have fun!

Great Fun If Only 4 the Novelty. Didn't have high expectations for this laugh of a place and ended up having a ball.Note that you normally buy 2 or 3 hours and the system tracks you by a small card that is scanned at the base of the chair lift or J-Bar (Card sits in your sleeve so no fiddling about).The gear that is supplied is only just warm enough but it does the job for 2 hours, not so sure about the 3 hour selection :-)Note, they won't supply gloves so bring your own or be prepared to buy some.I went in the middle of the week in August and the numbers were about right for a good mix of socialising and skiing without having to avoid others.

Skiing in the desert. I would never imagine I will be skiing in the desert at 45*C. There's a skiing slope in the Emirates shopping mall in Dubai where you can enjoy an adventure, rather get a cold moment considering the heat outside. The temperature is -5*C, artificial snow is well prepared. It is obviously not as skiing in France alps but you can have a go ;).

Ski Dubai. Went here with my 3 year old son, who absolutely loved it. Nice and clean with very helpful staff.They provide full winter clothing on arrival but you do need to get a locker which is 25 AED roughly £5.Due to my son being below 1.4 metered he wasn't allowed to go on the Speed Bullet (zip wire) so we went for the Super pass which was 250 AED which is £44 per person. The giant zorbs and the bob sleigh have a minimum height restriction of 1 metre. Both are very good fun!! Especially the giant zorbs! The penguin shows are a must! But they run every few hours so make sure you ask when the next one upon arrival.Good fun day out temperature inside is roughly -3 degrees compared to the 45 degrees outside!!
Only in Dubai. Fun for the whole family. Only in Dubai can you snow ski in the desert. My daughter actually learned how to ski there when we lived in Dubai a few years ago. Fun experience.

Snow skiing in the desert. Only in Dubai could you find such a structure. It was enormous. It was 40 degrees outside and minus something inside. They thought of everything. You are supplied with ski jacket, trousers and helmet, gloves and socks, boots and obviously skis. There was hardly anyone there when we went so the wait time for the chair lift was negligible so we spent most of the time skiing. They have some great runs which by indoor standards were fabulous. As an experienced skier it didn't challenge me but I was there for my kids and they had a fabulous time. The operation was very efficiently run and they had lots of special touches to make you feel like you were in the Alps. Definitely worth a visit unless you come from a country where you ski every weekend!
chilling place. if one needs to enjoy snow climate in an oven hot desert climate like dubai then this is the place where u would go which has a same place and climate as an real snowy climate

THE PENGUINS. if you had to have a god reason to visit a ski resort in the desert... then ill like to tell you the only reason is to see the penguins! Those lil guys go threw alot but something tells me they are pampered better then most of the people who work there.

Surprisingly like the real thing. With extra things to do including zorbing, toboganing,and sliding down slopes on rubber rings, but the best bit of all was the Penguin Encounter - even for teenage boys this was a winner. I hadn't realised that penguins were so interesting, nor did they smell of fish.
Definitely going there again. I loved it , i loved the snow, i loved the games , and the penguins are adorable i wished there were more games though but it is amazing
Awesome experience. Very cool experience and affordable. Was not crowded at all. You have to have some ski experience however. Overall awesome experience

Amazing fun and cold!. So much fun! I had a ski lesson while my friend skied on her own, and it was a great experience! We met the penguins (soooo cute!) and did all the other fun activities - tobogganing, zorbing, zip wire, tubing! So much fun and so worth the money!Can't go to Dubai without going here and getting in the cold for a bit!

Freezing Fun!. Fun for all ages. If going on a weekend, I recommend you go early in the day (preferably as soon as they open) as it can get quite crowded. There is enough to do for a good 3-4 hours before you feel like an ice cube and more importantly, there is enough to do for the whole family regardless of age.
Wonderful . -2 degrees in Dubai I can't believe....woo hooo... It was a fantastic experience...but I stay only half an hour...it was too cold for me....
not too impressed. Very expensive. not really worth it if you're not gonna ski or snowboard. Not that great if you're a beginner either

Winter Wonderland in the desert. Amazing experience. My 11 year old daughter actually enjoyed the penguin encounter the most. The novelty of being in the attraction is also great. It is a bit of an investment, so I would not recommend for small children that will want to leave in 10 minutes.
Family time.. Always a brilliant place to take the kids. Every once in a while its nice to get out of the heat and visit Ski Dubai.

Satisfaction lacks. It's very wonderful traction I must say to have fun in the artificial winter that too in Dubai but since being as tourist I found it very costly comparative to the satisfaction it gives.I don't remember the price exactly right is but the figure was big
The best snow experience. Fantastic place, from ski lessons to penguin feeding and riding chair lifts and fun games--- this place is absolutely coooooolllllllll....

Overrated . Not that much of an interest to me. Its a fake snow with a fake slopes. Interesting how to manage to keep on the snow in the middle of the desert. Worth passing if you are a ski fan or just looking in emirates mall.

Cool Place. Well we did not have the time ! But we inspected the area and it looked fabulous and well worth the money if you have the time. Lets tell your friends that you went skiing in the Mall. What a fantastic idea!
PERFECT SKI. Supreme service by counter staffSuperb arrangements Support staff very helpful Must go for all families Please make sure for some time u make u r kids wear inners or some warm clothes.
Enjoyed the place. its very nice to visit place which has below 0 deg temperature in the hot dubai. fun for all the kids and well as grown ups.
Well worth it . It's just incredible to see this sky slope with real snow in Dubai. Worth the trip and to give it a go. It's very clean , well organised and good value . Kids will.love it .

amazing place. what an experience of snow in desert.Very well maintained .Activities inside will make you feel like a kid.Good place to hang around with kids but not for very long.You can stay inside for max 1 hour as u start feeling cold and your feet in shoes become numb.But one hour is ok for all d experience.If you want to stay longer then you should wear something very warm beneath d body suits they provide.Very well managed area.staff is friendly and ready to help.Interaction with penguins is awesome .They have learning session of skiing with kids also.

Biked through Dreamdays.ae. I booked my experiences through Dreamdays.ae and they are the ones who make my trip all planned ... All ali need to tell them the time and date and there its done ...Doing this as one of the dreamdays experience was worthwhile .. I wish only I could spend a whole day there ..

Snow... so much snow!!. I took my kids to Ski Dubai which is located in the Mall of the Emirates. People like us from tropical places just cannot get enough of the place. There's so much you can do here, learn to ski, take a ride on the snow cart, etc.

Remarkable memory... It is one of wonderful in Dubai. It was located inside the mall of emirates. It was very surprised outside temp was 45 deg but inside temp is below o deg. They provided jacket, shoe and shocks also within the package.

Fun day and fun way to escape the heat. This isn't world class skiing but let's face it, it's pretty cool to ski inside a mall while its 120 degrees outside. That said, the ecologist in me had a hard time with the land of excess that Dubai is. But if you're there, you gotta try ski Dubai. They whole family had fun and best yet, my 5 year old really gained confidence in this controlled environment. Look forward to hitting the real slopes with her soon.
Fantastic. This is extremely great work, very large Ski area indoor, there are some interesting game people can enjoy or learn how to ski also very fantastic
Visit on march 2015. Nice experience, from 40 degree celcium got into -2 celcium, can be cheaper, everything was provided, costumes etc.

A kids highlight. This activity was a highlight for our kids, they will remember forever. Even fun for the parents. All the equipment is included in the price, including the jacket and snow pants. just bring a hat and gloves and enjoy!.

It's always winter within hottest summer in Ski Dubai. It's freezing cold inside move around or your limps will freeze, I enjoyed everything there and my kids was so happy playing with snow in the most hot spots in the world, quite awkward but so much fun.

Great Ski School. Terrible phone reservation system.. Best place to learn to ski. I actually got an angry reaction in Chamonix from their ski school when I answered to their queries on where my 7 year old had leaned to ski to such advanced level. LOL. Too bad its phone reservation system is IMPOSSIBLE. I tried and tried and even considered meditation before getting the personal mobile of one of the instructors.

49 degrees celcius outside, -2 inside!. THIS EXPERIENCE WAS EPIC! DO NOT MISS THIS! In 2012, my family and I travelled through Dubai and we didn't stop in. This time, whilst there with friends, we did and I'm so glad we did! This experience is perfect for the whole family because there is so much to do even if you don't want to ski or snowboard (like penguins and super awesome ice activities!!!). There are 2 ski runs, a chairlift, a T-bar (what do they call those lifts that you put between your legs...a puma?) and a beginner slope with a couple of magic carpets. You can literally hire all of your ski gear and just wear any regular clothes underneath. It's really cool looking out through the glass at the side and into the shopping centre. There's a cafe halfway up the slope and it's just such a cool experience. The slopes are also really well maintained! DO THIS! DO NOT HESITATE BECAUSE YOU'VE BEEN SKIING IN OTHER PLACES! I've been regular skiing a bunch of times but this is such an awesome experience and I didn't get bored.
AMAZING LOCATION!!. Very nice location, connected with mall of emirates,After you finish snowboarding you can go for shopping.Good Job!!
Great Indoor theme park. A fine indoor ski in the desert!!. It was 43degC outside and -4degC inside. We had a great time with the family.

Different yet brilliant. Love this place as it's somewhere so different and is nice to goto at Christmas time to attempt to make it feel more like winter. Good ground for what it is and they provide good quality equipment. Have the option of two lifts however I find that the drag lift is quite prone to breaking down. Otherwise, the facilities are excellent and is definitely somewhere different to visit in dubai.
Good Value. Enjoyed the 2 hour session for snowboarding, good value and a break from the heat. No need to pre book, just turn up and enjoy. Everything provided, but take your own gloves and hat.
Good ski instruction. learn to ski safely here - fun for kids and instructors are knowledgable and pleasant.Our girls learned to ski here.

from Minus 4 to plus 45- only in Dubai!. Attended here this morning- located in the mall of the emerates, and easy to find with St Moritz café situated outside where you can watch the goings on in comfort.Very Hot in Dubai at the moment and plus 45 temp outside, gave way to minus 4 on the ski slope here. Very well organised in paying, collecting jacket and sallopetes, then acquiring skis and boots. You actually weigh and measurer your height and print off a slip where your skis are given according to experience and Body mass index (which they should be, but many don't bother).You get a locker put onto your lift pass which you receive 20 Durhams back at the end for returning it to electronic system- again easily done.We got there at 09.30 am before it was busy- as it does get packed later in the day. 2Hours cost us 200 Durhams each, and it was worth it.Seasoned skiers like ourselves got bored after half an hour but we managed to last it out an hour. Only a couple of runs, and not a black as advertised, just a simple red really, but lack of crowds early when we got on, made it able to ski fast and it was enjoyable.You get free socks but now have to pay for gloves at the shop if you want them- we didn't bother- but it was cold on the hands after a while!Actually the jacket an pants were very well fitted, and loose, though had no pockets in them- so if you wanted a drink whilst on the slope, it meant you had to return to collect money- unless you keep some money elsewhere on your person.Overall a very good experience and well organised.

Have to snow in the desert!. Great family fun on our holiday in the desert. We had a ball! We did a package that only included skiing for 2 hours which suited us perfectly. We have only had one skiing holiday in the past so we found the slopes fun and challenging enough for our experience.

A ski slope in the desert, what's not to love?. I'd heard about this place years ago and made sure to see it while in Dubai. Why not? A ski slope in the desert! I didn't ski there but went inside and took the ski lift to the top and then back down again. The ski lift gives you an awesome aerial view of the entire slope. I loved the view from up there and watching the skiers. Being in there was an amazingly cool experience. Your ticket comes with clothes to keep you warm, access to some free activities inside at the bottom of the slope (lots of stuff for kids), and I think a free hot chocolate if I'm not mistaken.I loved this experience and am glad I got to experience it!

Wow- my family loved it.. I am from Wisconsin so well used to cold weather/snow tubing but something like this in hot weather of Dubai is a treat. Where: Mall of Emirates, accessible by MetroCost: 55 USDThey Provide: Free Gloves, Free Jackets/snow pants/Socks/Shoes. Locker rent 25 AED ~ 7USD, bigger rental available in men roomsTip: Super pass is good enough, Snow tubing/Chairlift/Snow Ball, Penguine March included. Do Listen to presentation during Snow March, you may win a free Penguine Personal Enounter :)

far out place. kids had a blast, stayed there for 7 hours on a stopover in dubai, penguin encounter is so worth it, kids loved kissing the king penguin and funny Mitty penguin who likes to take poses. the rides foe me are so scary but kids enjoyed them tremendously especially the zorb balls. a bit pricey but worth it.

One of the best places. one of the most Exciting places you have to visit in Dubai Mall of Emirates, whenever I go there I have to enter with my Family for almost the whole day where we enjoy all Ice games and watch Penguins.
ski is fun in summer. my kids have fun there but it was so crouded and so cold for littel one i hope they keep going it was so nice place in summer to go.

Good afternoon out . If your in Dubai I would recommend ski Dubai but only if you can ski ... As they will pull you off if you can't but there is a place to get tuition and learn if that's what you need ... It's not that cold and you won't need a hat or gloves (as long as you don't fall over a lot ) so don't be conned into getting them as it's the only thing you don't hire... There is a steep run and a not so steep run and the penguins don't come out till 5pm so be aware of that if that is what you are going for...

Enjoyed it much!. I came here with my niece. We really enjoyed the activities inside. The food also was great. One of the best things was meeting the penguins! They were very cute and fun to watch. This place is highly appropriate for families and children.

Ski Dubai..... If with a family -- little expensive.. Make sure you have enough time and energy for the ski lessons. Lessons start at the top of the hour. Mind you... their snow shoes are the HEAVIEST you'll ever wear in your lifetime. may be 3 or 4 KG .....(each). Don't spend too much on all the packages. Ski lessons should be fine.

Dubai - SKI Dubai, A Leisure Trip with Family. It was our 2nd day in Dubai on 26-07-2015, we went to the Mall of Emirates to enjoy SKI Dubai, we spend more than 6 hours but I think even after 6 hours we don’t want to come back from SKI Dubai.We enjoyed the followings;Fantastic SnowIce cave with ice sculptures - a dragon and some swans. Penguins ShowRolling ball Chair lift, drag lift. Ski shop.Even many more I cannot express my feelings in words.We meet 2 types of penguins and even touch them. You can touch them & hug them. They are well trained and smart. Pictures or videos aren't allowed. They have their own photographer and you have to pay to get your pictures and it's a little expensive.I would recommend every too must visit SKI Dubai with family , friends and relatives. It really a wonderful place. Syed Shahrukh Riaz

Nice 2 hours of ski. We had some free hours before our back flight and we decided to ski for 2 hours. As we do ski, we didn't need trainers, but such are available. 2 hours were enough as we were not well prepared for the minus 2-3 degrees Celsius inside. Although they give you ski jacket, trousers and socks, it was cold for the children wearing just short pants and thin jackets. If you want you can buy gloves additionally. Although very crowded fortunately most of the visitors were not skiing, but using other attractions and there were no queues for the ski lifts. The slope is relatively short but you can make a lot of runs.
Must do when in Dubai. Great for a couple of hours, it does get a bit boring after that the slope being too small. A must do when in Dubai.

well it was in the middle of a desert. This resort is located in one of the biggest shopping malls. It was a great experience to ski in a closed area with fake snow =) I highly recommend it for that experience. Dont expect anything more its not so big like a mountain of course.

Penguins!!. We went there mostly for the Penguins. You can meet 2 types of penguins and even touch them. You can touch them, hug them and kiss them. They are well trained and smart. Pictures or videos aren't allowed. They have their own photographer and you have to pay to get your pictures and it's a little expensive..
Wonderful for my kids. Wonderful for my kids they really enjoyed a lot Dubai was memorable experience for us ! Would like to visit once again !
A ski in the middle of the desert ! Well worth the visit. Went to the snow garden with my kids and they loved it ! well organised , a bit expensive if you have 3 kids like me , but worth a try once.

Extraordinary. Visited Ski Dubai in Jul and frankly i didn want to come out even after 4hrs. A wonderfull and beautifull experience to be enjoyed either alone or with family n kids(my kids loved it). Remember to rent a locker of you have a Super Sky Pass at the counter itself and bring ur own woolen gloves as its much better than the thin gloves they provide gratis. hav a coffee at the snack bar. will definetly go back again.

Just wish it was longer!. Great attraction... I learnt to ski here (at age 45) and have since skied in Australia, Iran and Germany (better views!).It is well managed and reasonable value. Two hours is enough as after that it gets a bit boring... no views. Best to get there right on opening time at 10.00am as the slopes are not crowded and the piste is as smooth as a snooker table.When you come out a plethora of restaurants and shopping. Do it!!

Brilliant and safe penguins are cute. The indoor arena is absolutely amazing the snow is brilliant the instructors are fantastic kids are safe and penguins are so cute, for 32 quid it is worth every penny just to say you done it it the desert,Go and enjoy it

Ski in the desert. a contradiction and show of wealth. build a ski slope in the desert - but it works. good for all (most ski abilities). You don't need anything they provide everything - socks boots etc. There are instructors, to a great zip wire, zorbing slides. Take time out for an experience or practice your skiing - a worthwhile distraction
Snow. Great to see snow in the middle of the desert, what an experience going inside to coming back out. One warning though watch out for the 15 yr old 'emirates' they own the joint and are good.

Pretty good for an indoor ski field. My friend and I went to ski Dubai despite being amateur skiers. Once inside you do feel like your in a real ski field. There is a good area for the kids with a Range of activities but I find that ski Dubai is more for expert skiers. There is only a small hill for people like my friend and I to ski down and that's it. You can go on the chairlift but if you get off at the top the hill you have to come down is extremely tall and long and is for expert skiers only. You don't have to get off at the top, you can just make your way back down. I probably wouldn't go back but if your an avid skier I think it would be great

busy and pricey. we just wanted to get everyone a chance to experience, but when we couldn't even bring our 1 year old in, that meant that someone would have to wander around the mall with a 1 year old while everyone else was inside. I am not saying I want my one year old sledding or skiing or anything like that, but I would like to watch the three year old sled with my husband or see the penguins while holding the one year old at the bottom of the hill......that shouldn't be too much to ask for
koooll.... First time experience of ice in an artificial environment. .. My kids n nieces freaked out on the slides. they even got to poise with the penguins. super fun...

Skiing to new heights. Just amazing -2 degrees inside , heat wave outside. Everything you need to learn to ski is here, just be prepared to enjoy and have fun in the snow. Bragging rights skiing in the Mall of the Emirates.
Good day. Good place for children to visit at Emirate Mall. But I think it needs more activities than what it has now which could give more entertainment for adults .

Very nice!. Love it! Perfecr place to be in a hot weather. The staff is good. We try only normal entrance, we just been there for 2 hours caouse its enough time. But next time want to try with a class for begining lever ski.

A surreal & enjoyable experience, but expect to queue. Located within the Mall of the Emirates. Myself and a friend visited on a late afternoon/early evening on a weekday in August. It was 45C outside, but -4C in Ski Dubai!Pros:-Surreal - snow in the Middle East!-Fun. -Ice cave with ice sculptures - a dragon and some swans. -Cafes - Avalanche Cafe (heated indoor with 'outdoor' seating/portable heaters), Snow Bullet Cafe ('outdoor' cafe with portable heaters), Ice Cafe bar (non-alcoholic drinks).-Chair lift, drag lift. -Ski shop. Cons:-Admission = 150 AED for 'Snow Bullet' zip-wire (2 runs), but this included the ski jacket & trousers.-Locker = 25 AED. -Queue for tickets, long queue for ski jacket & trousers, queue for locker ticket, queue for chairlift, queue for Snow Bullet zip-wire.-Staff issuing ski jacket & trousers looked miserable. -Mobbed with children as Saudi Arabia school holidays. Notes: -Take gloves, hat and a jumper/fleece jacket. -Ski hire and ski lessons are available. Plus a zorbing, tubing and a toboggan run. -There is also a penguin show featuring live penguins. You can watch it for free from the Costa Coffee.

Just like the mountains. It has a chair lift and great snow- a great morning or afternoon activity and its nice and cool excaping from the heat. well run, but you must be able to ski or board, otherwise you will have to have lessons.

Blow off some steam here!!. The hottest place I have been to (Dubai) has an enclosed snow park. Its true. Its cold and the rides are fun. You can take the Super Pass which is 300 DHS instead of the Power Pass which is 250 DHS. The advantage is an extra ride in that 50. You can learn how to Ski for an hour and then avail of all the rides in the park. Should take 3-4hours to complete. They give you a pair of gloves and socks to wear and then take home and also give ski wear and shoes. A locker is also provided where you can lock your belongings if you don’t want to carry them inside. It gets quite cold inside. Be properly clothed.You can also get your pictures clicked for free but if you want a copy, you need to pay at the exit.

Surprising good fun. We decided one evening to do Ski Dubai.. being skiers we thought it would be a fun kind of easy thing. It was fun and it was amazing to realise when we were at the top- this was man made! they provide all the gear except the gloves you can buy cheaply. it was not outrageously expensice for what it is and it passed a memorable fun evening for us. it is well organised and arranged and their is staff there at all times to assist you no matter your skiing level
Unique. Pretty boring after a while. The chair lift is very very slow. But glad I had the experience of skiing in one of the hotest places on earth.

Skiing in the tropic weather. It did look great fun, although I didn't try it as I think I would be a rubbish skier. Everyone seemed to be enjoying it. Most of the people attending were from Dubai, so it was very unusual for them having snow around and being cold!I think it was reasonable to hire the equipment and to spend some time in there. A very unusual experience with the extreme heat outside of the Mall.
Fun in the snow. When in Dubai go to Emirates Mall to see the Ski centre and you can even go inside to experience it as well, and the Emirates Mall is also amazing.

If you like queuing then this is for you. I took a bunch of my work colleagues to ski dubai for a work outing, big mistake! We got access to the snow park as none of us ski or board, we were expecting to sledge, ski lift, snowball fight, watch penguins, zorb, etc..... Instead we queued for an hour to get a zorb which lasted all of 3 seconds. The ski lift queue was slightly less but still a decent wait, and this was just about all there was to do. For the entrance fee, none of us thought it was worth it and we won't be visiting again.My tip is to wrap up very warm as you'll do lots of standing around in the cold.Very disappointing experience
Good experience. Allow around 2 hours to maximize the value of your visit. For people whose exposure to snow is limited, it is a good experience

Best place to Beat the Heat in Dubai. Ski- dubai is best place were u can beat the heat and got some snow rides, do not forgot to take penguin encounter in your itinerary, Its the best part iloved the only cons is they do not allow personnel cameras just to make money they are handing over you unproffesional photographs of ur penguin encounter for prices higher than that of ticket rates.... it way to take ur moneyLoved penguin Encounters the penguin trainers are really great they know their penguins and love each other..Overall A very nice experience with some wonderfull memories.....

Ski Dubai. We visited Ski Dubai the early afternoon of Sunday, August 2nd. To say it was crowded would be an understatement. When you enter, you first select and purchase the package you want. Then you get your gloves (fleece ones are free and waterproof ones cost extra). Then you get in another line for your boots, ski pants and ski jacket. Think confusing and exhausting. While waiting in line for our boots, pants and jacket the family of 8 in front of us didn't know their correct sizes and the poor attendant had to go back and forth to get them their correct sizes which turned out to be extra large and extra extra large. Just admit you are never going to get that in a medium size pants and jacket and move on! We rode the chair lift first since the line was short. Then we waited in other lines and they seemed to last forever especially for the Zorb. All the while our feet are getting frostbitten. We were told throwing snow balls is not allowed. How lame is that. It appeared that all of the workers inside didn't like the cold weather because they were all cranky and never smiled or appeared the least bit happy. To tell you the truth I couldn't blame them. After spending about 2.5 hours inside my wife and 9 year old son determined it was time to go and I wholeheartedly agreed. We purchased the photo that was taken of us on the chair lift which was very good. A couple of days later we were walking by Ski Dubai and saw how empty it was because it had just opened. I realized that should have been the time that we went in and the place would have been way more enjoyable. We can check this off of our bucket list and probably will never go again.

We were provided with ski clothes and socks and brought our own beanies and gloves. We ski at home so the slope was not a challenge at all, but still a fun way to spend a couple of hours. Our only disappointment was that there were no "Ski Dubai" T-shirts for sale, but oh well.If you pay with a MasterCard they give you a discount of either 10% or 20% (sorry, don't recall), but if you pay with a Visa, there is no discount. Plan a little extra time to get geared up - especially if it is busy. They pay special attention to getting the ski bindings adjusted properly for your weight and skiing ability, so it is worth the wait.

Excellent experience at Ski Dubai. When looking at things to do in Dubai this was top of our list and it did not disappoint. I think due to the concept of going out on snow slopes in the dessert really appealed to us. We decided to go for the Power Pass after looking at the various options and we are so glad we did. This included access to the snowpark area and we had a discovery lesson. The snow park had some great rides from toboggan, tubing and going in a giant snowball. The discovery lesson was fantastic! I've been skiing in Europe before so decided to try out snowboarding with my wife as she has never been. The instructor was excellent, from starting off with the basics to moving onto more advanced things, within 1 hour the group of four of us felt like we'd made amazing progress. The Powerpass we purchased was about £50 but this included access to the snowpark rides and the lesson. As well suits, snow boots, skiing/snowboarding equipment and fleeced gloves were included. Please note: snow suits are very thing and you will need a layer or to underneath. We brought ski gloves with us and purchased hats.Definitely a great place to go if you want to learn if you've never been before. Experienced skiers/boarders could find the slopes a bit tedious after a few goes! Great activity to do in Dubai and I thought it was reasonably priced as well.

If you have the entertainer , saves you loads . Also MasterCard had a 20% off the super pass ticket . 3. If you don't do the penguin encounter , do have a peak near the entrance , you can see them and see them swimming , and they do run some 15 minutes marches show at several times that is free and you see them quite close , you just don't touch them . 4. Do get a pouch bag or something that you can put your money and camera , as the suits have no pocket and it is quite a hassle getting things out and back in . 6. If you have gloves , bang with you , they provide you with fleece that are not water proof but also they don't have good size for little ones . Surreal experience. We had a 15 hour layover in Dubai, so we hopped on the Metro and rode out to Emirates Mall to kill some time.
