Skying in the desert? In Dubai is possible!!. I have been in Ski Dubai few times and always enjoyed it. It is a strange feeling to be on a slope with a snowboard under your feet while outside there are 50 degrees C. The slope is short and might be a bit boring for experts, but it is challenging enough for beginners and regular users. Very funny with friends. Just note that inside there are -4 degrees and without sunlight it is going to be very cold. The facility provides you with a ski jacket and trousers but are very light, hence bring your own hat, gloves and wear a pullover if you are sensible to cold climate. Tip: sky for the time you have paid. After it you might go and enjoy a hot chocolate at the Alpine cafe built at the middle of the slope.

45 degrees outside and I'm in ski gear !. There's something surreal about re-living the cold feet skiing situation when it's 45 degrees outside ! Only in Dubai..There's lot of mucking about in getting started - buying the ticket, getting the clothes & boots then getting your snowboard and finally getting out on the slope. It could be made a little more efficient: fortunately we went in the middle of the day in Ramadan when it wasn't too busy but it still took close to an hour to finally get organised. I hate to think what it's like when busy.You then get out on the slope. The snow quality is reasonable (for artificial, indoor snow). It certainly is not to dis-similar to the made made stuff on Australian ski resorts. As expected, the run is very short (all over in less than 1 minute) which makes the 10 minute lift ride to the top unbearably slow and frustrating. There are, however, a few decent rails but with a very hard landing - they could pad the landing site with a little bit more snow. The upper set of rails also ends at the top of a beginner carpet which means you have to be careful otherwise you could land on a bunch of beginners (most of whom don't really know about jumps and looking up the mountain etc.)Overall, something interesting in the desert. Good intermediate and experts will be bored pretty quickly. They really need to speed the lift up to make it more than a 12 minute cycle (with 1 minute of downhill)

Snow in a desert land. I have been in UAE since 2 years but never got the chance to visit the ski Dubai. Recently some friends came and we decided to visit this place. To be frank, it was very interesting, thrilled, adventurous and enjoyable besides the cold and freezing atmosphere. U am sure to visit it again with more companies. Who could have imagined to see such a place in a desert land, without forgetting the adorable pinguine .Ski Dubai, see you soon...
Ski lesson too short. Had a good time as ski dubai, make sure you do book for beginners and advance ski lesson, as the beginner one is just too short.

Snow in the Desert!. Ski Dubai was a pretty great experience from start to finish.Offers an amazing snow setting to enjoy skiing.You can take skiing lessons or enjoy the snow park.All in all, a great experience.
Skiing in Dubai. We didn't ski, but it was fun to watch the skiing when it's a very hot 45 degrees outside. Not a lot of places to watch, but good way to pass the time.

Ski Dubai - lots of people, but actually very few on the ski slopes - great!. Ski Dubai has broadened its offering in six years since I last visited it. The Ski slope is still there, and still the longest indoor snow slope I have visited (much longer than typical UK indoor ski slopes), and the other (non ski) activities (penguins, sledging, zorbing balls, chair lift rides, etc.) made the place look very busy at first, but actually the number of people actually skiing was small and so the slopes were actually fairly empty. In fact, you could argue that all these non skiers were actually subsidising the real skiers. So thank you.

Great snow experience in the desert. The experience was great, from taking pictures with the Penguins and snow fights, was all very interesting for us and the kids. Adequate provision for protective clothing and safety . Quite a number of activities for both kids and adults.

Ski Dubai. Absolutely loved our trip here, we spent the morning and it was my first time zorbing, going on a flying fox and hanging out in an indoor ski bubble! We also did the penguin encounter experience, which I can highly recommend, although it was super freezing during the encounter.
Sikring in a mall in Dubai. fantastic experience. 40 degrees celsius outside and 400 meters with skislope inside a mall. Try it, you wont regret it

Great for young learners. Our 5-year old tried her first steps on ski in Ski Dubai and we were very pleased with the quality of the trainer (Natasha), the well organised activity.We got the full set of ski suit, boots and skis, including the warm socks, all we needed to bring was the gloves.There are lockers and clean bathrooms.Especially during the summer, the sun is too hot during the daytime so we had to look for indoor activities. This was one of the most successful ones.
Snow in the desert. Great novelty but for a good boarder/skier boring after first 10 mins. Great to be able to do though.

impossible do not visit it. thecnologically impressive has been builded almost 20 years ago.it is always full and to see peole seriously sky on the snow in the middle of the desert, will give you an idea tha very soon humanity will and on Mars
Cold in the heat. It is a great experience to have fun in a very hot day, you can escape the heat and do some fun sports. It will never be as good as a outdoors ski, but is definitely worth trying.
Winter Sports in the Summer!. Fancy a place to do winter sports in the Spring, Summer or Fall? Ski Dubai is an amazing place to enjoy the thrills of winter all year round.

Penguins are my favorite creatures. How can you not be impressed seeing a ski resort in the middle of desert with 112 degrees Fahrenheit around you? How can you remain cold and apathetic seeing penguins in the country that has no natural conditions for them? I applaud those who came up with such an idea of bringing the best of the world to Dubai. I wish people who live in Dubai and their children appreciate what is done for them there.

Great All Round Experience. My husband took our 10 year old and 12 year old sons to this ski slope, and their were slope options for all of them. Beginners, blue/green and black runs. There were t-bars and chair lifts, however the chair lifts were quite slow as a lot of people go in their just to ride the chair-lift and not ski. Jackets, pants and boots are included in the price. Not gloves or beanies. It is a lot colder than skiing outdoors. There was a nice cafe half way up the slopes, however, as it was Ramadan that was shut, until sunset. The slopes were open until 2.00am because of Ramadan!There is also a live penguin colony at the bottom of the slopes. Very Really well organised.

FUN!. This is a really cool technical achievement place to visit and ski.Dubai is in the middle of the desert and so, it's amazing how it can be 120 degrees (F) outside and then below zero degrees inside. Yes, it's freezing inside. You do need to bring your winter/ski clothes with you or use the ones that are provided by the attraction. Of course, the steepness of the slope is a "bunny hill" compared to real mountains, but it's has a "cool" factor that is not available any where else.So, it's a good place to learn how to ski if you haven't already tried skiing in the past, it's a fun place for intermediate skiiers, but probably very boring/short for more advanced skiiers.

Great fun day out. We had already done the skiing so tried the winter wonderland experience with our young boys. Initially it did not seem well organised as we were left to find our own way as to where things are, and the constant pressure to get professional photos done was wearing thin after the 3rd asking in 10mins... However, the zorbing and sledging were great fun. The boys really loved it, as did we! Recommend it for a family with young kids who want something different in Dubai... Just avoid the photographers.
Fantastic. Stuck in the desert and it's too hot to go out strolling, ski Dubai is your place, located inside a shopping mall, you should not miss this.

Exciting place to be.... What more can one ask, than to Ski in hot climate in Dubai in a wonderful Ski atmosphere... Lot's of activities are on hand for any kind of skier... they hv made this into a fun place for kids as well as beginners & serious ski enthusiast...Classes & group classes are also held to make this a fun place to visit for visitors & residents alike...
Had a blast. It may not be the Alps or even a real mountain but it was a lot of fun. Good value for money and would be great afternoon activity for the family. Remember to bring your socks.

Didn't enjoy. If skiing is your thing you will not enjoy skiing here. A small slope made for beginners and it doesn't make you feel like you're skiing. It's amazing though, being able to ski in the middle of a shopping center while everyone in the mall are wearing tops and shorts while you are wearing skiing outfit.
Snow World. Must Must visit place.... too good for kids.... lot of activities within, brilliantly made with lots n lots of Ice.

Something different. To enjoy skiing at -4'C in the Middle East next to cancer tropic and n middle of desert of dubai.. Is something amazing ..
Kids can play safely n adults can wander or go real slope skiing..

Beautifully over the top!. Skiing indoors on a day when outside the feel factor was at 48C is in itself something hard to comprehend. Worth a visit although if you are a skier like me you will not be impressed by the slope but you will be amazed by the achievement!
SKI DUBAI. I love this place, as i always spend one day there during my visit. in this way i can get in a nice day skiing even when it is 45 degrees outside. I JUST LOOVE IT !

Very Close to Reality!. It was totally worth it
Small but worth the visit. Drawn here by the hype around it. Not too much impressed. but definitely a place you must see. Worth the visit even just to look at it....

Lovely family fun for kids. Ski Dubai is an excellent place to entertain your kids. If amazement was not limited to finding a ski set up in a desert, the place has it all: Ski slope, tobogganing, an igloo, plenty of ice. Equipment is up for grabs and you can suit up in a parka, helmet and proper shoes before you enter. The place also has an adjoining cafeteria serving snacks and beverages. A cool place to hang out with your family. A must on a Dubai visit. Located inside the Mall of Emirates, my favorite haunt in Dubai.

Magical ski slope. This place is just amazing, an indoor ski slope attached to the Emirates Mall, there's a ski lift an area to ski board and a toboggan area as well as ample ski area.It's like something out of Disneyworld.
Fantastic fun time with family. Very good place for fantastic fun time with family. It gives a feel of amazing Dubai, where you can enjoy ice scatting also!

Snow and ski in the middle of the hot summer........ The first indoor ski resort in the Middle East, you’ll be skiing on real snow here, which means the the temperature is kept to a slightly chilly -4 degrees C. Winter clothes are included with your ski pass, so you don’t have to worry about the temperature, especially as you can order a hot chocolate at the mid-station Avalanche Cafe. Or if you’re just watching, head to St Moritz Cafe at the entrance.

the coldest fun in dubai. nice place, its freezing inside afer 15 minutes u feel that so make sure you do buy gloves from outside they are chargable especially with children most tour organisers dont include the cable chair ride inside with snowpark entry thats worth doing so make sure u buy tickets before hands before entering skiing is only allowed if you are a proffessional skier over all good place 1-1.5 hours more than enough to enjoy inside because its too cold even if we are packed with jackets and lowers

Great family fun in the Snow Park. We had a fabulous morning (4 hours) at ski Dubai located in mall of Emirates. We were lucky to get a Ramadan special for 200 AED per person which included gloves (which can be upgraded to ski gloves) a locker, unlimited rides on the toboggan, sledges, zorb balls and tubes plus a return chair lift ride and a snow bullet (zip line) ride (children must be over 30kg). It was a Thursday and really quiet. Still expensive (as everything is in Dubai) but a fun way for our children to experience snow for the first time. With a burning 44 degrees outside I had some concerns about -4 degrees inside, but we only felt cold following our ride on the Snow Bullet, after which we went back into the changing area for a quick warm up before returning inside for more fun. Clothes provided seemed thin initially, but were actually very functional. Note - you place your pass in a zipped pocked on your left sleeve and this gets scanned for some rides. There are no other pockets in the clothing, so wear clothes with pockets underneath if you wish to take your camera with you. Take a hat and scarf along, but no need to dress really warm. Staff inside were very friendly and happy to make rides on the tubes and zorbs as tame or as exciting as you wanted. Snow bullet was fun - not scary, but relaxing, thrilling and very cold on the face!We didn't ski but it would be a great place to learn if you are an apprehensive first timer.

Great time! No black Diamond . I would like to start out by saying, it definitely does not have a black Diamond run like the website says. It was a pretty easy slope. But then again I come from Canada and have been skiing on pretty amazing Hills. You can totally pick up some speed from top to bottom though! Overall it was a great experience. I bought the unlimited day ski pass because it wasn't much more then the two hour pass. Although the two hour pass would have probably been sufficient because it gets somewhat repetitive quickly. If you can bring your own gloves and touqe. Those are the only two things not included in the ticket. It cost 25usd for a basic pair of insulated gloves. Fleece ones are cheaper.

If you love the expeirience of it - a novelty. The impossible made possible in Dubai . It is fun place for a change from the routine life .the scale is astounding .The crowd gets bigger - most attractive activity even to watch. Go for the Fun .

Snow in the middle of the desert. even though the slopes are not like what you will find in Switzerland, the place is worth a visit. it is a very good place for beginners to start skiing. Also, there is the snow park where you can spend some time walking around with your children+ some games. on top of the skiing slope there is a small coffee shop which you can go to whether or not you want to ski.

If you miss snow only. If you miss skiing, and miss the chill of snow, you will enjoy this place. If you don't know how to ski, and just want to experience snow, there isn't much to do.Kids will enjoy this more than adults.6/10
amazing visit: experiencing Snow in Dubai. Amazing to see snow in desert of Dubai, great for kids families and couples, had a great time with friends
Amazing. Very well done. Creating a big artificial ski area, with rides and full entertainment for all ages, is worth seeing when you are in dubai
Ski in a shopping mall!. Loved the experience....also there is the opportunity to ride the chair lift to the mid station even if you don't ski.

"COOL" idea for a "HOT" city!. Descent ski run for most anyone, but if you're more used to any other mountain ski run - it may let you down. Several activities for the family all based in a small area at the bottom of the hill, which can be crowded at times. Most visitors will spend their time in the area at the hill base, which is not always very fresh with new snow so look a bit dirty.The best place for me and my son was the time spent at mid-hill at the coffee shop having a whipped cream top hot chocolate outside on the deck over-looking the skiers. The worst was soon after arriving and going to get the supplied Winter jackets and ski pants. You may have experienced this in your past putting these items on that are not very fresh and still very damp from the last user, very icky.It not that expensive to enter unless your planning on buying anything from the gift shop which is normal Worldwide. To get some relief from the outside heat of Dubai, Ski Dubai is not all that wrong and good for a couple of hours, maybe a bit more if you wish. Ski Dubai is a touristy concept, but still a "COOL" idea for the littles ones and families all together.Chill out @ Ski Dubai,
A must visit . I highly recommend ski dubai once for every visiter.evem if u have small kids you should take them.my son..2.5yrs enjoyed a lot.

Ski Dubai The Best!. Ski Dubai was one of the best snow themed park attraction inside the Mall of the Emirates. My Family tried it out to experience real snow. The ski resort was so big and lots of areas to explore,it feels just like a real scene under the cold weather in places where there is snow. Great. Having lived in the UAE this is where our children have learned to both ski and snowboard.Staff are fantastic patient and consistent in their approach.Well worth a visit.

MIRACLE IN DESERT. This is a unique setup.Truly unbelievable as to how can they do it, especially in such a hot place like Dubai.!Clothes are available on hire at a nominal fee.Snow is artificial and is not at all sticky.My children loved to play around.

A very cool day in very hot country. a person could not be imagine without being experienced in sky dubi .when you are inter in the mall and finally go foe uniform for utmost cool you could not even think what is ahead.a totally changed atomsephire you also feel a changed region and you feel a great relif in scorching heat.a very vast area filled with ice which seemed real carrying a lot of entertaining aspects like sketing chair lifts big ball game etc.and avery rare thing the real panguines which take you to the antarkitika .all this was a very astonishing and entertaing.
Great Experience in the middle of desert. It a great place to experience snow if not experience earlier . Price could be on higher side for what you get.

Skiing in the heat. It is a fun place to visit once. Black diamond is not really that "black" but there are lifts, and ski and snowboarding gear is provided on site. Ski slope at the desert with in a stuning Mall!!!!!! Wow!!!. Got into a Geographical Surprise as a Snowboarding at the Desert! Greatly enjoyed the Idea of this Ski within a mall..... Snow and more Snow Amazing

Unique experience. We were a group of friends at the tail end of a cruise in Dubai. Since we ski together every year, thought this would be amusing. It was surreal and more fun than we imagined. A great distraction from the usual Dubai haunts and worth an afternoon!

From +30 degrees to -1 degrees. With around 40 pounds, you get a 2 hours ticket entry + equipment (ski suit, socks, gloves, boots, ski/snowboard). Even if there is a single chair lift, it's not crowded and you can have fun. Remember to bring a hat, scarf and jumper, because it can be very chilly.

theme park in a huge mall. visiting Dubai briefly last year for work, and we had a coffee and cakes stop in the magnificent Mall of the Emirates before viewing the awesome Burj Khalifa outside later on, and there was this huge glass dome right in front of us with a real ski slope inside! Dubai blows me away anyway for its sheer opulence, but this ski slope theme park inside a glass dome in a shopping mall did my head in! I have read reviews from people who have actually gone inside, and they all seem to say it is very good value and service and obviously a lot of fun, especially for kids! All I can say is, that it is just as much fun perhaps to just watch people and families in the mall (who are wearing shorts and t-shirts) go inside, put on lots of Arctic clothing and obviously freeze themselves as they go on the ski lift, tumble down the slope and so forth, and then come back outside laughing, in their desert wear again! This way you can have some free vicarious fun while having a coffee and not freeze!!

well worth visiting and the ski ing is very good. Brilliant to visit. Such an experience, actually ski ing in the desert! we enjoyed it and went back four times during our week stay. We progressed to the red and black runs which were very good ski ing. The service is very good and I would highly recommend it.
Looks fun. Observed from the shopping mall , but looks so authentic like a little ski village with cable cars , toboggan ski slopes ... Amazing

Admission comes with a snow suit and socks. The Ramadan special scores you a pair of gloves too! Awesome Experience. Indoor ski experience! That sums it up. Imagine being able to ski and toboggan anytime of the year! This is one of the must do attractions in Dubai for adults and children. Recalled childhood. Ski dubai...my children have enjoyed a lot.. Each n every ride... I am very thankful to ski dubai that recalled my childhood.. Me and my wife have enjoyed a lot.. Whatever you wont. Amazing service, perfect area for family...good price.We love huge Alp`s slopes, but in Dubai....It is fun, big fun....a lot of fan....

"Cold as it is". I recommend this for children. they will love this even the young adults. my daughter really like the snow... and the penguin named "shiela" very interesting show! a -3 degree Celsius--- what a GREAT EXPERIENCE
an cold and thrilling place. an cool place to experience winter or snowy climate even in summer season or i could say even in deserts like dubai where degree is -3 to -4

The very cold weather . The whether was too cold and the ski Dubai looks like you are in America when the temperature about -25 degree.The place is awesome there is a telifrek and other lots and lots of games.

Ski in the desert.. In Dubai if you can think it its probably already there for you to enjoy. The ski slope is inside the mall its a short run and really more for the kids to use then adults. But I still had fun.

Outside view of Ski Dubai. We visited Mall of the Emirates in May 2015 ,even though we didn't enter the ski place we had coffee at the café next door ,which has great windows so you can watch what is going on in there.The kids were having so much fun rolling down the short slopes in big round balloon things,seemed to be lots going on for children,not sure about the ski slopes or ski lift ,but it certainly made for an interesting show for us while we had coffee.Really quite amazing to come in from the desert heat and see real snow and feel the chill from the glass windows.Good one Dubai.

For countries that do not have snow. I do not pay the encounter with the penguins, the show was very good, now I will for a personal meeting. The playground is sufficient. Not impressed at all.. It is inside a mall. Short run. Ugly setting. Just nothing to like about this at all. Was planning on trying this, till I actually saw it and watched for awhile.

Snow experience in the dessert. Great indoor ski slope. the lifts are a little slow, so going up takes way longer than coming down. The staff were friendly, and the snow wasn't too bad for artificial, a little sticky in some places but that is to be expected from an indoor slope. Skiing in the Middle East!. After the incredible heat and humidity of Dubai amazing to actually feel cold! The whole experience was excellent. If you pay with MasterCard at present you get a reduction. Take your own hat and gloves. Everything else is provided, including new ski socks. Slick operation to get kitted out, very helpful staff throughout the Centre. Once in lovely skiing, can't quite believe you are in Dubai! We had great fun, we paid for two hours, which is about the right amount of time. You can have lessons, or if skied before just go straight to the slopes and ski or snowboard. Highly recommended.

Snow for All. For any age excitement, try this one of a kind indoor ski slope for skiing, snow boarding and tubing, completely encased in glass for viewing and picture taking, a must try while in Dubai.

Could use improvement on guest relations. As a tourist spot and jam packed with guests and customers, the management could invest in improving customer relations. Freezing Cold in Dubai. Memorable experience for the entire family... Nice rides and games even if you don't know how to Ski... Penguin show is fantastic and you get to touch this lovely creature and take nice photos with them...

the place was amazing. To be able to keep it so cold in there as if you were somewhere like Canada in the winter. Very. The feeling of winter wonderland took my breath away. Most Unusual Attraction In Dubai. Snow and Dubai are not things I imagine going together, but there is an actual ski slope inside the world's largest mall. I had never been skiing before and thought this would be fun and a great way to get out of the heat. I don't know if this is actually owned by Disney, but there is a big tie-in with Disney's "Frozen" movie. There were all ages and skill levels skiing when I was there. They offer lots of expensive extras, like gloves and goggles, etc, but you don't really need anything more than is included. Worth to do for the fun if you are used to be a skier. Bearing in mind that outside you have 30, 40 or 45+ Celsius andin Ski Dubai -1 or -2, it is of course a moment to enjoy for the fun if you're originating from countries where snow is not something extraordinary in winter times.Attraction is well done and you get dressed and equipped from top to down (suit, shoes, skies, ....).For people living in Middle East and maybe not having seen snow, it's obviously a great moemnt to shre amongst friends or in family.

cold in hot desert. to be in -4 deg C in a desert where temperature ouside is 40deg C is unimaginable. most memorable experience in Dubai. the rides are lot of fun. penguins are super cute. one easily forgets that one is in desert city.

Spectacular!. I never really knew about this. We were just at the mall, and it was just magnificent to see a legit skiing experience with penguins and all inside the mall. Even had the gondola's.
Ski Dubai. This is a great attraction... if you've never seen snow before!!! And if you like to walk into a room with AC's blasting in your face....
Skiing in a desert and inside a mall!!. loved the experience of spending time at the beach in 30 to 40degrees heat then Skiing in minus degrees and going shopping after!!! All in a day

Indoor Shop / Ski. This experience was based off a trip we took when Ski Dubai was first opened, and it was a pretty fascinating experience to ski indoors. I have skied indoors before in Japan, but the opportunity to shop and ski in the same day makes the experience more engaging.

Great for kids and adults. Wow... Its great fun for kids and adults. I never thought I will enjoy ski as much as I did in Ski Dubai.

Great experience for all of the family.. I was speechless when I walked into Ski-Dubia. Too Pricey and too cold!!!. went there with kids.could not stay there for more than 2 hrs.My little one who was most excited to go in was thankful to come out.I think it was a bit pricey.Would not go there again.
Something different. if you miss the snow whilst staying in Dubai, Ski Dubai is the perfect place! Don't forget to bring your own scarf, hat and gloves...it is very cold inside.

Ice ice ice. breath taking. the heat is unbearable but most places are air conditioned. Beautiful sky scrapers, very lush malls also very pricy, the public transport is clean, neat and safe, most reply on train.
Ski Dubai. A great place to practice your techniques before your ski holiday. Simple, easy, family fun. The penguins are a must to see!
A bit expensive but worth it!. We visit this place everytime we go to Dubai. The tickets are a bit pricy but I think it is worth as it has snow!!

Unique Experience. Take extra Gloves and a Hat.. Having the chance of spending sometime in an artificial ski resort its something unique, specially, in the Middle East Desert. The infrastructure its massive and you can clearly see it when you arrive to Mall of the Emirates (where its located). The attraction itself has lots to offer from the simply skiing or snowboarding in the big slope or taking some of the rides creates around the snow (mostly design for the kids). The entrance fee its around 70 USD plus some add ons for locker, boots and lessons. In my opinion, its a great place to learn how to ski in a very easy environment. You would learn a couple of moves and feel comfortable enough to try the slope. There are learning packages of several classes at a great value and the instructors are very nice.If you are coming from a skiing country, its kind of a pointless place as a tourist but if you are afraid of it, its a nice place to start. Ice World Inside Mall of Emirates. Value for money. Check if all activities inside are open and working before going there. Also check the time of Penguin Interaction, we missed it as there was no proper information available regarding the same. Everything inside is beautiful and sparkling.
A must go if you are going to Mall of Emirates.

“Snow in Dubai”. This is in the Mall of Emirates. It is amazing and a must do in Dubai. Building a snow park amidst a desert is surely an engineering marvel. the average temperature remains -3 to -4 degree C. There is so much to do in Ski Dubai - skiing, boarding or simply playing in the snow / meeting penguins. Great for both adults and kids alike.

Highly expensive. It's really not worth of all the money I spent there. I took power pass worth 300 AED . But when we enter inside ,we were lost. After 30 minutes we could use the rides . Big queues in all rides. We couldn't use all the rides becoz it was so cold that after 1 hour it's impossible to stay. The snow inside was so hard. It's good only if ur kids want to enjoy snow. The penguin meet was ok. But the photos clicked were so expensive ,250 AED per photos or all photos in ur USB at 500 AED . It's hype created nothing more then that.

The ICE ARENA IN DUBAI. Ski Dubai is a great attraction with lots of activities to take part in... The sculptures are wonderful and I enjoyed the arena. After the activities we were given bites and coffee... The coffee was superb!!!
perfect. a nice place to play , enjoy with your childrenmy daughter loved it very muchbut the ticket is a bit expensive

Snow on the desert. Great choice to have fun with kids. There's not a lot of attractions but it's nice . We spent about 2 hours and the kids were exhausted! The bad point is the price: 600 AED for 2 kids and 1 adult, so expensive!

Great fun. After 2 years of living in the desert I decided to try some snowboarding. Myself and 2 friends got a lesson for an hour and it was great fun, well worth a go... I'd go back again for sure but I have since left the UAE.

Good for once. Must visit if you want to experience snow clad region. Good for children and also adults to spend time . As it is located inside mall of emirates , easy to access .nice and well maintained.

Ski Dubai in Mall of the Emirates. it was an awesome experience. I have tried it previously in Switzerland, but seeing it for the first time in UAE. Awesome to manage such a huge infrastructure in a shopping mall in the desert city.Must experience once.
Not Impressed. It is just okay, nothing like original snow, but a change which children might like, but once is enough

Some fun in the city. Good place to entertain your friends visiting Dubai or to remember your snowboarding moves before the winter season.
Fun for a couple of hours, then can become boring.
Awesome. Awesome ski resort within a shopping mall, from the outside of Mall of Emirates you would not be able to imagine the Ski Dubai would be as big as it is!
Incredible. It was just out of this world to see snow in the middle of the desert but then again, you are in Dubai where anything is possible.
not so good. it has very less value for money u spent it is in dubai mall only children r playing n elder can take a chance u have to see from outside
fun. it was a blast. very easy to get equipment and it was a great experience even for skiers that are not beginners

Good, but chairlift isn't running. This was a fun way to spend an hour and take a break from the heat. Unfortunately the chairlift is running right now so you can only go about 100 m up the slope on magic carpet "lifts". There is a cheaper pass because the slope is limited. All in all not a bad experience, but could have been better.

It's a great experience . I loved the games and the penguin show but the only thing that I didn't like is when they take your photos they take extra charges for it.It's supposed to be as a souvenirs from ski dubai. And they don't provide caps with the whole set!!! When it is supposed to be free not charged.But over all a good place to enjoy with a family.
Snow in Desert!. I wonder how difficult it would have been for engineers to put his up in the middle of a desert. Great fun if you travel with kids. Do not miss the Penguin interaction.

Ski Dubai. This place is great for kids to start learning Ski, the trainers are friendly & the packages price are affordable however private lessons are very expensive I should say. At the weekend it is very crowded due to tourists visiting from GCC countries.
Dubai. This was such a fun place and if you have small children this is great experience for them to play and see all the wonderful things in side this beautiful snow resort
Loved it. The slope is huge. Open until 11:00pm, it can get really crowded during the day, but do visit after 8:00pm to enjoy the almost empty slope.

Great Fun. The slope is great fun for a couple of hours. Especially when your missing that winter ski holiday feeling. If you are an experienced rider it can get a bit boring after too long but it's great for a few hours or so

Something pathetic. I'm not cynical but this indoor ski practice is really pathetic. Impressive, yes, but not in the good way... all that people in ski suits is funny and the ski slope is flooded and not high. It's also really expensive for low sensations

Skiing inside the mall. I didn't expect to like Ski Dubai as much as I did. I had heard about it a few years before moving to the UAE. I never imagined actually visiting it. However my wife convinced to go there with a promotional deal they had with indoor skydiving center. So we went and had a blast. Even though it was 80 degrees outside, it was freezing inside. We opted to do the simple package which did not include skiing and snowboarding. We mostly did the sledding and tube riding. We also did the big ball that you ride down the hill. I would definitely recommend to anyone that was thinking about it.

A fun morning. My daughter & I went to Ski Dubai in May 2015. I didn't ski but had fun on the "tubes". They supplied all the gear needed for the morning and my daughter had a great time skiing down the slopes. Best to go when they open ( about 10am) to avoid the crowds.

-2 Degree Inside. You can feel the difference of 53 degrees from HOT weather of Dubai in Ski Dubai. What an exemplary place of man made wonders. Saw penguins for the first time. Loved the place. A must visit, if you are at Dubai.

Fun time with my daughter. My daughter had school holidays and after living for years in Dubai i had never visited. We decided to visit Ski Dubai and we basic tickets. We had to buy gloves. The equipment provided is good. Clothes, shoes, socks. The tickets included two rides, snow experience and clothes. Me and my daughter did the sliding ride multiple times as she was too excited. We had a chance to see the penguins too. Overall the experience is good and will recommend to others. I do think its a bit pricey and for Dubai residents the rates must be considered to be lower just like many other theme parks across the globe which offer upto 50% off for city/state residents.
A welcomed cool spot. My 4 year old son and I had an absolute blast here and it was well worth the money. He and I created some wonderful memories.
Tick the box!. Quick easy check-in and collection of gear. Seems more geared for the kids, the skiing is average but is pretty good for what it is and if you're in Dubai, you have to do it!
Nice but short. Good place for a run from summer and heat. A bit expensive for the short slope that is there, but overall experience is good.

Meh. Nothing interesting. Apparently you can only ski or snowboard there if you take the classes, I guess that's to prevent the amount of noobs crashing onto everyone else who knows how to ski/snowboard. The 'rides' are only interesting if you've never been to a theme park before as they're not really thrilling and felt like its more suitable for those under 10 years old. Avoid going in when there's a school tour or something as these kids (especially the annoying teenagers) would disrespect you because they're in a group, thinking they can just cut off cause their friends would back them up (even though all of them are half your height).

Good. Was outstanding but they free parts are very less. They charge for almost everything you would like to do. Very cold and they charge heavily for caps and gloves, so take warm clothes, Gloves and cap.

Must visit. Where else can you hang out with penguins? It was worth every penny. You also get entry to tubing and some sort of jump in a tube and ride down a hill circle thing. Our kids loved it. You get plenty of time to see penguins and take pics and hug them. You can't bring your camera so you are at their mercy for pics. They are very expensive but if you negoiate, you can get a lower price. We got a USB drive of pics for less than 100 dirhams, which was initially offered for 300. Tip- it is freezing in there and we are from New Jersey! They give you ski clothes and gloves but you need a hat and warmer gloves. You can purchase that onsite but it's a fortune. Just pack that from home.

Don't miss skiing in the desert!. Skiing indoors, no less in the middle of the desert, is a unique experience not to be missed! Spending a few hours on the snow is a great escape from the heat of Dubai and we would consider it a top attraction when visiting the city. They have great abilities for people trying skiing or snowboarding for the first time and the main slopes, while limited as you'd expect, are still fun for experienced skiers if just for pure novelty. There are even some smaller terrain park features to mix things up.Our only disappointments involved customer service. The ticket seller did not seem very knowledgeable about their products and needed her supervisor's assistance to sell us basic 2-hour ski passes. The poma lift (for experienced skiers, faster than the slow chairlift also used for "sightseeing") was closed for maintenance without prior notice or a discount on the pass price. The rental process was not clearly marked and everything we were initially given (jackets, pants, and boots) was too big and had to be exchanged. Finally, the changing area was filthy.Overall, we'd recommend visiting Ski Dubai, especially if you're a skier or snowboarder looking for a unique experience! Just be prepared for the process of getting geared up to take a while and for the staff to not be as helpful as they should be for such an attraction.

Good day out. Great place to do a bit of proper skiing whilst in the desert. Only thing I would change is the queueing for the clothing. That could be rearranged a bit better with somewhere try the sizes of the loaned clothing.

Cold place in a hot place. Nice way to cool out if you can spend for it. We have to appreciate the vastness of the place - that too inside a mall. Well thought of engineering feat. Warm clothing and boots are provided but gloves and socks are extra. Some attractions like ski, snow ball etc.are at additional charge.

Alright. We did a ski lesson the instructor was great. I think it's a little overpriced compared with similar attractions around the world. I'd like to see a little more, clear, directional signage. Oh and it seems to be the only place in Dubai that you can't pay with US $ which I found odd and frustrating.

Energy Guzzler. well, not a fan. can't imagine how much energy needed to keep this place frozen.Though the good side is it creates quite a lot of employment for people from many parts of the developing world.
Ski. Not too bad for a first time skier. It is located inside the mall - lots and lots of children. It is really meant for family.
Come to ski!. If you re to hot can chill at Ski Dubai ,then go right to drink something!Mall of Dubai is very good at helping you to enjoy the ride!

Mini Switzerland. It was very good to see mini Switzerland in very hot Dubai. My kids enjoyed making snow man and throwing snow to each other. It has many slides and a must visit park if you go to Dubai

A ski slope.in the desert. Whenever you are in emirates mall and got.tired of shopping you may just like to enjoy a taste of swisszerland in dubai.The ski.slope.is.there to be enjoyed if you are experienced. Otherwise you can just take classes or just enjoy the snow Park. Real life penguins may greet you and.show.you around. Don't you worry you don't need to buy any special gear. Most of the things are provided by ski dubai.A truly.great experience!
Nice Family Experience. The best part of that is experiencing the snow, the chair lift is nice and the rest of the games is not. i would only recommend to a family
Wallah it's Snow in the Desert !. Such a thing can only be made possible by Dubai ! :) It's charges can be high on the pocket still a good fun experience so give it a go !

Snow in the Desert. This is a make believe world! Absolutely amazing created by Dubai. This is expected of Dubai and the various.I was with colleagues. After some time we found it extremely cold. Did not try to ski.We found the prices too expensive!The whole process makes entry easy and it is definitely a one time try!

engineering marvel. it's impossible to believe unless you actually go there. building a snow park amidst a desert is surely an engineering marvel. the average temperature remains -3 to -4 degree C and highly recommend carrying a pair of hand-gloves. no trainers are there for skiing. kindly check the penguin show timings before you visit
Snow in Desert. I would say its a must visit place in Dubai, where you can enjoy the snow, test your skiing skills and have a nice time.

experience the snow in a desert city. This place will take to from 45 degrees hot temperature straight to -15 degrees. not many attractive rides available. You can enjoy skiing if you are a member only.
Snow in Desert. Its sound unbelievable when we say place of snow in desert area, but its true Dubai made it possible & its great experience skiing, playing with ice in Dubai.

Nice to try. Anyone who is a frequent skier/snowboarder would tell you that Ski Dubai is awful and a waste of time..To be fair it is tiny and therefore can't really be called a ski experience..The only reason that pushes me to say its nice to try is bearing in mind that you are in the middle of the desert and have the opportunity to ski all year long which is always a good option for exercises..

Cool down in the desert. What a fantastic way to spend the day! It's bloody cold, even though you're supplied every thing still wear long pants as I didn't! Also, either bring a beanie or buy one at the store, it'll keep your ears warm.Highly recommend a snowboarding lesson, it'll challenge you and burn off some of that holiday fat you might've acquired! Be careful and check your travel insurance; didn't realise I wasn't covered until I'd finished. There is potential to injure yourself.

Not bad. I'm a very keen skier. I didn't expect much for this indoor ski centre, but had to try the novelty of skiing in the Middle East!As expected, there're only 2-3 runs ranging from beginner to easy advanced. The length was decent and the basic lift system was quite effective. I've given it a 4 star rating as it fared well against my limited expectations. I went on a weekday and there was no lift queue or crowd, which enabled me to ski run after run non-stop. The price was also modest. Of note, all outerwear and ski gear are included in the price, and it's excellent value for money. It's also extremely convenient.
Marvellous Dubai. It was a Wow experience as experiencing snow in a dessert is an unimaginable experience and only Dubai can do it.
A dream came true. Kides enjoy the ski dubai and if you are inside it feels like europ.You will get jackates and gloves and boots at entry. It cost around 50 dollar.

ok. Don't go Thursday through sunday! It was jammed packed! The mall was packed as well...You can't really enjoy a place when it is over crowded, and the ski resort was really small...I expected it to be much bigger. BECAUSE ITS A INDOOR SKI....it should be breathtaking.

Class apart but quite expensive. The place is worth visiting at least once if you land in Dubai. I went there with my wife and had a great time. There are different packages which you can buy either by directly visiting the place or booking online. We went for the AED 275 per person package which included Giant ball, Cable car, Penguin meet and Ice Park/slides. The facilities are quite good inside. The package includes gloves + warm clothing + boots. However the gloves + jackets provided were not very thick and we felt quite chilly inside. I would recommend wearing some warm clothes before visiting the place. You can try the giant ball/cable car/slides multiple times within the AED 275 package. There is also a cafe (Avalanche) inside the attraction and can be reached using the cable car. The items in the cafe were quite reasonably prices (cheaper than Starbucks) and hot chocolate in a must try in the freezing cold. Best part of the attraction was meeting and feeding the penguins. However make sure you book in advance as the slots get exhausted for meeting the penguins. There will be a 20 minutes demo where the instructor will explain the do's and don'ts and then you can meet/feed/pose with the penguins. However you cant take pictures with the penguins with your own cameras. Their are photographers who will take pics and then sell 1 hard copy to you for AED 115 which is very high. I would suggest to try this place as its an experience to be in ice within a desert.Recommendations to the facility management:1. Increase the number of attractions inside the snow park2. Reduce the price of selling photographs shot with the penguin

Kills an hour or so. Good for what it is, not overly pricey but can get a bit boring after a while, we never last more than 90 minutes before leaving. Never go after midday at the weekend, Saturday mornings are best as not as busy.

Great for a ski in the desert. For an indoor ski slope, SD hits all the right buttons. Its long enough and just enough pitch to scratch your ski itch. The ski school can touch up your skills and give you a new experience with quite highly qualified instructors for all over the world.
ski. Absolutely fantastic been twice, first time in 2006 and 2015 always a good day out. It's amazing to think that there's a ski slope in such a hot country. Thoroughly enjoyable experience

Great fun trip to Ski Dubai. Great fun trip to ski dubai. Took our first ski lesson, it takes a little bit of getting use to those skis, but well worth it. There is a lot of time required beforehand to queue up for clothing, skis, gloves etc so its vital to be there in plenty of time. Would highly recommend.

Amazing but Expensive. every thing was good and amazing but the price... a little expencive
the view after jumping is wontherful

Once a regular visitor....not anymore!. I used to love this place. Very affordable ski-ing considering all the equipment is provided for you. Staff are also very helpful with fitting of ski equipment. Everytime i visit there is something new. This time however they have ill advised decided to introduce penguins. Yes, Penguins......seriously?! This is a step too far. They push it that you can hug and play with the penguins. These are wild animals. They should not be put on show so humans can 'play' with them for their own amusement. Sorry but this made me really angry. Almost as ridiculous as having dolphins at a water park. They have no respect for animal welfare.

Ski Dubai. Considering this is an indoor ski resort, in a mall, in the middle of the desert -- is amazing in itself! No, its not 10,000 feet above sea level, but the feel is very natural to actually being on a mountain base. The snow is amazingly made and although I got there in the afternoon, I was not skiing on slush. They have a lot going on in this place. You can snow bullet (zip line), swim with the penguins and places where parents and sit/eat while watching all the happenings. And, It's really not that cold in there either.
It was fun. Icy cold place with lots of fun,Friendly staff and lovely penguins.You have to have some sort of skills to ski, other activities is easy to do and enjoy.

Fun place!. Who would've thought you could go skiing when it's 45 degrees outside? If you don't feel like skiing there's other activities you can do or you could just watch the penguins at 2pm. Very fun and good way to cool down or take a break from shopping at the Mall of the Emirates

Loved the weather retreat. snow in the desert ..awesome . Children love the sliding and dodging snow balls and the lil penguins steal the show. It's a different world inside with feet going numb, feeling the hot breath and enjoying the yummy hot coffee in the cafe there

Something different. This is located INSIDE the Mall of Emirates. There are two sections, one for kids who would like to visit the Penguins and take some slides in the ice, and then the larger section which has the Ski slopes and the main rink.An experience you would not get in any other Hot city like Dubai.A must visit for sure
Out of this world !. Incredible, indoor skiing when it was +35 celcius outside, cannot be done anywhere else in the world.

1st time with snow. Cant believe my first time was in the dessert! people cant believe this exists inside a shopping mall! i would recommend to go with time because it takes a long time to get the things before going to actually sky. Love there is background music while you sky! very cold inside(its the idea) and good clothes and teachers if you have never tried it. if you dont want to sky but are planing to go into the mall, at least go to the outside and watch from the outside, its worth watching!cool experience to me!

Fantastic but expensive. We took our 3 year old who had never seen snow before and she was in awe of the place. We only payed for the snow park which was around 180 AED each for the day.There are some great little snow rides on tubes and a torbogan ride (suitable for bigger kids). There are a few sledges around which she loved just being pulled around in the snow. We had one chair lift ride with our pass so we went up the slope (pretty huge) to the cafe for a hot chocolate. Our daughter loved the chair lift and hot chocolate. The only downside was that we were freezing. We thought the hired equipment would be nice and warm, the jackets and ski pants are not they are pretty thin and we got cold quickly. We were not allowed to go out and come back in (might have been a language thing with my husband and the guard). My husband left early and we stayed to see the penguin parade. Which turned out to be a great experience. We were picked from the crowd and got to go inside and meet/ touch a penguin and have photos taken. My daughter was so delighted it made our day. Overall a fantastic experience.
love it. its the best place to escape the heat in Dubai. and a must visit if you are in a large group. filled with fun

ICE in DESERT. WOW!!! check out the location, in a MALL. Outside temperature 42+ inside -4 degrees. Awesome.It is really COLD inside!!!!I went for the pass which has the penguin encounter as this may be the only time I get to touch a penguin.The pass which I bought had fleece gloves but it really did not help. Recommend you to buy your own before you reach here as it really gets cold in there and buying in the location might pinch your pockets. Same for the cap.It has good activities and you will be amazed what they have achieved in Dubai.Skiers have good options, but I did not choose it but went for penguin encounter. Glad I did it. Penguins are so cute and they were well behaved(read it trained!!!!). If you go with kids ensure you take the pass which has penguin encounter. The guides provide all the info about penguin + how we should behave infront of the penguin ;)..Keep in mind that you cannot take any pics of the penguin with your own camera. Each pic which they take of yours cost 100 AED but you have no choice. You have chair lift which you can take umpteen times. I did it only once :(Spend as much time there as it is good.Definitely recommended,

An unlikely place for a ski resort!. We didn't try the skiing, but it is in the middle of the Emirates Shopping Mall, and there are huge windows so that shoppers can look into the cold area where people are skiing, as well as taking the ski-lift to the top of the hill ready to ski down. The people who ski have to wear ski clothes provided as the whole area is very cold. It is fun for the viewers as well as the skiiers.

Good time. We had gone there with the base package. We quickly found that there is not much to be enjoyed on the base package, and in addition you have to buy your own gloves. So upgraded to the next level and got the gloves free. The gloves are good enough for 45 mins to 1 hr, but if you plan to stay more, you should get your own gloves that can withstand the -ve temperatures. The rides are good but very short. Overall worth 1.5 - 2 hrs if you are not planning to ski
More of a kids place. I would only recommend doing skiing as everything else was pretty much for kids. It was fun and pretty cool how they built something like that inside a mall.

As indoor skiing goes, this is great... and it's in the dessert!. If you just want to view, there is a large swiss stye lodge window in the coffee bar where you can spectate. However the real fun is skiing. Is it short and shallow? - No. I have skied in Europe many times and I can ski anything. Sure, it isn't the longest run but it isn't bad and you can get up to a great speed. ...and better still, there is never a queue for the lift (or there wasn't when I was there).

Had great fun. This is amazing and must cost a lot to keep running especially in the summer. We loved seeing the penguins and we got to meet one :) I did break my glasses in a zorb but that is not the fault of the venue.
Worth to go.... U shud go for once not more than that... will have gr8 experience to have in desert area... Temp is -7.... gr8 for kids...
Ridicilous place. Imagine that theres +50c outside and you're skiing! Yes, it's possible at dubai - go and test it if you havent seen snow on long time.
Worth a visit only once. Visited ski Dubai with kids. Worth a visit only once. Few rides included. Like every other attraction in Dubai, overpriced and overhyped .

Skiing in the desert!. Dubai ski is expensive ( like every event in the UAE) but the experience is good. -3 degrees in the desert when it can touch +50 degrees outside. Long queues for most activities which eats into your time, but probably worth a visit.

The fun never ends!. There is so much to do in Ski Dubai - skiing, boarding or simply playing in the snow / meeting penguins. Great for both adults and kids alike.The place is huge and really well run. They provide you with everything you need whatever you decide to do on your visit. I have been quite a few times for ski lessons and the instructors, especially Sharon, are fantastic. It may be a bit on the pricey side but definitely worth every penny.

Good . Ski dubai is a nice snow park. Kids n adults both will have fun. Bt its very expensive.there r 5 or 6 rides in oll. In basic ticket of approx 3000 to 3500 u can go for only tyre ride n one more I.e just 2 rides. If u wanna go for chairlifts ride then u have to pay rs.1500 xtra. So its a expensive place n if u wanna go for penguin show its also chargable round abt 2000 -2500 per person. N more u want to do rides more u have to pay. In dubai everything is much more expensive. Dont forget to take gloves from u r home. In basic ticket they wont provide u gloves. N without gloves u cant play with snow. N also take woollen clothes of urs. They provide jacket n pants but thats not enough to cope with the temperature there. The temperature will be in minus 2 or 3 degree. Camera is allowed to take inside. In my opinion one must go there. Bt be prepare ur self for expenses. It will be a fun

Good change...!. The park like everything else in Dubai is well maintained and the staff is also very helpful. However do buy the combo ticket if u want to experience the Penguins also although check the session timings at the reception before entering the park as the entrance for the live encounter with the Penguins is separate. Do carry some money inside if you want to sip a hot chocolate in the snow!
Experience of a lifetime. Bring your own gloves and goggles or you will have to pay $40-60 more, but honestly, worth every penny.

Family time at Ski Dubai. One of the best places to take the kids and teens to enjoy their time. It's good that they added more things to do, especially the rolling ball, we loved it. I think they only need to reduce the prices of the photos they take for the people, so everybody get to keep their wonderful memory of this place. I spent lots of money in order to take all the photos, most of them were good. Try to go as early as posdible in order to enjoy everything there and you don't have to rush the kids to catch something else.

A must visit. Just the idea to have a such big venue where you can actually ski in the middle of the desert is amazing. very nicely organized very nice setup. Inside activities are not much if you don't know how to ski, but still a must visit. Highly recommended for the whole family.

Adventourous,Amazing experience. A place which is even tough to imagine in the weather of Dubai, is bound to be high on price but it is value for money, you do not need to bring in any thing all are provided and inclusive of your ticket.The slides and the rides though are very few but they are highly enjoyable. If you are with kids then it may get difficult for you to stay more than 2 hours otherwise you can spend 3-4 hours in cold except being too hot outside.

Hot & Cold. It was 101F (38C) outside & 30F inside this Ski-Mall, so it quite a change. Ski Dubai supplied all equip, coats, pants, helmet, but you needed your own gloves (or bought new ones). I brought younger kids (beginner-intermediate) who liked the experience alot (GoPro worked well). It was a 2 hr session & you thats all the time you need for this mini hill. Pictures to bring home was worth the $$.
No so good!. Dubai is fun, but i just didn't get what was the SKI slope was about. Artificial snow is just like your freezer.

Overpriced. Like most places in Dubai are insane price this was one of the best example as overall hardly any free rides for basic entry and power pass comes with 2 rides and super pass was best if you want to experience everything. But still it overall hardly have much rides and or to do. Unless someone is into skiing. I find bit overpriced comparing with number of rides it offers. Even thought opted for super pass I fished this place within 2 hours. Just to keep in mind better bring you own gloves and caps else u have to buy from there which are useless and expensive.
Amazing. It was a good experiance that i had.it was very funny day there at ski dubai at emirates mall.if you visit emirates mall you must go there.

nice afternoon out on the slopes. A great way to have a different day when the summer kicks in.make sure you take along your own gloves, bobble hat and comfortable trousers and jumper (gloves etc can be bought there but are a waste of money.)tell them if you are a resident of dubai, you get an extra free hour!

Fun in the snow......in Dubai!. You really can ski in real snow right here in the heart of Dubai. We went as a family of four and got our 'ski fix' on Boxing Day 2015. No queues just straight onto the slope ( unheard of anywhere in Europe at Christmas. Don't be put off by the huge amount of people going into this attraction, as 80% are just going in to play in the kiddies area at the bottom and they never venture onto the slope. A great place to ski - no matter what your ability.

Amazing!. Such a fantastic place! All equipment is hired out to you except gloves hat and scarf so take your own or else you have to buy in the shop. After 2 hours the cold does hit you! Button lift and a cable seat lift and different runs that you can do. This is a must if you are in Dubai and love to ski!

Tired and overpriced.. We are not skiers and we went into the dome on a superpass which gives you access to certain rides. Without vouchers a family of four whould pay £200 for the experience which includes a very short and bumby bobsleigh ride, a slope with with insufficient rings to slide down waiting ten minutes between slides, the giant ball and a chair lift. The place looked grubby and in a desparate need of a makeover.

Penguins are great. We went to see penguins in the desert. Yes it confused us too. 40 degrees outside minus 7 inside.... The experience was well priced and gave plenty of time to see and touch the Penguins. The professional photos were excellent quality some of the best I've seen and not expensive to purchase. All warm gear provided.

Eccentric. -8 degrees indoor, 45 degrees outside...Great place to visit and to get frozen!If you live near ski courts, then go just to admire the building. I consider is not worth paying to practise ski or snowboard

Escape the Dubai heat!. Though I don't like skiing, this is where I learnt to snowboard, and I love it. It's the perfect way to escape the hotter months in Dubai for a couple of hours, and because it's based inside mall of emirates, you can go shopping afterwards too. Only suggestion is take your own socks and gloves etc if you can.

Very cold, but worth it. Meeting the Penguins was an experience my family and I will always remember it was amazing. Loved the toboggan ride and the rubber rings. You don't need to take anything with you as they provide all the kit, even give you a voucher forsome free gloves, I would take a hat though as it is very cold.

Fun park. It was fine for such park in the middle of the dry and heated sands of the middle east. Hope the uniformed and gear gets sanitized frequently. I like the pre training instructions for those non experts, it was a good plus.

Alps in the desert. Amazing skiing experience in the desert, Ski-Dubai is in the Mall of Emirates, comfortably connected by the Dubai Metro. This is another wonder when outside high temperatures have no impact and one should rent the winter clothes to be inside.

Must Do!. We're Canadians visiting Dubai for a week and this was a must do for us, partly just to say we did it, but mostly for the experience. First off I would only recommend the 2 hour pass as there is only 2 runs (3 if you include the terrain park) so it does get old after the 2 hours. Second, take a sweater!!! It actually gets very cold after a while in there!! Overall we had a lot of fun at ski dubai, we bought the 300aed ticket that was 2 hours skiing and then unlimited time in the snow park, I would advise against the snow park if your above the age of 12 as it really is mostly for kids, it's fun but definitely not worth the extra 100aed.

so much fun.....get COLD in Dubai. We are avid skiers and couldn't resist the urge to try indoor skiing in Dubai. We went in the evening when the crowds were thinner - and in fact it turned out that most of the crowd was headed to the "winter park" versus the ski hill. There were lots of people on the lift but only a few skiers on the hill which was fine by us. We actually got COLD in Dubai which was a welcome change. Everything is provided but gloves and hats....service for equipment rental was quick and easy....it was a great and unique experience which we highly recommend!

Fun!. We were able to ski in the desert for $100...so take that as you will. After working in Kuwait during the summer I was excited for snow. They ran it very efficiently but there were still tons of people there.

Snow in Dubai?. We loved ski Dubai where rise can you be in 40C and then -2C and ski in snow. It was a really good set up easy to get all your kit and skis but make sure if you gave been shopping to get two lockers on the way in as they are not all that big. The chairlift is a bit on the slow side but that's due to people not skiing just going up and down on it taking photos etc. there are two slopes one being a black and it is just like skiing on the slopes somewhere. There is the snow park, zip slide and tobogganing and a few other fun things to do like meeting real penguins. The Avalanche cafe on the slopes does a mean hot chocolate with cream and marshmallows and it is all good fun. Make sure you have gloves as it is quite cold after two hours skiing. Good laugh.
Amazing in Deserts. Its really amazing to see the infrastructure in Dubai. Its inside Mall of the Emirates and really amazing to have -45 degrees insidewhen outside temp. is more than 45.
Fun. If you are looking for a place to cool off this is the place. Great place for families. Clean. Safe. Ski instructors. Snow ball fights.

Ski in Dubai how wonderfull outside + 40 Celsius inside minus2. Inside -2 Celsius outside + 42 so when machines go down it will take 90 days before the whole inside ski will disappear amazing this site of Dubai next to mall of Emirates. With inside skilift And a long scope to ski down all worthwile to do

Great to be back in the cold. Great to be in the cold and have a blast when you are missing the mountains. The snow is good for an indoor ski slope and its always quiet in the mornings. I would prefer it if they was a steeper section of the slope
Cold Fun. Ski dubai is a great fun location to enjoy snowy subzero temperature experience even though if you don't have any skiing skills.

Unforgettable. Experience at indoor snow resort at Ski Dubai was amazing, we enjoyed very much. My 8 years old daughter loved the rolling down in the Giant Ball run, turning down the tube slides were small but nice. Ski clothing, Lockers, Restaurants available..... We face difficulty on Sightseeing in the chairlift, was stopped/stuck in the middle almost 10 minutes. But the rescue team at the Ski Dubai managed it very well. They compensate the ride and served us refreshment drinks. We strongly recommend to visit Ski Dubai if you are visiting Dubai.

As hot as it is in Dubai, an indoor Ski mountain in right up your alley.. This is a icy oasis where you can easily forget about the 100+ degree weather of Dubai. They have everything there that you can find on a Ski Resort mountain. They even have little penguins you can hand out with for God's sake! Not to mention you can sit down at your favorite restaurant (The CheeseCake Factory)and have the indoor Ski as your backdrop. Overall this is a wonderful place for the family or couples alike. Just be sure to bring your own winter gear if you plan to visit...I'm not to keen with wearing someone's once sweaty gear (even after they clean it).

Felt like a kid again.. Had the most fun in four hours and in -2 degrees. We were rugged up with the clothing provided and spent our time on the rides available such as the toboggan, rubber tyres, large ball that you climb into. Even did the flying fox which was fun. After all the running around we treated ourselves to a hot chocolate in the coffee shop half way up the ski slopes and to get to it you take the chair lift. We didn't do any skiing only because we haven't skied before and didn't want to do an injury before flying home. But those skiing looked to be having fun as well. It is situated in the Mall of the Emirates and has a hotel attached to it and a restaurant at the other side. If you stayed at the Hotel Kempinski then you would be able to watch the skiing from your room.

Great Experience. It is quite an expensive visit so be prepared to spend a few hours. If you are not accustomed to cold then I highly suggest that you wear REALLY warm clothing underneath the ski suits provided and not just your ordinary clothes. My daughter was frozen because the staff on the phone said just wear normal apparel. Had we been advised properly then we would have gotten our monies worth. We left after only 2 hours as it was just too cold.
Amazing and Cold. It was very good. Though we did feel teh chill, even after the extra layers of clothing, it was still very enjoyable. The Penguin interaction was excellent.

Encounter with penguins....u acutally get to touch them. Its an amazing Place, You have to do this if you are in dubai specially if u have kids along. It is located in the mall of emirates, if you are not Sking, There are limited slides. But they offer different Packages, My favoraite is encounter with penguins....u acutally get to touch them, Lovely feeling!

Bit of Fun. We decided to have a visit to Ski Dubai - where else can you say you skied in the desert? It was fairly expensive but I still had fun - I hadn't skied in years! We also did the penguin encounter which was quite cute. Always disappointing when they don't allow you to take your own photos and to buy theirs is very expensive.

Ski Dubai. Great bit of cool fun. Even though we did not ski as I think you would have to have some amazing ski experience as the ski sloap is very steep we had loads of fun. Area to do snow man making, ski tobogganing and have loads of fun. Something a bit different out of the heat. Probably allow 2-3 hours if you are not skiing.

GREAT SNOW FUN AT 104 DEGREES OUTDOORS !!. This is a great attraction in the desert ! If you want to ski in the desert when it is 104 degrees outside this is for you!! You will probably never see another attraction like this in your lifetime.

A nice snow park. Extremely cold inside. But they charge for the lockers which they know everybody will require so why not give it for free. Park nicely made with some good run rides. Good for 2-3 hours visit as it's really cold inside.

Fun for the kids. Liked; the concept, the games, zorbing.
Disliked: Freezing cold without earmuffs, not too many options if you are not skiing

great. This is in the mall of Emirates. It is amazing and a must do in Dubai. They give you shoes, coat , gloves etc to go in the snow. One feels they are actually in the snow. They have an excellent ride over the ski Dubai to see the whole area. One can also go on the sleigh and play in the snow. An excellent place!

Disappointing.. It is disappointing to know most of the places in Dubai are looking after only the visitors/investors money.Once you arrived, the staff is rude and push - force you to pay an additional high expensive training for the SKI only.They will not allowed you easily to have free access without paying something... Overall experience, nothing better than a real SKI ambience and scenario.

Skiing in the desert!. A must for visitors! Great fun and the closest thing you can get to real snow. Ski runs are not as hard as the colours suggest! Button lift is very steep. Equipment all provided which is great if your coming strwight from the beach!
Great Fun. An awesome place for children in the middle of the desert city. Meeting up with penguins and taking a bullet ride were really enjoyed.
Amazing place for kids - Iceland. Amazing place for kids - Iceland. They loved it thoroughly and wish to go back their again and again.
visit to swiss alps. Great guys. How do they manage to conceive, execute and maintain a ski place in a desert.Must visit place for people visiting Dubai for the first time.
Great time. is a ski opportunity in the middle of the dessert and the summer. Not to big but good enough to feel the Alps breeze or the Charpatians , is worth a trial

Fun in the snow. It was a bit of a wait to get in and also having to change into suitable clothing which was supplied to quite some time as well, but in the end it was worth it. We all had a great time and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

Nice experience, bad ski gear.... The experience of skiing in Dubai is unforgettable... skiing in one of the warmest places in the world!
It wasn't too cold inside the skiing area and the instructor was ok.
The ski equipment was old and not maintained as it should. Lots of people at the lookers area and there wasn't much privacy to change clothes.

Ice in a land of sand!!. staying in the UAE this is the closest you can get to Ice.pay a visit in the summer and its a bliss to be in there.They proivde for warm overcoats and shoes as per sizes and a locker area to keep your belongings..its divided into the snow park area and the actual ski area... lessons are also given for sking if you would like to learn - at a cost ofcourse!

Best Skiing in the Middle East. This is a "do once" experience for the novelty factor. The actuall hill is bigger than some of the places we have skiied in the American Midwest, but tiny compared to the skiing in Europe or the rockies. The lift ticket includes ski/board rental as well as pants and a jacket to use on the hill. Gloves are extra but are not really required unless you have a serious aversion to cold.

Brilliant Fun. The biggest indoor ski field in the world. Little kids absolutely nailing it down the slopes. You can also tobaggan, sledge and zorb. Its kept between -4 to -8 and also gear can be hired, down to socks to wear under your boots.This is a must and a little surreal when its 42 deg outside.
Weird snow inside a glass dome!. had to see this and was not disappointed. It looks fantastic and seemed very popular everything you need to ski is supplied.

only if you love snow. it is really fun, but beware, i am a person who hasnt seen snow my entire life, so your view might be different, yes- only a few rides, but they are so addictive!! i went on the big slide like 100 times or something!! if you ski this is nice for you, they have a cool ski slope with the chairs, you can go on the chairs even if you dont wanna ski, just go up and come back! they have penguins you can cuddle with but only a group of 10-15 people so you sometimes have to wait for a whopping few hours!! overall, if you love snow, and have a high budget, this place is for you! it costs 600 aed when i went last year!!
Entertainment for everybody. Fun for all. Fun and games in the slow for the little ones , ski and snowboard lessons for beginners to advance , meeting penguins .... What is there not to like

A let down!. We brought the full passes for my myself and teenage and adult children. We were all really excited when we first entered it all looked magical. Unfortunately it was much smaller then we anticipated (and we weren't expecting much being indoors), half the rides were shut down and they never informed us and really the best bit was just doing the ski lift ride. But if you want to cool down, then this is a great way to do so:)

What Absolute Fun!. I love skiing, so, why not Ski Dubai!!!!!I visited here whilst visiting my Son. It was great fun, two hours of up and down, two slopes.They rent you all you need - jacket, sallopettes, boots - inc socks & ski's. You just need to buy some gloves for 25 AED.The drag lift was being maintained so only the chair was working on our visit & it was a bit slow, but not really a problem.Definitely worth a visit.

Cool and cold. The place is great for kids, many games for them to enjoy plus the Penguins show that is very nice too with some memorial photos you will never forget. Beware that it is extremely cold inside as it reaches -4c
Best Snow Park. My entire family had a very good time here. The experience will be there in our minds for ever. The children had so much fun

Awesome!!!. There are not a lot of places you can go where you can ski on snow in the desert. I started up doing a couple of ski lessons as I was planning on going on a ski trip in the following months. The team is professional, well trained and it is lots and lots of fun. I had never really skied before and they literally took me from stage one, step by step. You have the option to either take group classes or individual classes, the individual obviously being more effective, not to say the group classes are not, but the focus will be solely on you. I took the group classes (easier on the pocket). They do all the fittings and measurements for your boots, be it for snow boarding or skiing, and they also provide you all the equipment and warm clothing as well. You would only need to bring your own gloves, for hygiene purposes, or you could buy them there. Lot's of fun, you won't regret, whether you're a pro skier/snowboarder, starting for the 1st time, or whether you want to bring the family for a fun day out with their activities. A must see in Dubai!!

Looks incredible. I honestly did not go in here but I went right next to it at the mall. It looked like so much fun and truly amazing. I thought it was genius, the fact we were in the desert and yet you can go skiing! I sat right by Costa coffee and had a great view of the slope, the snowman and watching the kids throwing snowballs at the window. There is this huge ski life that takes you to the top of the slope and to watch people skiing while there are people shopping around them - only in Dubai. I have to be honest if I had more time I would have done it. When I return in 2016 I shall be trying this. Would recommend it as it looks like true fun.

Looks Fantastic.. Haven't tried the skiing yet but have been inside and looked at the facilities. As always they are great with everything you can think of.Love the penguins - great entertainment even if you haven't got the kids or grand kids with you!

WOW a snow mountain in a Desert. We went in Jan 2015 and it was an experience in itself. You imagine a snow mountain in the middle of the desert.The place is very well managed and all is very secured and safe. The staff is very helpful and would like to se if you are having good time or not and would do whatever to keep you all happy.We are very thankful to all for giving us such a wonderful experience.This is one place one should never miss when they visit Dubai.The Cable ride to the top of the mountain should not be missed and all rides should be taken as all rides have their own charmGO for it people and enojoy
Excellent. Great place to have fun with family and friends. Adorable construction at mall of the Emirates. I enjoyed it a lot and I am a return guest of the structure.
nice experince. Worth to try it even though it is a little bit expensive. الأطفال انبسطوا حتى الكبار وكأنك في أوربا أو أمريكا

First Time Skiing. The layout and design of the pace is very well done. We went on a Friday afternoon after completing out shopping.After buying your ticket you proceed to pick up your gear to get onto the slope. It took us over 30min to get our gear, which means we missed our pick up to the slope. Whilst waiting there were children distracting the person helping us every 2 min.
