They would not follow the line, walk to the front and just touch all the tools being used to set up our ski's.After getting our ski'd we proceeded to the slope unassisted.On arriving we were greeted by a not very un-impressed instructor who asked us why we were late.We were not asked to join the group, and proceeded to wait for another 5min. Eventually we were asked to join the group, and proceeded to have our instruction.I thought the service was poor for a beautifully constructed place. The most disappointing was not being told that we needed to ask if we wanted photos taken. As all out valuables were in the locker we did not have any memory of this even though the facilities exist. And would advise visitors to be at least an hour early for any lesson.The one saving grace was that we had lost a ring, and service to locate it and return it to us was excellent!

Ride Breckenridge & Ski Dubai in the same week!. Aafter riding (snowboarding) in Colorado mountains came back to Dubai, where we live now ,and having guests in town decided to take them to ride Ski Dubai.The place is fairly organized, rental gear from boards to snow pants and jackets is available, Gear is ok not great, but staff is readily available to help you find your way. Most guests may not have seen snow before, so for experts it's really a novelty, playground type experience. The ride up the hill (?!) is slow and lines can make it even slower. It's the equivalent of a bunny hill and there are some boxes and jumps for tricks.So don't go for the ride, you will get bored fast if you are a serious or even intermediate rider, but at least you can say that you ski'd or snowboarded in the desert
Cute. Cute but so many other more interesting things to see and do! Much like the any ski resort but only indoorsr!

Some issues are there. If you are UAE residents, then you are entitled for 20% dicount on entrance ticket. They never tell you unless you claim for it. All clothing such as over coat, trousers and shoes are just ok type. They give a free voucher to buy one cheapest hand gloves. Believe me all our kids including me and my wife got our fingers totally frozen. Becaz of this we could not enjoy anything. So make sure you wear very good gloves. If you are a ski rider then its your day. Its really worth. We had very good time in cable car. It was awesome. Other rides inside were much focused on children. All together you can spend maximum 2 hrs. After that you really feel totally frozen. They charge around usd 40 per head without ski ride. It is quite very expensive. For a family it would cost you 160 usd. Keep this program just a day before you leave dubai. So that you can have cool memories.
the beat. It is the best snow Park I ve ever went to. The temperature is just like real and it is big and there was some ridea to have fun. Also there is sking.
its as good as the real thing. fun for all ages. this is an amazing experience for kids and ourselves especially if you havnt been to snow at all. the penguin show is a bit steep bu

Ski in the Desert. Coming from Canada we had high expectations for this and it's actually a really fun time. We put our young kids in a ski school for the week and they were able to have some fun and learn a bit. My wife and I skied one day. It feels like an actual ski lodge when you're walking in. It's not challenging for experienced skiiers, but it's really cool that you're skiing when it's 40+ degrees outside, and listening to music. Highly recommend

Its a Snow Park in the Desert!. Its a Snow Park in the Desert! so that in itself is a big deal. Good Fun - lots to do. I did not ski but enjoyed the other rides and the Penguin Show. Even though they provide the gear - I would suggest putting on a thick pair of socks and when asking for shoes ask for a size smaller than your regular size. Gloves help too.
great experience. mall of emirates , ski dubai is very diferent from other attractions , its always in minus temperature & cant resist morthan 1.30 hours max. rides are good , not very big...

Pretty ordinary for the hype created around it. Covers a large area and it pretty well organised...but my expectations were probably too high and it turned out pretty normal for the hype that was created around it...All in all a good place to spend some 20 to 30 min but definitely highly priced and the rides are at additional cost too...lot of similar places in India and other parts of the world are at equivalent or rather better than this

Had a ball!! . Ski Dubai was a lot of funny. Crazy to be in -2 degrees Celsius cold in the desert lol. My friend and I did the single person bobsled, tubing, and got in the big inflatable ball. We had a fun time. Def something you should do while out there if with friends or family everyone will enjoy themselves.

Great experience - snow in the desert!. Good value, nice quality snow and lifts pretty efficient. Great to have a lesson - instruction looked very good. they gave us 20% off if using MasterCard. Take glove and socks but rest is included in the cost of entry. Good value

Crazy. You just have to see it to believe it. All the locals were having a ball on the slopes and sleds. The mall was very crowded and reminded us of the Mall of America. Interesting to watch the families spending their Saturday at the mall!

Dealer trip experience was terrific. We took our dealers for a pleasure come business trip in May2015. One of the day agenda was a visit to Skidubai. All the people had real great fun and enjoyed throughly the rides inside and the Penguins show. It was a day very well spent for the whole group

sooo much fun. absolutely not to be missed.it is huge and does include sking and cable cars and zorbing too.really cold and totally fun.we did the encounter with penguins and that was an opportunity of a lifetime,where we could meet the penguins up close and also got to give them a hug and kiss.wow that was amzing.loved and loads and specially recommend ti for kids and animal lovers.my daughter loved it.

“North Pole in Dubai”. Ski Dubai in emirates mall is must place visit.The very cold temperatures give you the feeling that you are actually in snow. very well maintained. Penguin encounter is not must do thing. but overall very enjoyable place.

100% FUN!. I have been to a couple of indoor ski slopes in the UK, but nothing like this, it is huge! It is attached to a shopping mall, and if you're not a ski bum you can sit and watch from one of the many restaurants that overlook the action! You can have lunch and amuse yourself watching the good and not so good on the slopes!
North Pole in Sahara. Brilliant!!! Amazing experience for kids and family together!! Multiple things to be done!!!! Its an amazing adventure for the kids!!!! Family outing would be much more fun!
superb place.. ski Dubai in emirates mall is must place visit. very well maintained. Penguin encounter is not must do thing. but overall very enjoyable place.
excellent!. The experience was my first time and was simply amazing. The trainer was Bulgarian and very good! He inspired me to try skiing on a real mountain and I followed his advice.

Amazing change!. Nothing like getting out of the scorching heat into sub zero temperatures to shock the system! Only downside was there is no real beginner slopes so make sure you can ski before you attempt it!

Excellent for skiing but get your lift chairs working better!. Living in Dubai for quite sometimes we like to go to Ski Dubai from time to time for skiing and most importantly train.The concept has changed over the years as over 80% of the guests are not skiing. This is fine as there is a lot of different attractions for people to try however this is penalizing the skiers who are using the chair lift as lots of non-skiers are using the chair lift for leisure. We used to go up within 5 mns, on our last two visits it took us 9-10 mns. Not really fair especially that the faster lift on the left side is out of order/under maintenance since a month.SKI Dubai can you look into this in order not to loose your skiers! Otherwise good ski experience and a great place for beginners.
excellent place. they have created a proper ski place in desert. The very cold temperatures give you the feeling that you are actually in snow. well maintained. enjoyable for kids and youngsters.

Entertaining with The two poles meeting the Scorching Desert.. Ski Dubai: The lessons are entertaining and you learn fast. In six lessons I went from knowing nothing to an intermediate. There are two slopes, the first Starts VERY wide and not that steep and then goes very steep for a bit, then flat and then a long way to the end. The second is very steep and wide all the way and then a long finisher. For two slopes, having a wide variety is amazing. It is very peaceful and even though it is indoors, the views are amazing, so bring a thin camera / smartphone.Ski Dubai provides you with boots, suit, ski trousers, poles and skis however if you can, bring your own stuff.I recommend arriving at Ski Dubai at 8:00AM as in midday, it is packed and there is no space in the changing rooms.You should come with a friend and I recommend staying for 2-3 hours.The snow park is also very entertaining. There is lots of games and activities to do.Overall. I would definitely come here again and I recommend anyone in Dubai should come to either ski or play.

The northern hemisphere ski trip.....done for this year. Novelty value at best for any avid skiers or boarders. Lift is slow & run, well, it is indoors. Snow condition was surprisingly very very good. Fortunate to go on what must have been a slow day, as there was virtually zero traffic on the run.Boots were basic rentals, ski were not to bad ( have seen worst rentals).Don't forget your gloves, helmets available foc.
Enjoyable family outing. Spent a few hours at Ski Dubai with my 6 year old son. A great family experience which we both absolutely enjoyed.

Brilliant holiday!. This is a superbly run attraction with plenty to do,the ski lift up to the coffee shop is amazing for those who want to sit,watch and have hot chocolate.Everything you need for skiing is provided although if you plan to go to this attraction remember to bring gloves and a hat as these are not provided but the shop has them to buy at a reasonable price.Lockers are provided for your valuables etc which is good there are separate changing for ladies.There is also a wide range of things to do they have a penguin experience and you can even swim with them which is amazing and wetsuits etc are all supplied. There is no need to book online as it is better to go and see what you want to experience and they will explain to you the packages 3-4 hours is sufficient to spend in the place although you can spend all day.

Excellent Attraction. In June, I went to Ski Dubai, This is an extremely, exciting and excellent site. The rids are really cool and playing in the snow. I liked the houses and the cable. This is really excellent site!

Gret place - absolute fun!. Its a great place to spend 3-4 hours with family even if you don't Ski. Its maintained at -3 to -5 degrees and hence you need to have proper winter clothing. They provide jackets and lowers but you need to buy the cap and mufflers etc.Rides are fun and there is a café as well.
nice to watch from the restaurant. it's great for ski lovers who cannot travel to ski real resorts. this place adds to the variety of attractions in Dubai.

Only In Dubai!. SO where else in the world could you have 46 degree heat but be able to ski in snow and freezing cold temperatures...... Yep, they've done it again.... Ski Dubai is great fun for all the family and is in the middle of a shopping mall so even those in the family who aren't that bothered about taking part can find plenty of other things to do while you are in there! If they feel a bit peckish while you're burning off the calories flying down those slopes or glazing along on the cable cars, they can pop in to the Cheescake Factory which has a great view of it all. Take your own gloves though - they don't provide as standard and they are very expensive to buy just for that experience!

Not to be missed!. This is a must see attraction, especially for families with young children. The Ski slope is pretty decent and the instructors are competent. You could either snow board or ski. Apart from this, there is a zip line and a ski lift. Ideal for kids

A chilly experience worth having.. One of the best parts of the mall is this-ski dubai. A must visit place for all. Nicely maintained and full of activities. The only part you have to face extreme cold about. They are providing everything socks, shoes, hand gloves, suit etc. The good part is all the things given to you are either new or properly cleaned. You will find a stark contrast from Kashmir where you get clothes in very bad condition in spite of paying high rates.Here also the ticket rates are high about 220 AED for all but justified. Kids will surely enjoy the slides on ice, ball ride etc. The ropeway across the park is very good. You will be definitely be chilled when you reach at certain heights. All the rides and activities are for adults also. Some people feel it to cold when then enter, but again the good part is you can come out for some time and go in again without bothering about tickets etc. Penguin show is added attraction. Very delightful experience as seeing penguin is not routine. One side wall is of glass you can watch from outside before buying tickets, so you can go only if you find it worth.In my opinion one must visit.

Ski lessons. I had never done skiing before in my life until I went to this place in Emirates Mall. My intention was to learn how do skiing and I recommend this place for the beginners like myself and may be for others who are willing to master skiing. Can not complaint about the price and it was 125 dirham if i am correct and the lesson lasted for one hour which is well enough for a first timer. My instructor was a friendly guy from UK named Grant who was very good at his job and I had a great time there. Will definitely visit again for my second ski lesson.
Value for money spent. -3 was the temperature inside and was super fun for the kids as well as adults! Had hot chocolate inside as we were freezing after 1 hour.

Lots of fun. Quirky thing to experience in the middle of the desert. Warm clothes provided but take a beanie. There is lots to do or just walk around taking it all in. All of the rides are safe and lots of fun. Take the ski lift to the top to get the best views.

A great way to pass time. Went to Ski Dubai in April and we absolutely loved it. We had booked it on-line before we travelled so we got to skip the queue, worked out at about 100 euro for two people. It takes about 45 minutes to get set up ( getting your ski coat and trousers and ski boots and skis sorted) and then you get 2 hours of fun. Your time doesnt start until you first go up on the ski lift. It was such an experience skiing to music and then looking out and seeing people in shorts watching you ski in -4 conditions. I will definately be back to Ski Dubai, loved every minute of it.

Outstanding Experience for my Family. This was second trip for kids to Dubai... Dubai ski was amazing experience to all of us, wife, boys, daughters and of course myself. We are planning to repeat it again... It's so much fun.

Not worth it. Went to ski Dubai in December. We had entertainer vouchers but those didn't help coz it was cleverly designed for only certain (very expensive packages). Inside queues were crazy long and really unpleasant. Spend most of your time in queues and very very little on rides. Disappointing. Too expensive.

Must do. One of the oddities that you just have to do. One of the two slopes was closed. The hiring process was a bit chaotic, but manageable. The gear was worn, especially the boots. Managed to ski 5 times, then I had it with the boots. Been there, done that. Tick in the box. No big thrills.

EXCELLENT PLACE. This is a really beautiful place where one can really enjoy oneself in this man made "snow"park! There are rides of different sorts to please everyone.I would definitely recommend this place.

OK!!!!!. little overpriced in my mind if you dont ski. the concept is great and kitting up for it is fun post that its big let down unless you know how to ski or really want to learn. honestly felt like being in a large area with the aircon on -2. not my cup of team but you want to check it out. the ski lift ride was the only funpart

What an amazing experience. We went to ski dubai with our 4 year old twins and we had the best family day ever.It is freezing inside and even though you get snow gear it's still not warm enough. I brought vests and long John's for my kids so they were very warm, but my husband and I froze. So bring scarves and long pants with and a jersey when u go. They give u fleece gloves but they convince you to buy the proper snow gloves because the fleece still get wet. It is very pricy but the pictures and memories were worth every cent.
Gr8 place to visit. Temperatures rising. Outside mall its 45 degrees. But inside its minus 4. Snow clad place must visit.

Great time. This is the place where I saw all my girl's teethes because of happiness.
Despite the mostly expensive entrance fee ,, the amount of enjoyment you will get with your kids is priceless.
Very entertaining and recommend.

Snow Park . We had a nice morning out in the snow park with 2 kids aged 6 & 9. They enjoyed the activities and we felt the experience was value for money. One tip- give the photos a miss. They look great on the screen but the print out quality is terrible! Compared with what you get at Yas Waterworld in Abu Dhabi these are an absolute rip off!!

Surreal experience. We have been here before a few years ago, and I returned again with my son who had not been. It was as good as I remembered and my son was equally impressed. Not many indoor ski centres have a chair life as well. Snow conditions were good given that it was man made and the equipment was reasonable as well. It is somewhat surreal to be skiing in such cold temperatures then go out into the high 30's when you leave. If your a skier it is worth a visit just for the experience.
Skiing under 40°. Skiing under 40°, ok not outside in very big place, but very funny to see people skiing when the sun is high and hot. Love it, NOT TO ECOLOGIC ...

If you're used to skiing in the countryside, this is baby-level.. It's great for people who have never seen snow or gone skiing before as they can learn the basics etc on a comfortable, not dangerous slope. However, for more experienced skiers it can get tiresome very quickly. The slopes are short and the lifts are very slow. For anyone who plans to learn how to ski here, know that skiing outside of Ski Dubai will be a very different experience!!

Even mum and dad had fun. We had amazing time visiting Ski Dubai. We did everything except the skiing and had a blast. Great value for money. The kids loved the penguin show also. Our youngest loved that there are rides just for the littler ones. Tip, ask for the photos on USB much cheaper and you will get all the photos and if you can bring your own gloves as theirs aren't the greatest for keeping your hands dry and warm.
You Must Ski Dubai. This place is great. They provide all the equipment you need along with all the fun. Buy the full access pass and stay all day.

No Limits for Dubai. There are no limits for dubai to do something......A place full of snow inside a mall?Oh yes it is....The place provides you skiing surfboarding playing with snow and playing with penguins..Yes exactly the only place in the world where you can play with penguins and click photos with it.......Its an undescribable place because it can only be experienced

Amazing place 38 outside -4 inside. Paid for a private snowboarding lesson for our son.The organization is a little complicated which queue to get clothes, boots, weigh yourself then board. But that's just because it's all new and their were lots of people.The instructor was brilliant, and quickly took him from the training slopes up to the next level.He was an absolutely brilliant instructor. Even allowed our family to take a ride on the snow lifts.It's truely an amazing place.

Wow!. It's an amazing experience just in the desert!, Ski Dubai offers a lot of attractions you can do in the same place, also you can learn to skiing in a few hours!, the lifts are amazing and for sure is a must to do if you love the snow!

Ski Dubai, Kids will enjoy..... Good place to have your kids in, specially when you come from a country where its is rear to get to see snow or indulge in some snow / ice games, fun etc. Though not very cheap, but if you are in Dubai.... you have to visit SKI DUBAI, experience snow in the desert of Arabia..... once you are done, Mall is always there to spend more time.
Had my first Ski training. As a person who didn't have snow experience before this was great. Only got tickets for ski lessons! It was a great experience.

Good fun for once. The indoor ski slope at ski Dubai is now open since 10 years. It is probably great for the kids to learn how to ski and for more seasoned skiers to warm up before doing the real thing in the mountains. The facilities are starting to wear out a little and although you pay for a 2 hour experience you will most likely stop earlier as doing the same slope 25 times is getting quite boring. Again it is wonderful training facility but cannot compete with real skiing out in the Alps.

If you love Snow, this is miracle in desert. A must view, located at Emirates Mall.If you are from Tropical countries, Don't forget to take your own Hand Gloves + Monkey Cap + Worm Jackets, as you don't get it with your regular tickets & cost for buying there is Sky High.Kids will love it

A 2-Hour, All Inclusive Must Do For Skiiers. For anyone who can already ski or snowboard, Ski Dubai is a must!For only 200AED you get ski's, boots, a jacket and longs and two hours on the slope.For beginners, there are lessons. For those who already ski/snowboard you can start on the easiest slope which is the first stop on the chair lift. At this platform you get off turn right and have a gentle run down to the base. This is also the point at which you can stop and have a quick coffee, hot chocolate or bite to eat if you feel like getting the true skiing experience.If you stay on the lift instead of getting off at this first point you are taken up to the top, at which there are two routes that you can take, with one of the runs being steeper than the other. This means that you can get your ski legs back for a few runs and then hit the faster slope.This 400m slope (80m wide) is never going to compete with outdoor skiing but is amazing considering the temperature outside the building.I have told my wife that in future I only want to fly Emirates when travelling overseas so that we can include a stop over for a day so that I can take in a quite ski.

It Took Me Back To My Childhood Days !!. Located in the center of Dubai Mall, this place will make you forget that you are in a Desert City. The temperature inside is freezing and within 15-20 mins you get to feel the real chilling temperatures. This place Entertainer(the book that offers deals) might not benefit you much unless you are an experienced Ice Skater level 3. Tickets + Lockers+socks+ Jackets+ Bottoms+Shoes are all paid. Average costing would be 3000 per person. Initially you might wonder why people are shivering, those who have just come out but no sooner you will realise this that inside it is chilling cold. You have so many activities to do here. Some of them are included in your ticket. You can enjoy ride on each. If you are lucky you can enjoy watching Penguins show here. World's second biggest penguin is here and all in all 24 penguins have been restored here for public. A trolly that takes you to up and brings you down will let you experience the whole view of thsi area. though inside the mall but it isnt small. The area occupied by Ski Dubai is huge and its worth each penny. For every activity you have to get in the queue and wait for your turn. We loved our time here and played making snow - balls. Great time !

Skiing in a desert?. Why would anyone want to ski inside a mall in a desert is beyond my understanding. The amount of electricity and power that place must use to keep all that 'ice' cold is ridiculous. I did go inside for work once but never to actually ski and I probably would never do it either. Hundreds of people frolicking in stagnant 'snow'? I don't know.
Good for 1-2 hours. There is no much to do there for kids. The prices are high, but for this hot city is cool to have ski. You will get discount if you pay by MasterCard.
After the beach go skiing. Slopes are good to spend the time with children. 1 hour makes your cheats red and for legs some change of walking in the shops.
Good if you have your kid. Good if you have your kid with you otherwise will be boring unless if you upgrade your pass to super pass or power pass.

Ski Dubai .. super experience. Amazing ambience, the way it is made, super activities for adults and kids.
however a little expensive

A concept mall that will put you in Awe!. A fastastic mall, good shops and store (I loved the virgin store, superdry etc.) But skying is the best thing that can happen in this place. Do check it out.. and dont miss the penguin dance!

Escape from the heat. 4 of us went(2 adults and kids 5&8) and spent a good part of the day there. We picked the Power pass which had all the snow park plus penguin encounter. Did not include ski or zip line. We can't ski and we still had a blast. My reco is to go early, enjoy the snow park while no one is there. Eat lunch in the mall and then do the penguin encounter. Then go back to the snow park for whatever the kids want to do again.It is very annoying that they insist on no cameras with the Penguins and force you to pay 25 euro for 1 pic with penguin. What an experience, you need the picture!

So much fun. I love Ski Dubai. It is great to escape to the cold in the summer heat. I took group snowboarding lessons and the instructor was excellen. Obviously no comparison to real mountains but there are slopes.for all levels and a real ski lift. A special treat for children would be to see the penguins on the close up encounter.
Reasonably Ok but costly. This is reasonably Ok in terms of fun but costly place. Their packages are very costly. Also, activities for kids are less. One can go if want to enjoy simply snow in Dubai
a must see. unique in the world and amazing when looking outside the mall. i have not skied but it is certainly worth visiting
New challange. My kids enjoyed it too much, i have 8-10 years girls .needs more arrangement when taking the clothes. need more help more first time visitors .
Nice. LOvely placeMany slides and ridesPenguin programs were coldPlease don't go if u have cold phobia you will regret itBut lovelhy big area

A real snow. A real snow in the middle of the dessertIts an icy world that will take u in hours ( as long as u can stay in a -18C) to a nice trip with lots of ice games and activitiesDo not miss the penguins show every two hrs like 4 pm , 6 pm and 8 they are amazing creatures

Unbelievable!. A ski resort in the middle of the dessert! Only in Dubai - worth the trip, even if you have been to an actual ski location. The resort provides all that you need - complete with socks, gloves, shoes and overalls. Should have brought a hat and the gloves were are not helpful but quite an amazing experience!

Lovely Christmassy feel. Ski Dubai is a great experience and a must around Christmas time. The activity's are great, zorbing down the snow is great fun. Lots to do and see and the kids love it. Didn't go skiing but will next time!

Good place to hang out. I was on a business trip. So I went to ski Dubai solo. I snowboarded in there costing me AED 300 for a whole day lift ticket. The slope is reasonably long and wide considering it's an indoor slope. Price includes renting the boots, the snowboard, a jacket and pants. You have to buy gloves if you don't have one. It costs AED 25 for the cheapest fleece gloves. I went there on Saturday, there were not many people. I basically did not have to wait for the lift rides. They provide locker for a rental fee. If you are a beginner and you expect you will fall down, I wont recommend it for you. The snows are man-made. It hurts when you fall.

Must do if you love skiing. I had great fun skiing in the desert! Just what I expected and more. Bring your own gloves and a sweater, the overall they are lending is not enough, it is really cold there. the faster lift was a bit tricky but if you are an experienced skier, you should be fine. Snow was OK, and there were not that many people on the slope, so plenty of space to have fun. Its obviously only a short ride and you will spend most of the time on lifts, but for only a couple of hours it is well worth it.
Penguin Visit. Great fun and a surreal experience to meet penguins in the desert. It's a well run and well laid out experience and well worth a visit.

Expensive novelty - not worth the wait / money. It's definitely a novelty, but if you are from the USA or have ever skied in your life, I highly recommend just watching and not paying to go in. It's great for small children, but there are better ways to spend your tourist dollars and time.
amazing. I went there with 2 children they had very nice experience and watch the penguin if you have children you must take them to ski Dubai must

Penguin Experience with Anna. We had SUCH an amazing time at Ski Dubai doing the penguin adventure. We were with the trainer Anna, and she was so fun and knowledgable about the penguins. We were able to feed and hug the penguins and have them do tricks. Definitely an experience to remember. We LOVED Anna!

A Unique Experience. I really had a wonderful time with my family at Ski Dubai. There are many things to do there, such as sliding on the ice, strolling around the attraction, skiing, and the penguins' show. My kids had so much fun and want to go back there very soon.
Fun!. We had such a great time here! We really enjoyed ski-ing here in the snow! This place is a must visit!

Penguin parade. This is at the Mall of the Emirates. Set times for the penguin parade, first one was at 2.00 so we did not wait for that. We only looked in but the children we saw in it seemed to be enjoying playing in the snow. They were all dressed in snow clothes which they had hired

40 bday bucket list. booked this well in advance and what can i say but i have never been so nervous , excited, scared in my life but i absolutely loved it !!! its the best feeling ever plus teh best view in town and the Dubai sky dive staff are superb!!! They talked me through everything and what was going to happen and made me feel as much as ease as possible ! so thanks to Leigh and Mas !!! you really just need to do it its a once in a life time event and i can honestly say i will be doing it again when i next go back to dubai !!

A bit pricey. Penguin Encounter - You can meet the cutest little penguins @ AED 150 for around 40 minutes or so. A guide will impart information about these rare creatures in a funny manner. When our guide was explaining stuff to us, a little penguin kept following him about, asking for fish. That will definitely warm your heart, even at -4 degrees. :D .... As you are not allowed to carry your own phone or camera, Their own photographer clicks pictures while you hug & kiss the birds. Here's the catch - you can then buy these for AED 100 per picture (WHAT!!!) or AED 550 for a whole deal in which they give you 4 or 5 prints and a snow globe or something... Definitely over-priced, I think..... But one must definitely appreciate their efforts that enable us to meet penguins enjoy snow in the middle of Dubai.

Funny but too short. It is very different to see such a place in the middle of the desert but it is funnier for kids and beginners , but if you are advanced skier you would want too loose your time. Go search for resorts in the Alps. But it is worth to see if pass through Dubai.

What a fun place!. My husband and I wanted to see this recreational spot in the Emirates Mall and were impressed with all the recreational activity that this place included. Although we didn't participate, we enjoyed watching the activities through the windows.
Ski Dubai. Very well organized, something for everybody at the sight, one issue was that my wife didn't want to ski but we had to pay for ar she couldn't get it and watch us.

Had fun but I hate the cold. Fun my teenage kids loved it but they insisted I must accompany them for safety issues and I don't like the freezing feeling...The Penguins were cute and friendly an experience that is not regretted
Great place for fun. Really worth a visit, fun place to ski and perfect for childrenTried the Pinguins attraction and it was great, even for Adults!

Great Experience - But ensure you get your pass deposit back. Took the kids and they had a great time on the zip line, toboggans and various other activities. It is cold so make sure you take some extra clothes as the coats they give are not really enough for some people.WARNING - WE WERE NOT TOLD ABOUT THE REFUNDABLE DEPOSIT ON THE SKI PASSES AND LOST OUR MONEY. MAKE SURE YOU KEEP THEM AND GET A REFUND.

Feel Cold In The Heat of Dubai. one of the best inside ski places i have visited .. the place is nice and clean . one of the top attractions of Dubai. a little heavily priced but worth it . lots of attractions for people who dont want to ski and enjoy the ice . it has a good ski lift to take you around. also place for small children who just wanna enjoy in ice

Fun for the kids.... Been here 3 times..kids just love the snow, the slides and the cold temperatures..!! There are penguin shows as well, but for thrill seekers, go for the skiing and snowboarding....

Great fun for all the family. What a crazy thing to ski when it is +25C outside! We went there view times with kids and every time it was a great fun! Of course, don't expect much if you are an advanced skier. But it is great for those who want to improve the skills and for beginners. We prefer to go early in the morning to avoid crowds. Discounts for residents are available.

Snow Skiing in the Desert!. How exciting is snow skiing in the middle of the desert inside of a mall? If I didn't know that we were inside of a mall I would not have known the difference. The atmosphere was as if we were in Lake Tahoe at Heavenly or any other ski resort. The temperature was kept at 30 degrees so it was cold!!. We arrived in summer clothes and was able to change into our thermals and sweats. Snow suits and socks were provided and we brought our own hats and gloves with us as they are available for you to purchase. Lockers were available for a fee to lock up our personal belongings and the skis and poles were included with our rental along with the snow suits and socks. Hours for Ski Dubai are 10am - 11pm and we purchased our ticket online for $55 USD for 2 hours. You are able to choose your own time at anytime during the opening hours. There is another part of the Ski Resort that does not include the Ski price. It is separate to participate in a big ball that you can roll down the hill in and also there is a part where you can ride a zipline. The ski was enough for us! We enjoyed it and had an awesome time!
Terrible Service. We ate at restaurant in ski dubai food took forever and dd not look appetizing. We returned it. Yes it was that bad!
Too Good is skiiiiiiiiiiii.............. Skii...... a great snow sport, to show up our skills see ski+lls=skills and skills-lls= skii..........

Kids loved it. I visited Ski Dubai a few years ago and enjoyed it. THis year we brought the kids but to our disappointment the penguin show was sold out. even though we went early. The only way we could see them was if we paid double the entrance price.

Cool place in the middle of the desert. This is a place you have to see. I’m living in the northern part of Sweden where we have snow seven months a year. For us that didn´t matter, this is still a place you have to see with your own eyes. For us who are skiing five months a year, the slopes are quite easy and flat, but despite that skiing “in the desert” is a must. They have one slope that is for people that have been skiing before and one for beginners. They also have an area for non-skiers that just want to play in the snow. Besides skiing you can also pay to hug and kiss a real penguin. We did that and it was once in a life time experice. I really recommended this!!

Ski Dubai is fun. We did the kind of cheap access as we were non-skiers. The place was -3 degrees C. We were warm enough but after two hours playing with the Bobsled run, slides and big plastic balls, we were done.

Skiing at 30 degrees Centigrade. Unbelievable experience and at a very reasonable rate. I was surprised to find that the man made slope was reasonably testing. About 300m and nice conditions. It was very unique and totally unexpected. A must do adventure. Loved it!
what a place. had lot of fun with friends in summer of 48c in dubai we r on snow so wonderful very nice experience

Nice place. It is amazing to find such a big ski location in hot weather city like Dubai. The hotel gives me free tickets as a hotel package .it is part of the emirates mall ,the second largest in dubai.it gives also good view for the surrounding Resturants such as cheesecake factory

Cool Place. It is kind of amazing to put on your ski gear at 40+ degrees outside temperature and go for a run down the slope(s). Very good organization and a perfect summer break for children. Ski courses are well orchestrated and kids are looked after.

Amazing Day Out with Penguins !. Good indoor ski area, Ski slope is pretty good. There are other smaller areas if you can't ski and just want to enjoy the snow.Best part is the Penguins. Booked the show where you can touch & play with penguins, it was awesome. There is a separate show where you can watch penguins perform as well. You are not allowed to take camera, they have photographers, just be aware of the photos, each photo costs around 100 AED if I can remember :)

Winter whole year round. It may seem expensive for the largest indoor snow park (with real snow); we can play min. 13 hours on their shortest opening day (while Fri opens 9am -12 midnight). And whether someone gets too cold/uncomfortable to continue, there's no limits of entries/exits to get some sunshine or ever shopping at one of the largest shopping malls in the world: Mall of Emirates.

Ski dubai. It was the most fun. All kinds of snow fun besides skiing. They also had a penguin show, there was plenty of skiing to be had including expert trails. Unbelievable for in a desert setting. A must to do in fubai

Good for beginners. Would recommend this to anyone who hasn't been skiing before and wants to learn to ski in a comfortable environment. The instructors were really helpful and all the important equipment was provided. Give yourself plenty of time to get equipment fitted and would recommend going on the ski lift to see the size of the slope, very impressive for an indoor slope

Dream become true. It was such a good experience to see, touch and learn about Pingouin especially for kids.Good staff, very well organised...Remarks : if you have kids, make sure to wear winter clothes.

Horrible staff during the ski lesson. I took my two children to Dubai for the holidays and we decided to book a skiing lesson for the kids because they had never skied before but the instructor was shouting at all the children if they did not do a tiny bit right.When my daughter did really well they shouted at her and said that she is stupid and she is terrible at this which made it really not enjoyable at all

Looks Like Fun!!. Whenever I go to the MOE, i watch people in the indoor ski area, and keep saying that i will go for it - the next time around this is one Place I want to go to...The kids seem to have a great time there..Would be good to Experience the Ice in Dubai.

skiing lessons for grandchildren excellent. The family have travelled to dubai several times and never miss the chance of a skiing lesson for the children now aged 5 &7 yrs. It is a great facility especially in the heat of dubai and the rest of us can have an hour for a coffee.Hopefully they will be ready for the real slopes.
Good to see !!. Brilliant !! man made snow ski in the mall of emirates... adventures and love to enjoy if you enjoy ski

Good place, bad service, horrible employees. I went to ski dubai with my 6 yr old son on 9 April, 2015 starting at 12.30pm. The place is nice and maintained well. However, there are two big concerns:1- No instructions or signs to direct you to the location of each game. We were looking for the entrance of the chairlefts for 15 minutes till we were able to find it after asking employees who don't even smile.2- The worst thing happened was during (meet the penguin) session. I paid extra money expecting good service. First, we were not able to watch the instructional video because the door had technical problems! later the employee who provided the session was horrible (so much serious with the kids). My 6 yr old son was trying to show his simple knowldge about penguins which he learnt in school this year, but unfortunately the employee was so rude not allowing him to say a word! later he shouted on a little girl because she wasn't following his instructions.. I told him the girl doesn't understand English.. he said to me in a very rude way but you saw the video and it was in Arabic! this indicates there is such a bad communication among employees. Moreover, this particular employee doesn't have the basic skills of giving a show or a session in entertaining place.. he does't smile, does't interact with people, and the worst thing he wanted me to keep my purse with his friend (supposedly be security)!! I went to tons of places such as Disney theme parks in Paris, LA, Orlando and many others, but this experience was terrible because of the employees and not the place itself.For further info., you may contact me at alsaleh.d@gust.edu.kwIf Ski dubai want to take the necessary action about the employee, our session was at 2.30pm on Thurs. 9/4/2015.Regards,Dr. Dhoha AlSaleh (Kuwait)
ski in desert.. its ok if you don't have any other place to ski or see snow. Cool that they built it. Outside the building is attached to Dubi mall and unique looking.

You have to do it..... Not because it's great skiing but because how many times do you get the chance to ski in a MALL? There are only 2 slopes and the place was empty. It was me & my 2 friends & one other person. The ski lift is ridiculously slow & the snow is kinda like glue. LOL. But it was a once in a life time event, so it was fun!

Excellent facility. The skiing experience itself was excellent, longer indoors than I've experienced anywhere else. My son had a lesson and developed his skills.My reservations are on the organisational side. The centre did not respond to email correspondence which meant that our beginner booking was ultimately incorrect. Clothing collection is a muddle and caused significant delays, almost to the point of my son missing his lesson. The clothing was good and comfortable but had insufficient pockets to hold a phone, wallet etc. Therefore I could not buy a drink on the slopes, which was surely the point! Information and co-ordination was generally poor, but the overall experience was very good.On a second visit some of our group did the Exclusive Penguin Experience, which was truly excellent in all respects, helped by having experienced the confusion in obtaining clothing etc.My advice is that this facility is definitely worth a visit, but please have patience through the confusion!

Great fun. A definite must when in Dubai and great fun for all the family. All the equipment and clothing is supplied and prepare for some thrilling rides and slopes. Remember to bring a extra pair of socks as it is extremely cold.

A unique attraction worth a visit when in Dubai. Ski Dubai opened in 2006 part of the Mall of the Emirates adjacent to the Kempinski Hotel. It gives a visitor the opportunity to ski all 365 days per year......there are plenty of attractions for 'professional' skiers to children that wish to learn how to ski. Even if you do not visit the slope to ski it is worth having a meal at the Cheese Cake factory restaurant which is located at the bottom of the ski slope to watch (when entering ask for a table with a full view of the ski slope) or in one of the Kempinski hotel chalet suites with superb unobstructed views of Ski Dubai.

Skiing in the desert. Obviously a must-do, especially when travelling from Australia! My teenagers first experience of "snow" happened in a shopping mall. This is an incredibly well-done bit of tourism. We can't ski although my son had an hour long snowboard lesson. Plenty of fun on the rides, chairlift and toboggan slide. Not a cheap day out! Like most things, pre-booking on line gets a better rate and slightly shorter queues.

Pretty good for indoor skiing. Considering this is indoor skiing, it's actually pretty good. The snow is quite real and the slopes aren't bad. But since I'm from Canada, their "expert" hill is really still a green / blue hill here.

Interesting Experience. We paid for the 2 hour ski experience and that was enough. In the 2 hours we got in about 12 runs. We went in the evening and there were only about 5-7 people actually skiing. The rest of the people were taking the chair lift up to the top and coming back down. It definitely does not compare to "real" skiing but it's great for beginners or cooling off from the desert heat.
MUST DO! in Dubai. In teh shipping mall spend some two hours in the ski resort to play and ski.. It is really cols. Brig a scarf an gloves! Ski pants an Jacket are easy rented...
Good place to visit. Good Place to visit but only once. Kids might want to go there again and again. try to go a bit early to avoid the crowd and see the fresh snow.

It's a mini Kashmir in Dubai.. Dubai is full of heat and sand; however Ski Dubai was a pleasant experience all together. Enjoyed to the fullest along with family. Got a wow kind of a feeling beyond imagination. Could be developed still further, was little bit crowdy.

Nice Private Lessons. My 3 kids had never ski before and I registered them to private lessons. The instructor was amazing and with only 3 days lesson they were skiing by themselves. Very well organized.
a ski resort option. a good moment to enjoy the wonderful penguin show and the ski ride... kids had loads of fun out of the sun in Dubai...

Interesting to look at. Obviously if you are a skier, you will not want to ski there, but it's nevertheless quite interesting to see it. Don't expect St. Moritz but it's definitely "real" snow vs. the plastic slopes that used to be around a few years back. There is also a bob sled run, but super short. More fun for kids who perhaps haven't skied before.

Ski in the Desert at Ski Dubai. During our free time in Dubai, my friends and I decided to kill two birds with one stones: ride the metro to see Ski Dubai, an attraction that piqued our curiosity. A 25-story ski resort in a mall in the desert? Really?We purchased a day pass from the Al Rigga station in the Deira section of Dubai to reach The Mall of the Emirates, a 35-minute ride (12 stops) on the Red Line. Exit the station and you are at the mall. Very convenient. Of the malls we visited (Dubai and Yas in Abu Dhabi), we found the Mall of the Emirates to be the most elegant with 535 stores; 97 restaurants and cafes; 2 luxury hotels (5* Sheraton and Kempinski).We relied on a mall locator map to direct us to Ski Dubai (www.skidxb.com) on the G floor near the Virgin megastore and adjacent to the Cheesecake Factory. We were strictly observers; another friend skied here the day before. She is a Minnesota native and while she was happy for the experience, commented that it was fairly simple for one native to the land of the frozen chosen. Ski Dubai It was fun to watch the kids all dressed in helmets, snowpants, gloves and boots throwing artificial snow snowballs at each other. We were able to see the chair lift and bobsled run but could not see the ski slope from our vantage point next door to the Cheesecake Factory.The resort packs 6,000 tons of artificial snow with a tow lift, and quad chairlift to service the five runs. Ski and snowboard lessons are available along with access to a quarter-pipe freestyle zone.

Penguins, out of this world!. I visited ski Dubai but i didn't actually ski. I went there to see the penguins which in my opinion was worth every penny spent. It's really amazing to watch a trained and named Penguin do tricks in one of the hottest places i visited and it's amazing to see how well taken care of the penguins are. Their skin is unexpectedly soo soft and the excitement i got from petting them and watching them cannot be compared to any other activity i did in Dubai. One could go on this tour with family, friends, or with a loved one. The only thing in my opinion that was unnecessarily over priced was taking the pictures after leaving ski Dubai. One has to pay around 100 Durhams per picture which is approximately $28 .

Fun, but expensive. I like this place, but it is an expensive "man creche" while the wife is shopping. This time I used my Emirates ID and saved 20% which was good, but if it was more reasonably priced, I would go more often.

Wonderful, Don't miss it. A real wonderful attraction. Imagine out is so hot and in is so cold. It's really amusing. Price of ticket is expensive but it worth it. They give you free gloves & socks too. I met with penguins & they were so lovely & cute. You can play here for hours and you won't get enough. There are many things you can try : Chairlift ride, Giant Ball, Mountain Thriller, Snow Bullet, penguin Encounter etc. I recommend everyone to spend some hours in ski Dubai. Hope to come back here asap.
Ski Dubai. Ski track in shopping mall. Outside temperature + 40 C. It's real. No fantasy :) for children pinguins shows.
go slow!. don't get into expensive passes if you are first time person.. go slow ask them you just want to look around at first and then go advance one by one

Grounded. I booked a couple of hours of skiing at the most unique ski hill in the world (in a mall, in a desert) and had a great time. Not overly challenging but not too simple either, it is well worth the time invested.My husband had booked snow board lessons but despite having documentation, Ski Dubai didn't have it in their system and didn't seem too concerned about getting it resolved. No lessons and he was left standing outside while I skied. We did get the money back but lack of effort on the part of Ski Dubai was concerning.

Expensive. if you're a beginner skier/ snowboarding don't let them suck you into buying the most expensive pass for 500dhs as its not worth it. They didn't tell me that after my lesson I wouldn't be able to snowboard by myself and practice what I just learnt. You're not allowed on the slopes - even the low ones. This was the only reason I got this pass. When questioned they then disclosed that they don't do partial refunds. Very disappointed. Rip off.
A novelty and no more. Massmarket indoor ski area. Take the kids for a laugh, but its three or four turns and you are down. Give it a miss.
surreal. went early morning and slopes were quiet and snow good. Good fun and surreal expereince after arriving in summer clothing.

Snow park in Emirates mall- a wonder Frozen zone. From 40 degrees Cenigrade ouside temp enter an area of Snow having -2 degrees temp. After wearing special clothing provided you can experience Ski, chair lift , sliding and also Tumble ball , all in an area full of snow. Sounds unbelievable until you see it.

fun and different. We just booked snow park entry from uk you had to pay deposit for locker key which you got back at end.We were supplied with trousers jackets disposable socks and boots i had taken gloves you will need them it was -4 in there. A couple of rides inside are free and the penguin show is lovely. Enjoyed it but you do have to pay extra fot everything.else.

Waiting times horrendous. Visited today as my two children had a ski lesson. We arrived 45 minutes in advance as per the advice. We finally got them kitted out in ski clothes, helmet, boots & skis 1hour 15 minutes later! The queues were enormous - possibly due to bad weather. Ski Dubai were very good and allowed us to put the lesson back by half an hour.The lesson itself seemed good from what we could see. The kids loved it - their first time on skis - and seemed to achieve a fair amount. The feedback from the instructor was good. Would have been a better rating if our experience prior to the lesson had been better.

worth it for the novelty value. All visitors had to go there as it was too incredible or should that be ridiculous or enterprising; anyway it was fun and is what makes Dubai different and ahead of the others!
Why?. It's an indoor ski slope. How good could it possibly be? I did not ski on it, but I would not want to. It is short and very expensive. I'd rather spend the money and go skiing on a real slope.

Penguins in the desert. I took my siblings to see and interact with the penguins while they were visiting. It was the first time for myself as well. It was a great experience although I wish we were able to spend some more time with them. I did learn a great deal about their environment, layers of feathers, and habits. I will say that I'm lucky to have the opportunity to interact with the penguins as its the only place in the world that allows for this sort of experience.
ski dubai 😁. a place to enjoy with young kids penguin show was gud enjoyed a lot .. gr8 place those slides were gud those cable carts were built very smartly overall i had a gr8 experience......

Very nice experience!. Ski Dubai is an amazing experience no one should miss, we had sooo much fun! But take good care of your tickets because we lost one for them when we were inside, so we lost 20 DHS.

Extremely cold place in extremely hot city. I think just the idea of being there is amazing. I have been to the mall several times but did not want to try this alone. So I tried it with my family. Everyone had lot of fun, little ones and adults.You might think it won't get that cold inside but it really does. They give you cheap gloves that gets wet and makes you cold so if you are planning to stay for long, I would recommend the water proof gloves.Take the family package ticket and try it all.

Best Indoor Ski Experience. I visited Ski Dubai in Feb15 with my family and was pleasantly surprised by the whole experience. My children loved it and the quality of the facilities were top draw.Highly recommended for something different to do in Dubai.

The irony of this concept of skiing makes this a must see !!. Has to be done for the novelty factor - either to see or do! Smaller than I expected and it was very very busy, but the fact you are able to ski in the dessert makes this a must see or indeed do!!

Penguins!!!. Went there for a penguin encounter- they dont just sku there, but they also have real penguins! I took the Ultimate Penguin Encounter, where they take you for a guided tour around the penguin's house, where you can see, how they live, breed, molt ^)) Penguins are really cute and feeding them is also a funny experience. Our guide Yawas was also excellent!

A really COOL place. Great few hours of entertainment. Numerous different option of different activities to suit all ages and skill sets. You do not have to be able to ski to enjoy. The staged pictures are very good and they offer 4 for 300 AED which is the best offer I came across in all the different attractions
Disorganised. It has everything going for it , in terms of an indoor snow ski experience. However getting your kit is a huge problem. We waited over an hour !!

even if you dontwant to ski its still a great place to visit.. We didn't want to ski but still couldn't pass up being in the snow in the middle of the desert and we were not disappointed. We had fun sledding, sliding, rolling, playing with penguins, riding the chair lift and sipping hit chocolate is the lodge. If you are in the area and have a free afternoon, even if your not a skier, ski Dubai is still the coolest place around.
Ski lessons. Really enjoyed the ski lesson. The powerpass upgrade was not great for adults. Decent equipment. Would go back again. Reasonable prices.

Great experience, but pricey . Ski Dubai is quite the experience, coming from the desert heat, through the fairly mundane shopping mall into a full on snowy ski centre. We enjoyed our experience very much. We opted for the 500 riyal experience which included beginner ski lessons, a penguin experience, access to the ski fun park and also lunch. The instructor was helpful and knowledgeable and the skiing was great fun. The penguin experience was fantastic but perhaps mainly aimed at children and the fun park was good fun but not as good as the skiing or penguins. Overall I would recommend any tourists to visit ski Dubai but maybe consider just the lessons or just the penguins - the complete package is a little overpriced and the photographs are extortionate.

A true wonder in a desert. It's hard. To believe how they could create such a thing in the middle of a desert. This artificial snow park and ski is a perfect place to visit to escape from the Dubai heat. They have small penguins which the children love to play with.

One of the First things I do to get Oriented to Dubai. I'm a PSIA Level 2 instructor, and have been three times on three different trips, and each time is consistently fun and enjoyable. Ski Dubai has the worlds slowest charlift bringing skiiers to the top of a small vertical rise. Sort of a Green slope, with a bit of Blue on skiers right. Stop for great hot chocolate at mid-slope. All clothing, skis, and boots are provided. Boots will be well worn, so advise getting a smaller boot than shoe size. Low cost gloves (20Dh) with Ski Dubai logo make for a collectors item, and function to keep the cold down. The room is kept at freezing, so wear a few extra clothes to stay warm. Riding the Poma lift also helps keep you warm. I'm usually ready to quit after 2 hours.
winter wonderland. After coming from the dessert heat , it was unbelieverble sight to see snow in dubai.we saw little toddlers with their parents/grandparents.we even saw roaring log fire.

Bit of fun in the snow. Great place to go to cool down lots of fun and great place to hang out have a drink & eat and bit of skiing, penguins too kids will love it everyhing is supplied but don't forget warm socks, hat & gloves but these can be bought there too.

A bit chilly!. A great for kids even if you are not into skiing but be sure carry your own winter gloves and boots if possible as it does get really cold inside. The free gloves which they provide is definitely not sufficient to protect you from the cold.

Beautiful . We went there and since it was warm weather it felt amazing to be in snow.we took the super pass.it included the jacket shoes and gloves,but found out that we had to purchase snow cap separately which was overpriced and felt like being cheated.once inside u forget about everything else and just enjoy the snow.being in snow ball was lots of fun.wished that i took skiing lessons since skiing was for experienced skiiers only.nonetheles definitely a place to if u are on holiday.
great fun. great setting, i never tire of the fact that its 40+ degrees outside and -4 in here, plenty for everyone to do although you may get cold if you ski as the lift seems to take ages
miracle. and you have snow in the middle of the desert as well. the experience is worth the costly ticket and you will not regret it one bit

Snow Park in the Desert!. Brillant piece of engineering .... to have a snow park open 365 days of the year in Mall of Emirates.
Benefit as a place to go anytime...with family or friends.

Amazing experience of Ski in midst of a desert... MUST DO for Family. This is one of the most amazing experiences for any family visiting Dubai for the first time. Will be a memorable one and must enjoy to the fullest.

Surprisingly good snow quality, not very crowded. We probably went at a non-peak time (8pm on a Wednesday) - barely anyone was there so at times we had the "slopes" to ourselves, which was great! The snow is "snowy", not icy or thin, very easy to ski on. Lots of fun!

Won over. I had thought it would be a gimmick, but it was fantastic fun! It's very well organised & everything is provided (although I'd pack some extra socks). We had toddlers aged three with us so didn't ski, but did have a great time playing, going on rides & the chairlift - the place is huge! The ticket is all day so you can come in & out for a quick defrost. We also had the penguin encounter which was amazing - great guides. Overall, good value & a great day out. Recommended.
Ski Dubai . This was one of the best experiences. Your walking through the mall and allOf a sudden you see cable cars and a ski slope. You know I had to give it a shot.....Instagram: @tommiesox

great fun. me and my wife visited this place on our anniversary and it was great fun. Being in the heat all day long outside in Dubai was nice to get some cool cold air and snow. There are plenty of things to do inside and is great fun.

ski dubai. You can ski in the middle of the desert?? Yep right in the middle of Emirates mall is a ski slope which provides all the gear you need for tobogganing or skiing. There is a ski lift as well. There is also a gorgeous group of penguins which will come out every hour to be fed and waddle around. A great experience for the kids.

Snow in Dubai. This is a must if you love skiing. Where else can you lie on a beach or at a pool all day and then go skiing in the evening. Or if you like take the children during the day for some fun. This place is great!

Ski Dubai with my kids. Ski Dubai is a wonderful destination venue and as a Dubai Resident have enjoyed it for 10 years regularly visiting it since it was open. Both my kids have learnt to ski there and the facilities are good, and constantly being improved. Unfortunately the delivery of service, particularly early on a Friday is erratic, with inconsistent pricing and promotions, drag ski lift sometimes not open, or with damaged equipment affecting it's operation, with staff seemingly untrained to operate or maintain it properly. Avalanche café is a good vantage point, but recently the staff have changed, sometimes open late and not ready to serve you. Some appear not to have been trained on food handling, and observed not using gloves when preparing food, after handling cash. Overall the experience is good, but standards, especially quality of staff & training seems to be diminishing, which is a shame.
amazing experience . we went for a great fun time and we had the greatest day there !! FAMILY AND FRIENDS EXPERIENCE ... advised to goooooooo

Escape. When you are outside in the Dubai heat, you dream of getting into some nice, cold climate with soft snow. But once you get into SKI DUBAI, you feel as if you in the ALPS. Its cold and the snow soft. Excellent facility, if a bit fast for my liking.

The best santa ever!. We had a brilliant day. The children loved the hot chocolate and marshmallows in the Avalanche cafe. Visiting Santa was the best part, he must be the real santa! He was so kind and caring. Visiting Santa here is definitely a new christmas tradition for us now.

Unique to ski in the middle of the city. It s lovely and the quality of the snow is good. You can have rest of the strong sun. Very good organization when everything is arranged, they borrow you all you need when you want to spend 2 hours in the facility.
good indoor ski. for all year ski you can enjoy ski and snow boarding there but its small place and the bad thing you cant ski without lesson in ski school there.

Sking in the desert. Now tell everyone that you went snow skiing in the desert. Great price for 2 hours of fun. They give you pants, jacket, boots, skis. Bring gloves and a hat or buy them there. Priced very well. About $60 USD for 2 hours. 2 hours of skiing in the dessert. Another slip of paper for the bucket check off list

Want to experience freezing cold and snow in ME?. My kids wanted to ski and I did not want to travel all the way to the Alps while we live in Doha. Great compromise I thought: I will send them to Ski Dubai for a 1.5 hr group ski lesson. The kids really enjoyed it. Not too expensive and all gear (incl socks), except for gloves is provided as part of the deal. Lockers are not for free, but bring a bag along for your shoes and presto! your parents take care of the rest.

A quirky-fun couple of hours. Ok, these aren't the kind of slopes that anyone who's ever been skiing anywhere else will actually see as a thrill of any kind, but for the fun of walking from the 100 degree outside, into a respite from the heat that includes a little snowboarding or skiing, this is a fun couple of hours. There are only two slopes and they're both very short, but the novelty of skiing inside outweighs the lack of a challenge that comes with it. This is a good break from afternoons at the beach or the pool.

Cool play to ski or board but dont bother otherwise. Considering we / it is in the middle of the desert and in summer it can be 50c outside it is an amazing snow venue.The GOOD bits: a. It is real snow, it is a constant -2c, b. no wind chill and the contrast to Dubai's harsh summer is amazing.c. Very good ski tuition (group and private lessons for all)d. uncluttered slopes ideas for a once a year skiere. the black run, is easy but fun.f: you can book a whole day's ski which means you leave the slope or mall and come back again the same day and ski some more, cost is very little extra and excellent value.The Bad bits:a. The Penguins: they shouldn't be there. not good.b. The ski lifts are slow c. Very very busy at weekends and evenings (early morning is amazing, its practically exclusive!)d. For non skiers its overpriced and boring (in my opinion)In summary: if you ski, board or want to learn it is fab. Otherwise don't bother (unless its 50c outside and you just need to chill, then it might be an expensive way to do it but it works!!)

Pretty cool, kinda gimmicky. It wasn't that busy so that was nice. We only stayed about an hour or so, we didn't do any skiing, but we did the snowball, the luge track, and we were able to take the ski lift up once with our pass. We actually regretted not paying extra to do the ski / snowboard all day pass, but the other activities are pretty fun.
Ski lessons. My son took some beginners ski lessons and loved it. It's a great alternative for those of us who can't travel to the real slopes.
Ski Dubai. Was an excellent day out plenty of things for kids to see and do unless your into ski-ing you run out of activities quickly

Average experience very expensive. Its okay place, lot hyped and significantly overprices. Also they try to oversell you. I bought higher value pass as they mentioned there will lot of free things after going inside realised most of things were free in regular passes also. Ended up paying almost 100 AED more for no significant benefit. Visit only if you have excess time

Great Experience . We enjoyed is ski dubai, but it was very busy as we went in Eid time but anyway it was nice.
We missed meeting the penguins as it was closed due to eid, hope to see them next visit

Snowboarding in Dubai. I recently was in Dubai for a business trip and vacation.I decided one day when it was overcast to visit Ski Dubai. I actually learned to snowboard here whilst on holiday.Its ok to have a sketch about in, but now as a experienced snowboarder you can only spend 2 hours in it. Its good for what it is, but nothing compares to the real thing.Its ideal for learning on, or practicing your skills.You sometimes have to remember that you are in a indoor ski centre.I might go back again in the future, I have been now 3 times.My wife was away getting her nails done, so it filled in some time.Its funny when you see peoples reaction to snow, that have never experienced it.If you are in Dubai its worth going to see.

St Moritz in Dubai. Pleasantly surprised to see all the activity at this beautiful venue and how the public enjoyed the feeling of being on a genuine ski slope. Even more of a surprise was the St Moritz Café and viewing windows where one could sit and enjoy hot chocolate and a view to boot. Very lovely

Ski Dubai. We did book before we left the UK as they only let so many in there are loads of fun stuff to do inside so if you don't ski you can still enjoy the sledge run the ball ride see the Penguins and more. take hat and gloves with you but everything else they supply.the slopes are short but the experience of skiing in such a hot country was great we loved it -3 so not as cold as Europe for the ski. we went on a Friday not sure if this is a Sunday to the locals but the slopes were empty up and down in no time. Most of the locals just walk round the other areas.as they don't ski, how could they?

Cool. Very nice but coming from Canada snow doesn't impress me but only in Dubai could you see such a piece of workmenship! We saw the one at the West Edmonton Mall and spent time in Switerland and Austria. Awesome to see an indoor huge snow hill.
SNOW IN DUBAI!. Liked: The whole concept of skiing, interacting with penguins, snowboarding etc. Disliked: The PRICE - VERY VERY pricey!
great experience. The experience at ski dubai was great.u will enjoy many kinds of rides.don't forget to ski over there. It is one of the unique experience in dubai ....
ski dubai. Ski dubai is located inside the mall of emirates in dubai.Its good and worth for 250aed .Another good entertainment option in dubai.

Ski and Bowl. We plan to go to Ski Dubai every time we travel to Dubai this time we receive a card to the third floor game area our daughters had lots of fun next time we add bowling to it why not in Dubai Ski so Bowling would be fun also.

We saw the Penguins, and played in the snow.. We where interested in seeing what Ski Dubai had to offer. We were not very interested in the skiing aspect but they did have a great thing about seeing the penguins. The cost is fairly inexpensive for what you get, but let me tell you... its all about the photos. They will not let you take your own photos. There is a photographer at every second, its good if you have the money to spend. For one photo they want 100 dirham, or for eleven they want 1000 dirham!!! A bit expensive if you ask me. The whole experience of petting and kissing the penguins is very cool. Just be warned about the photos.

Cool time in the Heat. This is mainly for local Emiratis who want to experience the cold and excitement of fun in the snow! I doubt if many Europeans or Australians would actually use this place as it is so easy for us to Ski at home! Its fun to watch the locals at play in the snow!

Snow in Dubai!. When you have a family in tow, this is certainly one of the best attractions in Dubai. It will keep your young ones and even adults occupied for a good half day of fun and activity in the snow! They have lessons for beginners and only qualified skiers are allowed to use the chair lifts with skis. Get the Power Pass which includes a ski lesson.

Ski in the Desert. Great way to enjoy skiing in the most unusual place! Ski Dubai is an exciting place to go, if only for a couple of hours.No need to bring any gear, so can actually go in your shorts & tea-shirt. All the gear is provided to your size.Try to avoid Fridays & Saturdays, as these are the weekend days.And stop off at the half-way chalet for a hot drink - it won;t be hot wine unfortunately:)

strange attraction. went with the metro to emirates mall and visited the mall and the stores. Here you find also the attraction ski dubai..which is strange to see people skiing here ...But it is not bad to give locals the possibility to touch some snow in the dessert..

Missed chance. Sadly we ran out of time to visit this indoor ski resort, saw it from the outside, looks spectacular snow in the desert. Friends at the hotel went with their son and thoroughly enjoyed the day.
AMAZING. First time i had ever been skiing, but still had the time of my life. The atmosphere is awesome and the snow feels so real. Such a great experience!

Suspend judgment ... and enjoy !. Ski Dubai is one of those places that you'd love to hate but you'll hate to love. Morning at the beach, in sapphire blue waters with views of the Burj Al Arab, and then afternoon skiing ! I almost did not go, but I was exhilarated.It's not the skiing in itself; it's the surreal idea of skiing in Dubai, with a "mountain inn" midway down that makes it great fun. I was there with a group of friends and we all had a fabulous two hours. I know, I know ... the environment ... capitalist excess ...the exploitation of immigrant labor ... and just like some of the best in Vegas it's all uber-fake - but it was great fun.

Best hangout in summers... Great place to visit with families..Located in the MoE, it is equipped with awesome rides in the snow, professional training also provided for ski lovers. Watch out for deals, it is worth a visit.

Try - 4 degrees celsius in a 40 degree celsuis country. I thought I had to know how to ski in order to get into ski dubai but in fact, it's the complete opposite. i went with some friends the first time around and then with my son the second time and I had the most amazing time, from taking the telefric, to snow ball making, zip lining and the amazing hot chocolate! you can easily take a few hours of your day to make it a special occasion

Fun, fun, fun. Indoor snow skiing, where else but Dubai! Attached to a large mall, this popular attraction is easy to navigate because all signage is in Arabic and English. Rent skis and other gear and you can buy a 2-hour pass or an all-day pass. Short slopes but lots of fun and there are places your friends can go to get decent photos of you skiing.

Surprisingly fun. I live yearlong in a ski resort (Chamonix), and so spend most of the winter on ski. While on a short trip to Dubai, I went to check out this out of curiosity. I wasn't expecting much out of it, but was pleasantly surprised: it's well run, the snow is fairly good if a bit slushy and there is enough height gain and steep bits to be able to pick up some serious speed.The chairlift is painfully slow, but the other lift goes reasonably fast, I counted 18 rotations in 1h30. The gear they rent is good enough, and the clothing warm enough for a couple of hours in the fridge.It's not cheap at Dhs 200 (plus a nearly-mandatory 25 for a locker, as they won't let you have a backpack on the slopes, and you need somewhere to put your shoes and change of clothes) but worth it for a different experience, even for advanced skiers, though you'll probably get bored after an hour or so. It would be a great place for beginners, though.

Good, but can be avoided. Good points1. Snow park, nicely made2. If you can ski - then you are surely gonna have a good time3. You get to greet,meet and see penguinsNot so good things1. Pricey2. If you are from europe, or have been to Switzerland then you can give it a miss3. Limited number of rides

Surprisingly fun. We love skiing, and while this certainly doesn't compare to the real thing, we definitely had to experience skiing indoors in a desert! It was a welcome drop in temperature from the 114 outside and we were surprised how cold it was inside, and that the snow was pretty decent (we've skied much worse conditions). In total we did 10 runs (5 beginner/5 expert), which was plenty for the experience.
Amazing get away. This was one of the best experience to be remembered for very long time.the ski dubai park is amazing and team will take care of you very well.lots of pictures and fun.

Brilliant ski slope in the desert.. My wife did the one hour begginers ski lesson which cost 150aed and I had a two hour slope pass which cost 200aed. We both had a great time, the snow quality is superb and the lifts are quick and comfortable. The slop is a decent length and they provide you with clothing. You will however need your own gloves but these can be bought for 20aed there.

very average. A very average experience, probably aimed more for children. This attraction could be a lot better, and by Dubai standard quite poor for the money.It was probably good when first opened but no upgrades or improvements apparent

Snow in desert. The ski Dubai is conveniently located in the famous Emirates mall. My sons enjoyed the sking so much... It is unbelievable that some one thought to create this wonder in a desert. The charges are expensive but fun.

It's Not Park City, But Still Amazing!. Snow skiing in the desert in a shopping mall. Go figure. But hey, you just have to do it while in Dubai. I watched as little kids from the area plopped down in the snow and tried to make snow angels. The slopes were pretty decent for an indoor place, and it was just downright fun!

When it's 110*+ outside was a must say we did! . Modern marvel in the desert we did it to say we did coming from Utah and some of the best skiing in the world it was a must when it was 110*+ outside. Wore shorts and a t shirt and was actually good to go we got some funny looks but outside was 100% humidity and was going to shrivel up. Lol

Just do it. It sounds wrong, but just go for it. Quick check-in, easy kit - get out there and ski. The slopes are longer than I thought they could be, and it's a great 1-2 hours of fun. Nice to have a break in the mid-slope cafe. Much better than walking round a mall.

Awesome - I was so surprised - must do in Dubai. I was so surprised at how good this is! This was my 4th trip to Dubai and i dont know why i havent been before. From the outside it doesn't look much, but when you get in there you see the extent of the slope and it is impressive! I wanted to go back the next night but couldn't convince my colleagues...Also, it is for more than skiers, there is s much to do there from riding the chair lift to other adventure activities.It also isn't bad value! 200 AED for 2 hours skiing, clothes and ski hire. One bit of advice is to take gloves - these are not included and the ones you can buy cheaply once wet don't work that well...WIll I be back - absolutely - every time i visit Dubai!!!! Maybe more than once...

Pleasant surprise. I did a discovery snowboard lesson as I had never skied before while my fiancé skied here. I have to say I had low expectations for both the lesson and overall experience, but I was actually very impressed with everything. The whole process of getting all the equipment is pretty slick. They don't provide gloves so bring your own unless you don't mind buying them there. They have a separate section of the slope for lessons so you're not having to watch out for the actual skiers, which is really nice. My instructor, Mounir, was great and really took time with each exercise and person. Really reasonable prices for an hour lesson too.

Amazing. They have created Switzerland in Dubai with this ski Dubai.It has temp of -4 degrees.
