Sooooo cold inside,with snow rides and facility of sking.They also Manage to click your pictures inside which u can buy if u want to.But I will suggest not to buy because they are giving that very expensive,not wortth.Over all very nice experience.There is one small outlet for food also, u can enjoy snacks there.

Worth a visit. As a keen skiier, a trip to this ski centre had to be done. The shopping mall that it's in is fantastic and well worth a few hours of your time. The equipment that your're given (jacket, trousers, disposible socks and boots) are ok, the boots, seeing as they are hire ones, were really comfy. The chair lift was slooow, so use the pommel. They haven't quite mastered the pommel take off yet (got stuck a few times) and there isn't anyone on guard full time like you get in ski resorts. There is also a play area with a toboggan and rings etc, which was a great laugh. I had a fun time, glad I went.

Not amazing but a bit of fun!. My friends and I got the Snow Bullet package as none of us can actually ski!In this package we had unlimited rides on the chairlift, giant balls and slide as well as 2 rides on the Snow Bullet which is basically a zip wire.The Snow Bullet really isnt all we expected - it didnt go very fast to be honest! The other games were quite fun but we only did them once. At 8 pm we got to see the penguin march - which was only 3 penguins but still really exciting as I had never seen a penguin before! Maybe this is better suited to kids!The main problem with Ski Dubai is that it is VERY COLD in there, and after an hour or so you just want to get out!Main positive is that they give you full kit/gloves/shoes. Main negative is that it is very cold in there and it is also quite expensive.

Mindblowing. For a first time traveller, to see snow (well ice) in the middle of a desert, and to be able to run on it, ski, make snowballs and throw it at your loved one is unimaginable. This is one of the best things about Dubai, to make the unimaginable happen, and happen so well. Must visit
Children orientated!. Average experience for the price. Great for children who love Frozen but not good for adults if you are not a pro skier!

Incredible. Ihad spent very nice time There, everything was fine and organized,first they gave us special suits and the staff help us to fit this suits ther were many offers but we pay 300 Aed, but we enjoyed

Wonderful . It Was a nice experience for me
-2 degrees celcious was little hard for my skin but the time i spend there was superb.... C u soon

Amazing. This was really really fun. The slope is short, you won't find any Alpes slopes here, but still. The fact that it is inside makes it stunning. The entrance fee includes the ski or snowboard, the boots, and the jacket and snow pants. It may be 30°C outside, but it is always -8°C inside.

Beat the heat and a must do for a skier. As an avid skier and snowboarder this was a must do. When else can you be at the beach in 85 degree weather and then cool off snowboarding indoors. They provide the board, boots with socks, pants and jacket. You will need to bring your own gloves and hat. If I remember correctly they place a 20 Dirham hold on your card for the equipment which you receive back in cash when you are finished by returning your ski card pass into the automated machine on exit. The chairlift moves incredibly slow compared to typical ski hill chairlifts. If you have some experience I would recommend the tow rope that follows the wall up, it runs about twice as fast as the chairlift. It can be tricky on the snowboard as it makes a steep left turn in the middle, but if you relax and hold on it works out ok. Two hours is plenty of time here as you only have a choice of two runs, left or right.

if you have never seen snow then its must do for u. its located in emirates mall and to pre booking required as your agent will charge extra commission just go to mall and purchase tickets on spot. There is nothing gr8 about ski dubai if u dont know how to ski but if you are in dubai you must visit it once.

TRYING TO BOOK A GROUP LESSON. I booked my son a set of group lessons and purchased the booklet from the chalet in ski Dubai.Deciding to book the second lesson using one of the vouchers, I found the telephone system very annoying with so many number options and almost impossible to reach an operator, it is almost as though this is done on purpose as nobody wishes to speak to you!!!In the end I just kept pressing all numbers until I reached someone!I told them I wished to book a group lesson for my 8 year old son.They told me to come to the chalet at ski Dubai and book, I told them this is not possible as I live in Abu Dhabi.Eventually David the staff member told me he would call me back after checking with his supervisor!!!He sent me a mail and after several mails back and forth with confusion over the specific age group and class it got booked and my son took his lesson.I then sent a mail to David asking to book next Saturday. His reply we did you a favour last time unfortunately you have to come and make the booking with your voucher.Hello!!! I live in Abu Dhabi.After several mails and still no reply from David or his management I am writing on here, let's see if I get a response.On a plus note the instructors are excellent.Waiting patiently.Francisco

Why wouldn't you?. This place is nothing other than amazing. It is in the Mall of the Emirates and as you walk through the Mall you come across a wall that is glass. On the other side you can see 4 slopes, button and chair lifts. A frozen area for the children and luge run. I have never been skiing but for £28 I had an hours lesson and borrowed all my kit. You only have to buy the gloves but they only cost a couple of pounds. There were 6 people in my lesson group and we learned the basics such as putting on the skis, walking, starting, stopping and then finished with a mini slalom made from cones. It was great fun. If you have never been skiing before then you have to do a lesson. After this beginners class we graduated onto the next group which would have been a 90 minute lesson before being allowed to go it alone on the slopes. We were there in February when the temperature is a perfect 28 degrees. However I imagine Ski Dubai is a welcome break from the heat of the summer. I would definitely recommend it, excellent value for money on real snow in an indoor ski resort on a massive scale.

Family ski fun!. A great place to learn to ski on the beginners slopes, and good deals for the kids' ski school compared to usual ski school prices in Europe... Instructors were all fantastic with the children, and made the lessons fun.

Awesome experience. Me and my friend really had fun in this place, it's a must try place when you are visiting Dubai!We have used the entertainer voucher Super pass for the snow park since we don't know how to ski, it was a good deal, as 2 of us paid 250 AED/- including a locker. You will need also to pay 20 AED/- each for the locker key, but it's a deposit only, you will get it back once you return key through a smart machine. The ticket are also including one set of clothes, boots and a pair of socks and gloves, it's suggested to bring a hat and scarf with you, so it will keep you warm and really make you feel like it's winter season, just like back home.The staff there were really really friendly and helpful, everyone was wearing a warm smile, it's make us feel so welcomed. The Giant Ball and Mountain Thriller are really fun, it makes us scream and shout, the Chairlift ride gave us amazing view, really enjoyed it. Will definitely come back to have much more fun!

Kids will love it !!. The very idea of getting frozen in a desert city creates an excitement.We had a 3 year old baby with us, so we were little anxious initially,however now that we have done,its a must whenever u visit Dubai ,especially if kids are around.Very safe and super fun for the family.

Excellent Experience - above and beyond to accommodate our needs!!. I am blown away by how we have been treated by the team at Ski Dubai. Good for a change. This activity is located in the Mall of Emirates and is an enjoyable experience. Just the fact that you are experiencing skiing in the middle of a desert is quite unique. In case you have been to the real skiing areas, this place might not seem to be as great as expected. Although it is a fun and exciting place for kids.

Fun for all!. I've been to ski dubai twice now. The staff are so friendly and enthusiastic I love this. We had the penguin friend experience and a fun pass. Throughly enjoyed both times. It's reasonable on pricing and where else can you do this in a great mall.

Not a skier!. I went to Dubai on a group tour. The tour did not include Ski Dubai. We made a special trip to the mall to see this. They pack a lot of stuff into a small space. No one in our group went inside. You could not see the skiing very well from the public space. It was on the farthest side from the public windows. You could go into a restaurant, pay for dinner and get a little better view. I'm glad I went to the attraction but I was a little disappointed in Ski Dubai.
Ok. Needs some more ski runs. The black run isn't really a black run. Ok for a few hours of fun though. Expensive with all the extras. We just had 2 hours of skiing.

you will love it if you didn't try the real thing !. you can easily spend few hour of enjoyment there with your family nice place with variety of activities within the place very well prepared and designed place with good safety for kids and nice organisation . the price is a bit high Recommended

Great opportunity to ski for half a day but watch out for the dots on the slopes. You have to be able to link turn and use a lift to go on the slopes. People obviously did not read this. surreal !. Even if you don't ski, this place is worth just a look. Fun time with penguin. We booked the tickets along with penguin interaction. Penguin interaction is for 20 mins. I have went to some other places of snow game areas but this is very cleanly maintained.

Awesome. Learning to ski in Dubai!. As I spent the vast majority of my life in no-snow territories, I decided to learn snowboarding at Ski Dubai. Great day out. It is a very smooth we'll run venue from fitting your equipment to the ski lifts. With a good variety for both novice and the more experienced.
Great Experience. This Freezing Zone is one of its kind in the world. You can enjoy a real Skieng on the beautiful slopes.

Skiing in the desert. If you love skiing then this is amazing that you can do it while there is a desert heat outside. If you know how to ski and love it then it is good, but this is not a good place for beginners to start skiing.The real thing is much better.

Amazing experience. After the outside temperatures in the 30's entering Ski Dubai is a shock. the snow is real and the temperature is in the minuses. However all equipment is available to hire. Awesome. My family and myself had really enjoyed at this place.We spend about three hours there.They provide the jackets and the boots .My teen daughter just loved the place.
A must do!. My husband did this while we were in Dubai and loved every minute of it! Just the thought of skiing in a mall in the desert is crazy!
felt like playing snow in the desert. its feels good to have snow around the desert, but not many rides. it has more value to give to people who can Ski. Personally i would rate this amusement 7/10.

Snow fun. Trust Dubai to plan a snow oasis in the middle of the desert! Ski Dubai is fun, very well organised and ticks all the right boxes. Excellent for Newbies. Being a newbie to ski-ing I was hesitant to say the least to try ski-ing. Proved to be an amazing experience that I cannot wait to do again. Many thanks to our patient and friendly instructor Giuseppe. Ciao da Malta!

great great great. In the middle of Dessert, you are at -3C to -5C with snow all around. Many activities to play, enjoy. The kissing and hugging the penguins is amazging. A must visit place for everyone esp. kids. My son was so excited and did every sport multiple times. We Love Ski Dubai

Excellent ski adenture in the heart of the desert. Fun winter activity in the middle of the Dubai desert. Buy your tickets online at least 24hrs ahead of time and then check in at the will-call line to avoid the hassle of long lines. After check-in you will be given a wrist band and sent to the clothing and equipment line to pick up ski pants, jacket and boots. You can either bring your own hat, gloves/mittens and scarf or buy some fleece ones there. (Everything except hat, gloves and scarf is included in the price). Even if there is a line for the clothing, it moves very quickly. Make sure to know your clothing size in S/M/L/XL, etc. They have a conversion chart, so you just need to know your shoe size and the country you are from for ski boots. They do the conversion for you. There is a food court just outside the Ski Dubai entrance on the 2nd floor of the mall (they let you go in/out as much as you want during the day as long as you keep the wristband on and show it to come back in), as well as 2 coffee shops, one being Starbucks and the other a local chain. There are lockers in the bathrooms as well as in the common areas to keep your valuables in while skiing. They do require a deposit for the locker, but you can get it back by turning in the plastic key card at the end of the day (We turned ours in the next day and were still able the get the deposit back). After placing items in the lockers, you can claim your skis and hit the slopes. Overall, the process is very user-friendly, the workers are friendly and accommodating, and the skiing is fun with easy access to food at the top of the ski lift or in the mall outside of Ski Dubai. There are also fun activities for kids and a penguin exhibit, although we didn't participate in either of those and can't speak to those.
So many lines. It´s interesting do the ski lesson, but for the others activities must face huge lines... facing freezing temperatures
Nice for Dubai Summer!. Nice place and definitely not just for skiers like myself! Enjoyed the penguin show as well! Such a wonder having this in a place known to have plus 40 degree weather.

Only in Dubai. Only in the middle of a country of deserts where it rarely gets too cold (for the normal person) would there be an indoor ski slope. That is where the novelty ends. I would recommend going on a weekday if possible as the weekends are NO fun at all.....

Ski Dubai Spectator Perspective. I live in WI and have had many years of fun in the snow. My daughter wanted to see what Ski Dubai was all about - and I have to say it was a hoot! We viewed the attraction from seats by the window in the Cheesecake Factory where snow balls (more like human hamster balls) rolled right up to our table! Our fabulous trip of a lifetime. My husband and I traveled to Dubai with Gate 1 for 9 days and had the most fastinating time. Our guide Shalini Pinto was well informed and kept us going to so many sites. This is a truly wonderful country to visit. So much to see==and so little time==. Shalini was so well versed in the culture and the stores that went along with it. She made our trip so much fun Our bus drive was terrific==getting that BIG RED bus around was really something. We truly had a wonderful experience and would like to return for a longer trip. The people in our tour were so friendly and helpful. I recommend this trip to this part of the world. PLUS there is NO crime here. You feel perfectly safe at all time. We were mesmerized by the lovely buildings. Pictures on internet just do not do them justice. LOVELY. Don't miss this trip to Dubai. Joan and Lee Porter #793402

Big freezer in a desert. I wanted to go skiing in Ski Dubai since I learned the place exists, even I knew it will suck for skier of my skill (black slopes with ease) and it did. I consider this a must, even it's not much about skiing itself. Boots of my size didn't fit well, skis had poor maintenance, the snow itself is bad, the platter lift didn't work, the chairlift is so slow. But this is so unique (or bizarre) experience, none of this matters. I have NEVER seen a ski lift with support pole mounted to a ceiling :)I purchased ski passes on the spot with my MasterCard, which gave me a discount. Then I picked up boots, warm black socks, red and blue jacket and trousers. Then I got my Rossignol skis. I changed to my skiing outfit and packed my stuff into a locker. Just before entering the "freezer" I got my poles of desired length from a stand. Everything was fine and all our problems has been solved quickly by the helpful staff.Temperature was -3 °C. The lift got me to the top and I turned left, to the blue slope. Skis didn't go well and I struggled with them. Especially because my boots didn't fit tight on my foot (but crushing my shin), so I didn't have much of a control. Next round we went to the right and it was much better and with each round it got better and better. Last few rounds I can even talk about skiing :)Because the temp was close to what we have at home at the moment, we had a hat, gloves, sweater, turtle neck and stuff. Nevertheless after about 8 rounds (1 hour) we were freezing, so we decided to leave. It was really a unique experience.

Snow in Dubai. How exciting to find snow in Dubai. We have been before, but the children find it amazing, so lovely to see there little faces childrens slope and also adult slopes where the older ones went. Have to say ( not my wife and I.n
Great Family Fun. Very good, the kids loved it and enjoyed every second. But be warned this is not cheap, yes its a one off attraction but be prepared to delve in to your wallet constantly

fun for the whole family. Ski dubai is an excellent attraction for the whole family .There are many different activities for the whole family .we really had fun as this was the first time that we got to be in an environment where it was "snowing".We really enjoyed ourselves.Next time I will remember to take my own extra thermal vests n leggings because the snow suits provided where not enough.

Skiing in the Emritates Mall in Dubai?!?. Of course the actual skiing is a joke, but to Ski in Dubai, in a shopping mall with a real Chair lift?! If you are a skier, this simply has to be on your bucket list. Not Colorado, Not Utah, Not California, Not Austria, France or Switzerland, but DUBAI! Skip the snow park activities and just go ski!. I was disappointed in the snow park. The bobsled made my back hurt and it felt I though I was going to slip off, the tubing is ok but kinda silly that you have to go get your own tubes and bring it up to the starting point (shouldn't there be an employee that loads up the tubes on the belt??). It felt very disorganized when I got inside, I would line up for something and it would not be the activity I was looking for. The kids behind me were also asking me where to line up for tubing. I had to keep asking employees where to line up. I was also very annoyed at a family trying to do zorbing. The dad had his kids go under the turnstiles so I'm not even sure they scanned their passes. One of his kids was too short and was turned away. There's no employee at the beginning of the line to check if people have the right passes.It's also time consuming picking up all the equipment once you go inside and again not too organized. I wish it were more clear where go first, second, third, etc. Immediately after buying the ticket I was directed to the store, which is where I thought I could pick up all the equipment. I was wrong because you pick up gloves only in the store. I don't believe this was explained clearly in the beginning.The lady getting the equipment looked annoyed, I'm not sure I told her which size pants to get for me, she just went ahead and handed me the smallest ladies pants available. Then I had to make a second trip to get a size up. Also had to get smaller size shoes as sizing is not accurate.I wish I had skipped the snow park and just did the skiing.

Amazing. This is a must visit on your trip to Dubai. Kids will love it too.Tickets can be bought easily from the venue. It takes around 30-45mins depending on rush etc to get boots, warm clothes, etc and to prepare for the trip so it is best to consider this time in advance so you can make the most of the time in the ski.

Great fun day. The snow park is great fun, this year the theme was "Frozen". The bobsleigh was exciting, the uneven rubber ring slope likewise, wall climbing, snowman building - all fun. Fantastic place, I've been to Dubai three times and went to SkiDubai each time, and I will go each time I happen to be there.

A cold adventure in the middle of the desert. The place is fun and well organized. Kids enjoyed it.. It didn't live up to the expectations we had. We did enjoy watching the penguin show.P.S. - time your visit according to the shows you want to catch.

The grandkiddies liked it. They give you a suit, helmet for kids and boots . Ladies in abeyas get a floor length puffy snow jacket and snow boots . Its a novelty and perhaps the only indoor skiing in the world . The kids loved the sleding . It is the next best thing to the real thing .

Left me wanting more.. Ski Dubai is an interesting place, and one that I was very much looking forward to visiting.We rocked up to the lady at the ticket counter, who perhaps could have been a little more informative, and managed to get into a Beginner lesson starting in about half an hour.Lessons are an hour and a half long and we felt the price, which includes all the gear except gloves, was pretty good value.We luckily had brought along our own pants and gloves so only needed to get a jacket, boots and skis. This part of the adventure was a bit slow, and we were pretty much left to our own devices as to where to go, what to do with everything and where to meet our instructor etc etc.Also the cashier had only charged us for and given us one locker ticket, so I had to line back up at the counter to get another one. It all took quite a bit of guesswork and time and we were running just a few minutes late for the lesson. Luckily it was just us and one other lady in the group so we didn't inconvenience too many people.Our instructor at first seemed a little abrupt, but soon warmed up. He was an excellent teacher and it really was the best ski experience I have had. We ended up with the skills to be able to ski down right from the top, which I never thought I would have been able to do.When we had finished he marched us back to the lobby area and presented us with our signed Lesson Passport that stated we had passed with flying colours.After this we desperately wanted to join in a lesson for Grade 1, but after checking the timetable found there is only a few each week and we had missed out. Unfortunately this meant our skiing was over for the trip. So disappointing, but our fault for not checking the lesson system and session times beforehand.We didn't partake in any of the other activities on the snow, but they all looked pretty fun.Also, there was a guy taking photos who gave the other lady in our group a slip of paper presumably saying he had taken photos of her. Not sure why he didn't take photos of us, not sure if you have to book a photographer or what but I would suggest just taking in your phone and doing your own happy snaps. Not that there was much time for this during the lesson!Quick Tips:Look online for lesson times. You need to meet their requirements before being able to ski on your own. Not sure how you can prove it without taking their lessons.Arrive nice and early! Could be chaotic if busy.Check your shoe size before hand. Bring thick socks instead of using their thin ones. Jackets have no pockets. (unsure about the pants)Ask the lady at the counter for cheap add-ons to your ticket. Peng Friends etc.Use Entertainer voucher for slope pass.Take in a tissue for runny cold noses. Return your lift ticket to a machine by the exit for a 20dh refund.And above all - see it for what it is, an indoor ski field in the desert. Enjoy the experience!!

Ski School - Think before you book. We recently took our children (now aged 6 & 8) for a "Discovery" ski lesson prior to taking them on their first ski holiday. It seemed like the perfect introduction: learn how to put boots & skis on and move safely on the snow, and maybe even a little snow-ploughing on a gentle slope. They did achieve this, hence a 2* rating.My gripes began before the lesson even commenced: Before booking, I asked if the kids could join a group together (ages are normally split 3-6, and 7-13). I was told there was only 1 chance to do that - it was an "extra" lesson not mentioned on the website or flyer - and so I booked. On arrival, the instructor advised that it wasn't possible as age limits are strict. This wasn't the end of the world for us, but annoying that staff don't know or communicate procedures amongst each other.Issue #2: timing. Lessons are only for 1 hour (and poor value for money at that). We were told to arrive an hour before the lesson, which we did. The children were fully clothed and equipped 25 minutes prior to the lesson, and sat sweating while they waited... for a lesson which started more than 10 minutes late, mainly due to other students arriving late. The class then arrived back at the school kiosk well within the lesson time. So for $40 each my kids experienced a maximum 40 minutes in the snow, not the hour they were expecting, and barely longer than the time they'd had to sit around waiting.Issue #3: equipment. The suits and boots we hired were in pretty good condition, but the skis were very poor. Helmets for kids also looked fairly new, but there is no attempt to sanitise these as they are shared around. No wonder there is an epidemic of headlice in Dubai schools.Issue #4: instruction. Since we experienced 2 different instructors, it is clear that standards are not universal. One was very good with the kids, remembered their names and gave feedback after the lesson. The other was entirely disinterested/distracted and clearly had something more important to occupy him for at least 20 of the minutes we were paying him to teach our child. We didn't even see him at the end of the lesson.Overall, it was an expensive and frustrating waste of time - we should have just waited for our holiday. We certainly won't be going back.The Ski Dubai venue is an incredible facility, given its location. The novelty value is enormous. But the ski school (for kids, at least) is not worth the effort or money.

Cold Cold Cold :-D. My advice, when you go there you have to take heavy clothes & socks with you and don't rely on their clothes to can enjoy, it is so much fun specially for kid we were adult but we also enjoyed playing in the snow, playing with slides & penguins show, we didn't skate but it sounds goodThere are 3 packages one for slides, one for skating & 3rd for penguins you can choose what you want & it is expensive but it worth
Fantastic Experience. Just what you would expect of a venture like this in Dubai. Few queues, great slope, great kit. Great fun!

Skiing in the desert? Only in Dubai. Attached to Mall of the Emirates, this is one of the more unlikely attractions in Dubai.While it can hit 50 degrees outside, it's 3 degrees inside with a penguin encounter and the Snow Bullet zip wire ride adding to the action on the slopes.There's a black run as well as nursery slopes, zorbing and a log cabin cafe midway up to add to the authenticity.

made an oldtimer happy. what a brilliant place for old and young in particular,i came across this place while strolling through the shopping mall,and seeing the children having a great time and as we all know when our children are happy it removes all of grown ups problems it makes an oldtimer feel a youngster again,if you travel to the heat of Dubai and have children do them a big favour and take them to visit the ski,they will probably never want to leave,you will have a ball watching them,while your wife will so enjoy the hugh selection of shops,everyone in your family will love you

Indoor Ski - Brilliant Idea. Ok, so to help you escape the heat, this is a brilliant trip, however it is quite pricey. we paid 300AED each for a power pass, which allows you into the ski dubai all day. However there isnt that much to actually do, apart from ski. Also make sure you haggle for your pictures at the end, as they always try and over charge. it was quite fun to be honest. would definitely recommend it.

Good Fun. A winter wonderland in a shopping mall. Ski Dubai is easy to access from the metro through the emirates mall.There is a chair lift up two levels or you can use the pommer tow.It is quite an amazing structure, it is good fun and reasonably priced for 2 hours, if you can ski or snowboard you probably wouldn't want to go for much longer.There is a small slide and play area for small children.

Skiing in the Gulf - got to be done. Just had to be done! 2 hours skiing AED200 including the equipment, but take hat gloves and socks if you have them. Like any indoor ski centre, it was fun rather than demanding and after 2 hours, I had had enough but pleased to have got the tick in the box!!

Not in. We actually didn't go skiing, but the idea about having this possibility under the roof of the mall was interesting itself. Not much can be seen from the mall, but it's nice to visit it when you have time.

Ski Dubai. Wow what a money making scheme this isAs soon as they take your money you are left defenselessI waited hours for my turnI asked so many people for help but they just shrugged me and said they are very busyI repeat they are quick to take your money but slow to render helpI took my 11 year old son with and his smile was lost soon after we discovered how bad the service wasWith the bad aside the venus is lovely...extremely cold...make sure you buy the gloves for AED20
Amazing place. Hard to believe you can Ski in Dubai with outside Temperatures above 24 degrees. Great indoor Ski resort with all that a Ski resort has. Great facilities.

Magical place - especially at Christmas!. What a winter wonderland at Christmas! Totally magical, you step from heat to zero in seconds. Wrapped in winter snow suits, have fun at the snowpark, enjoy the views on the ski lifts and have a welcoming hot chocolate half way up the piste...All of this available in Mall of the Emirates. Alice stepped down the wrong rabbit hole :)

One time, for a new experience. Ski slopes in middle of desert environment is novel for sure. You can try if never been to snow or ski slopes for experience. It is artificial so one gets over it pretty fast.Will not miss much even if you don't visit on limited time or budget.

Cold & How. A lot has been spoken about this place. So just a few bits>> They give you clothing - Shirts + Pants. You will also get a pair of gloves (mittens) >> Kids will get a helmet >> The place is cold. Was about -2 degrees when we were there and hence do carry something for the ears (if you cannot handle it)>> The snow isn't snow. Its more like powdered ice. So DO NOT expect to have stuff to make snow balls and Ice Men>> There are lines inside for everything; So please plan to spend atleast 3 hours here>> If you are there during high-season, try to get there before 11am>> There are lockers available to keep your bags, phones etc

Just Amazing. Exceptionally pleasant experience.this is truly one of the best action in Dubai. It is truly leaving when you can appreciate the ice and snow and skiing in mid of desert and whether it is winter or summer.it provides for you an opportunity to meet a genuine penguin for 40 mins. Ski Dubai. If you are interested in skiing you must go for it. It is a wonderful experience they have created inside the Mall. Don't forget to carry your own hand-gloves. they don't provide it else you buy it for Drh 20 per pair.

So funny experience. I never thought about how our brain connect some places, feeling and conditions.......if you go skiing, u know it's cold outside, but coming from minus 2 degrees C ( the skiing was really fun, just ski lift a bit slow) in 10 minutes on 35+ degrees C....that's a shock for the brain! Must do!

strange but fun. For Europeans that are used to natural ski and open ski resorts, this is an odd experience. It is not cheap either. But when in Dubai, I somehow needed to try this and I dont regret. You get all the equipment in the center except for the gloves. you have to buy those. I dindt and thought that I will be fine without. It was cold! The feeling is funny, they even have a cottage to have a drink. All in all very different experience.

visit to ski Dubai snow park. Booked super pass for my family (2adults, 2kids ) for snow park. On entering sudden gush of chilled air kisses you. It's snow everwhere. Very nice experience. Best for kids. Buy tickets for skiing only if u know how to ski. Slide, chair lift, giant ball can be enjoyed in superpass which is for whole day. But when I visited it was bit crowded so difficult to repeat turn on chairlift and the giant ball etc. 2 hour time is more than enough. Though u can avail extra facilities in superpass but I didn't find it useful. To be inside ski Dubai is just amazing. After 1 hour your fingers starts getting numb. Chair lift ride not to be missed. Penguin sighting also very good though a bit lengthy. Coffee available both at bottom and Top of ski Dubai.
Amazing Place. This is really one of the best activity in Dubai. It is really exiting when you can enjoy the ice and snow and skiing in mid of desert and whether it is winter or summer.

A novelty experience.... Being from Canada, this doesn't really boggle my mind like it may for others - but it's a novel thing to have a ski slope in the middle of the mall in 30deg temperatures. Fun for kids of all ages and it won't break the bank. Definitely a fun place to visit (even if it's just to see it) while visiting dubai!
Pure Pleasure!. Quiet an interesting way to experience snowboarding & skiing - but, I expect nothing less from Dubai.It is quite beautiful and worth the money just for the experience...

10*. I would give this place a 100 stars just because it gives you a chance to meet a real penguin for 40mins. Don't ever miss the chance to meet those lovely creaturesI hatedddd that they didn't allow anyone to take photos with the penguin so that they can do business. A hardcopy photo for 100DHS and the soft copy for 375DHS That's crap. I already paid 500 DHSOthet than that i loved the place
Hug a Penguin. Only place in the world you can actually hug, pet and kiss a penguin. Must do if you are in Dubai. Once in a lifetime.

Snow Skiing in the Desert. Get there early - my only concern. I love skiing but rarely get the chance to leave Dubai. this is a perfect substitute for me! Getting there early is the only point I can make as the snow gets choppy and the queues for the lifts get long in the 3rd hour.

More than a bit surreal. Walking in to this place is more than a bit surreal, the temperature inside is negative 4 degrees celsius and you instantly forget you are in the middle of the desert!Having never been to the snow previously, I took a ski lesson, the lesson itself wasn't actually all that useful, but it was good to try to get my feet. I took a few runs down the beginner slope, not all that successfully, but I had a heap of fun. While there I also did the Zip line and a few of the other rides, they were all great fun.Definitely a recommended visit, but probably better if you already know how to ski.

Great fun for the family! Indoor ski!. My husband and 8 yr old daughter went ...you have to know how to ski to be able to 'free ski' otherwise you are required to take lessons. My husband knew how to ski and my daughter had taken a lesson last year and luckily remembered enough that she didnt have to take a lesson. They tested her once inside to ensure she knew the basics otherwise she wouldn't have been able to ski w/o a lesson. My husband and daughter had a lot of fun. They provide ski suit, helmet, ski boots/skis as part of the rental fee. you can rent a locker to put your shoes in, you can 'gate check' your stroller for free. We were advised to bring hat and gloves from home but otherwise you can buy them there. FYI We heard ski lessons sell out a few days in advance as do the penguin encounters. We would recommend this for other families.
Not to miss if U R in Dubai.. first thing take your own water proof gloves,as they r very costly over there. Secondly regular tickets provide some rides.Children will love this place.
Winter or what!. Innovation at its best! Man-made winter! Worth the experience. So much fun things to do in the park. You would think it was winter really. Will love to go again again!
snow in the desert. snow park tour is the best option for families with young kids. or one can go for ski lessons. lovely sledge rides and zip lines over the snow.

Amazing,,. We visited this attraction on 16 October,and had a great time,,we came in from 40 degrees outside to minus 6 in ski centre,,shock to the system..it was a wonderful experience..everything you need for the slopes is provided,,gloves boots and ski suits,,we also got a couple of lessons as we were beginners,and the instructor was very good with us..then we went on the slope for downhill fun.this place is fantastic for kids also as there is a section to see penguins
Mindblowing!. Such contrasts! Desert safari one day and down hill skiing the next. Good value for money. Nice temperature inside and good skiing baring in mind that youre indoors......
Fantastic value for money. This place is brilliant, the coldness takes a bit of getting used to but the quality of what you get for your money is fantastic - worth every penny

Looked good fun. We didn't go into this, but had a very nice Chinese lunch overlooking the area. There were a lot of people in there and they were obviously having great fun. There were ski runs and lifts, snowboarding, tobogganing, a zip wire, giant snowballs going down slopes and a general area for just playing in the snow for little ones.

Ski Dubai. Ski Dubai is very well done place by the man in a mal, it is incredible taht being 40°C outside, inside there is snow, there is a ski shop at the side of ski dubai where people buy everything. and it is located at the end of the mall
Once try. It is located in a mall which is easily accessible by metro. For a small price you can ski down a small slope. They provide you with all equipments.

A snow world in dessert. If you are travelling to Dubai with your family and kids, it will be a great experience to enjoy snow and skiing in the middle of dessert. They got penguins as well and that was a thrilling experience to my kid.
Though a bit expensive, but this place is a must visit.
ice and ice. amazing place, created artificially...all attractions of snow covered area...a lot to play. and experience snow. must visit
Lovely place.... Nice entertaining and worth visiting ski part inside a mall in the middle of a dessert! I just loved playing with the snow ;-)

Interesting to experience. I was in doubt how to rate this venue.If the focus is on skiing it would be 2 points. There are 2 skiing slopes, the easy one and one little bit harder, both the same length, some 300-400 meters. There are 2 ski lifts, one four seat and one cable. There were no crowds.If the focus is on bringing the mountain with snow into a desert in the middle of the shopping mall, then it would be 5 points. The Ski Dubai from the inside of the Mall of the Emirates, where it is situated, looks surreal. On one side of the glass you have people in T shirts eating or drinking in restaurants and watching through that glass the others skiing.The entrance fee is on a higher side. It starts somewhere from 200 Dirham (50 Eur) for 2 hours (which is more than enough), or you can choose a day pass. In the price is included everything, the ski suit, ski shoes, socks and skis of course.Gloves and cap IS NOT included, so bring your own in order to avoid buying them. The inside temperature is around -2, no wind, so it isn't cold that much.Ski Dubai participates in the Entertainer book, so DO buy it, and then you get 2 for 1 tickets.Beside skiing, inside you have another attractions paying extra, like zip riding, bob, meeting the penguins,...All in all it's an interesting experience to spend couple of hours in this unique place, if nothing else, just to see snow and skiers in a shopping mall.
Loved it !! . Visited here with my son and sister in law both of whom love skiing and snowboarding. They loved it 2 hours for £30 with all the gear included, great value. Would defiantly go again.
I loved it & so did my kids. A nice entertainment, sooooo different!Expensive a bit.You have to be prepared, the clothes given are not enough! If we were more prepared we could have spent more time!

Fun for the novelty, but not much more. The building itself is an experience, and we liked the novelty of playing in the snow in the desert, but we won't be back any time soon. The logistics of getting on your snow gear is a bit stressful and disorganized. None of us had the right size of clothes/boots at the start, so it took a good bit of time to gear up. Plan to rent a locker - there is no other place to keep your shoes. Bring your own hat and extra layers underneath, especially socks. The clothing they provide will hold you maybe 2 hours at most, and then you'll be very cold.We found the staff working the rides inside to be very difficult to communicate with. Lots of confusion on the chair lift and when we were to get off for the toboggan run. No assistance with how the passes work with the proximity readers to get around the park. We figured it out eventually, but it would have been helpful to be told.For the price paid, I would have expected a better experience all around. All of that said, it was a unique experience, and I'm glad we went to see the facility and enjoy a taste of winter. But I feel it was more of "check it off the list" event rather than truly fun family time.

Ski in a Desert. The way they have built a ski area in the middle of the desert is just speechless. The place has activities for every age group. A must try, If you didn't go to Ski Dubai, your trip to dubai was incomplete.
Snow in the desert. Had a birthday party here for my son's 5th! Had lots of fun! The gloves provided weren't too warm though so would suggest carrying your own.

Great fun. Visited this place earlier this week and it was great !
Price was okay staff giving equipment could be a little bit more friendly but everything inside during my snowboard class was perfect.
Snowboard instructor Pepito was amazing and really helpful during the entire summer.
I'll definitely go back

Winter in the desert. Having been raised all my life in the cold (Mid-west) I wanted to try this out and see for myself. I have to say this is pretty impressive. If you haven’t ever experienced snow or even if you had I would definitely recommend this place. I find it very fun especially with the type of summer heat Dubai gets. Great experience. This was a great indoor snow experience. Its a lot of fun for all ages. Just be aware that it is cold inside about -4 degrees so ensure that you dress with warm (Long pants, long sleeve shirt and jersey or warm top) if you are sensitive to the cold as they only provide you with the termal pants, boots and jacket. The mountain thriller is alot of fun.

fun ! fun ! fun !. One of the most fun things to do in Dubai Mall. I'm sure kids (over 8 - 10 years) will enjoy a lot too. There is a package to choose if you would like to train to Ski, though I was a pretty slow learner, the experience was unbelievable. Must try (though it is quite expensive to try more than once).

Indoor ski slope. Good place to learn how to ski before you head to the mountains for skiing. Some of the instructors are nasty. Very expensive. Sometimes it gets crowded. Worth a visit. Snow experience all year round!

confused. Children who have never experienced snow, might be fun. Well, personally I like the idea that in Dubai you even can find snow... But besides the fact it's expensive, they also sell photos they took for you and prices are quite high! Not upto expectation. I am a person who is a nature lover, and had high expectations with Ski Dubai.. For people who have never seen a snow clad mountain or played with snow,this is the place to fulfil your dreams, but if you have ever been to Natural Snow, its not worth a single Dirham. Heard The Penguin encounter is wonderful, but cant comment as not encountered during my visit. Check timing of penguin encounter before checking in.

Excellent. The thermal wear provided by them is very low quality and cannot be there more than 2 hours carry your own.No washroom inside, get it sorted first as repeat entry is not there i guess.Free penguins to watch at particular times.Entertainer is best.For sliding, need to carry your own tube upwards.

Awesome.... Being in a snow park in the middle of the desert is truly an amazing experience. Massively built, a must visit place on your Dubai trip. Kids just love the experience. As a caution, please carry your own woolen caps as the place is extremely cold & it gets uncomfortable after 1 hour or so.

winter in dubai. Went with my kids to Ski dubai, something unique they have created in dubai which is unimaginable. We enjoyed every bit of the place, kids cant stay for more than 2 hrs as the place is very cold.Experience is great.

The artic in the desert!. Mall of Emirates
The arctic in the desert!
Went to the ski arena...truly a must do!! Be warned it is cold inside so wear good gloves. For adults you'll pick up helmets inside arena rather than outside. Also keep an eye on time restrictions e.g be sure to do ski bullet within the allotted time!

Freezing was Fun!!. This was my second time to Ski Dubai, and the first to the Snow Park. A very nice experience, and the kids had an absolute blast. They have started providing ski Dubai fleece gloves with the ticket price but I would highly recommend that you take your heavyduty gloves and snow cap. I also recommend that you carry your own socks and wear them along with the disposable socks that they provide. The below freezing temperatures start affecting your toes first. I was disappointed that there was no snowfall, as promised on the website. Overall, a lovely experince- which is slightly unreasonably overpriced, but I would still not give it a miss.

Worth to try. it is very nice skiing activity for a reasonable price. it has it all the snow man the lights and the carts hanging from the sealing where you can jump on ice but don't really recommend it.maybe i was impressed because i never went skiing before that. but it is certainly something :D

Awesome!!!. There is nothing cooler that skiing in the Arabian Desert. Ski Dubai is in the mall and it is awesome. We had a blast and highly recommend this experience. Did I mention that it's awesome?

Penguin Encounter. This was brilliant. Went with the fiancée and she loved it too. What during Ramadan which was great because the place was empty no queues no waiting. Paid for the lowest one which was fine about 150 I think. Got our pic with a great little penguin called Luci. Then cuddly the king penguin who liked getting stroked and constantly fed! Just watch out for peak times, could be a nightmare trying to get a slot!

So much cold. Obviously it should be cold but my point is that the thermals are not enough for that cold for us who lives in warm weather.plus it should be mentioned that their is a coffe shop inside so we could have take our wallets inside.My kids hardly stayed 1 hour .

Fun. If you've never been skiing it's a great experience, particularly when you come in from the blazing sunshine to find penguins! Only query is the hire of every individual thing which gets expensive. Bring your own hat and gloves as it really makes a difference
great experience. For those who live in tropics the experience is great and wonderful especially for the kids. The rides are also fun and nice.

Grateful I didn't have kids with me. Although the penguin encounter was worth the money to touch and see a penguin up close the whole experience was v stressful. It was completely hectic, we were not given clear instructions as to where to go or what bit of kit we needed the queues for the ski clothing were ridiculous and people were pushing in when they couldn't be bothered waiting. There were kids getting lost and running around everywhere In all the crowds. We were told by a member of staff that every group runs late due to the poor organisation of the resort so we were left waiting an additional 15 minutes before we could go in.

I-c-excellent. Initially i was quite skeptical about this place, but after visiting Ski Dubai I am in love with it . This place is quite a popular place with the tourist and got very crowded during the holiday season. I had bought tickets outside Ski Dubai , however, one can look up their website for deals/offers. The ticket prices vary depending upon what you would like to do . The tickets bought by me included free gloves and a single chair ride and was for a specific time limit. They also provide you for complete snow gear that is padded jackets, pants and shoes. However, make sure you take protective clothing too and be well prepared as it can get really cold in there.If you have strollers you can park it at the security office and they will give you a tag. After , passing a hurdle of getting ready between the crowd, it was a wonderful surprise , it was real snow and there are different area like free play area, some rides like carousel, chair lift ride , skiing area etc. You can come out for a while and go back in again if you feel cold. In all it was good fun and my children loved it will be going back again for sure.

snowboarding lessons. this disappointed me to be honest. we paid for a one hour lesson for snowboarding. none of us had ever snowboarded before, so it really was a beginner lesson. the class that we were in was so big! there were probably about 15 of us to two instructors. then one of the instructors left for lunch break and we were down to one! he was fantastic, but in a large group of people who have never snowboarded, we needed more instructors. eventually he got us all up to the top of the slope, got down to the last 5 of us for the one activity and realised he was running out of time, so he skipped us doing that activity alltogether, but everyone else before us got to do it. this should have been limited to 8 people perhaps, and more than one instructor! i would have liked to be taught the basics and then left to play for the other half an hour with my new found skills. not something id bother doing again besides, the bruise on my bum from sitting to stop because we were not taught how to stop meant i but-skated, not snow boarded!

Mall of Emirates -Ski Dubai. A must visit place to experience ice in the desert. The rides are excellent especially the rope ride, kids skate ride. Making ice balls and throwing on each other was fun too.

Fun. I really enjoyed the experience. It was so much fun and the activities are really amazing. However, the quality of the shoe offered were not good and out feet got wet and froze. I advise you buy ur own gloves since the ones offered were very light while the degree is below -1. For the penguins, u need to book prior, otherwise, u will most probably miss it. Overall, i highly recommend this place for families

Unique experience in the mall!. Nice to experience indoor skiing in a mall, but for serious skiers, this will disappoint. Fun areas like zipline, tubing, snowboarding, etc. will keep kids happy. Where else can you do this type of thing?!
Loved it !!!. What a great place to visit in the Emirates Mall. Not cheap but great fun for all the family to pass a couple of hours.

Not as good as we thought. We went on a broiling July day thinking it would be the perfect antidote to the hideous heat outside. It was fine. Some of the snow rides were hilariously underwhelming for the kids and you weren't allowed to throw snowballs! Nevertheless it was a nice afternoon out. Everyone looked hilarious in their snowsuits and the Ski Dubai gloves are still very popular with the children now we are back in the UK.

Average. Visited ski dubai in dec 2014. We had some mixed reviews there. To start with the queues at the ticket counter should be managed better as I felt it took plenty of time just to buy the tickets. Then again it took some extra time in getting your shoes, ski clothing etc. The inside of the ski resort is great. Its great that someone has made such a snow resort almost in a desert. Since we just visited the snow park we felt that the rides were pretty less as compared to the price which we had paid for the tickets. Again rides/activities should be managed better. One has to collect his/her tube etc himself and then bring all the way up to have that ride. You have to keep going up and down for this. And if you are with kids it becomes difficult. This goes for all the activities. This should be automatic or have some manpower to do so. Overall a good experience but make sure you wear good clothing as the jackets they provide are pretty thin and its freezing inside.

Snow Play in 43 Celscius. Just good fun all round. Kids loved it, being indoors in -2 Celscius when outside it's 43 Celscius is very cool and surreal. Snow play fun only. Could have had some more snow play activities, but limited space so all good.
Children Learn to Ski. My two daughters learnt to Ski at Ski Dubai and had a first class instructor and enjoyed themselves so much we are continuing to go back for more classes.

Great teaching, get there early!. Had a one hour taster session, having never skied before. It took 30 minutes to get all the gear organised, so I would advise getting there at least 30 minutes early - it is very busy.I was in a group of 7, with one instructor - a Moroccan guy called Yassein - great guy, good teacher, and we learned how to put the skis on, how to move about in them, and how to snow plough. There is proper snow, and everyone there looked like they were having fun! They have a large slope for more advanced skiers, and lots to do. Could be better organised, but I really enjoyed it - and I got 20% off for paying by MasterCard, which wasn't advertised before I got there.

Freezing Family Fun!. Make sure you decide what packages you want. If you want to take skiing lessons get there early in the morning or afternoon. We were disappointed we could not ski without having five (5) days of skiing lessons which seems absurd since we only had one more day left in Dubai. Seems kind of chaotic getting the clothing gear and finding a locker when it was so many people. MAKE SURE YOU CHECK YOUR SKI SUIT POCKETS FOR THE CARDS TO GET YOUR DEPOSIT BACK. There were couple of teen boys checking pockets of pile of ski suits in a return bin. They found a couple of cards and went to the machine and got cash refund deposit. Although they were caught but it probably doesn't stop anyone from coming through to check. They don't have any barrier that would keep non-paying people out of the area. Anyone can walk through the area except the ski area.The penguin were cute but it was too cold to be standing there watching their cuteness so we went bobsledding and on the chairlift, etc. If possible bring some thicker gloves the free mittens they give you won't keep your hand warm.
Great Fun. Make sure you take gloves and dress warm, but once you've suited up its great fun for the family. Get to interact with penguins, build snowmen and go tubing.

Complete disarray and disappoint.. I live in dubai with a 5 and 7 year old boy. My brother in law with his 9 and 13 year old are visiting.So we were told 4 days ago that you don't need to book in advance just get there as it opens.We were very disappointed on arrival to find out the penguin experience is fully booked for the next 4 days. Our visitors leave in two days. 4 upset kids, 4 angry parents.Ok well at least the 300dhs package includes a ski lesson and access to all rides. We're planning on a full day so lets do it.30 minutes wait just to get boots and clothing. To then be told we need to be back 45 minutes before our lesson to change our boots. That will be right now then. Why didn't you say that in the first place. Another 40 minutes to change boots and get our skis. So we've been here just under 2 hours and we're still not inside the dome. Wait for the instructor to then have our 3 year old taken off with one group our 5 year old and 7 year old with another group and the adults another. What so we book a lesson for 7 of us and we're all split up. We were not told in advance.No idea where our kids are. Can't see them from where we are on the slope. 1000s of people and no idea how they intend to ensure the kids end up with the correct parents at the end of the lesson.So I'm a little angry and trying to lissen to the instructor who's rushing through things and having tot deal with 4 complete idiot adults in the group who refuse to lissen or wait for people have there practice.I'm on my third run just getting the hang of it and another instructor who is obviously giving a private lesson to 2 kids decides to walk straight across my path. If he had of been on his own I would have intentionally plowed right into him. But the kids were not to blame so I had to intentionally fall over.That's it I've had enough 20 minutes of dealing with this crap. Explained my anger to the instructor, Skis off left them where they were to emphasize my anger and walked off to find my kids. Thankfully they were having a great time.Wife did the full lesson and it didn't get any better.Another 30 minutes waiting to change our boots again!!!!!!!Time for a coffee and a chillout.What I can't go back into the slope to the small cafe because my lesson is over.I have to go outside to the big and might I add full cafe.So I've been here 3 1/2 hours and only done 20 mins!!!!!!!!!!Had my coffee let's try again.In we go join the Que for the small tabogan. 30 minutes later. 20second ride. Join the Que for the ski lift. 30 minutes.20 minutes wait for the larger tabogan.Get to the bottom ques are now massive. There still letting people in....40 minutes waiting for a the large ball ride and the kids ask if we can go home. To bloody right we can go home.We were looking forward to a good day with the kids but instead not only did we despise the experience. Our 5 year old ended up saying " I'm not having fun can we go home.".My brother in-law booked a lesson for his wife and kids and then paid for slope passes for them all. After he had paid anf the kids knew what to do he was then informed they can't go on the slope they need more lessons. The slopes for professionals. So why the he'll did you sell me the passes. Refund and complaint time.If you like paying money to watch people be completely disorganized and inefficient. Missleading and none informative. Have your blood pressure raised and patience tested then this place will be perfect for youshall not return and shall advise others to avoid the place.Such a shame.
nice place for kids. Our kids enjoyed lot good outdoor activitywill try againWell organisedliked everything San ice place
Amazing !!. This ski resort contains an entire mountain slope for skiing and it is bigger than some of the largest malls in India. It has other attractions as well such as snow slides and rides.

A Fun Time. I took my son and we had a great time. He was 4 years old. He even went down the slide in the big ball. I would recommend that you go at opening. My favorite part was riding up and down the ski lift. We do not ski and just had a good time going down the slides which are like a water park but with ice. My only problem was there aren't a lot of sleds to pull your kids and you have to wait for others to finish using them but some people just hold them and "guard" them and don't let you use them. Selfish.

Kids and adults will have a great time.. We loved the whole experience. We took our 10 year old son, who had really never seen snow. He loved the tubing, bobsled, and throwing snow everywhere. My husband chose to ski and said the slopes were quite good. I played with my son, and went zip lining down the mountain. I will say if you can wear jeans or long sleeve shirt under the provided ski clothing you will stay warmer longer. Also, like others have stated to get your monies worth be prepared to stay for awhile. We were there 5 hours which went by really fast.

500 dhs for nothing.... We were sales talked into taking the unlimited 500 dhs option...It's is not unlimited. All my 4 kids were able to do was the discovery ski lesson which was soo rushed and done with so many people in a groups it was not even worth having. There was no practice time, no time to take photos, no time to even ask questions. Part of the package was unlimited rides but the lines were sooooooo long, you'd freeze to stone before you can even get to any of the "unlimited' rides. So in total of the 5 hours spent inside there, the kids were able to do 2 things unsatisfactorily. Very very disappointing. There were several unhappy customers, who verbally expressed their disappointment to the management & staff who would listen but I don't really think they plan to do anything about it.
Switzerland in Dubai. This is a must visit sightseeing spot for those who are travelling with their family ! However,to avoid rush one should visit it except friday !
Booking Online. IFly Dubai number 042316292 doesnt work, if its not answering its always busy. I cant book online and cant book buy Phone.

Snow Skiing in Dubai. If you like skiing, and you are in Dubai, it is worth going. Its expensive, as all skiing is of course, and the crowds can be a pain so plan to be there for the entire afternoon as half your time will be taken up queuing up for this and that, then eventually.....you get on the ice. Expensive. Bring credit card or a lot of cash!

Ski in the desert. Never would I imagine skiing in the desert! This indoor ski and snow experience was worth the effort. The skiing lessons made the experience more memorable particularly when we realised skiing is not as difficult as what we thought it to be.

Great experience. Good way to learn to ski for beginners especially if you have never had any experience at all. Expect to get a bit bumped and bruised, its still very fun! The activities and cable ride are also good and if you can have a cup of something hot at the coffee shop (after going on the zorb and bobsledder!)
Fantastic. Enjoyed the cold weather and a hot snack in Avalanche cafe. Need to wear thick clothes since the coat is not enough.

Not Great Snow, But Fun One Time. The snow is not great, and it hurts if you fall!!! But, this is one of those things you need to do....just so you can say you have snow skied in the desert!! I did not make it on my first trip, but had a long layover on my second and headed out for an hour of fun! And now I can say I did it!!
something to see absolutely. Unique curiosity... well situated in a mega shopping mall. Take an entrance, do not only watch from public place.

Dad and Son time!. This was fantastic and my 3 year old little boy was astounded by it. Having only seen snow once in the UK he has mesmerised by the whole place. Took a chair lift to the top and back, built a snowman and went on rubber rings down the slopes. Fantastic.Exoensive in my opinion but worth it

Good, but not for long.... If you're an experienced skier Ski Dubai is very much a novelty. Slope is impressive considering its indoors, but takes about 45 seconds to go down in reality if you're a good skier. Bought a 2 hour pass and that was definitely enough. Good to do, but no need to spend more than that there
Nice experience in the dessert. Wonderful to have a place like this inside Dubai Mall. You need to have atleast 3-4 hours to enjoy this.
Awesome experience. We were amazed be in minus 5 degree while it was 40 degree outside. Its a great adventure , kids & Wife loved all the rides, Penguin show.

Funtastic!. I live in Switzerland - a Ski paradise - but skiing in Dubai is simply elegant and comfortable. You have summer clothes on, you go to the mall, and everything is there. You can opt for a two hour fun run or a whole day unlimited. Its inexpensive, and I promise you, you will enjoy every bit of it.

Snow in the Desert. This is a truly amazing attraction in the middle of Dubai . A winter wonderland has been created where you can ride on a cable car , ski , ride on a tobbogan and meet Santa all in sub zero temperatures while you are snug and warm in a ski suit ,boots and socks (loaned ) included in the admission price.I watched my grandchildren throw snowballs at me while I stood outside in the mall wearing sandals and T-shirt. One word of warning photos taken inside are rather pricey.
no thrill. two words rip off,over price.will not recommend to any of the family or friends,only a few slides for the young ones

Snow in the mall!. We managed to survive in there only for an hour as it was pretty cold even though we had our gloves etc on but we enjoyed every minute of it. The tubing slides are a lot of fun. There are a lot of activities in there and you can spend 3-4 hours there and not get bored.

Fun at Ski Dubai. I really enjoyed this experience and would love to take my family over to Dubai one day to spend a good morning or afternoon here. I did zorbing (quick but fun), a couple of runs on a tube and the flying fox there. My group only had a limited amount of time here, but it was well worth the visit - enjoyed a few runs on the chair lift too. I also did the penguin encounter, which was fantastic!

Only good thing about Mall of the Emirates!. I loved it. My wife loved it. and my kid loved it the most. If you like some adventure and you like snow (minus 5 degree celsius), you can easily spend 3-5 hours here.We took 200 dirham option and its sufficient for most, unless you want to try your hand on Ski-ing (which is also very good and has decent slopes of decent length). Make sure you reach there on time and dont waste time on roaming around Mall of the Emirates because you will end up having less time for this. NOTE: Get good and warm Head Cap to keep your head warm and ear closed because that's where the cold hits most! They give helmet to kids with woolen inside, which can keep your kids warm, so no need for head cap for kids.
The best in dubai. What else do u need from having 24/7 snow? Love the ski slope. Love the penguins. Loved everything about it :)
For Ski fanatics - the best choice in Dubai ..... Decent arrangement - though not really for the avid Skiers. Good for visitors to Dubai and those who have never seen snow.

Great fun. We really enjoyed skiing in Dubai. Perhaps a bit expensive but definitely worth it. The slopes were fun and do not require you to be an expert skier. Remember to arrive early and bring gloves, hat and a good sweater since it gets pretty cold after an hour or so and the jacket they provide is very thin.

Skiing mad possible in summer:). Experiencing skiing and winter activities in summer is wonderful, great attraction for family:)Fabulous indeed, family can enjoy safely in the park, the encounter with the penguins was a wonder.

SKI IN THE DESERT. So this is a Must Do! How often can you tell your friends that you actually "snow skied in the Desert" At the Mall of Emirates. If you know ahead of time that you will want to do this...Bring your own gloves, hat, and thick wool socks. Included in the ski rental are socks, however not thick enough (your toes will freeze) You can purchaser gloves, hats etc if you do not have.They will give you pants and jacket, skis and boots and socks. If you are a skier, you can certainly do the "Expert" slope. I had not skied in 13 years and it was not hard. Pretty cool to do this indoor in a MALL in the DESERT! Just saying! If you have family members that do not want to participate they can sit in a restaurant warm and cozy and watch you! This was on my bucket list! :)

Skiing in the Desert - it's a BIG slope. I'd assumed that being an indoor ski slope, it would be one of those tiny crowded slopes. Whilst it isn't the Alps, is is huge - deceptively so. I'm a good skier and really enjoyed the opportunity to brush up on my skills.One important point to note. BUY GLOVES! I was cheap about it, figured 'how cold can it be'... and nearly froze my paws off. It took the edge off which was a shame.Another of those 'must do' things in Dubai

Loved it!. Such a fab experience to be able to ski on a big slope inside! Clothing provided was good although after 40 minutes the cold does start to kick in especially when sitting on huge chairlifts. Thermals needed just for the hour. The slope choice was good a blue or a 'black' it was more of a steep red. We both had a fantastic time, and would go again if we were back in dubai. If you pay by MasterCard as well you get a some money back off the original price. Rye idea of the cafe on he the slope is a fab idea and makes it more realistic. There is lots of activities for the kids too, seeing the penguins, snow balls etc at the bottom of the slope :)

Great Experience.... It is located at the Mall of the Emirates. First thing we did was the Penguin Encounter. Penguins were adorable and smart. After we went at the snowpark. Be sure to wear a jacket inside if you are not used of low temperature. They procide clothes and boots too.

Tourists or Residents a good place !. Been here a few times now with kids and family. Easy to book (Dont get fooled into booking on SkiDubai.com us SkiDXB.com) Clothing provided is good, always warm, helmets always available and never too busy !

Learning to Ski. I wanted to learn to Ski and bought the Power Package (Aed 300) which entitled me to learn to ski in one hour. Had great fun learning from the instructor (skiing down slope and braking) . Package also entitled to unlimited day stay inside ski Dubai (enjoying the chair lift and other rides). Money well spent

Great fun!. Ifyou're not into shopping, then while your other half shops you can ski. The runs aren't advanced by any means, but being completely artificial they aren't too bad. It's a bit of fun to kill the time and a great place to escape the dubai summer.

Fun!. Great experience at Ski Dubai - and I don't ski or snowboard. Would recommend to all - very fun experience. Find the zorbing a little nausea inducing - so would consider doing this last to avoid the effects impacting your experience. Definitely pick the private penguin experience - that was really fun and cool. When in Dubai next will go back.

A novelty worth the ride. I'm not a great skier so this was a good fit for my skills and it was fun for the couple hours I was "on the slope". Equipment was good enough, staff was friendly, and I'm glad i did it. BTW - the expert side is probably a blue level run, but it's a touch shorter so better to go faster on the other side given how quickly you'll get to the bottom.

Discovery lesson Ski Dubai. I recently went to Ski Dubai and took a discovery lesson. There were 11 1st time skiiers in the group. Both myself and a friend were highly dissatisfied with the lesson. Our instructor shouted during the lesson continuously. He was bullying and would not let my friend try for herself, but instead held her jacket at the lower point of the beginner's slope. When she didn't hear instructions at the back of the group he refused to repeat. Very little ski time, spent most of the lesson waiting around. In addition, the lesson started late and ended early. Terribly disappointed as I was looking forward to the experience.
Worth a Visit. Wonderful rides.....Penguin show is good.. but unfortunately fewer options. Rope way is a wonderful experience
So cool. Wow to snow ski in the desert. We ate too and watched other ski. The mall has great shops and a nice food court. Even Popeyes chicken. So cool.

Really nice thing to have in a desert area maintaining temperatures below "0" degree C. Conveniently located in the shopping Mall of Emirates. Its just about 15-20 minutes drive from the Jumeirah palm ares and hotels. There is a metro station located here just outside

-30 Inside +30 outside. Ski Dubai is great for a few hours on the slops - The staff are friendly and assist in all the prep required for getting skis and coats etc.. They have 3 slops - kids red and black run - you need to be good at the basis. They even have an alpine ski lodge for a break for a drinkNice place

Very short but good if you want to do something different in the Desert. I had an ok experience going here. I loved the concept of the ski/snowboard park but it was rather short. It takes 1min 30sec. at most from top to bottom. The thing that got me was that they required you to wear helmets to snowboard in the "park" which was a little makeshift area towards the top. Other than that it was a fun 2 hours.
Ski premiere inside. Very strange to make the first turns for the season inside at Ski Dubai. Fast service ,bad skis but so funny and strange.

Great Experience of Desert Sunrise. We have booked morning desert safari for our colleagues from Mercury Tourism. It was really a refreshing experience as we have never seen a sunrise in the desert. They picked us on time and the whole tour was really organized in well planned way. All of us enjoyed a lot. The breakfast and other services were really very nice. We have booked the tour online from happlinkers.com.

Snow in the Desert. Amazing to believe and feel -4 degrees of cold in the land of deserts. Hats off to the makers and financiers.Ski Dubai is the first indoor ski resort in the Middle East and offers an amazing snow setting to enjoy skiing, snowboarding or just playing in the snow.Right in the heart of the Mall of the Emirates it's easy to access and well connected to the Metro line.You would be provided with winter clothes and boots. Lockers at reasonable price. Must go for kids who haven't had the experience of real snow ever!
Weird but fun. So weird skiing indoors. It's not for you if your looking for the real alpine experience but a fun thing to do

Penguins and Snowboarding. We visited for a Penguin Encounter but also booked an impromptu beginners' snowboarding lesson upon arrival. They provide everything for you and the process is simple when it comes to getting your kit. The Penguin encounter was fun and the photos (extra cost) were good quality. Snowboarding on the beginner slope was great, the instructor was very enthusiastic and good to work with. It was worth doing this course simply to get inside the main slope area and get a look at this incredible feat of engineering!

penguins encounter. I really like the experience and the penguins were so friendly.
It won't be the last visit. Next time I'll try skiing.

Impeccable creation. all i would say it was just a perfect way to end my vacation being here one feels that he as reached in ice world where u can do sking, rolling bag and also overhead trolley to have a bird view of the whole surrounding. For more please visit and yes if u can carry a pair of extra gloves, it will help u to save some extra bucks or else u will end up paying 20AED ( as they are on chargeable basis)

Penguin encounter ski dubai. Fun event if you love penguins!Booked in advance.Timed slot given and directions on where to meet up.Snow suit given to change into(-4degrees),boots and gloves.Gloves you get to keep afterwards.Approx 40 mins spent with penguins.No photography allowed in the area where the Penguins are,but many taken by staff which you can purchase later,although quite expensive.You get to cuddle and stroke the penguin and they waddle around and sit next to you.Lockers are charged at 25dirham.A 'one off' experience when visiting Dubai.

Great fun for non peak time ski practise. Living in the desert it's nice to go and practise some skiing ready for the winter! As long as you go at a time where there is limited children as it isn't policed very well and they can be hectic and not polite.Fun day out and good quality if u want to go all day and take a break in the middle

Snow on the desert. Since I live not too far from this place, I visited Ski Dubai several times and even took a ski lesson here. Surprisingly, according to some ski experts, the snow quality here is always similar to early morning powder of natural snow. The slope may not be satisfying for those regularly gliding on Black slope, but hey... where else in the world you can get snow on the desert?

All enthusiastic till i got to the ticket counter. Was looking forward to ski dubai as one of the main activities i wanted to do when i arrived.I changed my mind after i spoke to desk clerk...who if i say what i wanted to im pretty sure trip advisor wouldnt post this review... his attitude stunk and i took my 800 dhirums i was planning to spend on a full package elsewhere.Im sure i missed out on a great experience and im sure the other staff were nothing like this, however personally service is everything to me.Dont let this put you off but if your like me just hope u dont get the same guy at the front desk.The only let down to a fantastic 5 days in dubai.

Great day out with my daughter. my daughter has been learning to ski since June 2014. She is now advanced level. I thought to go ski with her last Friday. We reached ski Dubai at 8:45 am. We got our tickets (first time since my daughter used to go to ski school). There was an offer for the UAE residents giving you an additional hour and 20% discount. The only condition was to show either emirates ID or driving license. I had mine but I didn't have my daughter, which was a hassle. Despite this inconvenience we went inside and a two hours non stop. I recommend ski Dubai for those who would like to learn or those wanting to flex their muscles before going on a ski trip.

Snow in desert. Can't imagine a place maintained at -3 deg C where the outside temperature was over 40 deg C. After wearing the winder-coat and boots, never did we realize the door would lead to such a beautiful place with snow. The ice carving were nice, kids enjoyed the bobsled ride and other activities.After coming out, the hot water at the washroom was kind of giving life to the numb fingers. I should say a must visit place in Dubai. Don't forget to handover the locker key and get back the deposit amount!

Really enjoyed. It was really nice to enjoy the ice experience but the photography was very costly. Measures needs to taken to reduce the price of photography. These rates cannot be justified at any cost.

24 hour stopover in the desert so went skiing.... We had a great time with 2 small Aussie children who haven't seen snow before. Yes it was expensive, but we got value for money with tube riding, toboggans, giant snowball rides, ski lift and meeting the penguins.

Great relief from Dubai heat.... A wonderful weekend hangout with family and kids..Though a bit expensive, but worth the time spent. Lookout for deals and dicounts offered before you go. Nice rides and fun activities..can easily spend 3 to 4 hours inside..

It was nice. It was nice and very nice experience
- lift is slow, there is not a handle on skis
- in the hall would be nice wallpaper of mountains because blue wall is not very nice
