Totally chilling..... Amidst the deserts, this is a place must-visit in Dubai. Superb creation and perfectly constructed. Well planned and organized. Total enjoyment for friends. Loved skiing with friends in the desserts.
Great fun. A great way to pass sometime in a desert! Well organised and big enough to give you space to play. Clothing and gear all provided.

Awesome experience to ski indoors!. Ski Dubai is an amazing experience. It is well organized from the time you pay, pick up your snow pants and jacket, boots, skis and poles which are all included in the price of admission. Your entry card is scanned to allow you to use the ski lift as much as you like. The lifts are fast and efficient and the hills are well maintained. Other activities include zip lining, tubing, snowboarding, up close with the penguins. Ski Dubai is well worth the admission fee!.

Book before you go.. I was amazed at the atmosphere they have created. I loved the toboggan down the side! It was probably my favorite part! I would definitely recommend booking in advance if you are a beginner. My partner cant snowboard so we thought "oh thats ok" we will go on the beginner run (as there are only 2 runs) but they wouldn't allow it unless he was in a lesson; which the lessons were full. So we went on the other run which they came over and told him he could not go on this run. Definitely recommend seeing.

EXPERIENCE. It was fun and exciting! the trainers were very able.However I bought a USB with my videos is EMPTY! very disappointing! i even asked the staff if they are sure that it is saved because i don't have my laptop with me and i cannot check it immediately at the hotel.

Out of the Heat and in the iceland. its AMAZING we were to + 42 ° out of the mall we enter the ski and there are -2 ° chairlift bob slitting snowboarding snowmen x climbing walls , penguins and snow children playing with snow ... these Arabs have really exaggerated ! we also had a Sky ride on the cable cars for a complete view of Ski Dubai from the Top. Mall of Emirates worth a Visit. Don't miss this !!
Very cool. I liked everything about it. it is one of its kind experience for those who have never being in a iced placed :)

Great attraction in the desert. Little expensive. The attraction is marvelous. It is very cold inside the Snow park one should have winter wear with them along with those provided by the Park. Penguins are available for photo shoot even though there is a separate ticket.

Skiing in the desert?. Another item checked off the Bucket List! Certainly not the skiing I am accustomed to in Colorado but quite the experience regardless. And they made it effortless. Easy to get suited up and get equipment. Lines were short, lockers near by, lots of attendants to help. Not much by way of slopes but so much fun to play on. And met some really fun people in the process. Good value for the money.

Go to the snow, even outdoors +40.. Go to the snow, even the outdoors +40. This is a truly amazing experience that is worth experiencing. Ski Dubai is located inside the Mall of the Emirates, together with many other facilities to be visited, such as the Ice cafe.

Good indoor slope. A bit expensive.. I visited during a business trip to Dubai and was pleasantly surprised. Compared to the indoor slopes I have been to in England this was superb. There are two main slopes which they describe as a 'black' and a 'red'. In reality they are both blues - the 'black' does have one tricky section. The 'red' can also be accessed half way up for an even easier run. There is also a nursery slope for beginner lessons.The slopes can be accessed by a drag lift or a four person chair lift. There were a lot of none skiers going up on the chair lift which was a bit weird. Skis, jacket, socks, trousers and boots were all included. Hats and gloves were available to buy fairly cheaply.The shortest pass was for two hours. Bearing in mind there are really only two runs I would have appreciated being able to buy a cheaper pass for one hour.Overall pretty good, just don't expect it to compare to real skiing!

Ski Playmania in DXB. I visited Ski Dubai many times, I am very excited, when you think about it is amazing to have Ice Ski here in the Middle East considering originally the area is considered previously a desert. Now we can enjoy skiing, snowboarding for beginners and intermediate skier. The resort is a fantastic to escape the heat of the outside..This an experience to remember , It is a must visit .. Best Wishes

snow in the desert. Dubai is really a case in what can be achieved by money power. To have a large snow park and ski slope in the middle of a mall in a desert nation is unbelievable.The snow park is great fun, has a couple of interesting rides and slopes inside. All equipment is available at the venue, and if you know to ski, that's an added advantage. They also have a very cool penguin enclosure inside where they you can spend some time with these cute creatures, at a price ofcourse, but its great fun.a couple of hours can easily be spent at this attraction and for the young at heart its a must do in Dubai.

A fun freezing day in the Mall. Ski Dubai was just okay for me.. It would have been much better if i didn't have a long day before going there or if I knew how to ski!!. It's quite fun though especially with a group of friends. The in-house photographers are expensive though so be sure to carry your cameras along. I made frequent stops to buy hit chocolate as I was freezing..
Truly fabulous !. I loved the experience ! we went to mall of emirates and found this interesting place called the ski dubai. lots of snow and fun. good to see lots of ice in the desert.

Not worth the money anymore. If you like to ski then I'm sure there will be a suitable package at a rate that suits your budget.If, like us, you want to go in as a novelty for your children being in a cold environment when it is so hot outside it's not worth it. Previously you could pay a nominal fee to go in, throw snowballs and visit the ice structures - this no longer exists. The basic package was circa 200AED per person and now offers activities such as sitting on a ski lift or being in a snow dome (which your child might not be able to do but you have to pay). Very over priced for what is on offer compared to alternative attractions, unless you go for the ski package where there is no comparator.I urge the organisers to reinstate the basic package else's lose a lot of passing novelty trade

The Penguines visit- excellent choice (though the high fee as usual in Dubai). . this time we have decided to do something different and that is getting to know and see the penguins; it is a very nice experience for the kids who enjoyed their time there and got to discover and differentiate the emperor penguin from other species and some fruitful info on them ( like aside a DNA test; there is no way to know the gender of the Penguin!).

Authentic ski experience. The price includes equipment and clothing rental but not gloves. I bought a 2 hr pass. I ski well and was not planning to enter but decided to do it just for novelty and picture value.It is a well run operation. The lifts snow and run length were actually better than expected and better than the small hill where I learned to ski growing up.Great place for beginners.Since I grew up in cold weather. Sometime as low as -40, I thought I might just ski in shorts. I am glad I did not. It was pretty chilly and my hands were colder than comfortable. I recommend getting gloves, and the knit gloves may not b warm enough.I only skied 4 times to get a few pics. The expert run was equal to a green run at a western US facility. There were a few jumps and rails to try .

Sand, sea, sun and SNOW!. This was a great experience. Real snow and chairlifts. The runs were well covered and the equipment was first class. The trousers and jackets which were supplied weren't very flattering but they did the trick.This could be very expensive but there are many offers in local magazines which often give 2 for 1 admission - Time Out and What's on in Dubai to name two.

Unbelievable SKI experience in Dubai. Skiing is always imagined in mountains with snow and never in desert surrounded dubai. At Mall of Emirates this is possible and I had a wonderful time with my wife and children. There are few slopes to try and ski lifts to take you uphill. There is a cafe at the top as well. I choose the full ticket of 500 dirhams which gives access to all activities including the penguin encounter, we also got free lunch and hot chocolate drinks with the tickets. Money and time well spent.
Children loved every minit. My family enjoyed it would love to go back bit cold didnt relise that i should of dress the kids with warm clothing .siuitable for all ages and the penguin were amazing .
Part of the family. We live in Dubai and have been coming here for years. They taught our daughter to ski from scratch. the Moroccans are amazing. Nina is an absolute star. Amazing place

Oasis in the Desert. Mind boggling snow park with professional skiing facilitates inside Mall of Emirates is a delight for children and adults as well. There are couple of rides to enjoy and keep one busy at -3 deg cent for at least 3-4hrs. Super Pass entitles one to get a Cap and gloves as well apart from Warm jacket and lower which is included in std entry ticketCafe at the top is accessible by chair lift or ski lift and serves hot tea/coffee/chocolate and snacks and fair prices to give comfort in the chill of snowSeparate space for ski lessons with qualified instructors help newbies to stand on their foot on the ski , albeit at a price !!Overall a good family destination in Dubai
awesome. very cool experiencewe spent three hours many options for every onedon't forget glovesadd penguin encounternot to be missed

UNLIKE ANY OTHER. The mall has stores for every taste and pocket. we got some great buys , great lunch and then proceeded to check out the 'indoor ski lodge" it was amazing to leave 90+ degrees outside and be inside 30+degree temperatures skiing indoor as though you were at a swiss chalet. An incredible experience.

Lots of fun. Never been skiing before so was reluctant to go here but had a really fun time with the other attractions. My favorites were the giant ball and the toboggan run. My only complaints are the socks are very thin so my toes were frozen and I wish the jacket or pants had a pocket big enough to hold a small camera to take my own pictures. We ended up buying the picture package which was expensive and not all of the pictures that were taken could be located. Otherwise a fun time and glad I did it.
Who'd have thought it!. A ski slope inside a shopping mall anyone?Only in Dubai. This has since created a new market for Dubai - ski-wear!

Christmas came early!!. One of the beautiful places i have visited in Dubai.Though so so cold an my fingers freezing even though i had gloves on,i really enjoyed my time here.You'd have thought that it's actually snowing an wouldn't believe that you're inside a mall,lol! Cool...is the word!!
Only in dubai. We ski all over the world and ad to add dubai to our list great fun in the sun on the snow well worth a visit even just to see it it's well worth the money and ski clothes are included

Icy Wonder In The Desert. One of The main attractions on my list off must see attractions in Dubai. Well worth the entrance fee! Visiting over the festive period, it had this holiday spirit and feel about it. Not once did I believe that I was actually standing in icy temperatures in the middle of the desert. It felt as if though I was in Europe. The variance of people from around the globe added to the charm and grandeur of the place. Dressed in My Ski Dubai outfit, I undertook my journey onto the ski slopes. I wasn't disappointed and so were the 100's of visitors around me. I must say, it was really cold and within half an hour of standing inside, I was frozen. It helps to purchase a warm hat for your head and ears. The Ski cable took a while to reach the top but was worth the journey upwards. For an experience out of the ordinary I would suggest it anytime for visitors to Dubai. The snow had a pretty real feel about it too and it all adds up to an amazing time in Dubai. Look forward to visiting it soon again :)

Awesome Awesome Awesome. Need I say more. Indoor skiing in the middle of the desert!? Well organized from getting a locker for belongings to getting kitted out with ski outfit and ski's. Slopes well looked after and safety top notch while traversing ski lifts etc. A must visit!!

Kids Birthday Party at Sky Dubai. Dubai have loads of options for birthday parties and if you are looking for something different, fun and very well organised like we were, Ski Dubai is perfect!From the first phone call to paying the bill everything went so smooth and for the first time I could actually enjoy and have fun with the kids!The reservations team was perfect, the follow up for booking the food, the welcome, the actual food and drinks... especially the staff!At the arrival there was already a staff waiting for us taking away the cake and everything else whilst we waited for the rest of the guests. The room was ready waiting for us and everything was well timed, kids got dressed, group photo taken and we entered the snow park to have fun.The kids had a blast and played for over one hour!There was a group of older kids being a bit unruly and the staff tackled the issue in a polite and efficient manner.When we returned to the party room the food was ready, we cut the cake, the kids played a little with some games, dancing and ate the cake.The best party ever according to the birthday girl and I had time to chat to other parents, enjoy the coffee and food.Would definitely recommend for kids 5 and up.

This is a must!. Ok, so don't expect this to be the most amazing skiing experience. But if you want to have a really cool experience and say that you went snow skiing in the desert, it's a really cool thing to do. There are several packages to choose from. I took the two hour package and left a little before that. It was really awesome to be sunbathing in the morning and skiing in the afternoon. The facility provides everything except gloves and a hat. Happy that friends had recommended it. Definitely a cool activity for a couple of hours.

Cool!. It's a symbol of the area's wealth. Where else would you find a ski hill in the middle of a desert? Getting the equipment as part of the entry is a must obviously because no one in their right mind would own it or bring it here. It's a different thing to do or expect if you've never been to Dubai.

Dubai Trip. I was there in May 2010, it was a wonderful experience.We had tea in the restaurant overlooking the ski field. We sat and watched everyone having fun on the slopes.I have to put a date below because the system fails to show enough dates.

Free Ski. This place is truly amazing being the worlds largest ski dome everything is taken care of from clothing to ski boots & skis even have graded ski runs and cheaper than the indoor ski centes in the UK !!!!!
Ski Dubai is awesome!!!. I really like Ski Dubai. It is the new thing in Dubai or you can say in United Arab Emirates where you can feel very cold and enjoy.
Great!. Went there with kids. A nice place for fun. Even have a chairlift ride. Must recommended if you are visiting Dubai.

Slight decline in standards. THis is the third time i've visited Ski Dubai and the novelty of ski-ing in the desert still isn't lost on me! the snow is pretty decent and the equipment adequate although i've noticed more of the slopes and surrounding areas being used for other snow related activities other than ski-ing, probably to attract families i guess as it seems to lack direction in the kind of customer it's trying to attract. I generally use the attraction early in the morning and it's always empty with perhaps 20 other people on the slopes. it's beginning to look a little unloved and scruffy now which doesn't affect the ski-ing but the whole experience isn't as good as it once was - the cable car to the top of the slope is painfully slow too.

Not happy with Ski Dubai. First of all I still do not understand the concept of giving everything with your ticket except handgloves and woolen cap. They will give you very nice and warm clothes and shoes but no handgloves and woolen cap, just answer me why?It was soon damn cold inside that as soon as we stepped in few of us has to go out and buy handgloves and woolen caps to survive inside, and to make the matters worse when we asked how much we needed to pay for them, thats when we realised that UAE earn more from these items than oil. When you enter inside and see everything thats when you realise that you have been fooled like a small kid who bought a big expensive chocolate box with just a small piece of chocolate inside. You have to pay extra on extra to go other rides after just few kiddo rides. The only fascinating thing about the place is how they make snow in desert. I wonder the amount of electricity consumption of the place.
Great!. Being a swedes who loves to ski this is a must. If I lived here I would probably buy a golden pass. Okey the slopes aren't long or hard but it is still very relaxing.

Fantastic. Great expierience . Who would believe it, real snow in dubai . Had my first lesson while my nephew went to the top slope . Have a great play area too for both young and old. A little expensive but worth the visit. My mistake was not setting enough time aside. Next time I plan to spend the whole day there. Managed to stay upright without falling over. Great fun for all the family. Look out for offers.

Must visit, Wonderful Experience . Although a bit pricey, it's worth a visit. Located inside Mall of Emirates, and well connected by Metro, once inside, it is difficult to believe you can enjoy snow in Dubai. There are lots of fun filled activity for all. If you have bought the right package, you can even meet and greet the penguin. You can enjoy the sliding on snow, the ropeway and even learn sking if you the time and the inclination. I would highly recommend visiting this place, and kids will want to come back for more.

Indoor ski slope. It's the world's largest apparently and it's good fun to ski. To be fair it's nice when it's 45C outside to find somewhere authentically cold. It's not appreciably any different to indoor slopes I've used elsewhere and certainly still a long way from an outdoor experience in any kind of ski resort. The lift queues have been reasonable when I've been there but it's a very simple slope to ski on - simple for beginners but no variation or challenge beyond that. It does get cold and although the gloves are ok the coats offer little insulation so take something warm to wear.

Could have been better. We had a two hour pass for the ski run. Buying the tickets was hard work as there's people everywhere and the tickets aren't explained very well. There is no one hour lift pass available which I think there should be and lockers aren't included in the price, neither are hats and scarves. I think for the price you pay these things should be included.We were a bit worried the slope would be busy as there were so many people there but most people just go to the snow play.The lifts are good and were all open.The equipment isn't the greatest and I was given boots a size too big as they didn't have my size!? There is only really two runs which gets a bit boring after two hours.Worth a visit but expensive for what you get.

Skiing in the Desert. Ski Dubai is one of the best places to visit in Dubai, could be done as family, couples or even single, your visit will be filled with too much fun, your experience at ski Dubai is Great and sure you will have a good value for your money. the staff from the reception to going inside the park are very nice and very well trained. ski Dubai has the highest standards of safety. as for the things you can do in the park besides skiing, snowboarding, group exercises, snow bullets, if you have kids they will enjoy meeting the penguins. after saying all this i would like to make it clear that i dont know anybody who works in ski Dubai, i Honestly just love the place, if your on a visit or resident of Dubai you sure have to give it a go

Fantastic to entertain kids and adults alike.. We take our children frequently to ski Dubai, not only to escape the heat in the summer, but also to keep them used to the slopes as both had skied before in Switzerland. It is so convenient to get to from anywhere in Dubai, easy parking and you can even do a spot of shopping in MOE while they are having their lessons. I would highly recommend the Snow park for small children and the Penguin Encounter is an experience not to be missed. AMAZING!!!

The Snow Park is great for the kids. A thoroughly enjoyable time for the kids and adults. My 4 year old had an absolute blast. Winter snow suits are provided as are safety helmets for kids under 13. Bring your own gloves and hats if you can. There is a shop that sells winter clothing if you need.

friend. it was a visit with a friends and cousins it was amazing i never saw real snow but the atmosphere the rids ,ice and the cafe , let me feel as am on a totally different place ,that time i think we stay for 5 hour and did not feel the time at all ,my advice is to visit on week day so there it will not be crowded

Good craic (you get SO cold). Was in Dubai with my boyfriend and another couple!!None of us had skied before so we went for the 'Power Pass' which included an hour discovery lesson....cost around €55 each but was so much fun!!The lesson was good....instructor really explained everything and you got a few chances to come down the small slope....we then had unlimited access to the Snow World and all the activities it was good craic......got very cold so we stayed for only about an hour and a half!!All clothing and boots and that were provided with our pass.....IMPORTANT make sure to keep all cards as you need them to get deposit back....this was not explained to us by our cashier guy and left one card in a jacket so just makesure to return them!!!Good fun :)

Be prepared. This was an awesome day out and so easy to forget it is in Dubai. We had a snowpark admittance which included toboggan, ringos, zorbing, chairlift and sledging. It was great to enjoy a hot drink and nachos in the Avalanche cafe up high. As the temperature was only minus 3 ⛄️!! We stayed from around 11 til 4. There were lots of shivering people not staying so long. I wore: thermal trousers and thermal vest, trousers, t-shirt and fleece, 2 pairs of socks, scarf, hat and 2 pairs of gloves PLUS the snowsuit and boots provided. Very well done attraction indeed. Entertainer vouchers a big plus to bring the cost down.

Great fun, and huge. A bit on the expensive side I suppose, but great fun and fantastic way to pass anything up to the whole day. It's not just a ski slope (or two) -there's lots more activities to have fun with, toboggan, sorting on ice, etc, etc - oh and the zip line, of course! I couldn't resist that! The staff were all friendly and helpful, the equipment and clothing was good quality. I watched from a restaurant for a while (Après) then dived in.......it's every it as good as an outdoor slope!

Good fun... I recently visited the ski dubai.we were two families with 4 young children.all of us had great fun there.chairlift ride make u remember of gandola ride in gulmarg.more over on hill stations you dont get such clean snow.all other rides are also good and very safe.they provide snow boots and suit.but dont forget to take ur gloves and cap otherwise it would be difficult to stay longer inside

Snow in the desert . An amazing attraction that has to be seen to be believed!!! Awesome fun for beginners or advanced! This was my first time in a snow board and I aced my self pretty hard hahah so take it easy and start on the kids slope as it is a huge steep hill '!!! Worth the money and would go back for sure

An awesome break from the heat. We spent a nice time at The Snow Park, the world's largest indoor snow park housing 3,000 square meters of snowLocated inside Dubai Mall of the Emirates, With a chair lift and a t-bar, 6,000 tons of snow are at your disposal.Whether you just want to learn the basics, or get good enough to fly off a 10 ramp, our qualified instructors will help you improve your skills and have you carving up the powder in no time, I feel the price is good considering all the inclusions. We had a great time and wished we would've spent more time here but we were pressed for time.

A lovely day to cool off!. Enormous fun and very refreshing to be in the cold when the outside temperature is 40C. We had such a good time skiing in Dubai that we visited the place three times!! I know, its a little strange going to Dubai to ski?? It was fun and it was great being located within the Emirates Mall as there was a fantastic choice of restaurants and shopping.
I love SkiDubai. It was one of my best days in Dubai, It is awesome, we like it very much and we must come back to SkiDubai when we come back to dubai.. ONE OF THE BEST PLACES EVER IN DUBAI

Very Small Ski Area. Came here to Ski one time because frankly, I got tired of the heat. Paid something around 300 Dirhams for 2 hours. I love skiing in the states so thought this would be fun. The lift is slow and it takes about 20-30 seconds to come down the slope, maybe quicker. I believe they offer lessons as well. Nonetheless, it's fun to get away from the desert heat and have some fun in the snow.

Favourite attraction in Dubai!. I visited ski Dubai and booked a discovery lesson followed by a beginners lesson, I didn't use the snow park so my review is only based on the ski school and it's facilities. It was so much fun, both my instructors were great! Especially the guy from Morocco i can't remember his name. I skiied once 10 years ago but haven't since so I was a little nervous about getting back in it but the instructors were so friendly and I felt totally at ease. They really are a credit to this place. Also reception are very helpful and friendly!I booked my lessons online before - I'd definitely recommend doing this as it's quicker and you have a guaranteed spot. They give you everything apart from gloves. I bought my own ski gloves and a thick pair of socks I wear with normal boots at home- they gave me a thin free pair of socks but it's -4 in there so i don't recommend these! I wore leggings and a tshirt and was not cold at all - I was skiing though so this might be different if you are in the snow park and not doing a whole lot of exercise.The only downside is that the mall isn't that great - but hey not their fault at all!Thank you ski Dubai for such a great afternoon!

Snow in the Desert!. Its a different concept in the desert. the weather outside might be 40degrees but here be assured to enjoy - 4degrees temperature. There are lot of fun rides. book super snow park tickets to enjoy the rides. All rides are easy to do. End your snow experience with a cup of hot chocolate.

Great fun and very easy to do. They provide everything here. If you wanted, you could be shopping and then decide to go skiing for two hours! I would recommend taking a jumper though, we we did get a little cold. With the entertainer voucher, it cost us 100 dhs (about 16 GBP) each, for two hours on the slopes. We can ski already, at various levels, and there was enough to keep us occupied for this time. A fun afternoon.
SNOW FALL IN THE DESSERT. Awesome experience. Please note that they dont provide wollen caps and handgloves and this forces you to get out early. so carry your own wollen caps and handgloves.

Snow In Middle Of The Desert. We spent a nice time at The Snow Park, the world's largest indoor snow park housing 3,000 square meters of snow, you can enjoy Twin Track Bobsled runs, a Snow Cavern filled, and tobogganing hills. also the ride on the Giant Ball, the jump on the chairlift, Ride the Snow Bullet and soar as high as 16 meters above the ground, Don't forget to watch the March of the Penguins. Highly recommended.

A lot of inclusions. Had a great time here last week. My husband and I purchased the Power Pass with Discovery Lesson. I had taken a lesson once before but many years ago, so I don't consider myself a skier. Your snowsuit, gloves, ski boots and skis are included. The instructor was nice and kept the group laughing. There were 8 people in the group including ourselves. We must have been having a real good time because the lesson was over before we knew it. After the lesson we returned our ski boots and traded them in for regular snow boots before going into the snow park. The snow park was a lot of fun, we felt like kids. We went snow tubing, bobsledding, rolled down a hill in a "snow ball" and rode the chair lift. I feel the price is good considering all the inclusions. We had a great time and wished we would've spent more time here but we were pressed for time.

Day out. Visiting the Emirates Mall the are the ski lifts and areas for ski ing. You can hire your clothes and boots etc, and it is a great fun way of visiting the shopping mall. The children are well looked after and you can arrange birthday parties there. Very cold but of course it is. Very enjoyable.

Interesting Experience. Ski Dubai is one of a kind place. I'm not a skier, but it was a nice way to experience a cold environment from the comfort of a mall. I have to say however, that it is on the pricy side.

Perfect. I haven't been skiing in years. It was so much fun to do it again and in a controlled area. Not many people skiing. Was glad I read a few tips before coming. Bring your on Gloves, hats and socks. I was wearing shorts and I think I should have worn pants too. It's was in the 90's out side so it hard to wear the right things. I would do it again. It's a perfect placed to learn how to ski. I would do it again if I come back. Got hot chocolate. It was great!

Winter Wonder Land in Dubai!!. We heard so much about this attraction it was one of our first stops in Dubai. At first I could not believe my eyes, there really was snow inside of the mall! Not only snow, there were ski lifts, big plastic balls for snow fun, amusement rides, sledding, penguins and much, much more! The place was full with people of all ages inside having the time of their lives. Everyone that we saw were laughing, kids were playing and it was one of the best places we had seen on our trip. They do offer ski lessons if you have never skied before or just go and play in the snow. Dressing warm is a must. If you do not have enough warm clothes and socks you can easily buy them at their gift shop or in the mall. They also have a coffee shop if you need to take a rest and warm up. If you don't want to ski or go into the the attraction you can view it from the outside and take photos or visit their store for souvenirs. It is worth seeing for sure. The location is in The Mall of the Emirates.

Ski classes. I did a beginner class for skiing. It was very nice to do that in Dubai. I never skied before, but they taught me well. No falls =)
Nice to make some GoPro videos ;)

Bone-chilling thrills!. Residing in a tropical country, i am not exposed to freezing weather or even snow! For me, it was a thrilling experience. There are several packages to choose from depending on your budget, and if you're a first timer. Kids will like the penguin experience wherein they get to see, touch and take pictures with the penguin.Ski dubai is a park that can entertain the whole family. Theres an area for experienced skiers (i am not one of them, obviously), coffee shops for those who want to thaw out, and various activities like slides and zorbing. I recommend getting the package that allows you to sit on the chair lift so that you can see the whole view of the park.One thing's for sure: the skidubai-provided gear was not enough to keep us warm. 30 minutes later, our toes were freezing up. Make sure to bring your own (if you have it) warm wooly socks, weatherproof boots and gloves, a wooly hat and earmuffs. Remember, the warmer you are, the longer you can stay in the park. It took us 2 hours before we felt like our noses will fall off and some of our friends gave up 30 minutes in.Bundle up and enjoy!

My 9 year old had the time of her life. We spent the day at The Snow Park, rather than the ski slopes.Take layers of clothing and wear better gloves than the ones that come free. The snow slides and rides are enormous fun.
ski dubai. this is a mst visit place and very enjoyable . full of snow with flyer ride and other few activity . its a value for money

One of the best and must visit attraction in Dubai. By far one of the most wonderful and beautiful attraction at Dubai.Located in Emirates mall which also has a metro station, this is one of the best places to visit when in Dubai. This place should be visited early around 10 am as it is relatively empty and can be enjoyed completely and at leisure.The fees are based on packages you choose including a special package on feeding penguins. It is one of the biggest snow parks ever visited by me and my friends and boosts of several entertainment rides within. The suits and shoes given are clean and hygienic and good enough to keep you warm inside.The rides including ski lessons are worth the buck. The best part is the helpful and smiling staff, amazing. Very safe and a must visit for people of all ages.Do not have a limited time for this place, it surely requires atleast 2-3 hours. It does have a de-freeze option once you re out and helps you get back to normal.Do not miss this one.

Actually quite unbelievable. Everything in Dubai is so maxed out, and this is no exception. Just the thought of buildning a ski slope in the middle of the desert is crazy, and they did it. If you are a skier this is not much (20 sek run) but it actually is a perfect slope to lern skiing. Good snow quality. Attraction is fun for about 30 min and probably not very enviromental friendly....

So fun ~ and for all ages. I learned and mastered snow boarding in one day! I had an awesome teacher, from Belarus, and by the end of our day, I was snowboarding on my own. So fun!They provide equipment (no hat or gloves) and guidance.

really nice!. Ski dubai was excellent my son took the discovery ski lesson the instructor ali was very nice i reccomend you to take a class with instructor Ali. my daughter and i took the ski lift to the snow bullet , the snow bullet for my daughter was scary at first but the staff told her its 100 percent safe it was really fun for the both of us. I highly recommend you to visit ski Dubai. Beware its really freezing cold .

Not recommended unless you need cold air. I am a ski instructors and i wouldn't now recommend skiing at this venue. The snow is not the same and people are dangerous stopping in the middle of the hill. The bottom part is fine and the kids have a much better time at the bottom than the top

Excellent for skiing if you live here. I notice a lot of cynical people on here saying "this must be great for people who've never seen snow"... just remember Dubai is 80% expats and actually most of us do know what snow looks like, but if you live in Dubai there are simply no other options for skiing.As a non-skier before I came to Dubai, SkiDubai has been great for me, I have learned to ski to a good standard and am improving my skills in there most days. The instructors and marshalls are really helpful and the standard of tuition is very good, I learned to ski competently in about 3 1.5 hour lessons, and the prices are reasonable too - a lesson costing 230 Dhs (about £40) and a 2 hour pass 200 Dhs (about £35).Obviously it's not a mountain indoors. But it's been set up by people who know their stuff to give a good range of skiing environments to learn and practice on. I really rate it for anyone living here who want to learn to ski and have an enjoyable hobby in Dubai.Can't comment on the snow park, never been, looks way too tacky for me. If you like queueing the cold it looks like the best place to be though so maybe ideal for english people.

Unusual experience.. I am very keen skier and I have been skiing as long as walking. I grew up in the country where skiing is taught at schools. This was my first experience with indoor skiing and I was very keen to try it, so my first journey after arriving to Dubai was to Emirates Mall and on the slopes. I should say, on the slope. The whole “resort” was larger than I expected. I spent only two hours there as slope is not steep and long enough for experience skier and I just got bored. If you are a beginner or you have kids, I would recommend a visit as it is nice to get a break from the heat outside. I probably will not be visiting again, unless I am relocated to Dubai for longer time and this would be my only option for hitting slopes.

Waste of money. i promised my kids that I would take them to the snow park and was shocked to see that it had more than doubled in price since first opening a few years ago. There are several activities inside but after 45 minutes we were bored and cold and came out after spending dhs700 for 3 of us.

A break from the heat!. Bizarre to step into -6 degrees from nearly 40 outside, but I'm glad I did. A decent slope, with some variation half way down, in a surreal touristy atmosphere comprising fake log restaurants, small cresta run, sliding on tyres and even a pool with periodic penguin visits. I just stuck to the skiing. It takes 4 mins to go up the poma and ski to the bottom (the chairlift is very slow). Not that many people were skiing (midweek in September) even though the place was busy - most were doing the other activities and riding up the chairlift to come back down on it (including the obligatory "buy your photo from the booth" stunt). Around 200Dh for 2hrs, 300 Dh for the day, including equipment is pretty good in this city of excesses! 20% discount for mastercard when I used it. You will need gloves (or socks on your hands) against the cold if you use the poma.

New activites. So its a new experience to do in the hot weather here in Dubai !! Its has many activities to be done inside you can play with snow or the slide and many others. Also there are ski lessons and school to teach you how to ski from the top point. There are 2 cafes inside the ski the bottom area that as all access too. And the other on is the other section of the ski which is the upper area you should pay by tickets more to have more access. There many staff there to help you there. Also when you get you tickets (which is around 150 Dhs and above) is has with the ski jacket,pants,socks and boots. Also there was a store near that area where you can get all your ski stuff. They also give your card that by it you can lock you locker with. And when your leaving there are blue machines near the store where you can put the card and it returns 10-20 dhs for each card (after you take your all stuff from the locker).

Ski Dubai Only If The Environment Dosen't Matter. If they built it they will come is the mantra for Ski Dubai, housed in the Mall Of Emirates where money isn't an issue, where the environment dosn't matter, then you would go sking at Ski Dubai.It aimed at children of locals and tourist who don't experience a winter with snow, there are even penguins. I like to say its fun, yet my social conscience dictates that it's not.

Great Winter Fun In The Desert. Who would have ever thought you could play in the snow in Dubai! Ski Dubai is great fun for all ages. I would recommend going during the daytime hours because it can get quite crowded in the evening hours. The bobsledding, tubing, skiing and rolling down a hill in a giant rubber ball made me feel like a kid again. But the highlight of my experience was being able to meet, touch, hug and kiss several penguins. Ski Dubai is a must do!

It was "just ok". We purchased the Super pass, which includes the chair lift ride, giant ball, Mountain Thriller, snow tube, and a free glove voucher. Chair lift - very slow and boring. Not much to see. 1-time use w/ this passGiant Ball - This was the most fun! I rolled and laughed. 1-time use w/ this passMountain Thriller - This was fun too. Usage is unlimited.Snow Tube - Fun but lasted 3 seconds. Usage is unlimited All of this lasted an hour if there is little to no queue. You could probably do everything in 30 minutes. Nothing out of this world. This pass is tailored for kids. Maybe if we skiied it would have been a different experience. To make it more fun for young adults that don't want to ski, they should include more rides/activities, which will mean they will need to expand.Beware, the photographers are VERY ANNOYING! We took a photo before and after like every ride.I agree with the reviews that said it was very cold when you're inside (it was -3 degrees Celsius). So if you are sensitive to the cold, wear a hat, a scarf, 2 gloves (my hands were still cold with 2 gloves), and a jacket underneath. The jacket and pants they provide are not enough if you are not used to the cold. Also, you can carry a phone or camera inside.

Weird to see it for one who has snow every year. As a Western foreigner who is seeing snow every year, Ski Dubai in the Mall of the Emirates is just a waste of money. But I can imagine that for people in a desert like the area in and around Dubai it might be once-in-a-lifetime experience. And perhaps in several decades we would like to have that too, considering the global warming.

Had to try this in Dubai! If I lived in Dubai, I would get the yearly pass!. Hey, this isn't Colorado or Utah, however it is adequate for where it is. The staff is professional with supplying the right gear for us skiers, very helpful and friendly. We were impressed with the services.I would agree it is pricey if you don't ski, snowboard or have never seen snow.

Unique experience!. If you visit Dubai and are a keen skier this is not to be missed. Spent around 1hr on the slope which felt enough and got more than 10runs in. Try to go on a Sunday morning as this is a very quite time of the day.The chair lift is a little slow however.

Best indoor mall skiing. Understanding that you are skiing in a mall, in a desert, it was a great experience. Staff was fast to provide ski clothes, and equipment. Once on the slopes, we pretty much had the place to ourselves, never having to wait more than 30 seconds to get on the chair lift. They have a 2 hour option and a full day option. Glad we went with the 2 hour option, in that we were easily able to make a dozen runs in our 2 hour timeframe. You save $100 AED if you get both the super and supreme - thus able to do the tubing, Zorb ball, sledding, etc. After skiing, these other activities were fun for about an hour.

Very cold best part middle of the desert. Ski dubai se obviously very cold -4 degree amazing fact is that it is in the middle of the desert we also did skiing we that long slide. In the end very memorable experience.

Snow in hot Weather :). i have visited it many timesif you visit Mall of emirates, you shouldn't miss the experience of SKI in hot weather country.it's Nice for SKi lovers and mainly for kidsit divided intro many sections based on you Ski skillsyou don't need to bring any thing with you, all are availble.you may pay extra fees to watch penguins and have super pass

Fun Experience. A great way to cool off and have some fun. You can get all needed gear there. It wasn't too crowded much to my surprise. Those that do not wish to ski can watch thru the windows. A great mall worth strolling around too.

Good for Kids and Professional Skiers. It is big and made good. Located at Mall of emirates. But there is not much you can do if you are an adult and do not know professional ski boarding or skiing. It costs about AED 200 for a super pass which has all except penguin adventure and Skiing. Power pass is another AED 50 extra which has touching of penguins included. Skiing lessons are available for AED 150 extra which is for 1 hour. You can try a hand at that. But yes if you are a professional, it is very good fun... you can enjoy...

Ski in the Desert. Although there in 2011, this was some of the best value for money of our whole trip. We'd seen Pisa, Rome, Pompeii, Venice, Paris, Berlin, Munich and parts of the North Sea. A stop in Dubai was spent in part Skiing in the Desert and the operators think of everything. Great value, great fun and everything supplied for the equivalent of au100.00. and 2 hrs solid for my Son and I.

Fun in the Snow, when you are in a desert?. Very well organised and easy to access. The kids had a great time in the Snow Park. Don't need to bring anything as it is all catered for you, including ski gear. Must do when in Dubai.
nice and cool. Wasnt busy and Emirates Mall is worth the visit The skiing its self was better than i expected and was great to get inside in the cool of the midday sun

Great fun. Met some friends and had a great time skiing for 2 hrs at ski dubai. Not too busy. Took my own ski jacket and trousers as my friend had said the jackets supplied don't keep you warm enough.. Surreal being in -4 temperature yet it's 40+ outside. Would definitely return.. Ok it's not the Alps but it's the nearest thing to it in the desert !!
Great unique fun. Worth doing just for the unique value. Works well and very professional although you could probably get a ski pass in the Alps for the same price :-)

Expensive but worth it!. Ski Dubai was a big draw card for visiting Dubai, without which, we would not have stopped over for more than a night. And it was not to disappoint! 200 AED for 2hrs seems quite a lot to pay until you realise... You're skiing in a freaking mall! I've skied Canada and Switzerland and wasnt expecting much from this but wow. After paying and getting your lift ticket, you get a one piece and then get fitted for skis. Staff are friendly and efficient, it is well organised. Equipment is pretty new but basic. Gloves, goggles and hat are not included. You can purchase but I went without. Temperature is freezing but mild and of course there's no wind. I put my hands in my jacket and warmed my ears when they got cold. Personal preference here. This is not the place to learn how to ride so you'll need to have some experience as lift operators look pretty oblivious and are off to the side. After a quad chair lift up a dog leg, you get to the top. One wide blue run splits to 2, black run to the right (which is more red than back and is a short 50m) or continue around for blue which meets for the end stretch which is a hard green/easy blue. I arrived just before opening at 10 and glad I did as it started to get busy around 12. I never needed to wait for the lift as there was no line ups during this time. Overall a must do if you've skied before.
Looks like fun. Only indoor ski area in the world. Lots to do for kids / adults of all ages. 300 AED for a day pass which includes all your gear.

Very Good Entertainment, more points for being in a mall !!!. Ski Dubai is one of most recommended places in Dubai, I have been twice to this place, its more fun in high summer, when there is heat outside and you are inside and you are freezing inside, it has some excellent rides, the chair lift is most popular and universal type, even a simple walk through the place is fun.Penguin interaction if you try it is also sort of fun and the trainers are really professional and friendly, the place gets extra points as it is located in the excellent Mall of Emirates so you don't have to visit is specially and make a special plan, you can go through it while shopping or if you are dining in the mall, one of the best in-mall entertainments.The reason I gave it a star less is the staff at the ticketing counters, they are not as friendly like other places in Dubai and they don't address your answers properly to the queries about multiple places, this is the complaint I heard from other fellow tourists as well. Otherwise the inside staff is nice.

Not for begginers.. I am not the best at skiing or snowboarding but get by. The staff here have no time for people who cannot ski and will ask you to leave if you are not confident and fall over often. They provide you will a suit, shoes and socks but you have to purchase hats and gloves seperate. It was really expensive for 2 hours, roughly £120pp. It is a great place for kids as most of the rides and activites are with kids in mind. They have a cafe for parents to watch if they don't want to go in themselves. Great experience if you come from somewhere with no snow. As we are from Scotland we get our fair share in the winter.

A Skiing Experience for Someone who came from a Tropical Place.. Snow will always be exciting for someone like me that came from a near equatorial area.I experienced playing with snow many times and it never cease to excite me.I been to Dubai like 5 times already and my visit to Ski Dubai was the third, one to experience the snow park and two to try skiing. Ski Dubai might be artificial as a snow park and as a ski resort but the amazement and thrill was just the same as the real thing. Seasoned skiers will always say that it is more difficult to Ski on not so fresh snow and given the circumstances that it is enclosed and feels like in a giant freezer but who's complaining, it's located inside a huge mall in a desert oasis of UAE. It is very convenient. You can shop do sand dunes bashing, shopping or sunbathing in the Gulf's coastline after skiing. I can consider myself a beginner and needs more practice.I would love to go back to comeback and do it again. All the spills and crashes were all worth it.Thank you Ski Dubai for reminding all of us that we need to follow all the safety precautions. Continue to promote safe snow sports in a place where snow is next to impossible. Than
Awesome. The kids will love this. It feels as though you skiing in Switzerland. Great rides and entertainment for all. And this is all inside a shopping mall.

Lovely!!. Amazing experience of -3 degree Celsius in the middle of hot summer. I am a Gulf country resident. Thus, it was a pleasant change for me. We got to see penguin show. It was very cute and professionally done. I would say most rides are meant for kids. For adults, major attraction is skiing and chair lift. Overall, a good family fun.
"Yey, Snow in a Desert". Awsome place to run around. My partner & I had a cosy time in the Ski Park at the Dubai Mall. Fun rides, real snow and helpful staff.worth a visit :)
average. too expensive for the experience provided. Just go for the zip line and come back. For more the price you dont get the fun factor of wild wadi or desert safaris.
Just passing. I would have loved to have tried this on my stay as i am a keen skier but didn't have time. Its amazing to be able to ski in the middle of the dessert. Really big slope aswell.
Pricey, boring. First of all it's too pricey, you have to pay for the training , the outfit and only then can you do the skiing . I think it was a waste of time. I won't bother again!!

OK, I did it. I wanted to be able to say that I had skied in Dubai. OK, I did it. For anyone else having this kind of a thing on their bucket list it is worth spending the ~$50 to take a couple of runs and get a photo.
Snow in the middle of the desert. We had a lot of fun here. Children get to play with snow and slides of different sizes. They even had a live penguin show which was a nice surprise.

Wrap up in Dubai! . Only in Dubai can you go from desert safari to skiing!! Had an exhilarating time. There are two main slopes, one for advanced and one for intermediate and they are both pretty long. There is also a ski instructor for those who haven't mastered the basics. However there isn't anything in between - we hadn't skied for 10 years and it would be have been great if we could have had a quick go on a smaller slope first to get our confidence. Having said that I loved it and would definitely recommend going. Staff are all very helpful. They supply boots and clothing but you have to buy your own gloves in the shop (you can also buy a hat if you want). There are lots of cafés and some rides for kids, plus of course you are smack bang in the middle of the Mall of the Emirates (which you pretty soon forget as you head up to the top of the slopes on the chairlift)! If you like to ski this is definitely worth a visit - it's one of the things we want to do again if (when!) we come back to Dubai.

Exciting. Our visit to ski Dubai was really exciting, my boyfriend particularly enjoyed it as he is use to going skiing, for me there was a beginners corner which was nice, I enjoyed our day very much.

Nice Snow vacation. It would ne nice to play Snow in Dubai ... We are very excited and playfull the staff also nice specially Saheed... Just wan to Say Hii to him nice to meet U.. This my number +6285218342095 hope u see this cause maybe i will come again on december see u

great fun for kids. great fun for kids, quite expensive , kids really enjoy, .If they take special photos for kids when you go out may be over 250 dhs, you will see it is very expensive they should review this disadvantage . also it takes long time to go in . Although they should offer a hot drink inside.

Unbelievable. It was an amazing experience to have snow in a desert country a fun place for the family we all had a great day on the ski, but need to wear warm clothes beneath despite the winter clothes that are hired out.
Un-Real. This is amazing that this is in the desert. Eat at the cheesecake factory to watch people ski. They have everything, Zip line, ski, ball roll, stuff for little kids.

Ingenious to say the very least!. For us from the tropics, who dread the cold and too much snow sends a shiver down the spine (literally), this is literally a cheat sheet to all the fun without the pain! Loved the rides, felt like an Olympic Luge player and the best part - if it gets too cold, come out for a breather! The equipment they give is spic and span - quite clean, no hygiene worries. Had a fun evening in the desert! Highly recommended.

Penguin Visit. Ok I will admit I felt bad visiting the penguins because it makes me sad they are stuck in Dubai, but I LOVED every moment. I love penguins and to be able to pet, take a picture, and play with them was amazing. One day I'll make it down to Antarctica, but doubt I'll get this kind of interaction!There are also other activities to do for everyone. Great thing to do to escape the heat, but avoid busy times as it's in the Mall and can get very crazy!

From 45 to -8ºC. One of the coolest places in dubai. Don't be cheap and buy some gloves (they're not included on the entrance fee). First time I was there I didn't buy a pair, at my firt fall (there were a lot of falls) my hands seemed to freeze! I was there on november 2009

Only in Dubai. Changing your flipflops for ski shoes, wear a ski suit over your summer clothes an make some downhills in world's largest indoor ski hall. It was just awesome. However try to arrange or rent gloves, because your hands will be frozen after two hours of skiing.

You have to give it a go. This is just worth a visit for the fact it is so odd to be able to ski where it is over 40c. We had an excellent afternoon on the activities, and as someone who has not previously been on ski's the hour beginner lesson was really good and something I would now like to have a go at again in the near future.

What an amazing experience!!!. What a great place - Arrived about 10.30 and was on the slopes by 11.00. The staff helped us from start to finish. We were guided through getting all our equipment and ski clothing we needed also ski passes etc. They couldn't help you enough.The slopes were quiet in the morning and we had en enjoyable 2 hours up in the chairlift and skiing down. We used a 2 for 1 voucher from the entertainer Dubai book for the skiing so it cost 2 of us only 200 aed for the ski. We bought our teenage son the 500 aed ski Dubai experience which included absolutely everything from the snow park to the zip line to the snow balls to the skiing to free hot chocolate, locker, gloves and a set menu at the St Moritz Café to the penguin experience. This was definitely worth it for him.Mind it was absolutely freezing and I should have worn something a bit warmer than shorts under my ski suit which was provided by Ski Dubai. Take your own gloves and hats as you will need to pay for these. The socks they provide are a bit flimsy and did not really do the job of keeping your feet toastie.A fab day we spent here and I would definitely recommend it for a fun family day out.

Hit the food court and then hit the slopes!. Ski Dubai is obviously unique... the great thing is that it's not just a gimmick. The slopes are really fun, and you can burn hours of daylight while having fun in the cold. There's a fun park for the kids, penguins, and a zip line that will rocket you over the slopes. This is one of my favorite stops when we are in Dubai.

Winter Wonderland, for a Price. As someone who loves winter and hates the heat, this was an incredibly welcome outing. I went to Ski Dubai with my company and only had two hours at the park, but easily could have spent more time there.However, had I not had this excursion paid for by the company, I don't think I would have gone. It is $60 for two hour access to the park which includes a jacket, snow pants, and snow boots. However, the jacket is much too thin for the temperature of the park (-4C) and unless you came prepared with a thick fleece or sweater and long pants, you will not be adequately dressed and will likely be extremely uncomfortable. I also suggest bringing a scarf. If you want gloves or a hat, you have to purchase them ($5 and $16 respectively). If you want a locker (which is quite small), you have to rent one ($5).If you want to see the penguins, that's an additional $43. And while the penguin encounter was absolutely wonderful, they DO NOT permit cameras. If they didn't want flash for fear of disturbing the animals, I might understand. But the park provides a photographer who takes photos with a very bright flash, so the camera ban is only in place so that the park can charge you $30 for ONE COPY of A SINGLE PHOTO. The photographer doesn't even wait to see if you're ready to have your photo taken and rushes through taking the pictures. You've already paid to see the penguins and get into the park. Charging that much for the only photo you could possibly have of the experience is nothing short of robbery and they should be completely and utterly ashamed of themselves. If they were to charge even $10 for a photo (which is still pretty absurd), they would still be making far more than the cost of printing a single photo, without completely gouging their customers.All in all, that is over $150 for ONE PERSON for two hours, not including any food purchases you may wish to make. So yes, it was a lovely evening and I had a great time, but if you asked me to shell out that kind of money myself for the novelty of seeing snow while in the desert for two measly hours, I would laugh in your face.I would rather spend that kind of money on an experience unique to the Middle East, like a desert safari for example, than pay to experience something I can do for free at home come December.
Amazing. My kids and their friend like to spend timme n ski dubai to forget hit of 60•C outdOr. They play n snow park nd go to slop to learn more about skiing nd try snowboard

Snow in the Desert. Ski Dubai was a wow experience. The children had a gala time....so excited to be playing with snow. small rides for the lil ones that i could never get them to stop. Even i couldnt get myself to get off the rides finally. Children below three have to be kept out though....a good destination for spending half a day ............ :)
Tulsidas - Ski Dubai. Its very nice to visit families and even bachlors. To see cuch place in the desert countries, its amazing.
Wonderful. Really liked the feeling of cold in a desert. Got to make a snowman when outside temperatures were 38•c
Ski Slope in the Mall of Emirates. This place is great fun for all the family, you could just visit and play in the snow park, or go skiing on the slopes. They have all the kit you need
extreme fun and cold. easy access from the Kempenski hotel. Right at the end of the Mall of the Emirates. A wonderful day destination that's a pretty decent value for what you get.

Cool down. Good fun, my son had his first experience with snowboard, not cheap but great fun and all part of the adventure. It is freezing so you need a couple of layers. And you can watch from the Mall or enjoy a coffee with a window seat view.
So much fun!!. Little pricey but it's so much fun you quickly get over that!! Our 3 girls had the best time!! Skiing in the desert who would think?? Def another must do!!

Nice. The idea is definitely amazing.
Location is not so big, and if you want to ski you have just two lines.
Very expensive to go in if you do not sky (about 60 euros per person to have access to all slides).
Freezing inside (-5' about) so a sweater and a scarf are highly recommended.
A nice experience.
Get away from the heat and go. New experience, I totally loved it . To me , the place was freezing but we had fun any why . We were lucky that day there were penguins show .

Fun fun fun. Great thing to do in such a hot city! Staff were helpful and the facilities are top notch. Compared to what you pay in a natural resort this is fairly reasonable in price. The snow is a bit in on the icey side as opposed to powdery but not bad enough to ruin the experience. Make sure you bring your own gloves (otherwise you have to buy a pair for about 75dh) and a beanie or helmet if you need one.

skiing in the desert. A welcome break from the summer heat and a novelty to ski on real snow when it's 48 degrees outside. Lots of options including snow boarding, zorbing and just playing in the snow.

Amazing experience. We thoroughly enjoyed our day. My kids had an awesome time. Beautiful all day experience with the family. It is advisable to buy extra gloves and socks as it is absolutely ice cold inside ski dubai.One almost feels that you are in a completely different place and not actually in a mall. Ski dubai is picturesque.It is really busy in December so it is avisable to get in early as you have to queue for all the rides.
A bit small, but a good place to have some fun. You can do it all here, Ski, Skate, Play with Snow, sit on a Conveyor for a round of the "hill" or just watch. Good all round family fun

Shocking lack of safety from staff. We went to ski Dubai last week (snowpark tickets) and I was shocked at the lack of safety procedures by staff.The double tube ride that follows a path along the outside edge of the ski ramp is so badly surfaced I had to lift my body right out the tube to avoid a serious coccyx bone injury. The slide is very uneven in places and covered with protruding mats. Additionally, the entrance to this ride is very badly marked and the staff allowed us (women with a 3 yr old child) to walk across the busy ski path, unaided to reach the beginning. This was only after asking one staff member if we could go across and he didn't even bother to turn around and see what we were doing. We were allowed to enter the queue for the big tube slide that lauches a tube into the air and onto a huge inflatable mattress. With my child being only 3 yrs old this was a shock (of course we didn't continue). Areas were very unclearly marked, there are no directional signs and staff could not speak English. Additionally, it is very unclear who is allowed on what ride/where. Staff also allowed small children to enter on the request of their parents (even though they were clearly well below the age requirements). In general, a very unpleasant experience with too many people, clothing and shoes lying all over the entrance area, too little sleds, too little snow, pushing and shoving, long queues blocking certain areas and general confusion. It's expensive, chaotic and unsafe. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone with children.

The unexpected nature of Dubai. We don't ski but went in for the experience, which we enjoyed thoroughly! Marveling at the enormity of the task and human feat, seeing locals in the characteristic head scarf ski, enjoying the ride on the ski lift and savoring the hot chocolate at the cafe that overlooks the ski piste was a really worth the visit! The cafe with the huge fireplace outside is also worth a visit

Skiing when it's 110 degrees outside. The skiing was fun in Dubai. As a family from New England, we thought it would be fun to say we'd found skiing in the desert. The skiing was actually pretty good. There were lots of people there, but it wasn't crowded.

Dissapointed. Very expensive for the activities available. 2 slides and the ball is not enough. People who know how to ski will enjoy it better.Not recommended unless the price drop little bit. You have to pay more to watch the penguins! Bring a hat with you.

Can be more comfortable. It was very cold,not comfortable,after like 15/20 minutes not easy to stay inside.I feel like the way they were providing the suites they should also provide something to cover head and face.I know could easily be bought but when u don't provide the face an head cover then the first timer would not know it's essential.I an my family couldn't enjoy so much as not properly informed about it and I heard other people also having this problem.If properly dressed could enjoy more and only then it's worth the money otherwise toooo expensive.

Amazing Ski in the middle of the desert!. Another landmark activity in Dubai, situated in the Mall of the Emirates. Move from 45C to -4C in minutes and enjoy a great ski experience. if you don't want to do it you can just watch from the large Costa Coffee shop, which has a large panoramic view of the ski slope. Great fun and highly recommended!

Fun time for the whole family. This is a great experience if you are a beginner or have experience. Ski Dubai has much to offer beyond skiing also if that is not your thing. The only thing I would warn is that you need to check the site before going so you bring the things they don't offer in the way of clothing... it's extremely cold inside!

A snow covered mountain in 45 degrees (Celsius). A ski slope that is covered in snow all year and has penguins living there too. While it is 45 degrees outside. And you're in the middle of a desert. It can be a bit surreal, but it is definitely worth a visit.

Great fun. Today we had our first ever ski lesson anywhere. My two girls joined the 7 to 13 ish group and I was with the adults. We have lived in Dubai for over 5 years and have been into the snow park twice, so I decided that if I was giving again it would be to try out the skiing. It is advisable to get there at least half an hour before the lesson starts as getting boots and clothing etc can be time consuming and you will have to get skis aswell which may take a little while. Our instructor was funny and easy going and soon had us finding our feet - or rather skis! The cost was just over 500dhs and included a deposit for the ski pass cards- which are redeemable at 20dhs each at the automated machine. We looked at the photos the staff photographer took and bought two for 150dhs. The girls want to go again and so do I!

Interesting to see once, penguin visit is fun. While the idea of snow in the desert is conceptually cool, in reality Ski Dubai is overpriced and not particularly exciting if you are from a place where snow is readily available (we live in the U.S.). Since we were there with a 2 year old, we elected to do the penguin encounter (note you have to reserve a time in advance, so it is difficult to find an immediate open time if you just show up). The encounter itself was short (15 min), but it was fun to sit next to and even touch a real penguin. The whole place is like a Disney attraction, so you are extorted for money at every turn. We were charged 25 AED for a locker to store our shoes. No cameras were allowed inside the encounter, so we had to pay 150 AED just to get physical and digital versions of 2 photos of our daughter with the penguin. All of this is on top of the 150 AED per person for the experience itself. Since we were burning through cash on this part alone, we elected not to pursue the skiing. The park itself is small and probably not worth the money or time for adults without kids. Overall, this is an interesting place to see, but nothing special. The penguin encounter is different and you do get up close with a real penguin, so if you are willing to pay it's a fun, albeit short, diversion while avoiding the sweltering heat.

good skiing for being in Dubai/UAE great event for meetings. for us scandinavians normal average skiers its a so so its cool to say we skied in dubai but u don't get goose bumps thereice hard snow 3 5 plus celsiusgreat service ok equipment for rent skies and boots average qualityu get an overall as well buy own socksboots can be wet as they are quick in turn aroundlifts feel safe 2 stations top and halfway cheap cost in my eyesgreat afterski areaits max up down 10 times great fr snowboard lessonsgreat for groups

Bring gloves and hat. I bought a 2 hour pass to ski, which ended up being more than enough time. The one or two runs are very short, but the novelty is fun. I only brought some knit gloves and my hands were really cold, so I would highly recommend bringing better gloves and a hat. There are some other activities here for the kids, and I saw several families just riding up the lift together (not skiing) for a fun little trip in the cold. I enjoyed my morning here very much and would recommend it as one of the fun and random things to do in Dubai. There is a lovely hot chocolate cafe on the hill, but I forgot to bring cash in, so I didn't get to partake - they serve a bit of food as well.

Ice in the milddle of the desert!. Well, that is a great place to visit! The temperature was -3ºC and there was snow all around! I had a lot of fun. I don't know how to sky, so I decided just to take a look around but it was nice! I recommend, specially if you are form a country were there is no snow!

Average experience - not that much to do for little children. A decent day out - but mainly for skiers. Other childrens activities can get very busy. Its OK. I wouldnt write home about it considering the cost (AED 220). Photos are way way too expensive....so take your own camera...its a must.

Loved it. Firstly I'll start by saying it was a bit surreal snowboarding on real snow in the middle of the dessert in 41'C. I have never done any form of snow activities but it was great to be able to swap the sun sand sea and heat for some snow. It added a lovely touch to a already great holiday. You are given all your gear included in your lesson price and after a hours lesson you are ready to try some more tricky manoeuvres. There really is everything here for a great family day out. A must try for sure.

Great ski school. I decided to give ski another try, after a failed attempt in a ski resort few years ago. I thought I am unable to ski, but the instructors in this school proved me wrong. I had different instructor for each lesson, which was good, as they had different tricks or stiles to teach students. They all speak good English and have good teaching skills, so I am very pleased with the services and with my progress. First classes tend to be busier, as more students attend discovery or beginner lessons, then they afterwards attend the intermediate lessons. And while there were 10 of us at first, I ended up having the intermediate lessons with 2-3 more people at max (that could partially be explained due to Ramadan, as the slopes were overall quiet). Cloths and ski gear are provided, you only need to bring gloves and hat. And you do need them, as it feels really cold once in the snow for an hour! The jacket has no pockets, so be prepared to leave everything in the lockers (that are available for 20 dhs). As an indoor facility, it creates the perfect ski environment without feeling too small. An experienced skier might think otherwise, but for lessons and for practice afterwards it is very good. I can only compare it with the Xanadoo slope in Madrid (the only indoor slope that I have seen before), and Ski Dubai is better.Before planning to go for lessons or just on your own for the exercise, it would be advisable to check the penguins show schedule, as it gets excessively crowded with families and teenagers who come in hundreds to see the penguins. Once I have learned my lesson, I planned to get there immediately after the shows started, and the queues for ticket and ski gear counters were a lot shorter.

If you ski...MUST VISIT. It is great experiance to enter from over 30 degrees centigrades in short pants, hire equipment and next moment You are skiing!!! As it is part of big shoping center, non skiers have a lot to see, visit, buy, eat, while skiers are skiing. Biggest slope is not demanding, but if you are experienced skiier, ask for better and sharper ski, as their avarage ski is not sharp enough.

An amazing experience. We visited this place with not a great deal of expectation as what could an indoor simulated snow world offer? A lot. As we eventually found out. Just the very fact that an indoor ski area complete with ski slopes of different difficulty levels, to cater to the beginners as well as experienced skiers, with its own cable car which ferries skiers ( and non skiers) up the slopes is awe inspiring. Add to that professional instructors who teach kids as well as adults the nuances of skiing or snowboarding, Penguins who strut around for 15 min shows, enough rides to keep kids and adults interested and ice carvings of dragons, horses and monuments(the Taj was on display when we were there), all in all guarantee everyone a great outing indeed. They provide you everything including socks, gloves, thermal wear and shoes with lockers to house your stuff. So just go as you are(no specific clothing required) and have yourself a taste of winter wonderland in the heat of the Dubai summer or pretty much anytime.

Skiing in the desert!. We had to try this out while we were in Dubai. It was great! You rent the ski clothes and get to keep your gloves. Our daughters 8 & 10 loved this place. We went up and down the slope for almost 2 hours. The slopes were fine with the snow too. Lots of snowboarders there too so you have to be on the look out for them. Seize the moment and give it a try! How many can say they were swimming in the ocean then skiing indoors in one day??
Very NIce place to visit. I would recomend tourist to visit this place, wonderful chiling atmosphere with lot of fun with friends and families
Amazing. The ability to ski/snowboard without the travel times! As usual, Dubai have done it again with their craziness and have yet again succeeded in a great venture.

Interesting experience. My wife and I were in the mall with an hour to kill, and we decided VERY last minute to do a quick run down the slope. Our friends had gone previously and convinced us we would have enough time, and they were right. The process of getting the tickets and getting suited up was very efficient. We were on the chairlift within 20 minutes. The lift is painfully slow, but the run itself was pretty decent. I would consider it an easy/intermediate for those who ski often. The snow condition was very good and the temperature was comfortable. I'm glad we did it, and it was certainly a good way to break up the hot dessert climate.

Snowboarding and Skiing in the Desert. It was our first time to snowboard and we really had fun here. We were the only beginners during our scheduled lesson so we were lucky to have a private instructor (who was Filipino too) :)Tip: Bring your own ski hat/gloves or buy the cheap ski dubai gloves in the ski shop.

Great experience amid the scorching desert heat. When we went to Dubai, it was the start of the Summer in Dubai, and we could already feel the pinch every time we stepped out to any non air conditioned area. Ski Dubai was a complete surprise package amid the sweltering heat that we were experiencing. They maintain a temperature of 2 to 3 degrees Celsius.. and outside its like 48 degrees. Its amazing. The ticket pinch a bit when you are buying them... but once you are inside you do understand why it is so. The kids had a real good time as it was a first for most of them. they took almost all the rides possible. But I have to say, you need to be really brave to be inside the place for more then 3 Hours. The Ski Dubai also has a great view from the cheese cake factory and other restaurants in the Mall of the Emirates. Over all a great experience for people who don't get to enjoy snow on a regular basis.

Penguin Encounter. Amazing place. In the middle of the heat of Dubai there is this magic place called Ski Dubai. Girlfriend and I were keen to do the fun park but it was full of kids running around so we went for the Penguin Encounter which was at a good price. We had to book a session time then get our snow weather clothes on from the locker area. We enter the freezing cold snow and sat down with a trainer and watch couple penguin play around while she told us about them. Then the King Penguin come out which we were allowed to hug and kiss.Its a must do in Dubai
Good fun!. Ski Dubai is as good as it gets for an indoor snow arena. It's runs are long enough to enjoy. Get there early to beat the crowds.

Wonderful ski in the desert. Temperature inside is -4°C. We did all kind of activities and liked all. But it's good to spend time only skiing because the rest of attractions is not enough attractive for adults. Snow looks like real, that's amazing. You can see penguins in park there. Better to bring your winter scarves, sweaters and hats. ❄

Great Time!. My buddy and I just randomly decided to go snowboarding after work one day. One of the best days ever!I would consider myself a tough guy but I was scared to death on that slope. It took me an hour just to work up the courage to go down the beginner slope. I wouldn't even try the top. NO THANKS!Loved it.

Only in Dubai ! (Well Almost). In a recent trip to Dubai with my wife we pre-booked via email a Penguin experience which seemed quite odd to be leaving the searing heat of the summer to the freezing temperatures inside. Ski Dubai is located at one end of the Emirates mail so is quite easy to travel to by the Metro and find upon arrival at the second largest but still huge shopping mail. Upon arrival you are giventhe required snow suits and gloves etc. before using the lockers to store any personal items that are not required. At the allotted time one of the handlers took us through to a small briefing roomwhere we were shown a short but humorous film about penguins before being told some interesting facts as well as some do’s and do not’s about the experience. We were then escorted througha couple of door’s and gates to meet Sneezy and Pebble’s who are both Gentoo Penguin’s. The handler chatted to us briefly before aided by his bucket of fish got both of them to walk onto therocks so we could all have our photo’s taken with them by the official photographer who had now joined us. At one end of this area was a large pool with a large amount of penguins swimmingaround in. We then went onto to meet the largest penguin of them all who’s name escapes me but was a King Penguin.
