The format was similar only this time as he was not so nervous you wereable to touch/pet or even kiss if you wanted to. After returning back to get changed you are then given the opportunity to purchase the pictures that were taken in various price bands.Like most things in Dubai this was not cheap and it would have been better if it was possible to take our own photo’s but if you are looking for something different to do we would recommend you try this experience.

Great fun, escape the heat!. We only had an hour so just did the snow park rather than skiing but tubing and the bobsled were fantastic! The staff were really friendly and fun. Although it was 45 degrees outside, it was not busy so we didn't have to queue for any of the rides. My children thought the penguin show was very entertaining. This is a good option to keep the kids entertained during the hot summer.

Ski Dubai. For me it was nice experience. Close the desert you can go and ski inside, just pay ticket and you get everything what you need (clothes, shoes, skies). For me lift was too slow, but i think it is so slow, b´cause most of visitor are beginners. Slope isn´t so deep, so don´t worry if you are beginner, and of course you can hire teacher who helps you to get basics.

Good fun to stay out of the heat. Had a 2 day stopover in Dubai and wanted to escape the summer heat, so went for this. Being Australian, my son has never experienced this kind of "weather" and loved it! Italy here we come . We had a fun time in the snow park and he kept going and going, never seeming to tire of the short rides. Although we didnt ski, it looks good for a couple of hours. Whole atmosphere of the place was super - they have really created a wonderful experience. We added on the Penguin experience, which was sensational - got to hug and feed them and it all was well controlled by the ranger. Only disappointment was that we were restricted to just 1 go on the Bullet, yet there was really nobody on it most of the day. I can understand at peak times it could get very busy and they should restrict, but in off peak times when there is hardly anyone around, why deny people?Overall though a decent day out.

Great fun inside a mall - Only in Dubai!!. My 15 year old daughter had never seen snow. So we paid to go in.What great fun we had! My daughter threw snowballs at me and thought that was the best thing!We stayed for about 2 hours before the cold got to us (especially going up the lift!)Well worth a visit. It's really weird to go into somewhere so cold in a place like Dubai that is so hot!
indoor skiing at its best. ski dubai is an indoor skiing area. You can ski or snow board or there is a snow park where you can play. Ski Dubai is for all ages.

Great fun. My children love it so much! Only cost around $400 HK dollar per person! It's include all the clothing and tools you need, an hour lesson and unlimited time in the snow park!! But my wife complained its so tiring!

Great and cheap. Ski dubai is located in the mall of emirates. It has something for everyone of every skill level. Ski school for beginners and then the main slope. The main slope is about 350metres long which is amazing for a indoor ski slope. The snow is great quality. The price is 200dhs for a 2 hour pass or 300dhs for a full day pass. That includes all ski gear. Its a good fun day out and a good way to stay cool in dubai.

Definitely worth a visit!. Ski Dubai was amazing and extreme! We have both been skiing before but were a little rusty when going to Ski Dubai. An instructor was very nice and helped us. I am pretty sure that there are skiing lessons and whatnot for anyone who isn't experienced. Be prepared for the cold! When you're outside in the overwhelming heat of Dubai you do not expect it to be that cold! I'd suggest bringing hats and gloves with you. You can buy them there also but the skiing for the day is quite expensive so to save the hassle of paying more for something you may only use once be prepared. All ski wear is provided but again I'd suggest dressing somewhat warm underneath the provided clothes! Ski Dubai is somewhere you can not skip on your visit to Dubai. Go and experience a surreal experience. You will literally be snowing inside a shopping mall, a shopping mall which is in the middle of the desert!

Maby good for those who havent been skiing before, a litle boring for experts.. Fun to have been there and tried it. Only vent 4 rounds, then it became boring. The black route was closed, realy would like to try it!
ice. Imagine a desert where minimum temperature at day is 40 degree Celsius and a place is full of snows !!!

A Never Before Experience. An artificial ski park inside a shopping mall where you would find original snow/ice. The temperature is less than zero degree Celsius inside this park. Can enjoy skiing, cable car ride and donot forget to get your good photographs clicked here as the moment would not come back again.

Whao! Freezing cold in the middle east!!!. One of the wonders of Dubai, freezing cold and shivering in the middle east. Lol. Just a note of warning, do not under-estimate the freezing effect in the ski Dubai - go prepared for winder in the desert!

When in Dubai, Ski Dubai. You have to see to believe it !In the middle of the desert, one can snow ski !I think they should also provide a tour of the cooling system. It must be mind blowing, to see how efficient this huge "freezer" is ?!?! If you are a good skier, you should ski just to be able to say ... that you did Ski Dubai. If not there are big windows from the mall that one can see them skiing or sledging.
fun fun fun!!!!. awsome fun...must godifferent from other places....fun time with familymust visit and its for all the age groups :)

Worth doing but an hour is enough.. The fact that I love to ski meant that I could not give up on the chance to ski in Dubai and chalk it off the list. A two hour pass is €40 which includes ski, boots and pants and a jacket.The runs are green and maybe blue at best, when I was there it was quiet so I was able to give it a good go, the piste are wide and the snow is not that bad. The staff inside are the most unfriendly group I have ever come across, I tried to smile say hello but was greeted with blank stares and just ignored these were not happy people. Some poor soul who was learning was been shouted at by an instructor when I was leaving. After an hour I was bored and had had enough, worth doing probably just dont go expecting the Alps. Would be good for a beginner who wanted to develop their technique.

Something Different. On a stopover to the UK we had 24 hours in Dubai. We did the stock standard city tour and finished up at the Dubai Mall.We decided to take the kids into Ski Dubai - how often can you go to the snow in the desert?All equipment - overalls, gloves and boots is inclusive of price.Our kids tobogganed, bob sled, rolled in the giant zorb ball and we all rode the chairlift up to the top of the slope.We only lasted a few hours (-3 C) but it set the tone of fun for our big overseas holiday.

Snow in Dubai...? Believe it!. Yes, you read it right. The folks at the mall of the Emirates in Dubai have managed to create a ski resort inside a mall. That's snow in a desert folks. Admirable effort and if you're feeling too hot, its a place to really cool down. They have both beginner and advanced slopes, so it's pretty entertaining. It's a bit expensive to go skiing there. Equipment is available for rent and they provide lockers for storage as well. You tend to forget about the desert when you step inside Ski Dubai. It's a wonderful place to visit the next time you make a stop in Dubai.

What fun. A great experience, snow in the middle of a shopping mall can only be Dubai. Had a great time with my daughter and son-in-law skiing. Everyone should try this even if they have never skied before.

OMG. A ski park in the desert.Well you just have to go there.The entrance fee did include warm clothing.new socks & gloves.Although it was still extremely cold.Our teenage boys just loved it.We had hot chocolate coffee & snacks at the coffee shop half way up the slopes.It was quiet exspesive but it it was nice to get out of the cold.The change rooms were fantastic and very clean.We hired a locker for our belongings.We had a ball.Its one of those places that you just have to go to.

Skiing in Desert. I visited Dubai in May 2014. I was wondering whether its right decision or I made a blunder. But visiting ski Dubai was awesome. We had seen such an experience for real for the first time. Its a great creation and indeed worth it.

Snow. I visited this place with my kids. It is average place to visit. Not too much excitement for adults. Penguin encounters are there for kids. You can take pics and touch them. Entrance ticket included the dress for inside temperature (which is below zero degree). Those who know skiing can go and enjoy there a lot. As it is too cold inside so bring your cap with you so you can keep your head normal.

"Snow" in the Desert. If nothing else, you must go to see the sheer amount of money spent to construct this 2 slope ski run inside a climactically controlled building. The price of admission gets you a "Ski jacket and pants" along with boots and skis rental. Hint - bring a hat and your own gloves or you will freeze! Another, the clothes are very well worn so if you're a germaphone, beware! The inside of the building is fabricated to resemble a ski lodge with a single lift taking you to the top of an L shaped slope that gives you the option of 2 slopes to ski down. The "snow" is fairly icy and requires some pushing, but the overall experience is worth it just to witness the locals in Arab garb wrapped in head to toe down ski blankets riding the lift round and round. All in all, how can you visit Dubai and not say you've been here.
first time they have seen the snow. First time for my kids they have seen the snow.We spent 4 hours inside. It was just great.Many different games for different ages and no need to know to ski.

Cold but worth it!!. My first day in Dubai and the sun was shining (aprox 25degrees) and we decide to go skiing!! What a surprise!! We had such fun doing tobogganing and rubber rings and just in general "playing in the snow"!

Fun for kids. It's really a great relief from the desert heat although it's difficult to be there in the snow for more than an hour . Kids enjoyed the rides , it's really an achievement to manage snow in midst of a desert which enchants the kids . One should carry gloves & cap as they would cost you an extra 20 Dirhams each . Some rides are chargeable despite the high entry fee they charge . Overall it was good fun .

Everything fantastic!. Nice experience to do again.. One week is not enough, books say one is enough to see the most important attractions but to see the real Dubai and around, you need almost two weeks. I took a tour but you need some time on your own to really enjoy it!

Fun but perhaps overrated. Biggest achievement of ski dubai lies in it existing in the middle of the desert. Slope looks great for skiers, but otherwise - rides are very few. Given the high entry charge - they should have had some more attractions. Another limitations is that the layer of snow is very thin, you cant really play with snow the way you would if were real, unless of course you go to the skiers terrain. However, it is managed well - costumes are clean, boots are good and staff helpful. One should remember two things here: 1. carry your own woolen cap to survive the cold for longer duration, as that is not available at snowpark and 2. Your day pass allows multiple entry, so enjoy for a while then get out to the mall for food and warmth, and come back again.

Great fun in the heat of the day!. The slope is very simple and perhaps too boring for extended periods of time for experienced skiers (like my boyfriend), but it was perfect for beginners and a great way to escape the heat of Dubai in summer. I had literally just burned my feet (blisters!) on the beach, so cooling down was exactly what we needed. They provide your jacket, pants, boots, socks, skis, poles and 2 hours of skiing in the 200 dirham ($50 USD) fee. You have to purchase your own gloves and hats if you want them. The temp inside is pretty darn cold, so I'd recommend getting the gloves and hats. The quality of the snow is pretty amazing, because they don't chip ice...they use a system which allows them to seed snow clouds indoors. Yes, they make it snow.People who don't ski can play in the snow and do inner tubing down certain sections. They also offer zipline rides from the halfway point on the slope to the bottom. It was such a unique, fun thing to do, and certainly a welcome respite from June's soaring temperatures outside.

This is a wonder in the desert. Ski Dubai is good to see especially with tempratures touching 45C and higher in the city. Step outside the mall and its a furnace. Its a good experience for people who have not experienced snow.

Amazing experience especially for a family with kids. We had so much fun, a family of four with a 6 year old girl..we all enjoyed especially we have never gone skiing before..it was Xmas time so there was a photo op with Santa in the snow and a penguin show..if you have time in Dubai, a couple of hours in ski Dubai are worth your time

Nice way to spend a few hours. Kids love it, adults do too until they end up too cold. Good way to spend a few hours, the rides are good fun.One tip, take your own pair of thicker socks and buy a nice pair of warm gloves from the shop. The ones they provide work for 30 odd minutes but then your fingers and toes start feeling they are about to fall off.

Terrifying cold but worthwhile visit. We decided to tryout this fantastic place, it's extremely cold , makes you forget you are in the middle of the desert. Rides are good and interesting. They have it so cold that you will not stay for more than 20 minutes, or you be left shivering while queuing for the rides. One visit is enough , will not return .

amazing - in the middle of the desert. was hard to wrap your head around this as you are freezing cold and steps away it is hotter thank hades outside but it is refreshing though you have to see it to say you've been pretty crowded with kids
Ski Dubai with kids. It's very good we did penguin encounter and loved it know one else there so kids had a great time lovely staff

Best attraction in Dubai. Totally different experience. We enjoy so much. All equipment provide except u had to pay for gloves. Do bring ur own hat. Helmet is only for kid. Do shake the penguin inside.noted for time of attraction

Superb experience - a different experience all together.. The ski Dubai is a real wonder of human engineering. You don't realize the scale and size of what has been built till you get there. We were with 3 year old and had a great time. Some tips - keep at least 4 hours to enjoy it fully. Some rides have queues but not too long. Would recommend the super pass or higher for full experience . overall a must do in Dubai.

A little over rated. 2 real runs here, they say one is a "double diamond", it's more like a mediocre blue. Still pretty cool place and worth checking out, I just had seen a lot of great reviews and expected a bit more.

Overpriced but worth once in a lifetime.. The infrastructure is fascinating and the whole snowpark has a nice vibe to it. But there isn't much to do, once you're done gazing all around you end up on rides which have an year long waiting and the skiing is limited to only the professionals. Its fun only if you're a professional ski enthusiast. Although the best thing around there is the Penguin Encounter. That is a really interesting experience. You get to touch and meet the penguins from an inch. Rest, stick to the above para.

Thrilling Experience!. My 10yr & 8yr old kids did the Ifly. They had a blast, the instructors were very nice & they took the children high up into the tunnel. It was my kids first experience & they were very comfortable & would certainly wanna do it again .

Blasting Cold temperature! Brrr!. Mainly the rides suits for kids. More to family-oriented kind of place. However if you are a skilled in skiing, a place to ski too. Fret not, those who are unable to ski, they have a package that includes learning to ski with an instructor.

Good concept however..... 3 of us went to Ski Dubai on Saturday, 29th June. For two of us - first time. Ticking counter procedure went well. Very helpful staff. Winter shoes they are providing are very wet and stuffed with dirty socks. They don't try it after the previous users. My question: how do they maintain hygen?(if they have it)Take your own winter socks, gloves and hat and your winter jackets. It will help to fight the cold. Visitors there was very rude to each other's and especially to staff. No mercy, no sorry for anyone around. Everyone first and ahead of the rest in queues. Coffee shop on the way to the top is really cool. Nice and cozy design, not bad food. But most amazing staff and service. Had perfect service from Jagat. Colleagues on the ZipLine also really helpful and full of enthusiasm. Especially the African guy from South Africa (Tsitsikama area). Just because of these guys and their service we will come back again and again. Had some fun, got freezes in wet shoesOne more thing: for those of you who come from the countries where snows at least once a year - Ski Dubai might be boring and snow unreal.

Snow Park was fun but not amazing. I cant ski very well so I just went to the Snow park. There is a fun toboggan ride, a ball you get inside and roll down a small hill, a windy slide on a rubber ring. There is a Zip Line but at 150 AED, is very expensive. It is quite short and I've done Two hour Ziplining in a forest for less than 150 AED. The ski slopes are longer than you would think and it looks quite good for skiing. Great experience to go once but I won't be rushing back.

Great experience. I think you have to do this once while in Dubai, as the experience itself is well worth it. 42 degrees outside -4 inside!... They provide clothing and gloves. We used all slides and watched the penguins. I would say 2 hours is plenty of time to do everything... It is nice to get out and go back in the warm lol! It was an average price but the photos were extortionate!....We did buy some as you are not going to experience it again. I would recommend it to others, especially those with children but personally if i were to go Dubai again i would give it a miss. Glad i done it though :)

Very Educating. We visited the Penguin Experience within Ski Dubai. They supply all your protective clothing and boots. Minus 5 cent in there.The Experience last 30 minutes. We could have been in there all day and wouldn't have cared about the cold. It was so interesting and great to be so close to the penguins. This is not a cheap gimmick to earn money. The work they do here is of great importance to understanding about these lovely creatures. Keep up the good work. Love to Speedy and Wally

Show park is fantastic. we enjoyed lot.. so nice during this summer. we seen pengiune..good experience.. you ticket is for multi entry.. so when you feel cold, u may come out for warm and you enter snow park again.

I skiied! For the first time ever!. I have never been able to stump up the cash for a ski holiday and the thought I may not like it and be stuck with 6 more days of skiing after the initial trial concerned me so I thought this was perfect to test it outI loved it! Such fun and such lovely staff!Really friendly atmosphere, pleasant temperature (not biting cold) and very pretty and impressive snow sceneMy 2 tiny niggles- lockers are not included. I didnt realise gloves werent included from the website so took none. I was told to buy then from the shop for around £10 (good ski ones in fairness) but then got to my lesson to find everyone who didnt have gloves were leant fleece ones by ski dubai!

Snow Park surprise!. Last October 3rd, I availed a very special offer of free entry to Snow Park for anyone whose birthday falls on the promo period. It was a dream-come-true moment for my 2 kids as we'd been planning to go & this offer came along with thrills galore for my birthday boy. Entering through a cave was enough to capture our imagination. We had a photo taken with the amazing ice dragon for our souvenir package. The tobogganing & tubing were awesome! Kids simply love going up & down. The Penguin Parade is not to be missed. Pumpkin was super friendly & came really close to us. A free Zorf Ball ride was the icing on the cake (would've been the chairlift actually but my little girl wasn't ready to get on it). Of course we had a snow fight & I pulled them on the sled. They also pulled themselves up a hill. That 1st time we tropical people lasted a little over an hour. Just last May we took our friend there to celebrate his 9th birthday & we lasted almost 2 hours! A good sweater & gloves help. Don't forget your camera & wallet in case you want to to add-on activities as you go along. On both occasions we ended it with a scrummy late lunch at St. Moritz Cafe. Thank you, Ski Dubai for making an 8 year old boy's birthday surprise so spectacular! We'll definite bring our visitors who'd never experienced real snow there.

I wouldn't have beleived it, if I haven't seen it :-). I haven't actually skied, but too be able to feel the snow in the middle of the desert is something you cannot describe. You have to experience it!

FROZEN in the middle of the desert. It s a fun day for all the family especially those coming from a warm countries and miss the snow, you are chilled with ski sports activities , they provide you with special clothes , shoes and socks. Kids love it.

Had to pinch ourselves we were snow skiing in the desert!. My 10 year old twins, a friend and I had to experience snow skiing in the desert and we weren't disappointed. It was mind blowing that this existed at all, and we were pleasantly surprised that there were 2 runs to choose from and the snow actually wasn't too bad! There were only a total of 8 people on the slopes when we were there, so no crowds to deal with. There was also a chairlift and a poma lift, and a cute little coffee shop with yummy hot chocolate and the usual hot and cold food selections.There were also penguins etc, but we just chose the skiing option.I have to say it really was a lot of fun and something you wouldn't get to do every day! The hire gear was fine and it is pretty crazy to be skiing inside a shopping centre. Definitely something to try if you're over there.

Fun break from the heat!. This was so nice to go snowboard during all the heat of summer. It is very nice for an Indoor Slope. The slope is good if you are a beginner or if you don't mind repetition. Get the two hour pass since there aren't more than two different trails.
It is a great place to spend the afternoon.

Worth a visit! . Ski Dubai was awesome. We had so much fun. It felt a bit weird going from 40 degrees heat to -4 degrees, but it was great. We bought the super pass - this involved giant ball/zorbing, tube slide, chair lift ride and tobogganing. We opt against sking as we wasn't experience, but it was a good way to enjoy the snow experience in Dubai. There is also penguins to see there and you can also do snowboarding and zip wiring. The jackets, trousers, gloves and snow boots are provided.The price was reasonable and you only need couple of hours there at the most with the super pass, but it is well worth visiting if you are in Dubai.
Skiing in Dubai? Fun, wow.. Want something novel to do? Come ski in the middle of the desert! We had so much fun and the price was moderate and affordable. Glad we tried it!

Brilliant place to escape the heat ;). Each time I visit Dubai I can never resist a visit a here. This place is really one for families, but is suited to all types of visitors. The staff are friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. No issues in terms of service.The ski slope is good fun but after an hour or so can get a bit repetitive and other activities been quite expensive such as the apres bar. The prices for the skiing are in line with prices charged in the UK at real snow centres and couldn't really complain at the price.The penguin encounter was the best part of my visit, however the actual time we got to spend with the penguins wasn't really a lot. The proffessional photos were great I had done, having been told before hand that we couldn't take iPhones in, I did think it was very unfair that other locals could take theirs and were free to take pictures on there own devices without having to pay nearly £20 for one photo! Been my only criticism.Now I've done all activities in ski dubai I don't think I'll bother again. Once you've seen it, you've seen it. The pictures make the best memories and abit unfair now I wasn't aloud to take my Iphone.

Great Experience. Worth the price..Must go place for kids. I visited SkiDubai along with my cousins. They enjoyed it to the max. I would not suggest this place for a people over 40 years of age. But otherwise an must go place for kids. Its amazing to how much kids enjoy this. Penguins in this place is a feather on their cap.You should expect the place to be extremely cold.. so please take proper clothing. They provide you overcoats, but I would suggest you to be take additional personal clothing. They serve hot coffee and chocolate beverages which is very good when you are in the coldest possible place.Plan atleast 3 hours time for visiting this place. Call them up to find out the timing of the penguin show.. plan your visit accordingly.
Refreshing..Great Value. Ski Dubai is one of the best things to do in Dubai.Unique,refreshing and amazing experience.A must go for all the travellers.

Wonderdul Experience. We visited the place in the scorching summer , and was totally blown away..the only down was that the arrificial snow cannot be made into a ball . It was the cherry on top of our dubai experience. .will visit again for sure

Interesting to see but an hour of skiing is enough. It's great to name Dubai as one of the places you've skied just to say you've done it. It was interesting to see because of all the different cultures and people there (the slopes were empty but the chair lifts were full because most arabs do not know how to ski and they go to watch us from the lift) It was definitely COLD, but it was a freezer type cold not a natural cold. The slope was not big but it was enjoyable for what it was. An hour or two is definitely enough. I would not purchase an all day pass just to ski or snowboard. They also give you everything you need aside from gloves and hats.

Dubai, Cold and Snowy. My skiing skills really came back to me when practising with the skis at this excellent experience, in Dubai of all places. Mall of the Emirates is a recommended shopping venue, but even better with this rather unusual attraction in a place with such a hot climate. You are provided with skis, snowsuit, socks, gloves and snow boots when you buy your tickets at reception and refreshments are also available here. Use your ski pass to gain access to the chair lift, where you can alight at the smaller slope and enjoy a coffee, or those who are experienced enough can continue to the highest point and ski to the bottom. Children can participate in the snow school, zip wire and sorbing are amongst other activities besides skiing. You can also visit penguin breeds in the penguin centre, situated below Ski Dubai. Make sure you also have time to explore the shopportunity inside Mall of the Emirates. Buy souvenir photos of your experience on your way out! I live in Sheffield, United Kingdom where the local ski resort has closed as a result of recent arson attacks on the site. So the people of Sheffield are hoping for it to be rebuilt and hopefully reopen to the same high standards of Ski Dubai.

Great experience . I enjoyed being there as for my children they love it so much they don't want to leaveas for the price it might be fair but in my opinion if it's a little bit less it will be awesome

Fun. Personally I didn't ski, but still wanted to see what it's all about. My entry included pants, shoes, jacket and gloves for around $90 aud. I was able to use the ski lift and had unlimited use of the ski tube things. Overall it was fun but not somewhere I'd spend all day.
Crazy Experience. Feel the cold snow in hot Dubai plus skiing like in the mountains is really original! Definitely great to try it..

really cool. This was really cool! just like being @ a ski resort. :)Definitely worth the visit! And if you don't want to ski or snowboard…you just want to get inside & ride the ski lift, you can buy a cheap ticket @ the counter INSIDE the locker area just for the ski lift! They will even provide the warm gear & boots!This was a great (secret?) option for us to get the full experience without spending too much time or money! :)

Hot'N'Cold. We were on a short break to Dubai and crammed a lot in to three days. Ski Dubai was magnificent, and the kids loved it. The activities available were great and gave the little ones the taste for a real snow adventure, a truly wonderful experience.

Ski in the dessert!!. Go from the very hot outside to the freezing cold inside!!A great way to spend a few hours, and lots to do for the kids. My 2, aged 12 and 15, had never been on skis before and had their first ever ski lesson here, they absolutely loved it. They both managed to ski down (and stay upright) a small slope at the end of their lesson.The chair lift is a great way to see just how big it is inside, and the kids had a great time in the big balls and inner tubes. A really fun afternoon.Would advise taking a warm hat and good gloves and thick socks if you are going to be there for a while, as our feet were absolutely frozen when we left.Very enjoyable and kids keen to go again for another ski lesson!!

Fair price and good fun. Either you already know how to ski/snowboard or you buy a class, which is around 30 usd and is really fun! If you've never skied (like I hadn't) it is one of the best things to do in Dubai.The equipment is included, but you have to buy gloves separately (around 3 usd only).

Great Family Fun. What a cool way to spend a couple of hours!OK, so it's a really small run & not very steep, but it's great fun to get your 'ski legs' back, if you haven't been on the proper slopes for awhile, or need a top-up when you're really missing the real thing.Would recommend going as early as possible (Mall of the Emirates) & avoid weekends/school holidays etc. - so that you avoid the crowds. Also suggest using 'Entertainer' vouchers, to buy 1/get one free for 2hr session. Unfortunately, when we went the chairlift wasn't working & we needed to take the T-bar on the left-hand side, which is a bit challenging for novices.To get a good feel for the run, check out 'Ski Dubai BrettP' on YouTube, from our visit in April 2014.

Great Value and not too busy.. Very good value with 20% discount for using a mastercard. The snow quality was good with no icy patches. The button lift was fairly quick but the chairlift painfully slow. No queues for lifts and slopes uncrowded. Price includes two hours ski-ing but my legs had gone after 90 minutes. Slope is 400m long and wide so you get a good run
Great Fun. We enjoyed a one hour ski lesson which was just long enough for a bit of fun without becoming tiresome for kids aged 6 and 7. Will follow up with another next time in Dubai. RECOMMEND!

A little chilling. It takes a great amount of hard work and effort to build something like this. I went there with some of my relatives and was a bit skeptical intially but thoroughly enjoyed the experience. I felt it was a bit overpriced but definetely a yes.
Freezing in Dubai, who would have thought?!. Went here today, had a blast. Worth checking out. 2 hours was plenty for us as only 2runs to go on. But amazing and what a great idea

For Skiers: Great Fun for 2 Hours. I would classify myself as an intermediate skier who goes 3-5 times per season. So my initial reaction was the experience was expensive for a touristic experience. It was roughly $100+ USD once you add in the cost of gloves and hat (which will definitely need).But I decided to shut off the logical part of my brain and decided to say what the heck and try it out for a couple of hours.  It was well worth it. It was good fun and an anachronistic ski experience. It seems so out of place in the midst of Dubai but they replicate the ski experience quite nicely. Also, it draws an eclectic group of people which makes for a load of interesting observations and conversations to be had (e.g. an airline steward who flew to Dubai for 1 day to meet with friends to snowboard) The skiing wasn’t anything amazing. But what was amazing was the system of organization and the fluidity that they built around their entire indoor skiing world. From an assembly line approach to distributing ski clothes and fitting of boots to the scanner that tracks to the minute how much time you had left on your 2 hour ski adventure.  The slopes were short and there were only 2 options -- It took me a grand total of about 90 seconds to get down the "Black" slope. But over 2 hours, I had nearly 10 - 15 runs and reminded that I'm actually looking forward to skiing in the East Coast of the US again in half a year.My verdict: Well worth the time and money. And certainly is a great photo opportunity to text/email to friends as well.

Wow. We had a great evening meeting the penguins! It's so cold and wintery it feels like Christmas!!! We spent 20 mins meeting 2 penguins we fed,hugged and kissed them! My 4 year old loved it as did we! The only thing for me was the prices of the photos very expensive !

That was cooool!. Wow, way better than expected. For an indoor ski resort it was really well done. Snow was compacted but groomed well for a nice run down. Board park was cool too. Had lunch half way down in the Avalanche Cafe...was surreal. Was 40+ degrees outside so a nice escape from the heat.

Skiing in a desert.... a definite yes!!. A must do in Dubai, even if you don't ski. It is a fun place for the entire family or if visiting with friend, playing in snow is definitely fun. Especially good for quick get away during the blazing summer months. I am yet to experience live snow fall, this was a close second.

Snowfilled surreal experience. Covered in thermal clothing, sitting in a ski lodge halfway up a ski slope sipping delicious hot chocolate in Dubai, where the outside temperature is in the high 30's C is a surreal experience. It is so professionally managed that it is easy to find your way around the activities. There are even 'live' penguins to keep the little ones happy. This is an amazing place but, did I mention the fact that it is just a part of the massive Mall of the Emirates so you can cool off after some 'hot shopping' ? Go see for yourselves - it is amazing.
Nice Escape f/ the Hot Desert!. Don't be intimidated if you are not a good skiier/snowboarder! Most people are going to do the activities, so it leaves the slope empty and peaceful!

Surreal experience. It was definitely weird to be wearing winter coat in Dubai! I didn't try the skiing, but I was with my children here to experience the snow. I was pleasantly surprised that the snow is actually quite powdery, not hard. We played snow balls, toboggan, rolled on the tires, etc. It was fun and very cold at the same time. My young son was visibly cold by the time we finished our first hour. Make sure to bring good gloves as otherwise you would have to pay, since oddly enough, they don't provide gloves and hats here.

Just crazy. 38 outside, -4 inside.. We walked in to the payment area in shorts and t-shirts and 10 minutes later were in snow boots, thermal jacket, trousers and a complimentary pair of Ski Dubai gloves to keep. We opted for a day pass that allows you to basically do everything except ski. (We aren't skiers and just wanted the experience).Entering through ice caves that house real penguins... you enter a winter wonderland that blows your mind in the desert.As part of the entrance pass we purchased, we rode the ski lift to see the slopes and the views from the top, tobogganed, slid on inflatable rings and even went Zorbing (rolled around in a big inflatable ball) on a short slope. There is a little hot chocolate cafe inside, plenty of options to have your photo taken and be charged stupid amounts for souvenir pics and things for young and old to keep the whole family busy. Keep your eye open as the kids do like to throw the odd snow ball or two at unsuspecting adults.Take your own camera or smart phone for some memorable pics and just go with the flow of snow in the desert. Something different and a bit of fun.

Great skiing. I can now add Dubai to my ski C.V.!I had 3 night stopover in Dubai and decided I wanted to go skiing.It was fun un crowded and the snow was good.All the gear is supplied except hat and gloves which are available at the store I'd been to Europe so had a hat and gloves.The only complaint no pockets in the gear luckily I had a cord around camera so the compulsory photos could be taken.Overall a fun thing to do.i only bought the 2 hr pass which was long enough.I then went and did some retail therapy in the Mall !

get to ski in the Gulf. an amazing place to spend a day. all facilities are there. everything you need is available. you can ski in the summer in a gulf county in the middle east. you will spend at least three to four hours having alot of fun
The Ski come to you. The first indoor ski and widest rink around the world, it is so big and wonderful. you will enjoy your time there with the games.

mostly for kids, great family escape from the heat. mostly young kids and families, insite Mall of the Emirates. Good escape from the heat. They provide Ski wear adn equipment for a fee. Great family time. I was there on business, but enjoyed watching from the lodge area

Making the impossible possible. Making the impossible possible is what i could say about Ski Dubai. It is like being at a ski resort in the middle of a mall which is in the middle of a desert. Could you imagine that...I couldn't until i saw it. Wonderful experience...once you enter you are in a different world.... world of its own. Don't miss it for anything.

Snow in the Desert. It was my first time to be in a -3 Celsius enviroment and it was my first time to see the penguins as well and I can really say it is an unforgettable experience for me.It's a good place to visit especially for the people who wants to try out skiing for the first time. Inside the snow park there's also a cafeteria called Avalanche where you can munch on while watching the people skiing and such. Staff are very friendly too and the place is just so cool!!! Overall rate is excellent. I definitely recommend this to be on their list for the people who will visit Dubai.

Skiing in Dubai. great palce to take the kids if they can ski. if they can't you can also get lessons. Very reasonable entrance fee includes ski suit, socks, boots and skis/ snowboard. All you need are a hat and gloves. You get a 2 hour pass which is enough to do quite a bit of skiing. The run isn't very long but you still get a decent ski experience.

Let it snow!. Lovely for a family day of fun but comes at a price, AED 150 for Adults and AED 140 for children...I probably wouldn't pay the extra to get up on the ski lift unless you are actually going to ski! There's heaps to do at the bottom, lovely photo areas, sleds for the big and little, the snow ball and some other fun games! The coffee shop up the top is quite reasonable but getting up there is exy! Lockers available and you get back your deposit through conveniently located machines. All in all, fun for everyone :) Try to get some entertainer vouchers if you are a big group!

Better than you think. I am a pretty extreme snowboarder, and I thought that this would be a total joke....pleasantly surprised...although short runs, that I had a very good time....equipment is pretty good...surface is soft and nicely groomed...must do if visiting Dubai.

Oasis in Desert. Dubai with its weather reaching 50 digree it is really amazing how they manage to build something like this and maintain -4 digree throuout the year . I Liked the huge olympic size skying fecality built indore . The whole family entertainer ...

A unique experience....ski in the desert. Well designed indoor ski slope in the middle of the desert. Very well organised. Bring a fleece , gloves and beanie....everything else is provided. Go in the morning to get some freshly groomed snow. Day ticket is the best value.

Come on! Skiing in a desert - Don't miss it. This was fantastic! I did the snowboarding and my friend skied. So much fun! We actually met the Dubai Ski Club. Imagine a ski club in Dubai - hilarious! It was a blue run and a green run and we spend 2 hours with our rented ski clothes and equipment having a blast. Don't miss this!
Brrrrrrr!!!. It's so amazing and worth the ticket You can ski through a huge area for professionals You can watch and play with penguins You can exit and enter as much as you can
Penquins. Inside Ski Dubai we met Pumpkin and Pie, 2 Penquins. The King Penquin is Makvettie, so beautiful and cute. They are clever and very loveable.

Cold Grumpy Staff in the Snow. The whole time I was literally so lost, there is no one to ask, and when you find someone you get a rude answer. Disappointing indeed. From the very beginning, the lady that sold me the tickets had an arrogant attitude. I'm sorry I don't know anything about the place, or the prices, but then again, that's why people like you is there! to help! ( she sent me to a board to read the prices myself, I've never met someone so useless and she wasn't busy at all) . Once I bought my ticket I had literally no idea were to go next. Following the rest of the people I found the place were they give you the jacket and pants. With all of that stuff in my hands (a big ball of clothes) I went to the next step which is getting the boots, then the snowboard, then with all that heavy stuff I went to the lockers where I couldn't find anywhere to sit down, so I sat on the floor.Once inside, the snow is perfect, everything looks beautiful and clean. I wanted to do snowboarding but I've only done it a couple of times so I decided to go to the "beginners" section. Just to find out there is no beginners, only medium and expert. After almost braking all my bones going down the hill I finally reached the end. I couldn't get my snowboard out of my feet so looking everywhere I was trying to find someone to help me (all this while fast ski and snowboard experts coming down the hill were trying not to run over me). Thank God I found a member of the staff which again very rudely took my snowboard off without saying a word or even looking at me (a chubby woman with blue eyes and dirty blonde hair, I wish I could mention your name) :) . As if I wasn't embarrassed enough, carrying my heavy snowboard I just wanted to leave so AGAIN without knowing where to go (PUT SOME SIGNALS IN THAT PLACE PLEASE!) I just started walking towards an "exit" signal. Then someone stopped me (literally grabbed my arm) and said "to go out, that way, straight". I swear I said thank you to that guy. Since at least he helped me, avoiding me to queue for the Big Ball when I all wanted to do was leave that place. Once out I realized there are also places you can just walk and take pictures, and wooden bridges. Ski Dubai is very very confusing. There are different tickets, or passes and once inside you find out there are things you can't do and If you want to do them you need an special pass...it's just exhausting. I left feeling I wasted money, not because of ski Dubai itself but due the terrible staff they have inside. I met this guy, Daniel, He doesn't work there but he helped me so much. He's a regular there. He advice me to take some lessons and also were to go to buy them. You could feel his passion for snow sports and for ski Dubai. You should hire people like him and let those grumpy others go.

Impressive. I admit, we're suckers. We were in the mall and decided we had to go and take pictures. There's a charge to do so-but they give you boots, socks and a jacket and you get to ride the lift to the top. Tourist trap, but fun just to say you did it.

Must go there . It's so amazing and worth the ticket You can ski through a huge area for professionals You can watch and play with penguins You can exit and enter as much as you canOfcorse you can have your own locker for free or share it with anyone else it's big enough You can take your glovesThere Is amazing souvenir shopFun fun fun fun fun...... Lots of things you can do there

Brrrrrrr!!!. Very well organized. They provide you with warm clothing, boots etc. Only funny thing is you have to buy gloves from them!!! For 20 AED each. But the whole ski dome is well maintained and lots of snow based activities like skiing, zorb rides etc are available. You can visit the penguins too at extra cost.

Try it!! It's a experience!!!. This was my second time to ski Dubai which is located inside the Dubai mall. Lots if fun for kids and for adults if you live in a hot climate and never see a inch of snow! A little pricey to rent gear and clothing. I would advise packing something warm to bring with you so you don't have to rent every stitch of clothing! Check out the COBONE website they have special vouchers you can buy! They have a deal running now if you need it! All and all it is a great place to visit because it's a novelty thing to see! They even have real penguins! If you spent the money to go to Dubai you might as well go for it all and visit there!!!

You must add this to your list of places to visit.... Simply surreal! -5c skiing in the desert. We had 2 hours of fun...off peak so it was quiet. Wrap up warm - take a jumper as it gets cold when you're on the slow chairlift. If you love skiing, you've got to add this to your list of things to do in Dubai...so much fun!

A must do. This was really awesome. I was disappointed at the desert safari but the ski resort in the Mall of Emirates made up for that disappointment. Go early, make sure you carry a woollen hat (not supplied) as it is VERY COLD inside the ski resort. Also I recommend your own thick gloves. Put the clothing provided by the resort over your clothes. I used an helmet to cover my head as my head was ice. They also provide you with boots. Ski Dubai is a bit expensive but worthwhile.

What's not to like. A ski centre in the middle of a mall, surrounded by great restaurants and fab shops.
Didn't ski but had lunch overlooking the ski slopes, with tobogganing, skiing, zorbing, zip wires, actual chair lifts and even a penguin show how could you not love it!!

Winter And Penguins In The Desert. A unique experience of skiing and snow sliding literally on a 50 degree day in the middle of summer. Its insane how they have built this amazing indoor snow spectacle in the middle of a shopping mall. We spent a good half a day, however as Australians who don't deal with such extremely cold winters, the temperature got the best of us, It was absolutely freezing. None the less we had a blast and laughed the entire time. I highly recommend the penguin experience its so cheap and was so amazing to meet penguins and even hug them and get a souvenir photo. Unreal experience. I would definitely go again but next time wear double clothing underneath my ski suit.

Disappointing to observe. I will admit that we did not pay to go inside and play in the snow, but from the outside looking in, it was not as great as I was expecting. Also, I wasn't able to see the ski slopes themselves, so I might be wrong. The ski slope faces a hotel and restaurant attached to the Emirates Mall, and we tried to sneak in to get a glimpse of the slopes but was unable to. But, like I said before, just looking at it did not entice me to want to pay to go inside. Although, it was really cool to have snow in the middle of a desert.

Unique Place. You have to visit it if you there in Dubai .. it's unique place in the middle east and its very funny specially for kids .. be carefully not to let the ice reach inside there clothes because simply they will get very cold and want to get out.

Man vs. Nature. Even though in you conscious mind you know that this is not real, but once you enter inside you will admit that these guys have challenged nature and brought snow to the desert ! Might not be as real as you would like it to be, but it will definitely be one of a lifetime experience. Must try

something everybody should try here. I came now a couple of times here. Usually with friends who are visiting me.Of course it is cheaper to go somewhere else in the world indoor skiing. But just think about how crazy it is to go skiing in -2 °c and outside it is about +38°c.;)It is a great place with a lot of fun. But definately not for the whole day. A few hours should be enough.

27 degrees inside , 104 on the outside!. Ok where in the world can ski in the middle of the desert?? Really this place was a blast. Located in the Mall of the Emirates I had more fun than a 54 year old fat man should have! Everything is well thought out and your get your gear, gloves coats lockers boots etc all for one price. You can buy passes for whatever you like and the combo passes are great. I spent a few hours, tobogganing, sledding riding the chairlifts and just having a good time in this amazing architectual wonder, Music is piped in , you can stop on the slope for cocktails or hot chocolate or you can watch the diners and tourists in the mall oogle your every move! Throw a snowball at someone who cares it feels good after a long day in Dubai. The cost is pricey but worth every penny. Take the kids and enjoy. there were lots of photo ops everywhere and you can by the pics when you leave. This place was very well done and there is something for everyone to do there . Beat the heat here,go to the beach then come back again as your pass is good all day!

Super fun!. Experience freezing cold in Dubai inside the Mall of Emirates! An indoor ski resort, this is a fun destination and not just for the kids. Good fun if you are in a group. Oddly, they do not provide gloves while jackets, pants and boots are available on rent with the ticket. Loved the zorbing ball of all the activities.

Guess, you have to do it once.. Yes, it's for tourists, but still... Actually the slopes are better than what I anticipated. I like watching skiers and boarders coming down the hill from the restaurant across. All equipment can be rented.

Whaaaat a refreshing view. Totally bonkers having a ski slope with real snow & ice in the desert but i love the concept of it.Never actually went inside bit had some great views from dining in one the reastaurants in the mall.Its like hang on theres a ski slope, is that real, omg it is, people inside are all kitted out in proper ski clothes.Must be an experience to have a go while in Dubai

MALL OF THE EMIRATES. Ski Dubai , Shopping at MOE was great .
Very Impressive MALL , the METRO station is inside the mall .
So Barsha is a very good stay , connected with Metro

Refreshing break from the desert heat!. Truthfully was not so optimistic about this place at first, but it was a lovely break from the heat! My friend and I took part in the pass that permits a chair lift ride, unlimited "zorb" rides and tubing. We had a fun time, played in the snow a bit like kids again, and really enjoyed it! They have a bar at the top of the chair lift. You can opt for either kids area, skiing, or other passes- they cater to the activities you want to participate in. They provide gloves, socks, boots, jackets, pants, etc so you need NOTHING, which is great, since when you vacation to the desert you really don't plan on packing your gloves. A private locker is available to place your belongings. Price is very reasonable as well- about $60 for a variety pass. Good for adults, kids alike.

What an experience. Great experience - imagine coming to the desert to ski - discovery lesson was simple to understand and with a group of good friends it was a great laugh. Everyone enjoyed themselves - of course the children showed us what to do! Really recommend it - even if just to get away from the heat!

Skiing in the hot. Whilst the wife and daughter went shopping my son and I decided to use the ski facilities, we were provided with everything apart from gloves which you bought, very cheap tho.The lift up was a little slow but coming down was fast, very enjoyable, paid for two hours at the cost of approx. £37.00 each, so good value taking into account all your equipment rent!

Worthwhile Splurge. For any ski or snow board enthusiast, this is one of those over-the-top experiences not to miss doing while in the UAE. You are not going for the challenging expert terrain but you are going to marvel at the great effort that has been made to create a winter wonderland in the midst of not only a desert but a mega-mall. For about US$60, all you need to bring is a hat and pair of gloves, which you definitely will need! If you forget to pack them, do not worry as there is an adjacent store offering hats, gloves, scarfs, and may other items with Ski Dubai on them. Then you will then be efficiently outfitted with boots, poles, skis, jacket, pants and socks (I recommend using the 2 that they give you!) and lift ticket good for 2 hours. You can also purchase an all-day ticket or more expansive ticket that includes the other snow activities, such as the zip line, luge and huge snowball slide. Also, there is a ski school in case you have those that are just learning. Couple suggestions: Two hours was plenty of time for us. We went on a Friday morning which definitely was a less crowded time and therefore, shorter lines for everything. We shared a locker between 3 of us.

Unexpected Ski!. Yes it is weird to say that you can actually ski on snow not sand in the middle of the desert but you are in Dubai. Yet Dubai knows how attract all kind of people. For me since I am not a skier I played with the snow games and took a tour. It is cold inside around 5-8 C below zero and the clothing they gives you is not enough if you are staying more than 2 hours. They offer lessons with one or two hours of skiing for a special price. If you don't want to ski but want to ENJOY the view then you can eat your lunch or dinner at Cheesecake Factory or TFI Friday.

Fun for a few hours. We've been a few times. The kids usually have a lot of fun for a couple hours. It's a fun beginner hill. Early morning is best as there aren't many people until after lunch. A little expensive so see if you can get a coupon from somewhere first. Have fun!

Brrr in the desert!. After the day before spent in the desert, cruising around in Toyota LandCruisers and camels! After a morning in the souks on the old town, off to the ski hill!! 37* outside, baking in the heat! 2* inside, frozen fingers, laughing our heads off! This activity is extremely well organized, fun and affordable! Go! And enjoy!!❌⭕️❌⭕️

Best attraction in Dubai. My 5 year old absolutely LOVED Ski Dubai.Positives:- All staff were extremely friendly and helpful.- Wait times for rides were 5 mins (we visited on a week day).- Ability to leave the attraction and return in a 24 hour period.- Numerous rides.Negatives:- None.

Umm...its skiing in Dubai!. I travel through Dubai quite frequently and usually only have hours there. On this trip I had an extra day and traveled to the mall. Totally shocked when I saw this in the Mall of Emirates. Great mall as well by the way. Skied for about three hours, they give you a snow suit, so that is a plus. I had no gloves or hat. That was fine but after three hours in the area, I was ready to call it quits. They have an area for children to play in the snow and some rails for the snowboarders, etc.The price was fairly reasonable as well for what you get. They have ski instructors that are sent to Germany to certify. I've heard they are okay for what they have to teach (me being a former instructor my self - O would have LOVED to train in Germany!). Also, seeing woman ski in a burka... interesting to say the least. Give yourself a half of a day here and take a break from the ridiculous heat of Dubai in the summer! Get a hat at the shop prior to skiing and you can leave with a memory. Very cool!

Best Place to be in Dubai. The Man-made Ice Skating place is located in the Mall of Emirates. No better place to be .. Good Facilities of equippment, good space for pros and small games etc for tourists / kids.
Go and Enjoy to the fullest.

You have to try skiing in the desert. We are frequent skiers so of course we didn't discover here the best slope ever, but still, it was longer and larger than we expected and the snow was obviously artificial but still enjoyable. Don't expect too much from the equipment they give you, the skis and the clothes are not performant but this has no importance here. 2 hours are plenty, plenty enough for a good skier, we stopped before the end. The main problem is the incredible slowness of the lift. You spend most of your time sitting on it. But an overall crazy experience !

Loved it. Had a great time. 3 year old son loved seeing and kissing a penguin - although the penguin tour is a little short. Don't forget to take warm clothes (mainly gloves and a beanie as your entrance fee includes coveralls and boots).
Amazing. its a awesome place with all the rides and skiing. the gear provided by them is also nice. the penguins in there are very cute.

push n slide!!!. apart from fun...excitement...cold..i learnt to ski..i was hesitating but finally my roller skating skills helped me to go through! just had amazing day. penguins were so cute just wanna take them home! never wanted to come out!. must try for summers ..as its too hot outside ..n here u will freeze!!!!!!
Exccelent. At the Mall of Emirates ; It is simply superb, Very good Rides and what an atmosphere. Kudoos ! People Standing Out and Looking Inside ; Join In the Fun !

Great fun. Great time! Gets a bit cold if you're just in the rented ski gear, but still good fun for people who enjoy skiing. Would definitely go back next time I'm in Dubai. There's a few reviews on here complaining about how it's not the same as real skiing. Obviously it's not done on a mountain and it can get busy, I'm not sure what they expected. Still great fun and I'd recommend it to everyone.
unbelievable !. Imagine you walking in a shopping mall and suddenly ...you find a sky track in front of you ! this is what happens here ! with 33°C outside !

A SKI haven in a DESERT!. There's nothing like this in the world! And I don't mean figuratively , there just isn't any other indoor ski resort anywhere in this whole wide world!When you first enter you are just overwhelmed by the sheer size and brilliance of this place, specially because just outside this place it's a sweltering 120 degrees Fahrenheit !They've really taken this to another level. They've everything an actual ski resort has. And it's real actual snow not anything fake and the temperature inside is about 38 degrees Fahrenheit . This is the real stuff.Very well managed considering the crowds at certain hours and seasons. They have everything for everyone whether it's the clothes , the ski boots or any other accessory. And even an 18 month old child can enjoy. There's different skill levels for every one and every age.A trip to Dubai should be planned specifically to visit this ski resort , the burj khalifa ( the tallest building in the world) and the Dubai aquarium and underwater zoo amongst many othersA must go place

Excellent Adventure. Its the best Snow and Ski experience I have ever been to.We went there with cousins and its ideal to enjoy it with your group of 3 people and above.There are two ticket options available.The cheaper one gives access only to the snow and kids play area with 4 rides to experience (2 of them are for kids).For adults I recommend to take the higher ticket option which gives access to the Ski as well as the snow (kids) area and go straight up to the Ski and enjoy the Ski.It is recommended to carry your own snow gloves and socks as the ones sold by Ski Dubai are expensive and not good quality. They also have the option to rent it but I don't recommend this.If you have your own Ski gear, carry it, you will be more comfortable using your own gear.If you are a tourist visiting Ski Dubai you can hire the Ski gear but definitely carry your own gloves and socks.

Peng Friend Exclusive Tour. Very expensive but so worth it! My boys (6 year old twins) were able to get a one on one experience with lots of Penguins. We were able to pet, hug, kiss and feed many penguins. The tour was very informative and interactive. We did not purchase an all inclusive pass because we didn't have time to do the Snow Park. Really, I don't think we missed too much. Basic Information: Upon check in- I found the male attendent very rude! Of course, no name badge. However, we didn't let him spoil our trip! We brought our own gloves and hats. Wear your socks as well as the socks they provide to keep your feet warm! Children must wear helmets. It is cold of course! We arrived at 12:15 for a 1:00 tour. We were told to arrive at 12:15 but then had to wait until 12:30 to start changing out. Get there in plenty of time! Of course, lockers will cost extra. It takes time to change yourself and kids into snow gear. We met right at 1:00 at the Penguin Area. The tour guide, Gene, took us back right away. We met one Penguin type and learned all about him. then we met a different type and learned about her. Afterwards, we went to the penguin area and spent some time looking at their schedules, their food preparation, and their "bedroom." We went up into their swim area and spent a lot of time interacting with them. Of course, their was a photographer taking lots of pictures. And, of course, you can buy these pictures for $100+. We did! After visiting with the penguins, Gene took us out to the penguin parade. My boys were able to go help with the parade and this made them feel very special. We finished the tour with some complimentary hot chocolate while sitting at the local restaurant. Overall, it was a great experience. My boys were very interested and amazed with the penguins. I think it depends on the children as to whether or not the Peng Friend Exclusive Tour is worth it. Like I said, it is pricey...the 4 of us was over $500. My boys did indicate that they wanted to play in the snow park...but we enticed them with visiting the mall stores instead! I just don't think we could handle the cold long enough to make it worth our money- which is why we spent more on the penguins. For us, this was the right choice. Before leaving, don't forget to turn your cards back in for the 20 AED deposit each! Visit the photo place to get your pictures and pay for any extra that you would like. Our package included 4 printed pictures, presented in a nice booklet. Additionally, we bough the USB of all our images. Pricey- but a once in a lifetime experience for us!

So expensive!. We booked snow experience and the penguin tour. It cost a lot of money. Because we had to wait for our appointment to see the penguins, we spent time in the snow. It is an experience because it is really cold, but without daylight it feels only like being locked into a huge freezer. The penguins are lovely and we got nice photos. My husband and I left because after the snow lift there was really nothing we could do but freeze. The light inside is dim and in total it was a rather boring experience. The kids loved it and enjoyed the rides. They did ride the snow bullet which costs extra...It is possible to learn how to ski but one has to come in every day for that purpose. I feel this place was made for the local people who may never have seen snow or experienced sub zero temperatures.

do we really have to ski in the desert?. Well, I learnt skying at the age of 5 - yes I know I am privileged - and while living in Europe skying was one of our weekend and holiday pass-time during winter season. But nowadays do we really need to cool the whole year round some ski slope in the desert?You see that I am not a fan of such crazy stuff and I feel so pity when I see the poor penguins walking down the path. They never see daylight.Dubai is offering a lot ......desert, Polo, seaside, diving, .......... much more interesting and natural than skying close to a shopping mall.I gave it a poor as it seems that some people need the snow experience and for some it is an unique experience not be able to travel abroad.

Ski Dubai. Had a great few hours there. Gets a bit cold after a few hours. Lots of fun and really had a laugh watching my friends learn to ski and I enjoyed the rides available. Highly recommend it for anyone. Staff were helpful and friendly too. Remember to take your own hat and gloves as they are not supplied but aren't really that expensive if you do buy them there.

Lots of fun in the cold. I booked the 2 hour pass while my girlfriend went for a 1 hour beginner lesson. In the price all equipment and cloths is already included. The only thing not included are the gloves, which i highly recommend to buy a pair, because it is really cold in the hall.The beginner lesson was good and my girlfriend (who skied the first time) really liked it and can't wait to hit some real slopes. Instructors were friendly and handed a helping hand whenever needed.Well worth a visit!

A Miracle in the desert. I wanted to take up some lessons at the Ski Dubai and approached them. The whole place is very professionally managed. They provide us with all the kit that is required. The classes are conducted well. I took about 3 lessons and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. This place has things to do for every age category. So no one is too young or old.Lots of kid activities as well as adult attractions.

Ice cold in the desert heat. You can't not have fun in this place - it's got to be done just to say you've done it - snow skied in the desert. Everything is provided so you can just rock up and they'll give you new socks, ski suit, gloves etc. Weekends can be quite busy. Kids parties are well managed and offer a variety of activities.

Skiing Inside. It's fun to see Ski Dubai once, but it's not the end of the world if you can't make it. It's pretty cold & they charge extra for good gloves. If you don't want to ski, you can always tube & that's a nice option.
Over to soon. This is definitely worth a visit. Brilliant instructor, so patient and very good at explaining. Looking forward to going back. Well worth the money

good but could be better. we went to the Ski dubai in march.Found the place little expensive for no reason.The park is really small and little expensive.There are hardly 3 rides out of which 1 was closed .but a good experience in HOT DUBAI !!!

Worth a visit!. Its quite amazing the way the whole place has been designed and maintained. Advisable to take the 200 AED pass called as Super Pass as it includes Gloves, Socks and all the necessary things to go in. You need to pay for these things otherwise.The rides are quite good for the kids. Though adults may not find them as interesting.Those who know skiing and want to do it. This is unreal!Mountain Thriller (there are two and you need to climb up using chairlift to be able to get to the better one), Giant Ball and Chairlift are included in this pass and you have unlimited access. You may want to walk out after a couple of hours though since its pretty cold in there ( -3 degrees).Taking along a cap to cover your head and ears is advisable as buying it from there can be quite costly.

Helpful staff who make learning fun!. My daughter takes lessons here and loves it! It is a great escape from the heat and has options to learn and practice - particularly before a big ski holiday or venture out in real snow territory. Fun.

My kid loved it.... Ski Dubai is undoubtedly one of the best attractions of Dubai and an amazing feat considering Dubai is a desert city. It’s located on the ground floor of Mall of the Emirates… Take the metro to Mall of the Emirates MRT station and reach the mall through the metro link.There are multiple entry pass options available… I recommend the super pass at AED 200 which allows you unlimited entry to all rides/slides (except Snow Bullet) and a complimentary pair of fleece gloves. If you are an experienced skier you may opt for the ski slope at AED 200 for 2 hrs and AED 300 for full day. There is a ski school too… My 9 yr old boy took a one hour lesson for AED 150 and loved it. No need to bring any special clothing or equipment as they provide everything except gloves and caps… (you get a free pair of gloves with super pass though). So, just bring a cap with you or buy one at the store inside. There are lockers available for AED 30 to keep your extra stuff. The snow park is spread over 3000 Sq.Mtr area… The slides and rides are quite fun for kids but as an adult I would have loved some more adventurous ones… But enjoyed the snow around the park and the -3 degree temperature. There is a chairlift which takes you from the bottom of the park right up to the peak with a station in the mid-section. The ski slope is not very long and quite a simple one but one needs to understand it’s an indoor show park and therefore bound have its limitations. Once you understand and accept the limitations you are going to enjoy the experience. You need about two hours to fully enjoy all slides and rides. Important: Children below 3 years are not allowed inside Ski Dubai.

Cheesy but had to try it.. I live in the Tahoe mountains of Nevada and have some of the best skiing available. The mall-based ski hill is cheesy, but I tried it anyway. It is similar to the typical bunny/intermediate hill. The lift is slow and you can only get about 6 lifts per hour. The show is always perfect as the temperature is controlled and snow likely has preservative to keep in in perfect condition. I noticed that it is denser than light powder and does not fly up when you ski. I was more disappointed at the gear condition. My boots were in pretty bad shape and my skis had probably not been waxed since they were manufactured. As an experienced intermediate skier I felt unsafe on their equipment. They do provide the skis, poles, jacket and pants as you likely did not bring any of this gear when you came to Dubai. They do not provide hats or gloves, but of course they are available for purchase if you need them. I was able to withstand the cold temperature for about an hour before I called it a day.

Great fun for 2-3 hours. Nothing speaks louder about the amount of money that is in Dubai than this ski slope in the desert. That aside, the slope is good fun an da good place to warm up for Thursday night drinks. Bring your own pocket camera as photos are insanely overpriced.
Insanity. The Dubaians are preaching sustainablility, reduce the CO impact and on top of that they try to sell me indoor skiing (i am from the Northern Norway and have enough of snow)

Most beautiful adventurous heart touching cold ski dubai tour of my kids and me. Hi how I should start this review .marvellous .at minus 3 temp with red nose chilling weather of ski dubai .my daughters eeshal .zona and little zyreen and my 11 yr old son muhammad ali all crying with happiness .mama most most enjoyable activity in dubai is ski dubai.write it in capital .SKI DUBAI zindabad.its chairlift was marvellous excellent to see snow down .At the time of ticketing I felt it is costly but not later I realised .man created snow .wow wow I will recommend must go with ur kids and enjoy .

Skiing in a Mall?!. It is a very beautiful place to be in and its really freezing cold in there. Plus, so many things to do and the snow bullet is awesome! I really want to come back. Really worth the money.

Awesome fun!. Went with mum for the first time boarding in years. The ski school people said i wouldnt be able to go on the slope without a discovery lesson, but the people at the front said i would be ok as i thought i was between beginner and level 1. No showers after was the only downside... Was looking forward to getting warm!

wonderful outing for kids. we had gone with our 5 year old son and he had a fun filled experience. it was freezing at subzero temperatures - shoes, socks and snow suits are complementary. gloves and caps are available on purchase basis. we had carried gloves and caps with us. it takes about 15-20 mins to get dressed to enter the snow zone. we spent about 1.5 hours in the snow park. we didnt ski but there are a few rides which can keep the kids occupied.the other imp attraction is the penguin show. pls note that the first show is at 2 pm and hence you might want to plan your park entry accordingly especially if you are booked on a single entry ticket. there is a small outlet serving snacks and hot beverages - we found it very useful when it was getting a bit too cold for our kid - a cup of hot chocolate revved him up
fun in the sun. Great way to spend a couple of hours. I'm an experienced skier and would say that you need gloves. Equipment is good. Chair lift is slow but poma tow is a lot quicker.
Ski in snow. Skiing in snow..it is good fun for kids, Nothing spectacular if you have skied on real snow mountains!

Fun activity with friends to fill an afternoon. Whilst the veteran ski holiday goers among you may find the slope options limited, this was a great introduction to powder skiing for an enthusiastic novice like myself.It is a perfect venue for those wanting to learn the basics. Lessons range from starter course to intermediate in 6 transitional levels. We took a 'level 2' lesson which assumed you knew the basics and focused on enhancing your stopping and turning ability with increasing degrees of difficulty. The tutors are very friendly and extremely capable and we were meandering seemlessly down the short practice slopes in no time. There were 2 practice slopes - one gentle slope of about 40m long and one steeper slope with slalom flags of about 30m long. We were able to progress through each and have one attempt at tackling the red run on the main slope which was a similar gradient to the 30m practice slope.Ski passes are available for the more experienced skiers which you can get for either a 2hr session or a full day. All in all a great day out with friends and a lot of fun. Would definitely return for a ski pass to conquer the bigger slopes next time I visit.

Visit only if you have never seen snow. Visit this place only if you have never seen snow and you are not going to in future. I do not recommend this attraction simply because its too expensive to experience this. Unless you have kids you should stick to penguins show which is worth, since you would see/touch/feel only in extremely cold weather area.

Seen snow for the first time....amazing. It was a great experience for me and my 10 years old child during my visit in June12 as we had experienced snow for the first time in life and that too in desert. What else we want at 46 degree outside and zero degree inside. As per me this is one of the top 3 attraction of Dubai.

SnowPark in Ski Dubai. Took my son to the Ski Dubai as he wanted to "play" in the snow. We just got the entry to the Snowpark since son was too young to try out the skiing. There are around 4-5 rides and we were done in less than 2 hours. Then what? So we paid additional for the super pass which included the lift ride, snow tubing and the Giant ball. Did that for another hour and we were done. We came from a region that has tonnes of snow and so probably the attraction wasnt so wow. But for a first timer it will be a great experience. The idea of a ski area inside a mall itself is great. Overall an enjoyable experience but will not do it twice.
Experiance the ice. it was amazing experience in a country like U.A.E in which we can get ice and it was amazing experience of ski
Terrible. A terrible experience. You have to pay for gloves and most of the other attractions. Moreover, it is very difficult to spend time in the area due to excessive cold.

Skiing in Dubai. Where else can you do something like this? If you like to ski, this is a must! The attraction is no mountain, but the next best thing. They supply you with everything except a hat and gloves that you can buy there. Not everyday do you see women riding the ski lift in a Burka.

Great fun for all but allow plenty of time for queues!. We are not skiers but wanted to try out the experience at Ski Dubai. We booked the discovery session - which lasts for approx 90 mins and costs 300 aed for 2. When we arrived it took nearly one hour to sort out all the kit with at least 3 queue to join to collect tickets/locker passes, ski clothing and finally ski boots. Once kitted up we met with our instructors for the session - who were fun and put us at ease. The session focussed on using putting on/taking off your skis, plus starting and stopping.Once inside the ski area - you can appreciate that Dubai has really replicated a true skiing environment with ski lifts, snow, ice etc., With 2 other people we practised and had the opportunity to use a small/gentle slope etc., We enjoyed the experience and would certainly like to return - if you are a learner the cost of lessons are expensive £100 for 121 or £36 for a group lesson of 90 mins. You could join the ski school program if you are in Dubai for an extended stay. We also saw more experience skiers and snowboarders using the slopes - so the venue is not just for learners.Overall a fun day for all but not cheap. Plus allow plenty of time to get your kit before your session starts.

Slippery slope. It's not soft, fluffy and fresh snow. It's icy and slippery - like ice is. A good place to go and have some family fun but you won't catch me there every weekend. Went twice for snowboard lessons. Good lessons but nothing like the real deal on the real slopes in nature.

Good. This is a fun place for everyone if they like snow and fun activities.The best thing is that the activities are so much fun you feel like doing them again and again and again. You cannot take cameras inside as cameras are not permitted but you can tell one of your family members to stay outside and take pictures of you from outside. Another good thing is that they provide everything for you to wear . At the end of the trip you can go to the counter and they give you pictures of you and your family. It depends if you want to stay for 2-3 hrs or the whole day it's your personal opinion.
Great adventure. Where else can you ski and then put your flip flops back on. They provide eveything from your socks to your boots, jacket and pants. Only thing they dont provide is gloves.

An experience unto itself. Let me divide my reader in two categories:If you're a skier and you're missing some powder time, it's well worth paying for two hours to sky here. After that, you get bored with the track options. 2 hours is just enough to get a feel for the pleasure of skiing and start missing some more options. And it's important to remember: You're skiing in the middle of the desert (or the mall).If you're not a skier and/or have small children, there is a good snow park at the base of the "mountain" where you can a have a great snow experience, including a penguin show.
