If you're a local and want to learn how to sky for a following vacation, i highly recommend it as well.

Great fun!. Not what you expect in the Arabian desert! But well run, efficient and surprisingly good skiing. Long enough to get going and with the choice of a steeper pitch or a longer flatter descent. Both had good snow and it was a great way to spend a couple of hours. Your glasses sure mist up when you go outside!

give yourself time. If you ski, you do not need to get more than a 2 hr pass. however with all the lines to wait in (passes, ski boots, jackets, skis) etc you need at least 3 hrs to get this in. A very unique experience with good quality snow. Length of runs only make this a novelty but still worth the price.Take gloves as it is cold in there.

Small Beautiful Snow World. nice place for all age group. don't forget to carry woolen caps as they don't provide any. inside temperature was -3 degree. we have enjoyed all rides 2-3 times. if u feel numb, u can come out from main entrance, only u should not cross ticket punching gate.

Amazing. We had the best time in the ski Dubai, we got the power pass which allows you all day entry with a locker so you can put your stuff in the locker and leave and then come back and go in again. The snow bullet was great and so was all the other attractions in this, would go back there again. There is also so much there for the kids as well.
Surreal experience in the heat. Well worth a visit if you want to experience the surreal experience of skiing in the Middle East. It's not the alps, but it sure should be seen.

Lots of fun. Our last day and it started raining so we decided to ski in a mall !!! It was a weekday so not overly crowded . The process was seamless . Purchased our tickets (pleasantly surprised as a 20% discount if paying with MasterCard .) We then collected clothes, boots , skis . All good quality and they managed to get the sizing correct . Take gloves or you can purchase a pair of gloves ( they came in useful for our next stop in the UK ) from the store next to the entrance .Take the chairlift and at the top ski off to the left for the black run or to the right for the easier slope . You can get off half way up if a beginner . We saw the instructors and they seemed to be very good . Great chatting to people from all over the world going up on the chairlift .A must do when in Dubai and reasonably priced !!!

Really fun if you get there early!. We arrived at Ski Dubai right as it opened at 9 AM. My son (4 years old), husband and I had the run of the place until around 10:45 when lots of other families and kids arrived. The staff was very friendly and helpful and we enjoyed being the only ones in the snow park for 1.5 hours! The snow park is great for little kids but we will probably ski next time. We had done everything in about the first 15 minutes and just went to the same slides and runs over and over again until my son was tired. The best part is being able to say you played in the snow in Dubai!

Fantastic way to spend a few hours. As a beginner or accomplished skier taking a break from the sun and spending a couple of hours on the slopes is just fantastic. Ski Dubai provide everything apart from gloves, so just turn up and they will kit you out. Best to wear something reasonably warm underneath however as after a couple of hours it gets chilly. Friends of hours had a lesson and said it was just like what they had experienced from ski school in France.

Skiing in a mall......what else can I say?. Did it just because we had never been skiing indoors. It was a great experience. We went at 10 AM on a weekday so no rush. The process was seamless. Get the tickets, rent your ski apparel and boots, get your skis and go change and walk through. The equipment was in good shape and fairly high quality. The ski lifts are slow and the slopes are green to maybe blues ( by North American standards) but you are skiing in a mall. Great experience and to be able to provide skiing in this part of the world is excellent. The price for the whole package was $66USD which is not too bad.

Yes they have snow in UAE. This is an interesting bit of winter in the middle of UAE. They really have snow, skis and pen quoins. Coming from Utah the skiing was not a must do but the penguins were so fun and the zip line was fun
:(. i went there and it looked really fun but my daughter could only go on a couple of stuff so it came so boring plus its a bit pricey

Surprisingly Fun. As anything Dubai i'm aways skeptical about the validity of the experiences here. My first impression of Ski Dubai was....WEIRD, but as a long time skier I could actually enjoy the place quite well for a couple hours. The snow is quite good, and the track is not as small as one could imagine. Good for first times, and for some training. One of my favorite attractions in Dubai.

Fun thing to do but the skiing is just play. If I would give points on this as a real ski-slope I would give it really lousy points but considering it is inside and in a country where it is very often 40°C and sometimes more then 50°C outside it is just a incredible project and a total out-of-the box idea to create something like this in UAE.I will list my thoughts on the various things at Ski Dubai. Most are good but there is some cons as well.General info.I just did the skiing, not the skids, slides and rides so I do not have anything to comment on that.The temperature was something like 4°C so it is not really cold for a Scandinavian like myself and I could easily spend the 4h skiing without using gloves or a hat but if you think it sounds cold I recomend you bring your own had and gloves. You can also buy them in the Ski Dubai sports shop to a exaggerated high price.If you have the possibility then try to avoid weekends, the place is small enough as it is.If you do not know how to ski, stay in the lower half.If you know how to ski, you will discovere that you are King of the hill - 95% of the other skiers are beginners, have not learned to stop or have not understood the skiing rules that whoever comes from behind has to give away for the people below them. Be careful.Checking in and payment:I dont remember exactly the price I paid but I think it was 200 dirham for 4 hours of skiing. This includes insulated skiing pants, jacket, slalom boots, poles and carving skis.On top of it it includes the time to ski offcourse.I was offered to take a course in skiing, I smiled at the Melanesian girl at the counter and told her I skied since I was 4 in which she thought I was a Pro, I told her no, I am a quality engineer and do not make my living of skiing. She had apparently not tried the skiing herself.She was however very good at determining the size of clothes, boots and skies I needed. Everything fit with the first set she gave me. Equipment:Clothes keep you warm enough. Skis is not top of the line but certainly good enough for this little ski slope where one can not accelerate to top speed before it is time to stop.The lifts:There are 2 lifts. The larger one is a chair lift in which your ride with others. It makes a bend in the middle portion of the ski slope to it is easy to get off on the middle if one requires. The only thing is that it is very very very slow. I never seen a ski lift this slow in all my life but perhaps it is because there is so many people who is so bad on skiing it looks like Bambi the deer on ice.The other lift runs on the side of the wall towards the mall. It is much faster but is very jerky at some points and if not used to skies it will throw you off as it requires you balance and concentration to ride.The ski slope:It is really really short and very very easy. I could make it from top to bottom doing slalom in about 13 seconds so it is really a ski slope for children. In the middle is a building for the turn of the chair lift. And below this building some jumps for the snowboards. Special surprise:As with many other muslim countries the ski slopes has become some kind of liberal free-zone. If you have noticed malls is a liberal free-zone where although forbidden people walk hand in hand, kiss etc etc. In the Ski Dubai it is not uncommon to be approached by local girls/women whereas this would rarely happen anywhere else.My recomendation is to try Ski Dubai just to say you tried to ski indoors and in Dubai. But if you are a real skier this is probably only something you want to do once.

Snow in the desert. Not as pricey as I thought it would be for what you get. The whole day for a family of 4, stopped for lunch placed our gear in the locker provided and had some lunch in the mall. Then it was back to the snow for a 2nd go, kids were sad when it was eventually time to go. Kids never had to wait for anything and the staff are fantastic, a must do in Dubai

No Fun in the Snow!. Dubai has many excellent tourist attractions. Sadly this is not one of them. The concept is brilliant but the attraction failed to dazzle or even entice us to enter. Having experienced the real thing outside with nature at it's best, this indoor environment looked, artificial, cold, grey, icy and depressing. Could not even see the potential for real thrills due to the lack of space. They need to get rid of the excessive unimaginative clutter in order to extend the slopes for better rides. Finally the place needs a good old fashioned clean up. It looked dirty, tired and in need of a fresh snow dump!

Wow experience! Do take your own gloves and caps.. It is a beautiful experience to have right in the middle of a desert. It is contained within the Mall of Emirates. They maintain -3 deg C inside, provide you with the outfit (jacket and trouser), boots and socks. You can also get lockers to keep your stuff at a nominal charge of 25 Dirhams. Do remember to carry your own gloves and cap since it is not provided and it becomes uncomfortable inside without these. We were not aware of this and to buy it from the ski shop (20 Dhm for gloves, 55 Dhms for Cap).This place has a lot of fun filled activities inside but you need to purchase appropriate pass to experience them. There are 3 options - Snowpark entrance (basic one), Super pass and Power pass. I would recommend taking Power pass since most of the activities are fun. However, you can start with a lesser one and upgrade it later inside by paying the difference.

Don't bother unless you can actually ski or snowboard or have kids. It cost us nearly £40 each to go in there and as we can ski we just went on the attractions. Which were all pretty lame and slow. The snow zorb run was so short it wasn't exciting. I was glad we didn't pay extra for the snow bullet. Yes it's crazy that there is real snow in the desert but we were in there for an hour (and half of that we stopped for a cup of tea). Kids will love it and if you can ski or snowboard it then looks worthwhile,

Novelty only, very small slope, slow lift. expensive. This is a fad, you will most likely go do say you have been there! however its tiny compared to a real ski slope and the worst thing is the lift is incredibly slow! My biggest gripe is the speed of the lift, The ski run is about 500 meters so very good for an indoor slope, however you ski down it in 1 minute or less and they the chair lift takes 10 to 15 minutes to get you back to the top! My seven year old son kept asking why the lift was so slow! I can only think its so that if you ski down three or four times its taken you an hour! 4 mins skiing and 45 mins sitting on a chair lift! If you are planning on going take you own gloves with you as you cant rent gloves and you will end up buying some if you forget.

Great attraction, shame about everything else. We booked online the day before, encountering problems with the online booking system. However after a few attempts it went through. We booked the penguin encounter and also after that a ski lesson.I received the online confirmation to my email almost straight away and in the email itself there was the bookings. In no part of the email does it say about that you need to be 45mins early ( this is very important information and should be included in the email itself not in an attachment).We arrived over 15 minutes early than the scheduled start time. The first counter we went to the guy asked us to go to a different counter as we needed the online booking counter. We went to the next counter and we was behind one lady who already had been waiting awhile and no one come. So then we went straight over the penguin counter again no one came to serve us or even noticed us waiting. We then approached someone whom very quickly jumped in saying you are late no refund can be given. I asked straight away to see a manager as the way she responded made me realize very quickly that this must be a common problem that the 45min notification isn't given in the email and also that they have a I don't care attitude. Another lady came out who then told me we had booked the wrong class for skiing. To any normal person a 'beginners' class is the first class for a beginner, but no in actual fact it turns out that its a discovery class that is the first class for a beginner- staff communicated back to us that they have reported this is a common issue that is misleading and gets them a lot of issue but still are not working to fix the common problem. The woman that then came to assist was not helpful at all, trying to just get rid of us and didn't want to give us a refund and tried to tell me that finance was not working so she could not give me a refund or tell me what percent they could give back, which is totally unacceptable. So at this point feeling very frustrated we demanded to speak to the Duty Manager who was very lovely and understood our situation and agreed that what happened with timings and also confusion over beginners classes is a very common issue and got us rebooked for the penguin and issued a full refund for the ski lesson. The penguin encounter was a great experience and the trainers was great. The introduction video did not work, but the instructor quickly then resolved the issue by talking about what would have been said in the video. The penguin encounter is good value for money and would recommend it to anyone. Also inside is amazing totally different to what you expect. My only observation was is there enough safety exits and clearly signed enough? Once coming out we wanted to look at our pictures, which was another bad experience: Majority of the staff were unhelpful and didn't focus on one guest, at this point I refused to buy a picture as the whole experience has not wanted me to give of my money to the company. But my friend did decide to buy one photo, it was very quick to print and straight away handed it to us in a bad not checking it was the correct one. I told my friend to check it and good job she did as it was the wrong photo.Its a big shame that it was such a bad experience from start to end as we are working in a hotel in Ajman and If it had of been a good experience and I had of done the ski lesson, if we had of enjoyed we would have come back time and time again on our time off and also recommend it to the guests are our hotel. Being manager's in a hotel we understand not everything is perfect but we really had bad luck with our experience which was a total shame as it is a great attraction

great spot for those who miss snow. I love the available facilities even though it is much better to go out of peak hours to avoid 30 min in the queue for each fun ride. The lighting is just great, creates an impression of winter evening - shine from snow. Artificial snow might create some disappointment for the kids as it doesn't make snow balls, but that's not a big deal. The only disadvantage - offered clothes is not enough to my opinion. Went there more than once and even with my own "input" in terms of socks, pants and jamper I got very cold after 1 hour, so I'd say for not too active runners this visit needs preparations - small bag with warm staff

Amazing!. Went along for the 2hr session and had an amazing time! Located in Dubai Mall, its huge! You get your ticket, get your boots, skis (or snow board) and outfit then head to the slopes. There are lockers to put your belongings while skiing. You MUST take your own gloves or it will be unpleasant and freezing! The slope is great and is well maintained. The only thing that is ridiculous is the cost of the photo they take of you on the chair lift when you go up first time. They want £20 for it! Other than this, the whole experience is very good value and exceptional fun!

Amazing!. Ver crazy place in big shopping centre. Snow in a desert? Why not? Very ver nice abreaction after work. For 200 DHS you can spend 2 hours on the ski slope. But for me is chair lift very slow. Funny to see local people when they see snow first time.

Snow Ski in the dessert anyone?. We booked a hotel near the Mall of Emirates where ski Dubai is located. It took me months long of excitement before I have actually experienced to be inside Ski Dubai. It is simply amazing that a snow ski facility can actually exist in a deserted area like Dubai. Try to experience their different package and Iam sure you will be happy to have experienced them. In the price that you have to pay, this includes clothes (which has been heated -- probably sterilized for hygenic purposes), boots ... etc.. ) Though there is a big window glass from the mall inside that you can see -- but nothing beats having to experience the real thing. Go and spend a bit for experience sake. As a tourist, it doesnt get too expensive when you get the best experience.

Please do!. How often do you get to say you went know skiing indoors or snow skiing in a dessert. This is a must do, I thought it was great for people of all ages. Even if you don't want to ski or sled you can go in and walk around or just watch from the windows inside the mall. Amazing!

Ski Dubai. Snow in a shopping centre in the desert, it doesn't get any more far fetched. For that reason I had to visit the attraction. The cost was very reasonable and you could spend as much time as you wanted inside. I paid 200Dhs which allowed me access, clothes hire and unlimited access to the chair lift, slides etc. If you wanted to ski I believe it was 100Dhs for 2 hours skiing.

Sand or snow. If everywhere is sand, it´s wondefull go try to skiing.. or what You think? Im only look behid the window in shoppingcenter, because in Finland we have snow also in wintertime, and im holiday here. However, people look happy inside there....

Indoor Skiing!!. Its amazing to see kids playing in the snow. trolleys moving up and down.People skiing , kids sliding all at SKI Dubai, which is an indoor snow park.It is amazing to see how they have created a snow park and maintained the temperature in the desert area.Beautifully made and feels pleasant to experience this. It is very cold there as it is all snow inside.Slightly pricey, but if you enjoy snow, must try it once.
Good. Its a good place if you have not experienced snow and would like to have this experience. Its too cold so use gloves and thick socks. The place is a little overpriced for the benefits offered.

Unbelievable. Ski Slopes in Middle of the Desert. Ski Dubai is truly amazing. While the temperature soars outside, people can ski and enjoy winter activities inside. There is a large ski slope for those interested in Skiing as well as plenty of room for Ski boarding. There is even an Ice park with slides and even penguins. Incredible Experience.

Very Costly. Once we bought the tickets, we were then told to buy the gloves and beanies separately. which on top of the high price of the tickets we bought the gloves that wont get wet with the snow! As i have experienced snow before I knew it will be very cold so lucky we bought the gloves and beanies because without it I think it would of been very unpleasant. We did have a good time and the park without the slopes had some nice fun for the kids. Maybe a little thicker snow would of been nicer. Good value for families who want to experience the cold of being in the snow. Nice experience in Dubai.

Don't waste time here.... If you have seen snow before...don't waste your time in this place....it's overpriced..and most of the things are paid....after the general admission...all activities are paid..I don't recommend this place at all....if your in a 5 to 8 days tour

Unbelievable but costly. Incredible to have a ski slope and other winter sport activities inside a mall (Emirates Mall). I did not ski but rode the ski lift to the top. A wonderful experience, but be prepared to lay out cash. You have to pay even if you just want to see it and not participate. For the variety of activities available, the cost can exceed $100 US dollars.

Carving the snow in the middle of the desert, Ski Dubai!. Okay, if you are a veteran of the ski slopes this may not pose much of a challenge. Ski Dubai is attached to the Mall of the Emirates. It has, basically, two slopes and a terrain park. It is pretty cool to say you've skied in Dubai. You can walk into the mall in shorts and a t-shirt and rent everything you need to go skiing for a couple of hours. I went on a Saturday morning at about 10 am, and there was hardly anyone at the place. Mainly because people are brunching off their hangovers from the night before. The experience is relatively cheap and something different to talk about at the lodge or the chairlift the next time you are out skiing or boarding with friends. Both skis and boards are available for hire.

Excellent. Ski Dubai is a great place to spend your day in. I have been there a few times and to be honest, I enjoyed it with friends, more than I did with my family, because my little siblings weren't allowed to do much, and they couldn't ski so... However, it is a nice experience that you should have a look at, especially because it is always hot in the UAE, and we don't really see any snow here.

Fun on Ice for the family. So if you thought that it will be all hot and humid in Dubai, to make sure that you are amazed the UAE has built the worlds biggest indoor ski slope .Ski dubai is a place you can be till your hands turn blue and u know you will catch a cold as soon as you step out.Kids and adult will enjoy the place equally.

Snow Park. The Ski Dubai is located inside the Mall of The Emirates which makes it very convenient for everyone particularly for tourists since you can have a look around the mall after visiting the park. It is a good experience for people who have not seen the snow, and played with snow. It offers lots of activities, e.g. tube run which my four year old enjoyed. The Zorb ball activity has a very long queue so if you want to do this make sure you have lots of time to spend. We did this attraction on a weekday and still there were lots of people, not sure if mainly tourists. We did the penguin encounter too where we were able to touch the king penguins (there were just two). The attraction can end up quite expensive but it's worth it. I recommend getting a good pair of winter gloves. Parka, pants and boots are provided.

Excellent. If you haven't skied before you will need a discovery lesson. But my son thoroughly enjoyed it.
It's quite a sight to see a massive ski slope etc in a shopping mall.
Great fun.
snow. perfect place to chill out especially if u have never been snowy place....enjoy the indoor rope way.the snow games and if u know skiing ........

Good but expensive. Went with friends and had a lot of fun, because of the company not the place. Not saying its bad but for the amount you end up sending (approx AED 300), its not worth it. Some rides / attraction look good from outside but disappointing when you're actually on it. Skiing and Snowboarding on the other hand is totally worth it if you are good at it. Bottom line - can go once in a blue moon not regularly.

Well Made for Kids. Good For Kids who wanna have fun time playing with Snow all the way and keep practicing Skiing . I personally hate snow, but Ski Dubai had nothing which recalled me that i m not a fan of Snow, Liked it and will recommend too all thos who hate snow too :)

Pretty Fun, to say it's snow in the Dessert!. We came here one day after work. I've never Ski'd before so this was a first time experience for me! I thought it was pretty cool to say it was in the Dessert! I had a fun and would recommend someone visiting Dubai to at least go in there and see it! Great place for kids too...

Its snowing in the desert. Hard to believe that they could actually freeze area of this size, artificially. When you get in, there are all the ingredients you will find in a actual ski resort. For an amateur who cannot ski, there are other alternatives such as orb ball, slides, and lifts.You will have an option to select the color and size of the clothing (included in the ticket) including the shoes. Lockers are available for your belongings too.Take care inside, as the hands tends to get cold very quickly. Walk up to the top and get out for sometime and come back in - a nice idea for temporary relief. Avoid visiting during the weekends as it tends to get very crowded and there is fairly a long crowd for the slides and lifts. All in all a nice experience.

Enjoy the novelty. As someone who goes to the snow every year I was unsure of what to expect and whether I would enjoy it. To help give some perspective on my review I am a strong intermediate snowboarder. I have boarded in Australia, Austria and New Zealand.The snow quality was a lot better that I was expecting. It is firm without being icy. As snowboarder this makes for easy turns. Especially given the standard of equipment. The board I was given had very little wax and dullish edges. It took a couple of requests before I got the size board that I was after. For me the runs are very short but it was great to get some turns in. However after about 40 mins I started to become board and called it quits after about 70 mins. It may have been more enjoyable if I was with a group of mates.There are other activities to do such as a zip line and zorbing. I did not try these.For someone who has not had a snow experience I can see how this would be a lot of fun. Would I do it again, I don't think so. But I am glad I did it.

Family fun time!. Nice place for kids and also adults to have fun together in a safe place. Many attractions inside. Located inside the best mall in Dubai-Mall of the Emirates. So you can get and experience everything! For a mom who can't ski and doesn't have gut to do crazy things-like me :-)-still got fun!
Lovely experience. My younger son had his first experience in snow. It was a different experience and both my sons enjoyed it.

Cool off with snow play in the desert. Ski Dubai is a novelty as the largest indoor ski, snow play area in the world. The runs are not long, but fun to say you did it. Fees are moderate, by the hour or all day. There is a "snow park" area with a toboggan, tubes, etc. for the kids. No snowman making.... Winter ski clothes are provided.

Great ... for beginners. This is definitely not a long run, more for the beginners.The all-day pass is only worth it if you are a beginner and want to make the most of the learning. So I would recommend the hourly entry for others who would like to have the novelty of snow in the desert.Just be aware that the ski all-day pass does not allow you to enter the park area (slides etc) and vice versa. So if you want to 'experience' both, then best to get the hourly entry.There is also a free locker service (with a refundable deposit) which comes in handy.Perfect idea to have the skidubai in the shopping mall so that the wives can shop while the guys can hit the 'slopes'.

"Fun but real cold". I went with my five year old daughter and got the superpass (200DHS each), which gives you access to the snow park and rides. The slopes are for professionals or for people who want to take sessions. For us the rides were better. My girl enjoyed the rides and played in the snow. She only got super cold hands despite the double gloves that she was wearing. The outfit they gave us was also not enough as she was wearing light summer clothes underneath. If your kids are not used to snow, get them some heavier clothes to wear. We stayed for less than two hours only as she couldn't tolerate the cold much longer. It was fun for her, but she enjoyed the dubai ice rink way better than the ski Dubai.

Definitely worth a visit. For someone who stays a long way away from snow, to experience it in the middle of the desert that too in a shopping mall was awesome. The snow is not your regular soft type, but it works.Lots of activities for kids and grown ups alike, skiing lessons for beginners are also provided.There are photo ops with cute penguins also, but those are time bound and are charged extra.The temperature inside is maintained at a cool -3 degrees, and there is generally lot of chaos inside with people and kids running all over the place, that adds a charm to it. Personally i loved the zorb ball ride and the thriller ride.Recommended to bring your own hat and gloves, since same is not provided with the winter gear.

Its worth having SKI Dubai experience. Located inside Dubai Mall of the Emirates, Ski Dubai is the world’s third largest indoor ski slope. You can meet the Snow Penguins in an up close and personal one-of-a-kind intimate encounter that the whole family will love. Snow Penguins at Ski Dubai are dedicated to teaching youngsters and adults about the nature of this remarkable colony of Gentoo and Kind Penguins through engaging and interactive programmes.Don’t forget to watch the March of the Penguins several times a day which is free for the Snow Park guests

A great skiing intro. A busy, some what chaotic place but it all seems to work. Did the discovery and beginners skiing lessons and wanted to do more. My son did the same but with snowboarding. If your bring your own gloves and hats it saves on buying them.

See the Penguins, don't bother with the skiing. I had fun, I played with the penguins which was fun, You get to see them up close and personal, the staff there are well trained and so are the penguins.The skiing on the other hand is boring. first off, even their "expert" slope is a piece of cake and just slightly steeper than the other slopes. If you've gone skiing before this will be a disappointment as it's just two slopes to choose from. One thing I found rather amusing was that people would ride the ski lifts just to see the "sights" not sure what there is to see as far as sights go unless you're really into industrial strength cooling equipment. It only adds up to longer lines at the ski lift. My suggestion would be to visit the penguins and skip the skiing.

BEST SKI EXPERIENCE EVER. I suggest everyone to visit the SKI DUBAI located in the DUBAI MALL ,IT IS REALLY WONDERFUL,With the temperatures outside hot espectially during summer season,Its really different world in ski dubai,with the tempertues below 0 degree its really awesome,It lets us feel as if we are in switzerland or in Kashmir with full of ice blankets covered in ski dubai,it really made my day wonderful.

Worth even once a life time. I liked the activities.You have a chance to pay more and meet the penguines for 45 minutes.I didnt like that we have to buy an icecap and it was not cheap although they offer us clothes but with no icecap.I like that cameras are aloowed because inside you will definitely want to have very nice photos for u and ur friends and family.(A memorable ones :)2 hours or 3 are more than enough.
Ski Dubai. My hands and feet froooooze that day but still we enjoyed every sinnnnnnnngle second :))))))really loved it

Kids Luved It.. This was my Second Visit to Ski dubai, the First vist was some 3/4year back I opted for the bit more expensive Super Pass that allows u 10/12hours access and as many coming in & out as u like. I felt it was better as the kids get cold being "in a gigantic freezer" and they came in and out 3 to 4 times. when they got cold. Also the super Pass allows one to visit the ski Slopes and other attractions which were not around in my first visit, like the Huge Ball which they roll u down the Slope, and couple other slides.Great full day outing Kids enjoyed it, expecially as my wife was busy shopping in the Centre and u know the ids are safe once they are in.

Escape the heat. It's not everyday you get to go skiing in the middle of the desert. Fun place for the family except although we paid for an instructor for skiing on boarding boards no one attended to us. Our money was however refunded.

Great experience. This is one of those things to do before you die - ski in the desert; in a shopping mall! for the person who has never seen snow; it's a great way to check it out and feel the cold. there's many different activities rather than just ski. you can see a penguin show, have skiing lessons, Zorbing, etc. We only did the skiing for 2 hours and that was plenty. There's a painfully slow chair lift and a poma for the people who can ski. It takes a while to get to the top and not a great deal of time to hit the bottom - but it really is a bit of fun.My sons and I were really glad we gave it a go.The company is very professional with many counters and quick fit out time for boots, clothing and skis. A fraction of the time you spend on Alpine skiing. If you are a skier, I would suggest taking gloves to save buying some crappy ones as it is -4deg C inside. The hire clothing doesn't have pockets so stashing your phone or camera is difficult. For that reason I wish I had my own jacket, but it's not a hardship to whip back to your locker and re-stash.

Ski Dubai , The world of snow !. The first indoor ski resort and park in the middle east , it is located in the best city in all time and if you guessed Dubai then your absolutely right. Ski Dubai is a faux snow park and is one of Dubai's famous attraction. With so many fun and entertaining rides you will never get bored. Beside just slides and sledging , they offer snow boarding lessons and ski lessons too. Enjoy winter all year round, experience real snow fun with penguins and snowmen just like Antarctica. All this endless enjoyment for the entire day in the snow park with only 140 Dhs for children and 150 Dhs for adults , not pricy for a snow park. There is also some bummer news, you would have to wait a long line especially when your in mall , it might be crowded sometimes depending on the season and you would have to buy your own gloves due to hygiene reasons which could be a great thing and a souvenir too. Everything will be provided , helmets , suit , boots and socks to stay warm and prepared for the frosty weather. It is located in the middle of the Emirates mall in Dubai , United Arab Emirates. Now that you read about this wonderful attraction wont you give it a try ? but if you ever do , make sure you wear something cozy because it is freeezing in there !

Went for the penguins and was not disapointed. I loved being able to interact and play with the penguins! I highly recommend that you go if you have time. They provide all the jackets, gloves, pants so you do not need to bring anything but you love of animals.

Amazingly Good. We have visited Ski Dubai on many occasions and the whole family love it. Whilst I am a sun worshiper our son is not and he pestered us all of the time to Ski each afternoon. It was great fun and is an absolute must to your Dubai experience.

Skiing in the desert. Having heard much about the Ski Dubai experience, I went and tried it this week. I was amazed by the entire experience, and thoroughly enjoyed the slopes, the quality of the snow, and the overall experience. It is a unique fun atmosphere because they play music while you are skiing, and people from neighboring restaurants and the mall are watching. It's truly a fun experience, and a great place to take the family. Would highly recommend!

Wow what a snow. I visited in January 2014, payed 220 AED + 20 for a locker, You will get everything there except Gloves you have to buy them cheapest 20 AED (for me a perfect Souvenier too) its very cold there and for me as Austrian (NOT Australia) there are perfect Snow Condintions - The lift ist a litte bit slow because they took pictures of all newbies to snow but ok thats business the - Downhill will need about 30- 45 sec if you are a fast Skier - i really enjoyed the experience to go skiing in the desert - be there at 11-12:00 when i left at 13:00 it got more crowdie but for Skiing should everytime be enough place

What Fun. Skiing in Dubai - you must be mad - yes we are.About £40 pounds each for 2 hours - everything included except for gloves which can be purchased in the shop for £3It seamed really busy when we arrived as it was a holiday but the slope was really quiet - all the kids were not skiing just playing on the other attractionsThe cafe half way down the slope was closed which was a shame as it would have been nice to have a breatherGreat indoor slope - much better than others in the UK

Fun Place. I was truly mesmerized to see a snow park in the heart of the hot and very hot dubai. The rides I felt were more for kids. We went with friends and had a fun time. We did not take the skiing session. I felt the place is a little overpriced as 1-2 hours are enough to spend here ( without skiing)But nonetheless it was a memorable experience.

So much fun. Thsi place is great! definitely worth it, price includes hire of board or ski lift entry and also boots and clothes. You will have to buy your own gloves tho. they have cheap gloves but your hands will get cold. As i new this in advance, i brought my own ski gloves and used those.The slope is definantely fun, and split into 2 areas, you can get off at the half way point of go up higher for a longer steeper run. They also have a few jumpos you can do in the higher area.Easy to get to it is right int he mall.

Many laughs and memorable day! . We had no plans (like always) to go into the ski adventure, but we truly enjoyed it! She had never seen snow before so it was well worth to live this experience... Not expensive for what it is and what it includes... Just take a pair of good gloves if you are used to travel with them to the dessert because after an hour it could get chilli with the gloves they give you! Overall great experience and highly recommend it!
how fun. The penguins are a great touch. The environment is so cool to see in a dessert. It feels so real. The penguins exhibit we were told were going to be added in the next few months.

Most enjoyable way to escape the heat. Ski Dubai is the most enjoyable way to escape the heat! If you looking to get the adrenaline pumping and have some fun then its a must! Its a bit expensive but well worth it. For adults I wouldn't recommend the fun park, its more for children to go have some fun, but the 2hour Skiing session is great fun and more than long enough. They are well equipped with gear to keep you warm and have various size snowboards and ski's to use. Once you are inside it doesn't even cross your mind that you are inside a mall, feels like you could be at any ski slope in the world. Really well decorated and maintained. Will be back to do it again.

Marvel in the desert. Amazing how it can be 140 degrees outside and a winter wonderland inside.The place is truly amazing. It's beautiful and imaginative. It's expensive and uncomfortable too.I got boots that didn't fit me all that good and I didn't buy gloves cause I'm a tough Chicago guy that can handle the cold. Get the freaking gloves!!! I don't care how much they cost. After my first run down the frozen snowscape I was in throbbing pain. It had been years since my last skiing trip and this isn't snow. It's chipped ice so it feels a lot colder. My feet hurt so bad on the way down that I fell into the ice too many times. I got to the bottom and rushed to change my boots and buy gloves. My second run was much better. The trip up on the ski lift is serene and peaceful. You can either zone out and be one with the stunning scenery or laugh your $%# off watching people bumble their way down the hill. Moral of the story, don't rush it. Make sure you are comfortable before you get too excited. It wasn't as much fun as I thought it would be but still pretty interesting.

Good, but the chairlift was not working!. We had planned to spend 2 hours at the ski Dubai facility in the Mall of Emirates but ended up spending over 5 hours there due to the Chairlift not operating! The staff did let us and others use the slopes for unlimited time as we had booked the 2 hour pass, but it was very inconvenient!! Wish they had told us that it was not working when we were paying for our passes. To stand in line everytime for the individual seats to drag you up was most inconvenient, and instead of doing about 20-30 runs in 2 hours, we managed only 10-12 runs and had sore wrists at the end of the day. Otherwise the slopes were good and the skis very well organized by the staff there. However, some of the staff are unfriendly there and that must be checked by the management!!

Excellent facility and experience.. My girlfriend and I done the penguin experience here. Such good value for money. We got to hug, kiss, feed and pet penguins in a small group of 5. The setting is unique with different ice sculptures ect. This is in a great location, connected to Mall of the Emirates. Definitely worth a visit, either to ski or do one of the experiences on offer. One slight downside is that professional pictures taken here are quite pricey (as to be expected).

nice try to copy the alps :D:D:D. well skiing in the desert? its possible as we know.. the fun park isn´t worth the money thats for sure but to drive ski or a board for 2 hours and watching people who have never seen snow in their live (probably..) its funny!!! easy to reach with the metro and a little bit more difficult to find inside the mall but worth to see!

Great Experience. It was simply an awesome Experience .This place is a must visit for winter cold lovers. It is nicely developed. A fun place for every one. Well i loved it.It was a little expensive but still good.

Discover Ski in Dubai. A family holiday in Dubai during the festive season in December/January took us to the Mall of the Emirates where Ski Dubai is located. We had never done skiing before and were a bit nervous about the experience and cost. The staff at the Ski Dubai were friendly and informative and we opted for the Discovery lesson for 150 Dhirams (about 25 GBP) per person taht included warm clothing except gloves & hat (that's extra optionals), ski boots and skis for an hour's instruction. Pre-booking is recommended during busy holidays season. Changing areas are a bit chaotic but okay. We had a good instructor who taught us the ski basics and then guided us down the gentle slope. Some of us took to the ski without a fall and some fell everytime down a slope! All fun though. The place has much to offer if you are a skilled skier although it is all indoors. Just go for a lesson and you will not regret the experience. They teach little kids too as well as grown-ups.

Can you imagine Snow in the middle of Desert !!!!. Located inside MOE, one must say its one phenominal combinations of Vision, Architect & Engineering. Once you are inside the arena, one can't differentiate that its all man made. It gives you a feeling that you are somewhere in Himalyas. Penguin show is awesome. You don't have to worry about ski clothing or equipment either. Ski Dubai has thought of it all and offers winter clothing, ski and snowboard equipment. Skis will carry you down the slope, and quad-chairlift and tow lift will promptly carry you back to the top for another run.Overall a total fun and what more you expect better than snow in the middle of Desert !!!Check - Price bit high for an individual, but if you are in a group its worth it. Also you must check online for promotional rates.

excellent adventure. My family were so excited when we went to Ski Dubai. It was very well organised & easy to organise. My daughter commented as soon as she hit the cold blast that we were in the desert, in the shopping mall on a ski slope...... weird. Best two hours spent! As we went after new year the Dubai kids had all gone back to school so the lines weren't too bad. Well worth going even just to say I skied in the desert!
First indoor ski park in Gulf.. Liked the rides and cabins which takes you up high. Good for a family and teen adventure.Not very handy as it is expensive to enter.

Awesome fun with our kids.. We also paid for the penguin experience which was good. Little expensive though. My kids have never seen snow and although not as good as the real thing we had a ball!!! Spent around 3 hours of just running around having fun. Wasn't busy at all. We only left because the kids were frozen!

Fun thing to say you did it.. We did the Ski Dubai Dec 2013 just before New Years. Was very busy and long lines due to the fact that the chair lift was not working. We are a family of skiers so it was not as much about the quality of the skiing as much as it is about skiing in a large indoor facility. One of those things that you have fun with and say you skied in the Desert.

You skiied where?. So it's a relatively short slope, so it's in a mall, so it's kitschy, so they take a picture of you skiing and try to sell to you, but, c'mon, you're skiing on the bloody Arabian peninsula! Beat that! And they have size 15 ski boots for rent (my size), which many places elsewhere do not. Not to mention that when it's 130 degrees outside, a little freeze feels sooo good.

A strange one this. Skiing in Dubai felt a bit weird, but it was ok. As ever, it was expensive, and there were loads of people in there. The kids rides were entertaining for a while, and the skiing itself was ok too.

Nice. Really good Lots of good stuff to do with loads of fun.Wish we knew how to ski would have made it even better .Real value for moneyGets cold after 2 hours so take a 200 AED pass and go out and come back again. Need to improve the overall entry system.

Absolutely Amazing Slopes For An Indoor Facility. Ski Dubai is a outstanding indoor ski centre that has much more to offer then just a few slopes. The whole centre was well designed and filled with helpful staff. The entrance process is very simple and the lines aren't too long. Once you have paid for your desired entry fee you will get your equipment with ease. There are also lockers available for purchase for 40 Dirhams to store your unneeded gear. You can have a full meal at the St Moritz Restaurant in the entrance of the ski centre or have snacks in various stalls also in the ski centre entrance. I went to the ski slopes and the lines were short throughout the whole day. The snowpark seemed extremely packed throughout large portions of the day when compared to the ski slopes. The chair lifts are quite slow (5 minutes to the top) mainly for safety reasons as people have to get off at the midway point. The t-bar is far faster then the chair lifts (2.5 minutes to the top) but rather steep for amateurs. The snow is surprisingly powdery for an indoor centre and not icy at all. The slopes are snowboard and ski friendly and the staff are very exuberant. At the very top of the slope there are some flat rails and mini jumps as well as a big jump below the midway point that is opened for a short period in the evening for safety reasons. The midway slope is good for beginners who are past the point of carpet mats and the top slopes are for intermediates. Ski Dubai may not offer the largest slopes in the world but it is quite easy to improve your skills on over half a day or less and the whole place has a great atmosphere. I was blown away by how big the centre was considering it is firstly in a shopping mall and secondly in a desert. Whether you are a expert skier/snowboarder or a beginner I highly recommend trying Ski Dubai for a few hours and bringing your camera with you.

Good value and fun. This was a big highlight for our family as they were all looking forward to this. Reasonable price and all equipment provided the girls loved it and wanted to go again. Big numbers go through here up to one in the morning only down side was booking in as you can wait a while even though you booked on line

Cool down in warm weather. As already bored with other "great" Dubai attractions I expected another average fun. I am quite experienced skiier and have to admit that this was a fun. Short queues, slope is short, but not that short. For me it was a pleasant surprise!

Really fun experience when in the desert. Really is a fun experience as being in the desert you can go skiing even when it is 30-40 degrees outside. We went snowboarding as the skiing lessons were booked out as we didn't pre book. As coming from a warm climate I can't really compare it to much real snow as have only a little experience with it but was quite impressed. Makes for a fun day out for all ages and levels of snow boarding and skiing as they have various different slops and also snow based games for kids and kids at heart.

Wonderful. Snow in the Desert...can you imagine? Ski Dubai is a nice experience. It is in the Mall of Emirates. You can enjoy skiing, tobogganing and see various ice sculptures. Kids as well as adults can enjoy Ski Dubai. They provide you with special clothing like jackets, gloves and shoes to keep you warm inside.

Excellent with kids. My 3 year old loved this place. Tubing was fun and so was running around in snow!! Slightly older kids loved the skiing, toboggan and other things the place offered.For more details and pictures on our visit, see this post: http://livinglargetinylot.wordpress.com/2013/12/20/snow-fights-and-fun-galore-ski-dubai/

Experience snow in the desert...!!. Very good concept. great experience. we did not do the skiing, but still enjoyed a lot. do not forget to get hand gloves on rent. People of all ages can be seen playing with snow..
Excellent. It was a wonderful experience. Kids really enjoyed getting gift from santa. It just get freezing after while. Queues are tedious at times but over all amazing experience

Good entertainment, but not the real deal. My daughter and I attended ski Dubai today. We booked a full day ski pass.The structure and concept is brilliant, and very well executed, however it doesn't compare to the real deal.We had a great experience with obtaining our boots, skis and clothes- the all fitted first time, and were clean and dry. We hadn't really thought it through very well, so were forced to buy new ski gloves ( because we hadn't brought our own from home).It is a bit of a "one size fits all", so I would suggest that if you are a basic skier, you should take the lessons so that you have access to the bunny slope and revived a bit of guidance. My daughter, who has skied only once before (aged 9) was a bit spooked by the gradient of the part of the slope from the midway point.It is a great way to play in the snow and get a first taste of what skiing is like, but it is nothing like skiing under blue skies, with 50+ runs specific to ones ability.I would suggest the 200aed ticket that gives access to the toboggans, snow balls and perhaps the penguin experience instead of just the ski pass.
Must go when in Dubai. Do not miss out on trying sking here. If you havent done it before, take the beginner training. Its a lot of fun.

Strange to be able to ski in Dubai...But has to be done. Finally made it to Ski Dubai. As said it helps to have some experience as the slopes are very narrow and you have to be able to stop quickly. To be fair the "ski guards" or whatever they call them keep a look out & make you go for a lesson if you struggle. Gear comes with the fee but not hats or gloves so take your own!

Must do for all ages. Its a must do for all ages at lest ones. Has rides which will be enjoyed by all. The facilities offered are very good from ticketing to clothing/equipment and locking. While the rides are few they are fun. Will take about 2-3 hrs for one to complete them all. The Ski Slope is amazing to look at. The prices asked for photographs are a bit steep. Better to take photographs by yourself.

Lots of fun for the entire family. We planned our visit for the New Year Day. The park now accepts only online booking for the penguin experience and skiing, so beware. I booked the penguin experience and a visit to the Snow Park. The Snow Park was great (more on that later), but I personally thought that the penguin experience was a huge rip-off. First of all, make sure that you are at the park 45 minutes before your booked time to allow for getting your winter gear and changing. However, we were done in about 20 minutes which left us standing there and waiting. Secondly, they do not start on time, so that's about 10 more minutes of waiting. Thirdly, you book one hour experience, but it only lasts about 35 minutes, of which 5 minutes is a video of how to behave around the birds. Then as a group of 12 people, you are led to sit down and look at one penguin and take pictures with it. Then as a group you are led to sit down in another area and look at two penguins and then stroke them while photographer takes your pictures again. All in all, you look at the birds for about 15-20 minutes, and stroke them for about 1 minute. If you want pictures of the experience, you have to buy their photos. You are given snow jacket, pants, and boots, fleece gloves and thin socks, but no hats. This gear is too thin to keep you warm. I read online about Ski Dubai, and people recommend brining your own warm hats, winter gloves and thick socks, as sweaters and jeans - and this is a great advice!! After the penguin experience, we went to Snow Park and we had a great time. I would suggest buying the Super Pass upgrade because there are two attractions (the lift and the zorb ball) that are not included into the regular snow park pass. The snow park access is not timed, we were able to come out, get warmed up and eat at a cafe (by the way, be prepared that restaurant wait time to sit at a table was 50 minutes, and there was nothing but chips and salsa at a cafe to eat, all food is terribly overpriced). I would recommend getting some sandwiches and thermos with a hot drink and put them in a locker if you plan on only visiting the park and not staying at the mall for the rest of the day. You are allowed to come out for a little bit and then go back again. Slopes looked reasonably good, with several levels of difficulty, and a separate area for snowboard jumping. Will definitely go skiing next time we visit.

A real WOW........ The kids really enjoyed every minute. It was a real experience and entertainment for the family.....Located inside Dubai Mall of the Emirates, Ski Dubai is the world’s third largest indoor ski....

Nothing spectacular. Ski Dubai is very attractive from outside and amazing to see how it has been created and maintained in the desert. The prices are quite a rip off if you want to take the cable ride(costs around 200 AED per person) and they offer you free gloves which are nothing but fleece ones and don't withstand the cold.Nothing spectacular for the price you pay but the cable ride is good. You tell them your shoe size and they give you one size smaller mentioning our sizes are bigger whereas in reality they are not. We had to exchange our shoes twice. Would suggest to take your own caps and warm gloves if you intend to stay inside for more than 30 mins.

Ice Skiing in Desert City. Cant just think of anything of anything else then Ski Dubai in Dubai. Amazing -40 deg temperature to experience. This is a must visit during your tour of Mall of the Emirates.
family fun .... each family member enjoyed ... all age groups .. even if u have oldies with u ... take them for a chair-lift ride.. they will have fun

Snow in UAE. First ... Emirates mall are biggest shopping mall in Dubai city . Second they also have the biggest ski place indoor . Amazing Better come to this place in the morning time , you can easily take your ski equipment in Reception . Then rent the locker for AED 20 + 20 for Deposit Kids under 13 must wear helmet for the safety reason For the indoor activity better you prepare your time more than 3 hours in this activities.

Snow in the dessert fun. Loved it. The entrance was chaotic but the snow park was worth the wait. We all had fun on the rides and crunching snow beneath our boots. Loads of fun and a must for families.

Great place to learn. I had never skied or snowboarded before and decided on snowboarding. If this is you read on....if you thought that standing forever in queues full of strollers, small children and people generally just milling around was hard, wait until you turn up for your first lesson. When you walk through to the equipment area everything appears completely chaotic. Follow the signs on the wall i.e. queue for your clothing (jacket, pants and either ski or snowboard boots, they should give you socks too), get changed, dump your extra stuff in a locker if you decided to get one, then go get your skis/snowboard. The guys issuing these may ask some questions you can't answer yet, just tell them it's for a lesson and they'll sort you out. Then head on down to the back of the area to the ski school and wait for your instructor . A word on lessons, you'll need to take a discovery lesson if you've never tried the sport before. Then you move on to the beginner lesson. My instructor said that it's not uncommon to take a particular lesson a couple of times so don't plan on taking just one of each level. The lessons are pretty personalised with each person moving through the required skills as they master them. So as your lesson progresses you'll see people being shown how to do more advanced skills and others still practicing the basic ones. The idea is for you to feel happy with each skill. Your instructor will tell you at the end of the lesson if he thinks you could go on to the next level.

Worth a visit for all types of skiers!. Was a good experience to go to this indoor ski experience. Having real snow and all the equipment was great to experience, temperatures around -2 made it feel like you were on the slopes. Of course its a short run from top to bottom and the lifts are a little slow but to go to a hot country and then be able to ski is an amazing experience, worth a visit for all types of skiers!

Enjoyable two hours with the kids. If you have two hours to kill and like to ski then this is great. It's not so busy on the snow. As long as you can ride a pomma lift you will be ok. The chair lift is busy with people seeing snow for the first time and taking the ride. Note to Ski Dubai, please do something about shooting out the pom a lift trail. My kids who are competent skiers really had trouble with the track as it's very bumpy and as a result the ride was jerky. That being said we had a great time.
Take the kids. They will love it more than adults but it is an awesome place. Great experience for those in the warm parts of the world. We could definitely do with one in South Africa

Lift too slow!. The run is a nice size and great for practice before a holiday, however the lift takes approximately 10 minutes to get to the top and it gets very cold. It only takes two minutes to get down from the highest point of the slope. It would be good if they offered a 1hour option as we left after an hour as we were too cold.Great place for beginners

Coolest Place Ever. Such a wonderful place, and had so much fun! So weird having snow in the middle of the desert which made this even more exciting. Could have stayed all day . . . . take the kids, a must do in Dubai! Even without the kids, go play folks!!

Overrated.... The snow park area is quite small, suitable for younger children with a cable car ride for Non skiers,but very few activities ....however if able to ski the slopes are pretty good for indoor area,also has a learning centre at additional cost.

Cool. Its cool to have something like this in the Gulf. It is a tad over rated as there are only so much you can do in there. It is just too cold and you cant stay longer than an hour in there. It was -3 C when we were in there. Kids wanted to leave despite all the 'snow' and excitement. And it is just way to expensive.

Ski in the desert. For intermediate level skiers this was very cool. You come to the mall and in less than half an hour skiing. It is reasonably priced at 200AED per person for two hours. They provide everything in terms of clothes, shoes and skis. You need to get your own gloves and helmet.

Ski in the desert?. If you really cannot live without snow and ski it is worth a visit. Apart from that I doubt that it makes sense from the environmental point of view to operate a skiing hall and cool it down to 3 degrees centigrade in an area with summer temperatures in the 40s and 50s.

Visit the penguins. In November I went to Ski Dubai and paid to visit with the penguins. There were two penguins: a King and a Gentoo penguin. Both were very sweet and the guides gave each person enough time with each penguin for photos and to touch them (only the King penguin as the Gentoo was like a human toddler). We were in a group of 12 and were provided with snow suits, boots, socks and gloves which were hot to stand around in whilst waiting for the tour to start. We also rented a locker as we were unable to bring our phones / camera etc when visiting the penguins. Once we were led into the ice, it was very exciting and the guide was lovely and knowledgeable. I thoroughly enjoyed this visit and will definitely pay for the VIP penguin visit next time.

Improved Ski Dubai. It's my fourth time in Ski Dubai and this time we had double the fun as they added an additional attraction to those who've never skied before. A long time ago it was just the Snow Park, you do tubing and play with the snow that's it! But now you can ride a ski lift that goes around (for an additional fee of course), go in a giant ball plus you might catch the penguins if you're lucky (penguins are a different attraction all together so again additional fees).But I agree with some that say the price is not worth it. We only have the entertainer vouchers that's why we went in (Buy 1 Take 1), but otherwise we would have passed it up. Those who are just tourists in Dubai can check the web for anyone selling Ski Dubai vouchers. You can save a lot. Gloves and hat are not included in the price you pay. They will give you socks but it's so thin the cold will seep in through your boots. I suggest to bring additional socks and gloves and hat with you. A jacket would help as well as it's so COLD inside.

Mall Of The Emirates Ski Slope. Activities for everyone. Skiing and snowboarding, bobsleighs and ski lifts to the top of the ski slope and a small cafe. A new addition from last year is a family of penguins.

Ok.... If you've never skied before you can only sledge, go in the giant snow ball or the air lift? I had fun here but didn't think it was worth 200dhs.. I'm from London so I am use to the cold but couldn't stay here more than an hour as I was frozen!! I would suggest either bringing or buying well insulated gloves as the free ones are as good as none!! It was fun and a good experience but not as great as I expected... They need a few more activities. Great concept though.. Great for kids... Think they have a kiddies ski area too which is great for kids

Chilling and Thrilling. It is an artificial snow park that would give you real enjoyment of snow skiing and various other rides. Avalanche cafe inside provides you a wide variety of drinks. Must visit place if you are in Dubai. Temperature inside is around -4 Degree C to -5 Degree C.

Badly run and disappointing. We have skied here a few times over the past 5 years, but each time it looses its appeal. On this last occasion we booked a two hour session but left after only one hour. The whole internal area smelled strongly of diesel fumes, and when we mentioned this, one of the staff explained that they were building another ski run with chair lift. Machinery used during the night had polluted the air and we guess they had not vented the building. We were almost sick and felt very sorry for the poor staff who had to work the whole day in that stink.In addition. The clothes you are given are kept on a heap at the back of the equipment area. They are mostly in bad condition. My jacket arm was torn and couldn't hold the ski pass. The clothes smelt of sweat. After use everyone just dumps their jacket and trousers in a big bucket. Nothing is folded (or even cleaned after a days use...).On the inside of the building the paint looks old and stained especially around the cooling fans. The chair lift was being used by sight seers which caused a complete holdup for the people who had paid to ski. The snow is grey colour because they have not changed it in years. The ski boots are ropey to say the least.It high time that the management did a complete overhaul of this facility, and review their quality before expanding.I would advise anyone tempted to try this ski experience to skip it and go to the beach instead.
Amazing but expensive. Amazing place, very clean, organized, interesting and enjoyable, you feel like it's a real snow, but still it's very expensive!!
Awesome. The whole mall is a incredible. A theme park, great restaurants, heaps of shops and a large grocery store. And a ski slope ... worth a visit and you'll love it.

Good but few activities. It was nice and well organized place. But when we went inside there were few activities to do with the high prices the present.The some of the staff were friendly and others were serving people with a board face.It is one time experience, unless you are going to skiing.

Excellent Family outing for day. Good infrastructure ,Disliked - No rest area with normal temperature where one can relax as after 1-2 hrs it is impossible to be out in snow;Boot quality provided NOT GOOD enough to last 4-5 hrs, water seeps in though boots (Maybe SKI DUBAI doesn't wants you to be inside for more time) !!!

When in Dubai, why not go skiing?. I was in Dubai last week with my lovely bride and we decided we would be fools not to try this.It was $110 for the both of us and that included everything you need except hat and gloves.For indoor man made snow, it was pretty good.The lighting is very flat, making it somewhat difficult to read the snow.Boots and skis were pretty new and in good shape.There is a four seater chair lift and a pom a lift.Nothing challenging, but we had fun.The only downside was that the air seemed to smell of plastic resin.I would recommend if only for the novelty and would repeat.

Incredible!!. What would be better than to play with snow when it's 40 degree celsius out in the desert! The suits were tidy and warm. It was the first time I was skiing and I only ended up slipping and falling on the velvety snow. From the Mountain Thriller to the Giant Ball, the slides were very delightful. The proper quad chairs gave a spectacular bird's eye view of the entire park. The March of the Penguins was interesting too, however they did not allow us to touch them. It was good that cameras were permitted. Overall, it was a memorable and standout experience!!

Fun in the snow with penguins. Intendend to only do penguin encounter but to get whole snow experience went for the power pass which is valid all day.Great place to experience the snow for Australians but wish for our family with two teenagers to have only got the penguin pass where we could have still experienced the snow but not the giant ball and sled which they only did twice each. There was no way once we left the penguins that we were going back in due to the cold and handed in our boots and clothes so a power pass for the day for us was expensive.Great to experience but choose wisely which package is the best for you.Penguin experience was good as we were lucky for it to be just the four of us. We gained great knowledge on them but left feeling a little dissapointed as we were lead to believe that we would have a little more interaction with them thn what we did.Overall a good outing for the family.
Great experience. Called in to have a look and wow it's amazing. Only did the luge and zorbing this time but def try snowboarding next year

You only Live Once. It doesn't matter your skill-level. You'll have a blast. The staff and instructors are professional and most hail from the winter weathered countries from all over the globe. The cost is minimal for all that you'll receive. You can walk in with a tank-top, shorts and flip-flops and get issued all that you need to stay safe, stay warm, and have a blast. It's a great bucket-list item or a place to test skiing or snowboarding, without being submerged in the climate all day. You can purchase any of the 50 photos that their on-site photographer captures of you, marking your experience with a lifetime snap-shot. After a 90 minute session, you're back into the mall and moving on with your day. Oh, and what a great mall it is.

“for dubai,this is great”. ..Will really enjoy the place.Can enjoy ice skating ,cable car travelling,giant ball roll,slidesif you have never been in snow this would be a mind blowing experience(,i hadn't when i went there)ABSOLUTELY STUNNING

Very good for Ski Lovers. Children would love to see this place, it's like Christmas all-year-round!!! Teenagers can also show their Skiboarding moves to the delight of the viewers...If you are not a fan of snow, you can always watch everything from the Windows on the Ground & 1st Floor of the mall. Just need to be courteous to people wanting to get a souvenir picture of the Ski Dubai...

freezed!!!!!. heyyy!!! this is for the youth!!...Will really enjoy the place.Can enjoy ice skating ,cable car travelling,giant ball roll,slides etc.Jackets,shoes and gloves will be provided.(no extra payment).Only thing is you need to select the package required from the tkt counter.No time constraints.

Cool Runnings. Went for a Ski lesson in Ski Dubai and got a real VIP treatment.Turned up unfortunately late to a lesson that i had booked for a beginners introduction to Skiing. When we arrived i explained and apologised for the poor time keeping and was told it isn't a problem we will look after you. We waited for the beginner slope to clear from the lesson that we were supposed to be on and the instructor took us out. As i had no previous experience of Skiing i was a bit apprehensive of hitting the slopes within 40 minutes i was able to easily manoeuvre around the slopes. Had a brilliant lesson and would definitely recommend this to everyone.10 out of !0

for dubai,this is great. if you have never been in snow this would be a mind blowing experience(,i hadn't when i went there) . But if you have already lived or been in such snowy places or been skiing this would just be an ok-ok thing to do. But if you live in Dubai,this is really a great place to go,you will definitely enjoy. We(couple) enjoyed it alot. the whole experience of snow and skiing fun. Once in Dubai, this is a must-doLockers are available,you also get dresses and boots for rent if you want or you can bring your own. There is also a shop outside it if you need anything.,changing room is neat and clean.some might feel the whole idea of snow in mall weird,but as i have mentioned earlier snow in dubai that even is wonderfulLocation: this is located in Mall of Emirates in dubai,you can take metro or cab to the mall.The ticket prices are 200 AED for full day pass if you want access only to the snow park and ridesFor skiing i think it is 200 for 2 hours

Been there, done that :). For a girl form Norway, borned with skies, this was only a been there, done that experience :) Opened the ski seson in Dubai is pretty cool though.It was cool to ski inndoors, but I prefer the mountains at home.... a big plus for the staff working there. Friendly and serviceminded. Good value for the monet. A two hour skipass costs AED 200 inc skies and dress.

SNOW IN THE DESERT REALLY. Okay the penguin show whoa awesome, We paid to touch them and get the experience. Very very good experience. Pay for the picture, it's really a memory. There are no penguins better trained than these. The snow slopes were icy, very crowed and pricey but well worth it. My family loved it. A must do if you come to dubai.

Mixed feelings about ski dubai. As a first time snowboarder I was extremely excited to experience this in a safe environment. Upon arrival we made our way to the counter to purchase two day passes to the snow slopes and unfortunately this is where my devastation hit. The lady behind the counter asked if we had experience which my partner has however I didn't therefore was happy to take a first timers lesson to get me on my way. The lady proceeded to advise that not only did I need to complete a first timers course at 150AED I also needed to complete three other courses (make it to level two) before I could access the snow slopes. Although shocked at the requirements I was eager enough to get out there so I booked into the first timers class and off I went - our instructed Nina was fantastic and very patient with those in her group. Once we had finished I made my way to the counter to be told that there was no additional courses being held that day, therefore I could not access the snow slope at all. At this time my partner had already purchased his day pass and was out on the slope, so really the only option for beginners is to take lessons or entertain yourself in the snow park (great for kids, however I chose not to go with this option). It was highly disappointing that they had no beginners slopes which could be accessed for practise by those with any level of experience. I headed out for a day of shopping whilst my partner made the most of his snow slope pass. Later on in the day I attempted to book into the penguin encounter, to kill a bit of time the same lady as before advised that it was available however photos were not part of the package therefore I would have to ask the camera counter regarding the cost of these (you can't take your own camera in), when I returned to book the encounter it was fully booked up for another hour. By this point my attempts to enjoy what Ski Dubai had to offer had run out and I gave up on this experience. My recommendation would be to plan ahead if you want to access the snow slopes but have no experience, look at the lesson timing and book in advance to ensure you get to partake in what ski Dubai have to offer.

A bit of fun - especially when it's quiet. Spent a couple of hours here today just nipping down the slopes and then taking the chairlift back up. Hardly anyone around so really enjoyed making the most of the (fairly short) runs. Not too pricey for what it is - fun to say you've tried skiing in the desert!

Cooolllzzyy. I got almost frozen and every one else with me enjoyed a lot... hahaha.. Well i wanted to thank the Security Lady sorry i forgot her name.. when one of our family member got lost she took it on her and found her as phone and announcement dint work as it was very loud... over all it was a cooolzzy experience...

Penguin encounter rocks!!!. Ski Dubai is a great place, the ski slopes are probably more for kids, but penguin encounter is fun even for grown-ups. I found penguins to be extremely cute, we had good fun! The pictures with penguins are very expensive though :(.

Granny's Great Adventure. This is a wonderful experience.Every age and ability is welcome. Happiness is being able to ride the ski lift and get a hot chocolate. Perfect adventure for the slower moving adventurer.

Fantastic. 200dhrs for ski kit ,ski hire ,lift pass .There was no queues ,two hours of total fun . I brought a hat and ski gloves with me so I didn't have to buy them (yes you will need them )in comparison with other things to do in Dubai this is really cheap.lockers are 20 dhr and you get that back when you leave .
Penguins. Went to meet the Penguins this was brilliant always wanted to do this and could not believe that you could do it here worth a visit

Skiing Indoors. Did this just so I could say I skied indoors in the desert. The run is pretty short, but you can get some turns in. The place was pretty empty when I went so in retrospect, it might have been cool to learn to snowboard or try something different.

Wonderful !. We went for Ski Dubai with kids and as a family we enjoyed the snow . The snow zorbing , tube rides and the chair lift was great . A great place but be careful with the kind of entry passes you choose.We took the Snow passes(300 AED per head ) which included the Penguin Encounter along with the Snow park and zorbing . The penguin encounter is higly overrated where one could touch the penguin and click a picture with the penguin . While touching the penguin would be for few seconds , one has to pay minimum 200 AED for a picture .It is better to see the penguins from the snow park rather than pay extra for the penguin encounters.Ski Dubai is wonderful but very expensive . A full day pass is good when someone wants to ski but to experience the snow park and do the various rides . one does not need a full day pass. 3-4 hours in enough for visiting the snow park .

Only in Dubai!. Only in Dubai can you go snow skiing any time. One of those things you need to do once to say you have done it. Cold inside - not like an ice rink where the floor is frozen. All runs very basic and the lift ticket is all inclusive including equipment and clothes. If you don't go in and ski, at least stop by and take a look.
Unique. Ski Dubai is worth seeing just to see what oil money can buy. Not overly expensive but not "great skiing" either. Something you won't see anywhere else.

Refreshing experience. Something you least expect in a desert country =DI am from a tropical country(all-year summer), this is the first time that I been to such facility, I find experience is quite refreshing. Although this is a ski facility, we were just hanging around at the snowpark area. We stayed till the meet-the-penguin session then rushed out for a hot chocolate.Some points:1) If you intend to stay there for long, do get the gloves and hats. It get really cold there.Gloves and hats are not include, so do bring along yours or buy from there. 2) Do check if there is any entertainer voucher for the place.

Go late and on a weekday!. We have been here many times before. The day before we went there, we ate in the Cheesecake Factory with a view of the slope. It was about 9-10 pm and we noticed that it was very quiet. We therefore visited the attraction the following day at around 9 pm. We used Entertainer vouchers to get a free snowpark entrance and if you pay with Mastercard you can also get 20% off. The snowpark is great for young children and at that time of day, there were no queues and they could ride the different activities again and again without waiting.
its wonderful. its the best thing in dubai , we just love being there .even though we dont know to ski but its really wonderful to be watching people ski there .we love the way its planned .

Nice ice. We went with the intention of getting a skiing lesson however they were quite booked up on the day we went to the mall, so instead I convinced my wife to do the Ski Park pass which gave us access to the Zorbing, chair lifts and tube rides which kept us well entertained while our friends carved up the slopes. Very good fun.
