Good fun, really cold!. Ski dubai is really cold inside. The jacket and pants they provide do a good job of keeping you warm, but you got yo buy your own hat n gloves ( aed 75) for both. You might want to bring your own! The snow park access is pretty useless on its own. You need the super pass.... Which gives you unltd access to the rides ( just 4 different rides). Plus you can exit and re enter the park the whole day.We really enjoyed the chair lift up to the avalanche cafe, where the hot chocolate is great with marshmallow toppings. The slopes looked amazing and it was a pity you couldn't try skiing without buying the slope pass. Good for a one time visit. Pretty expensive after upgrading to the super pass and buying the hats n gloves.

Freezing in the mid-summer desert. Once you've gotten it through your head that it's indoors and not quite the Alps experience you understand that this is a very practical (or maybe impractical due to the energy consumption) solution to itch that skiing itch you may get mid-summer without having to fly 1500 miles. It's also a great place for those who want to learn to ski in a relatively safe environment because the slopes were clearly created having that progression in mind.

go for super-pass. ski dubai is located in mall of emirates. you can spend half day out there. b coz area there is not too big since its completely indoor a mall. costumes and boots are given there by them on normal tickets as well. but you have to purchase hat and gloves to survive in -4degree temperature. normal tickets includes just roaming which is no fun. if you add just 80 AED in normal ticket, you get super pass. which includes 4 free rides.and if you are skier, you can buy skiers pass and burn some of your calories.3 to 4 hours inside is more than enough. you can continue your day with shopping outside in mall. :)

Great Novelty Value. Brilliantly conceived , built and supported. What Al Futtaim has created here is a must see for any resident or visitor.Even experienced skiers can enjoy the slopes and benefit from a pre holiday warm up. Great for kids too.

Saw Penguins!. We went on the penguin experience and got to meet three penguins. Bear in mind, you do need to book first but we went there and only had to wait a couple of hours for a free slot (and you are in a shopping mall so lots to do). It was a lovely experience. There are lots more snow activities to take part in however we only went to see the penguins

How can you beat a couple of cool hours of skiing. What a brilliant idea. Skiing is something that normally requires an entire holiday, or at least a full day. Hiring equipment, ski lift passes,... It is an expensive sport, and y would only do it if you really wanted to ski at least a full day. Here in Dubai you can ski for a couple of hours or play on a snowboard, are the entire family, introduce them to skiing, check out if people enjoy the cold and snow... It is a good exercise, it is safer than real skiting as there are no rocks and trees. Sure it is artificial and not extensive, but heck, for two hours of ski experience it is perfect.Everything is supplied for you, and even during the 2 hours skiing you can go down and swap your board for some skis - like I did. There's even a cafe where kids/mums/dads can pike out, or grandma can sit there and watch the family.Excellent facility.

Better than expected. Fun experience. Easy set up with everything taken care of (except for the gloves, which you must buy). One complaint is it is quite expensive- a 2 hour lift ticket is the same as a full day ticket to Whistler or Banff or other world class mountains. Those of course are not in the desert. The fun of this place is really the novelty of it all.

some thinf different. love the place .. its new in the gulf area .. some thing different but amazing .. on the other hand its expensive in every thing !!! the entrance ticket , the gloves and hats , the photos !! we spend more than 2000 Dirhams
So much Fun. our children's first experience in snow and this was just so much fun for them. They did not ski but there were many other kids activities that kept us busy the whole day

Snow in the desert ? Yes its possible!. Had a wonderful experience visiting here. Where else would you be able to ski in the snow while being in the desert? There are many other things to do there other than just to ski. Make sure you get some gloves it is vary cold.

the impossible is possible in dubai. yes snow in 47 degrees of heat, it can be achieved in the mall of the emirates. lovely apres ski chalet style bar runs from outside through to the ski area. lots of cheap food outlets to chose from.
Birthday Trip. The two younger members of our party used this they loved every minute. They did it for 2 hours party of which was instruction all the equipment is supplied gloves etc.,

Penguin encounter blew me away.. Went to ski Dubai for my 18th birthday to do the exclusive penguin experience. Although they messed up the booking they sorted it out straight away so no complaints. The experience was absolutely amazing! Our guide Dennis was absolutely fantastic and not only did he tell us everything we wanted to know, you could tell he was happy in his job. He went out of his way to make my birthday special and even gave me a picture that we'd watched a penguin paint! Getting to kiss, cuddle and play with the penguins is an experience I will never regret! Thanks ski Dubai...I'm beyond impressed!!!

Fun day at the mall. If you want to do something a bit different in Dubai,, Ski Dubai is a great attraction to try. Whilst the concept of building an artificial ski slope in one of the hottest countries in the world doesn't exactly promote a sustainable energy strategy for the region, it is fun nevertheless.Be sure to dress up warmly. It is -3 degrees Celsius inside the ski hall. Ski gear, ski suits are provided butti is advisable to bring your own hat and gloves (or purchase them cheaply at nearby H&M). It is not cheap at 200 AED for 2h but with the Entertainer 2 for 1 voucher it is not too bad.Slope is good and accessible for beginners. I think experienced skiers might be a bit disappointed when they are used to skiing in the Alps but need to take it as an hour or two of fun in the mall.Cafe next door is very cosy and food is reasonably priced. Would come here again once I crave a bit of cold weather and exercise.
Very cool!!!. Who would have ever thought you could go tubing and skiing in the desert. This place is really neat and a little pricey but fun.

fun even for advanced snowboarders. Spent a diverting morning here the day I left Dubai.It felt a bit like being in a snow globe or aquarium. I could look out and see Virgin Records and other mall stores, as well as tourists pointing and taking photos. It was kind of fun to take photos of them taking photos of me!I bought a package with includes snow park + 2 hours of snowboarding. Spent about a half hour in the snow park trying out zorbing, snow tubing, and tobogganing. Then turned in my snow shoes for snowboard boots and went straight to the "summit".I like that all the jacket / pants / socks were included, and they were in good condition. My snowboard boots were brand new. The board was also decent, although not waxed enough.There's mini-park with a straight box, rainbow box, a small jump with a jib feature on top. 2 lifts, but they both start / stop in the same place. The chair lift is really slow and unfortunately, you can't get on it half way. The button lift appears to be faster, though it also looks tricky - bumpy and steep with a big curve in the middle (I didn't try it).The run from the top is a good intermediate run. Not powder, but not super icy either. They appear to have some good slopes for learning too.It was crazy packed during the weekend, when I was originally going to go. I changed my mind after I saw the crowd and decided to come on Monday morning instead, at opening time. I'm so glad I did. There was no line at all for anything. More people started to arrive as I left, but still nowhere near like the weekend. One of the workers told me that the line for the zorbing can be 3 hours long. Since I was the only one doing the zorbing, I did it twice in a row and both times, the guys working there were kind enough to take a bunch of photos of me inside and outside the ball.You might get pretty bored with the snowboarding if all you do is go up and down. If you're there alone, definitely bring some tunes for the SLOW lift ride. Since I don't do rails or boxes, I managed to amuse myself by practicing ground tricks like 180s and buttering. It's nice because there was virtually no one to avoid on the slopes, no nasty weather, and decent snow. Although I did hear that the snow quality worsens throughout the day. Another good reason to arrive at opening time, if you can manage that.By the way, I did happen to notice that there is a bar overlooking the ski slope that offers gluhwein. Would have been a nice way to cap off the experience, if I didn't have to catch my flight.

Super experience!. Really enjoyed a couple of hours on the indoor slopes! We went during the week, and early in the morning so it was quiet which was great as I am just a beginner! Recommend wearing a sweater (not just a t-shirt) as the ski jackets provided are not the warmest!

beautiful attrection. one of the most attrected place situated in the Mall of the Emirates if you want to enjoy the Ski highly recommended to visit this place you will never be regreted as so many things happening in the said shopping Mall which is happened to be the biggest mall of the world.

Kids loved it!. Our kids have never tried skiing until we got here. It is a giant freezer with not just ski runs, but a small snow park with a toboggan ride, a circular tube ride and a giant ball that rolls down the slope with a rider in the centre. Prices were cheaper than in Australia and experience skiers could ski the whole day, with every piece of equipment provided. Ski and snow boarding lessons were available but probably best to book them on-line as time slots and spaces are limited.

Wonderful restaurant (switzerland tipe). It was incredibile, near the windows, through we see skier, we were seating in the restaurant arranged like mountain hgotel(wood, fire place). The food is excellent, the prices were resonable.And I had the excellent coctail ( mochito)

Desert snow. Maybe a bit over-priced, but, caters to all ages with the snow park, penguin encounter, slides, skiing, snowboarding and an indoor chairlift to a wood cabin, where you can enjoy a cup of hot chocolate.

To crowded to enjoy. Needs more organization regarding the numbers of tickets sold , it was too crowded we couldn't enjoy it to the max or even close. I guess time frames would be a good idea or a whole day multi entry ticket might help solve this problem. Especially in peak seasons . U The idea that once u r out u can not re enter is ridiculous . Visitors should wear warm clothes sine it is very cold inside and the clothes they give are not warm enough especially the socks.
unbeleivable. to find this place in a shopping mall blows your mind. they supply everything you need to ski,tabbogan except the gloves and hat. I paid £20 for a few hours andLOVED EVERYMINUTE
Not worth the money. You can ski only after a certain hour of ski training and apart from that the rest of the fun rides are no fun at all. May be for little kids but certainly not for adults.

Exactly what it should be. Great fun. Do not go expecting to ski the Alps or Vail. When you go to Disney you don't see real castles you see a version. You don't see real pirate ships you see a version. This is a Disney version of skiing. I went to Dubai for one day and took a cab to the mall to see the slope. I did not intend to ski. As soon as I saw it I had to try. I found it very inexpensive ($30 for 2 hrs included rental skis and coat and pants. Had to pay extra for gloves. The slopes were not a challenge and could be handled by the most basic skier lots of kids in classes. Extra activities for kids like tubing sledding and sliding down an ice track. Would do it again and again. Hint. The chair lift is very slow. Use the poma lift on the side much faster and you will double your runs
Great work. In a city which has the temperature so high, building a place like Ski Dubai is amazing. Not much in the sking but still had a great experience playing with the snow and the slides.
Be freeeeeze in the summer. The whole family will enjoy the Sky but you can not stay for more than an hour because it is -3 degree. But it is costly

Snow in the desert. Having lived in Dubai for over a year we finally visted Ski Dubai with some visitors. It was more fun than I expected and I highly recommend a visit. The snow activities were a lot of fun, I recommend opting for the Super Pass and definitely recommend arriving as early as possible to avoid some of the crowds.

Just crazy, snow in the desert. We walked by the slopes and wanted to have this experience. Just the idea is crazy to ski on snow in the middle of the desert. The slope itself is okay but not special. After 40 minutes i got really cold. Funny experience and a nice story for home other than that its average.

Good...at least once :-). We had a great time at Ski Dubai...but it isn't something I put on my to do list but once. Although we go to Dubai often, we have only been there once. The insane amount of people makes it nearly impossible to truly enjoy. But it is worth going...once :-)

first time. I was a bit apprehensive as to what to expect upon arriving. but thoroughly enjoyed every minute.staff where everywhere to help. never even been on skiis before,fantastic well worth the fun.
Let it snow. Not much of a ski slope, but hey, it's in a mall. It's a must-do while in Dubai. Had a bunch of fun. Bucket list item now checked off.

Not bad for an indoor slope. I went skiing on a public holiday,one of the busiest days of the year no doubt. The chairlift was busy with non-skiers just taking a ride, but the attendants gave skiers and boarders priority so very little waiting. The slope itself was not crowded (far less busy than the indoor slopes in the UK). I enjoyed two hours on the slopes and it was good to ski for the first time in 2 years. The slope was well groomed. I have only two areas for improvement:(a) the chairlift moves really really slowly. It takes around 8 minutes to get to the top and less than a minute to ski down! If it could speed up a bit, it would be good, but I guess the pedestrians won't be able to get on and off.(b) Take your own gloves. I bought some for 70 dirhams from the shop but my finger tips were FROZEN after an hour so they were useless.

It's Fun, But Busy!. My husband and I visited Ski Dubai for the first time recently and took a Discovery Level skiing lesson. We had a good time, though the area where our lesson took place was crowded (several group lessons running at the same time) so we each only had time for 4 runs down the small beginners' slope before they ushered us out. The instructors were helpful, though it was somewhat loud in there and hard to hear them. Neither of us had ever skied before but we were able to master the very basic skills they taught us, namely skiing down a very very small incline and successfully slowing down/stopping. I would have liked to have twice as many runs down the hill though, in order to make the price really worth it. When you book your lesson you are warned to arrive an hour early. We did and checked in, but didn't think we would need all that time to get our gear, so we reentered the mall and shopped for a few more minutes before coming back. It was so crowded, however, that it did take us at least 30 minutes to get our boots, ski clothes, and skis issued and all sorted out. So, if you are coming during a popular time, definitely give yourself 40+ minutes so you aren't stressed about missing your lesson. Our lesson was in the afternoon during the Eid holiday, so Ski Dubai (and the mall, and the entire city) were jam-packed. There were so many people milling around in the changing areas I felt claustrophobic--it would be nice if the facility was a little more orderly. Overall, yes it is a bit pricey for such a short lesson, but you can't beat the convenience of having all the clothes and gear issued to you and being able to walk right out and continue your shopping afterward. You ALSO can't beat the "cool" factor of being able to say you skied indoors. For someone who has been living in the Middle Eastern heat for a while, the chilly winter air in there was so refreshing! Bring a hat and gloves if you have them--we paid 20 dirhams extra each for gloves because we didn't have any. Also be prepared to pay extra for a locker to store your stuff. We enjoyed our experience--minus the crazy crowds in the entrance area--and can see ourselves going back again.

Good fun. Saw snow after ages. Visited with my wife and nephew. They had a ball!! The rides are fun. I suggest not more then 2 hours in there. Also, make sure you get the right shoe size as I got a size small and was very uncomfortable.

Fun for all!. Not the cheapest attraction but for a snow slop in the middle of the dessert it really isn't to expensive lol. My partner & I had a great time, we board at home and had been away all winter so were getting our fix! I would only recommend paying for 1 hour of boarding/skiing if you are only going to use the slops and not the jumps or park. There is also other things to do in there but they charge extra for everything!! Take Gloves as they DO NOT include them in any hire prices, and you will have to purchase new gloves. There are a cheap option for gloves but they are not water proof for long, especially if your hand touches the snow for any period of time!Real good fun though!!

Not worth the detour. They did install a very small ski-slope in the middle of the Mall which is one of the megalomanic fixations they have : bringing snow in the desert ! Anyhow it's small and it gets very crowded.

Snow in the dessert. I am not sure who thought of this attraction but good job. Fun for a family, couples or teens. An indoor adventure skiing and snow boarding or sledding. You can rent clothes and skis for playing in the snow. It is not cheap. If you want to just ride the chair lift and not play that is ok too.

bored after my first run. Since its the only ski run, it can get very crowded. And because of the size, you can get bored after your first run. Any real skier or boarder can enjoy the idea of it. but it's not worth your time to actually go down it.

Wonderful. We went there with the children in April 2013.Ski Dubai is located inside Mall of the Emirates which is a huge mall in Dubai.It's kind of a huge dome inside the mall.We got all-day tickets for about 250 AED for adult and 150 for children (prices may have changed since then).This gets you a nice warm suit, socks and shoes and a helmet for children.You still need to buy a hat and gloves for a good price.You can also rent a locker for your stuff.One thing, if you do not know how to ski, you need lessons before you can ski or snowboard there.Lessons are provided there for a fee (did not take my self).It's huge in size and contains a large snow cavern, bobsled track, and observation tower.You can take a chairlift ride even if you can not ski, just to have a look from above of the dome.At the end, we enjoyed a nice penguin show.You can spend the whole day there and even you can go out and back again if you still keep their braclet.Once we finished, we continued the day shopping at the huge mall.Definitely worth seeing in Dubai.

Kids favourite. My children aged 12 and 15 went into ski Dubai they absolutely loved the experience as living in Perth Australia we don't see snow. They loved the whole theme they have going on it is like a magical wonderland, they didn't get the chance to have ski lessons but when we return they will definitely return and ski. The penguins were gorgeous, overall excellent !

Good fun. They only had 2 runs open at the time I went, but it was still worth it. I would say 2 hrs is the limit there, though - not enough runs to keep you occupied for longer. And it is indeed cold - get the gloves that you have to pay extra for!
Loved it!. Really enjoyed our visit here, so much to do and excellent helpful staff. Didn't wait long for activities, and not too busy. Would go again.
great work of engineering. The emirates mall, where the skiing is located has a beautiful main entrance, unfortunately the location of the skiing is next to a rather unkempt food court

Lots of fun and quick to defrost. Probably little to interest the experienced or hardcore but a great place learn or try. Why go to ski fields if you are not sure or needing lessons. I skied, shopped and water parked in the same day

Great experience. Make it a day out for shopping and pleasure at this great mall and don't forget dinning as well my 2 teens loved it so much and they just kept going till they got hungry,, and also you have to see the penguins show...it's nice
Snow in Desert. This place should be registered as 8th wonder of the world. Its full of snow and a penguin show and ski slopes better than swiss alps.

Ski dubai does not allow skiing. Been to ski Dubai in Oct 2013. We asked the ticket office for tickets to ski. We were told NO - you cannot simply ski. You need training lessons first - first training is at 20h00 at night. After 3 lessons it would be ok to ski. Training lessons are very expensive and can take 203 days we were told, so we could not ski - what a disappointment. All the way there and no ski. avoid this overpriced place at all cost !!! Why not allow first timers to practice on their own on the small slope on the side ? I would have signed an indemnity form - no problem. !!

Fun! But not that much…. It’s a good experience to ski on the “middle of desert”. The lane, however, is not that big and the price is a little high. You can definitely scape from the warmness of the Middle-East desert, but that can be a little expensive. I couldn’t spend more than 3 hours inside, because there were not so many things to do there. If you have time, go. But if you’re going to stay in Dubai for a short period, you can skip it.

Height of luxury!. its almost unreal.... snowpark, ice skating and penguins in the middle of the desert! there is a separate section for the experienced... this is something to tell to your grandkids... stories of best places you hv been to :)

Well worth the money!. A fab afternoon out snowboarding. Value for Money as includes all hire of equipment. Gloves available there or bring your own. Friendly staff always willing up help a whole day is a little much going up and down the sane slopes but the mall makes for some good shopping!

SNOW IN THE DESSERT. a wonderful experience especially for those who do not have snow fall in their countries did not go onto Ski slope but enjoyed the extreme chill and man made snow and the various ice scultptures etc my kids enjoyed it and we all had a blast ...being kids again was fun ...make sure your hands and ears are covered as its really freezing even though you are provided with really warm jackets etc was worth the visit , a must for the whole family to enjoy .

Fantastic 2nd jump!!. Did my first jump here last year and then couldn't resist doing it a 2nd time and making my other half unwillingly join in haha! And if you're doing a 2nd jump you get a discount too!! DVD & pics included it's just an experience you need to do! The palm location doesn't open until 1/2nd of September and closes around June time (check up on the dates they are subject to change) so if you're coming here to jump over the palm really check the dates so you're not disappointed!

Temperature -2 degrees Celsius. I with my wife and two kids aged 9 and 3 spent one hour in SKI Dubai and enjoyed it thoroughly. The temperature inside was -2 degrees Celsius , but the outfits provided keep you warm. The kids enjoyed the snow fight and made a small snowman too. You should get socks for the kids as the socks provided are for adults only.

ice in desert ,, WOW. when ice get in desert really it s was amazing the first indoor ski resort in the Middle East! With an amazing mountain-themed wintery setting, enjoy skiing, snowboarding, tobogganing, or just playing in the snow with my family

An OK experience.. If you have seen the original, then this is waste of time, money and energy. However, the authorities have made it a great place and adequate precautions are taken for the safety of the visitors.
Amazing.... Where else in the world can you go snow skiing and tubing when it's HOT outside.. Must experience while in Dubai.

All their outdoor snow melted. Never skied before, let alone in the middle of the dessert. As a double surprise the instructor was from Morocco which apparently has some very good skiing. He was great and by the end of the hour has us hurtling down what seemed like Everest's steepest slope but when looking back was a mere gradient. LolIf you have never skied you need to do the discovery class first, but as I said you will actually do a lot of skiing on it, so don't fear! It's a lot easier than I thought it would be.They tell you to arrive an hour before your lesson which is nonsense, 30 mins is fine to pay and get set up. They supply free socks, and if you want gloves don't buy theirs (£60 plus) just go to one of the shops next door or opposite in the mall.

Paradise in Desert. Visited Ski Dubai 2013 with my wife and sons 7 & 8. They enjoyed this place The Entrance is for the Park only or you can opt for 3 Rides Sledge ride down the slope, Roller ball were you are placed in the huge ball with adequate padding and pushed down the slope and Cable car ride. We are given socks, shoes,ski clothes, ear pads and snow cap when we enter and place is freezing at -4C is maintained and reading of temperature readings are placed on various locations.I had taken the 3 rides along with entrance and it was worth it my kids enjoyed and the cable car ride open with 4 seats for 2 km was just amazing. All the rides were good and they also have a penguin show every hour, Ice carvings when we enter are also just amazing. Overall it is a must visit place in Dubai

Over-priced, poor health precautions. Two main problems, first it is over-rated and I go tricked into buying "super-pass" tickets to use all facilities inside to find that most attractions could be reached for a cheaper price. Just buy the ice-park ticket and donot fall into this trick, you may upgrade your ticket later on if you wish.My son, 3 years old, almost died from hypothermic coma. Thank Allah, Iam a doctor and suspected this and had to run through the park to warm him up outside while he was in coma and stayed motionless for almost half an hour. There were absolutely no warnings given on your way in, later on i found that they do have a warming chamber but nobody notified us where it was to access it in case of emergency and nobody cared to ask what was wrong or offer help as I ran all over the place with an almost dead child in my hand and then sat on my own warming him with my clothes in the dressing room. Another child whose parents may have not suspected this could have been dead within a few minutes.
high price but good. ski Dubai is also worth seeing specially in the desert. There are also few ride which though have long lines but still it is good specially for the kids.

Good Fun, Friendly - but a little tatty round the edges. I had a couple of hours before my Airport pick-up and thought this would be fun, being an OK skier (not very regular), and having used indoor slopes in the UK before I knew what to expect. The slope itself is good and given that it's inside is bigger than I expected. The 'expert' short run isnt really expert, you might consider it a difficult european 'blue' rather than a 'red', but it's nice to have a variation on runs. The staff were great, very helpful and polite and the hire desks very efficient so not a lot of hanging around to collect gear etc.The Skis I had were terrible, no edge at all and very battered, which was a shame - I guess I could have swapped them but that meant trudging all the way back to the desk. That said, they were good enough to be fun for the 2 hour session.The clothing that's included is OK and warn enough - but there are no pockets (that I could find) in either the trousers or the jacket (except one very small one on the arm to keep your pass in) - so I couldn't take my camera or wallet in with me, which was a shame, however the locker facilities are fine and secure.Travelling up the button lift though you notice how dirty the walls are, and there are cracked windows on the TGI Friday's that overlooks the slope, also you see a lot of water staining and just general grubby marks - of course this dosent impact your enjoyment of the slope, but it just seemed a shame when so much money had gone into creating a ski-slope in the middle of the desert!I had a really good time, 2 hours is plenty long enough before you get bored of spending as much time on the lifts as you do coming down - but thats the same in some outdoor resorts.All in-all a good way to spend a couple of hours at reasonable value for money, and overall I enjoyed my time there.

A novelty but nothing more.... Skiing in the desert is a novel concept but like many novelties, they are often more gimmicks than anything else. The run is only about 100m so if you're a half decent skier then you'll get bored before you even arrive. If you've never skied before or have never been to the snow then give it a try. Of course, it's man-made snow so it isn't really like the real thing but it's undoubtedly the closest you'll ever get in Dubai.

Snow in the desert. Every time we visit Dubai, we make sure we go to Ski Dubai.The kids enjoy their time, playing with ice, taking photos, skiing on the ice, watching the penguins etc. they realy enjoy uf.

okay dokay. its a experience only for folks not seen snow before otherwise its a waste of time. my kids were adamant as they hadnt been in snow so they wanted to experience it. too chilled as it machine operated i guess. so cant stay for more than 1 hr. but we did get the best out of it as we seen the penguin parade. super

Amazing. Amazing to see a ski area in the middle of the mall...outside it was 107(f), inside during the day, it's 30, and 20 in the evening.There was a shop where you could purchase appropriate clothing and there about 6 slopes to ski on, including one for the more advanced skier.

Fun time at Ski Dubai. I had a fabulous time skiing at Ski Dubai. The staff were efficient and helpful and you were sking in no time at all. The run is about 400 metres long and is "elbow" shaped. There is a slightly steeper part on the right hand side of the chairlift but I wouldn't call it "expert" as rated. The slope wasn't busy when I was there (quite early) so you could catch the chair straight back up each time without waiting. The electronic ticketing system is great and tells you each time you go through the gate how long you have left of your 2 hour pass. Make sure you rug up. The ski suit you are given is not particularly warm and the slope is not long enough to get a sweat or the heart rate up, so rug up to avoid the cold setting in.If you are looking for a fun experience (quite surreal when you think about it) I would certainly recommend you try Ski Dubai for a few hours of entertainment.
Cold. It was amazing to see this ski resort in the middle of the Emirates shopping centre but entrance was quiet expensive but we considered it a one off experience

A fun respite from Dubai's heat. We visited this attraction simply because it was my 10 year old son's one requested activity while in Dubai. He loved it and wanted to return and I loved watching his enjoyment.
Not a cheap activity but a fun way to chill out if travelling with children.

Skiing in the desert. Expert or novice, you have to try this!! I hadn't skied for 24 years, but was determined to give this a go. I paid for a 2 hour session which was plenty, though full day options are also available. Worked out to around GBP20. All the equipment is provided : skis, boots, salopettes and jacket... even a pair of disposable socks. The only things not provided are woolly hat and gloves, which are available to purchase.I had a whale of a time. The only downside was the slow speed of the chair lift, which meant it took a while to get back to the top. Oh and be warned... going from -4 to +36 degrees in a matter of 2 minutes is quite a shock..!! For the non skiers, there's a toboggan run (with inflatable dinghy type things) or the snow park.All in all, a great way to spend a couple of hours.
Superb .... Ski Dubai is the first indoor ski resort in the Middle East and offers an amazing snow setting to enjoy skiing, snowboarding and tobogganing, or just playing.

If you like to ski, you really have to give it a try!. Okay, we're a couple of middle-aged ladies who like to ski, and we figured we had to be able to tell our friends that we went skiing in the desert. It turned out to be a lot of fun. The snow conditions were surprisingly nice, especially if you're used to icy East Coast skiing in the US. Yes, the runs are pretty short...but you're skiing in a shopping mall! If you have a couple of hours to spare and like to ski, you'll enjoy the experience. Also, if you know you are planning to ski, bring along some real SKI gloves. We brought thin winter gloves that weren't warm enough. It's really winter time in there, and the warm clothes they give you are absolutely necessary!

Not too bad.. This is my 6th trip to Dubai from the US. Each time before I kept saying I'd go. On my last trip here I checked on it and found out you get everything you need to ski (2hrs only) for about $60 USD or 200 AED except for hat and gloves. They'll sell you that for about $40 more. So if you come over bring the gloves and hat. So this time I did it and it was pretty good. Pretty smooth, not icy, and actually better than skiing on blown snow out on a resort. It felt like real snow. They do a good job of keeping the atmosphere as close to ideal ad possible. You should definitely go. It's amazing what a lot of money will build.

My Snowy Bday on A Desert City. The place was awesome. Had so much fun and did not regret having spent my 2013 bday there. Had the chance to meet and touched some penguins. There are so much activities you can do there, may it be skiing, unlimited chairlift rides, giant ball ride, mountain thriller and a lot more. Recommended for all ages.;)

Good Fun!!!. We went to Ski Dubai initially just to have a look. But we had some time to kill, so we got a 2 hour lift pass for snowboarding. The price was pretty good, I think it was about $50-60 AUD.If you have snow gloves, bring them, otherwise you will need to buy them. but everything else is supplied and inclusive of the entry fee. (including socks!)Definitely worth the trip out there, even just to have a look at the snow in the desert!

unbelievable. You have to take the training lesson to use the ski slopes, however all can enjoy the ski slides and igloo houses and the small hillock inside the Ski Dubai . The equipment and gear provide is up to the specific standard and the assisting staff is also ver friendly.

Skiing in the dessert?!. Before I left for Dubai I said I would try Ski Dubai. When I got there I hesitated: skiing indoors? Really? I grew up skiing on Northeast ice and migrated to the good stuff out west. Ski Dubai seemed way too gimmicky in person. But I knew I'd second guess myself if I walked away, and I'm glad I tried it. Gimmicky - for sure if you are skier. But for locals, it offers a unique experience. And I'll say this: I never waited a moment in the lift line (skip the chair, it's too slow) and the snow conditions were far superior to many of my eastern trips. They give you everything but gloves and a hat (didn't need the latter).

leave the penguins encounter - unless you are loaded. I went to the penguins meet together with my son. We were told you can play and hug the penguins. Well there was a hug, but just quickly for the picture. The explanations are rather short and the so called interaction limits it self to a few pictures from the photographer (no own cameras allowed). The suits are also very old and partly broken. My son did feel very cold in them. With the entrance ticket you are not even allowed to go in the snow play area afterwards. The best thing came afterwards when we found out that you can buy the pictures for 20+ Euros a piece,... that is simple extortion!!! I do have to say that my 4 year old boy (who is still blind for such commercial practices) liked it.
Ok. There is really not much to see, you really have to rent equipment and go skiing. So be prepared if you decide to go.
Small. Was not very impressed small in size and in my opinion too expensive, the penguins looked a bit sad and the kids who's parents had the most money were up front

What a hoot!. We are all excellent skiers and thought Ski Dubai was a hoot! We could not imagine skiing inside, especially in a mall, but this was more of a real ski experience than I could have imagined. If you are a skier, you will get a kick out of the entire experience.

Visit a chalet inside the desert. While I would not recommend to visit Dubai for your Winter vacations, if you do visit Dubai it is a must that your visit Ski Dubai. We decided to make a short trip (2 days) from Qatar during Summer and Ski Dubai blew our minds althought we are NOT funs of skiing.We spend literally the whole day in the area playing with the penguins and the snow. The operation of Sky Dubai is very organised considering the big crowd it attracts. They will give you all the warm clothing you need except for a beanie and belive me it is very important. In general, I would say that the transition from the 45 to -4 degrees can be very stressful for you so keep this in mind.

Snow in Dubai. I didn't actually go in and ski but stood at the window and watched many very happy adults and children having a great time. There are chair lifts and travelators to get you to the top of the ski areas. There are different heights and lengths depending on your ability. Toboggans and snow boards for non skiers.

Must try if you're in Dubai. Along with the Burj Khalifa this was on my 'must do' list during a layover in Dubai, just to say we did it for the heck of it. I came here with a good ski buddy from Colorado and we were just cracking up. It was pretty surreal to see women in bhurkas riding the ski lift, then seeing the TGI Friday's next door. We didn't have much time but the staff was very speedy and brought us to the front of the line to get equipment. For a couple of hours lift ticket and rental (skis, boots, and all clothes minus gloves - bhhr) it was about $60. If you're in Dubai I'd say definitely check it out! We were on the more difficult slope, which was actually more difficult than I had anticipated. That being said, going fast we could cruise down the whole slope in about one minute, so it was kind of like skiing in the midwest. The main ski lift is really slow (since the whole place is full of beginners). There is a poma lift that is a bit ball busting but gets you up the slope quicker. If we had more time we would have paid to get our pictures taken with penguins. This is located inside the Mall of the Emirates, which is a piece of cake to get to from the airport by taking the metro.

Mixed Feelings.... I am a passionate snowboarder who goes to the mountains every year. So now and then I like to go to an indoor slope just to keep on top of it throughout the year and is change from the cinema. But this place I visited while on holidays in Dubai. The slope is big for an indoor slope, but the problem is it is very crowded. Just too busy for my liking as it is accessed through the mall.

hmmm. From 40+ degrees to -40 degrees is sth to be extra careful with, the ski centre is not well equipped - obviously, being a warm country - so be prepared and if u plan to visit take along gloves, scarfs and hats so you wont catch a cold.

Hmmmm, what oil money can buy.. It's not as big they say it is, kind of expensive and crowded, other than than it's very nice, this ski Dubai is inside the Emirates mall which is a very nice mall not as big as the one near the Burj Tower But while in Dubai it's a must see.

Just to say we did it!. We are avid skiers so we just had to try it and we had a great time. Two hours was plenty of time for us. It is well run and the staff was friendly. We arrived at 10 am on a Wednesday and shared the ski hill will about 10 other people. We hear it can be crowded on weekends. Great fun!

Amazing experience. Went to Ski Dubai last night and it was a fantastic experience. I did the 40 minute penguin encounter, visited the snow park and did a 60 minutes ski lesson. I would highly recommend the penguin encounter - its a very unique encounter and the trainers are fantastic. Having never ski'd before the beginners lesson was a great way to learn the basics. Overall the whole experience of going to Ski Dubai was great and I would highly recommend it.

The best thing in Dubai. Skii in desert at around -5 when the outside temperature was around 40+ is something unbelievable.This is what my whole family enjoyed most in UAE.Fortunately, there was a quiz programme which I won and got free encounter with penguins. This is again something I had never dreamt before. Touching, hugging these lovely animals was an experience, I cannot explain in words.

Great experience in Sahar!. Perfect! Experience in a city like Dubai to have the chance to go on ski!Perfect! Experience in a city like Dubai to have the chance to go on ski!Perfect! Experience in a city like Dubai to have the chance to go on ski!Thanks a million.
Desert snow. enjoy freezing atmoshere & sports when it is more than 400 degrees outside . it is Dubai , always gives the different and the intersting whether you are a resident or a visitor

If you feel hot outside, go here. It's nice to feel very very cold while it is so hot outside.Me and my kids had a great time here. Everything is provided so don't bother bringing your jacket with you.

Freezing in a mall. The moment you get inside the Ski Dubai temperatures drop from 22* to -4* degree Celsius. Its the best experience of my life till today, my 8 year daughter enjoyed every moment of it. Real Fun... highly recommended.

First snow of my life. Yes its not natural snow but still it fulfilled my desired to feel the snow . Full kit was provided which was surprising ... we took super pass, only penguin and skii was not permitted other than that we enjoyed the rides , big ball and slide was fun , chairlift was indeed a good ride to have an bird eye view of the full snowy area. Temperature was -6 so we only stayed one and half hour , there was snow man , ice age acorn in the glass, small pool, a big dragon in the entrance and a very interesting narrow passage with a mirror on one end , wen u pass that passage you will hear scary noise of bear, sea lion and avalanche....it is bit expensive we took 200aed super pass each and a locker of 20aed to keep our belonings . but overall splendid experience :)

a very nice place for kids. a very nice test and it as very good for my kids at last we stayed there 6 hours it was fantastic but you need million gloves and too much jackets or you will freeze hhhhhhhhh

snow in the desert. must visit this place if you are with family and children.Children can really enjoy the rides.The man made snow is enjoyable in the hot Dubai.A cup of coffee/tea with snow around adds the pleasure.

Fantastic experience!. Quite the surprise to have a ski park in a desert land like Dubai. Ski Dubai didn't disappoint. Boots, jackets, gloves etc. are all given to you which is great and expected anyway. Kids below 4 have to buy their own gloves at a store next door. Very importantly, make sure you take your own pictures. The folks with cameras just make you do a silly dance and stretch your arms like kooky tourists and you never know how those pics will come out. Besides they charge you an arm and a leg for the picture. So if you want a memory of Ski Dubai, get someone to take a picture of you with your camera. It's awfully cold so your camera will cool off and shut down or maybe I'm using a real old Canon. The ski lift is stupendous. Enjoyed the rides etc. but didn't really snowboard etc. because I don't know how to. You can choose to get the (more expensive) all day pass which allows you to get out, grab a bite and come back in. But honestly, if you start early, you'll pretty much have enough of the cold in a few hours. In all, it was a great experience.
very cold. if you like snow and cold weather every now and then would be good to go there. I just think digital photos were a little expensive.

Quite the surprise. We went on a day trip to the Mall of the emirates, and whilst we decided if we wanted to ski we watched the march of the penguins from the Mall during which we won a free ticket for the penguin encounter. We therefore decided to do this, buying an extra ticket as there was two of us. This was relatively cheap AED145 which included free gloves and the full kit. The experience was very nice, we got to meet two types of penguins and stroke, pet, hug and kiss the King Penguins! This was a very unique experience, but there were two things to be aware of:Firstly, no cameras were allowed, so you had to buy the internal taken ones, these were almost prohibitively expensive but you do feel you need a memento of your trip!Secondly, though educational, the exhibit doesn't seem to serve a conservation point, there was no real explanation why the penguins were there, so it must be presumed just for tourists! Whilst this is a reason and the penguins appeared well looked after it didn't sit emotionally as well as it would if the clear educational purpose was spelt out!

Great experience.. As I have never been skiing, I wanted an insight to see what it was all about. I couldn't of asked for more, I had a skiing lesson..which I found I needed! The people were so friendly and helpful to all ages. It felt very professional and a great sight from inside to see the huge slopes. Good for money!!

Bring your scarfs and gloves. Overall the experience was OK, couldn't do the upper part which seemed a lot of fun but not suitable for my little son. Just one tip which I can offer since I spent more than AED 300 on buying gloves, hats and scarfs from there.... BRING YOUR OWN stuff from home as the package only includes jacket, pants, shoes and socks. You sure want to avoid catching a cold that can ruin your holiday.

SKi Dubai. Good place. Crowded over the weekends. Provided shoes are non slippery but do not prevent cold. Wear a cap, gloves and do not stay more than 2 hours . The cold becomes painful without protection. Go on a weekday, reach early , enjoy the chair lift and if you want Ski on this slope. And yes, do have a photo by them (I know its pricey) since the cold really flushes your face and its undeniably good !
brilliant. fantastic day for everyone ive visited here a few times its perfect great value for money out the sun for a wee while and you can even shop, eat and drink all in one visit!

Penguin Encounter. To be honest, I'm not really sure whether should I join the Ski because my body can't resist the cold well, but the section with penguin is really something exceptional that I was pleased and happy that I didn't miss.The thing that I really love about this section is not about the encounter itself or the guide on penguin, but to see the passion spark in the eyes of the trainer when he talk and train the penguin. Rarely can I see such a dedicated love like this. It ensured me that the penguins here are well-loved and taken care of since I didn't want my fee to contribute to any greedy organization who only want revenue and money but not the well-being of these cute animals.My standard Peng-friend section is about 150 AED and 30 AED for the locker, but you get all of the clothes and gloves (you can keep the gloves later). First I was guided through a tunnel with educational video of penguin, then arrived at the meeting point, where I were officially encountered these lovely friends. You will see a series of king & gentoo penguin enjoy their underwater swimming. Then had the gentoo penguin run over you and sit right next to you... Well, that's totally unexpected.After the meet up, I was escorted to meet two big King Penguin, and have chance to personal touch and give them a hug from the back - really amazing experience as their fur is so soft and warm.Another highlight is that our photographer was really good at taking pictures, all of my pics were so beautiful that I had to have them all. The package I had at that time was 500 AED for a CD with all photos, 2 big print-outs, 3 small print-out, a snow ball with your photos, and 2 small size photos printed out. Quite a good bargain!

@osama_bahar3. You have to be ready , eat well use the wc then bring with you hat and lather gloves, they give you free but better for you to stay more... because it's too cold.200 is the ticket for all kids and adults to go every where. And 140 to stay on snow only.

nothing out of world. i went to dubai in aug 2013 and we went to mall of emirates where v had read ice sking was done,we took a glimpse of d inside view fro cheesecake factory which is just situated by d side,it was quite nice,but for people who have already seen real snow,it didnt look much of fun,so v decided not to go,v have already seen much snow in rohtang pass in india,good for people who have not seen snow and for families living there to go for outing ,and track away heat,for delhites who spend one month of shivering cold ,nothing vey promising

Snow in the Blistering heat. quite an experience! Snow---freezing cold and step out in the blistering heat and U THAW!! lols
The gear was affordable and comfortable for those who want an experience of ski in a blistering Desert

Brilliant day out. It all started with Giving my 2 teenagers something different to do. As they have never skied before, they persuaded me to participate with them. It was brilliant! I too have never skied before. The instructor was brilliant. They started with very simple tips and had us coming down the junior slopes after an hour. It is a must to experience when in Dubai.

Lots of fun. We went to Ski Dubai during Ramadam, so it was very quiet - no lines but also we couldnt get drinks or food whilst in there. We had to come out after an hour to go to another hotel and warm up with a hot chocolate. We did go back in and carried on enjoying the tobagan run, snow slides etc for another couple of hours. We also saw the penguins come out for a show which was lovely.We went there purely so the kids could experience snow - living in Perth, Australia, they had never had the chance to play in it. You werent allowed to throw snowballs - the snow they use is too hard. But other than that the kids and us really enjoyed ourselves.

Sky Dubai. I loved this place. It's amazing that you are visiting a city in the desert, the outside temperature is 43-45 degrees, and all of a sudden you are in a place, either skying, taking a chair lift or walking around in a place where's -3 degrees. You can also see penguins in there (there's actually a show to see them).To get in there, we walked through the Emirates Mall which is huge. It has lots of stores. There's a hotel there (I forgot the name) that has windows looking at this place. I bet this has to be amazing!!!!

Snowboarding, skiing in dubai. Its a great expiriance going from 40 degrees on -4 degrees. They give you everything from skiis, snowboards, suits but they dont give you gloves and hats. This is what is extra charge!

First time skiing. This was my first time skiing and i learned over there. They several tracks, for dummies, medium and 'hard'. Great experience.Since the skiing is inside the dubai mall my wife went to the mall instead of skiing!

Interesting cold Ski experience. Ski Dubai is a very interesting place & for those who visit Emirates Mall is a must see attraction.you can enjoy the Ski view from the mall or you can go inside it & feel the cold! I nearly got cold inside the Ski Dubai , I didn't expect this much temperature difference although they provide proper clothes for you but it's still cold !
Fun!. The ski dubai inside the mall gives you a complete feeling of a real ski experience. Its great fun for the kids especially.
Ski inside!. The people using appeared to be having fun but after Europe and Canada it somehow seemed very tame and very very small. Good fun for children and those who had never seen snow.

oasis in the desert. it is a very different experience to ski in the middle of a desert.you should try indoor skiing. If you are professional, it will be boring but if you are an amateur as I am, you will like it.

Lot of fun. Really enjoyed this experience. Also allowed us to get away from the heat of Dubai for a couple of hours. Had a lesson which was fun and felt like I learned something and would be keen on doing again. Expensive though.
It almost real. It almost real ski quality I highly recommeded it worth a vist a single, cuple and a graet family time
my winter experience in Dubai. it was an amazing experience to be able to feel the winter in Dubai... The oozing cold temperature, gives you an idea what is like to live in a place that is so cold...

Let it snow in the desert. Not bad for indoor snowboarding. Of course you won't expect those powder snow but the snow condition is better than I expected. It's really interesting experience. You don't need to worry about gears, just walk in and have fun. They even have new clean sock for you. Just as easy as shopping! I don't have enough time to visit penguin, may be next time~
Out of this world. Visited today, like nothing I've ever seen before. Amazing sight, a true winters wonder,and in the middle of the desert!

Indoor ski resort. Ski Dubai is an indoor ski resort with 22,500 square meters of indoor ski area. It is a part of the Mall of the Emirates, one of the largest shopping malls in the world, located in Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

Escape from 45 degree to -4 degree.. Even at the peak of summer if you want to enjoy the winter, then you should visit Ski Dubai. Once you enter the premises, you are really into a different world. Remember to bring a winter glove. Rest of the dress they will provide. Here you can see penguins and go for an ice skating. There are many kids’ activities here. Make sure to have a hot soup from there.

Ice in the land of sand. It was fantastic experience for us. The games, skiing and ofcourse the penguin show... Wow... The temperature maintained inside is -4 Degrees celsius. Incredible..Cheers Dubai

Skiing in 40C heat!!. Well its not the real thing, but for a few hours its not bad at all...and the other stuff they have like the penguins, and giant ball make for a fun few hours...but its just weird going some where in shorts and then within minutes its minus 5 degree's...
Snow in Dubai?!. Unbelievable. Real snow with proper runs, tobogans, chairlift, snowboarding and -4 degrees. Don't miss meeting the penguins - one-off opportunity - enjoy!

Makes your brain fizz. walking into the Emirates Mall and seeing Ski Dubai for the first time really does make your brain Fizz. With outside temperatures of 50 degrees and inside temperatures of minus 3 - it surely is an amazing feat of engineering. The Skiiing is amazing and at the bottom of the slope there is an Ice Bar with Chairs and Tables calved out of solid blocks of ice. Fab.

A welcome break from the heat. Four of us went here and it was a great time - not too expensive, could not spend a full day there though as not a great deal to do. Minus 4 and when you turn up in shorts and T shirts with only a 'snow suit' and thin gloves to wear on arrival, it was actually as cold as Tromso in Northern Norway in December !!!!

Great but cold and expensive!. Ski Dubai, was one of the highlights for our family holiday we also opted to meet the penguins this was good we all enjoyed these funny little guys. We did not ski but enjoyed the other activities but nothing not even a cold winter in England could prepare us for the cold!

A Cold Experience Worth The Visit. Ski Dubai is an experience worth enjoying, especially if you are seeking comfort from the hot summer. The receipt of your clothes and boots was simple and quick and well organised. It was a bit strange for our kids to have to wear helmets to walk around on the snow, especially given they are all excellent skiers.If you are an avid skier, be prepared to freeze if you use Ski Dubai's clothes, as they will not be as warm as your own!!!
Just perfect!. You can not imagine that in a mall Is a very big ski place.We ate a lunch in a restaurant in the mall and the experience was amazing to eat and stay in front of a ski area

A bit of a novelty, but we enjoyed it!. OK, it's not like the alps or Colorado, but the novelty of skiing in Dubai (about 50C when were there) appealed to the skiiers in us.I was impressed by the size of the slope and the condition of the snow, it felt like genuine good alpine snow. This is probably achieved by the extreme cold in there. Whilst they give you ski-jackets and trousers to wear, they're laughably thin and I'd advise anyone going to take a jumper along too. We booked two hours, but all of us had enough of the cold after 90 minutes.We also did the 'meet the Penguins' thing. My son's a huge Penguin fan and it was a (they say) unique experience to actually touch the Penguins. I'm not sure how 'natural' that is, but it was an experience and the environment for the penguins did look as good as (or better than) I've seen in any zoo. The staff seemed genuinely concerned for the animals welfare too (and they looked healthy), so I didn't feel too guilty about this experience.Overall, the trip to Ski Dubai was one of the highlights of our stay in Dubai.

Cold but cool. If like me you have never been skiing then this place is for you. We loved getting dressed in our snow suits and boots. Take your own gloves and wooly hats....it's freezing. Kids will love the fake snow, the the igloos etc....as will adults. Be prepared for the audience of people watching and waving at you from the other side of the glass inside The Mall of the Emirates.

It's Skiing!. It was a lot of fun and you do get the ski bug somewhat taken care of. The snow is actually pretty good. They sell 2 hour passes which is all the time you really need if you are a good skier. There are two runs and don't take too long so you will get bored if you stay longer than 2 hours. They have a chairlift but it is slow so take the t-bar right next to it to get up faster and get more runs in. I did skiing while the family enjoyed the snow fun park. It is one of those things that you have to do when you are here. If you have your own kit, just bring your own gloves and socks (maybe hat if your ears get cold)-all the rest they will give you and it works for what it is. Don't expect top notch rentals-my skis stuck when getting up to speed-but they worked great to play around for the 2 hours. I would do it again the next time I am in Dubai

Terrific unique experience. This is the only place in the world where you can ski in the middle of the desert. Sound cheesy? Sure, but wait until you see it. Great fun for the young and the "not so young"

Great fun for the family. We bought a 2 hour slope pass and had fun going up and down with the kids. The centre is well run with all equipment supplied (except gloves and hats) but I was curious as to why it takes so long to set up the skis. It took the staff 3 or 4 goes to get a pair they thought my 4 year old could use - maybe they were trainees but it seemed to take a long time.Don't forget to put your ski pass in the left arm pocket, something I didn't realise until a bit later :-/If you're an advanced skiier, you may find the slopes a bit tame but for us and the kids is was just right.
Amazing Ski In Desert. Unbelievable to go indoor skiing in nthe Dubai area next to desert. Unbelievable but everythuing is npossible in Dubai. Exceptional experience

Tacky. Not worth a visit for this. Very tacky and cheap looking, not new and full of tacky decoration, not a ski st
Lope like I was expecting

COLD!!!!. Awesome experience but then the cold was something else. Went on the different rides, the slides, the giant snow ball and finally met the penguins (including the king penguins)...Awesome summer experience..YOu must try the panorama rides.

How fun is this?. You've got to laugh at the sight of people in hijab and abaya with ski jackets and boots - so mixed culture. Eager kids await lessons on the snowy slopes. Even if you don't ski, the sight of the GIANT balls with occupants inside rolling down the slopes will keep you laughing.

Skiing in the Desert. We had to try this!Being an avid skier, we had to give this a go.While its rather limited with just 1 slope, its pretty good for in the middle of the desert and 50c outside.The lifts could do with speeding up, as it takes a long time to get to the top.But all in all, it was a good few hours spent.If your in Dubai, try it just for the novelty aspect, and not for a good ski.

Watched from the window of Salmontini Restaurant. What a great little mountain in the desert! There are 2 ski runs, a short tubing hill, a louge sled run & an oversized "golf ball" that you get in & roll down the hill! For those who have never been skiing/tubing etc. or for those who just want to say they've experienced this in a mall, what fun! I didn't see the cost...

Average Ski park. Visited on a weekend in August, the ski dubai is overpriced for what it is in my opinion, i found there was long queues for most of the decent rides and when you do get to go on them they are not all that they seem to be.

strange. When you're in the Mall of the Emirates, it's always strange to see the ski dome. They even have penguins there. It looks like Dubai has lost it but hey... it's Dubai! Nothing is impossible by temperatures above the 40 celsius.
cold. a very nice place to go its -4 there just amazing a perfect place to ski i like the slides and the ski school to allow you to skate i recommend going there i planing to go again
Feed the Penguins. As we were not trained in the art of skiing we decided to do the feed the penguins experience. A great time at minus 5 degrees after the 44 degrees outside.

Nice experience in Summer. Interresting place to ski!
Go there early to avoid the crowds. The resort opens at 9am. Be there for openning and you will be the only one on the slopes. 2 hours is enough to have fun if you are a good skier. Probably a great place to learn skiing before going to the real resort in the real mountains.

Day light robbery. From the last time I went the only thing that has really changed here is the price,The entrance prices have increased,They now even start charging for the air lifts. What the hell does the entrance price actually get you... Nothing.This is day light robbery at its best and to be honest you can't let out wind even without being charged some dirams(!)Would never go back there.

Skiing in Dubai? How can this be?. This is amazing, it was minus 1 inside and 44 degrees outside! My son, the skier in the family thoroughly enjoyed it, especially the black run. The non skiers in the group took the chair lift up to the cafe which was fun and watched the world go by. We knew the option for non skiers was available but were faced with a hard sell to buy another package before we got to the ticket desk. however, we stood our ground and the person behind the desk sold us what we wanted without any fuss. Inside the ski centre, everything was very well organised with help always on hand when we needed it.

Great deal to beat the heat!. It was a hot December day and i have decided that i have seen enough sand!!! So i went to the Mall and went skiing!!! What a blast!! Would do it again in a heartbeat!!! Only thing i did not like was the lines.. But it was worth it!

Snow in the desert...more than you bargained for!. I did not want to spend the time to suit up and get fitted for boots, etc.! My family made me and WOW! I was so happy I did it! It actually was so much fun....and the snow quality was great! I thought the snow would be man made ICE. It was awesome! Great option for kid skier's, a good break from the heat of the desert......
Great experience. When can you get to go skiing in the middle of the Arabian desert. This was a must activity for us, and it did not disappoint. We had a great time.

freeezzing coooold !. Ski in Dubai ... When my friends told me first I did not believe it .. As I've never skied in my life I had a good moment. But not sure penguins live in the mountains usually ... Anyway I enjoyed so much but it was freeezzing coooold !
WHat one needs in a desert. Superb experience specially if you have kids, the nearby Emirates mall has also nice shops the skiing is more like a sno park but its fun for kids.

Amazing place. My kids and myself loved the place and enjoyed to our fullest. But it was so cold that we couldn't spend more than 3 hours. The fleece gloves that we bought were not good enough. We didn't know that we could go in and out as much as we liked. But the coffee, hot chocolate and nachos really helped u remain there. The chair lift was great ride, just that it was freezing cold up there. Worth spending the money once again.
Good fun. Visited in august for the second time. Children would like more attractions to go on. Would recommend to others.
Pick your day carefully. Don't go on Thursday evening full of very spoilt children who can not ski and get in the way of people who can ski. Very efficient on getting your boots and ski clothes

Gloves. They give you zero instruction, so be prepared to figure out everything. One thing they do not tell you, is that you must BUY gloves before you get to the equipment area. They give you a jumpsuit to keep you warm, they give you ski boots, skis, and poles, but no gloves. If you plan on doing more than one ride up in the chair lift, bring gloves.

Cool but not amazing. Let say than skiing in the desert is just unexpected. If you know how to ski you will not enjoy so much as it's expensive and cold. But let say with friends you can have a good moment and enjoy your stay inside this huge fridge !

A great place for kids. Growing up in Saudi my son has never been around snow. This was a really fun trip for him, my husband and I. We spent a few hours sledding, tubing and running around and really enjoyed ourselves. This is really something for the kids so if you do not have any you may not enjoy it.

Extremely thrilling, and cold!. A must visit place. It has many thrilling rides. Waiting times are acceptable, they are very efficient, partly because the duration of the rides is short. The have safe rides for kids. The whole family enjoyed. Word of caution: being a Saudi, where temperatures higher than 45 C are the norm during summer, my nose couldn't stand the cold temperature, so I had to go to the store and buy some protection for it. So get familiar with the place first, buy what you think is necessary to stay safe, then go and enjoy.
Giggles All round. An excellent family day out. It's amazing to see the how cold the temp is and having to wear snowsuits which are supplied when you are in such a hot country as Dubai

Awesome. My hubby and two kids did this one as my lesson time would not have been until the afternoon and we didn't want to be there all day. They paid about £100 for the three of them to have. Two hour pass. There are blue,red and a black run so plenty for all levels. Snowboarders re also catered for. Everything is included except for gloves. Fleecy ones cost about 20dh more for proper ones so try to bring your own as all of their hands were freezing by the end. There is a great snow park for kids and lots of other attractions to do once inside, including meeting penguins! There is an all inclusive price to do it all but can't remember the cost. They loved it and it was a morning well spent.
Kids love. Of course a must for kids and adults as well . Had to look for kids after 2 hours though and I had just my slippers.lol

Great place. it eas my first time in this huge indoor ice skiing place. Really wonderful place. Great staff. The clothing available encludes all the sizes. There were activities for all the ages and all the levels of experiences. Too bad there was not too much free walking space without entering any activities. I highly recommend this place for everyone.

fantastic. Loved it.... firstly.... we are a skiing family.... so we could be vert critical... but for something indoors.. in Dubai! where you can ski.... no ques if you go midday.... I thought reasonably priced.. equipment wasn't that good.. but I could ski on 2 planks of wood.... so good enough...when done, off to the beach..... Only in Dubai...
Overrated. Well the kids enjoyed it, just that it was terribly cold in there and so we couldn't even stay for up to 2 hours.
Lots of Fun!. This is a great way to stay cool in Dubai! There is something for everyone. 3 ski slopes a cafe and Penguins!

Fun time and very cold..... Just when you think that Dubai couldn't be any cooler. It's minus 4 and the penguins are marching. Ski Lessons are a minimum of 4 lessons in Discovery before allowing you to move to the slopes. But just hanging about in the snow is good. Very cold if you are standing around and not moving much. Take advantage of the unlimited entry as you can go in and out as much as you please. Upgrade gloves as the complimentary ones are only fleecy and they get wet. For 2 adults plus 2 kids $300 AUD plus. But where else will you get snow indoors and it's 40plus outdoors. Snow blaster was fun!
fun fun fun. We had so much fun. As it was Ramadan the place was so quiet so we got to go on the tubes countless times. No line ups. Yipee..The Penguins were so cute..

Indoor ski slope. Prefer the real thing.. Wasn't that impressed about the indoor ski slope especially when u have skied before.. Not a big space and snow was more ice than powder ..To many people in that space provided and more fun for little kids than teenagers or adults.

Not quite a mountain!. While the experience of skiing in Dubai was pretty cool. Having skied in the Australian snow fields I found myself bored quite quickly. If I was to go again I would do some skiing and then spend time in the snow park as well.
Not bad. Not clear on what package to select. Staff not clear. But heaps of fun to have snow in the dessert. Recommend the middle package unless you are a good skier.
Totally crazy. to have a winter experience, while it's +50 outside. The snow was a bit icy. 1 hour of fun is more than enough. Was totally shocked to see real penguins around

Freezing Cold in Dubai- Crazy!!!. Went here with my 2 small children for some snow fun on a recent trip to Dubai. We bought a Super Pass that included all the activities as well as entrance to the snow park. Was well worth it as we had hours of fun in the snow. The staff were quite helpful but at times needed to smile a bit more!! My children also enjoyed the Penguin experience offered. Great memories in a freezing cold part of Dubai.

they said there would be snow this christmas. Ski dubai is a fairy tale for adults and kids alike its fun unique cold a fantastic photo shoot with a story to tell of desert snows beside desert dunes in searing heat and who would believe you but who cares coz its your story,your memory and your little special experience that is no one's but yours.Just do it.

Ski ski ski no more...!. Great for first time visitors but I feel it lacks the reason to revisit. Most of the rides (atleast last time I went in 2000) were for kids and those like me who didn't know how to ski weren't allowed on the slopes.

Weird sensation. You just have to go and check this out. It is colder then you think so dont be fooled and not wear gloves. You dont need to buy the whole day ticket but definitely go for a couple of hours. Nothing like skiing when its 120 degrees outside

Nothing special. Probably only kids will enjoy playing snow balls, otherwise if you enjoy skiing its not for you. Track is very short about 30 seconds ride, btw inside it smells like in big old refrigerator.

Snow in the Desert!. I went with my sister. We are from south europe and had never experienced snow more than once or twice in our lives. I think it is quite expensive for what it is, however we have to marvel the fact we are skiing in the desert. The activities are fun but adults cant be there for more than 2h without getting bored due to the repetitive nature of the activities. However kids will love it. I was told by experienced skiers that the slopes are quite short but again I think people complain with a full belly because this is the desert. Enjoy the trip and if you are into skiing or learning how to ski just come and enjoy. Class prices are steep though. The only thing that really bothered me was the smell inside but then again it is artificial snow and we are in the desert.

Ski Dubai. Honestly if you are a seasoned skier it is a bit lame but at the same time its kinda awesome, not challenging at all and the longest run is less than a minute. Fun for those that don't ski and fun for those that do for the novelty of saying I was skiing in dubai :)

Do they cater to "large" people?. I will be visiting there next month. Can anyone tell me please if the snow suits are available in big sizes to fit larger people? Also, does anyone know if there are weight restrictions for the Giant Ball and Chair Lift?

A Unique Attraction. Yes, it is a little pricey, but so is everything in Dubai. We had an enjoyable couple of hours here. However, please remember it is indoors and so is not like real mountain skiing. Just like a safari park is not like the Serengheti. Inside it is minus four degrees C so if you arrive in shorts and a T shirt you will be cold under the ski suit. Take a hat and gloves. The penguin encounter is not really worth seeing!If I lived in Dubai I probably wouldn't be a regular visitor but I'm glad we went whilst we were on holiday.

Amazing Place. greetings of the dayone of mircale of Dubai you are tired of hot weather go to Ski Dubai... Enjoy Sking Enjoy the ice slides Or have nice Drink in there cafe after you are tired of having all the funThey provide every thing you need to have best Ski ever..100% recmonded to Ski Lovers

Play time!. Face it, no one can walk through the mall, stare through those gigantic windows and not want to go to Ski Dubai! I found the process very well organized. From buying the tickets, to getting the outfits, to dressing. They have an A-game going on in Ski Dubai. Even if you aren't going for the ski slopes, you will have hours of fun!

Not to be missed. You have to see it yourself to believe it that in desert also one can experience the pleasure of snow activities. I was really amazed and astonished to see it. it is build in a huge area, Its fun place for kids. One can do many stuff here . It is an attraction not to be missed

Amazing. Lots of fun!. Very fake but amazing. You are in a large freezer :) very expensive but Dubai is a very expensive city. The encounter with the penguins was amazing. We got to touch and play with the penguins! The only place on earth to touch a penguin!

Don't Miss the SKI Training Program. First I need to say I never had any snow park or ski experience previously. So you may find my review a bit biased, since it was my 1st time experience of this kind.We went there on a Saturday morning and it was quite packed with locals as well as tourists.Our ticket included entry to the snow park, a free pair of gloves, a free hot chocolate and a basic training to ski.You need to get your jackets in the counter before entering the park.Once you enter the 1st impression is a WOW. Come'on guys u r in Dubai and you have just entered a big big snow park - It 's just Amazing.The snow park as a whole was good with slopes to slide, giant balls to roll and a rope way ride.Now we come out again to join the ski program. This part starts with getting the appropriate pair of ski for you. It itself is an experience. Once inside the training zone the trainer gives you some basic movements on how to ski and then he leads you to a slope and helps individually to ski the slope. We fell, we rise (it was quite a challenge to stand again with the ski on your feet), we learn, we enjoyed. I had some of the most cherished memories with my friends here. It's, in fact one of my BEST experience in Dubai. You will see just kids of age 4 to 6 skiing quite difficult slopes here. But please don't be ashamed to join the course. You will quite enjoy it and moreover we have seen peoples of age 60-65 also joining the training program. So just learn from them on how to continue learning.P.S : The gloves and hot chocolate provided are not best but who cares.
Dubai's best Mall. This mall has a family atmosphere and the entertainment is endless especially for families. My grandchildren loved this mall and we thought that it is well presented.
fantastic. I only take a look from out side you have all the diveces to ski there as in any place to ski.I like all at Dubai

Great Fun. As a family with older children (11 & 13) who had never seen snow before, we had a great time. The process of getting our tickets and clothing was seamless and we were in the snow in no time! The only downside is that we did get cold! Coming from QLD Australia the gloves you are provided didn't really do the job. If you intend on spending the whole day there (we spent about 2 1/2 hours) and feel the cold, you might like to upgrade to better gloves!

Not be going again. All good skiers will be very disappointed. It is a novelty for the locals who wont go to the real mountains. You have to pay for lockers, gloves and hat extra as they are not included. Not value for money. I must be getting too old for these type of fun.
Skiing in the Middle of UAE summer. A ski slope in the middle of the desert. Who would believe.Located in the middle of the Mall, good places to eat while you watch children skiing.

Skiing in desert. The place is huge and is cold. It is totally cool and happening palce with lots of skiing and ice and fun for all ages.Really recommended place and you will not at all want to leave this place and surprisingly this place is inside a mall.
Snow in 45 degree heat!. Simple review: Why did they decide to do this?? incredible feat of engineering. Amazing experience. how often can you ski on snow in the desert?
looks great. didnt actually ski but watched from a restaurant overlooking slopes. Looks amazing and well set up for skiing and sledging and also zorbs
Great for skiers and kids. Take a lesson or go to snow play. Visit the penguins its a great trip for little ones. Lessons need to be booked in advance i think.

An excellent time at Snow World - Ski Dubai. We were four in the family including kids of 5 years and 9 years. In the hot warm weather of Dubai in July-2013, the Ski Dubai had been a very good attraction for all of us.
