The tickets per person is Dhs 120/- + Dhs 20 for Lockers for all + Dhs 20 hand gloves per person. We had been to Snow World in Bangkok and Malyasia but this one was too good. Well maintained rides and Penguine Show was also good. During the month of Ramadan, there was not food available but normally food/drinks are availbale inside the Ski Dubai.
Ski-ing indoors!. My daughter and I had a fantastic experience.The view from the cable car was also great! We had an awesome time playing in the snow!
Enjoyable. Very systematic and reasonable. More signage's and direction markings need to be put up. Staff are courteous. Photographs clicked by staff are not reasonable.
A cold park. Once in a while is good to visit, and we always find out that we cannot stay in the park more than 2 hours, feels bored

Next Best thing to the SNOW. Ski Dubai has captured the true snow and ski experience. You can have it all indoors while it's HOT outside. It seems to cater to young kids, but the adults seem to be having a great time also.

Skiing in the desert :). If you visit, do not miss this place! They have several choices like the snowy park, skiing or playing with penguins. They offer lessons for skiing for adults & children too. You do not need to get your own stuff, because they offer everything. You need only to get your own leather gloves and enjoy the snow in the middle of the desert when the temperature is above 50 degrees!!

Allround excellent. In Dubai my family picked up a family entertainment book from a Carrefour store in the Emirates mall. This allowed our family to get a 2 for 1 discount for the Ski Dubai. Before you are allowed on the slopes you have to have an hour lesson if you haven't skied/boarded before. When on the slopes they provide everything for you except gloves which cost about 12 AU dollars. I would recommend to wear a jumper and tracksuit pants underneath the snow suit. If you go to Ski Dubai you should definitely go on a school day. When I went there would have been about 30 people on the slopes. The staff were very understanding. I left my gloves back in the main room and when I entered the slopes a very kind staff member gave me his gloves. Also the chair lift stalled for about 15 minutes and we asked the manager if we could have our time again because my brother was stuck on the lift and he agreed. Overall very friendly and fun, great Dubai experience.

Had to do it. Skiing here had been on my list for a long time. Was it challenging skiing? No. Did it take more than 1 minute to get down the hill? Nope. But it was SO COOL! 2 hours is more than enough, and I enjoyed every minute. Beware, there are a lot of bad skiiers in Dubai (to be expected), but some surprisingly good ones too. Ski Dubai was a brilliant idea and I'm glad to be able to say i skiied there...if you're a skiier and you visit Dubai, add this to your list of must-do's.

Give it a go if in Dubai.. We really enjoyed our time at Ski Dubai. For a very reasonable price, you get to ski for two hours, ride the chair lift, be supplied with ski suit, skis, boots, poles and Socks. You just need to bring beanie and gloves, as it is a constant temperature of -5 degrees, so is a little cold. We were getting chilly by the end of the two hours. But really enjoyed the experience of being able to ski indoors. We are skiers and didn't require any lessons, but I think they have them there if you need them.

Snow skiing in the Desert?. I got to snow ski in the middle of the summer desert! What an awesome break from the summer heat! For about $80 US you get 3 hrs of skiing on about 400m of groomed slopes. The slope is an "L" shaped curve with the steeper more advanced skiing on the inside of the curve. The slope is served by a central high capacity chair lift and an old style Poma lift on the inside curve. You don't need to bring anything to have a great time; everything is provided. (Skis, boots, poles, jacket and snow pants) I do suggest buying a pair of gloves and something to keep the ears warm. The climate control is still set to "beautiful winter day". The slopes offer challenges for all levels; lessons for the "never ever" and big jump ramps with and without airbags for the truly daring. The facility offers sledding and skating activities also. A great way to spend a few hours out of the summer heat!
OMG. I guess if you haven’t seen snow or not likely to this will be worth seeing ONCE.If you go to the Mall, worth seeing it from the outside rather then going in for the experience.
Enjoyable. Ski Dubai is the coldest place I've ever entered! It was freezing and AWESOME! I enjoyed many rides as well as my grandpa. It offers things for everyone in the family.

Skiing in the desert - totally unreal. Had some time to kill and skiing in the desert has got to be better than walking around an awful shopping mall. Impressively large piste where you actually have the room to get up some speed and make a few turns. A couple of hours in the cold was actually a welcome relief after a few days in the high 30s!
It is always nice to ski in July.. Slopes, certainly not in Alps quality, but the whole experience amazing. Worth to try for two three hours.

Great fun but the local kids are out of control. great experience to ski in a shopping mall. staff are great and all speak very good english. however the local children who frequest this place (i assume their wealthy parents give them season tickets for the ski field) are completly out of control. they are rude, push in line and when i was there almost caused 2 very serious accidents. the staff there say very little despite when they can see it happen infront of their very eyes. perhaps some of the kids are sons of sheiks and they are scared about saying something i'm not sure, but they ruin it for all the tourists and other older locals.

Fun but a bit pricey. Loved the penguins.. My husband and daughters (aged 9 and 13) did the play in the snow option, and all 4 of us did the penguin experience.The play in the snow option was enjoyable for my family, they liked the tube rides and tobogganing.This is apparently the only place in the world where you can get up very close to, and even touch, penguins. I had some initial reservations - is it ethical, etc? - but the penguins (gentoo and king penguin species) are all third generation captive bred and all came from a sea world in Texas. So they have not been taken from the wild and would in all likelihood not survive there.It is true that they are learning unnatural behaviours (chasing skittles, posing for photos, allowing humans to touch and even kiss them), so if you are concerned about this I would give it a miss. All penguins seemed very healthy and happy (at least to my inexpert eye). They are certainly extremely cute and the carers gave very good instructions about what (human) behaviour was acceptable before we encountered the penguins.No photos are allowed inside and they hit you up for what I thought were very overpriced photos on the way out.
Snow here?. I had to do it...just to say I did! My friends were chickens, so we only did the sledding. Kinda pricy, but when will I ever get to do that again?

Children under 3 not permitted. We had planned to visit this attraction, but upon arrival we were disappointed to learn that Children under 3 are not permitted. Not even for the snow park or the penguins.This is not mentioned anywhere in the attraction description, or clearly on their website.This meant that my husband and I had to go in on our own while the other one looked after Master 2.5, and then swap. We decided not to.Everything else looked great, and we were really looking forward to going, so we were really disappointed.

Ski Dubai. Amazing to have a ski slope and snow in Dubai, in fact could only happen in Dubai. Amazing and credit must go to His Royal Highness for his strategy for the future of Dubai. The penguins are fascinating as is the toboggan ride.

very cold :). Ice in the middle of the dessert.....well amazing..the ski world is huge...rides and slides for the kids...rope way...penguin show...penguin march... they provide with complete snow wear...overall very good

A LETDOWN............ I visited SKI DUBAI with my wife in March 2013. The experience for those who have experienced snow in one or the other hill stations is not woth the effort, time and money. The changeover system for dress and shoes is not very well coordinated and penguins are also a let down.......AVOID IF YOU HAVE SEEN SNOW EARLIER..
worth a go. we have been Dubai 5 times and although we have only done this once it makes a change from the desert heat for the morning!
good fun day out. done the skiing here on our last trip, done snowboarding this time, had a really nice time, was lovely to get out of the extreme heat

Super Cool. Ski Dubai is super cool because its something that you don't see everyday, the snow park is super fun and ski slopes are really good, the equipment are excellent but sometimes the prices go up and sometimes the ski lifts stop but overall its super fun and safe!!!

Snow in the desert.... Ski Dubai offers something you don't see very often, winter sports in the middle of the desert. It is a great place for kids and adults alike. It does get busy so plan to spend a good part of the day there to utilize all the different offerings and then you can shop and/or eat at the various places in the adjoining Mall of the Emirates.

Feel winter in the summer of Dubai. I went to ski dubai primarily because I wanted my five year old to see what snow feels like. I think it's an amazing facility with plenty of activities for all ages. The snow penguin show was quite entertaining too, and its good that all the appropriate apparel and gear is provided. A must visit for all those coming into Dubai.
Just weird to be here, but fun. So you step out of 40 something degrees to ski, toboggan, go in a ski lift, meet penguins etc. a great evening with loads of fun and the chance to try something new.
Best Snow park !. amazing stuff to do at the Dubai ski park. Kids love it, adults love it, can spend a lot of time....

Great to visit. So unexpected to see a ski complex in a shopping mall. If you want to cool off from the heat this is the place to visit. All equipment is provided and its suitable for all ages. It can get busy so if you want to go when its quieter go in the morning.

A unique experience and tons of fun!. Went with a buddy to Ski Dubai and had a blast! Tickets were a little pricey but not heinous. Two hours is plenty of time on the one slope that they have - skip the all day pass. Skiing on snow in 100+ degree heat is pretty awesome, but don't expect Rocky Mountain runs in Dubai. All in all, worth the money for his unique experience!

snow boarding in a mall !. its funny that you actually can go to a mall and snowboard or go ski ! since its really really hell on earth outside and i hate it , could be nice to go ski ,....although i love snowboarding , and i think the runway is too short for me ,,,but would be lovely for beginners

Amazing skiing experience. I've been taking skiing (snow) lessons at Ski Dubai over the last few years (unfortunately at the same level because I only go now and then!). I've never been able to get the hang of turning- it's completely opposite from waterskiing. Our instructor this time was excellent and patient. He calmly walked us through the turn and all of us managed to do it and continue with it several times. I was very happy with the instructions.
Enchanting meeting with penguins. It was wonderful learning about the penguins and enjoyed every minute of our interactions with them.
Amazing experience. It's mountain of snow in the dessert of Arabia a must seePrices starts at 140 UAE Adult and 130 child What I like about this once you come outside its back to 100 degree weather

Sun and ski. This is a cool thing we never saw anywhere before. Just imagine the sunny city and you go inside a mall to see a ski slope covered with lots of snow ... Bry good place for kids to spend few hours of fun
Goofy but fun. Well worth doing as generally not Much family stuff to do. Ok value while could be some improvement in training of staff on safety , but then again....... Give it a go hoygh !

Skiing in Dubai. It is very surreal to be skiing inside a shopping mall when it is 38 degrees outside. This slope has its own chairlift and different options on the way down for the beginner and the more advanced skier. It does not take long to get down but the slope felt uncrowded and it was a great escape from the heat for a while.
Nice experience. Something for all ages here. There is Skiing, sledging, tube riding, skating etc.Nice place and sometimes you forget the heat outside. An extraordinary place.

Wow, how good is this. If you think our shopping malls in Australia are good then take a trip to Dubai. One of the stops on the Big Bus Tour in Dubai was the Mall Of The Emirates, the Mall itself is huge and luxurious and seems to be never ending. Then you come across the indoor ski run, with real snow, unbelievable. Its obvious that those in power in Dubai responsible for constructing this Mall were never part of the Australian Labour Party Government as it seems all of the dollars actually went into the Mall.
Freezing cold. Great place enjoyed cable car long ride too cold freezing your nose becomes numb nice for everyone kids and adults

Great experience for beginners. Never skied before so this was a good place to practise. Hope to do the real thing real soon though. All the gears and atmosphere was perfect on a hot day outside. I wish i could atay in there longer.
Mind blowing.. You cannot believe they have a ski run in this mall when the heat outside is hitting 39 degrees. Surreal !! but also do not miss it.

Different from outdoors, but still impressive.. This place is an excellent place for more experienced skiers and snowboarders, since the is so many people. There is quite a number of people, so beware. I really like this place because there are really good t bars and ski lifts. The trail is not too short but at a good length. Outside has a great ski shop with different boards and binders with great looking jackets. There is also a fantastic looking snow park. There are different games there. I think there is also a bar on top of the trail. Another thing is that there is a tubing trail for children and their parents. This place is certainly a great place to go if you are over heated by the weather of Dubai.

Winter wonderland in the desert. Want to stay away from the piercing heat where temperatures can hit 40 degrees Celsius in Dubai? Well Ski Dubai promises this by having a really large skiing arena where there are attractions for both the beginners and the experts as amateurs can start off with the low lands and have fun while rolling in a ball for excitement. The professionals can experience different levels of skiing fun by having competitive races with loved one. If you are tired, little huts close to the entrance are stationed there for people feeling chilly as they sip a hot cup of coffee or hot chocolate. The arena also has tubes and sky rides for people to sit on and take a picture as a keepsake. Truly a winter wonderland for all.
it is out of the world !. in the middle of asia, Switzerland is created..it is a wonder world, great place for kids and family, the rolling ball and the trolley rope-way is amazing

if you can ski then don't go. I've never liked indoor ski slopes. the challenge wears off after one minute. The same is true here. Plus there is the added benefit of spoilt Indian rich kids who are apparently there to prove that daddy can buy them a ski outfit and are oblivious to anything around them.For non skiers, it may be worth a look. Although (as with anything in Dubai) it is not cheap.

Don't miss it!. Rides, skiing, behind the scenes with the penguin trainer and shopping in the mall after... what's not to love??We visited Ski Dubai in June (hot hot HOT Summer!) which provided a wonderful reprieve from the weather outside. My 6-year old went for her first ski lesson and I regret not having enrolled myself as well. I saw many adults (including some who must have been in their 70's) at the Discovery and Basic classes as well, as well as a tiny tot on the intermediate slope. For those who prefer other activities, there is a giant "snowball" in which to roll down the slope, toboggan rides (fast and slow depending on age and preference) and meet-and-greet with the penguins! Or, as in our case, a behind the scenes visit with one of the penguin trainers to see the King & Gentoo penguins in their home. Amongst other things, we watched a couple of male Gentoos stealing pebbles from one of the nests to build their own, and then later watched the original "owner"of the pebbles steal them back. Since it was situated in the Emirates Mall, there was plenty to eat and buy before/after visiting Ski Dubai. All in all, a wonderful experience :)

environmental nightmare, but unique. If you consider all of the desalinated water and power needed to make this attraction run, you cannot help put to feel like it is harming the environment. But, I have to admit it is nice to play in the cold and snow (not truly like real snow) when it is 100 degrees and humid outside! The day I was there, the ski lift did not work, but they had a tow-rope thing going that was a bit difficult to use. The slides in the park are fun.
Great for Beginners. Having skied in the alps I wasn't that impressed, but It still looked like a lot of fun, especially for kids.

Expensive, but not to be missed!. Who would expect a snow hill (indoors) when the temperature outside is 120F+ ?
You can ski or snowboard (equipment rental available).
It's not cheap, but it is fun!

The freezing land of Dubai. Fantastic, you could visit the penguins even more better you can touch them . Bring some Dhs with you inside because there is a small coffee shop that you could enjoy and spicily if your cold drink a cup of coffee to make you feel warm.

Great way to forget you're in the desert!. We went in the afternoon and although we only stayed for 2 hrs (it's all you really need) we had a great time! For an artificial slope it's very well maintained and it's not ridiculously crowded during summer months which was a relief! A must do in Dubai
Freezing!!!. Good place to run from the hot... Outside.. It is freezing in side.. Nice game some are for well trained such the mountain ski
Sking here we come. Great fun for all ages. A must do after a day out in the sun and shopping in the mall. Polite and helpful staff.
Ski. Our fourth visit to ski Dubai , our eldest son is an excellent skier and he goes straight off the top! This time while he was skiing we went in the fun area, saw penguins and could feed them.
Looks a bit tired. Went to ski Dubai looks very tired and its not cheap and not that busy would not recomend it look from the viewing class instead of paying .

Skiing in the desert who would have thought!. My kids and I had never seen snow so this to us was amazing. My daughter and I did the power pass penguin experience and my husband did the power pass snowboard and 6yrold son did the ski lesson power pass. We all had a wonderful time. Snow balls, snow men, tube rides, chairlift rides, skiing, snowboarding, kissing penguins and phot opportunities galore. All suits, socks, gloves, shoes, ski boots, snowboard boots are provided (great when you are packing for a desert).
Cool place in Dubai. Excellent venue - book online for discount - very professionally run - ski instructors fun and a wonderful cool place to be in the heat of the summer

A Blast!. My fiance and I had so much fun at Ski Dubai!When you pay for your entrance, you are given a snow suit, boots and gloves! We went tubing and even took a few rides up and down the chairlift. There are skiiers and snowboarders of all experience levels having fun here. Kids stand at the base of the hill having snowball fights and there is a small play area for kids tubing and tobogganing.It's about 85 degrees F outside, 65 degrees F in the lobby and 28 degrees F inside the slope. It was a great experience. I would also highly recommend the Penguin Encounter! We got to touch, hug and play with two penguins, McFatty and Lollipop - That's a great experience for kids as well!

Safety is a big conern. I was quite nice family fun but safety was big concern. I visited with my two young daughters 7 years and 9 years. Staff always on hurry. My daughter took slide ride in a rubber tire. Even before she can sit properly and fit herself properly in tire, attendant release the type and she got scratches on hand and almost bumped her head. During the ride on cable car also staff seems to be in utmost hurry. Even before we could sit properly in cable car, it was release and since I have height of 5 feet 10 inches, my lag got trapped under the car for couple of second. Then I pushed myself so hard to stop car from moving further ahead and released my leg, I really thank god that no serious accident happened on that day with me/my family. Staff is in so much hurry they will not even give you safety instructions.So enjoy the ski Dubai but with care.
Penguin show was great for Kids. Nice snow park, lots of things to do with your kids, snow balls and ice slides along with the penguin show, it was great

It is an Icy Indoor Ski Slope. I enjoyed being able to ski in Dubai. During the day the crowds are small; however, the weekends and evenings are out of control with people everywhere. Tons of classes in the early to mid afternoon as well. The slopes are icy, no fresh powder. Still a fun experience but you only need the 2 hr pass if the crowds are down and you can make well over 30 runs.
great fun. I love love love love love it!!!! really great fun!!! well, its not better compare to the real one in Europe, but to see something like this in Dubai...thats just GREAT!!!

Meet the Penguins. For 300 Derham you can buy the day pass to get a close contact with the Penguins or recive sking lessons for kids, plus enjoying all other activiteis . Carry some money with you if you want to have a hot cofee or snaks in the small cafe inside,
Ski Dubai.............. Interesting to have a ski slope and slides for the kids in a Mall. We've seen snow, so no biggie for us. However, a wonderful, and expensive, treat for the people of Dubai.

QUALITY - VERY VERY GOOD. WE ( me n wife ) are regular skiers and absolutely loved it here, had a great time and it was real snow and just like being on a skiing holiday, fun activities to do as well as the skiing included some jumps as well. The ski run could be longer but apart from that it was brilliant.

Excellent experience. Fantastic experience in the middle of the desert! Different length slopes and degrees of difficulty to cater for a complete novice like myself up to an experienced skier and snowboarder.Well worth a visit.

A must-do at Dubai!. Ski Dubai was an awesome experience for us! We were a couple with 2 kids aged 9 & 5 yrs. We didn't buy the regular site-seeing package of Dubai, but had planned an itinerary for ourselves with 1 exciting sport each day!We reached the Mall of Emirates early & bought a special deal from their ticket counter which included Ski lessons for all 4 of us, along with the snow park activities, the Penguin show & free fleece gloves as well! Its better to reach early to avoid crowds.We were issued insulated clothing, woolen socks & very heavy ski boots according to our shoe size. One has to get skis according to the size of these shoes provided. Then keep all your belongings & shoes into a locker. One should definitely use the rest room before getting in all the layers of clothing. All of this takes quite some time. Then you all gather at a specified location to meet your guide (in case you are taking a skiing lesson). The guide escorts the group in. We were 6 adults in a group & the kids had a separate guide. Once inside, you feel a sudden drop in temperature. Just keep following the guide's instructions & soon you'll be skiing down the learner slope. Our kids picked up the sport very fast. It was us adults who kept falling very often. Once skiing is done, you need to return the skiing shoes & ski, and regular rubber snow boots are issued to you. Use rest rooms again now...You return again to the snow & enjoy the activities like the sledge ride, snow tube ride, zorbing, chair-lift ride and take snaps. After that you can enjoy the Penguin show. Please note that there are specific timings of the Penguin show, about 2 hrs apart. Do inquire about them when you re-enter for snow fun, else you may miss out on the show.Overall, a fantastic day! A not-to-be-missed activity when at Dubai!

No value for money. we went there in 2010. it was just okay, very expensive for the 1 and 1/2 hour that we spent there. there wer only a few activities to be done and we were not comfortable in the attire given to us. I think they should introduce more deals for visitors who would like to spend only 1-2 hours there.

Snow in the sun. Well what can I say --- only in Dubai!!
Real snow, skiing, toboggans - ski wear - could have been in UK.
truly surprising. Well worth a look at its real skiing if you don't want to ski pay the entrance fee and ride the chair lift its still worth it a truly amazing place
Good but small compared to others. It is good as a first time experience for an indoor ski place. But if you have seen others you may find it a little small.

A place to be. visited with family. enjoyed the winter in hot Dubai. it is a fund place to be even if you dont know how to ski. the package was really reasonable and lots of activities are available for adults and kids

Heaps of fun. Spectacular sight seeing a snow park in Dubai. Its somewhat confusing to work out what package to buy as you are not allowed on the ski slope unless you are a competent skier/snowboarder or take a lesson. The day I went the beginner lesson was booked out so I would advise booking ahead of time. I still decided to go in and found that there were heaps of fun activities for non skiers many of which were included in the basic entrance pass and some that you either had to pay extra or were part of a super pass. All the gear was part of the pass to but I would suggest taking an extra long sleeve for under the snow jacket because its still quite cold. The signage to many of the rides was poor but I think they are refurbishing. Overall I had an awesome few hours at ski Dubai.

Giant freezer in the hot desert. It is a great respite from the heat outside, and is big enough for a two-hour ski session. The only thing missing for alpine scene is the beer.Very crowded check-in causes bad tempers.

May 2012. I was there last year and its perfect.this year as i couldnt get in cause no one was with us to take care of our baby (2,5 years) and as per their policy child less than 3 years old can not access.
Amazing!. costly but worth every dime! it was an breath taking experience and will do it again soon. dont miss it!
Rug up in the Desert. Surreal is the only word for it. An indoor ski jump and snow field whilst outside it's a blistering 42 degrees celcius. Amazing....and the kids will not stop loving you for it!

Feel The Chill In Heat Of Dubai. Feel The Chill in burning heat of Dubai.Good Place for kids wrt Rides, Feeling snow & to learn Ski.Bit expansive as they do provide jackets & trousers to protect you from cold but apart from tickets you need to buy gloves and Cap from their authorize store which is again too expensive.I recommend visit as its a good experience.
Great experience. Easy purchase of tickets/snow gear hire. Spend all of our time as a couple in the snow fields/taboggan tracks etc. Have not skiied before so we avoided the slopes.

Excelent place to learn how to ski. If you don't know how to ski yet, then Ski Dubai is the perfect place to do it. The instructors are very good and it's much more easier than to learn on the "real world".

Good for kids. If you have not seen snow or have not experience cold temperatures , it is a good place to go. If you are from Europe or any other place where you see snow and natural landscaper for sky sports it might not like you at is is limited.
Excellent. Where else! Inside the Mall of The Emirates so not only can you ski/practice you can shop or watch the skiing from the Apres bar located at the foot of the ski slop

Wall-E. I'm not much of a skier to be honest with you, But there is one thing that I truly love and that's the penguin experience that they have there. My girlfriend and myself go and get the VIP Penguin experience (I believe its about $250 USD per person) and you get a tour with one of the penguin trainers and you get to feed them, see where they live, and how they take care of them. The name of my review is Wall-E cause he is my favorite penguin that is still there at Ski Dubai to this day.

Swoosh Swoosh. After we went to Austria for Christmas I fell immediately in love with skiing. Unfortunately, living in the desert it was hard to follow my new hobby but thanks to ski Dubai i could pursue my hobby. If you dont know how to ski and dont want lessons well dont fret there is a snow park with all new (real) penguins.

uuuggg......cold.....urrggg. it was -5 degrees inside you have to bring your own cap gloves and mufflers otherwise you buy them there and they are not cheep,rest they provide (boots socks and jackets) it was a great experience a must for everyone
cold in the desert. What a place, totally unexpected in the heart of the desert, it is huge and so much to do in there, great for families and oldies alike

Best part of Dubai. You can't go to Dubai without trying the skiing. Great professionalism shown by the staff. Hire equipment was good. You need to buy gloves (get the good ones if you will be there for a while - 70 UAE) and Beanie (30 UAE). The website / ticket said you will be tested with your ski ability before getting on the slope - no one checked us out so on we skiied. The chairlift is in the centre with a 'get off' point half way up or you go to the top. Against the wall is a draglift / T-Bar for experienced skiers. Much quicker than the chairlift but there are some really short steep areas. The best time to go in on weekdays and as soon as it opens. I had the runs to myself for nearly 2 hours. The hot chocolate is awesome and a best way to warm up. Avoid the 2 hour ticket - by the time you are enjoying yourself, the time is up. A day tickets is best option. It can get cold so wear minimum two or three t-shirts underneath your jacket. Bring thick socks as well to get the best comfort for the hire boots.

Snow in the Desert. Just a quick experience in the snow with 300 other agents however what a wonderland of wintry proportions! The 2 slopes are magnificantly kept, and for those who do not ski, there is enough for you to do too! A chairlift, and good quality snow is a great family experience and a great way to cool down in the desert!Fabulous fun!

Snow park in the desert! What else do you want?. We bought the Super pass which was AED200 which includes: Snow Park Entry Unlimited chairlift rides Giant Ball Mountain Thriller Fleece Gloves VoucherOur daughter stayed a good 3 hours in there. If you are planning to seethe Penguins get the Super Pass for an additional AED100. (Otherwise the Penguin encounter alone would be AED145)All the gear shoes, helmets provided. A great way to stay cool in the warm weather!

Try it!. Ski Dubai was a surprisingly good time. I get to Dubai a few times a year as a buddy with airline crew. I kept putting off Ski Dubai with all the other things on my list. A sandstorm on our recent layover moved it to the top. We ski out West and always figured this wouldn't cut it. While it will never be true skiing, it works! From the ride up on the chairs to a med. speed run took us about 15 minutes. Bring gloves. It was that cold. All other equipement comes with your reasonable ticket. We did two hour pass and it was perfect. I liked the "Return To Reality" door. It was weird going from Dubai weather/environment to this --very cool. Move it up on your list.

Cool hangout for a family treat!. This review is actually only of the Snow world in ski Dubai; as we went as a family with small children and none of us know how to ski! This indoor, artificial snow covered attraction is a good experience for wholesome family fun. It had a variety of rides that my young son just couldn't have enough of.... And my mother enjoyed the ski chair lift which gives a view of the skiing going on below us. Pros: lots of fun for small kids.cons: bit expensive if you're on a budget.Tip: Although the ordinary ticket includes entry and warm outer clothing, (excluding helmet and gloves) there are special packages that include the chair lift, fleece gloves, hot chocolate and giant ball ride that seem like a bargain... DONT fall for it... the hot chocolate in the package is outside the snow park and is not exchangeable with any other drink, the giant snow ball ride is something many small kids refuse to do, and if you go in and find that they want these things, you can easily upgrade to a higher package inside !

Loved the experience!. What I found intriguing is the contrast! Coming from 100F outside to the cold and snow of the Ski Dome was amazing. Took two grandkids, 12 and 13, for several hours beginning at about 8 pm to almost 12, they never tired but did get numb feet and fingers after a while. The price, in my opinion, is very reasonable for the basics including pants, jacket, boots and even a pair of socks (unused and in a wrapper). Although some activities are not included in the basic prices, upgrades are available and many choices too. Only downside for me was the exorbitant prices of the photos, the agents start offering the highest prices, then after some negotiating the deals are revealed. Not to my liking at all and no prices are posted, so the bargaining skills must be implemented to get a fair shake! Gave me a chance to wander the Mall of Emirates, have a coffee at the St. Moritz cafe with its charming but fake fireplace! Then this grandmother went in the Ski Dome for some fun in the cold! I do believe we will go again in July!

pay money for nothing. there are nothing inside deserve what you pay for tickets .paying more than 50$ per person and some very silly games do not deserve more than 5$ ,as I been informed that the expensive ticket is for reducing temperature bellow zero degree in city like Dubai ,which is very unreasonable excuse..

Skiing in the Desert. I have been a couple times now, great experience. I have brought a couple friends, 1 snow boarder (still a good guy) and 1 skier. Temperature is -1 inside, 48 outside. No wind, no lines, and quick lift. Pants and Jackets are provided as well as the equipment. Bring gloves.Also they have a great snow area for kids, what a blast!

Had to do it. It was a bit surreal to go diving one day and skiing the next - but had to be done. It catered for all levels-equipment all provided- even socks except hat and gloves. Good value for money . Spectators had a good view . I had only started skiing this year on a dry ski slope and one real snow experience so really enjoyed this experience , I even tried the black run !
My children loved it. Just loved the snow play and tubing . A rest afternoon spent in th snow . Just loved hot chocolate on the mid level cafe using the ski chair lift .

Amazing!. This indoor ski slope is amazing, we have used the one in Manchester in the past but this one in Dubai is approx double the size and even has a chair lift! We had an Entertainer voucher (bogof) so we paid about 100aed/£18pp for a 2 hour pass which included ski rental,ski boots, clothing and socks (we took our own gloves and hats as they charge more for these). There is a drag lift as well as the chair lift but we did not use it as it looked steep and the chair lift saves alot of energy. As well as skiing and snowboarding you could get different passes to go in the play area and zorbing ball, all very cool. We did wear leggings and a long sleeve t-shirt under the clothes provided but I would advise to wear more as we got cold quickly as its -2 but seemed strange to take jumpers to Dubai. Snow was well maintained and as we went early in the day it was freshly combed. There are toilets located on the slope, half way up at the avalanche cafe which was very handy.

Great Fun. I have done Ski Dubai three times when family members visit Dubai. The Entertainer Coupon Book allows for two for one passes. The snow (although not powder) is fine for indoor skiing. Remember to dress warm because hands can get cold even with gloves after an hour or so. The slopes are not too busy. Unique opportunity. Take a small camera.
Great for adults and children.. Didn't experience the snow and cold ( get enough of that in the UK) but enjoyed watching everyone through the plate glass windows. Looked like great fun.

Excellent. was at d ski Dubai with my 5yr old son and he was wowed. coming frm a country wit no snow and seeing all d fun he had...the slides and all was great. good we had a corner where we can buy hot tea :)

Fun but probably only once. Hiworth it once, small slope with yer actual snow. i took my own gloves and socks. Very quiet when I went and may be less pleasant when busy. as all indoor slopes it is short and the chair slow. But passed away an hour or so for DH200. There's not so much shock of the cold as you dont enter from outside: you've been in the aircondition mall for ages anyway. As a keen skier it was something to tick off bit can't say I'd do it again!

this place is a must .... very big indoor ski in arabic country.you should wear a full equipment, otherwise you will be feel cold very fast. spend together with friend and family to make the moment more precious ...

Such good fun. Great place to visit even if you're not going to ski. There's lots to do - ski-lift, lots of bob-sleighs, rides etc. You can also see the penguins. Something very different to do in the usual heat of Dubai.
FUN FUN FUN!. made me feel like a child again, riding down the slides on tube, going up on the cable cars and enjoying a hot cup of hot chocolate at the top with marshmallows and m&ms.
very bad the transportation. if you spend 30min on the lift and 30 min in the queue the fun is gone for sking. this is spending 1 hour for a 2 hour ski pass

Hugged a penguin. Obviously if you are not from the Middle East you can find much better skiing locally, but its amazing they built this indoors and you can touch and pet penguins, which is a first. Def worth it for the penguins, not worth it for the snow if you can see snow every year at home.

How ??. You really have to see this to believe it - in 45c heat how is is possible to maintain a fully functional ski resort complete with ski lifts, sledges, snowball fights, iglus etc etc and great skiing. its one of the most amazing building marvels you will see.

Great experience... Ski Dubai is an amazing place to have fun with kids. Within the Mall of Emirates, it is a must do activity with the kids, The kids had fun watching the penguins, snow boarding, taking rides on the ski lift, and playing with the snow. One can ski on the artificial slopes. The whole ambiance is out of this world, and should be experienced.
too cold. absolutely freezing the suits they give you to wear arent warm at all, staff were very good and the penguins were lovely to see, couldnt stay too much longer could not stand the temperature
An indoor Ski Resort. This was like a bigger version of Xcape in the UK. It had the ski runs with ski lifts and also had a ski village for the younger generation to play in the snow.

Expensive activity, but pitiful. Now we didn't enter Ski Dubai, but you can watch from outside and see how much 'fun' this place is (or isn't). It's not that large so ski slopes and zorb runs are pretty tiny. They have a pretty pitiful penguin display. Basically some guy comes out, penguins know he has fish in his pocket, they follow him around for a bit. And the prices for this are sky high. Seriously the most over-rated attraction in Dubai.

Dinner at the Ski Run. I enjoyed having dinner watching through the enormous plate glass walls in the Dubai Mall. Pretty phenomenal watching all the ski bunnies having a frosty good time in the desert resort.

Indoor Snow Skiing!. Unique experience for sure. A lifelong skier, this experience was not about terrific snow skiing but rather about a very unique experience. Rental includes equipment as well as ski pants and jacket - everyone on the hill is wearing the same. Novelty of skiing indoors wore off before our time was even up. Yet I would not hesitate to recommend; be sure to go with a group of friends, family or colleagues to make the experience even more fun.
Ski Dubai. This gives an excellent escape from the scorching temperature outside, you actually feel like you are in Europe in winter with all the snow and all kinds of snow games, lovely

VERY NICE. WOW.really a very nice experience especially for eastern and Middle East people who didn't experience a snow in the real life.Different offers which almost suits every body.You'll laugh, fall down and ENJOY :)
Desert Alpes. The most amazing thing is to see it in such a hot place. Many people in UAE never saw snow so the idea to put it there is impressive!

Gr8 weather inside. Something of a relief to avoid the scorching, skin tanning heat of dubai. conveniently located in the mall of the emirates, ski dubai is easily reached by monorail.technological achivement.

snowboarding in Dubai!!. Amazing stuff getting a snowboard in Dubai.For around $55 AUD you get a 2 hour lift pass and all your ski snowboard gear.The only thing you need is gloves , so either bring your own or they sell some acceptable ones for $5 in the shop next door.If your travelling and mindful of space in your bag just get the ones next door for $ 5It was really cool and the runs cater for different ski levels.If you cant make turns they make you pay extra for a lesson on the begineers slope.They have a really cool section for kids with Zorb balls tobaogan and tube slides as well.The slopes arnt to crowded either.Only issue is the ski jacket and pants are a little smelly and could be changed over a bit more and velcro wont do up either on pant bottoms.If you like to ski or snowboard make sure you do it!!

We didn't ski but got to hug Penguins!. You learn why it's the only place trying to train penguins (because it's like herding cats!) Still very cool (literally) to pet the penguins and learn about their habits and personalities.

Freezing Fun!. It's like being in a totally different place altogether.You can get Ski lessons and pros can Ski to their heart's content.There are few fun activities that keep kids engaged and wanting for more.You can even try yiur hand in making a snowman!You should carry your own set of gloves, socks and especially cap. They do give you the gear, but for us it was not enough.You can easily spend half a day here.
Snow in the desert ?. Yes true snow in the desert, a great place inside a mall. A real snow ski run. A attraction you must experience. No other place on earth has this.

Freezing!. When you you ski outdoors, you get to feel some sun. Being in here is like being in a giant freezer! We lasted only 2 hrs. It cost our family of 4 about $250 which was for all day but when your nose is red and fingers frozen, it's hard to hang around.The clothing provided is probably not that warm and I strongly suggest you wear some warm clothing to start with eg. bring a cardigan to wear under ski outfit.It was more of a novelty and an experience for us rather than trying to do some serious skiing.

Great indoor entertainment.. We head heard about the indoor ski park in Dubai and I remained quite skeptical about how well it would perform being much to small to get any real skiing. How wrong I was! We ventured to the Mall of the Emirates and had a good look around before deciding to try it. We had taken our own gloves and beanie, but everything else was supplied with the entry fee - skis, boots and suit. We paid for a two hour stint on the ski slope and after kitting up, we entered the slope. As you enter, the time starts automatically by reading the plastic card which you have inserted into the sleeve of your jacket. This is a great system, for every time you enter the chairlift, your access is permitted by the card and when your time is up, it simply tells you, so no clock watching.The temperature inside is -5C and the slope is groomed every night. The snow is dry and crisp and easy to ski upon. I marveled at the size of the slope which cannot really be seen until you enter the slope itself. Although I hadn't skied for 15 years, within a couple of runs it all came back and we all thoroughly enjoyed our time, which went all too quickly. I thought it good value, being efficient and fun. Snow skiing in the desert ... well I never!!!

Kids went crazy in Ski Dubai and had awesome time. My kids just loved Ski Dubai, rides. Slides, throwing snow and hot chocolate. Rides are amazing. Photographs taken by in house photographer are very expensive, make sure you have got your camera and batteries fully charged.
crazy. imagine that outside it's 45 degrees celsius, you see people with huge snow jackets... whats going on? there is a real snowy hill inside a mall where you can ski. these emirates are crazy!

True skiing on real snow, plus great fun toboggan rides and encounters with live penguins - and all this in Dubai!. Snow, a chair lift, a green, a blue, a red and a black slope and all this inside a shopping mall in Dubai. Incredible and worthwhile, not only because something as weird and impressive as this must be experienced, but also because the snow park activities are great fun and the skiing is genuinely good. Plus our 5-year old son got to ski for the first time and, with the help of the ski school instructor, did fantastically well and loved it. The penguin encounter is also an amazing experience and truly memorable. If you can spare a day for this in Dubai, do!

Didn't ski, but how often can you hug a penguin?!. We went to Ski Dubai to see the penguins and it was GREAT. We booked a later time, so we went at night, which meant there were fewer people and had a great time hanging out with penguins. Unfortunately they don't allow cameras so it's a bit of a rip off to buy the pictures (in addition to the admission) but again, how often are you going to be hugging a penguin? So, even though it was expensive, I thought it was worth the money.
Looked very good. Only had a quick look at the excellent facilities. Didn't actually ski. Cost about £40 for 2 hours or £60 all day. All equipment included.

beach, sand, ski....?. had a chance to be here in april. i make it a tradition to drop in and at least ski for a few hours. they have packages for a few hours or for all day, with or without lessons. just get a two hour package. its about 80 US. and then grab your skis and go for it. it gets cold so buy some cheap gloves downstairs at the ski store. 10US. the experience is priceless. like a bad Citibank commercial. would highly recommend. which of your friends can say they snow skied in the middle of the desert?

ski at all seasons. although it is not for professional ski people, we found it interesting. We have been to many ski resorts in Switzerland and Australia ( Mount Buller), but Ski Dubai is convenient for people who would like to start ski lessons specially families with children. It is well organised and has stable weather all year round! Children can spend hours of fun. Being not crowded is another advantage.However if you are a professional sports person you may find it boring.

Snow in the middle of the desert. For professional skiers, this will be a funny experience as slopes are really short so this is not a proper skiing experience. Given the fact that skiing slopes have been constructed in, virtually, middle of the desert, this is an absolutely must-try wonder of modern architecture, to be seen nowhere else in the world. Do not miss!

Good, but not as fun as some other attractions in Dubai. Unless you've skied before you'll be unable to use the big slope. Four one hour lessons are required for novices - we were unaware of this before we went.Novices get access to the small tobogganing track and the tube slide for a basic pass. That's pretty much it. For an upgrade within the centre (more to pay) you can use the ski lift, long toboggan, etc.For just the basic pass like we opted for, 2 hours is enough, you've done it all. We went on a fairly quiet day and were stopped at least a dozen times by Ski Dubai photographers for photos which became annoying.Still good to go but if you've played with snow elsewhere, wouldn't rush to get there as Dubai has some fantastic other options for kids. Shopping centre around it was pretty good and can have a look at Ski Dubai through the glass windows.If you buy "The Entertainer" there is a 2 for 1 pass in it. This book was worthwhile buying for the all the attractions in Dubai (available from bookshops in the shopping centres).
Just amazing!. Well it takes quite some time that you look at a ski slope in the middle of the dessert. Great fun for all ages, helpful staff and overall a fantastic experience! Highly recommended.

Worth a visit but expensive.. Liked :1. The overall atmosphere inside is chilling and refreshing.2. Few rides are very good. specially the ropeway.3. Very good for skiers. that too in the desert landDisliked :1. Long ques2. Very expensive. Around 250 AED each. Locker itself is 40 AED.3. Limited rides4. Unfriendly guy in specks before entrance. Would not give ideas on small plans and would directly insist to go for whole package and does not share information thoroughly. 5. Mall of Emirates is too big. Took lot of time in finding the place for ski dubai. Lack of directions as compared to Dubai Mall

must visit attraction if you visit Dubai.. We visited ski Dubai with my two kids I was bit apprehensive before going there but I was wrong kids loved it, it is must visit attraction if you visit Dubai.

Exhilarating and Exhausting. This was not my first time, but it was so for my two boys; 11 & 9 years old. I loved it from the first time, but they loved it more. It was the highlight of our two full days stay in Dubai.Some research is needed to determine which ticket you want to buy as there are many possibilities and making the decision while people are waiting is not the best. I saw a few take VIP level tickets costing about US$240 and not really knowing what the alternatives were. As we did not really want to ski or take skiing lessons, we had to decide between a Super Pass (about US$87) and a Power Pass (US$58) where the Super Pass includes an interaction with the penguins.We had a hard time with the portion the followed buying the tickets which is getting the right-size attire. With the crowd being very light, it still took us a good 30 minutes and my son still went back to get a smaller size. One thing to note is the boot sizes are at least three sizes bigger than normal. In other words, if you shoe size is US 45 (UK 10), make sure you try 41 or 42 before you leave to the changing area. If not, you might end up standing in line again or having an argument with another customer if you skip the line.Putting on the attire was somewhat of a struggle with two kids, but we managed though I was feeling hot inside out by the time we were done. One thing to remember is to keep the entry cards(or tickets) outside either in your hands, in the very small pocket in the left arm of the jacket. It might in fact be a good idea to carry a small cross body bag with you.Once inside, all the waiting, the heat and whatever were forgotten. We starting shooting photos with the kids from the entry and did not want to stop. It was not about snow only, but the design of the place provides for many photo opportunities. More than that the activities offered are all wonderful and exciting. Even though we did not ski, we took the ride up to the top and saw some skiers, young and old, doing some interesting moves and truly enjoying themselves.Though the final part of our visit, interacting with the penguins, was less than I expected, it was still exhilarating for the boys. They keep taking about it and chose to have their photos with the king penguin printed more than the other photos.We spent almost three and a half hours from beginning to end and another hour choosing the photos (we lost the reference numbers as we did not have a place to hold them). We also had to wait another half hour for the photo package to be prepared which we spent at a restaurant having a meal and resting. We will definitely remember this experience fondly for many years to come.

A must visit for sure brrrrr. I was contemplating whether how good and value for money would this be. It turned out to be a really good experience. Of course Dubai is overall expensive so this cant be any exception to this. But then the fun here was worth it. You can do different rides ehre and enjoy the indoor ski experience inside a mall! Now isnt that amazing. Of course the photo charges for their printed photos is too expensive and not worth it.

Kids over it. Kids loved every minute. Was very cold inside so dress warm and maybe use an extra pair of socks. We bought a combo ticket that included access to Wild Wadi - worked out to be cheaper.....had to buy gloves though at 20 dirhams each. Good experience to ski in the middle of a desert.

Slips and giggles. Who would have thought that I would fly 10000 miles away from home where I lived within a couple of hours drive of some of the most stunning ski fields in the world to learn to snow board in the middle of the desert in 38 degree heat? Not me, yet here I am!Ski Dubai is attached to the Mall of the Emirates and the parking is free. Some of the systems they have set up require a bit of waiting in lines and there certainly could be more staff on hand to help the bewildered looking newbies wandering around. Apart from that it was a seamless affair by UAE standards. The gear was all in perfect working order, the lesson was very good and well laid out. I have no issue with the AED170 cost and will definitely be going back for more! If you see a fat old guy floundering around in the ice at the bottom of a slope, wave because it's probably me:-)

Just Amazing. The Ski Dubai is situated inside "The Mall of the Emirates". I don't have enough words to explain how amazing this place is. It was the first time I ever saw snow in my life and what a place to see it in Dubai. Although its quiet pricey, its well worth it. My only advice to potential tourists would be to avoid touching the ice with the free gloves that they provide because the gloves cannot sustain the heat for too long and you'll be forced to come out. This advice is more for people with kids as they get very excited and want to touch the snow. Otherwise this place is great for both adults and kids.
The kids love it. As they never saw ice in their lives they loved the place. it is fun mostly for teens coming from a hot countries and never experienced snow. but taking photoes is very expensive.

Saw from a distance. The Ski Dubai is inside the Emirates Mall so we just saw it through the glass windows. Looked amazing, with chair lift, ski slopes and all kinds of fun stuff going in. Great for the kids.

Amazing Activity in a Desert Setting!. When visiting The Mall of the Emirates, don't miss going to see the indoor ski slope or if you want, you can experience it first hand. The Metro goes to the Emirates Mall. In the mall, just near the ski slope, there is a great restaurant called 'The Cheesecake Factory'. This restaurant has an extensive meal menu & a great range of cheesecakes. One of the workers even took us on a tour of the restaurant, when we were checking it out. You can even sit at the window which is beside the part of the ski slope where the ball ride is located. This makes for an exciting meal, as the balls head straight for the window. No danger of course, just a few moments of stress at the beginning of your meal until you realise you are quite safe. Food, fun, excitement & cheesecake! Can't get much better than this! Have fun, near the snow, in the desert, while eating dessert!

Nice for the kids. Ski Dubai is nice for kids( and those who still think they are). In the Mall of Emirates, you would never think you were in the middle of a shopping mall in the heat. Ski slopes were great and for Dhs200 you can rent all the gear needed and make use of the ski lift. Very enjoyable

Penguin experience. We booked the 45 mins experience, you get given a ski jacket and trousers and boots socks and gloves. Bit of a catch as you have to pay for a locker (20 dirham) where else are you going to put your clothes.We waited around as family (not with us) in our group argued over letting their 2 year old in for 20 mins, I don't think this took away from our time with the penguins, but was irritating. After watching a brief instruction video we went through and met pumpkin. The trainer chatted about him then there was a photo opportunity, with their photographer. There is no cameras allowed ( this didn't stop the other family!) then we went through and met 2 king penguins which we were allowed to stroke and pet, ( while taking photos which of course cost a fortune !) Over all great experience, the time was long enough as you may start getting cold . If you do a longer experience you may want to wear more layers.We got to stroke 2 real penguins and yes paid 100 Dirhams for the photo to remember it by!

Just what you need in Dubai. Ski Dubai was a lot better than what I expected. The hill was larger and the price was reasonable for what you get. For 200 AED with coupon, you get the full rental gear plus a two hour lift pass. Two hours was the perfect amount of time to have an enjoyable day. The facility surprised me with a rail section that had three rails/boxes to hit (two side by side ones followed by a final one) giving a decent option for your run. There were also two nice jumps set up on the bottom portion of the hill, but they were not open when I was there. We went on a Thursday afternoon and the place was nearly empty. No lines for the chairlift and even less for the t-bar (which if you can bear it, gets you about double the amount of runs as the chair due to speed). We did not buy or rent hats or gloves, but a thin pair of gloves would be recommended if you are doing any sort of stuff that could end up with yourself on the snow. Speaking of snow, that was the only slight downfall to the facility as the boards did not seem to be waxed and carving through the snow sometimes would slow you down noticeably. If you have some time in Dubai and a few extra bucks, I'd definitely recommend this attraction.

An original experience!. The fact that you can ski in a hot country like the UAE is amazing and stunning really.I mean you can go for a desert drive, the beach and have an afternoon dedicated to ski! That doesn't happen anywhere else in the world!

Fantastic experience - snow in the sun. This is a fantastic thing to do. My son did the "Discovery Lesson" and loved it. He then did the "Beginner lesson. Discovery is 60 mins, and other lessons are 90 mins. He was completely exhausted after each. All equipment is provided except gloves - and prices are reasonable.A variety of activities available - ski-ing, snow boarding, tabogans, big balls, and there is even penguins.It was lovely seeing the faces of people who had never seen snow before... endearing!

Great to try!. My husband is able to ski but hadn't for several years, I couldn't ski. I had previously looked up on their website, what you could do and cost etc. It said gloves weren't provided. I believed you could take an hour lesson, then had a go on the slopes yourself. When we got there this was not the case. The reception/pay area was a bit confusing, we were told to by the snow pass separately, then go and book the lesson. It cost the same and the people where you book the snow lesson, seemed to be surprised as we were when we had to pay/book separately. You now get free gloves. The equipment was ok, but if you feel the cold, I would take a jumper for underneath the coat and wear long trousers. The lesson was ok, showing us the basics we booked up for the 12 oclock lesson, there were only three of us in the lesson, which was good.The snow park was really aimed at children, but worth having a go on the rides it is a bit of fun.

very Good!. Much better then I would have imagined.You have 4 slopes to choose from and its a good experience.2 hrs are more then enough. But bare in mind it´s REALLY cold inside, so dress warm and bring some gloves since they are not included in the ski equipment.
Take your kids there.... It is a great opportunity for kids and adults to learn how to ski before the go to the real slopes. The price is not bad for the package. The kids are having fun

Loved my visit to Ski Dubai. Can you believe it? Ski slopes in a mall? Amazing! Even if you don't ski or snowboard, buy a ticket and enjoy just being in this wonderful attraction. Yes, it's cold however, with the price of a ticket you are outfitted in a warm coat. Take the cable car up to the top of the slopes. There is a little cafe that serves fantastic hot chocolate.
we watched not went on. this and the ice rink are a novel idea for the gulf , mostly busy at weekends, enjoyed watching ladies in black viels skiing down slopes, unusual sight, a must for kids

Blow your budget to see the Penguins!. There is something to be said seeing something as surreal as a ski slope in the middle of the desert (not to mention a shopping mall) however the real treat here is to meet the only King Penguins in the world who are able to interact with humans. While the VIP experience is pricey, the experience is priceless. You are able to learn about the penguins, feed them and interact with them as the make their 'march' through the ski area. This is a great educational program and truly a once in a lifetime experience.

Surprisingly good with a few reservations. Another of those things that had to be done, but I wasn't expecting too much. The queues to get in were agonisingly slow - too many people with too many choices asking too many questions about the too many options. Something they definitely need to improve - maybe a dedicated line for skiiers only as most of the people were taking their little kids to the snowpark. However, once on the slope, it was great. Good snow conditions, not too crowded, and great fun. Two hours was just right. My only complaint was the behaviour of some of the young lads who were skiing too fast and in some cases rather recklessly, and were not being challenged by the staff who were on site and should have been reining them in. But apart from them, it was great.

First time skiing a success. I had never been skiing before so why now while vacationing in Dubai. I had to take a ski lesson of course, however I found the instructor very informative and easy to understand. It really is more like ice skiing rather than snow skiing however I enjoyed it anyway. Only down side, it does have a fairly hefty pricetag.

Great if you fancy a day off. What a great idea! One minute you are sunbathing in 40 degrees and the next minute you are wearing thermal socks and gloves and skiing down a black run. Great for kids or if you fancy a break from all the hotel bars/clubs.

Fantastic. I have walked past it many times since it has opened and never had the desire to go in and try it till my boyfriend asked to go while on holiday with me in Dubai. I don't no regret it for a second. Having never skied before they ask how competent you are at skiing and I of course said I had done it many times before... not such a good idea at the beginning. We got an all day pass for AED 300 rather than AED 200 for only 2 hours, an all day pass is much better as one only starts enjoying it after 2 hours!!! there are baby slopes, medium slopes (not sure of the correct terminology) and the black slope which in many proficient skiers minds is very good for an indoor ski slope. There are other activities to do for those who don't want to ski and you don't feel like your in a mall for a second other than the people flat nosed against the mall window panel its pretty realistic and enjoyable! will go again before I hit the real deal. Be smart get an instructor for an extra fee, I had one for free luckily by bf could ski and was a great coach!!!
Kids loved it. Kids favourite thing. My kids ski so they got stuck straight in. Avoid Fridays and saturdays as local days off.

Ski Dubai. Amazing indoor ski resort. My husband and son and son inlaw tried it out. While my daughter and I went shopping. Didn't help when my husband took my son and headed down the wrong way brought the resort to a stand still thank god they were ok we had a great laugh over it for ages after

Ice and sand. Fantastic that you can get this experience in the desert.A tip though is to be there almost 1 hour before your booking as that is how long it takes to work your way through the crowds, and the process of getting your tickets, getting your gear, putting it on, getting your clothes in the lockers. We missed our slot and had to wait a whole hour in our gear fr the next slot, which fortunately was not booked out. The hassle of getting ready is the only downside as the ticket/dressing area is as busy as a railway station. Other than that a great experience and worth the trek. Even experienced skiers get a kick with a visit.

Not bad for a ski hill in the desert. Impressive facility with a reasonable ski experience. Service and lessons could be improved...somehow tossing the 3-year olds who are learning how to ski on the same hill as the folks who think FAST = BETTER doesn't seem wise.

Skiing in Dubai. Incredible. Inside the Mall of Emerates in Dubai. Although theski run is short, it is amazing that it is created inside a mall in a nation that has outside temperatures in the 80s (F).

A great afternoon out in the hot Dubai sun!. Ski Dubai is an amazing place to be in, especially if you are visiting during the harsh summer months. Probably the only place that would be snowing!!! Warning! For Europeans used to natural snow clad peaks, this may not be that great an attraction. However, for people who are from the hotter climes such as Asia, this is definitely a place to be. Or you may want to visit it just to marvel at the way an entire snow park has been created right in a desert country, and even more so, right in the middle of a mall!!!Would suggest taking the entire package which costs around AED 200 per head if you want to enjoy all the activities on offer. This includes the zorb ball and slides. You can also watch the penguins being fed if you are lucky to visit around their lunchtime. There is a separate package that allows you to feed the penguins, though that is a bit expensive. For people travelling with kids, this is an extremely kid friendly place. The kids can freely run about while you have your little ME time. The place is extremely safe and manned by very helpful staff.You also have access to lockers to keep all your stuff. And if you get hungry after all this activity, remember that you are inside the Mall of the Emirates! Plenty of food options are available.

Amazing!. Most amazing indoor ski centre I've ever been to! I love that little cafe that you can go too half way down when you get tired! Hot chocolate with marshmallows and whipped cream AND m&m's!!!! OMG!

A winter wonderland.... Ski Dubai provides a great afternoon out for skiers and non skiers alike. My sister and I have both been skiing since we were very young children, and of course the slope hardly competes with the real deal, but it's still great fun and somewhat of a novelty to ski in a shopping centre in the Middle East! My boyfriend is not a skier but enjoyed his discovery lesson there too. This trip we decided to try the Penguin Encounter, which costs around £30 per person. You get to 'meet' a couple of penguins, stroke one and give it a hug, which was fantastic! Be warned that no cameras are allowed and that their photos cost 100 dirhams (around £18) each, which is a bit of a sting! The snow park also looks great for the little ones, although I have not visited it myself. Everyone should visit this place whilst in Dubai, a definite must! Tip: This year's Entertainer book has vouchers for BOGOF on skiing and the snow park (I think) although not for the Penguin Encounter, so might be worth getting one if you are planning on doing lots of activities and eating out a lot in Dubai
Great for kids. We did the Snow Park with our 2 and 9 year old - it was brilliant although a bit smaller than I was expecting. I can't imagine spending more than about an hour in there.

lot of fun! 126 out side and 30 in side. Great time you know you can even get some to teach you how to ski.Their are a lot of kids there though but is so worth it how many people can say theyWent skiing in Dubai! The snow is fresh and relaxing is a def must do!
UAE visit 10-16 March 2013. I like very much. We enjoyed with our family and relatives. We spent about hour time. This is a really nice spot.

Dubai winter all year round. nice to start ur winter experience here, we took ski lift ride for dhs80 per person but we manage to enjoy the snow park and watch the penguin show before going up the ski lift and have our picture taking up there at avalanche café before going back down, the attendant generously given us a brochure for free hot chocolate that we enjoyed after the ski experience, lockers have dhs20 deposit, I suggest renting gloves if u wanna stay 2 hours inside cos it gets really cold and bring ur own bonnet to enjoy -3 degrees C temp.

Amazing. Just experiencing snow inside a mall, with dubai temperatures is a great experience. A little pricey.A large ski slope. Located in Mall of the Emirates. Equipment hire is easy. You can ski for 2 hours. Bring your own gloves. Worth a visit if you are in Dubai.

the only ski place in the dessert.. When ever the time,you can come to this place to ski,it is totally exciting for you and your family to ski in the hot place like this,no where else you can find in this world.
Brilliant must go place in Dubai. Even if you dont ski theres lots to do! Great place for whole family. Excellent value for money. Dont miss the experience!

Another amazing piece of fun infra in Dubai. For those who have never visited a Snow spot, this is a must visit place. Take the AED 200 Day Pass and all family members can enjoy. Dont forget to get down at the Coffee Shop half-way up the Trolley ride for some hot coffee and hotter brownies to warm our body. Stay there for an hour atleast and click snaps of the ski slopes..

You ought to do this once in your life. I am an excellent skier and normally ski outdoors in the Alps or the Rockies. So this indoor skiing sure isn't anything that compare to that. But it's a great, cool and fun experience one should not miss. Where else in the world can you go skiing in your shorts (all gear including ski suit is included in the price!) and flipflops, 5 mins. later you're on the slopes with your gear on and half an hour after skiing you sitting in your beach chair at Jumeira Beach Park. Very well organised, great staff! Go in the morning just before noon, you're alone on the slopes breathing the crisp cold air and realizing that outside it's 40°C!
not worth the money. Do not go there if you do not know how to sky. Rather look at the ice in your chest freezer. Rides are hopeless and will only appeal to under 10's.
amazing. Just experiencing snow inside a mall, with dubai temperatures is a great experience.Place was packed with teenagers. So be prepared to bump into them.A little pricey.Recommended
Great trip. Best time for the kids we had perfect time. Well organized. Bit expensive though. You don't need to bring ur gadget They rent everything

Wow. Went there with my kids. Amazing experience when you consider you're skiing indoors, and in the desert. It was as authenticity as possible given the circumstances. The kids had a blast, and talked about the experience for days.
Winter wonderland in the desert.. Get your skiing fix in the heat of Dubai. Pretty good legitimate skiing considering it's all indoors. Only in Dubai. Colder here than on the outdoor slopes

Fabulous indoor ski slope. A large ski slope. Located in Mall of the Emirates. Equipment hire is easy. You can ski for 2 hours. Avalanche Cafe at the top of the slope to warm up and drink hot chocolate. Bring your own gloves. Worth a visit if you are in Dubai.
First time skier. Tried the introductory lesson and loved it, will be back for a further course of lessons. Skiing when its 35C outside fantastic !
Fantastic fun!. The staff were lovely & helpful & we had a ball. It really is amazing to have this set up in the middle of a shopping centre!! Have fun!

Ski Dubai. This was in itself an experience, who knew or could picture a ski resort in the middle of the desert?? It however offered everything a ski lodge/resort could & does. We had a blast, on the ski lift, tubing & the the other rides in the park......LOVE IT, LOVE IT......

The only ski resort in the UAE! Great fun!. Indoor ski resorts can be found all over the world (we have 3 in the UK), but Ski Dubai is one of the longest with over 500, of skiable snow, served by a Poma and quad chairlift.Registration was quick, as was kit distribution. Boots and skis were tired and beaten up, but functional. Over trousers and jackets were provided. It's important to take your own gloves!!Snow conditions were good, and we enjoyed 2 hours of skiing. Not quite the Alps, but the next best thing!

Chilled out time @ Ski Dubai. We had a wonderful time at Ski Dubai on our visit to Dubai in March 2013. A must for your Dubai itinerary. Carry your own gloves as the ones available there are a bit expensive.
Only inside ski resort. It is the world's only inside ski restort. It is cool to watch people ski while you are drinking a hot cocco and eating pastry.
great fun. Son really enjoyed this, he thought the two hour session would be too long but it wasn't. It was challenging enough for him and he enjoyed the novelty of skiing in the desert.

Snow in the desert?. An odd and surreal experience in Dubai but absolutely FUN!!!!!When planning a visit to Dubai, Snowboarding in the desert seemed like a fun novelty idea that would be disappointingly small proved otherwise! Though small, the concept of snowboarding in the desert overwhelmingly drew out smiles! Included in the price of the lift tickets were clothing, equipment and hours of fun. Please note, gloves and helmets are an extra charge but those with experience will not find these items absolutely necessary. There is basically one small run that takes about 7 minutes up the lift but watching beginners and spectators was quite entertaining. Those with experience will enjoy the terrain park that will allow you to jump a car!!!!Great fun, good value for under $60USD which is much cheaper that actually skiing or snowboarding a real mountain.

not worth it. It is amazing being able to ski in the middle of the desert.However, unless you have no alternative choice, it is not worth it.The runs are very short and easy (despite their classification in blu red and black).It is enough to look at it from outside through the big windows....

A great deal of fun at Ski Dubai. We arrived at Ski Dubai and the very helpful guy suggested the best pass for us. They give you new gloves and new socks for the books, you get suited up with jackets and pants and a locker to put everything in.Then you go inside, you can see Emperor Penguins, toboggan, zorb ball, body tobogganing, etcWe had such a great time and it was a very great relief from the warm weather. Would absolutely recommend spending some time here.

Better Than Expected. I was surprised at the size and the slope here - it was great. For one price you get a coat and ski equipment with ski lift.I stayed for about 2 hours and enjoyed every minute. Tip: go later in the evening for less crowds. I practically had the place to myself. And do let them take your (expensive) photo....you need a record of the event.Go. This is a unique experience and well worth the effort.
Do the penguin encounter. if you love animals and unique experiences you can't do this anywhere else in the world. We got to kiss and hug actual penguins and it was awesome!
Fun. Amazing to see as you would not think you were in Dubai. Didn't venture in as we can't ski/snowboard but had lots of fun just watching.
Snow in the desert. A place to be for a experience.Watch the penguins for sure at 2 pm.For people who loves SKI it is a different experience.wonderfully made and enjoy all the rides..

very good place. the ski dubai is a huge place, you can play in real snow and skiing.i didnot go into ski dubai since i have seen real and live snow here in india, and didnt see it worth spending. but people who havent had a snow experience, this place is must go for them

An overrated novelty. Coming from Australia this was a novelty for us. We paid 300AED for a discovery ski lesson and access to the Snow Park (without the penguin encounter). The lesson (150AED) on its own would have been fine but the Snow Park was overrated. I was imagining some sort of a walk through winter wonderland but it is basically little more than 3 very short rides, a chair lift and a small ice cave.

An amazing sight in a mall nonetheless. Didin't go into the attraction but seeing is really believing! This is a hige snowpark with slides and rides available or both young and old. You can get lessons as well and also play with the penguins. Fun all round.

ok ok place. its not snow.. Just frozen ice.. Over priced.. Nothing in there thats special other than the fact that ur standing in minus 3 tens mins after u were in the parking at 35 deg cel. Wouldnt go there again.

A ski station in a Mall. It is funny to see all the children and adults wearing all same ski outfits.A real ski station surrounded by glass.The best view of this station is from the few restaurants overlooking the station.
Amazing DUBAI

Very new experience of snow activities. I have enjoyed this. This is a unique concept of artificial snow mountain, activities, fun ride, ice skiing etc. you can stay here more than 2-3 hrs, due to -4 temp. Overall good place to enjoy.
Good suggestion is upgrade service is available at counter, you can take super pass to enjoy all best experience of snow unlimited.

Coooold Icy Ski Dubai. One of the best places to be with kids if your family has never seen snow. Its real cold there. -3c. But the experience is unmatched. Snow balls and slides and cable cars. We did not use the slope but the village and rides there were simply amazing.

Bit of a novelty. Two slopes, only average. Wouldn't go again.. I wouldn't go again. The fee you pay covers "all equipment" with the exception of beanie/hat and gloves. Stupidly! So you have to pay for those on top. Im a decent skiier for an Australian and I found it a bit easy in parts. I was bored after 90 mins. Glad I only bought the 2 hour pass! If you're a great skier give it a miss. A good place to learn and there's a special section for kids.
