Interesting but very costly. We visited snow park, it was nice although costly and gloves were not provided with the package which is unfair.
A big let down. I am a confirmed skier but wanted to see this unique place. It is barely a hill so I felt a bit robbed of my pleasure. It is very pricey too.

Bizarre but True. The cost to enter this experience may not be worth it but it worth a trip to the Mall of the Emerites just to see it. The Penguin Encounter was expensive but our kids loved it. We live in cold climate so the snow was not as exciting to it is a strangely weird experience.

I never thought skiing was so difficult. Amazing experience skiing for the first time. Good activities for kids. The place is very well organized and our instructor was good. One can easily spend the whole day here.

Big refrigerator. It's true.Ski Dubai is one big refrigerator or bettes say cold room with some acrivities inside.It is completely wrong if you expect to feel the snow,as inside there is no snow but only iceas frozen water,If you expect to ski inside,it is not so bad but track is very short.Snow park consist of sledge track which can really harm you and safety procedures are reallyon very low level.What a fun!Premium rooms at Kempinski have refrigerator view,just in case you want to imaginethat you are at St.Moritz or Wengen.Anyway not better than 3 of 5

Fun fun. For canadians it's fun to be able to ski in Dubai with average exterior weather of 30C in march.
Very well organisation .
A place to visit

First time skiing and what fun we had!!. A must to do if you are in Dubai, but please if this is your first time skiing, start with the smallest slope and work you way up, I must say it is not a nice feeling hitting a wall on your way down.. This is realy a place to have a fun and good time..
Pour experience. The idea of making a slope in the desert is great but the slope is for thous who haven't seen a real one.

WHAT???. a ski slope in a mall... Well I guess if I lived there and wanted my children to learn to ski before they moved to California or Switzerland... Its cool.. I have never been to a mall with a ski slope.. ice rink yes... oh wait.. My hotel the hyatt had an ice rink.. OH DUBAI... ahhhhhhhh

A ski resort inside of the mall!. It is 35C degrees outside, but Dubai Ski inside of mall of Emirates has -6C. It is amazing how much Emirates build and how vast is their imagination!The ski Dubai can be seen through the window..if you are not into skiing, iceskating, or freezing yourself for an entrance fee. When we were there I saw a lot of children, and mostly adults supervising them.You can rent all,the winter equipment, and purchase the necessary clothes if you will. They have slopes there and a lift.Overall pretty impressive for an outdoor ski place.

So much fun!. Amazing that there is a ski run, blue, inside a mall! There are other activities such as sledding, tobogganing and rolling down hills in a giant ball. Also, there is the penguin adventure where you actually get to pet live penguins, and learn more about them. It is the only place in the world that you are able to do this. An adventure not to be forgotten!
Awesome. I thought I was in real snow on a real slope. If you could make it to a real slope this would be the next best thing, everyone was freindly patience and fun.

Good visit even if just for a couple of hours. USD prices are about $55 for a 2-hour pass or $82 for an all-day pass. We used the 2-hour pass and it was worth it for a quick visit. They provide all clothing and gear EXCEPT gloves. Bring your own gloves or you will have to buy some. You can buy a cheap pair ($22) if needed. Fun for kids and adults.

Great for the whole family, learners who just want to try skiing or those that had to give up their ski holiday to go to a hot c. Great place. Never going to beat a mountain but lovely controlled conditions offer a chance to work on your technique and escape the relentless desert air of Dubai. Great for learners as a quick 1 hour lesson gets the juices running before a proper trip to the alps.

Skiing snapshot. A great experience, it was the perfect thing for me because I had never been skiing before so it was a lovely snap shot of what a skiing holiday would be like. The staff were very friendly and helpful! Still have to go and see the penguins though really looking forward to that.
Not too sure!!. Went because it was a ski resort in the middle of the desert. Expensive if you are not a ski person. Would not recommend it to my friends and family that visit.

A great fun place for kids. I thoroughly enjoyed ski dubai. I went with my kids, I took the general entrance, which though a bit pricey was worth it. I recommend it for families going with kids and also just to have fun with friends. Do take the slope rides, they are totally fun. They also had the penguins, which was good. Enjoyed it... was a riot.
Skiing. Unfortunately I did not have time to go in and it was a bit pricey but through the window one could see the people were enjoying the ski lifts, building snowmen and skiing

Fun for everyone. It's just like being on real ski slopes.It's not just for people who can ski. People who can't ski can have a great time too in the snow, there's slides, rings, climbing, ice sculptures! This indoor skiing centre is a good attraction in a hot country. Especially in the summer, when Dubai gets very hot.

Straight out the frying pan into the Freeezzzeer!. Something different to try when your out in Dubai, I've never been skiing or snowboarding before so it was quite an unusual feel to be outside in the blazing sun one minute then going into the cold facility to ski... but i'm glad i did.It was recommend to us to do lessons if we'd never snowboarded before however me and my cousin was feeling quite rebellious (not recommended) and just decided to take to the snow and teach our self's!! It took me about 30 mins to get the hang of it and started hitting the decided to hit the slopes, i had a lot of falls and tumbles but it was all learning in practice.I think the whole thing lasted about 1hr30mins/2hrs all together, it can be very tiring so make sure you've eaten something small before hand. I have to say it was extremely fun, i had a good time with my cousin who lives out there and it made me feel like i would possibly do a ski resort holiday.There is a great view from inside the largest mall in the world the Dubai Mall of Emirates(MOE) looking into SkiDubai and an even more awesome view from inside the Kempinski Hotel where you can see inside Ski Dubai from your hotel room,i imagine that to be quite kool and expensive!! I am back to Dubai in June2013 and i will definitely be coming back here hopefully as a professional!!!!lol ;-) p.s ...its real SNOW!!!

Surreal -we met penguins only. Very strange experience to be donning ski gear to keep warm when it's over 30C outside I have to say !Being only moderate and non skiers we opted for the meet the penguin experience which apparently is unique in being the only place where you can get up close to and stroke a penguin,After getting kitted out you get to meet a couple of gentoo penguins followed by 2 king penguins which you can stroke and touch. The emphasis is all around pics with the penguins and you will get a hard sell and the pics are incredibly expensive, given they are pretty unique you may find it difficult to say no so be aware beforehand.The groups taken in are up to around 12 a time and you get split in to twos or threes for the pics.Unique experience although incredibly expensive !!

Great wxperience. For people who are used to ski/snowborad the 400m slope is a bit tiny, but for beginners is good. But for all its a great experience and everything worked great. The temperature is on a comfortable zone between -1-2 degrees celcius.When you buy your lift ticket, it includes also skis+poles/snowbord, boots, winter-activity pants and jacket and disposable socks. All you need you own (or by for some penny) is gloves and if you want to have something on your head.

Stinky cloth and lack of safety. We went with the kids hoping to spend a great time with them specially that they wee missing the snow and cold weather. The ski clothes we rented were stinky. I doubt they were ever cleaned! The safety is questionable with so any black spot everywhere which makes it very difficult to keep an eye on the kids without shadowing them! And the staff does not sounds too professional either. Can't wit for a competition to ski dubai, maybe this will make them up their service!
Snow. Having watched a programme all about this, we had to see it for ourselves. Didn't go in, but had a good view from the mail. Has to be seen to be believed.

looked like fun!. In a shopping mall and looks brilliant fun for all but its very busy and very pricey. Need to book. Not a good idea to wait and see if you can go in without booking or your just going to be disappointed

Not a very big place to enjoy. Skiing for most people, its rare experience in life, because of geography. But if u want to visit, u must know, it just looks big from outside, but the adventure arena for skiing is not that big in inside. Big ball rolling was definite fun.But the best thing would be Peng a frienf where you can have time spent with penguins and have fun with them.

Snow Park Fun. My daughter and I checked out the snow park at Ski Dubai in March 2013, with a SuperPass. It is expensive ($50 each, no discount for kids over the age of 3), but for that price you get a rental snowsuit and boots, and free fleece gloves. Once you get inside, there is room to wander and experience the "cold", with a bobsled slide, and a tube-run, plus the Zorb ball run. The SuperPass also let's you ride the chairlift to the top, but my daughter was under the minimum height restriction (about 140cm, if I recall).My daughter has never experienced really cold weather or snow before, so she absolutely loved it! We spent nearly 2 hours inside, and had a blast! Definitely worth the money for the fun!

When in Rome...(but not that impressive). As someone who is a regular skier, I wasn’t overly impressed with Ski Dubai, but hey when in Rome! Ski Dubai is located inside Mall of the Emirates. I bought the Ski Pass, which was 180AED for 2 hours (the other options wouldn’t allow you to ski).I then paid 20AED for a locker (refundable) so I could get changed. It’s a well oiled machine, as far as you got and pick up your snow pants, boots and jackets (bring your own gloves and hats and they don’t provide those). Also helpful hint, don’t put on your boots as you will have to take them off to get your skies sized!After you have your skies you will grab your poles and head upstairs where you can get on the lifts. You can either get off half way up (near the “lodge”) or take the chairlift to the top where you can either go right or left (so essentially two trails).Tips: Don’t put on your boots as you will have to take them off to get your skies sized. Bring money for the lodge and your camera.

Great fun. Lots of options apart from skiing, I never skied before so done a 60min intro for 150Dirhams well worth the price, the instructer was very friendly and professional made learning easy. I would return again for more advanced experience.
Snowing in the desert!. if you want to try something special, and you never have try the real ski, this is the right place for you and your friends!Quite small but very realistic...

A wonderful experience, but don't forget hats and gloves. The snow conditions were only so so, but it was a great experience to ride the "expert trail" in Dubai. It takes longer to take the 2 chair lifts up than to ski down, but it was fun. Don't forget to buy the Ski Dubai polo shirt-- a great conversation piece. Remember to bring gloves and a hat....everything else is given to you. A nice way to spend 2 hours.

Great. This was great. No need to take any ski equipment as you are provided with everything including ski suits and socks! As a guide for those who have visited the Tamworth Snowdome this is much better. We really enjoyed our visit here. A great break from the heat of Dubai too.

Surreal. So there I went with a friend to face the slopes of Dubai. You came from a huge shopping mall, pay the 200AED fee for two hours, get your equipment and is ready to go. The guy who regulates the skis asked very seriously my level of ski to make sure the bindings were OK. Once you are in you feel hot because of the clothes but over the 2 hours you feel pretty cold. There is one quadruple chairlift that is very slow and reduces speed all the time because apparently local people like riding the lift as if in an amusement park. The ski lift is faster but has 2 very steep passages. The snow felt a bit wet in the beginning, but once you are used to it it is ok. Temperature was -4C. One part of the slope is like a european red track, there is a small jump on the way. I had a lot of fun, specially considering that this is in the middle of the desert. Don't forget to bring your hat and gloves, the rest is included in the fee. I highly recommend this attraction for skiers of all levels.

Loved this place lots, what a good laugh. Been to this place twice, once with family and the second time with friendsLoved this place lots, was such a good laughWent to the mall and then here, didnt do skiing just the entry, was a good laugh with the snow and walking around and stuff, would definitely recommend and would go againReally enjoyed it

Ski and snow fun for family giggles. A friend of mine worked on the construction of this surreal but iconic Dubai attraction. 2 hours worth of skiing on pretty simple slopes with shoppers in tee shirts and shorts watching from behind glass walls. If you're and avid skier you'll likely be bored after 4 or 5 runs. For novices ans those with families it's pretty cool. We went mod week so we pretty much had the chair lifts and slopes to our selves. Considering you get the clothes and ski gear thrown in to the 2 hour deal it's not a bad deal and there's plenty of lower slope snow fun and a penguin encounter to be had for the younger kids and/or non-skiers. It was colder than we were expecting so if you are prone to the cold, take some of your own layers and decent gloves. We warmed up at about the 60min mark in the cafe hand way up the slopes with a hot chocolate. We the had late lunch on the ground floor outside looking in at TGIF's. Had to be done and we very much enjoyed the one-off uniqueness of it.

Fun place. I had some visitors in town and after visiting a few places they wanted to do something diferent, why not skying.
Great experience. Would go again at anytime.
2 hours of snow and fun. The idea of skiing in the desert...The track is short and the ride on the lift pretty long, but I can recommend it.

Lots of fun. We went to Ski Dubai with our three year old and purchased the penguin encounter and the snow park ticket. For a three year old the penguin encounter was probably a bit long and they bring the penguins out for a presentation during the day so for travellers with small people with short attention spans I would probably forgo the encounter and just check presentation times. We also ended up upgrading to the full super pass as she wanted to go on the chair lift and ball. I was amazed at how much she could actually go on and do. They have staff everywhere and it was very safe and well run. We had a great time and I would recommend.
Much better than what I expected. I did like the size of the tracks actually. Too bad the walls are not decorated with mountains views. Lifts are great but a bit slow.

Fun!. I have to say, I had a blast! I signed up for both the 2 hours of skiing and entry into the snow park. The snow park had sledding and tubing. It does take awhile to wait in line and get all your gear. There weren't too many people when I went (around 11am), so there weren't many lines for the chair lift. The only downside is that it isn't very big - so there is only 1 chair lift and you can choose to go down the right side or the left side.
Skiing in the Desert. who will not want to see snow and ski in the desert all this happens though artificially it is a great place to be and worth the money spent now they even have penguins there
A bit of fun. The idea of snow in the desert is comical. Well equipped and good fun. Sledging and ice sculptures were ace. Young kids love it.

Go just to say you've been there.. I'm not a skier so maybe this was wasted on me but I felt like this place was way too expensive and didn't have much to offer. The "snow" was packed and dirty so the little ones couldn't really play with it. The rides are fun for a little while but all the bundling for a few minutes, is not worth it.
Not for the skiiers. If you go there keep in mind that it is attraction not ski track. Beside that lift system is good thay run it so slow that you can faster go up by your foot.

Perfect to cool yourself down in a hot desert weather. We loved the place!!!-Price is good. For 2 adult people 2 hours is enough -You can rent everything there besides glove which you really need. Its freaking cold there:)-If u cant ski or snowboard take the lesson. MY husband didnt they took him of the slop. You have to catch a lift to the top and then go down there is no small halfway slopes and If u try to do it the security will come to you. You cant use small kids slopes unless you bought the lesson.All in All its a wicked experience definitely go there!!!!

crazy thing at desert. this one is crazy, snow at desert? just try this one. this attraction is bery well managed. you can have a package suit to your skill. for me who came from tropical country, just get inside and stay at the coffe shop inside is more than enough. its minus 4 degree inside and its too cold for me.the best things is taht they have a speciality shop providing winter gloves up to ski board, amazing....
Just Amazing. A great xperience, one of the must do activity here in dubai feeling of being middle of the Alps right here in Dubai
Great Fun. Its amazing fun for the kids and elders.Very well made and very well managed.A must go if u go to Dubai.
Great Snowboarding lessons. Tip: Go early, they are much less crowded. The instructors were first rate. Very helpful and very patient. This is an amazing attraction.

Surreal. Well organised and imaginative. Slightly odd to be snow skiing at around -2 degrees and then going out into the Dubai sun! Was quite quiet when we went so never had to queue for the chairlift. One patch of sticky snow but apart from that the skiing was good. Hire clothing ok but definitely need to take ski gloves (and socks - disposable ones supplied looked thin!). Overall a good couple of hours

Snow in Desert Country !!!!. Amazing snow park in the middle of a shopping mall.... warm clothes, gloves and snow shoes provided... ice sculptures, sledding, giant snowball, skiing, chairlift... and all the works !!! Truly amazing !!!

A fun novelty. Ski Dubai is a great activity for those with and without experience. Personally, as someone who likes long runs and variety in my ski runs I would not go there again. It was fun and great value and offers some alternate activities such as bobsled, zorbing and penguin encounters.

Excellent ski in the shopping mall. We went to this place after my friends recommended that you should not miss and especially if you have kids . i would advise people to carry their handgloves as they dont give along with the dress and shoes but ofcourse you can buy . The kids had amazing time and the rides were exciting . Also it is difficult to think of such ski park inside the mall.

Skiing in the desert…how cool. As soon I found out I was headed to Dubai, I knew I had to do this. I didn't ski, but I tubed, tobogganed, and opted to do the penguin encounter. So worth the money!! I would say the penguin encounter was the best. You get to touch and interact with Gentoo and King penguins. They are soooo cute!!

3-thumbs for Ski Dubai. I like the idea that this place is man-made and inside the Dubai Mall. It's not really for average skiier but more so for folks who has no idea what a ski resort should be. There is nothing like skiing in a powdery snow resort such as Utah, Colorado, Washington, NY in US.

Freezing in Dubai. The Ski Dubai is located in the Emirates Mall, which is easy to reach via shuttle bus or metro. A day pass is for around 60 Euro quite okay, if you consider that it is in the UAE. Through the week you dont have to wait long, so its really worth it. You get free helmets, which allows you to use the Fun Park (boxes, rails and a table topper). From time to time there are two small kicker open, table is around 1,5 and 2-3 meter. Clothing is included but no gloves and hats. The socks are free of charge also included. As it is directly connected with the mall (where a carre-four) is available) its easy to get cheap food beside this a lot of restaurants are available. Even for me who grow up in the alps it was a nice experience, its not a must do thing, but its worth it.
fun!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. just something different imagine desert in iceland!!!!!!!!!!!! so real at times makes you feel in alps ( bit exaggrating )

Just ridiculous. I had to give it five stars just for daring to exist. A ski resort in the middle of the desert. It was a total hoot and just what I needed to give me a white Christmas. Hadn't been skiing for years, and couldn't walk for days afterward, but I did have fun.
not very modern. The space looks old and the shopping mall where it is located has a crowded parking space and looks too old.Not really worth going there on purpose.
Worth the Expensiveness. Nice experience to touch and feel snow in the middle east. Even though expensive, it's worth. We had fun
Amazing experience. Only possible if there are no infants or kids below 3 with you. it's a nice experience in the ski dubai.
Real snow that looks like fake. If you come from a country that has snow, this is a joke. Its fun to see from the malls windows how snow makes you feel and do when you haven't seen it before.

Loads Of Fun. Where else in the world can you experience snow in the desert? This place was loads of fun. I had never seen snow before, let alone had the chance to ski or snow board. This place caters for everyone...kids, the inexperienced and the experienced. It was great fun, visit their website and see what they have on offer. I had a great time learning how to snow board for the first time. Everything was provided, boots, board and clothing. You won't be supplied beanies or gloves, but can purchase them at the store while you are there if you want them. You do need to line up to get the boots and clothing, so get there a little ahead of schedule to ensure you don't miss the starting time if you are taking a lesson. My only regret was believing that the soft, fluffy snow was indeed that...I fell on my butt and the snow was like concrete...two days later my butt is still sore...try to soften your fall if possible!
Great Fun. Had visited Ski Dubai and its really a unique place to hangout in a city like Dubai. Must go place to when in Dubai.

A cool place to visit. This is worth the experience for skiers who need that fix. Wear more than shorts and tshirt underneath the suit as the cold does seep through. Try to go early or later in the day as it can be busy. You can pick up a fair bit of speed on the runs but have to beware of those being trained closer to the bottom.2.5 hours were enough for me.

What fun!. We took our 3 and 5 year old boys - they loved the tubing area. We went right when it opened mid-week so there were no crowds. My husband went skiing while I played with the boys. One tip - remember to bring your own gloves so you don't have to buy. Everything else is included in the ticket.
Soo cold and fun.. It so incredible to see snow in the desert.We played with snow balls and slide down the snow.WoW!You havent been to Dubai till you try the skis.

Great Experience for the kids and adults alike. Good for a 3 to 4 hours of pure fun. Ski, snow board, and do loads of fun stuff while there. Ride the chair lift if nothing else.Dont forget to visit the Penguins

THE SNOW SKI AREA AT THE EMIRATES MALL. The snow ski area is superb. it is huge and has real snow. I love the warm coats and other accesories they provide you before entering.the play area is really cool for kids and adults. the ice carvings are awesome.  oh if you havent been to switzerland then you can have a feeling of being there by going higher on the ski slopes and sitting on the chair lifts.fantastic for a desert hot place one would least expect to have so much snow activity, to top it all those who do not wish to enter the snow region there is a full gass view inside the shopping mall from where you can look at your near and dear ones what they are doing there. Once you go there you wil definiteley not mind going again and again for more.

Good Day Out. I live in Dubai and am a keen skier. I was a little uncertain as to whether this would be a waste of money or not! It isn't a waste of time or money it really is a good day out, suggest the 2hour package for your first trip there even if you are a keen skier as the slopes are hardly challenging but there is more than enough to keep interest for a short session.We did 2x 2hrs so 4hrs in total but that is not for the faint hearted if you want to get your moneys worth. One annoyance was that in between our two hours sessions we left our poles with an instructor at the bottom by the entry point who assured us that she would look after them, of course we came back and they were gone so we had to waste our skiing time queueing up to get another set of replacements.Overall though, it appeared well run and we had a good day there and will definitely go back a few times each year to keep in practice for the main season in Europe. Thank you Ski Dubai a nice little business you have there :)

Indoor Skiing in the Desert!. As keen skiers we just had to do this. Probably best to visit in the evening when the sun has gone in or a good way to spend a couple of hours if the family are shopping.If you are an experienced skier don't expect much. The cost is fair at about £40 for two hours. This includes Skis boots poles and waterproofs. Take gloves and wrap up warm its freezing in there!!Skis are ok boots a bit tired as you would expect. Its got the slowest chair I,ve ever been on. 9 minutes to ascend and about 10 seconds to ski down so you will spend most of your time freezing on the chair!!Had to do it but wouldn't go again.

Great Experience. The very fact that an indoor ski slopes have been made inside a mall in Dubai is itself a amazing thing to see and experience. The facilities are superb you will get all the gloves, shoes, jacket, equipment and gear with a locker room. The only drawback is that the slopes are very crowded and you need to be careful . Would suggest people to try an weekday to avoid the crowd.But overall this is a great place to see while you are in dubai

Gotta try!!!. I spend some time in Dubai,one of the things i heard is this place,one of Dubai's many attractions but still gotta come,been skiing before but a couple friends were not that experienced and had such a great time learning! even if have done it before you will enjoy,got a family they will love you after this!!! do not miss it!

The audacity of dreams. The sheer imagination and audacity to smoothly run an experience like Ski Dubai is laudable. Very well organised to handle customer traffic and friendly staff, this a great excperience for kids and adults alike. Even if you dont know skiing, there is enough fun to have ! My son just loved it, as it was the forst time he saw snow in real life.

A unique "only on Dubai" experience. I had a free day in Dubai and I decided to go skiing. I figured why not.I was impressed with the facility. The snow is actually pretty good, considering it's man made and you're in the desert. The cost for two hours, including a full suit, poles and skis was about $60 USD. Not too bad, as I had expected it to be higher.They have two runs - a steeper "expert" run and a "intermediate" run. I went up and down many times and had a blast. I got to meet up with many people from all over the world.If you're not into skiing, they also have a snow park you can play in, which is great for little kids and big kids like me. :)It was definitely worth going, and I can't recommend it enough.

A great experience. As soon as you have finished the stressful part of it, cueing for skidress, shoes and skis, it is really great. A 4-seat chairlift takes you up the top of the 400m slope, or you decide to take the t-bar lift that takes you to the same point at the top (the second slope which is a little bit more steep. Also jumps are available for snowboard or ski, an ice channel used with tubes and even zorbing (additional charge). It is really worth going there, a lot of fun! Go there late afternoon or evening, they are open until 11pm, we have been there from 8:30 until 10:30pm, waiting time at the lift was zero!!

Nice Place. This place is located in the mall of the emirates itself. We did not enter the place, but we just enjoyed watching the children enjoying in the Ice from outside. It appeared it s a great fun to be there. We did not enter due to time constraints, otherwise, we would have definately tried. The Ice Sking, Ice Rolling and there are some amazing rides which will surely make your day... :D

54 us dollars to get all outfitted and get skis and or snowboard.... It doesn't get much cooler. The staff is knowledgeable and very polite. The snow is surprisingly good packed powder. The slope is about as steep as an east coast blue run. But the wow factor of skiing in a mall when it is 85 degrees f outside is worth it.
family outing. whenever my family come, i take them there, good games for all, not tried sking as there is load of fun for me down, but people who tried sking they can learn and enjoy

WOW a ski resort in a MALL. That is cool. Who but Dubai would think of making a man made ski resort in a mall. That is exactly where the Ski Dubai is located, in the MOE or the Mall of the Emirates as it is known. All the man made snow, the ski lifts and the sking downhill makes you forget you are in Dubai Dessert or in a mall for that matter. Go there if anything only to have a look.

Go early and enjoy the empty slope. The snow was surprisingly good, it was pretty cold after a couple of hours so wear warm clothes. It is quite fun for a short burst of skiing and I was empty first thing so you feel like you have the run to yourself. A few rails and jumps. Chairlift and button lift to get to the top. One slow run, and a slightly steeper one to chose from.
Good value. highly recommend to buy the "super pass"get a free tutorial and unlimited time to enjoy all facilities inside the parkamazing experiences to ski in the desert

An entertaining experience. I went to ski dubai with my brother and we had so much fun there. They give i the costumes and then get ready . There is some activities in which u can do there and it's really worth visiting.
What a Thrill.. What a fantastic facility to have in the middle of this city! It was like being back in my home country of Scotland!A great centre with lots of children learning the art of skiing.
Snow in the Desert. Very fun place to be knowing that you are in the desert. Option to hire gloves is a must. Good fun activities inside.
Skiing in the desert. Where else in the world can you ski on the water, sand and snow all in a day! You've gotta do this just to say you have. The ski run is small but it's fast and fun.
what an experience. felt like swiss in Dubai.. God. These guys can create anything man made. real ski ing feel too. it was wonderful.

Great fun! Definitely worth 2-3 hours of your life!. Ski Dubai & the Snow World in there is awesome. Wearing the jackets & clothes is a bit of a task but is totally worth it. Also, they dont provide gloves so that is a mandatory expense one has to undergo... But all this is worth it. The slides, rides, both for kids & adults are awesome and if you're a skier, you can enjoy the main ski slope as well. They have regular penguin shows too which the kids loved!!!

Only cool if you are a beginner. This hill compares to a "bunny hill" to anyone who has skiing experience. If you have never been around snow or are a beginner you will love this place. The price isn't bad and it is cool to be in snow when the outside temp is 100!

Go if you have never seen snow. The only special thing about this place is the fact that it is located under a roof in a city that would otherwise never see the snow. Glad to have seen it so I can say I did- but don't think it was worthy of the long walk through the Emirates Mall. Would only recommend seeing it if you have time to kill and have seen everything else.

Ski lesson. We did a Ski lesson - a good experience for someone who has never skied ever. Very good instructor, and new equipment. WE didnt try any of the other activities but they looked like alot of fun.
So Real. The snow feels so real. its cold inside but they give you clothes for the weather. good to go on a hot summer day in dubai and feel the contrast.skiing lessons available for extra fee.

Outstanding Ski slope in the Desert. Truly a wonder to have an indoor ski slope in the Arabian desert. Huge tourist attraction and an absolutely outstanding facility available to residents and visitors to Dubai

exciting ski run in the desert:). Although we have a great ski tourism in Bulgaria it was an exciting experience to go skiing in Dubai. The ski slopes are not steep as the slopes in Europe but it is a great experience for the beginners. Very good organisation and reasonable prices. Love it!

Awesome for Dubai skiing!. Came here during a business trip and decided to do it because I hadn't been able to ski back home (Colorado) for the past 2 years, and figured it'd be cool to do it in Dubai. For the record, I typically ski intermediate and difficult (blues and black diamonds) terrain in most of Colorado's ski resorts.Liked: Scratched my itch for carving some powder (surprisingly decent powder)! Runs were steep enough to provide some practice on my turns. Great package deal that included a jacket (didn't think I'd actually need it, but did), snow pants (I turned this down), skis/thin boot socks/boots/poles, and the "lift ticket" (doubles as a storage locker key for a few extra bucks). I brought my own hat and gloves, but only wore the gloves and was fine; not sure if hat/gloves come with the package, didn't look like it but there is a small winter clothing store with name brand stuff if you really have the money to spend. Also, a few other activities for non-skiers that looked worth checking out. Didn't do any though, just wanted to ski!Dislikes: SLOW chairlift. Took much longer to go up the chairlift than to go down the run. They have a "T-bar" type lift that was labeled for experts only, but it was the fastest way up the slope. I've never ridden a "T-bar" and had no issues figuring it out.Interesting note: They actually built a little "lodge" half way up for a hot beverage/snack stop. Interesting.Final Notes: Relative to the fact that it's a man-made, indoor ski slope (in Dubai, no less), it does the job for getting some runs in. They have a bunny hill off to the side for learners, but as an average skier, I was pleased with Ski Dubai; just would've been nice if the lift was quicker since the runs are short.
Cool ;-). A must-do if you're into skiing. Granted, the slope is tiny, but the sheer fact that one can snow ski in Dubai is reason enough to do it!

Can't beat skiing in Dubai. After having heard about the indoor ski mountain in Dubai I had to go as a part of my trip. The facility is very nice, part of the Mall of the Emirates. For about $50 you can rent skis, boots and ski gear. Bring your own gloves or buy them there. The mountain is obviously short but decent for what it is. Snow quality was good and they keep the temps at about 30 degrees. You can buy 2 hour pass or all day, I did the 2. I was glad I went!
Cool off!. Excellent place to spend a summers afternoon. Slope is long for an indoor venue but short if you are used to the mountains. chair lift is slow.

Snow in the sand. Great family fun for thr Dad's & kids! Very well organised. Two types of passes, standard & super. With super you can avail of ski slope & chair lifts. Our family from Aus. Got to play in the snow for the 1st. Time as did their Irish cousins, despite our colder climate. In a word brilliant! Great way to spend 2-3 hours while the girls do the Mall which is one of the most pleasant in Dubai. If you love cars, bring a camera. This is where all the exotica of Dubai will end up.

Snow in the desert!!. It almost surreal watching skiers glide down the slopes...while it's 30oC and more outside. Quite a feat of engineering considering the difference in air temperature between outside and inside Skiworld Dubai.

Weird, but a must-do in Dubai. Ok, so it is kind of surreal that you're on a ski slope at -2 when its +25 outside (Jan 13). However, having experience of other indoor slopes in the UK, and of 'real snow', I have to say that I'm really impressed with Ski Dubai. The prices aren't bad; about £30 for a 2 hour pass, but that includes all your equipment (apart from gloves). The equipment is getting a little on the 'tired' side, and is probably due for replacement, but certainly is not bad.The slopes themselves are great; there's a central chair-lift which can drop you at the half-way stage of the slope, or you can stay on to go to the top. There's also a button-lift to take you directly to the top (with some massive inclines!!).The two times I've been so far, it's been at about 20:00 in the evening, and you pretty much have the whole slope to yourself. There are plenty of other people around inside, but they are there mostly for the snow 'experience', rather than skiing or snowboarding.The slopes are good; certainly not without bumps and ruts, and steeper sections, but the biggest issue is dodging people queuing for the toboggan run if you choose to go from the top, and not down the black run.The time from base to top on the chair lift and back down is about 10 mins (fairly slow chair), so your two hours flies past.If you're in Dubai, pay this place a visit - its a great way to spend a couple of hours (but don't forget your gloves!!)

overrated and overpriced. i went to ski dubai just for the experience and i do regret it  its overpriced for nothing !the games aren't funnothing is actually fun about it except that one photo of you there is for 120 derhamseriously ?i dont recommend this to anyoneeven for children its not fun save ur time and money and go some where else

Ski in the desert. I went snowboarding here, it was very good, cold inside like real snow. Although it looks bigger than it actually is. They ave a penguin facility now where you can go and sit with real penguins, that is amazing.

Funtastic. It does not snow in Gauteng , South Africa so this was an amazing , fulfilled experience for the kids. They loved the rides and just that cold experience. Very conveniently located in the emirates mall. The food there is great too!

Great time. Absolute beginners, all did lessons. Turned up in shorts and shirts and were quickly organised and ready to take it on. After a quick hour lesson, we all left voting to return. Only wish we had done this on our first days in Dubai, instead of our last.

Fab location in the mall. Great facility located in the mall of emirates. We visited on a Wednesday morning and the check in process was seamless. The snow was good quality and so was the equipment. Note you will need gloves which are available to purchase. All other equipment and clothing is provided down to the disposable socks. Cafe on the hill is reasonable for a hot chocolate. We opted for the 2 hour session which was more than adequate as no queues for the lift. The only negative would be that there were skiers allowed on the main hill who had not skied before and were some what of a liability to themselves and others. Therefore more stringent vetting would be recommended.

Awesome Experience. We visited Ski Dubai in December 2012. We really enjoyed all the activities and felt it was real value for money. Our advise to fellow travellers would be to go early in the morning, as it gets quite crowded after 12 pm.

Ski Dubai. Ski Dubai is (as of 2012) the longest indoor ski park (in a shopping mall) in the world. It is great for:-beginners (level snow, free from bumps). -intermediates, who wish to warm up or refresh their skills before hitting the slopes in Europe or elsewhere.-experts (for practicing tricks, boxes, rails, jumps etc). (Last Thursday of every month, experts can practice their jumps/flips and land in an airfilled cushion!). In fact this resembles more like a snow park.-people who are tired of shopping, but have to accompany family members who do!-are bored of treadmills, but need to exercise.It is NOT for:-long cruising runs (I am intermediate skiier and at full speed without slalom, it takes me about 30 seconds from top to bottom)-enjoying views (as it is entirely indoors)Overall, I would recommend it if your purpose is one of the items I listed above, as thats whats its great for. It has REAL snow, temperatures are about -4 degrees celcius, so its cool but not to cold. Great for summer!

Just for the fun of it!. Bulky clothing, shoes and locker provided, but your hands get frozen without gloves. Don't forget to get your 20dirhams refund for the locker. We did the rides as we are not skiers. A fun experience!

I felt stupid going in there, but depends where you are from.. Look, if you come from some country where there is snow, and you have gone skiing on a real mountain, well, the novelty just is not there, at least not for me. Of course, for desert people who have never seen snow, it is just incredible--skiing in the desert! OK, maybe it was kind of silly for a Canadian like me, who worked in arctic, to pay money to walk around in the snow, but there you go. I am sure people from hot places think this is just incredible, and it is, for them. I just felt like an idiot walking around the the little patch of snow in a building after fleeing Canada to get away from exactly the same thing.

Great for a beginner. We had never skiied before so this was a great taster session, we brought the Power Pass which included a 1 hour beginner's skiing lesson and unlimted access to the snow park afterwards. The instructor was really helpful and we picked it up in no time - only wish we had booked it at the start of our visit so that we could of got some more lessons/time on the slope during our stay. Clothes and gloves included. We took our wolly hats with us which came in handy as it gets very cold in there!

Ya kinda gotta do it!. Really...it's just to say you did it....but it is kind of fun too.....They give you everything but gloves and a hat and 2hours is about all you can do....5 min up the chairlift and then 30 seconds down!!! They have a half pipe and rails if you are into that sort of thing and it's kind of fun going up on the quad chair with international people...

Inside cold, outside hot!. Having lived all my childhood in the sweltering climate of Abu dhabi (just 2 hours drive down south from dubai), it was quite amusing to have a skiing holiday experience at Ski Dubai, which dad had arranged as a surprise for me and my brother. On a hot Saturday afternoon, we reached Mall of the Emirates & walked down to the basement floor to get to the entrance of ski dubai. It was an on-the-spot booking and thankfully, did not require any prior preparations. You'll get all the necessary ski clothing, gloves, boots & equipment for having a great cool day. Or you can buy extra stuff at the retail shop SnoPro. So, we entered indoors - it was as big as 3 football fields, covered with snow at -1 to -2 degrees which was poles apart from the hot climate outside. We took lots of pictures (ya, it's ok to take in your camera and phones,but keep them safe; my watch stopped working after 3 hours). There was a penguin show at 4 pm. Those interested can pay to spent more time with the penguins..:). Sightseeing on the chairlift was fun as we had a better view of the whole area including people skiing down the 5 runs. One side of the enclosure is made of glass, through which you can see the 2 floors of the inside of the mall. We waved hi to our parents outside who could see us from the 2nd floor. At the end of the chairlift, be prepared to pose for a snap as it descends. You can collect that photo or a souvenir with your photo on it after you're done with the tour. There were many other rides, including turning down tube slides, snowboarding, running down a slope in a Giant Ball, where you get the effect of running down an avalanche, or simply playing with the snow & throwing snowballs at each other. If you want to learn skiing, this is your best time as you will be guided under professional ski school instructors. Other stuff include kids party rooms, tow lifts, refreshment spots and so on. The next time I visit this place, I'm definitely going to get my friends and learn how to ski.
It is a must for every single visitor to Dubai. Ski Dubai is an exceptional place. You can enjoy the skiing during peak summer time or anytime else. It's fun to try, for adults and children.

Skiing in the desert - simply because you can. Like much of Dubai, the underlying philosophy behind building a real-snow ski-dome just 25 degrees north of the Equator appears to be: 'why not'?That said, having turned up not knowing what to expect it was a lot better than expected. Checking in and getting kitted up is flawless - there are plenty of staff members on hand, queues are negligible and I was suited, booted and ready to go within 10 minutes of arrival. Lift passes are electronic like all modern ski resorts and flawless in operation. The timer shows you how long you have left to go.The dome itself has both a button lift and - hilariously - a full chair lift. The poma is recommended, since it is significantly quicker. The slope itself is divided into two and is about 380 metres long, which really is very impressive and longer than any such equivalent in Britain. There is a bit of artistic licence taken with the description of a 'black slope' - there is a 10 yard section that is slightly steeper and icier than the rest, but I wouldn't have considered that this qualifies.One recommendation: take gloves! All other kit is provided, which is genuinely fantastic (particularly as you are unlikely to have brought your thermals and ski jacket to Dubai!), but no gloves are provided, and you are going to need them for anything longer than an hour.Overall - you wouldn't (I hope) go to Dubai for the purpose of a skiing holiday, but it is more than worth your while once you are there and is recommended as a result.
Good bit of fun!. We went as adults, and still had a lot of fun. Im sire would be even better with children. Selling AMAZING hot chocolate in the cafe too. Well worth checking out!

Ski in Dubai.. The metro can take you to the ski "resort" which is in a supermarket. You can hire the ski gear and go skiing for a couple of hours in the cold or sit outside in the heat and watch them do it.
You won't see this anywhere else.

Book a Group Lesson. I thought it would be a bit fake but it's just like skiing on a mountain in Northern Italy or French Alps.We got a group lesson for the whole family. We did the Discovery lesson (haven't been skiing since school) and were split into adults, juniors and little ones. My 3 and 6 year old were in a group together with a local child and the older children were in another group with some children from Saudi, husband and I were in an adult group with local adults and some english tourists. We were on the same slopes as the children so they were happy to be seperated from us because they could still see us. We had so much fun that we all booked again for the beginners lesson for 2 days later. The small children did not advance so they did 'Discovery' again, but we still saw them on the slopes having a great time. All the equipment and warm clothes are provided. It can take ages to get fitted out though, so it is better to arrive an hour before the lesson (especially if you have 5 children) so you don't end up late for your lesson. We went on the snow park after the lessons and the children really enjoyed the tobogan runs and seeing the penguins. It was not a cheap day out but you are allowed to stay all day and exit and return as much as you want. Plus it is open until very late at night. Next time we are in Dubai we will definitely go again. We were given a passport to show which skills we had mastered.
Great fun in the snow when outside its roasting. Definitely a must for anyone visiting or living here.... Lessons are available too . Lots of fun for the family for all ages here ....
Cool down in the heat. The kids love this place, while shopping at the mall and skiing in the summer heat,and we shall come back

Feel in Switzerland snow tracks still in Dubai.... Everytime I go back to Dubai always go back a little time for refreshment to the Emirates Mall and the Ski Dubai, where we can remember, surrounded by a very hot sun, our loved austrian Alpes and its stupendous snow tracks. Track is small but despite the cold everything is so pleasant and cosy inside that it truly worth a visit. Don't miss it...

Better for beginners. Great place if the weather is bad and your bored of shopping or sunbathing. Experienced skis might find it boring as only two slopes but one is more challenging. Great place to learn to ski though and brilliant for kids too. Even little ones as they have a snow park where you can sledge etc. there are a few nice bars looking onto the slopes if your friends want to ski and you don't. Après ski (I think it's called that) has nice food and wine! You can get a mulled wine in there too!

Snow in sahara. Playing snow and sand in same day? yes you can. Actually the place is great, but we dissapointed because they cancelled penguin snow without notification in advance. Should pay more attention on this!

Fantastic family fun!. Loved, loved this place. None of our family had ever attempted skiing or snow boarding, so this was a perfect opportunity. The instructors were very patient with the adults and children alike, although we found we were just getting the hang of it when it was time to stop. Loads of fun for the children in the play area, another "must do" while in Dubai.

Not what i expected but nice. I expected it to be bigger however it was medium size. If you do not ski there are very few activities that you can do. There are slides and zork balls that you can ride. Its cold so dress warm even though they give you the suit. i think for what you get , its quiet expensive. We spent half a day here as we were bored after a while.I would recommend that you at least experience it

Its all downhill from here.. Well there was no snow back home when we left so off we trekked. Shorts and T shirt underneath, warm jacket and trousers over the top.
Bizarre but brilliant.
Why not give it a go. A great experience and very friendly and helpful staff. We were first timers and it was a very enjoyable experience and one I would recommend to all. Go on give it a try.

great entertainment. Be sure to know what the snow park pass - the basic and the super pass entitles you. get warm caps and gloves from home .the penguins show is a must ...for kids. at 2p.m , 4p.m 6 p.m and 8 p.m. it was a great day out..the kids love it..

Good Fun. It was our first trip to Dubai. We're from Asia and we don't have snow here. So our kids (17 & 10) loved Ski Dubai. It was a lot of fun for all of us as there is something for everyone...especially those people who can't ski. It's best to go there early in the morning as it gets a bit crowded later on in the day especially at the locker/changing room. We bought the day-pass so that we could take a break and went to a coffee shop at the mall to warm up as our children learned how to ski. We needed that break as we're not used to cold weather. Overall, it was good fun at Ski Dubai.

Brilliant!. A bit of a mess about to get kitted up/ changed, but thats not the fault of the place, thats just the way it is...a good 30 mins to get your boots/ skis fitted and get dressed up. Brilliant facilities across the spectrum, the kids can do zorbing or bob-sled or meet the penguins..theres a beginers slope and plenty of instruction on hand, plus the main slope. The snow is great, no icy patches to speak of and not too crowded either. The chair lift is great but a bit slow, the button lift is faster to the top but challenging!Good fun, reasonable prices

Expensive but fun... If you've never visited a country with snow before, this is your chance. The place is so real inside and they have lots of games you can play. For a tourist, it is so expensive though. If you don't know how to ski, you're not gonna spend a lot of time inside.
Skiing. My kids thoroughly enjoyed this! They hired an instructer who was fantastic with them. Bit cold though!! lol!

Skiing in Dubai was Fun. Located by the Emirates mall. It was easy to find. A must do for any skier. We walked in from the mall in summer cloths and paid for our 2 hours of skiing. Very help staff. They provided all the equipment. The chairlift was well organized. We felt like we were at any ski hill in Canada. An amazing indoor experience.

funny and expensive. went there on x-mas day and unfortunately they did not accept the "entertainment voucher". Funny how western holidays suddenly become public holidays when it suits... nevertheless, a fun few hours in the refreshing cold. Unfortunately, the cashiers inside were closed and as such we could not do some additional activities. Some tips: try and use a voucher to lower your expenses, take cash inside (no cards) to pay for a hot chocolate or additional activities, ask to remove the logo when buying a picture.all in all: nice for a yearly morning out
lovely and adventures. nice activity every one mst do.Take a super pass for 200 aed per person.they provide good quality warmers and shoes gloves and socks.every thing is ok

A good Facebook update. The fact that you're skiing in Dubai is most of the fun. We used an entertainer voucher which gave us 1 entry for free. It takes 3 min to go up in the chair-lift(!) and about 30 sec to get down. It's good fun for two hours, after go and have some hot chocolate somewhere. The slopes are very easy for intermediate/experienced skiers. It's a good place for a fun check-in with pic on FB.Do bring gloves and a hat, it's -4C inside! If you didnt think of bringing these to Dubai then there's a few shops next to the entrance where you can buy these.

They need to allow public on the learner slopes.. If you can't ski you can't use this facility. There is no small slope to "warm up" or test your youngsters skills. They are for lessons only. We were told it would be 4 lessons until our kids were allowed on the slopes. Thankfully we found a ski patrol leader who saw sense and allowed us 20mins on the learner slope to check our kids skills. One of our kids was good enough, one wasn't. The youngest one swapped her ski pass for a snow park pass. Again, this was only possible due to the ski patrol guy. The main ticket booth would never have allowed it.If we hadn't found this guy, we would have been very disappointed as our kids were really looking forward to skiing. Black run skiers will be disappointed, but seriously this is in Dubai! A great day out for average skiers.

Take the Ski Lift Ride. Be awed by the sheer craziness and opulence the UAE does everything. Be prepared to freeze your ears off though. Gets quite busy but it's worth going to the chair lift ride around the park.

Good for First timers. Skii Dubai is very attractive and appealing for Firt timers in Snow Parks. Since we had already been to 2 Snow theme parks in India at Bangalore and Hyderabad we did not get the WOWWW experience. Learning Skii experience is unique in itself as that is not offered at other places, but you need to pay extra for the same. Overall it is place to have fun with Family. Please carry your own Gloves and Snow cap else you will have to pay for the same.
Amazing!. Skiing in the desert? Yup! This was a fun two-hours with decent snow and skiing. The luge ride was also fun. Bring gloves and a hat to save money.

Excellent. Ski Dubai is in Mall of Emirates. Metro is the best way to go there. Ticket was about AED200 per person which covers snow park and Big snow park also. Amazing Thrilling ride from top to bottom.

Good for those who enjoy the cold. You have to appreciate that in a hot country like Dubai they have been able to construct such a huge building housing a snow park, its just amazing. There are a number of rides available inside, the snow park itself is not so huge. You have to pay separately if you want to ski down the slope. Make sure you take gloves with you as they are not provided.
Superb. Great set up. Excellent for beginners and intermediate skiers to practice their skills. This was my 2nd time to visit Ski Dubai.

good skiing in the desert. I enjoyed skiing here, The operation is very efficient. The cost is very reasonable. I paid $53 for the 2 hour pass. You get a jacket, pants, socks, skiis, boots and poles. You have to bring your own hat and gloves. I really didn't need a hat. The equipment is decent. You put the ski card in a pocket on your left sleeve. When you get to a gate just press your sleeve on the post and the gate will open. The card also works on the lockers.They have one quad chair. You can ski to the left or the right of the chair. The one side is a little steeper but both sides could be skied by an intermediate level skier. The snow was good with no ice, There were no lift lines when I was there (Friday at 10 AM). It took a few runs to get use to the equipment. I could get on the lift, ski and return to the lift in 5 minutes. My skiing improved but I got bored after awhile but now I can say "Yes, I skied Dubai." which is why I came here.

Snow in the Desert. A must experience on my list. After taking the recommended ski or snow board lessons, you can enjoy different graded ski slopes as if you are in a true alpine region minus the hazards. Complete with chair lifts, toboggan tracks & a snow park for those without the need for the adrenalin rush.

No Substitute For Real Thing. This cannot even come close to the real thing- no way, no how. It's nice to be able to say "I skied in the desert!" Other than that, it's not worth the money. Gloves are not included in the price, so my hands froze, and the chairlift is mind-numbingly slow. One woman who worked there said it sums up Dubai: Good, but artificial.

Such fun!. A real highlight of our holiday, great fun getting togged-up in the ski outfits, took hat and gloves although not totally necessary for just 2 hours. However, once in the 2 hours feels like half a day. Didn't stop laughing and great skiing experience!

Skiing on a desert. This guys from emirates knows what to do to amazed us. A ski track, with lift, and all the other things you can imagine - in the middle of the desert (summer hits 50°C / 130°F) and you with lot of clothes inside a mall ... skiing. Just be sure to get your gloves - they don´t provide as they do with ski, poles, clothes and ... helmets (???)
phenomenal. finest ice rig in the world. massive scale construction! one hell of a place to spend the day! worth !!

Skiing in a mall. Totally bazaar ski in a mall heat outside and then go go into an icy wonderland we booked on online but you can easily book in ski centre a bit manic until you get your suit and boots they do not supply hat and gloves bring with you or you can buy in the ski shop next door you need to have skied before you get 2 hours which is enough well organised there are lockers for clothes toilets all you need a definite must do

Learn how to.... Don't go here if you're trying to substitute a ski/snowboarding holiday. Go here if you fancy a different afternoon or if you're learning to Ski/Snowboard before an planned holiday to the Swiss Alps!
Must see (and maybe try). Unique place and must see, when in Dubai. If You do not have big expectations of going crazy, it's still worth giving it a try.
disappointing.... Perhaps my expectations were too high. A lot of trouble renting clothing and boots for not so much to see or do.

A must. Theres no other place on earth like Ski Dubai, real snow in the desert. you can sit in starbucks/coasta & watch people sking, you can also go zorbing if thats your thing. Also go and see the Penguins

good experience. my family did this one afternoon. on power passes, my husband and daughter's included the discovery ski lesson while my son (who has skied before) included a 2 hour ski. we took hat and golves, but they were given gloves and socks. enjoyed by all.

Ski Dubai. IT was. Little Disappointing to us, the ski slopes were very icy!! We haven't skied in 20 yrs, but thought we wouldn't have to much trouble, wrong!!!!! Had to ski plow most of the way down, fell half way down the hill due to it was so icy,my husband had same problem, maybe if we went early in the morning, instead of late afternoon, maybe more snow? Very crowed, but we could say we Skied Dubai:) it was very pretty inside, but I think I'll try the real thing and see if I can still ski on a Mountain!!LOL...

Kids loved it. My kids had never seen snow and this was the perfect 3 hour introduction that we needed. We had a pass that let us do everything except skiing. We went early (10am) and were done by 1pm when the crowds showed up.

A rare technological ingenuity. To keep the snow so fresh and lively like a european winter is a feat of technology. The slides and cable car were so interesting and really worth the prices. Ensure that you have your camera cos you will make photos to cherish for eternity.
Something for everyone. We are not skiers, but the highlight for my wife was the opportunity to meet and touch the penguins.Where else in the world can you do this

Good for kids. This is a fun afternoon for the kids. It isn't the ski slopes in Switzerland!!Yet again while visiting Dubai it is one of those must dos just for the experience.There are quite a few little "hidden" extras which can add up quite dramatically.I got the basic ski park tickets for my kids. My friends lent us the ski gloves which you otherwise have to purchase there.As with most things in Dubai it is cheaper if you book online, however i had a fairly loose schedule so didn't book us in as i didn't want pressure to be at certain places.It wasn't that busy when we went so getting in was quick.So the kids went in and then I ordered a nice coffee at the cafe next door and watched them through the windows.They had fun throwing snowballs at each other and playing in the park.You can do a skiing lesson then go down the slope. I can't comment on what the ski field is like.You can buy hot choclate inside the park. A photographer roams around the area and of course for an extra fee you can buy your picture.We didn't do the penguin experience.The kids came out feeling very cold so they joined me in the cafe and had hot chocolate.

Extremely fun and refreshing. Very refreshing after a day in the heat. Price is quite affordable since everything is included (equipment, lift). Bring a pulll over and scarf since you can get cold easily.A must do experience!

Skiing and Penguins. It's a little bit ironic that as a Canadian in my 30s, I only skied for my first time in the middle of the desert. But I had a great time! I stuck to the bunny hill and had no complaints whatsoever. My husband did the bigger hills and enjoyed himself as well. One tip would be to bring your own mittens/hat if you have them, so you don't have to buy them. I would give the skiing portion 5 stars.We also did the penguin encounter, which I would give 3 stars. We were fortunate to have a small group of only 4 of us (I think most groups are closer to a dozen) but I still felt like they were rushing us through their usual routine. It was still very neat to be able to pet the penguins and have our pictures taken with them (like Dolphin Bay at Atlantis though, for a hefty price), but I felt a little like I was annoying the penguin trainers with my couple of questions, and that they just wanted to get us out of there. I probably wouldn't recommend the penguin encounter to others.
Awsome. well this was just awsome. one of the most amaizing things to do in Dubai. i had fun here. great place to come over with friends or loved ones.
fascinating. To build such a place in a desert is amazing. Temperature maintained at -3 degrees centigrade, in a desert is a formidable task .

What a load of fun. We stopped by to have a look, then last miute decided to go in and experience Winter in the Heat! It was a GREAT experience. The facility is well organized and offers a good selection of activities. We had a blast. We spent a coupe of hours in the area and it was well worth the money.
Ski Dubai. Our children enjoyed this tremendously. Don't miss this when in Dubai. Youngsters would probably want to make multiple visits. Booking online works well.
a must go with kids. it was the best part of Dubai. Its in Emirates mall. The park is fully covered with snow and has a lot of snow rides and penguin show.

Family fun!. This is such a great place for the family....especially in the months when you want to escape the hot Dubai heat!! My kids (8 and 6) absolutely love going here. The staff are always very friendly and helpful and the whole experience is enjoyable. Highly recommended!

New and Improved !!. Have been there 3 times before over the past 7 years and was pleasantly surprised with on my recent trip with my 9 year old son and 13 yr old nieces since there was lots new on offer. Highly recommend the SuperPass for 200 Dhs !! The new Mountain Thriller is a great ride which involves going halfway up to the top via chairlift and then sliding down in a twin tube ! Also they have the jumbo sized bubble slide down the ski slope and the Penguin shows are very enjoyable.Its always surreal going to a snow park in the desert. Highly recommended

Penguin Encounters. Penguin encounters is part of the Ski Dubai attraction. For about 60 USD (basic package) you get to spend 35-40 min with the penguins in a group of 12 people. The price also includes a pair of "Ski Dubai" gloves, they give you a voucher and you pick them up at a ski store next door. First you get to meet two Gentoo penguins, whom you are not allowed to touch but can get pictures taken, then the two King penguins that you can touch or even kiss. Each person gets about 1 minute with a penguin and the guides don't like when you try to touch another penguin outside of your time.You are not allowed to bring your camera or cell phone inside "for safety of the birds". You can put them in a locker for a fee. The introductory video they show before going in explains how to behave with the penguins and among other things tells you that "you don't even have to bring a camera, our photographers will take plenty of pictures for you!". This is very thoughtful of them, of course, but the video forgets to tell you that they'll charge about 35 USD per printed picture (!) or about 120 USD for a CD with all the pictures, which is pretty outrageous. You get to review the pictures and pick the ones you want before you buy and all the pictures of me were pretty bad and out of focus.Not recommended

Should have more rides like mountain thriller. Ski Dubai is two different worlds within itself. 1. The snowpark which is very tiny with lots of kids stuff and cheap tickets so you will find a lot of kids running around.2. The ski slopes which are huge for an indoor facility but open only to those who already know how to ski/snowboard.The basic ticket only allows you to access snowpark which is not useful at all if you dont have kids.Then there is PowerPass which includes a 1 hr ski lesson and unlimited chairlift rides which you can use to go to the top (for accessing mountain thriller) and ride down (if you don't know how to ski)We had fun with mountain thriller but that was that... there was no further use for the "unlimited park access".The ski school here is very professional and the instructors very helpful to all levels.We found the equipment rental area very chaotic and understaffed. There were long lines and quite a lot of commotion. If you've registered for a ski class, then make sure you start getting all your clothing plus equipment atleast 30 minutes before the class starts. Our class was scheduled to start at 3 PM and we started collecting equipment at 2.30 but due to long lines and couple of shoe size changes (very common for new skiiers) we could get ready only by 3.20PM ... the instructor was kind enough to assign us to the 3.30PM class.Also the staff was very helpful when my wife forgot our camera in her jacket and left it in a bin. We got the camera back very quickly as everyone in the clothing area started to search for it in all the collected jackets. Overall it would have been much more worth the money if they had a beginners slope where you could go after a class to practice.
A quick skiing fix!. We went for the 2 hour pass - about £30 for pass, skis, boots, clothing etc. The lifts are painfully slow (and break down), but it made for a break from the sun and shopping.
Fun fun fun. Really good but not enough snow to make snowballs or snow men. Gets really busy with school trips, get there early!
Ski Dubai is just amaziang. I can tell you its worth a visit to Ski Dubai. A lot of fun. Its very unique to find such a man made structure and worth going...

Fun morning. OK so it isn't like the real experience in the mountains (there is a distinct lack of mulled wine and odd bumps)... That said, it is loads of fun for a morning and considering where we are it is totally awesome. I'm defo going again before I leave.

a must. Ok, I'm Swiss. I've snow at home every winter, but Ski Dubai was still a great experience. Was really funny. Just go inside and get all the gear you need. The only negative point, if you are a "normal skier" (by central european level) you'll get bored after a few rides.

Great place but horrible staff. That was the 3rd time we were going to ski Dubai.We purchased a two-hours slope pass and we had a voucher for 2 extras hours for free.For some reasons, less than two hours could be used . When asked what the reason was , we were replied that " too bad , there is no way we can help you ". They gave us very strange explanations which made no sense . A few staff at the selling counters were so rude and blaming us for misusing the passes. It was unbeliveable to be scolded by staff when we were customers and only enquiring for answers. As I asked to speak to the manager, we were giving a 2 hours pass to use at 9pm !!Its a real shame that the staff at the tickets counters are so rude, unhelpful and who could careless about their customers, when the place itself is really good . Hopefully the management will do something about it
Weird. Queues Queues QueuesSkiing is good, the rest "so so"Great for younger childrenQueues though and pushing in.....Perhaps it's a cultural thing

Unique winter experience in the middle of the desert!. We had a great time with our 5- and 8-year olds. The kids started with some lessons. And as we were all beginners, the slopes took a couple of runs to get used to. Otherwise it suited well to our minimum skill level. You should budget 30-60mins to gather and put on all of your gears (shoes, clothing, skis). The buy one get one free deal from the coupon books made this a great value!

snow in Dubai - you must be crazy !. Dubai has everything you could possibly want - including snow skiing and a snow park. It is quite expensive but what a novelty ! You will get bored pretty quickly if you are a really good skier but for novice's, children and beginners it is great fun. Try to go early morning or on a week day if you can as the weekends ( Fridays and Saturdays are hectic ! )

JUST LIKE THE REAL SLOPES EVEN BETTER. Ski dubai has 3 main slopes. beginner where they give you lessons . Then there is intermediate and then the black diamond expert slope. although im not a regular skiier but i felt the experience to be just like the outdoors. The layout of the area, chair lifts, slopes all provide for a very fun filled experience. The equipment is well maintained the staff is super trained they help you if your a newbie right from putting on your gear to shoes to skis. If you are a beginner the highly trained instructors are very helpfull and provide for an amazing learning experience. The slopes are well monitored and maintained with dozens of instructors at your disposal. If you are not there for skiing or snowboarding then there is tubing as well as zorbing. Apart from the activities ther is a penguin show and you can just enjoy the snowy experience. I would recommend ski dubai to everyone to all the tourists who are visiting dubai for recreation

Great place to visit. One of the best attractions in Dubai. Snow in the desert. A wonderfully made place near Mall of Emirates and a must visit attraction. With lot of attractions like the giant ball and numerous slides and a charlift to the top of the huge snowscape. A good place for entertainmemt for both adults and kids. The penguin show was an added attraction which came at the end of our visit there. It was really wonderful.

Cool Experience. Anything goes in Dubai, an this is certainly something on needs to see. It is in the middle of the mall and certainly something fun to do especially if you travel with children and they get tired of shopping.
Great indoor ski. Great place to spent time with your family ..... Do try out all the rides!! However be prepared it is cold. Entrance fee inclusive of jjackets & boots but bring yr own socks.
Penguins!. Went to Ski Dubai to see penguins, and it was worth it. I could touch and hug these cute little creatures. Their colors are amazing!

Skiing in Duabi. You can see friends and family ski while you eat at any of the many surrounding restaurants in the mall, you can watch from the curve glass windows. It is like watching a snow scene in a snow globe! Very nice!

Fantastic way to have a White Christmas Day. After traveling to Dubai for the festive season, this was a fantastic way to have a White Christmas Day.
Super Pass is affordable and includes clothing, boots, gloves and locker hire.
Lots if fun to ride the toboggan, giant ball, chairlift, and of course the snow
experience.
Recommend this for people who have never experienced snow before.

Try to find Snow in the middle of Desert? its possible in Dubai. Ski Dubai is amazing place and which will make you say "Waoooo"
Nobody will believe can ski in middle east .
But smile and say Yes I Can

amazing place must visit. amazingly build in the middle of desert which u can find Snow and u can ski. What a amazing place i been visit.
you name it Dubai Have all of it.
Ski
Water Park
world safest Metro
convenient road and transport

Amazing venue especially with kids. We go to ski Dubai on a regular basis as it is a good warm up to the skiing we do in Europe. The venue runs some excellent camps for the kids and my son is a regular. The instructors are excellent and lessonsare conducted in a safe environment. The slopes are never too busy so it feels safe to learn skiing or enjoy yourself on the slopes.Highly recommended.
ski dubai is amazing. great Mall for shopping. need plenty time to look around. Can watch Skiers from within Mall. Nice eating areas

So Good we are going again next week!. We arrived at 7pm for an 8pm 1st snow board lesson as that was the time we were told to book in. Staff at the checkin were very helpful as I didnt take the voucher I should have printed online (thought my email confirmation would be good enough). We were then sent through to get our Boots and Snow suite. We donned our clothing and now it was 7.20pm. We walked toward the entrance and were advised that we had to meet at the meeting point for our 8pm lesson and to come back in 40 minutes... Off we went for some food in the attached restaurant - we only had a chicken burger. It arrived in good time and the staff were very friendly and courteous.Once at the metting point at 8pm we were taken through into the snow.A few minutes was spent showing us how to stand and which was the best way to stand on the board dependant on if you are right or left footed.We were then taken straight up on the conveyor to the top of the nursery slope.There were around 20 people in our group and there were 3 instructors all of whom were very freindly and funny. They made everyone feel at ease.The lesson went pretty well, and after the first few assisted tries they will let you go down the makey learny slope on your own.Much harder than skiing :-(We had the one hour lesson which is mandatory before you can go on the main slopes.It was a great laugh and everyone seemed to have a good time. Well worth a visit, our tickets for the lesson and all the equipment came to £54 for 2 people including all equipment with the exception of gloves and hat. You should purchase golves before you go in although you can buy them in the Ski shop for 20 Dhs (just over £3)If you are like me you will spend lots of time on your hands so they are a must.Great atmosphere, great instructors and cant wait to go back next week.

Don't miss Ski Dubai. The first ski slope in the desert. Another first for Dubai.A great time will be had by anyone visiting Dubai looking for some cool fun.If you are an experienced skier then you might not be challenged as it is hardly Whistler.But for the occasional skier this is a fun place to be to escape the hot desert sun.When I was there it was full of children having a whale of a time.Dubai Mall has the Aquarium and Mall of the Emirates has Ski Dubai.
A must visit!. I was fascinated with the site considering that Dubai is a desert City. Although only few people were around

Another Dubai "must see". What is there to dislike about the opportunity to experience an indoor ski-hill in Dubai? It is a too much fun to walk-in to Ski Dubai wearing shorts, get dressed in the rented ski-clothing and enter the winter wonderland they have built into the mall.

Fun but get boring after a while. The concept is pretty cool, you get to experience freezing weather and ski in hot Dubai. However since this is in a closed space, a mall, the space and activities are very restricted and if you are used to skiing in natural conditions this will get you bored after maximum an hour time.

Not a bad place foe 2 hrs. I like skiing and thought during a work trip a few of us would head over and see if Ski Dubai was any good. I was pleasantly surprised. Its well organised, the smart card technology works well (and shows you remaining time left as you swipe thru a gate) and it was actually a lot of fun - sort of ended up being "speed skiing". Would definitely recommend for a family or a group of friends.
great fun. First time to ski indoors - what a trip. I little cumbersome getting equipment that fit properly, but they kept at it until it was right.
