fun in the sky. It was a great experience, a lot of fun. If u r adrenaline rush person u definitely have to try it. I highly recommend getting this view of Dubai.

Snow in the desert. Great fun for the kids and adults alike. A bit pricy but use the entertainer vouchers to save some money on entry fee and slope pass. Can't believe it drops below zero while it's 30 degrees outside

Snow in desert. Excellent experience , must do, we had a blast. Thoroughly enjoyable, don't miss it. The snow is as good as real, pretty freezing, well planned. Inside a mall . Wow wow, we went in the morning and were we right in doing so, as it gets pretty crowded from noon. We upgraded our selves to the super pass which was a good deal as we wanted to do all the activities, for those who wish to do selected activities can take a regular pass and upgrade with whichever activity you want to do on spot. Clothes, socks and boots are provided in the regular pass, you need to rent the lockers separately. Do take hand gloves ur self or you can purchase it over there in the adjacent shop as your hands will really get numb, there are coffee shops inside, the rides are excellent. And the staff is very helpful, you will at least need about 1- 2 hours in ski dubai minimum. Loved it, great place to be for family, friends, loved ones. I definitely recommend it. One can take the metro to ski dubai as metro station goes right in mall of emirates where ski dubai is located on the ground floor.
Nice change of activity. Excellent place if you are a novice or intermediate. Best place to learn snow boarding if you already know how to ski

Doesn't look fun until you go and have fun!. We were hesitant at first if we should go or not. When you look at the place through the glass, it looks like fun but not really worth it. But once we entered it was amazing and we had a great time. The lines were really long but that's what we get for going during the new years weekend. I would recommend that you would go with a lot of friends, we couldn't stop with the snowball fights! Be careful when you exit the place, the change in the temperature got me really sick (but it was worth it).

Snowboarding in the desert!. We had so much fun! It is definitely worth a visit if only for a couple of hours. I thought the price was reasonable as it included all the hire. There are plenty of staff around so I always felt safe and they helped the less experienced on and off the ski lifts. There are also good facilities such as the cafe half way up the slope and the hot chocolate vendor at the bottom of the slope. A lot of fun to be had - we had a great experience and would definitely go back!

Just Like Real Snow?!. Adventure for the whole family, at a reasonable price and you dont have to be a pro! Theres lessons and different rides and slides fpr different age groups. After that, gloves off and you can shop!
Great but pricey. My little one had an absolute blast! Bit pricey though as you pay for entry and then to use stuff inside as well... but no complaints, all in all, loads of fun for young and old...

Defnitely on the list of Must Do's. For a skeir i guess it wouldn't be much of an experience however for any other tourist visiting I will say you must epxerience Ski Dubai atleast once. There is nothing extravagant about the place but it is one of those visits that you just must do in Dubai. For kids it will be great fun for sure. I visited Ski Dubai in 2008 and then again this December. I must say nothing had changed though. My favourite part of visiting this place is just to go to the restaurant at the top and enjoy a nice cup of hot chocolate.. Watch out when and if you are going to get the pictures. DO BARGAIN on the price cos they DO bring it down drastically. They had taken some really good pictures this time when I visited with my finance and there were about 7 great picutres but i cant remember the exact package they offered me but they wanted 600 AED and that was not even printing all pictures. But after refusing to buy at that price the privce began to drop to 500, 400, 350, 300, 250 an finally we got to pick out the 10 pictures on a cd for 100 AED which i thought was quite ok.

SNow in the Desert.... in a shopping center. I cant say enough... becuse i did not sky.I never ski in my life... so i arrived there 3:00 pm...and i had to wait until 6:30 pm for the Lesson...7:30 pm i had a booking for the Burj al Arab so i did not ski :(But the Ski duba is really cool... at the entrance for 20 dirham you can get a locker.. and then the clothes and sky are included in the price.Ther is also a iced area really nice for taking picture.... and a small area in the ice if you have child...NExt time i come back to Dubai i want to do this experience...
Fun. Ridiculous to have a snow dome in dubai bit its done well.Bring your own gloves and hat.Skis ok.Chair lift is slow by alps standards but better

Amazing! Must see. Who would have thought that somewhere so hot could provide something sooooo cold! The runs were long enough for a few turns but the chairlift was a bit slow. Definitely worth a visit!

Great fun but go prepared.. We are keen skiers and had planned to visit Ski Dubai on a recent holiday. When it rained what better way to spend a morning, ski-ing in the desert! We had taken ski gloves, thermal underwear, roll neck tops and fleeces, but hadn't got hats. Trousers, jackets, skis and boots are included in the hire price but only children are given helmets. As such we did find we got cold quickly. If you don't take any kit it can get very expensive buying it all there. The slopes were well groomed and it was great having a choice of slopes. We go fairly regularly to Snowzone, at Milton Keynes, in the UK, so were very impressed to find a chairlift on an indoor slope! There is even a mountain cafe with balcony and patio heaters so you can have a hot chocolate whilst on the slopes. We felt it was a similar price to the UK although you have to book a minimum of 2hrs, rather than one.
Must be a real attraction for someone not familiar with snow and ice. For all others, a strange, energy-hungry miniature alpine slope with all the downhill thrills you may know from the real world.

OK For A Visit But Quite Disappointing. Nothing to get excited about if you are a skier. For local non skiers could be exciting but kind of a disappointment for avid skiers. Don't waste your time to visit if you love skiing. Short run but what can you expect in the middle of a hot city.

Snow in Dubai?. A great experience for visitors and residents alike. Even eating at one of the Mall of the Emirates shopping mall's outlets overlooking the ski slope makes you feel cool in the heat of summer.

Interesting.... Was fun to look at from the Apres Restaurant. It is obviously an interesting project located inside a mall and therefore it isnt very big, but the idea of Ski Dubai and the people made it fun.

Nickel and dime you all the way. Way to overpriced for what you get. They charge the same price as a regular ski resort and have just a few slopes and unless you pay for the super pass, you get charged extra for all the snow games and the lift. They also have an overpriced penguins visit which would have been awesome but they don't allow you to take photos. They do have their own photographer, but again you have to pay additional for their photo.

Apre Ski Bar - Mall of Emirates. This is about the only eatery in the Mall that serves alcohol. Prices are at a premium though (a round of drinks for 8 adults (beers and wine) was well over R1000 !!! They have a very reasonable pizza and wine special (AED199) for a pizza and a bottle of wine which is way worth it considering the cost of the food and beers on the menu (the average cost of a bottle of wine in Dubai is AED200) . The Pizza's were tasty. The venue is also extremely smokey and stuffy but you get a great view of the indoor ski slope and have a good laugh at the beginners learning to ski.

Opposite attraction. Went here on November 2012 by myself. A bit rusty so was not so comfortable at first. The staff was really friendly and one of the safety supervisor was kind enough to let me warm up on the ski school slopes and provides some tips.There main run is divided to two type, black and blue (by Dubai Standard). There are ski chair lift as well as a pulley things to get you up to the top of the slope. The slope it self is covered by snow and in good condition.There is a cafe in the between of the top slope and the bottom slope where you can warm up and enjoy a cup of hot chocolate or sandwich when you need them.Rental equipment are ok, not great but usable. You get everything from locker jacket, pants, poles and ski. The only thing you need is glove or you can buy mitten from nearby store. Damage is 220 dirhams (20 for locker), and if you do anything above 3 hours, I suggest you get the all day package for 100 dirhams moreLots of kids are skiing here in the weekend so it's quite busy and dangerous if you don't get out of the way fast enough as the local kids are doing stunts on the slope and going really fast. Didn't try the park and the penguin attraction so can't comment much on it.One of the best indoor experience I've ever been too, and if you like skiing or just looking to stretch your muscle, you should give it a try.
Fun; but expensive. We got the snow pass, which is 200 AED (£40) and includes everything except actually skiing. It was good fun, but we were done after 40 minutes so not great value for money.
Beautiful & Cold. I like it, I feel its real & i enjoy every moment their. also the hut cafe in the middle of Chairlifts way to the top of ice mountain.

Is this a joke?. This is such a microcosim of DUbai, trying to be everything its NOT. They really know how to WASTE money, whether its making snow stay in 40degree heat, or watering grass so it grows ontop of a beautiful desert. This ski hill is way over priced and not worth ANY time unless you under 7 years old. The chair lift is BRUTALLY slow and you could literally walk up the hill faster. Its so short and embarassing. If you have never skied before than you might be amused. But if you have ever actually been skiing, dont waste your time at this embarassing attempt at a ski hill. I say stop wasting money and shut this thing down. What a dumb idea.

A FANTASTIC 2 HOURS. It was great skiing in Dubai.We went in the morning and it was very quiet therefore we got plenty of runs in.2 hours is plenty as you ski down very quickly and spend most time in the four man chair, and believe it or not we were shivering with cold by the end of our session.All the staff were very friendly and helpful.As we were finishing,it was starting to get busier.We were relieved to get back out into some warmth.
Very Nice place. It is very nice place, you don't imagine that you are in hot place like UAE, and also you can't imagine that this iced city is inside a mall.It is big surprise for me when I see it

Fairly large and well organized. Great concept for a really hot place like Dubai. Wish the signs to the various rides were clearer as you do tend to go around in circles trying to locate the starting points for some rides.Wish they also had some smaller slopes for someone who wants to just try skiing or snowboarding for a lark.

Great for kids. Not for experienced skiers. We went at 8pm, on a 2hr ski pass, (180AED) it was not busy and everything from paying to getting your gear was very quick and easy. If I had kids who'd never skied before I'd definately go and book a lesson for them.

Snow in the desert. I flight over 19 hrs just to go there and do it! It is not a ski resort or a great freefall but i would give everything just to have that in my country. The slopes are a little steep for a new snowboarder but instructors are nice and friendly and you will have lots of fun!

Amazing!!!. It was great fun and had many things to do. Although there was only one chairlift there were a few runs, a super fun sled ride, a nice restaurant and fun activities to do aside. They provided a snow jacket and pants (one piece if I remember correctly) a snowboard or skis, boots and a helmet. If i remember correctly they do provide socks and gloves as well but i think it would be best to bring your own. There is a store to buy clothes as well as souvenirs (shirts or clothes that say Ski Dubai) the snow clothes are very expensive but the souvenirs I think are worth it. Overall it was a great experience and if you are Dubai it a must do!!!

Tried to go, disappointed in access late at night.. Family of 5 tried to go at 11pm, they close at midnight.I realize this sounds stupid, but the mall is PACKED at 11pm, including families with young kids.We didn't realize it took a long time to get all the gear and there wasn't a shorter option. Might be nice to offer a ten minute or a stay-in-your-street-clothes-until you are so cold you have to leave option.We looked and it was cool and clever, but then it didn't seem like it was worth the $500 it would cost us to go inside so we skipped it partially on cost, partially on closing time of one hour after we arrived.
amazing experience. absolutely briilant hugest enclosed snow town I have seen, and its very well organised............the kids will have a blast

What fun, but remember to dress warm - surprisingly hard. When it's about a million degrees outside and you're scurrying from air conditioned oasis to air conditioned oasis, it is surprisingly hard to remember to dress warm when you're on your way to the ski slope. It shouldn't be, but it is. So bring a jacket, bring your gloves if you have any, or even just pop on a second t-shirt. Ski Dubai is not the most awesome ski location you'll ever encounter, but it's the only one surrounded by million degree heat, and it's a great novelty activity to do while in Dubai.

Good fun!. Nice experience and of course its crazy to be all toasty warm out in the Dubai heat and then to be freezing in the snow. If you are going bring layers of clothes as it gets cold out on the slope. I had to go and have a hot chocolate in the safe on the slope to warm up half way through my 2 hour session!
Great place to play in snow. We visited the snow park only and the kids enjoyed the rides as also the penguins show. The staff were very helpful.

Skiing fun in the desert.. I visited Skii Dubai out of curiosity when we visited the Mall. We decided to take the 2hrs lesson and enjoyed it so much that we decided that the day pass was well worth it! I'd recommend it to anyone! If you can, take your own gloves as the ones in the gift shop are ridiculously expensive. The rest of the equipment is included in the fees you pay.

Terrific Fun and Introduction to All Things Snow Related. Always wanted to try skiing so this was a great introduction to it. Just rocked up to the place and got a Power Pass which included an hour's discovery lesson, gear, socks, gloves, hot chocolate, locker and all the rides all day. There is a small pocket on the arm of the jacket to keep your entry card which makes it convenient. The lesson was great, class was small and instructor was attentive. We were even allowed to bring our cameras in and the instructor took videos and pictures when we were able to ski down the slope ourselves. We were able to get quite a few runs down the slope and were confident by the time the hour was up. After the lesson, you go change into rubber boots and do all the other fun things like Zorbing, bob sledding, tubing etc. They are only short runs but still fun and a safe introduction if you have never tried it before. There is also a Penguin show to watch. If you have friends or partners waiting for you, they can go up to the Costa cafe in the mall and watch you from there while having a coffee.I only spent a couple of hours in there as I simply wanted to give it a try. The Power Pass was excellent value as it allowed me to try everything and had I wanted to spend all day in there it would have been an even better deal. I even got a free hot drink after all that. And it's nice that I get to keep my Ski Dubai gloves as a souvenir. What a great way to try so many snow related things in such a short amount of time and for a reasonable fee. If I lived here I would go back again and again until I could master the highest slope!

Chilled Place. i been there On Eid time, its very busy you have to wait for about an half to one hour in queue to be on rid, you will get the warm clothes to enter the permissive which included in ticket and its not costly. i haven't got time to go for the ski course but its really worthy if you ho for that one hour course of you have time.if you are in Dubai visit Ski its a different experiences

Unbelievable. Outside the mall 40 °C, inside the mall 20 °C, in Ski Dubai 0 °C.You are provided with appropriate clothes, even if you buy only walking ticket.You can buy three different tickets, walking ticket (you cannot use any equipment inside), ski ticket (you can use only the chairlift and the ski-area), super pass (except skiing, you can do whatever you want - chairlift, bob, other funny games).Worth visiting!! :)

COLd. We where looking forward to go to Ski Dubai, until I realize that it is very cold , it should be disclose in the their website about bringing pants and a long sleeve t-shirt, as visitors we where dress for the heat of Dubai, so for me it was not a good expirience, but my husband had fun.
Snow Skiing in the desert!. This is well worth a visit, and you can hire all that you need to ski. A really good indoor ski slope that all the family enjoyed.

My first SNOW encounter. I feels like a small kid seeing real snow/ice :-)I join the 1 hour lesson, I really enjoy it , but 1 hour really is not enough , by the time the lesson finish , I just dont want to go out hahaha , luckily my pass allows me to ride the skiride upside the 'cafe' , it s indeed a memorable 'ski' experience
nice experience. really good experience to ski in a place where it never gets under 30°C :-)the slope is nice to do, the only issue is that the ski lifts go very slow, so you really get very cold.

Only if you have to. For an indoor ski experience if you've never been before I guess its ok - of course if you're more used to the mountains and the real stuff its a poor substitute. Sking is very limited, lifts slow and the queues to get equipment (basic) and onto the lifts are horrendous - perhaps a better experience if you avoid the weekends

Totally worth it. Took a day trip to Dubai for a few beers but thought we would pack an activity for the day. Having not skied before I was a little nervous but soon got the hang of it and now thanks to Ski Dubai absolutely love skiiing!! The place is huge to say the least, in the price you get all the gear you need, One word of advice, buy the gloves for an extra couple of pounds, its freezing in there! They literally have penguins in the place! Can't wait for another visit.
Woow. I don't imagine, when I see the Ski Dubai, That I will find ice in this hot weather, really it is nice, took you to different world

Fun experience. Even though it is a complete nonsense in terms of environmental impact, it is fun to ski by -3°C while it is 40°C outside. The size of the complex is pretty impressive, they provide a good equipment. 2 hours is more than enough as the slope is still pretty small, but again, we are talking indoor skiing.

Excellent value, good run for blue level skiers. Two hour slope access includes chair lift, winter wear, boots, skis, poles and socks (no hats or gloves though), so bring your own if your head and hands get cold easily. I went for two hours skiing and it's fine.The snow condition are very good for indoor ski slopes. Blue level skiers can easily kill two hours here or brush up their skills between seasons. It's the perfect place to cool down in Dubai. The snow park right beside the ski slopes look fun with long slides and pegguin encounters.

Skiing in the desert!!!. The queues to get a ski pass can be sometimes infuriating with all the other wannabe skiers but grit your teeth and stay. You need to be of a certain standard to enter the slopes.Next step is picking up your gear, boots and skis or snowboard, did I mention this is all included in your 2 hrs slope pass,It takes about 6 minutes for a round trip on the slopes. Weekends tend to be very busy but if that's the only time you can go make sure your there at opening time.Ski Dxb offers lessons to at a small fee to.The snow park is fun for the little ones, there are doughnut rides and plenty of snow for a snow fight. If you want to go the extra mile there are 12 king penguins that reside there that for a dent in your wallet you can interact with them.Worst thing about ski Dxb though is there website!

Good with a group of friends/family. OK so after a few trips to Dubai, we finally gave in and went to Ski Dubai. The preparation to get your skis, get boots, get clothes, get them all fitted is a little chaotic. We were there when it was quite quiet and it was just a ramble of people, boots, clothing, however everyone seemed to know what they were doing. I did find that most people were more than content with doing the non-skiing activities which made more room on the slopes for everyone else. The size of the place really is quite astounding. The chairlift was amazing but those used to ‘normal’ chairlifts will find this one remarkably slow. We decided to move to the drag lift which was a bit tricky to work and in some areas, you had to actually turn corners whilst on the lift and manoeuvre yourself around! There was a bit of a slow down and jerk in some places which really caught some people off guard and consequently threw them off!For an intermediate skier, you run can last for a good 45 seconds. Go with a group of friends or family because it is a lot of fun!

Good Place For The Family. Ski Dubai is wonderful place to visit with your family. It has fun activity for every members of the family irrespective of their age. Be sure to go with you own camera because those taken by the staff there are quite expensive. The Bubble and the sliding bucket were very popular with my children. The Ramp is also good activity for the whole family not for the faint hearted though. Adults should be sure bring along a head warmer if you plan to stay more two hours because it can be quite cold.Generally,Ski Dubai is a wonderful place for good family outing.

Very Good!. Very spacious, and good value for money. They have chair lifts as opposed to drag lifts which is great!I visited there during Ramadan and pretty much had the place for myself! They had a special offer on which made it even cheaper for me. Make sure you get your gloves as they don't hire them.
Amazing Experience. Who could have imagined to be skiing in a mall on a hot day indoors? It felt like skiing in Switzerland. It was even snowing. Remember to grab a hot chocolate at the end!

Great experience, excellent value. This was a really great way of spending an afternoon in Dubai and for once, something that wasn't overpriced and over-rated.All very efficient, the kit itself is a bit old, you need to make sure you have warm underclothes on if you're going to spend any period of time on the slopes as the coat and ski trousers they provide are not very warm. Also, there's no gloves provided (which is contrary to their website), though ski socks were.The 400m run was practically empty when we went and plenty steep enough to do some proper practising.My only complaints were that the lifts were a bit slow and that they didn't provide helmets as standard - there were certainly potential to build up some serious speed from the top of the slope.
Excellent, no value. Ski dubai is a nice place to visit, but if you go there, you are always overpriced. I am glad i did not have to bring my winter gear, because they give the gear to you.

Amazing, especialy the pinguins encounter!. We went there for the Pinguins encounter, which is new and unique in the world! I took the VIP experience, which alows you to spend a good hour with the pinguins, caressing and feeding them. You also have a private tour with all the informations you can imagine about the pinguins. It's very interesting as you're learning a lot about them and you can interact with them.We did it with our 4 and 6 years old daughters and it's been a great moment for all of us. The other great thing with the VIP package is you're alone with the pinguins, have a photograph with you all the time and all the pictures are included in your package (private camera/pictures are not allowed in the pinguins area).About the cold, I was wearing a short and a t-shirt, but they provide warm clothes... the pant is warm, but not the top, so when you're at -3C you might regret not bringing a long sleeve t-shirt or a sweatshirt with you... Concerning the feet, they provide snow shoes and socks, but you will leave the place with your feet wet (take an extra pair of socks for after...). They have lockers to drop your bags,...To book it, you can try the Skidubai website, but the online booking wasn't working yet when I've tried, so I had to call to book it in advance.

Snow skiing in the desert?. Dubai is a pretty crazy place, and if you must get a ski fix while it's boiling hot outside this is the place. All the ski gear is included in the price, except for gloves, they cost extra. The skiing itself was a fun experience, though the run is a little short for a regular skier. You can also have a penguin experience and cuddle their cute penguins
Strange but wonderful. Just fun to say you've ski-ed - in a desert country, in a shopping mall, in a completely man-made environment!

Just didn't get it. Unfortunately we went when it was the Eid holidays and the place was absolutely packed. Started off well...... The staff take one look at you and hand over your correct sized snow outfit and boots along with socks and fleece gloves (I wish I'd packed my thermal vest for the holiday though!). Now I'm sure that if you're a medium skier or you want a lesson then it could maybe be fun but the kiddie slides are far too short and while we were visiting there were almost fights breaking out, queue jumping, idiots trying to get their kids on the snowball ride even though there is a strict height and age policy. I felt sorry for the staff who managed to stay polite throughout!
excellent. fantastic place to visit.excellent friendly staff.must see the penguins and go on a penguin encounter,an experience you will never forget.

Brrr. It's a place you have to see to believe. We don't ski so we just rode the lift chair up & down. There was a variety of coats, gloves, hats that you could get to use during your visit in the cold. Great hot chocolate or coffee when you are done.

Better than Expected. As skiers we wanted to be able to say we had done this but did not expect the length of runs and quality of snow we found. We had a good time skiing and enjoyed watching all the other activities avalable,tubing, penguin encounter.

Snow in the desert!. As experienced skiers/snowboarders we chose to not have a lesson. Getting right to the lift, we managed to get in 13 runs in our 2 hours (12 right to the top and 1 half way). The hill was not crowded at all, especially for mid day during Eid break. The supplied snow pants were warm enough with shorts on, the boots fit well. We had our own layers for the top and brought mittens from Canada! The skis and snowboard could have been waxed to aid in the chair lift exit. My hands were chilly with 2 pairs of thin gloves. 2 hours was just the right amount of time for us here, but going down the hill in the giant ball might have been fun!

Really good fun, great location and good price! For all levels. Ski Dubai really is great fun! We were just starting off and paid for a beginner lesson for 90 minutes just to see how we would get on. (which turned out to be not very well!) The instructor was good fun and we all had a laugh! The slopes were set up for beginners like us but there were also plenty of "experts" flying about as well. The location of Ski Dubai is good coz we done a little bit of shopping in the morning, went skiing and then went for food afterwards as it is all set in the mall.We would totally recommend this to everybody who ski at any levels

Good for a wee change!. for beginners only, far too short for experienced skiiers but lovely escape from the relentless heat outside! Remember to bring gloves and hat with you as they are pricey in the shop outside!

Over crowded and captive penguins!. Sorry, it is nice to see 'snow' in the desert, but it is almost always over crowded and they have captive penguins who are forced to let people touch them all day every day.

Looked good. We never partook but its £30 for 2 hours and was pretty empty (Saturday lunchtime) when we were there so go for it. We didn't plan to do it as we thought it would be expensive and busy. Wrong!

Snowy. Its great for someone not used to snow..however since skiing is limited to those who know how to do it, there isnt much to do other than throw a couple of odd snowballs or fall on your bum. Nonetheless, being in a desert, it is definitely a must see..just to enjoy this man made marvel!

Skiing in Dubai. An Indoor Ski Field at a shopping centre, what more could you ask for! The ski field is maintained at a very cool -3 degrees so make sure you wear the gloves. The runs are for intermediate skiers and there are a couple of learner runs and a kids play area which we didn't go in but looked lots of fun. The chair lift takes you to one of two runs and there are plenty of staff around if you get in trouble. Great for trouble free skiing and to get away from the heat. Cost is quite cheap compared to other ski fields and the experience is quite unique.

Will go again. Ok so its not Val Thorens but lets not get snobby about it. What they have created is amazing and the fact they provide you with everything (including brand new socks and gloves) you can literally walk in, in your summer dress and flip-flops and be kitted out and on the slopes a little while later. However as it is -3 inside I would recommend wearing trousers, taking extra socks and a fleece jumper and hat if you were going to stay inside for a while. We turned up, booked a discovery ski lesson for our 2 boys and the top snow park pass for us too. The boys lesson was very good and they loved it. It lasted a full hour and we watched them whilst they learnt the basics. They both want to go again. The snow park was great fun and the rides much better than I expected. It was very busy (Eid holidays) but we never queued for more than a few minutes. Its very hot as you get changed and the ski jackets and trousers were not very clean at all, if these things had been better it would have 5 stars. However it would not stop me from going again. We were in the park for 5 hours and so we felt it comparable in price and experience to many other major attractions around the world.
Snow park in the dessert. Nice place to go if the dessert is getting too hot for you. If you have not seen snow, this is the place to go but other than that it's nothing special.
unusual experience in dubai. we did it for the novelty, It was fun, the outfits are not warm enough so wear thermals. Runs are short but it is a fun 1/2 day out

It's a chill way to spend some time.. I've got to say that the concept was too much to resist. I'm at somewhere between beginner and intermediate in snowboarding. I found the lifts comfortable and easy off and on. If you are experienced you will find it boring. You'll slide down in seconds and the two runs are it. There is a small, very small, spot for tricks but not enough to keep you interested. I didn't get to try the other activities because I had a reservation with the penguin experience but I think I'll try it next time. The snowboard provided was in great condition but clothing gear was inadequate. The gloves were fleece. So if you're learning your hands will get wet. And the socks gave me blisters on my calfs from turning pressure. The staff wasn't friendly or engaging. Either way, if you got the time and some cash, why not? The pictures will impress family.
Average. This was ok, the skiing was good but we did the penguin experience. It was meant to be 40 mins but were luck if we were there for 20 mins. It was expensive and not really worth the money.

Hot changing rooms. To put layers on in a hot changing room is really unappealing. It is 120 dhs for the snow park and then they charge an extra 30 dhs for some of the activities which I thought was a bit cheeky. It is spectacular though and my 3 year old has not stopped asking to play in the snow since!Would be lovely to go around to Christmas to get in the mood.

fun time.... Had a lovely time there....but after an hour or so it was really cold so i went out but u know what my kids enjoyed it for i think 6 hrs there and they had lots of fun because they saw snow for the first time as we live in a place where therte is no snow.The rides were great too.I would definitely recommend this to everyone with kids.

The best indoor ski centre. They've tried and succeeded in making the runs interesting, including part of a black run - okay an easy black, but they've tried.Worth a visit to witness the chairlift, alpine trees - bizarre when it's 30 degrees plus outside. Interesting for people watching too :)

Okay for a few photos. We did the snow park only. Make sure you take your own gloves and hats (woolen), otherwise be prepared to be ripped off! Very crowded on holidays and extremely cold in there, which means you can't stay for long. Would not do it again.

Fun evening. We had fun couple of hours. However, when you are used to the 'real thing' and are a decent skiier the two (very simple) runs will not excite you for too long. However, it is a bizarre and fun setting and we definitely didn't regret the visit.

Something different :). Thought this was great!! my sister and i are in our 20s and we went here and could not believe it! its a great way to cool down(its FREEZING!!) and have some fun! would definitely recommend it!!
Can you imagine snow park in the Middle East?. Do you think that is too hot in Dubai? Take you cap and gloves and go to visit Ski Dubai (situated in the Mall of the Emirates)

Chill out for a little while. Take a break from the heat and do some skiing in the desert. Makes a nice change and it's reasonably priced. The couple of times I have been there it hasn't been that busy, on both occasions we found ourselves coming down the slopes with only a handful of other people as a lot of the local Dubai folk don't ski there, they just go for the snow park experience. Take your own gloves though otherwise you might need to buy some as they aren't included in the package.

How Wildly Mad !. How much more extreme can you get than this?Oh yes its Dubai !If you are a skier, it is something you just have to do !For non skiers, go and watch from outside, and laugh at all the mad people inside !

Skiing in a desert. This is an atraction in mall of the emirates. My opinion is that i do not have to go to dubai for skiing. me as a tourist i could find other places to have skifun. But for arab people which have never seen snow is nice.

Fun for kids. We didnt ski itself as the kids have never skied before, and we had limited time, so only enjoyed the activities at the bottom of the ski slope. A bit boring for parents, but the kids had fun on the slides etc. I would bother again without actually skiing.
Great. A great place to experience especially visiting Dubai. They provide you with warm clothes, gloves, socks and shoes. Had an excellent time there, like been somewhere in the Alps.

It's fun. Just returned from Ski Dubai. It was not bad, but not as good as we expected. Kids liked the place, but we got frozen in there. Better to have some extra warm clothes with you, especially for your head and neck. They do provide jackets and trousers, as well as fleece gloves and socks, but that is not enough. WE had to run out couple of times to make blood run again. My kids have no idea about skiing, so we just had fun sliding on slides. They are not many, but fun enough especially if you've never slid before. I would never go there again, although we do not regret being there. But one time is enough to feel enough. probably for ski-experts its a good option to be able to enjoy their favourite hobby in the middle of the desert......Its like junk food instead of all natural food (when you are hungry and there is nothing else to eat, it can work. Some people even like it)

Cool. It is literally like the alps in a desert, wish there was more fresh snow, figure out when they blow fresh snow and plan you visit at that time, carry your own gloves and caps else you have to buy them.

Snow in the desert. Went skiing with my teenage son. I snowboarded, he skiied. It was Eid so there were LOADS of people, but the slopes were quiet as most 'played' in there rather than skiied. A fab couple of hours.

A great way to cool off!. Ski Dubai was a great experience to chill down from the hot middle east temps! There is a variety of different activities to do. My husband and I just did the two-hour ski pass, which is more than enough time to do the 2/3 trails over and over and over. The ski lift is very slow, so it is good for beginners as well as those that are just riding it as a part of the Snow Park option. The pomel lift is a little more tricky. There are a few spots that it can be challenging if you've never ridden one, or a t-bar before. The rental equipment is just that, rental equipment. Don't expect to get demos here. The Avalanche Cafe is a great mid-slope stop to get a hot chocolate or snack. The deck has portable heaters so it's a nice warm-up from the 30 degree temps on the slope. I recommend going right when they open, because as we were leaving, it was getting incredibly busy and rather chaotic.

Delightful Place to Visit. I never thought we would go there while in Dubai, but when we were at Emirates Mall, my daughter looked so intrigued by it that we went. It was tons of fun. Seeing the joy on the local kids' faces was a treat in itself. It feels surprisingly authentic, and is so mind-boggling to find a real skiing experience in the middle of the desert, but it's Dubai, so nothing to be surprised about.

Amazing. Quite an experience after the sun in the morning on the beach, minutes later you can ski there in the Mall under zero degrees. The slope is not long neither difficult but what an experience. Good tarrif while not cheap, you can take lessons, we did last time. Amazing penguins now there too. Need to work on the speed of the lift though, very slow. Skis are good quality also ski boots. Worth a try

Strange setup. Skiing in a mall?. Ok, if you have tried the real thing, this is nothing comparable. Odd curiosity and a cold one. For some reason i was freeezing all the time. Take along longjohns and woolen mittens, if you find them anywhere here in UAV....

Nice experience. It's pretty cold in there, it doesn't matter what the weather outside is, but you get free overall cloths to keep yourself worm enough, except you have to pay for the gloves.Multiple options are available for entertainment, but if you don't have to, avoid going there during national holidays, especially Eid periods, after Ramadan and Hajj, when lots of tourists are here, you'll have to wait in the line for a long time otherwise.

Snow Park good for a basic visit with young children. We purchased the Snow Park entry (130AED ad and 120AED ch) which gave us entry to the snow area, kiddie toboggan rides, mini snow doughnut rides, use of sleds, hire of boots, pants/jackets, disposable socks and helmets for the kids (under 13s only). Hire did not include a locker nor gloves and I suggest that you definitely source some gloves as it was very very cold on our hands and too cold to finish our snowman (many other tourists had gloves, not sure where they were sourced but BYO gloves if you are a seasoned skier or investigate further). As we entered the ticket sales area we were approached by sales reps promoting the tickets and upgrade packages. The sales rep we had was a little bit vague on what the Snow Park ticket included and strongly suggested that the kids wouldn't be able to ride on anything unless we upgraded to the Super Pass (200AED ad and ch) which included the Snow Park, unlimited Chairlift, Mountain Thriller, Giant Ball, locker and voucher for gloves. We decided against the upgrade and it turned out that we were still able to ride on some fun child-friendly rides and our kids were happy. You can upgrade your tickets once in the park but it is more expensive than purchasing the Super Pass. We didn't see any toilets once inside the park so be prepared, but you can buy drinks once inside. Also, make sure you get a locker as it isn't really convenient to carry backpacks or handbags. Once inside, the views of the ski slope and chairlift were amazing and it was amazing to experience snow in the desert. There also seemed to be plenty of viewinig areas from within the Mall of Emirates (lots of glass everywhere) so perhaps some good spots to grab a coffee while you watch your more adventures family members on the slopes!It was a very fun and unique experience, especially if you or your children haven't experienced snow, however we wont be returning on our next stopover in Dubai.

Amazing Snow Park. It is one of the biggest man made snow park , with various rides , chair lift , ski , penguin march et all . The experience was one of that of real time snow . Super pass enables one to access all sections - a must visit .

Unique Experience in Dubai. It's no mountain however it is a very fun and unique experience. It offers just enough for a great snow experience in the desert. I'd recommend the 2 hour session as anymore than that may become a bit repetitive as they only have a couple slopes.

Better then I expected. You pay 200 dirhams, collect your trousers, jacket, ski/snowboard, shoes of your choice/size, get changed, go up, get poles, and out for the slope. Your time starts counting when you first go for the lift, so do not hurry.The slope is about 400 m long, even unexperinced skier can enjoy it. It is easy - no surprises concerning weather, surface, trees...

Desert ski area. If you are at the mall, you should take a few hours and go skiing. The run is not long nor very high, but to be able to say you skied while you were in Dubai makes it all worthwhile. My suggestion is to buy the 2 hour lift ticket. That is all the time you need for the experience. And to take a hat, it is cold. If you have ski gloves take them along or you will have to buy a pair at the ski shop. Ski Dubai provides all equipment, ski pants & jacket, but no gloves.
Snow snow. very nice and well maintained.. standard of equipments the best... everything is really nice and a lot of care is taken of the people once inside the ski
A must do in Dubai. I loved it being a non-skier. Most pro's would probabl find it a bt limited but it is definitely something to try if your in Dubai. I had a ball.
Great fun. Something very Dubai like, an ice ramp in the middle of the dessert, staff are very professional and attentive only problems are the long lines to enter.

Interesting experience. For people who have never seen snow in their life it was an amazing experience. Kids really enjoyed the freezing cold... until they became too cold!The park itself has a few things to do... the sled runs were fun and the charilift ride was exhilirating for the family... we even took beginner skiing classes - the instructors were extremely patient and friendly, which was wonderful.Overall this is a a unique and fun-filled couple of hours for those not used to this kind of environment. I did see a lot of people from colder climes skiing, though not sure how challenging/ exciting it was for them (or whether they came to Ski Dubai for a feel of home in the middle of the desert?)

Great slopes. This site boasts several chair lifts as well as tows. There are several slopes accomodating beginners and more experienced skiers plus snow boarding etc. Great place to spend a few hours and reasonably price. Gear is available.

45 Degrees outside... -5 inside!. They know how to do things in extremes in Dubai! The ski slopes are awesome with beginners, intermediate and the black line skiers. Great instructors, well organised and doing the penguin experience was super!

Not well organized and timed. We spent more time looking at the guide doing an introduction like a clown than the penguins.The visit was 30mn, 15mn to get in and the clown, the 1mn to look at the penguins swimming then 7mn. Each to take pictures.We were not allowed cameras and the photographers were not proffessional ones. It is just a money maker.Would go again only for kids that's all
Ski Dubai. Froze to death in there inspite of the heavy jumpsuits, boots, gloves and hats. Kids were excited about seeing snow for the first time. But they were happy to get out into the warmth.

Penguin meet. We met 3 penguins - 1 King (only a baby so quite small) and 2 gentoos. We didnt get very long with them which was disappointing. No cameras are allowed which means you have to buy a picture which was incredibly expensive. I was very disappointed to see they had no offers for photos. Overall meeting a penguin was excellent but the experience was ruined by being too short and photos being too expensive.

Skiing in the middle of desert!. This is a very nice place to visit. It is located at the Mall of the Emirates. It has around 400m slope which is not that much but being indoor makes this a pleasant skiing experience. You will get all the gear necessary over there (even the socks!) but it is better to take your own gloves with you (although there is a shop where you can buy a decent pair). There is also a snow park within these facilities for those who wish to experience cold weather and play with snow but don't ski.

Must go.... Its a brilliant piece of engineering marvel. In this high heat desert, you can ski.... wow... -4C... You get all your jackets, boots, pants, etc at the entry along with your entry ticket... You need to get your head caps and gloves though.. That is a must, otherwise, you can't stay in there for long... So dont forget... Or else, you will end up buying them from the store at higher prices.Its advisable to upgrade your entry to a all-day pass at extra 50AED... that gives you unlimited in-out access.... unlimited rides access... etc etc.. Watch the penguin shows at 2:00pm inside... its fun. I suggest buying the Entertainer book of dubai and looking for "buy one, get one free coupons"... It would be a good option.

What a strange sensation!. We went shopping and ended up skiing.... How could we resist! A good chance to cool down. This is by far he best indoor ski run I have been to, much better than anything we have in Britain. They provide you with everything bar gloves, but we just took a quick walk across the mall to the super market to by some. 2 hours for about £35, great value for money. It didn't seem o get oo busy either.

Outside it is hot, inside it is.... The idea of skiing while it is 40C outside is the biggest thrill, though the size of the slope is impressive too. I did a personal class, but it was visible that my teacher prefered teaching a girl rather than a boy. He had not much eye for my lacking of technique and didn't try to teach me. He let me stay on the premises though, though my time had finished.

To said I've been there.. (at least once in a lifetime!). We are coming from a tropical country so we were thrilled to try this unique experience. The thought about playing snow indoor in ski dubai at -4C, in the middle of desert while outdoor temp. at 40C is just crazy, should try it at least once, right?! There are 2 main area in ski dubai: Snow Park where everyone can just play with snow, and the Ski Slope if you want to ski. There are some different passes to choose, just check their website, We choose the "Snow park pass" since we were not planning to take a ski lesson with our 5 yo girl, ticket price for those pass are AED130 for adult and AED120 for child (You have to pay more or buy other ticket pass if you want to play some attractions like giant snowball, mountain thriller, etc). We use discount voucher that we found at our hotel and pay less. This pass already included some standard outfit, protector helmet for child, snow boots, and allsize-socks, but not gloves, so better you bring your own gloves if you have, or you can buy it at their store, the cheapest fleece gloves is around AED20. If you are sort of people who can't stand cold, maybe you can also bring/buy beanie, scarf and wear warmer clothes inside the outfit.With so many people stomping around, we couldn't find any fresh snow to build snowman, although my daughter tried her best, with little success, to make a snow angel. The Snow park itself is quite impressive for an indoor park, there are pinguin show and free rides for adult to small children, my daughter enjoy the rides so much. Maybe next time we would try the ski slope - hey, it would be twice in a lifetime then.. :) Don't forget to bring some cash if you want to buy some food or hot drink inside.
I looked from the outside. no much to say other tham would be nice if one wished to ski, i found it pleasant given to have more time to spent in Dubai i may would have give it a try

Had a blast. Coming from WA we don't get snow so it was great fun to go to Ski Dubai and enjy this winter wonderland even if it was indoors.Rent your outfit at the entrance and make sure you buy some gloves which don't cost much as you will need them. Enjoy a Hot chocolate up at the Alpine Cafe after your chairlift ride. We had a great time even if we didn't go skying. Not to be missed.

Another good day out. We had a ski lesson for beginners. Bobby was very good with us, patient! Had great fun, although not sure it would be good for those very experienced as it doesn't look big enough or interesting enough. Great for learning though. I saw a chid having a lesson also. The instructors were very good.
Coooooool. Very cool or cold experince. We enjoyed our day playing with the ice, the cable car and the snow ball and others

Unbelieveable. We took a metro ride, very cheap, from the Creek to the Mall. Once inside we were taken aback at the size of the place. The ski slope was something else and, although we did not use the facility, it was great to see.

Penguins!. They now have penguins at the ski centre which is a separate ticket, you get to meet a few penguins, 3 in our case and have pictures taken whilst learning a little about them. A good afternoon out, clothing is provided as it's -4 degrees! Be prepared to spend money if you want the pictures as you can't take your own camera in...

Great experience. Me and my wife Ski/board every year so we had to check the place out. It was far bigger than i had imagined and well laid out. The kit was ok for hire kit but no gloves so remember that... as was my board, but not much guidance on what the best package would be. We opted for the just ski deal for 2 hours which when you take in the size and where it is, is better value than indoor UK slopes. They were also in better condition as well. Overall, worth a visit but avoid busy times...

Really????. I booked online. I have 2 young kids that are not ski age (yet). My wife and I thought it would be great if we could just take them to play in the snow, since we live/work in the Middle East, and snow is a completely foreign experience for them.I booked the Snow Park. You know? Build a snowman? Just like the website says? Anyway, we showed up to collect the tickets. The counterhelp asked, "How old are your kids?" I said, "4 and 2 years." The counterhelp said, "Sorry, but your 2-year old cannot go in."What?"What?" I asked. She says, "Ski Dubai policy. No children under age 2 allowed inside." She pointed at the dreaded "Sign on the Wall". It read the same thing. I asked, "Well, what's she supposed to do? Wait outside?" Blank stare. Hmmmm...I told her, "Your website makes no age restriction -- except for the ski hill, where it's a minimum of 12 years." She didn't want to hear it. I told her, "She is with her parents. She is just going to play in the snow." Nope. No go. Good thing the tickets were just booked, and not paid for. Ski Dubai can keep its tickets. It's all a gimmick anyway. When my kids are old enough, I will take them to Europe and teach them how to ski. I don't think the Europeans will close their Ski Resorts because a 2-year old wants to play in the snow...

FREEZE IN DUBAI. Another must see and do unique experience in Dubai. It really is cold in there! It is very popular with the locals too and if you don't want to partake there is a huge viewing window from the shopping mall. Lots of goodies to buy quite cheaply in the shop too.

check you travel insurance. my travel insurance did not cover skiing, so we went to the cafe at the top of the chair lift and enjoyed the view in the -5 degree c with a hot coffee and a cold drink from the fridge (fridge?????), jacket and pants and boots are included in entry price

A chill from the heat.. The idea of having snow inside a mall in Dubai in the middle of summer seems way out there, but this idea is fantastic. Ski Dubai caters for beginners and experienced skiers. They provide skiing lessons and areas for professionals to ski or snow board. It is also great fun for the children with penguins for the children to view and activities that are child orientated. Ski Dubai also provides the jackets, pants, socks, gloves and boots for you to wear and a locker to store all of your things. There is nothing Ski Dubai has not thought of. Once inside the ski area the staff have photographers for you to remember your time at Ski Dubai with plenty of shots to choose from. I am so glad that I can say I "went to the snow in Dubai". Thanks.

Much needed break from the heat!. I really appreciated taking a break from the heat and seeing my first indoor skiing facility. Skiing is obviously not optimal but they have other winter games you can choose from: tubing, rolling inside a giant plastic ball and so on. If I had more money and time I probably would've done the penguin visit - It was highly recommended but I ran out of time.

Very Good Artificial Snow But Showing Some Wear. Weekends and Evenings appear busy. Go first thing in the morning and no lines. Snow was good but the grooming left ruts. Ski equipment on average for a rental (dull edges, no wax, etc.) Runs are more comparable to a Green (Easy) and an Entry-Level Blue (Moderate). 2 Hours was good. Started to get bored after an hour.

Once in a lifetime. Every tourist coming to Dubai must try this atleast once.(and only once because it isn`t worth coming here the second time). There is no time limit..you can even ski...and recently they even added penguins as an added attraction !Extremely fun for kids too. And a must visit for those people who have never experienced snowfall in their life. All equipments/jackets/shoes etc are provided by the company.

Ski Dubai too pricey for so little. If your kids know how to ski already, don't bother! Ski lessons are mandatory, and then when they are done with the lessons, they still are not able to go down the slopes unless another package is purchased.

Something to say you have done !. We are skiers who gothe Alps every year.It is a bit of a novelty to say you have been here and skied in a shopping cenre in the desert.They provide all the kit including socks but strangely not gloves ! you can buy fleece gloves from the shop next door for AED20.We bought a 2 hour ticket which after 50 minutes and having done both runs (either side of the cafe half way up the slopes) three times we were rather bored of the novelty. Hilariously they call it a black run one side - well if anyone thinks that is a real black run terrain they are going to be quite shocked when they say what a real black run looks like !Quite expensive especially for the amount of time we actually used of our pass but something we can say we have done - probably wouldn't do again
Weird experience. Skiing in the middle of the deserts, it takes some time to get used to but it is a great experience. Lots of activities yet still an interesting slope.

Snow park and skiing. Mall of Emirates. Went on my day off, alone. Decided to pay for the "Super Pass" - 275 AED. 1hour lesson was good as I have never skied before. The teacher was helpful, he did get annoyed with the younger boys when they mucked around but treated me and the other adults with respect and was on hand for tips and an arm incase one is scared!Really enjoyed the experience - went on the ski lift, the bob sleigh and the power ball. OK to do on your own and passed a couple of hours in a fun way.
Fun for all children, teens and adults who like it cold.. The children enjoyed quite a bit. Since it is in a mall it was perfect for some of the parents who preferred going shopping or sit at a cafe.

Unforgettable first time. We joined the beginner class. Of course, 60 minutes is too little to master anything but you get the gist of it. The instructor was a bit harsh with us at first but later warmed up! We skied, we fell, we got bruised, we skied, we fell again! :) but oh boy, this was so fun!

Good for about an hour.. We did this just to say, we did it. We live in California, we have better places to ski obviously, but this sounded like one of those things you do once just to experience it. It was pretty cool for maybe two runs. My biggest problem is they don't give you gloves, you have to buy them. They provide you with everything else you would need to really, no gloves? Even disposable ones? It is so cold in there we didn't last merely because I was afraid of getting frostbite. There are two runs, and a short park which requires you to have rented a helmet, which we didn't know until we got all the way up there. They have a ski restaurant in the middle of the run where we stopped to get coffee because we were so cold and a little bored. It takes about 10 minutes to get up the lift and 1 minute to get down. I would do the two hour ticket but I don't understand how anyone could make a day out of this.

Snow Skiing in the desert!!. Wow!! The Snow Village in Mall of Emirates is something shocking to have in a geographical area known with its very warm waether. The activities are a lot of fun specially to families. The staf overthere are very helpfull and make everything simple and easy to the visitors however if you intend to go there do not forget to bring your camera with you and take some shots to remeber because the photos taken by their photographers are overpriced unless have no problem with that.

Go Early in the Day!. This is an unusual experience being in the snow with proper snow gear - Boots,gloves,etc, - at one end of an upmarket Shopping Centre in the middle of the Desert.The kids can be very rude and pushy and seemingly unsupervised but it is fun none the less. If you do not have a full head of hair make sure to take a beany or cap,etc, as it really is like being in the snow. If you are a skier then I imagine you could have a good half day's skiing at a reasonable cost.

Great. One of the best Placed in Dubai if you ask me , regardless if you can ski or not , there are 3 places in SkiDubai1- Ski : a-Ski by your selfb- Ski Jumpc-Skiing school (offers private and group lessons)2-Snow Park3-Penguin Experience (yes real penguins!) Note : Only place in the world you will be allowed to touch penguins, but please don't freak them out, they will hurt you if you didYou can rent any skiing equipment, or clothing .. but you will have to buy your gloves (there is a store there, don't worry about it)If you are going to learn how to ski, then you will be given a small book were your trainer writes your grade next to the exercise , you have to pass them all to be allowed to join the large cliff , so do not forget your book when you go for your second class...If you are familiar with snow and know how to ski , and you are only visiting , it is expensive Ski Dubai is for people who skiing is their Hobby , and are residence of the emirates or , for people who never seen snow , or kids who want to see penguins ....

So much fun. We had a great day at ski Dubai. Nice to get out of the heat for a few hrs, giving you the feeling your in the alps. Price ok for snowboarding, tubing, zorba ball, sledging. My husband had a snowboarding lesson and loved it too.Would highly Reccommend and will return. Good for adults and children

Dubai Mall Ski Lodge. You would never believe that you could find a ski lodge inside of a mall, let alone one that is in Dubai in a 120 degree heat. But that is exactly what you will find. You can sit by the windows or the floor to ceiling fireplace and watch people snow board, or children have a snowball fight, and watch people ski down the slope. This is a must see. Plus the shopping is great in the mall.

Snow Fun. Yes, yes, yes a 1 kilometre piste in a shopping centre next to the desert complete with ski lifts, snow ramps and lots of fun. Once inside it is very real in fact you wouldn't think you were anywhere else but the Alps.
It is excellent. if you go to dubai you can not miss ski in dubai, also for kid they hame a pinguin encounter that was very good
Its fun, fun, fun. right timing for the hot weather to enjoy. helpful staff and safe to enjoy. would love to be back with my nieces to enjoy park and rides.

Good for Beginners. Skiing in the desert sounds crazy, but in Dubai this is reality. We spent the morning on the beach and the afternoon skiing, a novelty and quite a shock to the system. This was the first time my 2 friends and I skied, so we took their discovery lessons for beginners.The lesson are good, however the average age of students was about 6, so we felt abit out of place and somewhat...embarrrased.It was very cold inside so you have to wrap up soon. You will need to buy gloves but they provide everything else.Quite expensive for a short time,but if you are a professional skiier you can get more for your money.The Ski centre is in a shopping mall and was great for shopping and eating in the evening. A great day out.

SIMPLY AWESOME. TO FIND A indoor ski park in a mall is one outstanding feature, but when you go inside its like wow, so awesome, my wife and i went in May 2011and are planing to go back next year 2013, it was a very good experience and especially we from South Africa, Durban where it does not snow
Must go for Children. It is a must go and one will thoroughly enjoy every bit. Please wear all the precautionary clothes-gloves, caps etc. It really gets cold after a while

6 minute lift up, 40 second run down. This is an impressive engineering feat, having an entire mountain inside of the Mall of the Emirites. Nevertheless, I had a slightly better than fair experience. On the plus side, I think it is very cool (pun intended) to be able to say that you are snowboarding inside, when it is 120 degress outside! Also good was the lift ticket lines. There are helpful people everywhere explaining the different things you can do. Also a plus is that your ticket comes with winter clothes rental (who would bring winter clothes to Dubai?)The biggest minus is that the run is the smallest run I've ever done - and I have snowboarded on some holes in the ground in Ontario, Canada, which is very flat. The lift is very slow, probably done intentionally for those not buying lift tickets but buy winter wonderland tickets that includes a ride up and down the ski lift.Another minus are the local teenagers. It is probably that they don't know any better, but they had no compunction skiing over the front and back of my snowboard while on the line waiting for the lift. If they did this in the rockies or in the East Coast, they'd get their skulls pounded. Probably contributing to this problem is that 99% of the people here are getting rental boards, and people just don't care about other people's property.Lastly, they had helmets for kids, but not for adults. One of the best things about this mountain, is that on the latter half, you can do jumps and land in a giant stunt airbag. Only, you need a helmet to do this, and helmets weren't available as far as I could tell.

Skiing for beginners. We'd been skiing once before on holiday, but went for a beginner lesson - glad we did as the 2 hour open ski pass would have been too advanced to us. Great place but a bit too short on time.Not cheap, but worth it just to say you've been skiing in the desert!

Good Place for a Family. We took our two small children (ages 3 and 5) to the snow park for an afternoon. All warm clothing is provided, with the exception of gloves and hats which can be purchased for AED20+. There are several tube slides to try, a lookout tower, and a penguin show. We spent about 2 hours there. I would recommend going as early as you can in the day -- you'll avoid crowds and having to fight with people over the use of tubes.

ICE AGE. A real gimmick on the edge of the desert. There are various cafes that provide fabulous views of the slopes and the ski activities. You can hire everything you need if you want to ski on the edge of a desert!!
Good ride. since I dont ski I only did the Ski Lift tour. This is amazing place and more popular when the weather gets really hot.
skiing in the desert. great fun to tkae visitors who havent skied before, cool environment great value and good fun had by all

Pleasant experience. In the middle of ramadan and summer heath (August), we decided to go to Ski Dubai. My husband is a very good skier, while I am more a beginner. And to our suprise, we both liked it (although 2 hours is enough). Ski Dubai is a pleasant experience for both the experienced skier who misses the French slopes and for the beginner who wants to practice once more. As of course the slopes are limited, 2 hours is more than enough, but it is worthwhile, especially if you can use the entertainer family voucher. One tip: dress well, because it is indeed very cold :-)
Chilled at 42(C). It was 42(c) on that day but when we enter ski dubai we were chilled very much, it was really a nice experience on ski dubai.You will surly like penguin show which runs all day.
Kids loved it. What an amazing setup, with all the clothing and gear you need. Really well organised, and those that want to stay warm can watch from the outside in the restaurants and cafes.

Easy snow. About the only good deal left in Dubai. The price has not changed in years. Your first visit will take time to work it all out. Take your own gloves and an extra layer on top as sitting on the chair you will get cold. If you can go during the day you will have the place to yourself but still rarely busy.
Fantastic.. Great fun experience. It so big. It's so unreal skiing inside a mall. you actually forget that you are actually in a mall.
Fake ice. the place is nice next to the mall but the snow is ice not actual snow ,so sleeper,but overall is good
From the pool to snow for skiing. Ausom. Great for my 3 kids who can ski. Good size run inside! Must do in Dubai everything provided except for gloves that we're cheap . C
Lots of fun!. Bring the family! I thought sure this would be a small attraction with no real room to ski but I was wrong. It's huge!!!

Very funny. Outside +45°C... inside 0°C. Skiing in the desert is a must do in Dubai. It is very noise and chaotic in the dressing area. But if you go for skiing, only are few people are there. Must arabic guys go only to the fun area. Enjoy and bring our own gloves with you!

Had cold fun in the middle of the desert!. Just the fact that you can be skiing in snow in the middle of the desert is amazing! Besides the skiing, other rides (especially the giant bubble were excellent fun.
Super snow fun. I loved it, my kids went crazy, a little expensive though, but worth it, especially if you live in a place that does not snow.

Not all that.... Tried it but wouldnt do it again... First of all, people there, adults and kids dont understand queues, they just push in, shove you out of the way, so if you want to get on a ride, you have to do the same. At one point, I was coming down quick fast on a sledge down a sleep bendy slope, little did i know that there was nobody monitoring at the bottom so I nearly crashed into a crowd who were still stood around, I came off my sledge to avoid a collision and as a result got a lovely large bruise on my arm.. My two boys 5 and 8 enjoyed it but the youngest one complained of being cold after being there for 2 hours. The clothing is included in the price and so is the foot wear which I must admit was very comfy. Kids gets a safety helmet but you have to buy the gloves, which are only a few quid. There is then a penguin show which lasts for 10 minutes and there is a chance of meeting the penguin at an extra charge. It was different but not something I would do again but I suppose if you live in a place where you dont see snow, then its a novelty...

A fantastic family time. We only visited the snow park at Ski Dubai. It was such fun! Our children are aged 9 and 4 and they were able to go on everything available. It is well set up with lots of helpful staff. It's great they insist on children under the age of 13 to wear a helmet, it keeps them extra warm as well as extra safe! I would advise to take your own gloves. All other snow apparel can be hired but if you don't bring your own gloves you need to buy some, it would be too cold without them. It's isn't too cold on there being all rugged up. Seeing everyone shopping in summer gear through the windows is a bit bizarre when you look the other way you could be in Europe. Great value and we will definately visit again. This is an only in Dubai experience!!!

Confirm your lesson booking. Visiting Dubai often we always visit Ski Dubai and have never had a problem until this last time.My 16yr son was booked for a level 2 lesson. 220dhr for 90min. The instructor told them to practice level 1 skills and refused to teach them anything new from level 2. We could have paid 180drm for 2hrs without lesson just to practice what he already passed from level 1.

Snow in Dubai. A great place to learn to ski. A variety of qualified instructors that seem to enjoy their job. Our children learnt to ski here before we took them on a skiing holiday. Gave them great confidence so when they hit the real ski slopes they were off and racing.
Keeping it cool. Had to experience the ski dubai with the family & enjoyed every minute. Well organized establishment.

A novelty. Let's just say "I did it" and I'm glad that I did but I think I'll stick to skiing on mountain slopes. This is a place for kids and kids on skis can be unpredictable. I did a few runs then called it a day.
Great. Really enjoyed this - penguins also good. What was good is you don't have to ski we paid to go into the snow park and throw snowballs and ride the slides.

Midweek skiing. Good fun, perfect to remind yourself what skiing is all about. Or if you are a learner No queues to buy tickets or equipment. We got there at opening time.
Choice of button or chair. One run but can be taken different ways.
2 hrs is plenty and v cold!

Only in Dubai !!!. We could not come here without visiting Ski Dubai. It provides a welcome relief from the soaring temperatures outside!! Great family fun, whether you want to ski, build a snowman or just throw snowballs!

A must visit if you`re in dubai. There`s a certain novelty to being able to ski in the desert! Great way to spend a day. If you cannot ski (like my first time visiting here) get a lesson and you`ll be up the big slopes in 2 hours. Really glad I did it and its a fairly well organised place. Great family day out too.

Don't visit during Eid. Hubby and kids lived this place, but I did wish I had stayed at the hotel. Crammed with locals celebrating Eid plus tourists on top made the queues very long.They provide you with ski suits, shoes and gloves, and compulsory helmets for the kids.I personally won't return, don't quite see the point of booking a holiday in Dubai to go skiing! But I can at least say I've done it once.You get the options of skiing or just visiting the snowpack to use the rides.Value for money for the point that you can go first thing I the morning and then return as you want as often as you want during the day.The queues for boots and clothing were very long, so if you do decide to leave for lunch, then make sure you stash all your clothing in a locker, so you don't have to queue again! They Amy be a bit damp, but what the heck, it beats queuing.

..... I would say Ski Dubai is a one time thing. Extremely good but very very very cold! Could only stay in there for 2 hours, and it was very busy with little kids throwing snowballs at random strangers.

Snow in the desert. Something dreams are made of, Snow in the Desert.Dubai has made immposible things possible in a very easy way. Ski Dubai is something you must not miss, even if you are from a snow covered region.Very well maintained and chilling cold are the simple words to describe this place. They have an added attraction of Penguins which althoug expensive is worth the money paid.Cover the children properly, as the cold will get to them.

Fantastic! - Cheaper during Ramadan. Fantastic experience! Dubai is a very warm place, so being on ice cold ski is very interesting. It is indoor and the place is big, you can easily spend at least half a day and the price is reasonable. If you go during Ramadan, it is even cheaper.

Cold fun. This is a very good attraction built in the middle of the Mall of Emirates. Your ticket gives you a full day of fun with all the warm clothing and boots you need. Bring gloves a hat and warm socks if you dont purchase the inclusive ticket 200.00 Dirhams. Check out the web site for all the information. The chair lifts and the toboggan runs are very good. The ringo's for the smaller slopes go quite fast and are good for the younger child. If your an accomplished ski or snow boarder you can use the slopes. Lessons can also be booked.This makes a nice change from the heat of Dubai.

Coolest Place in Dubai. When it's 40 degrees outside, the -3 degree Ski Dubai Snow Park is just plain irresistible! If you're not much into skiing (like me), there are still lots of things you can do like bobsled runs, tobogganing, riding the giant ball, chair-lift ride, playing in the snow, or just drinking hot chocolate and enjoying the view from the Avalanche cafe at the top of the slopes. Plus, if you don't mind spending an extra 175 AED, you can get to meet some snow penguins! The photos are really expensive but the experience is so worth it. Staff are very friendly, accommodating, and knowledgeable – especially the trainers at the Penguin Encounters.A few tips:1. The queues can be very long (around 15-minute wait) especially when lining up to get your toboggan/sled. Make sure you secure your sled because some people would just steal it from you while you're not looking. Then, you'd have to line up again. Boo!2. Unless you have the money (and willing to spend 500-850 AED), the 175 AED for the penguin encounter is already worth it. The photos afterwards can be very expensive so better if you have a companion with you to share on the cost. You can split the 550 AED photo package which includes 1 big picture, 2 smaller pictures, 2 keychains with pictures, 1 snow globe, plus a CD of ALL your pictures during the encounter.
Great indoor Ski. Nice experience. There are great instructors, if you need. But you must book in advance. It is good if you plan to travel for skiing , go warm up at ski Dubai:)
Great fun!. If you don't like skiing, just get a Frappuchino from the Starbucks restaurant next to Ski Dubai for a moment away from the heat.

Beginners Haven and black runners breeze !. My first ever ski lesson in Dubai!! ( How bazaar ..right ?) Fantastic experience for a first timer . I didn't stack it once! My sister did the black run but she said its 10 times more easier than a black run back home . If skiing is not for you , there is the snow park side as well with real penguins .

..If you like skiing when there is 50 degrees celcious outside!!. we only had a quick visit here, it all looks almost surreal as, during August, the temperature outside is close to boiling point!!! And yet inside the ski slopes you need...well, warm winter clothing!! Suitable for children and adults alike, "it does what is says on the box"!! Have fun

Excellent Ramadan value. Booked the extreme pass which gave discovery lesson in snow boarding or skiing for 1 hour, and then time for whole day to try other experiences such as tobogganing, zorbing down the hill, visit penguins etc. my family loved it and at around £40 was great value - this included all clothing and locker hire.

Big freezer only!. If you are curious what it feels ti be in a snow, this is not the place. Just open your freezer and imagine you are inside it. But I certainly do recommend this for kids age 6 up. Don't be confused with the snow slope (where you can ski but this is for those who knows how to ski. For the beginner, you have to go for a lesson and pay extra before you can experience the thrill) and the snow park which is like paying an expensive 130 dhs for punishing yourself by locking up in a freezer. Snow slope is limited for an hour only, pay extra if you want more while snow park has unlimited time. But who can last inside with not much attractions. Kids can certainly enjoy inside the snow park especially those who have grown up on countries without the snow. My advise to those who are curious to get inside the snow park: bring your own gloves and bonnet (very expensive when bought inside-cheapest pair of gloves is 20dhs), go with a group to save on the locker (20dhs), when you see a sled (for kids) grab it as this would be the last fun you'll have to last longer inside and compensate the costly entrance fee.

Great Fun. I've done this one twice and love it; if for no other reason than to experience of going from +120 degree heat to -2 degree cold. Of course, the runs are very short, but what would you expect? There are really two runs, one easy and one slightly more difficult. It's a bit expensive, but they have all the gear you need right there. Bring a cover for your head and ears as this isn't included. At the end of the day, you can't pass up the opportunity to snow ski in the desert.
Something for everyone!. If you are a skier, snowboarder or just want to escape Dubai's heat Ski Dubai is a nice attraction to kill some time.
Great fun. Had a family private lession but instructor was too busy arguing with one of his collegues, seemed he didn't really care about who was paying him.

Skiing!. The skiing is amazing; a must if you go to dubai! When you get given the suits put them on and then try to get out onto the slopes as fast as possible because otherwise it is very stuffy and you start getting agitated. The penguins are amazing! If you have family who want to watch the best location is the Costa coffe directly above the entrance to ski dubai!

What an Experience. My wife insisted to do skiing at Ski Dubai at Emarat mall and thanks God she did, it is for me the first time to experience snow weather. The only problem is tickets are too expensive, although i would pay 10,000 Darham to go there again ....
