Where else can you go from the slopes to the beach?!. Whilst in Dubai you must visit Ski Dubai. If you have skied or boarded on real snow, you will find that's it's really only for honing your technique as the runs are short, but it's good to practise and to get out of the heat. If you don't ski or board I wouldn't pay the money to ride up to the top as its not that impressive, but it depends of course whether or not you have seen real snow before. A better idea would be to play on the tubes or the huge rubber ball for a more fun experience. Be prepared for people trying to jump the queue, as is commonplace in Dubai. Practise your best 'get behind me' look!!
A fun day.. When its hot outside go and cool down to -5. A great experience for the whole family. All clothing is provided.

Interesting only for tourists from warm areas. There are lots of fun for children and adults. it's realy cold, about -4 degree C. They give you special wearing except the gloves. It won't be interesting if you have snow in your country.

Crazy Fun. We opted for a special offer on for Ramadan which allowed us full use of the Snow park and 1hour ski lesson. The lesson's are really good but are for complete novices like me which was good but I would imagine if you are an adequate skier than I think the lessons might get boring.
Was rushed and missed our ski School.. But they quickly found us a new instructor, He was extremely helpful and by the end of the class I was able to stand and stop on skis!

"Snowboarding/skiing in the desert.. It's a once in a lifetime thing! but only once will do... In depth review and tips. Mall of the Emirates | Shiekh Zayed Road, Dubai, United Arab EmiratesI went on this activity for two hours while on an epic holiday covering four countries in June 2012.Snowboarding/skiing in the deserts of the UAE is a must while in Dubai… but only once. Just so you can say that you've conquered the longest indoor snow slope in the world (400m long with a right hand turn in the middle). I went on the slopes on my own. As Ski Dubai was located in the Mall of the Emirates, it was no problem for her to go shopping! You can easily get to the Mall of the Emirates/Ski Dubai using public transport (MRT). The MRT stop is called Mall of the Emirates. Once you arrive at the location, Ski Dubai will be a bit of a pain to find as the mall is massive. Get a mall map and/or ask people while you try to find signs. I turned up on the reception door on a June evening for some slope time, where it was not busy at all… only 5 to 10 people on the main slope. You could always book lessons or slope time online too.I missed out on using a voucher for 10% off on slope time. Scour the internet or any voucher booklets beforehand.The package included:- Jacket- Trousers (both jacket and trousers were cosy)- Ski boots/Snowboard boots (make sure that they fit prior to you heading out… it's a pain and time wasting otherwise to go back and refit)- Skis + poles/Snowboard (Rossignol Snowboards… they are actually not bad for rentals... but doesn't beat my own board)- Free Disposable Socks- Helmets (for children)YOU WILL NEED TO BRING GLOVES/BUY GLOVES beforehand. I brought my own as I foresaw that I will go here. I also brought a warm hat with me.Make sure that you are a decent snowboarder/skier who can link turns, otherwise you'll get kicked off the slope.Lockers are 20AED and are only ONE TIME USE. So make sure you got everything but you hit the slopes… ski pass, gloves etc.The outdoors area comprised of:- Main slope which is split up in two mini sections. The lift allows you to get off halfway for tobogganing and a cafe area and also those who want to warm up on the main slope first before hitting the top of the 400m long main run.- Children's area (separate from main slope)- Tobagganing (at the side of the bottom half of the main slope)- Big Ball where you roll down a hill (separate from main slope)There were three main freestyle bits nearer the top of the main slope. A few boxes and kickers, but that was all.This package in my opinion was expensive compared to an indoor ski slope in the UK, but I guess it takes a lot of money to run an indoor ski slope (and is twice as long than the UK's longest slope) in Dubai…Overall, two hours was good. But I would only do this once. Real mountains are much better!!!Pre-Communication = N/AOn the Day Service = 8/10Activity Enjoyment = 8/10Atmosphere = 4/10Value for Money = 5/10Travel Comfort= N/ALocation = N/AOverall = 6/10Twitter: @hanstar007 - Scouse BBC (British Born Chinese!) Civil Engineer interested in anything funny, useful, photos, places, tech & food! Pro at: badminton, footy & snowboarding ;pUnited Kingdom

A Wonder in the Desert. I was impressed with the size of Ski Dubai and the fact that it even exist in a country where during some months, the low temperature is 110 degrees with 100% humidity! There is a ski shop, a gift shop, a restaurant, it is a great tourist attraction.

Oh Go Ahead & see it. You have to see Ski Dubai, just for the excess that it represents. I am not a skier, but it's a blast just to rent a snowsuit and go throw snowballs around when its 110F outside. How decadent! The scene is kitsch, but how can you not stopping giggling like a kid after chasing around someone on the sleds?The gift shop is decent as well; I always bring home SKIDUBAI hats & gloves- they are my friends' most coveted Christmas gifts. It makes a great photo.Photo tip: grab a bite or coffee at the Kempinski food court at the end of the ski run, you will have the best views.
Lots of fun.... It really is freezing in there!! you have to ski Dubai for the mere sake of saying you did it! The people were friendly but you do need to bundle up in there! It is very neat!

Absolutely amazing... Dreams fulfilled. This is one attraction not to miss at all in dubai... a whole Ski slope and ice sports adventures inside a Mall.. The Mall of emirates....I was with family in Dubai during the scorching July heat few days ago ... and to our utter surprize...ski Dubai turned out to be an almost real experience ( temperature maintained at Minus Four ( -4 Deg C)... Though i do not know skiing, The tube run and the ice sliding... absolutely amazing :) . We were short on time and could enjoy just for about an hour or so, but a day pass should excite you to the hilt. Also we were lucky to have "Entertainer" coupons, that had the offer of 1+1 free, which helped, as the prices are slightly steep, but worth it.Would cetainly recommend this attraction to anyone who's visiting Dubai...

For skiing in the desert, nothing better.. If you are looking for a serious ride, this isn't your place. However, there are very few places in the world where you can sandboard, snowboard, and go to the beach in the same day. If you go with that attitude, you will find that you will have the time of your life. You almost forget that you are in the desert while you are in there...it really does get very cold.

Good for Kids !!. To tell you the truth....I didn't enjoy it much, the kids had a great time in it. I also didn't find it value for money.....but its only worth it if you are from countries where there isnt too much snow....!!

Massive. Haven't used this but have spent many minutes whatching people enjoying the facilities. Its a huge Ski Park with Lifts and lots of attractions for all ages. Quiet amazing when you realise that this is all indoors ... its vast.
Decent!!. Had cut my hand so couldn't go on the ski slopes but the snow park was good fun, however the rides are mainly designed for kids and young teens. Anyway it is a good experience.

Ski Dubai. Approx €40 for 2 hours skiing, great value for a beginner to home in your turns, but for a good skier an hour tops and you would be bored, don't get me wrong it's great to do but if your above a decent skier who can easily do red slopes then ya may get bored after a little while. 2 slopes of 1 is blue and the 'black' is not that much harder, 30 seconds and your run is done!###went during Ramadan and its great that way as there nobody there! That's a great thing!

Fantastic experience. This place is so amazing you must do it once just for the experience.You can be outside in the 40degree heat one moment and the next you are in the snow covered slopes of Ski Dubai. Brilliant!

expensive but good fun. The lift is very slow, and it gets cold after a while, so please take a long sleeve top with you, or after a while the cold will get you and you will want to go back out side in the hot again.

must visit. a good alternative when kids want to play snow and you don't feel like flying all the way to europe or somewhere else. Please note, children below 3 is not allowed. make sure you have proper meal because the cafe inside do not offer much choice and sometime you may not even see the staff around

A nice place to chill in the desert heat!. Awesome. You will burn in Greenpeace Hell, but totally worth it! For about $50US you get all the ski equipment, jacket, pants and lift pass (yes, there's a chair lift) and 2 hours worth of skiing. Sure the snow is a bit clumpy and the hill isn't really big or steep, but still about a good 400m downhill ski and how often can you say you've been skiing in the desert?!

Ridiculous Fun. We knew we just had to try indoor skiing in Dubai, because it seemed absolutely ridiculous, but we had a lot of fun. It is worth seeing just for what it is: an indoor slope with a full quad chairlift and even a ski chalet half way down the slope. Again, ridiculous!The skiing is not particularly challenging and in the time allotted, you can probably get in 8 or 9 runs. My only warning would be that even though they supply most of what you need (I don't think gloves are included, but you can purchase them in the ski shop and they make a funny souvenir), it actually does get quite chilly after a while. Even though it is HOT outside, it is worth bringing an extra sweater if you want to Ski Dubai.

Skiiing in the desert. What isnt there to like that on a day when it too hot for the beach, you can take to the slopes. Environmental issues aside, for a few hours slipping and sliding down the slopes it is great fun, and what's better is you can turn up in your beach clothes-everything is provided (except gloves which you can buy). Just fabulous.

Inside Dubai or Norway?. If you need to cool down and have some fun in the snow when you are in the desert then this is the place for you.Just like being in the Alps ( not quite as high though) wrap up warm flip flops and shorts will not work here.

funny... and cold :). for those (like me) who never had the opportunity to be on the ice and snow, this place offers a perfect replica of a moment of fun on the ice. I loved it ....para quem (como eu) que nunca teve oportunidade de estar no gelo e na neve, este lugar oferece uma perfeita replica de um momento de diversão no gelo. adorei....

Nits in the hard hats. My kids usually do the skiing, so wear their woolie hats. However, they decided to go for a snowboarding lesson back in April and were obliged to wear the ski centre's hard hats. They enjoyed thier lesson...but not the unwelcome guests that found comfort in their hair - they returned home with nits!!!We've been to Autodrome many many times, and never encountered this problem due to them taking correct precautions and making you wear a head protector under the helmet.Ski Dubai - do something about it!!!
Well worth a visit. It was the first time my kids had experienced snow and it is done really well.Certainly worth a visit to check it out.
wow. its wow , you do not need to do anyhting else for a few days in Dubai , just take this skiing and you will be happy !
fantastic ski!!!. kids will love the thrill of snow in a dessert and coming from a country where snow is rare it was a treat.Well equipped and fun

A unique thing to do. It was 45 degrees celcius outside and there we were skiing? WILD! It took us awhile to figure out how it all worked, we spent some time figuring out what package to get etc. but once that is worked out things run pretty efficiently. we took the package that included a lesson. skis, boots, EVERYTHING is provided. We were the only ones in the lesson, which was excellent. 2 instructors to ourselves. A chairlift to boot!! A very unique experience.

Good Fun!. Spent the day there with my grandkids. We all thought it was pretty cool to be playing in the snow in Dubai in the middle of summer! The rides were so much fun - only downside was that as the day grew later the crowds grew bigger. My advice go early, we got there just as they opened. This way you can ride everything without the lines. By afternoon the crowds are insane, you can hardly walk inside and the lines to the rides are crazy. We got an all day pass, a summer special deal, and had ridden everything several times by early afternoon. By the time the crowds became crazy about 4-5 pm we were more than ready to leave. One big problem, the people in that region DO NOT know how to stand in line, no matter how the employees try to organize the crowds by making them stand in line (there are stanchions that form the lines as in other amusement parks) only the Western guests obey the lines(when I say Western guests I include people of different nationalities who reside in Europe, US, etc.), everyone else pushes, shoves, and argues their whole family to the front...the adults were worse than the children. It got very stressful and we found ourselves being shoved back and stomped so many times that we decided to call it a day around 5 pm. They even stomped and shoved my little 4 year old grandson.Have to admit this is an issue I've seen many times in this part of the world. Love the people, they really are very nice, as long as they aren't in a situation where they must stand in line! Then they just get very aggressive and very argumentative!

A lot of fun. We bought the Super Pass ticket - which included a ride on the chair lift and the slides. You can stay in as long as you like, and go on the slides etc as many times as you wish. We just wanted to experience the place, and we had a great time. Went on a Thursday afternoon. It was fairly busy, we had to stand in queues a lot, but it was a lot of fun. The super pass included a snow suit (which you can wear over your clothes), the socks, shoes and gloves. I suggest you bring a beanie and wear layers as it is very cold. Each person also pays a deposit for a locker so that you can store your belongings.

Fun! Must do if you're a skier!. We had a GREAT time skiing at Ski Dubai. We went during Ramadan and virtually no one was there so we had the hill to ourselves for 2 hours. We skiied our hearts out.If your'e a skier and you're in Dubai, this is a "must do!"

For an indoor ski place, pretty good. Its an indoor ski place, so I can't knock it for th snow not being that great. Considering its situated in Dubai, I thought the snow was awesome. The size is decent. There are only two runs, so I suggest only purchaseimg the two hour pass. Go in the morning too because all of the kids will be taking lessons and the hills aren't packed. In the afternoon, they all go up on the hills. The lifts move extremely slow, it's about a 5 min trip up the hill. There is a tow rope that moves about twice as fast, but it's at an aggressive incline and tough for snowboarders.The lift ticket includes equipment and clothing rental. It was sufficient gear for the conditions. I was wearing shorts and a tshirt under the cost and pants. Didn't get cold until the end. The temperature inside is -5C. The rental doesn't include gloves or a hat. I didn't need a hat, but as a snowboarder I wanted gloves. The ski Dubai gloves were about 20AED, which is cheap. But if you're going to do the penguin encounter, you get free gloves with that ticket.If you enjoy skiing and snowboarding, you have to go just to say you did it!

Kids Day Out. This is a one of its kind Theme park situated in Mall oF Emirates. Kids will have a great time skiing, sliding,using chairlifts etc. The best time to go is in the morning since it gets crowded after 3 pm

A unique experience!. Ski Dubai is one of those things you just have to do in Dubai! We got tickets for the ski-park for 2 hours and had a blast. The only downside is that it can get very crowded and it takes forever to get set up beforehand (again because of queues mostly). Make sure to have a cup of coffee in the lodge in their too, a great experience.

Snow in the desert. Took my 3 year old who had never seen snow so it was an experience for him. It was hard to believe once inside that you were in Dubai. Its a must if youre from a warmer climate. You wont regret it.
Really Fun. But not very big in terms of width. Please make sure you do know how to ski so u dont fly down the slope and Hurt yourself haha (like me )
Cool and refreshing. Being ski fans it was really lovely to visit the Ski Dubai. We had nice lunch in the asian restaurant where you can see people skiing indoors!
Great. Great but expensive, It had many nice places to enjoy but every thing was very expensive inside, but overall experience was great
perfect. perfect get away place for me and my friends, we enjoy the slope and very nice games and staff ,,,,,,,,,,

Ski Dubai. We wanted to go to Ski Dubai on the 1st day of Ramadan so we rang ahead to the attraction and asked if everything was still available due to Ramadan and we were told it was except for the eating areas/cafes. We drove from Abu Dhabi to Ski Dubai to find that the penguin area was closed for the month, an attraction that we most wanted to see. That was very disappointing, however we loved the cool air at -2 degrees as it was 50 degrees outside!!The slides are quite small and really based more at a child level but the ski slopes are great to get practicing on if you are a beginner.
great. lots of fun and activities, lots of cold too but so much fun

Good place to chill ... I went with my family to this place,which is inside Mall Of Emirates.My 3 year old son enjoyed a lot as it was the first time he had been in snow(although artificial).All the clothes & shoes are included in the ticket fees but Gloves are not included and you have to buy it from a nearby shop.

Surreal. Even if our home is normally in Switzerland and we have snow on our doorstep throughout winter this was a must have experience. We had great fun on the slopes of Ski Dubai decent sized runs, the equipment needs works and the clothing needs to be cleaned from time to time. Tip take long undershirts the jackets are a bit horrid and try go in the morning when it opens the late afternoons and evenings are really busy. Overall worth a one time visit it is the sort of "been there done it" experiences.
Metro. there is direct line to Emarats Mall (ski dubai) from Hotel

Very nice!. We visited snow penguins program at ski dubai. I liked penguins very much! They are so cute:) The trainers allow you to touch big penguins. Also I played with small one. I will remember it for my life! Here you can check the info: http://www.skidubaipenguins.com/

Ski Dubai, a lighter shade of grey. Ski Dubai is a man made ski slope with real snow at the edge of the desert, part of Mall of the Emirates. When we went this morning, it was a sweltering hot and humid 45 degres celsius (in the shade) outside but the thermometer inside Ski Dubai was showing 2 to 3 degres below zero, that is powerful air conditioning! It was very busy, with many children and families enjoying the real snow and the new attraction of some cute penguins around a small pond. New also is the little cafe near it where you can buy a soft drink. Before you enter Ski Dubai, you have to put on the good winter equipment which is provided: snow boots, ski trousers and big coats. There are even long coats for the gents who wear dishdashs and ladies in abayas. It is all well organised. There are two separate parts in ski Dubai, one just to have a little fun in the snow, see the penguins, and the other part for the serious skiers who take the ski lift to get to the top of the ski run. I liked it but it made me a little nostalgic for les Deux Alpes, where the sky is high and blue and the snow is snow white, not a lighter shade of grey. But it is great and, after getting a little cold, it is nice to sit in cafe Saint Moritz, just near Ski Dubai and warm yourself at the "fire place" and have a lovely lunch enjoying the view of the slope.

Too much fun!. Who expects to ski indoors when the temperatures outside are soaring above 40 degrees? Well in Dubai you can do just that. This was my son's second time snowboarding here and he loves it. We also go into the ski resort and see the penguins, have a drink and photgraph him. It is incredibly well organised and the staff couldn't be friendlier. It does get crowded though in the evenings and it is 245 Dirhams (AUD $70) for a day pass if you are skiing, which includes ski suit, boots, sox and helmet. Take your own ski gloves or you have to buy them there. They have lockers for your clothes.

Skiii Dubai. Skiii Dubai is a man made wonder inside the Mall of the Emirates...Dubai has added it as an attraction few yrs back..still they have maintained it very well..inside you wont even feel..that u r not in Jungfrao, Switzerland...it gives u a feeling of Swiss Alps...lots of sports r thr inside..big enuf to accomodate around 200 visitors at a time...Zorbing Ball...Snowboarding...Skates...Trolley etc are the main attraction inside...it has got some thing for every age group right from 1 yr kid to a senior citizen. :) :)
good fun. Very well organised and a change from the hot summer
Great!!. I have never skied before so was a bit unsure of this place, but it was all very easy to get to grips with, it is extremely well organised and super fun for beginners and experts alike.

dangerous. this place would be great if staff could control some of the kids that use the slopes and a platform to show off to their friends. the first hour was great but then a group of teenagers arrived and made the slopes feel very unsafe, even knocking over a complete beginner. staff saw this happen but made no attempt to warn this person for doing it again. i will not visit this place until the safety has been improved. i would be worried if i had any kids using this facility.

Ice Ice baby !. its very soothing to see so much ice in Middle east ! there are 2 sections 2 this , one is the ski-slope and the other is the general play area with a lot of games for kids and teens.. there are ski classes available for additional prices for those who are interested to learn.... from the mall inside the view is very beautiful of the play area where you can see pple playing....
go in the summar. I love it, but dont know how to ski ;-). place to cool your self in the summer.
Fun. This was our second trip to Dubai and again we went to Ski Dubai. Lots of fun and a good way to learn to ski and a reasonable price.
Most wonderful place. Must visit place in dubai with -4 degrees temperature, here you go for skiing and have fun with ice sports for as long as u want
Fantastic mall. Sitting at one of the restaurants in the mall enjoying kids and grown ups skiing was a great experience :-)
Ski Mountain. Its a snow mountain that you can ski on in a mall, whats not to like?

Different!!. We are skiiers and it was crazy to go skiing in the desert. I couldnt stop thinking how bad this was for the environment though.Great if you are a beginner or just want to say, I skied in the desert!
Unique and unexpectedly fun. Wow who would have though you could go snow skiing in the desert. This was a unique and pleasantly surprising experience.
skiing for the first time!. it worth skiing once here, but its expensive, besides they don't let you ski wherever, you want, you should pass some training...!
Awesome. I dont ski but I had great fun and got surisingly warm. Great instruction and you need to take nothing, everything is provided. You've got to give skiing a go in the desert!
Another must see/do while in Dubai.. Where else can you go to a desert and snow ski? If you can't ski, not to worry, there's a fun area with snow slides and such.

Snow in the middle of Desert !!. Wow, snow in the middle of the desert. This was an amazing experince. its fun for all ages... you cant ski down the slopes unless you have experience, but there is plenty more too keep you busy.

Great Experience for Kids from countries without SNOW. The Kids really loved the snowboarding and snow tubes, they dont know how to ski so we couldn"t really try the Slopes and our visit too short for ski lessons.Rather costly thou so( 130 AED adults, 120 AED Child)so maybe opt for the SUPER PASS(200 AEDs) which includes the lockers( 40 AED) and Gloves( extra 20 Dirhams Each) as well as ski lifts and snow balls( which are addition 50 - 70 AEDs each/ride). All other equipment/clothes provided so if a bigger family , maybe pack your own gloves will save you money that you can spend elsewhere.lovely experience thou and memorable for my boys, 5 and 8 yrs as we come from sunny AFRICA

Fun for the less advanced Skiers. Slope is dull after a few hours but it's good fun with friends and if you want to brush up on your skills. For snowboarders - there are some jumps and bars to use but unless you're confident in doing jumps, there's no other challengers.

Ski in Dubai!!! Yes in Dubai!!. Do not compare it to anything. Ok it is not the Alps or Aspen, but just think of the name for a second. Ski in Dubai. that alone deserves a 5* rating. and yes you can ski and the kids can have some fun with the snow afterwhich you just have a nice lunch and do your shopping! it is a must try experiance

Ski /dubai. Can you imagine a snow park and ski resort in the middle of a desert? Well, this is it. It is a little costly, but then again it is probably very expensive to keep making snow and ice in the desert. Great fun and an awesome time. I can say I've been there and done that....

Great place to cool down. Good day out to cool off from the hot Dubai temperatures. Experienced skiers would not want to stay very long as obviously there are limited runs within a man made ski resort inside a shopping mall. Good family fun and also interesting to watch from TGIs inside the mall

Chillin Out!!!!. Visited Ski dubai with two teenagers in tow.They had the time of their lives,and really enjoyed the ski run.The rest of us bundled ourselves up in the warm clothing on offer and enjoyed the antics of the people cavorting thier,Well worth a visit.
Must go - but it is expensive and small. Very expensive for what you get, but you have to go.

Skiing in the desert. We skied at Ski Dubai in the Mall of Emirates just to say we skied in the desert. It was actually better than I expected. The temperature was around -2 so a little cold on the hands after a few hours of snowboarding and skiing. The snow jacket and pants are included with the ski pass, however gloves and hats are not included. These items can be purchased at the ski shop on location. We knew beforehand so we just had our own gloves and hat. You can also pay an extra fee to interact with the penguins or play in the snow park. It's all so amazing.

A great activity. After reading the reviews I had low expectations but I was surprised at how good it was. This is not a ski holiday this is an activity like bowling you do for a few hours and just have fun. I think people might be disappointed if they think they are visiting a Swiss ski run or something. It's great for learning and getting your skills up prior to a real trip. We went early Friday morning and had the place virtually to ourselves. Not sure I would get the day pass again because after 2pm it was very crowded with kids understandably. No water bubblers at a sporting venue I think is poor form, none of the vending machines were working and the staff didn't care about my concern or had any delegated responsibility to be able to fix it. My husband had better luck and a staff member went to their lunch room and got us a bottle. Overall impressed with facilities and ski cost (300 for a day). Well done!

snowtime. Didn't go but was able to view it through huge observation windows in Mall of the Emirates. a real winter wonderland, a ski slop, a huge ball inside of which you could roll down a snowy slope. All this and a temperature of 43 C .!outside

What an ICE. we visited Ski dubai , and my little kids ( 7 years & 4 years) had lots of fun inside Ski Dubai. also they loved the penguins show which takes about 15 min. also you can take a close photo with the penguin with extra cost.
Seeing is believing!. What an amazing idea, only Dubai could have thought of putting a ski slop with REAL snow in the middle of a shopping centre!

Prize for non-sustainability, yet a must see. I've heard many times of this attraction and got the chance to see it during a long wait in-between flights at DXB airport. I was with a colleague and we both had our jaws down while witnessing what any echology defender would consider an horror movie: people skiing in a desert area. In front of this scenario I felt like I was in front of the demonstration of the power of money, and the power of manhood to revert natural laws. So, a bit scary rather than wonderous and hilarious. My experience, of course.The ski area is IMMENSE, with pines, snow storm, women in chador and winter jackets playing snow balls with their children.I could hardly comment with my colleague, We both left without words, with a feeling that something is going wrong on this planet.For those who ski, I think you must try it. When you go home in Europe or anywhere else and tell your granda, she won't believe you. And probably she's right.
Emirates Mall Ski Dubai. Wow, snow in the middle of the desert. Cool air....:)

Snow Dome @ Emirates Mall. Sorry to say this was the one thing I was hugely disappointed with.From their advertising I took it that the snow park was for all the family to enjoy and that as we were none skiers we would be able to 'toboggan' - Not the case.The non-skiing section is only suitable for young children.If you want to see the top of the runs via the chair lift then you have to pay extra.Definitely NOT value for money if you're not skiing or snowboarding .....

Fun and food.. Very strange to experience snow when it's 40 degrees outside. Nice long piste and good snow to learn how to ski or have fun with your snowboard. I gave a friend instructions how to ski and he wanted to go back there the same day. Experienced snowboarders will have just a much fun (if not more) as in every indoor piste, of course nothing beats a real mountain.

Guaranteed perfect snow!. Ski Dubai is awesome, that's the only word that can sum it up!Get up in the morning, head to the beach or the pool, have a break from the sun for some lunch, more sun then once you've had enough, hop on the metro and get off at The Mall of the Emirates. Follow the signs for Ski Dubai (you can't miss it).The snow is perfect, the slope is long and varied, even with a bit of a black run! There is a chair lift to the middle or top and a beginners escalator at a seperate beginners area.The kit is top notch (carvers), the ski suits are warm, the only thing I'd recommend you take is proper ski gloves and ski socks, it is COLD!After your session head downstairs to Apres' for a drink and a tabasco and prawn pizza (delicious) and watch fellow skiers fly down the slopes.If you don't fancy a pizza, head to The Butcher Shop & Grill for the most amazing steak. Try the mixed cuts kebab for a chunk of every cut of mean, medium-rare of course!

enjoy snow in dubai!. consider the discovery experience if you do not know how to sky OR snowboard. if you are lucky enough.. not to know.. you will truly enjoy snow in dubai. it is pretty amazing, particularly in the summer. Other best thing, you do not need anything but gloves, everything else in included in the ticket. instructors are sweet and good.. lots of great maroccan guys! thanks!
Skiing in the Desert. Great escape from the heat and a cure for a hangover, for an indoor ski slope not bad at all good value for money too.

A place in Dubai that is a "must see". Lovely place that everyone must visit. The skiing experience is great and is real fun. However, if you want to enjoy the skiing, you have to buy the "Super pass" which makes the ticket price too expensive. Don't be afraid of the cold weather, it's not too cold inside.Enjoy it.
break from the heat. Bit of a novelty but fun to do for a couple of hours.

Great escape from the heat. im taking skiing and snowboarding lessons and its quiet good ! you'll be able to go up to the hill by yourself in no time , only 3 basic lessons each about 200 dhs and your ready (y) . the snowpark is a nice place to relax , i would suggest buying a warm cup of hot chocolate while your there . there aren't much games , only a slide and some little games for the kids . i actually got a bruise on my hand from the slide because the edges were dried up and way too ruff . other than that the experience was really nice !

Such fun and amazing penguin viewing. A good couple of hours fun in the snow park for kids up to 12ish would say. The penguin talk was great and we got really close to the lovely things. Only downside was the indifferent staff inside the park. Would go back.
Verbanet Team Visit Sky Dubai. Wow!! We went to Sky Dubai for our Verbanet Technologies corporate leisure out. We enjoyed lot.. Really great place to enjoy in hot dubai.
Good for a once off visit. Nice to see and experience at least once in a lifetime. No real need to return.
nice experience in summer. wow it was a nice experience to try it in summer , you will feel you are at the lebanese mountains during winter in lebanon . kids will love it so much

All HYPE. Dirty Ice & Snow, not impressed.
I must admit we had fun in the winter park.
Rode the ski lift and decided to not break a leg on the sheet of ice.
you will be delited. unique experience , you will like this exeprience . only need staff support to be more
Ski Dubai in Mall of Emirates. Great fun you do'nt get easily in many other countries.
Skiing in a warm country. This is just great fun for all the family. Ski, toboggan or just walk round in this place. Plenty of kit to use, staff are real friendly.
Wow. Amazing and such a clash of cultures! Such fun and great for kids and adults alike

Fun Fun Fun. Ski Dubai to me was one of the reasons I fell in live with Dubai. It is fun for everyone and it is good that they dont have an hourly time limit or many people would have had to leave unfulfilled. To enjoy this place to the maximum, you will need to stay inside a minimum of 2 hours especially if you've got kids who from my experience simply go crazy once they hit the snow. Go there with extra warm clothing if you are not from a cold climate area as the warm clothing they give at the entrance wouldnt really keep you warm enough if you are not used to the cold. Take a pair of extra socks too. YES! its that cold. The only snag is that it is a bit too expensive if you are going as a large family. We are a family of 6 and once an admission fee goes beyond 50 dirhams we begin to sweat.
Annother Marvel. Another impossible thing in the desert, an ice skiing resort. Even when temp outside is 50 Degree
Snow in Dubai. could you really expect to see a snow resort in Dubai?Situated in the Emirates shopping mall and a real must for kids makes a real change from the heat outside.

Freezing in Dubai. well this is our 3rd visit to Ski Dubai and to be honest we are non skiers so quite expensive as after 1hr we were frozen and ready to go for a bite to eat, however if you do ski, happy days it's well worth it, you will spend all day in here. They have a new feature now with real penguins which you pay extra to see, this didn't really sit well with me so we gave this a miss. Would definately recommend if you are into skiing.

It is what it is. As someone who has skiid in Europe and North America, if you are looking for a challenging mountain experience, this is not it. However, if you are looking for a fun afternoon to escape the heat Ski Dubai is cool. It truely is an amazing feat to have an indoor mountain in the middle of the desert. I would have liked to see them build it in an area where there is more oppurtunity to expand, however, it's pretty sweet regardless. It is a tad overpriced for my liking but it's fun for families as it has the penguins, snowtubing and skiing. Tip: Apres is a great place to catch a cocktail and watch people go flying down the hill if you aren't up for it :)

Snowing. What a great idea this country has. An indoor skiing park is something unique in a hot country and people like us are just woved by seeing these attractions. We came right after the desert safari and the place is just so perfect to escape from the summer.

Awesome but.... I really enjoyed Ski Dubai, this was my first ever time snowboarding so I was a little nervous on the big slopes. The snow seemed too frozen the day I went so it was more like ice and very slippery, meaning falling over was painful! Probably better for more experienced snowboarders.
amazing experince. this was an amazing experince its fun for all ages you cant ski down the slopes unless you have experience but there is plenty more too keep you busy.
Ski Dubai - Love at First Sight. I just love this place..........especially when you with your friends or family............
nice but touristic. As i love skiing, i can not say that i didn t like it. It was impressive but a bit too much
Fake Ice. Fun for first timers- and people who have no scope of seeing real snow, cos they are stuck in Dubai.. otherwise, you can feel the fakeness! Big boo!
Nice for beginners. Impresive slap . Good to learn to sky or for beginners surfers. Careful can be too cold. Avoid fridays and saturdays afternoons too crowed
Ski in the Desert. Feels like a real Skiing experience, enjoyable, easy, very well organized, feels safe.
Amazing!. You will forget that you are in the desert... Amazaing place, and very nice slope...
Fantastic for the children to learn!. Brilliant fun group lessons for children and they provide everything except gloves!
wonderfu. Isn't it so wonderful to have the chance to inside ski like being in geneva's mountain with a 45 deg. outdoor in the same time, you should see this
Give it a blast. When it's 40 above try out 3 below and hit the slopes

Amazing. I only watched the people ski however the height of some jumps, the speed of people racing down the slopes,was amazing, I could see my son and his family using this facility as they are mad ski's in Australia.

Commendable. Things that people can do in a mall and Ski Dubai is the classic example for that. Well the experience was fun no doubt but it ends too soon.There is only so much one can do and then you have to repeat.However I did like the fact the you can do Zorbing and cable car ride was fun.Good for one time fun.
ski. this is a fantastic place, when u are in such heat it was nice to get into there for a few hours, everything they have done makes it so real, a wonderful place to visit

Weird skiing in Dubai. 110 degrees plus outside, -3 inside. Perfect snow, get there early during the week and there's not many other skiiers about. It gets busier later in the day and Fri and Sat. Thoroughly enjoyed my 2 hours skiing with my eldest lad, and 2 hours is enough as it only takes about 7-10 mins per lift to the top and run back down.

Awsome Experience in desert. Good experience for all age group. i visited with my mother,wife and daughter ..all really enjoyed it..worth a go with back of your mind that actually you are in snow with outside is desert, Good experience worth every penny we paid.
Fantastic. Well worth the visit when you go to Dubai. Great family day out.

Fun lasts an hour. Ski Dubai was a welcome break from the heat and the mall. We had a fantastic time while there. The only reason it got four stars is that with only two trails that only take about 45 seconds to ride down each, you get a bit bored after an hour. So get the two hour package because you won't need more time. The hot chocolate in the cafe that is mid-mountain is really good.

Worth a visit. We've been to Dubai on vacation but never visited ski-dubai...this time it was on our to-do list esp becos we put up at the Pullmans mall of the emirates which is just about a 10 min walk form hotel to mall/ski dubai in AC comfort. it was fun getting dressed up in snow gear and we had to buy gloves for an extra fee. Once inside, the cold just kind of hits you until u sort of get used to it. We had fun in the park riding the tires and although we did not ski, we took the ride to the top of the slopes and back. Our tkt was valid for a hot chocolate which can be redeemed at the little house close to the entrance...really yum and welcome after feeling kind of frozen. We stayed about an hr and a half and if not skiing, this amt of time is more than sufficient.
Great to beat the heat!. fantastic instructors for the novice and great ski for the pros

Cool experience but 2 hours is more than enough.. I enjoyed Ski Dubai. I paid for a full day pass but found out that the 2 hour pass was really more than enough. There are only 2 runs and at full speed you get down in about 30 seconds. If you are going to Dubai and like to ski this is an opportunity worth doing, however don't spend much time or pay for a full day because after an hour or so it gets boring.
Amazing to see.... typically 'plastic Dubai' but it's an amazing feat to have snow and chairlifts inside when it's 47 degrees outside. Worth a visit for entertainment value.
Snow ski. My son and grand children had some lessons to start of at the end of which they were skiing from the top of the slopes. Was fun watching them from the outside.

An icy oasis in the desert. Ski Dubai is great fun while in Dubai. Of course, the skiing is not the point. The runs are easy but short, but the true joy is being in the snow in the desert! The whole process of entering the ski area with rented clothes, skis, boots, etc is very entertaining. Completely worth it.

Suprisingly Good Boarding. I am an avid snow boarder and enjoyed a few hours at Ski Dubai. Not to bad for an indoor resort! I would suggest bringing gloves though. They supply everything else you need including socks but your hands will get a bit chilly.

Great experience with the penguins, but extortionate photo prices. Meeting the penguins on the peng-friends experience was amazing! Such funny little creatures and so much fun to spend a bit of time with. Also an important educational aspect to the experience, as in one of fastest growing energy using cities in the world, there was an environmental message of saving energy and saving electricity to save the poles and the penguins. Possibly ironic in what was basically a giant freezer, but important all the same.The one down side, and the lasting impression, was the rip off in respect of photographs. You're told you cant take cameras in as the penguins can eat items such as camera size (including my DSLR - really??) but its okay because they take photographs. To buy a single photo was £20, to buy the CD-Rom/DVD of photographs you also had to buy various other size photos and a snow globe at about £100. No option to just buy the CD-Rom/DVD. Thing is, we'd have maybe paid £50 for the CD-rom/DVD but were no way paying £100 for the set. As it is, we only bought one photo at £20. Speaking to other people, they did a very similar thing, and I saw nobody at all buy the full package. Ski Dubai - bring down the prices and then people would spend more!

Beginner or Expert... Ski in the desert!. I've never skied in my life and loved my experience at Ski Dubai. I did the discovery beginner lesson which included all the gear needed and an hour lesson. I definately caught the ski bug... I love it!

ski school. It Was a great experience for my kids to learn skiing, it was the second time that my kids be there in the first time was discovery lesson and today was a lesson for new skills, they have spent afun time , highly recommend it to everyone.

Fun. It was fun but the snow park gets boring after a while. Great for one visit. Large families or a big group would always be better. Went only to the snow park , dont forget to take your own gloves from home as they are NOT provided.

-3 degrees. Ski dubai is an awesome experience, a fun place for kids & adults, the temperature is maintained at -3 degrees, after a point u start feeling very cold, keep sipping something hot from their in house cafe.
Indoor Skiing. This is so much bigger than you can even imagine. We did not skii but it was busy, an awe inspiring sight. Its quite spectacular, and right in the mall. 9th wonder of the world.?

What a Fun Place. Me and my friends visited Ski Dubai to visit the pengiuns in a 40 minute experience. Once your all wrapped up for the minus 6 temperatures!!! you get a brief history of the pengiuns staying at Ski Dubai and then the little fella's waddle though to play football with you and give you a hug. Sadly your unable to take your cameras in the experience but there is photographers on hand to take the pics but at an expensive rate!!! we didnt buy any of the pics as we thought we could have took better pictures ourselves and the package was for the same picture in 3 diferent sizes!!! only disappointing thing about the experience was the pictures as we dont have any of us with the lovely animals

Worth Visiting. I can't ski so whilst some friends went skiing I went tobagganing etc. I was worried if it would be worth mywhile but it was deffinately good fun and great to get seeing it inside. It is very authentic !

Snow in the desert. A great place to escape from the heat and play in the snow, on the toboggan run, or tire ride. The ski run is also good for beginners and intermediate skiers/ snowboarders - lessons are very professional and appropriate for different levels. It is freezing in there - two hours was my maximum time limit.
Fun in the cold.. Always fun...........to do and watch............a good way to get some exercise.

Not much of a ski experience. Coming from a country with real skiing, we thought we would try skiing in the desert. After 4 runs in Ski Dubai we were done! The supposed black diamond run was more like a bunny slope and the chair lift was too slow to make the experience fun. The only good part was that it was so cold there that I was able to cool off from the intense Dubai heat. The snow park was mainly for the small children and not adults. The gift shop was sadly lacking in Ski Dubai souvenirs so that too was a bust.

Great mornings activity.. Brilliant, such good fun. It's not the alps and it could never be but for what it is which is a ski slope in a shopping centre in Arabia it's great. The slope is long enough for one to get to a good speed. A tip.... Keep away from the crazies who think that they don't need lessons. Get there early people don't arrive until later so the earlier you get there the quieter the slpoes are.

Loads of fun!. Just to escape the horrendous heat...was enough of a treat. A not to miss outing that my husband a I thoroughly enjoyed. we behaved like kids and went tobogganing down the slopes and even tried the Zorb ball. Had hot chocolate on the slopes..yum! Didn't attempt the skiing, but still thoroughly enjoined our morning in the snow!!!

Awesome. Skiing in Dubai at Ski Dubai is so awesome, when you get in to the slopes you feel like you are in the mountains and just like real snow and cold. I would highly recommend making a stop at Ski Dubai for the skiing and to visit the penguins, you can pet them which is awesome.

Most amazing indoor Ski experience. I was blown away at how snow could be created so close to the real thing. It was about 2 degrees and below in there.We were given an outfit,shoes, pair of warm socks and gloves and ready to go. We did most of the activities within the place and had to go for a quick cup of the best Hot chocolate ever at the Avalanche cafe. We sat under heaters, and I couldn't believe that just outsied the building it was 40 degrees and here we are sitting under heaters to warm up.You have to go to Mall of the Emirates and experience skiing indoors.

freezing in 45c!!! burrrr!!. The ski resort has 2 ski slopes and about 5 different versions of riding down an ice slope - on a type, in a snow ball, on a taboggan, lying down.... great fun!! the ski lift ride is short and unexciting. The penguins are utterly charming - do plan to visit when they are out! we toook the super saver which entitled us to limitless rides through out the day, and a discount on the ski lessons too. An great way to spend half a day
OMG I never thought they would do something like this. Its just a place worth to visit and play a lot of games inside, with dragon crystal body art and designs I mostly like
Great idea, however too crowded for my taste. This attraction is so great that the only thing ruining my experience was the number of visitors.

Good Value For Money. This is a very good facility that I have visited several times since being in Dubai. For the accomplished skier you may be board after an hour but for anyone wanting a quiet, relatively wide slope with good snow to practice on, this is just the ticket. I love they way they provide all the kit except gloves and hat in the price. Faults are few; they could do with opening the drag lift before 1200 as the chair lift is terribly slow and wastes too much time (or plan on skiing after 12 but it does become busier at weekends). Give the skiers the priority on the chair lifts over those in there for the ride only, can be annoying waiting while the non-skiers faff around trying to get on/off the chair lift. Otherwise great value especially if you use your 2 for Entertainer vouchers (3 in each issue).
Truly Amazing. Its truly amazing thats also in the middle of the city and on this climate really a great place to chill out

Amazing fun place. Amazing place for both adults and kids . You can go for ski lessons or better still go for snowboarding , tobogganing , zorbing etc . They also have a cable car ride . Had a really good time with the kids .
Bizarre but so much fun. It is like a magical wonderland. So much fun and feels so weird skiing in Dubai but tIt was so much fun

ski dubai. In this steaming hot Dubai, ski dubai is worth place to visit. Its located inside Mall of emirates. The mall is easilly acceable by metro as its train metro stops directly inside the mall. they provide ski lessons also. For Kids they have some nice rides which keeps them busy all the time. prices are different depeding upon your choice for cable car, ski lessons and full rides. Winter clothes & shoes are included in the ticket prices.

Very cold.... Im not a big snow/ ski fan..my husband and child enjoyed a lot tabaggoning and throwing snow balls. For complete 360 view do climb the top tower .and carry extra stoles ,caps,gloves..if like me u are not used to extreme colds.

What a sad use of energy. For folks who live where there is snow this is not much for a ski hill and you probably will be like me wondering how much energy is being used to keep it so cold in the mall when it's 40 degrees outside. It looks dirty and dark inside ... not my idea of a fun place to ski but I still had to see it for myself.

Skiing in Dubai?!?. It couldn't be more surreal, standing in the middle of the desert, putting on thermals in a shopping mall and then stepping onto a ski slope where it was -3! It was great fun and more of a novelty as once you've done a few runs it can get a little boring, but worth it at least to say you've been skiing on real snow in the desert!
We loved it!. We are in our 40's but went in for the experience and LOVED it! We didn't bother with the skiing, but went on the ski-lift, tobogganing, and Zorb ball.... so much fun - just do it!

P-P-P Penguins. We did the penguin encounter at Ski Dubai on a friday afternoon, having pre-booked the time slot a couple of days earlier at the penguin encounter desk outside ski dubai a few days earlier. The entrance fee is pretty steep at 175Dhs a head (no discount for children). This includes ski suits, gloves, socks and boots, and for the kids only, helmets. I was worried about how to get my elderly mother into a ski suit but she was able to use the floor length button down jackets which fit directly over her clothes. There was an introductory chat about the penguins but the 2 others who joined my family of 6 were not interested and pushed the guide to rush through this. Once in the enclosure two penguins were brought in by the trainers and one by one we knelt down to pat them. All the while two photographers snapping away taking photos of us. The trainers were extremely knowledgeable and happy to answer any and all questions that we had. After the 40 minute slot ended we had all had a turn and the kids were starting to feel cold (you take your gloves off to touch the penguins). You are not allowed to take your own camera into the enclosure. If that is because multiple flashes might frighten the penguins, then I have some sympathy, but the price of the professional photos is too much. For the high entrance fee I would expect a photo to be included. Otherwise, it was a much loved experience for my group (with an age range of 4 to 73).

Impressive. This place sure did impress, considering it is built in the Mall of the Emirates. If you are not a Ski or Snowboarding expert, this is not the place to learn as the slopes are rather scary for a novice. However you can participate in Toboganning, Chair Lift or Tubing, which is fun. Overall it is pretty expensive to visit just to Toboggan or Tube and you would only need about 1hr here with little ones. If you don't wish to pay to visit, you can see right into Ski Dubai from the Mall of The Emirates, so no need to pay to go inside if you just want to check it out.

Must see if not do. Well, I would have never believed that skiing in Dubai is possible. I was proven wrong! Not only possible, it can be done in the Shopping Mall! The Mall of Emirates is considered to be an old mall (?!) and has significantly less visitors than the Dubai Mall (good selection of high street shops and Jewellery stores). It's advantage is that it can be reached by Metro and it has an enormous ski slope. The ski gear hire is included in the price and, if you like fun in the snow, it could be a great activity. Ski lifts, nursery and high slope together with instructors makes a pretty good package. The near by Kempinsky Hotel sells rooms with a 'Ski Slope' view. Good attraction if you like to ski.

Private class & Penguin tour. I enjoyed my sking class and mostly my tour with the penguins. As atip wear strecth clothes because you will wear a uniform that iam sure many wore before you , you can buy gloves and a hat from the shop near the ski or bring it with you before hand as you will need it. What i didnt like was the overpirced photos of the penquin tour. but overall it was good.
Great for what it is. But if you can ski it's not worth the effort, if you're learning then I imagine it's brilliant, however the novelty of skiing indoors wears off exceptionally quickly

Totally unique!. Imagine skiing in sub-zero temperatures when its over 40C/100F outside! Keeping in mind the fact that this is a ski slope inside a mall in the middle of the desert, its pretty impressive and unique! The skiing obviously does not compare to a real mountain, but is still worthwhile. Prices are decent, they provide most of the gear, and the staff is pretty helpful. All said, very enjoyable!
Not something expected next to a Mall. What a facinating spectacle and experience. Something out of the ordinary
Interesting project. Take a look. It´s worth the visit. In the Emirates Mall
ski dubai a must. excellent value and good fun 1 hour is enough equipment and clothing was adequate.
Great fun skiing.... Allow yourself a few hours to ski in the desert! The hill is a good run and it is a lot of fun.
Just ok. The ski Dubai was ok. It didn't have much to do and was crowded. I could have done without it. Just a little note, IT WAS VERY COLD!
ok for skiers. we were excited to visit this but in the end didnt get past the window view- not enough snow just for casual people want to enjoy the snow, but rather just made for skiiers

Crazy must try if you are in Dubai. Yes, it is just a bunny hill; but seriously, skiing inside you've got to do just to say that you did it. Just like the manmade snow in the eastern U.S. And they even have a mid-slope cafe for a hot chocolate. You can rent everything, even your clothing down to the socks!
Skiing inside a Mall?. amazing and only the people from Dubai can accomplish something like this

creazy !!!. The feeling is incredible , otside was 38 inside - 4
Of course for skining point of view it is very weak, but the expirience is recomandable

Nice to feel just like home....in Dubai. A must do if you are a skier nice to feel cold (just like home) also had food and drink in the bar next to the ski centre an alpine type bar worth a visit.
No negatives on this place
My daughter's Loved it. I took my daughters there and they had a blast. While its 115 outside its 30 here, that took a bit getting use to. If you ski then its a place you have to ge and try.
Nice experience. Nice experience in the emirates mall. cool temperatures in the hot weather!

Who would have thought fake skiing could be so good. i came here totally negative but had walked around the mal far to much and wanted some fun. I was seriously suprised at the quality of the run for a shopping centre in the middle of a dessert. Loved the log fire too lol. I would go again if I was back in Dubai

Great Fun. Was unable to go skiing as a lesson is required and sadly did not allow enough time for this. However still enjoyed the Package. Kids thought it great. Remember the loudest person in the crowd gets to pat the Penguins!

No matter how warm is dubai - this place rocks. No matter how warm is dubai - this place rocks
the tempreature inside is around -5 so its good to take some closthes

Skiing... In Gulf?!!!. Can u imagine Ice in the middle of 40*degree?!
Go with ur T-shirt, get ur eskimo Coat n skiiiii !

awesome. At 53 years old i tried snowboarding for the first time with a taster lesson here, i was terrified at first but they were brilliant and had me snowboarding down alone in no time. the whole place was amazing, it just has to be experienced. they have lots of different activities for total novices to those more experienced, children and adults. you can even pet penguins!

skiing on snow in the desert. How freaking cool is that? Just the fact that they built a real snow ski slope in the middle of the desert is amazing, but if that's not enough, you can jump into these huge plastic balls and act like a snowball. If that's not enough for you, and you've experienced everything else Dubai has to offer, then your expectations are just way too high.
A novelty. This is one of those things that you do only to be able to say that you did it. It is really pretty cool, but it gets boring after a few runs.

Just an indoor attraction. To me it's just another something to attract visitors. When you are there it's a lot smaller than you see in all the advertisements. Like a lot of what's been set up in the Emirate, all this has robbed Dubai of its original magic. Most of the man made attractions do nothing for me. However like Las Vegas, everyone should visit Dubai atleast once and see for themselves!

St Moritz Restaurant in front of ski Dubai - Good food, fun view. If you are a Monty Python fan , require a "And now for something completely different" food-wise, St Moritz is for you.Obviously, they are known for overlooking the Ski Dubai, which is very entertaining for kids to look at the skiers go by. So in terms of "VIEW" it sort of does tick a box.As far as the FOOD is concerned, you could go for a fondue, or to be more conservative, I advise you to go for their grilled meat which is good (Angus) and generous (one T bone for two is way enough with almost 600g (!?)SERVICE, is standard in Dubai i.e. nice people but kind of slow. Snow park. bit costly but worth a visit of snow in the desert thing, great quality staff, good chill, plenty of things for kids to do.
I didnt try this but watched. you actually ski down slopes with PENGUINS! it was soo cute!!!!!!!!!!
The Kids Loved It. Coming from a tropical island, my kids were longing to see snow. They simply loved it. Impressive piece of engineering and technology. Bravo.

Penguins!. I love going to Ski Dubai. I also love the fact that I can snowboard "in the heat" meaning in summer. A worthy place to visit. Ski Dubai now have REAL penguins that anyone can interact with (touch, play) and they are amazing!
Amazing. Our twins totally loved this, if you go do pay extra for the penguin experience it's well worth it you spend 45 minutes in a private area helping the trainers touching and interacting

Very poor for young children. My 6 year old and 7 year old had beginner 'discovery' lessons. We paid for 90 minute lessons that ended after 50 minutes. In that time the kids went down the very short nursery slope just TWO times with the instructor shouting at them aggressively; they spent the rest of the time hanging around bored. Very dissappointing. Very badly organised.

Fun to ski here for an experience. This was the first thing we did when we arrived in Dubai. We were glad we did it, but we probably wouldn't do it again. It's just the fact that all this has been built and is maintained in a desert climate that is the amazing thing about it. But it basically amounts to an activity that the (bigger) kids can do while the mothers are shopping, or after school, etc., which was plainly evident when we were in the locker room below. However we were in good company also because there were a couple of other people like us who were obviously just trying it out for an experience. Go do it and enjoy, or just sit in one of the cafes adjoining the slope and watch the other people skiing. Tip: You'll get a jacket and pants to wear, but make sure you wear everything you own under it, because it is COLD. (This from an avid skier!)
Great. It felt strange to be skiing in Dubai but we really enjoyed it here. I had a lesson of a lovely girl whilst I was there and it was just nice to cool down! Great.

definitely worth a visit. snow in the middle of the desert the experience is awesome and both kids and adults alike will treasure the experience if only skiing was easy on the whole this is a must see attraction

To see it, not to ski it. It you are a good skier you'll be bored in an hour, but nevermind, it is so so fun, especially because there is around 30-40 degrees difference in temperature, and after skiing you can go sunbathing at the beach.Do not miss this attraction even if you don't ski coz there is a lot of fun inside.You wont be able to take your camera inside hecause the jackets have no pockets (mobile phones could fit in the ski-pass pocket).
Snow in Dubai. Not badly priced for spending a few hours out of the Dubai heat
Ouch. £75/$100 for 5 of us to take the chair lift to the top and have a coffee in the bar !
Good To Experiance Once. Why Not experiance once,and if u liked it u may go again especially during summer

Good fun, if not a little costly (complicated cost structure). My family consisting of 2 adults and 2 children visited Ski Dubai and had a great time there. The adults went for 2 hours of skiing on the slopes while my children were attending the discovery ski class. After that, we had lunch at the cafe just outside of Ski Dubai, before venturing to the ski park. It was pretty complicated paying for entry. Everything is calculated separately. So it's 2 ski slope access, 2 discovery lessons and 4 ski park entry tickets. I thought it would have been nice if they could have a package price for families...even if it's not discounted, it much easier to know at one glance the cost? We also wanted to have lunch at Avalanche cafe, but because the children has no access to the ski lifts (while we did), we couldn't visit the cafe for lunch. I thought it would make biz sense for them, if say, adults can bring their children along for lunch up there on mid slope?Very good fun overall. My children (3.5 and 6) really enjoyed themselves, though I did get a little bored after going down the slope after 3 times. :p Maybe it's just me. But the snow park with the kids was a lot of fun for us.
great fun. wonderful especially for kids and what a joy in the middle of all that desert weather :)
Real snow in a Mall. IT's surreal to see real snow with a slope inside a mall.

A fun activity for the intermediate skiier. I've been to Ski Dubai 3 times. It's a fun thing to do if you have 2-3 hours to spare. Allow 1hr for paying, obtaining the gear and getting into it and out of it afterwards. I had a 2 hour pass for the skiing itself.You must be able to ski to be allowed to use the slopes, unless you sign up for a beginners lesson. The slopes may not be very challenging for very good skiers. On the lower slope, it took 6-7 minutes to go up on the chair lift and ski down. For the upper slope, a "round trip" took 10-11 minutes.I have learned to wear warm clothes under the jacket they give you, as well as warm gloves and hat. Otherwise, you will start to feel the cold quickly and not enjoy the experience so much. Also, do ensure your equipment fits and works perfectly. Know your European shoe size (i.e. size 38).There are many attendees, particularly monitoring the chair lift and very focussed on safety. As a woman there by herself, I always feel safe and secure - although not always when I'm whizzing down the slope!!
Real fun. I was suspicious for 7 months to go....then discovered what i missed !!!It was real fun :)And ere is even Pinguis ! For all ages, its a niiiice outing

in emirates mall must see and do. Wow it's amazing for kids you will have great fun it's based in emirates mall..

Dress warm!. I had to see this attraction. I was dressed in shorts and sandals. Fortunately they provide (at a small price) a jacket and boots. With camera in hand, I rode the chair lift up and back. It was a lot of fun, if a bit cold.

freezing in the desert. Nice slick no hassle pick up of tickets, ski clothing and ski equipment. Great fun. Definitely worth a visit.. Oddly enough, we had to travel from Toronto, Canada to Dubai to get to play in the snow! Lockers are available and strollers can be checked in at security.

Overrated. Coming from Sweden it is of course not “fantastic” to see snow but one of those surreal things that is great to tick-off in life…skiing on an indoor slope! BE prepared. Thou they give you the thermal clothing,do wear a layer of wollens underneath, after 45 min we felt we were getting frostbite on fingers.Unless u plan to do ski lessons or sking or are adventourour on tabagging,do take the regular pass

Surreal. What an odd experience this was. Absolutely packed dressing area, everyone shoe-horning themselves into the supplied blue and red anoraks and trousers, so we all looked like members of some strange Nerd cult, and lots and lots of local people. When 'checking in' I heard an American voice asking the reception for a map of the ski runs. There is of course only one at this astonishing indoor snow dome. Things change when you finally battle your way through the crowds with your rental skis. Not many local people can ski, they tend to go round and round on the chairlift, or have a go on the small 'fun' rides; snow tubes, etc. So the slope is pretty much empty. It's a fun experience, not at all difficult for even novice skiiers like myself. Top to bottom takes about 2 or 3 mins. But it's pretty high with a 45 degree kink in the slope half way down (where there is also a ski chalet serving hot drinks, even more surreal). It was quite a hoot, but you do get a bit bored after your 5th or so run. Then you can do what i did, retire to the nearby bar which overlooks the slope from the shopping centre and sip a hot gluh wine. Like I say, surreal but fun to experience... once.

Skiing in the desert. My kids couldn't wait to try the indoor snow park. It isn't as good as a real ski resort, but it's certainly a unique experience. You can ski, snowboard, or just play in the snowpark with sleds, etc. It was fun to watch local kids who had never seen snow before and event adults who had to be taught how to make a snowball!
its just ok. you can find batter then this in other part of the world, but penguin play is nice . you must see and enjoy.
Skiing in the desert. How imaging to ski in the desert. Outside 50 ºC and inside skiing, bizard and amazing

Alps in the desert. This is truly an amazing venture - skiing inside a mall inside a desert city. Its freezing inside and you are well advised to buy or rent the cold weather gear. During my visit there were couple of 'expert' skiers but I gave that up and did the ski chair ride . Any longer and I would have felt I was in Switzerland . This is truly a great attraction and well worth your visit .

So fun!. I have to say i wasn't too excited about this, an indoor human made skii mountain? Well, it was an amazing experience...it really is fun for everybody....a few tips...The gloves they give you get wet so easily and you freeze inside (-2 degrees). So if you are planning to spend a lot of time there i recommend buying better ones there at the store. It is a little confusing buying tickets so basically if you are new to this and never skii before then the super pass is the basic one,includes all the snow park activities at the bottom of the mountain where kids have so much fun, a big slide from the middle of the mountain (very bumpy for little ones but fun for adults) and the balls where you can junp inside and roll down....if you want to skii then add a class, they have lots of group classes for all ages at different times. My kids took the 1 our snowboard class and they loved it!If you take the lift to the middle of the mountain they have a very tiny cafe where you can warm up and drink a coffee inside or sit outside looking down the mountain, it is fun...they also have bathrooms there.

Great fun. Standing in a massive freezer is an experience in itself. This place is absolutely amazing. Checkin and equipment collection is very quick and efficient if you get there early enough. In the afternoon, it gets a bit crowded and things slow down a lot. With super passes, you get free gloves on top of all the equipment which was a nice touch. Lockers were readily available, spacious and easy to locate and use.Staff were all helpful in giving directions, etc.We got super passes for the snow park, and then booked a discovery snowboard lesson (already knowing how to ski, we thought we'd try something new.)First of all, the snow park:The snow park has a bunch of attractions, mostly intended for kids, but quite fun for teens and adults too, especially the mountain thriller. We arrived before opening time and were the very first ones to get in. All the staff were very friendly, showing us around personally and offering to take pictures of us (with our own cameras, not that DigiPhoto tourist trap). They also brought tubes for us for the mountain thriller and the tobogganing. We did the attractions near the entrance such as the snow ball, bobsledding, etc. then headed up on the ski lift for the mountain thriller. We were told that it wasnt open yet as they were doing some final security checks on it, so we did the whole panoramic loop on the ski lift. We then went on the mountain thriller on double tubes, and got stuck a few times because the grids they use for brakes weren't placed properly. Staff rushed towards us to help, and quickly fixed the issue. Overall, the snowpark is great fun but will get a bit boring after a couple hours if you're not a kid.After a quick lunch at the St Moritz cafe, we went for the discovery snowboard lessons. The instructor came off as quite rude and aggressive, but ended up warming up and being really friendly and quite chatty. Despite being in a quite large group, he managed to keep everyone under control and dedicated some time for each person, especially if they were struggling. It was really fun and well worth the 75 aed (50% off per person since we all had snow pass and penguin passes.)Finally, meeting the penguins is something you cannot miss. We went at 12pm as a group of 4 (3 of us + 1 other person), so we essentially got an exclusive tour (worth 500 aed pp) for a fraction of the price. We got a lotOf time and pictures taken with the penguins. The trainers are very friendly and give clear instructions as to what can be done with the animals. Hugging a penguin is an absolutely unforgettable experience. They are lovely animals and being around them is a true pleasure. One bad thing about the penguin experience is that no phones or cameras are allowed, because they claim that if a penguin can eat a large fish, they can also eat phones, but in reality it's to force you into buying a photo package from DigiPhoto (starting at 100 AED per picture!!!) but for this kind of experience, you cannot really complain as it is a once in a lifetime kind of thing, of which memories should be made permanent.Overall, if you're looking for a fun filled day and escaping Dubai's searing heat for a while, you will love SkiDubai. If you're in Dubai, add SkiDXB to your must do list!

Over-rated and very pricey. As a traveller from Europe, this is an overrated park. If you have been to any cold regions and seen snow, it is not really anything special. Also note, you cannot ski, unless you are an accomplished skier (this is assessed at the park). Ski lessons usually take a few days and are very expensive.
Outlandish. Ski Dubai is dynamic and electrifying experience of life that is experience you won't forget in life. Bet on it.
Great fun, and very surreal. Only in Dubai, this is a great indoor ski slope for those who miss the winter slopes. Good children's activities and a long enough slope to brush up on rusty skills.

Such a crazy idea that you just have to do it.. This place isn't by any stretch of the imagination great skiing. It's man made snow, indoors, on a small hill. But it is such a crazy idea that you just have to do it, even if it is just to say that you skied in a desert.The rental/ski price includes pretty much everything you need -- jacket, pants, skis, boots, and socks. You need to supply your own hat (if desired) and gloves. The inside temperature is -1c. It doesn't feel cold at first with shorts and a t-shirt under the supplied outwear, but the cold feeling builds and you do eventually feel chilly. If you are the type to feel the cold, I'd recommend a long sleeve shirt under the jacket. Indoors it is as crazy as you would expect from Dubai. There is a chair lift, snow, and a mid mountain chalet to stop for a drink. The chair lift is slow. If you want to get up the hill a bit faster, there is a button tow lift on the far left. It isn't a beginner lift as it does slow and then jerk you a bit forward. You need to be able to control your skis or board on the ride. As others have said, the ski time down the "mountain" is about 30 seconds. It is just a step up from a bunny hill. If you are an experienced skier, the mountain won't hold your attention for more than an hour or two, but, really, it is all about the experience anyway.It seemed like most of the locals stayed in the snow park and just rode the chair lift for the experience. So while the place was crowded, the mountain wasn't overly crowded. I'm sure the show chair lift helps crowd control on the mountain. Our family of 5 (2 adults, 3 kids aged 13, 11, and 8) had a fabulous time. We went at night after a day at the beach/pool. Ski Dubai stayed open until midnight the night we went (Saturday) so there was no need to cut into our day of fun in the sun.

Snow in the dessert. Attraction is fairly small area. A good experience for those who have not seen snow or feel the winter weather in the northern hemisphere. More suitable for the young and not for the senior citizen.

Fun for the experience. We are occasional skiers and hadnt had a chance to ski this hwole winter in the US, so we thought it would be fun to ski while in Dubai. It is worth the experience and not too expensive. Great how they give you the pants, jackets and all equipment. We just brought gloves and glad we did. 2 hours is plenty of time. the other parts of the park seem better for younger children so we only went skiing.
Amazing. Outside the tepmerature is almost 40 degrees and inside the mall you can go skiing and snowboarding , includes all equipment needed ...A wonderful experience .... Well worth a visit ...
It does make sense..... sort of. Proper snow - without the flights? Fun skiing, and ideal for children and beginners to get the hang of things

Be sure to get them - the snow is real and the cold creeps up on you.My daughter and I skied for about 90 minutes, getting in about 15 runs. The snow is nice. There are a couple ways down. It was a super fun thing to do.

first hyped - now below average. in it´s need for new firsts Dubai´s shopping centers do nearly everything to get you into their property. the competition is high and the winner for the moment is the mallow the emirates.
