Much better than I expected. This is a must do if you are visiting. I mean come on! The least we could do is stop by.We are not skiers, but thought "ahh.. lets just go ahead and waste the money on a cheesy tourist attraction". Surprisingly we were wrong. A very nice experience for the money. Great design and crowd control. We visited after having brunch at Burj al Arab, which is a short distance away and a Cheap taxi ride. Friday morning, Mall was bustling but not packed /crowded. We were able to walk up and buy tickets after only a 2-5min wait in line. We have waited much longer at many other american places. We did not do the skiing, because the next ski lesson was an hour later and we didnt want to miss our desert safari. Chose instead the Fun park pass- You can tube, sled, ride the chair lift and roll down the hill in giant plastic ball, all day for 57 dollars. Even got a chance to see the penguins from afar as group did their personal penguin encounter. Why must you do this? This place is HUGE... and it is contained within a mall! I mean really! I thought it would be this one little old ski slope and some finely crushed ice and long lines of people and crowds hovering around it. NOO! It is more like a mini-snow-theme park with A huge ski slope ....within a mall - just the ridiculousness of it all.. YOU MUST DO IT. and this is not even the largest mall in the world! You MUST ride the ski lift to appreciate the magnitude because it turns 45 degrees around a corner. This does not included a snow cave/maze with ice sculpture, a mini-track to sled, a mini hill to go tubing down.The size of the ski park which you can admire from inside the mall, without paying money to go in - does not even include the assoicated facilities - The large area where there are multiple lines to get your snow pants, jacket, boots. The somewhat thin-fleecelike gloves are obtained from the nearby ski shop. Can you get warmer, thicker more weather appropriate gloves to use in the -3 C temps?... Yes. But come on! if you really want expert gear, and top of the line conditions- you would not be in dubai, you would be at Lake Tahoe. Besides they are embroidered with "SKI Dubai: you get to keep them and they make excellent souvenirs! We had a blast! If you are scared to take pictures with your camera ( dropping it in snow/damage etc) or too busy having fun, dont worry they have photographers running around taking your pictures throughout the park. They will hand you bracelets with the code on them to recover your pics for a fee when you are done. DO THIS! It sounds pricey BUT there is an option for you to combine ALL the pics they take of you on one CD...... No matter how many there are. This is a great deal. Wish we would have known this, we would have taken more pictures. Very well organized, wasnt crowded. no long waits. This was probably one of my best theme park experiences ever. Seriously. We were able to walk up purchase tickets, ride/view all of the experiences at least once in less than 1hr and half on a Friday afternoon (12-130pm). Of course you can spend all day here if you like, but I think 2hrs was plenty of time for young adult tourist couple. I dare you to try that at Disney and Six Flags. Amazing! So glad we did it!Tip: Ladies try to get a larger size snowboot and wear your provided socks with your ballet flats inside the snow boots for a nice snug/sturdy fit. I wore my snow suit over my sundress and felt perfectly fine! Dont worry about dressing for snow! Come in your summer attire and put the thick snow attire over it and walk out for some sledding- Ha! It will add to the ridiculous feeling of it all!Bring a durable/water/snowproof water bottle holder that you can strap along you underneath your snow suit. You will be active, there is water available inthe vending machines, and lockers are included with you fee. But you will want to keep your water with you- This place is too big to be running out to your locker everytime you want to take a sip.Lots of fun!

Peoples going for just an hour may not benefit as they charge the same price for a day as compared to an hour. So free off some time and spend quality moments here. Overall, definitely a must visit.

A trip to the snow without all the hassles and no worries about sunburns.. I gave it 5 stars because this was a lot easier then driving several hours to a ski resort and lugging equipment around and dealing with the cold. And 2 hours was enough time. I think this is a great opportunity for first time skiers or snowboarders, to see if they like the sport. Also, great to take the family to experience snow with the other activities. Located in the Mall of the Emirates. Our taxi driver dropped us off at the Kempinski Hotel because this was the closest to Ski Dubai. This is a drop off area only. (You need to go between Harvey Nichols and Debenhams to pick up a taxi. We had to queue up, but it went quickly. There is one other drop off/pick up at the other end of the Mall). Walk straight back, the slope is to the right.On the right you pass the giant windows. If you go with non-snow people they can watch from here or in 1 of the 2 restaurants that look into the snow area. There are a few steps, and a ramp for wheelchair and strollers. On the left you stand in line to purchase a ticket. I paid 180 AED, $49 USD, for 2 hours to ski, plus 20 AED deposit fee - for what I’m not sure. I used a credit card and they charged 200 AED. You'll actually lose money from the exchange rate, extra charges. So you don’t really get 20 AED back. Suggest you pay in AED. Remember to return the Key Card, which is your ticket, to get your 20 AED back at the deposit machine.I was told it was very crowded on weekends. So plan wisely.To save time, if touring with others, have them stand in the ski clothes/boots queue, while you buy the tickets. Find a queue with as few children as possible. They don’t move as fast as adults. You will get a ski jacket, pants and socks (good thickness). You try on 1 boot here to see if it fits. I'm 5 '3 and took a M in the jacket and pants. It was a bit big. There is velcro at the wrist and the waist. Take care with delicate fabric. The jacket only has snaps, no zipper in front. Remember to bring your own hat and gloves. There is a ski store between the ticket counter and the equipment dispensing area. Put the Key Card in the zipper in the left arm - leave it there until you change clothes. Three are no other pockets in either piece. They also distribute full-length winter coats - for those just walking around the snow. Then proceed to the next counter to get your skis. (You may want to change first so you are not burdened with the skis. Or, have one person change, one person stand in the ski queue, then switch, to save time).I didn't see a changing room, nor did I actively look for one. I went into the handicap bathroom to change out of my skirt. I just had a light shirt on, and I stayed warm in my jacket. There is a nominal non-refundable locker fee.The staff told me the temperature was -4C/24.8F.Once you're ready to go to the slope, you pass on the left, the gates, under the changing screen: Slope Here. Put the Key Card up to the gate to enter. You walk to the escalator. I had the employee carry my skis on the escalator as I was not comfortable. At the top you select your ski pole size. Walk out the doors and you’re on the slope. Take a picture of you and the slope. Ski to the chair lift. Very ingenious - you move your left arm near the sensor and the turnstile booth keeps track of your time: it countdowns the minutes and displays the time. Your time, 2 hours, STARTS from this point. The chairlift seats 4 people. You must pull down the safety bar. It interchanges between skiers and walkers. The staff said they slowed it because of the walkers. The walkers stay on for the round trip or can get off at the Chalet. It’s around 8 minutes to get to the top of the slope. So it can go quicker if they change the speed.Midway is a chalet to have some drinks. You can get off the chairlift here to ski down or stay on and take it to the top. Along the side of the building, there is a poma lift, a disk attached to a bar, attached to a pulley. To activate it, the top of the pole must pull against the vertical rod to release it. Usually, there is someone to help. This will pull you up to the top of the slope in a fraction of the time of the chairlift. The track is not smooth. It stops and goes. When it starts again, it YANKS you. I was fine, but men, I worry about your future children. I didn’t hear any men yell, so I guess it's safe, but you have been warned! From the start of this area. you can look over the side. This is were they bring out the penguins. I think, every two hours. Check the time on the boards in the ticket purchasing area screens.Ski slope: One section is Experts only, but this would be an Intermediate on a Lake Tahoe resort. There were no moguls. There is a ski jump under the chalet and a staff member is stationed there. On the other side of the slope there are metal things that you can jump onto and slide on. I presume for snowboarders. Against the wall you can take the donut sleds and slide down a snow slide. There is staff.Other activities: There are giant clear balls you go inside and you roll down the hill, there are 2 tube/slides., penguin parade. and the website said there is a snow cavern - which I just learned of while writing this. I will assume if walkers can come into the ski area, perhaps it’s possible to walk into thier area, to see the penguins and the snow cavern.You can also buy ski and snowboarding lessons.When your time is up. Exit the slope. There is a machine to warm up your glasses to de-fog them. Return your poles. Head down the escalator, drop off your skis on the shelves. Exit the turnstiles. Return boots to shelves. Take off jackets/pants and REMEMBER TO TAKE THE KEY CARD out of the sleeve. Go out towards the ticket counter and put Key Card into the machine and get your 20 AED back.http://www.skidxb.com/

Skiing. In a Mall. Go for the Experience.. I siphoned a couple of hours out of my busy conference schedule to get to Ski Dubai. I had to go there, if just for the bragging rights.Checking in was pretty easy. After lolling in a slow line to pay for a two-hour ticket ($60 or so, including clothing and locker), I moved on to collect my boots, socks, ski pants, and jacket. From there I went into the locker room and changed, before getting my skis. I didn't bother with gloves or hat since I figured it couldn't be that cold.I then went up an escalator where I picked up my ski poles. Then it was just a few steps through a glass door into a winter wonderland.Right in front of you is a chairlift, and behind that is a J bar that tows skiers up the hill. You place the access card you are given into the upper left sleeve of your coat so that you can open the turnstile that allows access to the lifts. The card reader is on the left, right below shoulder level.For the first couple of runs, I took the chairlift. There's a stop midway, about 100 vertical feet up, and then one at the top. After you get off, you can turn right and go down the moderate/easy hill or turn left and go down the "black diamond" hill.In no sense was the left-side hill black diamond, especially since a ski instructor was teaching kids how to parallel ski on the hill. But it was steeper than the other one, and it had two sets of slalom poles to ski through. Lower down there is a pretty big jump, but it was closed off.There were never more than 2 or three skiers/snowboarders around me at any time--I was there on a Tuesday from 5:30 pm to 7 pm, but I'd say most skiers were Westerners, either travelers or expats.Word of warning if you use the J bar. The sign says "Expert Skiers Only," which I scoffed at. I'm far from an expert skier, but it didn't look too hard. The first trip up, the guy in front of me fell off, and his ski went sliding between my legs. The next time up, I almost fell off at a very steep section of the trail. The third time was the charm, so to speak. At the base of the very steep section, the lift stopped for a few minutes. As I was adjusting my ski tips, not paying much attention, the lift yanked me upward powerfully, pulling me out of one of my skis. I held onto the bar with one hand while retrieving my ski with the other. But I fell off balance to my left side, close to the wall. As I held on, the knuckles of my left hand scraped against the wall, tearing off skin and leaving my knuckles bright red. I had to let go and roll off the track onto the slope. Very embarrassing, though I noticed later that very few people used the J bar, and several other people had similar mishaps.Besides that mental trauma, it was worth the experience of skiing indoors in Dubai, feeling (and tasting) snow. It ain't Breckenridge, but it's worth a go.

Ski Dubai: Can it get any wilder?. Imagine: where did you go ski this year? Dubai! Really! Outside temperature at 11:00 am in February: 25 centigrade. Inside: -2. 400 meters of slopes, 60 meters wide and just 10 people on it. Snowpark with some 50 local ladies in burka covering ski suits. Shoes a bit worn out, so maybe pick a size smaller. Socks included in rental. Skies were perfect. Bring your own gloves, otherwise for hygienic reasons you need to buy them locally. Hours of plain fun, just because it is so absurd! Let it snow, let it snow in Dubai!!. It is a little nice place to spend some time while in Dubai. I guess it will make the visit more interesting if you are not actually used to the real snow. The snow park consists of few simple slides and other snow play options. One thing worth remembering is that the snow here is not necessarily soft and fluffy as you would often find with natural fresh snow. The sides of the slides are of hard snow. So please do take care of the elbow and make sure the little ones have good protective wear. The ski slope is only for people who know skiing. The ski slope looked nice with a reasonable length for an artificial park such as this.Protective clothing is available as part of the ticket price. This includes jacket, trouser, boots and helmet for children. If you have ski/slope pass then I think you get all the skiing gear as well. Lockers, changing space and toilets are just opposite to the counter where you collect your accessories. Gloves and hats are not part of the above so please take them if you have. They also sell them in case you haven’t got them with you. The temperature maintained inside the park is below freezing and it was reading -4 degree Celsius when we visited. If you have paid for the locker then make sure you get the money back by surrendering the electronic key/watch in one of the automatic machines while coming out of the entrance. If you are from places where you get to experience the real snow then you may not find this exciting. Also, just to get a view of this place you don’t need to go inside and you can have good look from inside the mall itself. But, while in Dubai amidst and heat and sand, this place offers a change and more of a holiday adventure feel, especially if you have small children.

One of a kind , espacially being located in a mall. My children really enjoyed it a lot and stayed there for 7 hours, and didn't want to leave , and mwanwhile i enjoyed walking around the mall and finished my shoping peacefully .

No admittance for children below 3. Was just sad that we werent able to take our daughter inside the snowpark as she is under three years old....understand the safety reasons though. Dubai Entertainer voucher can get you a one for one entry though. Families waiting or those who cant go inside can enjoy a meal at St. maxims or Chopchop..and enjoy the view too. Great fun!. Did the basic entry pass with 5 year old boy - we both loved it! You can go tobogganing, ride down an ice slope in a big tyre and play around in the snow. It's not huge, but it's good fun. Apparently there will be penguins there from Feb. Make sure you walk around some of the little caves at the back.
snow in the desert?. the absolute contrast of a ski slope in the desert and it is well managed

Excellent fun and great value. How many times in your life will you get a chance to ski in the desert? Don't miss this. It is a lot of fun and not bad ski-ing. I was surprised I honestly thought it would be just a gimmick.

Fantastic place. Strange to see all that snow in Dubai great idea! You can go in or just look through the windows in the Mall it's a very popular place some people may never have seen snow and the children seem to be enjoying it warm clothing is supplied.
Loads of fun.. Great place to learn to ski, trainers are very friendly and make the experience very enjoyable

From Canada this seemed like a joke. Great idea to bring skiing to the desert but if you are like myself from a country that is renown for their ski hills and snow, this artificial snow won't cut it. You are almost better off eating at the sushi restaurant in the mall while overlooking the hill. Gives a chance to see the bunny hills and the clear balls that u can penetrate and roll down the hill. Don't waste your money if you are an avid skier
indoor ice :). nice experience, but it will be expensive if you don't know how to ski as the ski requires license and training

If you like snow you should be there. Biggest man made snow, in world i have seen, excellent is the world for it, we had a good time over there, on slides and visiting the entire area, had a excellent time over there and really enjoyed the same as well
The One and Only. Only in Dubai can you ski in a desert. This is a great accomplishment, would recommend it for beginners, as the run is very short.

Skiing? ? ? In the desert???. This was something fun to do once. The snow is obviously all groomed and the slope is short, NOTHING compared to the BC Mountains I'm used to, BUT a fun experience to have while living in the UAE.
Indoor skiing. It's in the mall, interesting to walk by and look from the outside. Wouldn't do it myself.

Awesome!. Ok so for you skiers out there - the snow is a bit sticky. The chairlift also kicks you off insuferably slow because of the pedestrians who ride up. The 2 hours is enough for any good skiers because the run is short. Weirdest thing for us was all of the non skiers who road up in boots, smiled for the camera and road back down. Seemed like most skiers were expats. All in all this was one of our favorite parts about dubai.

SKI DUBAI. It was nice to get a little time on the snow even if it was a tiny slope with a mini park that closed very early and was more of a danger than a true park for snowboarders.The set-up for renting equipment was excellent and well organized and the value was very reasonable.I would reccomend this to anyone who has not experienced skiing in Dubai.

See this thing before it sinks back into the desert!. It costs about US $60 for snowboarding tix, or $50 for the kids area with the Zorb ball. To get both, you have to pay about $100. It seems like kind of a ripoff because the Zorb area is tiny and there isn't much to do. There are two stops on the lifts: novice and black diamond. The quality of the snow is pretty good, surprisingly (based on snow I've experienced in Utah, London and California). It feels like being inside a giant freezer inside. The $60 admission includes boots, pants and a jacket. Unfortunately, you only get gloves with the Zorb area, not for ski/snowboarding. I don't know why, because they're cheap, disposable gloves. Worth checking out just so you can say you skied/snow boarded in the desert.
Ski Dubai. It's fun when you first go but it gets boring after a while and it is extremely cold. be warned, there is a lack of slope etiquette.

Switzerland in Desert!!. It's a really nice place, very well designed to get the real feeling. I bet you will not feel you are in a desert untill you come out of the place and face 40-50 Deg C outside
Brilliant Experience in Desert Country. Very genuine snow feeling, and the Ski lifts and slopes were great. Some staff members were as cold as the Ice inside, but generally good atmosphere

Very cool to have this in Dubai. You must try this out as its such a different experience. It's obviously not like skiing in Switzerland or France, but to be able to do something in doors and in Dubai is amazing! I would recommend that you try it for 2 hours, after a while it gets a bit dull as you are going up and down the same slope. I like to go there every now and then - good fun.

Great Fun. I travel through Dubai on a regular basis and I finally decided to give Ski Dubai a try. I hadn't skied in years and thought this would be fun. It was! It's definitely different skiing in a mall, but it's fun. Obviously the number of runs is limited, but they do a great job with what they have. There's also a few rails and jumps for snowboarders. The snow condition isn't ideal, but it\s man made snow after all. The price is very reasonable for the few hours that you get.
snow. snow ? i love snow and i want to go there again this year with my pocket money

Nice idea but too much waiting time, it doesn t worth it.. It is nice to be able to ski in such a weird place ..if it doesn t harm the planet.. honestly i don t know.. but i found it completely understaffed, crowded and chaotic. The staff at the changing rooms, managers and security staff are outstanding, really kind and helpful. But the waiting time for the snow ball fall is ridiculous.

Fun for the Little Ones. This is the second time I took my 3 year old daughter to the Snow Park in Ski Dubai. I think it's a great place to take young kids, especially if you live in the desert and don't get to see any snow. It was very busy when we went being that all the childeren were on school holiday. My daughter had a great time until the large crowds of people starting coming in. My suggestion is that a limited number of tickets are sold so that everyone can enjoy their experience. I had to leave because I was worried about my daughter getting trampled on. Before the crowds came she was able to really enjoy all the rides in the snow park. The snow outfits were clean and kept us warm. I will go back again, but never again during the school holiday.
A pleasant place or mall to shop for. Get tired after shopping? well go straight to Ski Dubai.. Cool relaxing, icing place.to remove pressures. Enjoysble place especially, for the children.
A must. So much fun, we got the whole package and enjoyed every minute of it.....if you are in Dubai, DO IT!!

it happens only in dubai. artificially made ice park in dubai, mind blowing and amazing. situated in the mall of the emirates, must visit place, u will enjoy each and every moment there. variety of ice sports, there is a ride also, shud be more fun if u know skiing as they have a very good slope.

Cold Play :). Well, its a ski slope inside a mall. What else can u say ?The place is brilliantly managed & great fun to be there.. IF u plan to visit it, ensure that u carry ur own gloves & a winter cap .. the rest of gear is part of the ticket cost ..

fun for kids. the place is very nice for kids. a welcome break from the sands outside. the cafe by ski dubai has very friendly staff and serves good food at reasonable price (a bit on the pricey but still reasonable for me). some of the staff are helpful, others are not. would appreciate a simple smile whenever serving people. i was polite anyway, and i just get a shrug? tsk tsk. other than that, the place is a-ok. a bit small and some of the facilities don't work but otherwise a nice experience for me and my son.

Snow Park only worth it if you have children.. Paid to go in as thought the snow park would have bit more to it but it really was waste of money. If you dont have children and dont want to ski just have coffee in cafe outside and take a photo of it all from there.

Expensive but fun. We did ski lessons and played around in the fun area and enjoyed it so much - but beware the massive drop in temperature gave us all colds the following day and the remainder of the holiday :(

If you do not know, how to ski- this is the place to be.. Amidst of dessert and concrete jungle, the idea of having ski rink, out of window thinking. hmmmmm so cold. :) y to go zuric to play in ice come to dubai they hve made it here

What an experience!. Ski-ing in Dubai! What an amazing thing to be able to do. The ski centre is excellent, very reasonably priced. There was good facilities and equipment. Winter feeling. Brilliant. Ski like in a december day at Manali in the middle of the desert throughtout the year !!!

Cold but fun.. Great to get out of the heat in summer. Good lessons/experience; also do parties and 'intros-to' skiing. Expensive, but lots of fun.
snow man in the dessert. lovely afternoon out. must do in dubai especially coming from a country without much snow .

An 'OK' experience. I'd never been on skiis before. Found instructors a bit impatient even if you are a complete beginner. Difficult to get boots to fit. Found people in the group willing to help each other more than the instructors were. Lovely being in snow and in the cold tho'!

Amazing. We didn't actually go in, we viewed from the outside and it was just like a real ski "village". Great indoor slope.. Good for Kids. It's not very big, but nicely made. it shud be a fine experience if you have lil ones.

Indoor Skiing at its finest.. Not Switzerland or Austria but beats the desert heat! Affordable and a good way to get your skiing fix. Must provide your own gloves and hat. They provide the rest.
What can I say "Skiiiiiiiiii Foannnn.....". If you're used to the Alps, don't think of comparing it but it's definitely a cool experience. Just don't get why to date they don't have an Apres Ski...

Nice experence!. Go early stay as long as you want, great for teens. Everything was included and the staff was helpful.

very nice experience inside a mall. well worth a visit but take care it is really cold inside,try to get your glooves with you as they will provide the clothes with boots and socks but you have to buy the glooves and if you want to cover your head ,nice small rides for children on ice for all ages and different from the SKI area,a bit expensive but worth a visit while in emirates mall

So much fun. We have never skied or snowboarded, but what an experience!!! We did the snowboarding and the instructors were very patient and helpful during our lessons. It's even fun for experienced people, because there are steep slopes for them. I would suggest going in the morning or early afternoon, especially when you are a beginner, because late afternoon the snow already turned into ice and this can cause quite a few falls, ask me!!!

Ski Dubai...a fun refreshing alternative in the Emirates desert. I had the pleasure of trying out Ski Dubai. Loved the experience. Imagine an indoor man-made ski hill in the middle of a desert country! The amount of money spent on this thing! Of course, it's nothing compared to the Rockies or the Alps, but it was a nice refreshing alternative to what Dubai has to offer which are shopping and skyscrapers. Ski Dubai offers ski classes for beginners. It's really perfect for anyone beginning to snowboard as well. There are two runs available avering between easy and intermediate. Ski Dubai prices are very affordable...about 180 Dhs for two hours including rental of skis and clothing. We need to bring our own hats and gloves though. Otherwise, they have a store selling those for a hefty price. There is a snow park for small children. Definitely a place that kids would love. Two hours are more than sufficient to experience this to the fullest! Beware advanced skiers, the runs are not amazing and can get boring. But I can guarantee one thing: no ice patches! An experience for your bucket list!

A bit overrated. Let's face it - considering that you are more or less in the middle of the desert, the idea of skiing might sound a little decadent. But when you're in Dubai, this is part of daily life anyway.Ski Dubai offers you a little treat and gives you a glimpse of winter. You can choose between skiing and tobogganing. The main lift to the top takes about 4 minutes, as opposed to the downhill fun which only lasts for a bit less than a minute if you are experienced enough. There is a limited choice of difficulty offering a bit of variety. However, if you are an experienced skier you will start feeling bored after an hour and the excitement will fade out.Hungry for a treat at the coffeeshop? You will find a large variety of juices, hot beverages and soft drinks. If you are craving for something more spicy you will have to content yourself with watching the crowds at Après Bar which is part of the Kempinski Hotel. The coffeeshop is not licensed.In a nutshell, it's a very nice one-off experience considering where you are. However in terms of quality and choice I would consider it slightly overrated.
Loved it. Kids loved it, both the skiing and the sledging park, worth buying entertainment book in Dubai as have lots of vouchers for it
Nice family fun for some hours. Not as big as the alps but still lots of fun. My kids did really enjoy this park. Everything is provided except gloves and hats.
Snow in the desert. Great facility for beginners and serious skiiers alike. It seems to go on and on
Great fun. We went for the two hour ticket, it was great fun, not too busy either. i would definitely recommend going!
Yust have a look. ...throw the windows. For people like me who go skiing in Switzerland, it's a joke, but a good one

snowboard in the desert???. If you are used to the alps, you will cry when you see the size of the place, its so tiny in comparison. ???. Just had a look - but did not feel like having to descend the slope ... as I'm looking forward to do 'real skiing' in the Dolomites soon ...
A bit of cold fun in the heat!. Fun experience skiing in the desert! The slope was ok, and it has a few places where you can do small jumps. Book the minimum 2 hours, you'll get bored after 1 hour...

Skii in August in the middle of the dessert? Check!. My six-year-old son took his first couple of skiing lessons here, as we needed to keep him indoors from the mid-day August heat of Dubai. It was the best idea ever! First of all, the entire complex and all equipment were in excellent shape and hygiene. All instructors (Maria, Owen, Julianne, Mahmoud, Hafid & Mehdi) we met were great with our son who could not in fact understand most of what they said in English to him! They took their job very serious to make sure he learned the basics of skiing properly. We were given a Skiing Passport, in which after each private lesson the instructor mentioned my son's progress and signed. My son is still very proud of his passport! He was, in fact, taken to skii on the experienced level slope by the 5th lesson. Since August is low- season in Dubai, this attraction was not very crowded at all until the last two days which was Eid for the Muslim. So we paid for group lessons to have private ones instead.
nice experience for the kids. the kids will love it; its a nice experience that the kids will love. recommended highly, but avoid peek hours. not good for kids below 3 years.
fun day out. great having hot chocolate in the cafe at the top...dress warm its so freezing inside
Mall Skiing. In the midst of a shopping mall stands this little bit of the Alps. I liked rolling down the ski hills in a huge plastic ball.

Ski Dubai something different to do.. Whilst I personally didnt ski one of our group bought a two hour ticket and enjoyed himself snowboarding. He bought gloves but said afterwards he really needed a beenie as his head was very cold.

Great Fun with the family. My 4 year old son had a blast, as did I. We got passes for the Snow Park only as we were short on time - that included a bob sled and a tire down the slope ride. The lines were fast moving and the staff were helpful - I'll go again.
Skiing in the desert. What more to astound your friends than to say you went Skiing in the desert. Well maintained and an engineering feat
Loads of family fun. Lots of family fun playing around in the snow - kids had a blast doing the various rides - bob sledding, ball ride, ski lift... good fun!!

Worth a peek. Went out of our way to take a look a the famous Ski Dubai. Did not ski. Looking through the windows was fairly underwhelming but was free and took all of 5-10 minutes. Glad I took a look but nothing astounding.
on boxing day in 27degrees!. so surreal one minute in shorts and t/shirt the next full ski wear amazing and only in Dubai wonderful Dubai
Was expecting more. I must be honest - little disappointing. The rides are nice but nothing to write home about and there was a shortage of tubes for most of the rides. Could be organised better.

-3 deg in dubai. Your kid will love you for taking him/her to this place. -3 degrees :-)
ski, roll, throw snow and have a great time. Remember to have starbucks coffee once you come out..

Nice one!. What a great afternnoon session on the slopes just before dinner!

Skiing...in the desert!. Silly place for a ski slope!!. Went to ski slope with teen kids. Dissapointed that slope only for experienced skiers. and lessons were fully booked for the day !! If I was an experienced skier I would go somewhere else, I therefore feel more provision should have been made for inexperienced persons to have fun on the slopes. 4 Degrees inside upto 50 degrees outside. Nice escape from the dubai sun, caters to novice and expert skiiers/boarders. kids can play in snow park. decent sized slope for kids and adults - go in the evening in the week if possible as nice and quiet and no numpties causing havoc
really fun for basic skiing. My children have now ski-ed three times in their life, twice here, a year apart. Expensive two hours, but such fun
Great Idea. the kids would enjoy it, as it brings something different to the outside heat.If you dont know how to Ski it wouldnt be much fun as the dont have many slides or rides

Worth it. The 2-hour Ski Dubai lift pass is amazingly economical. It includes skis, boots, poles, socks, and snow suit, but not hat or gloves. If you didn't bring a hat and gloves, buy them next door at a mall sports store for about 40 Dh. I don't care how hot it is outside, you'll need a hat and gloves on the "mountain." It's COLD in there. At the end of my 2 hours, I was frozen and ready to leave.Secure storage lockers are available at the base, so you can shed your street clothes while you're on the mountain.I had fun on the mountain. The snow was good, crowd was thin (the skiing crowd, that is - there were plenty of kids at the snow park and several people just admiring the winter experience by riding circles on the lift), and the equipment was in good condition. There a two lifts - a slow quad chair and a faster T-bar. The mountain itself is a glorified bunny slope, but do you expect? It's amazing this place exists at all.
Ski Dubai. Something unique, bring your own gloves and hat as it's a bit chilly. The slope is bigger than you'd expect. Maybe green, mogals of blue diamond.

Romantic & Chilling Experience. Its a finest place for people who dream about snow falling places that they have seen only in movies and TV can find & experience the beauty and romantic feeling of ICE and snow. Best place to visit.

Nice but... The entry fee is bit expensive for family traveller like me. Kids under 3 not allowed to enter. They provide shoe and jacket but beanies and gloves to be buy from nearby store. You can guess how much they charge you for a decent glove since you are desperate.
Hittin the Slopes on the Sands of Dubai. What else is there to say about getting to ski in the desert. What a great time!
Ski while the wife shops!. Real snow, ice and skiing when you need it and real sun, sand and heat when you don't.

I should give it excellent, lack of the 3rd run. The price is very fair as you get 2 hours with all gear but gloves, you wont need the beenie or glasses. 2 runs blue and green, did blue once and hit the green over 14 times so if you just go up and down your able to get a bit of boarding done. Great fun great price.

Snow Fun. Nice!!!! is all i can say. From the time we bought our all access passes we enjoyed every bit of it. The ski lift was quite scary. We were there on a weekend so it was quite crowded and there were small ques for every thing.But all in one wow

Fantastic yet bizarre experience. I would highly recommend Ski Dubai. Its a very surreal experience being in a snow filled room in the desert. I haven't been on ski's for probably 15+yrs so booked a lesson. It wasn't expensive and the instructor did enough to get us started on the beginner slope. That's all he did though, got us started and then disappeared to talk to some girls. I expected a little bit more than this but I was too busy having fun to care.Everything was included in the price, skis, boots and clothing. The only thing you don't get is the gloves and a hat. Family fun. The kids had a great time skiing indoors - a surreal change from any other skiing we do. Easy runs and short of course but the novelty value makes it a worthwhile activity.
? Odd!. Amazing considering the location, yet after seeing tv shows etc I was maybe expecting something more or bigger and was slightly disappointed?

What an experiance. Feel the chilling experiance at Ski Dubai.... If u dont want to ski, there are many other things to enjoy including the air balls..... go and enjoy seeing othere skiying or do it yourself... it's all fun... real fun
Oh its cold. Real experience of winter in hot Dubai. you can ski and enjoy snow slides. Can't stay more than half hour if not equiped with warm clothes.

Cheap skiing. There is a 4 person chair lift to the top of the slopes - you can get off half way up at the cafe. All clothing is provided from skis & poles, boots, salopettes, jacket, helmets & socks. The only thing not provided is gloves - which you definately need!!! I would advise taking some with you if you plan to go there as the shops are very expensive to buy some that will keep your hands warm (they offer some 'ski dubai' fleece gloves for sale at a reasonable price, but if on the slope for 45 mins or more your hands are VERY cold). We paid about £30 for 2 hours recreational skiing.

Great substitute for the ski slopes. this place is great for those of us who do not live near a ski slope without having to fly half a day. The slope is about 400 m and temperature and surroundings are carefully monitored at about -1degree celcius. this makes for excellent environment to learn skiing or to get really good at it. The whole system is very well organized and based on trust (to return boots and clothes).Everything is provided in your rental fee, including ski equipment and clothes, but bring your own hat and gloves. they provide socks disposable but quite thick!. no need to bring your goggles as it is not that bright. Toilets are large and the lay out is very clear and organized. Only minor complaint was that we only had options of the standard 2 hour slope pass, or the full day pass. This was despite that the flyer that we had indicated that we could get an hour extension at a lower rate. I guess it did not make business sense for them. in the end , most who would want to ski more than 2 hours, would either have to buy the full day pass, (about 80AED more than the 2 hour) or once you run out of time , buy another 2 hour pass (not worth it). the time is well monitored from your key card (pocket in sleeve of rental clothes) every time you enter the lift area to load. so not to worry about keeping track. Excellent snow experience in the desert. Kudos.

This has to be the best indoor ski slope. It is amazing that this even exists. You can get very good speed but of course it is over all too soon and then you are back on the lifts. As far as indoor ski slopes go this has to be the best.

Nice skiing area far away from home. As I come from Norway, I'm quite used to skiing. The Ski Dubai is worth the experience if you have some spare time or hate shopping. Good equipment, nice slopes and well prepared. A nice couple of hours spent while your wife goes shopping as this is inside the Mall of Emirates.

Make Sure you Go Here. Take teh 200 AED pass which gives you a pair of gloves plus ebtry to everythign except skiing.So enjoy your time by visiting the ski lifts,having hot chocolate in minus 4 degrees,trying your luck in the massive zorbing ball and lots more to do.

skiing - in the desert ! gotta be done. the indoor ski slope is similar to those in the UK, except bigger (of course), and with a dog leg, and with a chair lift rather than drags - and very cold ! you can hire the gear there, but not hats and gloves, so if you wanna go be sure to take your own or you will end up buying them - because it really is cold. you can also go inside as a specator (they provide you with big warm over coats) and you can ride the chair lift up the middle of the slope and watch everyone skiing without having to do yourself. There is also a cafe half way up the slope where you can stop off for a hot chocolate !

My favorite sporting event in Dubai. I loved this - totally organized operation. Just show up and they have everything for you. They provide skis, poles, gloves, socks, boots, etc. Lift ticket includes locker access as well. Fun both day and night. Less crowded at night but quite a bit colder. Do this for sure.

Couldn't believe my eyes. It is really something different than the ususal. People are snowing infront of you in a closed mall. You can have lunch, and watch them ski and play with the snow, at the restaurants available.

Imperative. If Dubai is the city of excess, kitch and non-sense, the Sky tack is a must-be. Imperative is also having your meal at the St. Moritz restaurant attached to the ski track.Try the huge fondue but please do not even try to eat all by yourself.

Skiing in the Dessert: About What You'd Expect. It is very wild to go snowboarding in the middle of the dessert. Great to do one-time for an hour or two. No reason to go back. Slope is rather short, but fun enough.

On the piste in dry Dubai!. This is probably the closest you'll get to a few hours "on the piste" in Dubai unless you spend a small fortune in one of its hotels.Great for a few hours fun away from the sun in a very impressive setting with excellent facilities and friendly staff.Probably not for the novice skier but certainly worth a try if you can get down a regular blue run.Of course this can't compete with the real thing, but given that it hasn't rained let alone snowed, for 3 years in Dubai then this really is a fun and unique experience.

Unique experience. It was just cool to go skiing in the desert while its 100+ degrees outside. It does take longer to go up the lift than to get down the hill but the experience is still worth it. If you've never skied before this would be the perfect place to give it a try. Everything is provided except for hat/mitts/socks so you don't have to lug all your stuff there. SKI! It was awesome.. We are Utah skiers and had low expectations of this indoor mountain but we LOVED it. Well worth the cost for a couple hours of fun.
Fun for all. Great place, very organised way to change clothes and ski boots. Cost-wise: of course, nothing is cheap in Dubai

Snow in Dubai. Whether you know to ski or not you can still get into the snow park walk across the bridges and enjoy sliding down the slopes. It is great to experience contrast to the temperature outside.

Not quite the Alps, but pretty good. Skiing in the desert! What could be more fun. I expected it to be hard-packed ice, but the surface was actually pretty decent. Affordable way to chill out in the middle of summer.

Most stupid idea ever, strong avoid!. Visited Dubai on November on a business trip. Great and fun family activity. Amazing experience: snow in the middle of the desert. Kids had a blast.

Amazing ice Park in hot Dubai. What a tough job to maintain so much snow in such a hot climate. You go to Ski Dubai to enjoy the snow. Even if you are not interested in skiing, there are lot's of things to do. A must go place. All the warm clothngs are provided by them.

A must if you’re in Dubai...just make sure you can Ski. Now this sounds bizarre but if you can Ski already and fancy something a bit different while visiting Dubai it’s a must. Coming from the North of England we’re used to the cold weather so while being chilly inside it was quite refreshing if I’m honest after being in the heat outside. All the equipment is provided except hats and gloves, best thing is to plan ahead and take them anyway even if you end up not wearing them later. The chair lift takes a while but this was the only method of getting up the slope when we went along. Watch skiers on the slopes from the comfort of your table!. In the centre of a shopping mall.....What fun! Worth the money, I think. Okay the skiing itself is marginal (packed powder and ice) and it is short but come on, for US$60 you get to ski in Dubai!!! The t-bar lift is twice as fast as the chair but it is somewhat difficult and MAKE SURE you bring or buy gloves as the metal pol will freeze your fingers very quickly. Cheap gloves are available in ski shop outside of Ski Dubai and they are a nice souvenir.Caution - This is a blue level mainly due to the icy conditions so it is not a place for first or second time skiers.

An experience like no other. Can one imagine skiiing in the desert in July when temps outside are in the high 40s C?The Ski Dubai in Mall of the Emirates is an excellently executed attractions. There are pro slopes and bunny slopes and many little activities for those wanting to experience the extreme cold yet not interested in skiing. It is well made, large and worthy of a visit.Also, if staying for a prolonged period of time in Dubai one can sign up for lessons or refresher lessons in skiing or snowboarding.

Skiing in the desert. Who wouldn't want to ski in the desert? From 40 degrees outside, to -1 inside. Amazing. Nice experience, one must do !! Wool gloves are availble at pro shop or bring them from home.

If anyone wants to see snow at one of the arabin gulf countries, this is the plcae.. Yes, it is always snowing in Dubai. Must try. If you never had the chance to Ski.or experience sub zero temperature (ice and snow), then one musn't miss Ski Dubai. It is present within the Mall of Emirates at the extreme right tower. They will charge AED 120 per person and AED 40 for locker facility. There are separate entry fees for some rides inside.They will rent you ski jackets free of cost but Head cover and Mittens/Gloves have to be either purchased or brought from outside.Once inside, you immediately feel the chill (-4 degree celcius)Inside is a small wonderland and excitememnt sets in. You can try the various rides or just fun and frolic around the snow. Ideally one can complete everything in 1 hour. The place isn't very big. Take plenty of pictures. The amazing present of the snow, while outside it’s over 40 degrees heat at the shadow. Great experience. The kids had a great time in the snow park. Bring your own gloves and hat. They are not provided but you can also buy them there. You can do without it for the snow park.

Fun outing. Loved it and will be back.

snowy and cold experience woooow. I adore this place you it will transfer you to be in the European region although you are still in Arabic Country .... i love it and i enjoyed that my kid he spent a good time there

Are you crazy man ? sky in DUbai ?!. no one will believe that you can sky all year round in Dubai because the ten never go below 15 in winter but DUbai is inter nation city with all possibilities that you can imagine , if you have your winter cloth bring it with you you may save renting the jacket ;)

A great experience!. We booked a beginners lesson at Ski Dubai, it works out about £35 per person for one hour which we thought was quite reasonable. piece of switzerland in the middle of desart. You can enjoy Switzerlandjust by entering at ski dubai. although the place is congested little bit. Avoid festival times, holidays.

Something different. Only did the cable car, staff very helpful in getting you dressed for the occasion, had not seen snow for 40 years, so therefore I enjoyed the short and sweet experience
Ski Dubai. turned up and booked ski lessons for kids and had to wait about an hour,great for kids and families,all clothing supplied apart from gloves which you have to buy,or bring your own.

Novel Experiance. Had my grandddaughter over for a week from the UK. Thought it might be good for an hour or two. Used the 2 4 1 voucher. Kit provided is a bit basic to say the least if you are a proficient skier.(I spend 6 months of the year in the Alps so ski LOADS). but hey it was OK. There is a 400 metre slope with a "dog leg" halfway down. Some Boxes for the more adventurous near the top. There is a 4 man chair and a drag(poma) lift. The drag is actually quicker for getting up provided not too many novicies fall off & get in your way! They use the chair for non skiers to access the toboggan run so it runs slow, but it is nice to chat to other visitors. A small cafe at the half way stage, nice touch so anyone never been skiing can get a bit of an idea what it might be like in the mountains. There is also a large "play area" for non skiers to experiance some of the fun of snow! Small toboggan run, slides, big ball to roll down the hill in and of course you can always have a snowball fight!! Just to say you skied in the desert on "real" snow is a novel thing.

great. excellent worth every penny snow suits and shoes provided in price but no hats or gloves but there is a shop which sells them so if you are going to visit you may want to take your own 4year old daughter loved it various small snow runs for children plus they can fasten there rubber rings to the adult ones and go down the runs together. Snow Skiing in a Shopping Mall, in the Desert, a must do!. Too bizarre of an experience to pass up!. Although we did not ski, we bought the admission that allows you to ride on the gondola and play in the snow park. in the middle of summer. not like sking on a mountain but close to it, great if you are a learner and lessons worth doing, particularly for our young chidren aged 5 and 8

Lots of Fun. We went to Ski Dubai on a whim while walking around the Mall, and we dont have any regrets. Piece of winter in the desert. Enjoyed two hours ride on the slope, althought it might seem short, to someone who used to ski in the mountains, but anyway it's unique experience - skiing indoor in the middle of the desert. Exciting indoor skiing experience. I went there during Eid holidays, so Ski Dubai was very crowded with people, and I had to wait for equipment in the long que.
